strIntroduction:
Elevate the typical whale- and dolphin-spotting tour with a private sailing charter in Tenerife. On board a private yacht, watch for native marine life, swim and snorkel with turtles, and enjoy an intimate experience with a maximum of nine people in your group—no crowds. Snacks and beverages are provided, and you can select the departure time that best suits you.

Your private sailing cruise begins with hotel pickup for the drive to the dock, where you'll board your luxury yacht.

Relax on board with your family or friends as you watch the water surface for dolphins and pilot whales. You'll stop to swim and snorkel with turtles in their natural habitat, and admire views of Tenerife. Sandwiches and all drinks are included. This private charter is an excellent way to celebrate a special occasion like a birthday, anniversary, engagement, or bachelor/bachelorette party.

After returning to shore, you'll be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Tenerife 3-Hour Whale- and Dolphin-Watching Private Luxury Sailing Charter

strIntroduction:
Go in search of whales and dolphins in the waters of Tenerife on a small-group luxury sailing tour limited to 11 people. On board the yacht, enjoy provided sandwiches and drinks, and stop for swimming and snorkeling. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

After hotel pickup in southern Tenerife, your 3-hour tour begins as you board your yacht and sail or motor away from the port to the area where pilot whales are usually seen.

On the way, keep a lookout for dolphins, as well, who like to swim around the boat. After about half an hour of navigating, you should spot whale mothers and babies, with daddy whales keeping an eye on what's going on.

Enjoy provided drinks and fresh sandwiches on board, and listen to information about the marine life from your captain. After viewing the whales, head to a secluded bay where you'll drop anchor so you can swim off the back of the yacht. Use the provided snorkeling gear to look for turtles, if you wish. More sandwiches and drinks will be served before pulling up the anchor and sailing back to the marina.
strTitle: Whale- and Dolphin-Watching 3-hour Group Sailing Yacht Charter

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a 6-hour private whale and dolphin watching and sailing tour along the South-west coast of Tenerife. Gaze at the island's incredible views and wildlife; you will have the opportunity to see whales and dolphins as you approach the different locations where the yacht will stop for lunch or any additional activities such as swimming, snorkeling or sunbathing.

Book your own 6-hour private yacht charter in Tenerife.  You will leave the assigned port first thing in the morning after greeting the friendly staff and the Captain, who will serve you a glass of cava and welcome you aboard.

You will then start your sailing adventure as you make your way up the west side of the island while you see whales and dolphins in their natural habitat. There will be several stops within the itinerary and you will have the chance to go for a swim, snorkel or just relax sunbathing. Just to make this experience even better, you will have a selection of drinks and snacks available during the whole journey so you can make yourself like at home.

Once you reach the Gigantes Cliffs area, you will stop for a local lunch whilst enjoying the volcanic landscapes of this area as you gaze at Mt Teide at a far distance.
Once you have finished your lunch and enjoyed the sun and water, you will head back to the start point.
strTitle: Private Whale Watching and Sailing Tour in Tenerife

strIntroduction:
Tenerife luxury whale and dolphin charters. A 3 hour luxury private motor boat charter,see whales and dolphins in their habitat, swim and snorkel with turtles. No crowds, just you to a maximum of 10 people in your private charter group. In ultimate in luxury, the Fairline motor boat and Captain will take you to exclusive caves and show you wonderful views of Tenerife.

This tour includes a free pick up and drop off with all food and drinks included. Relax on the perfect luxury motor boat excursion for your family and friends. This luxury 3 hour private fairline motor boat charter is available for 2 to 11 people, no crowds just you and your family or friends. See pilot whales, dolphins and turtles in there natural habitat, enjoy wonderful views of Tenerife, all drinks and sandwiches included. This private charter is the perfect way to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, engagement, hen party or stag event. Enjoy the cushioned forward sundecks our chill out in the shaded areas at the back of the boat.
strTitle: Luxury 3 hour Whale and Dolphin Watching Private Motor Boat Charter

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the sea on a Tenerife luxury whale and dolphin motor boat charters. Aboard a luxury private motor boat charter during 6 hours,see whales and dolphins in their habitat, swim and snorkel with turtles. No crowds, just you to a maximum of 10 people in your private charter group. In ultimate luxury, the Fairline motor boat and Captain will take you to exclusive caves and show you wonderful views of Tenerife visit the wonderful cliffs of Los Giganties,

This tour includes a free pick up and drop off with all food and drinks included. Relax on the perfect luxury motor boat excursion for your family and friends. This luxury 6 hour private fairline motor boat charter is available for 2 to 10 people, no crowds just you and your family or friends. See pilot whales, dolphins and turtles in there natural habitat, enjoy wonderful views of Tenerife, all drinks and baguettes, paella or roast chicken lunch included. This private charter is the perfect way to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, engagement, hen party or stag event. Enjoy the cushioned forward sundecks or chill out in the shaded areas at the back of the boat. Drinks include cava, wine,beer, coke and fanta and the bar is unlimited.
strTitle: Private Motor Boat Whale Watching Charter in Tenerife

strIntroduction:
Discover whale and dolphin watching in a luxury 3 hour private sailing yacht charter to see whales and dolphins, swim and snorkel with turtles, no crowds just a maximum of 11 people on your private charter.

This tour includes a free pick up and drop off with all food and drinks included. Relax on the perfect luxury yacht excursion with 3 hours of private sailing that is available for 1 to 11 people, no crowds just you and your family or friends. See pilot whales, dolphins and swim and snorkel with turtles in there natural habitat, enjoy wonderful views of Tenerife, with all drinks and sandwiches included. This private charter is the perfect way to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, engagement, hen party or stag event. The charter includes a free hotel pick up and drop of within a 20 kilometre radius of Playa de las Americas.
strTitle: Luxury Private Yacht Whale Watching Tour

strIntroduction:
On this custom half-day tour of Prague you will discover the city in 3.5 hours with a private guide. Explore the great landmarks of Prague, such as Charles Bridge, Prague Castle, Old Town and more. See also the intimate Prague of the locals with its hidden alleys, food markets, how people in the city live. This custom tour will be tailored to your interests and will move at your pace.

Meet your guide you at a central location in Prague at a chosen time and start your private custom tour.

Choose your preferred sights and see Prague's landmarks and must-sees, such as Charles Bridge or Prague Castle and Old Town Square with its Astronomical Clock. or choose to explore the more hidden and intimate sides of Prague, such as Kampa or Vysehrad. Stroll the city's streets like a local and be introduced to the spots that most visitors don’t get to see.

It is up to you, how much and which side of Prague you would like to see during your 3.5-hour custom city tour with a private guide. Learn about Czech history and enjoy great views. Explore Prague in a very unique way: your own way!
strTitle: Private Custom Half-Day Tour of Prague

strIntroduction:
Join this private tour and explore Prague Castle in a 1.5-hour night tour. See Prague's top attraction all lit up at night with a local private guide and after all the crowds are gone.

Meet your guide at the foot of the castle hill and take a romantic tram ride (included in your ticket) up to the castle grounds.

Make your way to the official castle, home to the Czech president, and venue to many main events in Czech history. Take advantage of the castle's unique position above the river and the city of Prague to take pictures of the castle complex, the illuminated city lights and its famed rooftops, including a spectacular 180° view of Prague onto Lesser Town, Charles Bridge, Jewish Town, Old Town and the city into the distance.

Walk down Nerudova, the lesser town's Grand street, and end your 1.5-hour tour close to where you started - near the Charles bridge, not far from several bars and restaurants, and close to public transportation and taxis.
strTitle: Private Prague Castle Tour By Night

strIntroduction:
Exploring Prague’s food markets is taking a wonderful short-cut to understanding Czech culture. On this exploration of the market, food stores and the Beer Museum around the Powder House, we sample great foods and beers, we criss-cross the Old Town, and we gain great insights – and we have heaps of fun along the way.

We meet at the Powder House - Prague's historical landmark.

The guide, who is a native of Prague as well as a passionate foodie, gives a brief introduction to two major Prague landmarks: the Powder House and the Municipal House.

We then enter the food market that stands across from the Municipal House. We join in the fun and walk up and down, we meet farmers/merchants, we discuss various foods, and we buy the ones we get curious about. We observe local residents make their round and size up products and merchants.

We then go by the shop of a traditional butcher: why does this Czech butcher shop feel so different? Why do people here eat more pork than beef? And what is the local diet like?

We continue down Dlouha street. What is this wonderful smell? And what did Czechs eat and drink in the dark days of Communism?

We visit a sweets store for a sampling of trdelnik - doughnuts will never taste the same again...

We walk by famous café Orient - Becherovka or Tuzemak, what do you know about Czech shots?

We step into a Vietnamese convenience store. Why all these Vietnamese 7/11's all over town?

Our exploration takes us to the beer museum. We can try the local beer, and the traditional accompanying snack, that no bow of potato chips can ever replace.

All along, we discuss local food culture:

What is Vepřo-knedlo-zelo ? And when is it time for “liquid bread”? After the fall of the iron curtain, what is the first thing the Czechs longed to eat? Why did one international food critic complain so famously about Prague cuisine? How come locals are so wary of restaurant food and often prefer to eat at home? Where does Prague’s vibrant beer culture come from? And why are food markets in Prague so different from anywhere else in Europe?

While walking the city and enjoying its food, we gain an insight into Prague life - its geography, traditions, and culture.

At the end of our tour we sample all the foods we bought, we learn what they tell us about Prague, we try one of Prague's potent alcohols – and then we sample some more.
strTitle: 2-hour Prague Food and Beer Walking Tour

strIntroduction:
This custom tour provides guests with the option of personalizing their tour of the stunning Margaret River Region. Organize a tour with us and join our friendly team to explore this world famous area in our fully equipped minivan.

The South West region is globally recognized as one of the major biodiversity hotspots on Earth. This recognition is based on the high levels of natural diversity, particularly for amphibians and plants and is the only global hotspot in Australia. Beyond the regions international importance for biodiversity, the South West also has a unique and important cultural heritage. Its landscapes have been peopled for at least 50,000 years, providing a rich tapestry of cultural diversity. With its mild weather and abundant sunshine, you will be blown away by the awe inspiring scenery, rich biodiversity and cultural history and getting there is only two and a half hours away from Perth by road.
strTitle: South West Region of Australia Custom Eco Tour

strIntroduction:
Visit amazing scenic locations, iconic sites and experience some local wines and gourmet produce. Get a feel for the area through the eyes of 3rd generation local guides who's knowledge will enhance your discovery of the Margaret River regions natural, historical and cultural highlights. Sample delicious tastings of local produce plus your choice of a glass of local wine, beer or coffee at the iconic Sugarloaf Rock. You will be blown away by beautiful scenery in this globally recognized biodiversity hot spot

Your tour guide will provide interesting commentary, including the stories behind each stop, a yummy locally made afternoon tea, and personalized service in a comfortable mini bus with a maximum of 12 passengers, you’ll be able to discover all the region has to offer.

Travel to Cape Naturaliste, one of the most spectacular locations in the Margaret River Region, with stunning gentle bays on one side and the Indian Ocean on the other. Try and spot the Bottlenose Dolphins playing in the waves or take memorable photos of Sugarloaf Rock and Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse.

The tour then heads in to the wine country, down scenic Caves Road, stopping at Canal Rocks, then on to a local gourmet producer and a winery or two for a taste of the Margaret River Wine Region before returning to your drop off point through the Yallingup Hills, home of Western Grey Kangaroos.
strTitle: Margaret River Wine and Sights Discovery Tour from Busselton or Dunsborough

strIntroduction:
The northern Margaret River region has stunning coastal scenery and is brimming with life both above and below the water, you can see it all on this jam-packed half-day trip. With the region’s only live underwater video feed direct to the tour vehicle, plus local knowledge of the best nature and wildlife viewing locations. Indulge in a delicious platter of local produce plus your choice of a glass of local wine, beer or coffee.

Your first tour stop allows you to experience amazing vistas of Geographe Bay, find out about its historical and ecological significance.

Journey through the Meelup Regional Park’s woodland to your next stop, the Ngari Marine Park. Here, conditions permitting, your guide will launch the “live action” underwater camera showing you the unique and diverse marine life that calls Geographe Bay home.

Drive out to Bunker Bay via a very picturesque road that takes us within a couple of meters of azure water and rock pools, before arriving at the ancient and awe inspiring limestone cliffs of Cape Naturaliste, viewing them first from below, before a short walk above the cliffs, offering majestic views.

Continuing on to the rugged and contrasting West Coast, keep a look out for the playful Bottlenose Dolphins, (and whales and wildflowers in season) while walking along the coastal track with views of deserted beaches and stunning granite formations. After this mini walk stop to refuel and indulge in a delicious platter of local produce plus your choice of a glass of local wine, beer or coffee at the iconic Sugarloaf Rock. 

On the return to your selected drop-off point, see large mobs of Western Grey Kangaroos lounging in the sun.
strTitle: Margaret River Coastal and Wildlife Eco Trip from Busselton or Dunsborough

strIntroduction:
Are you looking to experience something new and unique during your trip? Experience a close-up visit to a colony of critically endangered, but full of personality, Woylies (small relatives of Kangaroos) on this Australian wildlife tour. The tour begins with a short bush walk before arriving at the animal viewing area. As the first of the Woylies appear, learn about some of their unique characteristics and interesting facts about this biodiversity hotspot.

Join us on our nocturnal animal tour in the Australian bush. Observe a colony of Woylies (Brush-tailed Bettongs) in their natural environment. A very rare, nocturnal little macropod with personality, Woylies are small relatives of Kangaroos. This tour is your only opportunity in the Margaret River region to view these amazing, but critically endangered creatures. 

The tour begins with accommodation pickups half an hour before sunset, before driving out to a nearby private Conservation Sanctuary where your group will have exclusive access. On arrival at the Sanctuary, a short guided bush walk identifying bush tucker will take you to the animal viewing site.

As the first of the Woylies appear, keep an eye out for other local wildlife including kangaroos, bandicoots and possums. On completion of your Woylie encounter, you will be returned to your hotel.
strTitle: Nocturnal Wildlife Tour from Busselton or Dunsborough

strIntroduction:
Hanoi Capital is located on the banks of the Red River with tranquil Hoan Kiem Lake at its heart, Hanoi is the capital of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. North of the lake are the bustling streets of the Old Quarter, each street named after the trade that used to take place there. Sightseeing with a Local Guide; water puppets performance; visit Ho Chi Minh’s mausoleum, One Pillar Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Museum, Presidential Palace, and Temple of Literature.

AM: 08:00 - 08:30: Pick up at your hotel in the Old Quarters area, Hanoi. Visit the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Museum to explore the architectural and historical aspects of Uncle Ho’s final resting-place. Just next door is Ho Chi Minh’s house on stilts and lying to one side of the Mausoleum is the One Pillar Pagoda which was founded by King Ly Thai To in 1049 - the structure has become an important symbol for the people of Hanoi. We then continue on to the Buddhist Tran Quoc Pagoda on the West lake (one of the oldest pagoda in Vietnam).Then visit Bat Trang pottery village (apply on Mon, Wed & Fri). Lunch at local restaurant.

PM: After lunch we’ll proceed to visit the Ethnology Museum (apply on Sun, Tue, Thu & Sat), the Literature Temple and Quoc Tu Giam. We’ll also see Vietnam’s first university, constructed in 1070 - it’s gardens and well-preserved architecture will offer a relaxing glimpse into Vietnam’s past. We will take you past Hoan Kiem Lake to see the peaceful waters, and the beauty of Ngoc Son temple. For the last part of the tour we’ll journey through Hanoi’s Old Quarter, where you’ll then have a chance for some shopping and exploration. Tour ends around 15.30 - 16.00.
strTitle: Full-Day Hanoi City Group Tour

strIntroduction:
Sapa is famous for its beautiful landscapes, cool climate and colorful markets. With this private, full-day trekking tour, you will visit Y Linh Ho and Lao Chai Hmong villages and have opportunity to experience their daily life, work and original customs.

You will be picked up at your hotel in Sapa, then start your hiking tour.

Enjoy an almost 7.5 mile (12 km) trekking route to visit the Hmong villages of Y Linh Ho and Lao Chai. You will see some of Sapa's amazing scenery of mountains and rice paddy fields on terraces. You'll enjoy lunch with a local family in Lao Cai or in a drinking shop nearby the river bank, then keep on hiking to Ta Van village of the Dzay tribe. Here you have opportunity to experience their daily life, work and customs before heading back to Sapa where your tour ends with a return to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Sapa Trekking Private Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore the beauty of the mountains and experience this adventure in one the most beautiful landscapes of the North. During this tour, you will do some sightseeing in the beautiful landscape of Sapa, you'll see unique villages and experience the daily life of the locals, as well as join in various interesting activities.

Night 1 (Fri): Hanoi - Night train to Lao Cai
You will be picked up at your hotel around 8:30pm and transferred to Hanoi Railway Station to take the night train from to Lao Cai. Sleep on the train.

Day 1 (Sat): Lao Cai - Can Cau - Bac Ha (B, L, D)
Early arrival in Lao Cai, with a pick-up and transfer to Can Cau market (~2 hours). This small market is situated in a valley surrounded by mountains and only about 4.5 miles (7 km) from China. The market shows the typical cultural features of the people living in the remote, mountainous areas in Vietnam. Furthermore, you can enjoy seeing boys and girls in colorful costumes - different colors of the mountains. They attend the market in the hope of finding "the other halves of their lives" and this is also the time for them to chat, to exchange everything among different groups through cups of wine sold in the market, and have lunch there.
After that, transfer to Bac Ha. On the way, you'll spend time visiting a village of the Flower H'mong and then check in hotel in Bac Ha. You are free to explore the town, dinner and overnight in Bac Ha.

Day 2 (Sun): Bac Ha - Lao Cai - Sapa/Night train to Hanoi (B, L, D)
After breakfast,you'll visit a big market filled with many different hill-tribe peoples. This is the most colorful market in North Vietnam. At the market, you have chance to enjoy the Bac Ha people's simple but unique kinds of food with special wines made from rice, cassavas, corn, and different sorts of fruits such as plums, apples, and peaches. Leave the market for the H'mong King's house, King Hoang A Tuong, built by the French colonists and the Chinese in 1920. Return the town for lunch. In the afternoon, spend time visiting another village (Ban Pho village) and then get back to Sapa. On the way back, Stop over to see the Vietnamese and Chinese border in Lao Cai. Back to train station for the night train to Hanoi. Your tour ends with your train's arrival in Hanoi around 5:30am.
strTitle: 3-Night Can Cau and Bac Ha Market Tour

strIntroduction:
Spend a full-day biking through the charming town of Sapa with a small-group of no more than 12. Gaze at the impressive terrain Sapa has to offer, including its rice paddy fields and mountains. In Ta Phin, you will witness the daily life of the Red Dao and Black Hmong minorities as you enjoy a traditional lunch.

Begin the biking tour with a pickup from your Sapa accommodations. A professional guide will be with you along the way to provide safety instructions as well as direction. Most of your expedition will be spent riding downhill through the suburb of Sapa. Pass by the town to ride along the smooth terrain for approximately 3km before heading off on the main road.

From there, move on to Ma Tra village, home to the H'Mong people and stunning landscaping. Admire the rice terrace, corn field, and pine hill before heading downhill to Ta Phin. In Ta Phin, witness the daily life of the Red Dao and Black H'Mong minorities. Break for lunch with a local family and a short walk around the village. Come the afternoon, you will ride uphill and downhill through the forest to get to Takko pass. Return to your hotel at the end of the day.
strTitle: Full-Day Biking Adventure in Sapa

strIntroduction:
The Vietnamese Demilitarized Zone was established as a dividing line between North and South Vietnam as a result of the First Indochina War. The boundary between these two zones was established at the Ben Hai River, which enters the South China Sea at 17 degrees 0 minutes 54 seconds N latitude. The boundary followed the Ben Hai to its headwaters, about 55 km WSW, and thence to the Laotian border.

7:30 – 8:00 a.m: Pick you up from hotel and transfer to the Demilitarized Zone (180km).
9.00 a.m: Visit to Frame of the Church (Lavang holly land), La Vang Holy is a shrine located in Hai Lang district, Quang Tri Province. Christians believe that Mary shows flexibility in this area in 1798 and a church was erected near the three banyan tree, where the apparitions and this is an important place of pilgrimage of Catholics Vietnam. La Vang Holy was awarded by Vatican Holy is the Emirate Palace of La Vang Cathedral from 1961. And then visit Doc Mieu base: One part of an elaborate electronic system (McNamara’s wall) intended to prevent infiltration across the DMZ.
11.30 a.m: Arrive DMZ; stop to visit Ben Hai River and Hien Luong Bridge, Hien Luong Bridge was first built by French sappers in 1950 and under the Geneva Agreement on Vietnam signed in 1954, served as the border gates to both sides. It is very pleasant to go on boat downstream on the Ben Hai River and admire the beautiful landscapes.
12.30 p.m: Have lunch at local restaurant.
1.30 p.m: Visit Tunnels of Vinh Moc and Museum of the tunnels, Vinh Moc Tunnels is well-known as an underground village constructed to avoid bombardments during the American War (1965-1966). The complex grew to include wells, kitchens, rooms for each family and spaces for healthcare. Today, for visitors' safety, the tunnels were restored with reinforced concrete and internal lightening.
2.30 p.m: Keep moving to the Rockpile, The Rockpile was a Marine outpost built on top of a huge outcropping. Though it's inaccessible, it's a prominent sight from the highway. And then is Dak Rong Bridge, it is midway along Highway 9, and is the starting point of Highway 15, one of the main branches of the Ho Chi Minh Trail, which leads south to the A Shau valley and the infamous "Hamburger Hill". Though not entirely legitimate, there is a monument commemorating it as a point on the Ho Chi Minh Trail, (called Đường Trường Sơn in Vietnam), and Khe Sanh Combat Base, just east of the Lao border, was the site of a U.S. base which fell under attack in early 1968. The attack of the NVA on Khe Sanh was a diversion for the 1968 Tet Offensive in the south. The old airfield of red dirt still remains
3.30 p.m: Take the bus back to Hue.
6.30 p.m: Arrive at hotel in Hue, tour finish.
strTitle: Demilitarized Zone Day Trip from Hue

strIntroduction:
Discover traditional Vietnamese village life on this 7-hour day tour from Hoi An, visiting Tra Que village, Tam Canh Village, and the Thu Bon river. Ride bicycles and coracles, learn how to cast a net, fish for crabs, and make palm leaf tools, and feast on delicious Vietnamese specialities for lunch.

Your English-speaking local guide will collect you from your Hoi An hotel at 8am for the bicycle journey to Tra Que village. Explore the village, famous for farming the sweet vegetable that gives it its name, and join in daily farming life. From here, you'll cycle along the De Vong River to Victoria Wharf, where you'll catch a boat to the Cua Dai sand dunes. Here you'll watch fishermen casting their nets – they'll even teach you how!

At 10:30am, you'll continue to Cam Thanh Water village by air-conditioned minivan, to discover the area's fascinating Vietnam War era history – later, you may well be able to talk to local people about their memories of the Vietnam War. Learn how to catch crabs and paddle the traditional circular bamboo coracles that are so popular in coastal Vietnam, before the group divides into teams for a coracle race, complete with prize for the winner.

Lunch is at noon, and includes local specialities like pancake, fresh fish, and tam huu spring roll. After lunch, you'll learn how to make tools from palm leaves, before setting out for Hoi An Old Town at 1:30pm to experience the daily life of fishermen along the Thu Bon river. You'll be back at your Hoi An hotel around 3pm.
strTitle: Hoi An Villages Day Tour

strIntroduction:
A private day-excursion to Cuc Phuong National park in Ninh Binh. Through this special trip, you'll explore the beauty of nature by visiting the dense, grass jungle valley, seeing the giant ancient tree and various fauna and flora. In addition, rare primates are available for tourists to see and take photographs.

In 8:00 in the morning, your tour guide and driver will pick you up at the hotel and take you to Cuc Phuong National Park (140km). Upon arrival, visit the Endangered Primate Rescue Central where the rare primates of Vietnam are reared and rescued, the Ancient grotto.

Local lunch at site. After that, take a trek through the dense, grass jungle valley to the giant ancient tree where you'll enjoy the beauty of fauna and flora. At the end of the day, return to Hanoi and be dropped off at your hotel.

Notes:

  • Beware of your luggage and money
  • Take hat, raincoat, water, good shoes for trekking and cash
  • All customers must obey the directions of your tour guide for your safety
  • Passengers are advised not to take along big luggage for convenience
strTitle: Cuc Phuong National Park Trekking Day Trip

strIntroduction:
The Perfume Pagoda (Chùa Hương) is a vast complex of Buddhist temples and shrines built into the limestone Huong Tich mountains. The Perfume Pagoda is one of the most important religious sites for Buddhism in Vietnam. Every spring, after the Lunar New Year, thousands of Vietnamese pilgrims come here to pray for all the health and prosperity they need to get them through the year. You will glide along scenic waterways and walk up steep mountain paths visiting the pagodas and temples that were built in this area over the last centuries.

Your guide and driver will pick you up at your hotel in the Hanoi Old Quarter between 8:00am to 8:30am. After you will take a 2 hour road trip to a row boat trip to go visit the land on the Yen stream about 1 hour from Thien Tru harbor. Then you will go trekking up and down to visit the main cave. Arriving at the Huong Tich cave on the top of the mountain. After a trek down there will be lunch at a local restaurant at the bottom of the mountain.

After lunch, you will see the Heaven Kitchen pagoda to learn about the ancient Le Dynasty and Buddhism. Then you will come back by a row boat and transfer back to Hanoi for arrival around 6:00pm.
strTitle: Full-Day Perfume Pagoda Boat Trip and Trekking Group Tour from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Explore and experience Sapa in 2 days and 1 night on this small-group bus tour via the new highway connecting Noi Bai - Lao Cai (245km). This new road shortens the travel time and distance from Hanoi to Sapa. Moreover, you will have chance to admire the beautiful scenery as you travel the longest highway in Vietnam before finding yourself in Sapa – the resort town in cloudy situated in the Northwest of Vietnam.This tour includes a 1-night stay at a local house in Sapa.

Day 1: Sapa-Cat Cat - Y Linh Ho - Lao Chai San - Lao Chai - Ta Van (L/D)
06:30: Have transport pick you up at the meeting point or your hotel and depart to Sapa using the new highway running from Noi Bai to Lao Cai (245Km) in less than 5 hours. You will have the opportunity to enjoy the beautiful scenery on the both sides of this road.

12:00: Arrival Sapa, Enjoy lunch at local restaurant then proceed to visit.
we take a short drive to the first village H’Mong – Cat Cat Village, start trekking and walk around the village. We continue to visit the old Hydro Electric Power station, built by French in the old days. We then hike on a small path down the valley to the Muong Hoa River and from here to the Black H’mong village of Y Linh Ho & Lao Chai. Enjoy the overall pictures of the villages among terraces and visit the H’mong people living in the wooden and bamboo houses. After that, we continue going to Ta Van village to visit Zay minority. Have dinner and free evening at leisure.

Overnight at home stay in Ta Van Village

Day 2: Tavan – Giang Ta Chai – Su Pan –Sa Pa (B/L)

After the breakfast, we take on road to Giang Ta Chai Village of the Red Dzao minority via the paths between terraces, visit silver waterfall and suspension Rattan Bridge. We have chance to meet the local people and share cultural experiences with families. We continue along small paths in the rice fields, cross the Muong Hoa River and trek up to Su pan village. Picnic lunch is on the way.
then take a van for transferring back to Sapa. Freshen up before catch bus back to Hanoi. Trip ends.
strTitle: Overnight Sapa Homestay Experience from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
North and South of Phu Quoc full-day tour is a special offer to discover the pearl island for a full day. Have a memorable day visiting Sao and Vung Bau Beach, National Park, Fish Sauce Factory, and Phu Quoc Dog Farm. You will also get to enjoy some sim wine – a specialty of Phu Quoc.

08.30AM Pickup at the hotel and visit both the North and the South of Phu Quoc:

  • Sim wine factory: When visit the Sim wine factory, you will have opportunity to see, hear from processing the delicious wines from fruit sim of owners sim wine production. Along with that will bring the bottle back to with great-term sim wine as gifts for friends and relatives.
  • Pearl Farm: There are many Pearl Shops on the Island, and here you will find some remarkable pearls and interesting information about the history of pearl farming on the island through a presentation they show you on your arrival.
  • Coconut Prison: Coconut Tree Prison located about 5km north of An Thoi Town. The prison was built by the French colonial administration before World War II and was later used by the Americans during the Vietnam War to house tens of thousands of prisoners
  • Fish Sauce Factory: For a completely unique experience visit one of the many fish sauce distilleries in Duong Dong.
  • Sao Beach (Relax – Swimming - Sun bath): You will have opportunities for empty sun drenched beaches under those coconut trees will be found around the northern and northeastern part of the island.
  • Fishing Village (Ham Ninh): You will find a jetty that extends a couple hundred meters out to sea to allow for the shallow waters along the coast here.
  • Waterfall Tranh Stream (for rain season only): Located about 7km southeast of Duong Dong Town, after a short 15 minute stroll along the shaded forest path you reach what is the islands largest string of waterfalls and rock pools, also a good place for a swim when the falls are flowing, because the stream tends to dry up before the rainy season arrives each year.
  • Pepper Farm: You’ll find pepper plantations mostly around the central and northern parts of the island and most farmers won’t mind you stopping to take photos or viewing these amazing storks of pepper trees or the drying pepper. You can also buy pepper products to bring home as souvenirs, to impress your friends and relatives.
  • Phu Quoc Dog Farm (Ridgeback dog): On the Island there is a sanctuary which is great fun for dog lovers to visit on their tour.
  • National Park (forest walking): There is a good walking trail 5km before Ganh Dau, where the going is relatively easy and trail wide enough to take in the surrounding environment.
  • Nguyen Trung Truc Temple: This temple is dedicated to Nguyen Trung Truc, a leader of the resistance campaign of the 1860s against the newly arrived French.
  • Cape Ganh Dau (Cambodia view): Just adventure through the village and you’ll find this little piece of paradise.
  • Vung Bau Beach (1,5 hours for enjoy lunch, here or Sao Beach)
  • Phu Quoc Bee Farm (Fo Organic And Save The Bee With Us)
Drop off at your hotel around 04.30PM.
strTitle: Full-Day Tour of North and South Phu Quoc

strIntroduction:
With the tour, you will have a memorable trip to visit fish sauce factory, pepper farm, sim wine factory, and finally swim and trek at Da Ban Stream.

09.00AM Pickup at the hotel and start an exciting tour to discover Phu Quoc:

  • Sim wine factory: When visit the Sim wine factory, you will have opportunity to see, hear from processing the delicious wines from fruit sim of owners sim wine production. Along with that will bring the bottle back to with great-term sim wine as gifts for friends and relatives.
  • Fish Sauce Factory: For a completely unique experience visit one of the many fish sauce distilleries in Duong Dong.
  • Phu Quoc Dog farm: On the Island there is a sanctuary which is great fun for dog lovers to visit on their tour and see this breed of dog unique to this island.
  • Pepper farm: You’ll find pepper plantations mostly around the central and northern parts of the island and most farmers won’t mind you stopping to take photos or viewing these amazing storks of pepper trees or the drying pepper. You can also buy pepper products to bring home as souvenirs, to impress your friends and relatives.
  • Da Ban Stream (trekking, swimming ; enjoy BBQ lunch with fresh fruits): The stream originates from Ham Ninh, the highest and longest mountain among the 99 peaks on Phu Quoc. From a distance, tourists can hear the water cascading but the closer they come, the stronger they hear the sounds. Da Ban falls down from a great height and spreads around many places that are blocked by some giant stones to create smaller waterfalls.
Drop off at your hotel around 03.00PM
strTitle: Phu Quoc Day Trip Including BBQ Lunch at Da Ban Stream

strIntroduction:
A memorable trip to visit Cua Can River – Mot Island – Thom Beach. Enjoy fresh local seafood at a fishing village and enjoy Mot island’s natural surroundings.

8:30am pickup at the hotel and start an exciting tour to discover Phu Quoc:

  • Phu Quoc Dog Farm (Phu Quoc Ridgeback): On the island there is a sanctuary which is great fun for dog lovers to visit on their tour and learn about this incredibly unique breed of dog.
  • Pepper Farm: You’ll find pepper plantations mostly around the central and northern parts of the island and most farmers won’t mind you stopping to take photos or check out their plants or pepper-drying structures. You can also buy pepper products to bring home as souvenirs, to impress your friends and relatives.
  • Crocodile Farm: The Phu Hai crocodile farm is located in Da Chong in Thom Beach and provides you with an overview of crocodile are farmed.
  • MOT island – relax, take some pictures, discover nature
  • Thom Beach Village: You can watch the sunrise at Thom Beach is quite magical as the sun rises from behind Cambodia. And Thom Beach is also a great place to watch the sunset.
  • Cua Can River – discover the river via motorboat or kayak
Drop off at your hotel around 4pm
strTitle: Phu Quoc Day Trip to Cua Can River, Mot Island and Thom Beach

strIntroduction:
Phu Quoc Snorkeling and Fishing tour to the South – A special trip to visit Phu Quoc Island. Especially, it is a good opportunity to experience exciting activities : snorkeling and fishing.

8am - Pickup at your hotel in Duong Dong city center then start the tour. Tour the twelve southern islands off the south tip of Phu Quoc, the boat will be stopped near island for fishing about 30 minute, after that snorkeling at the two different island, so you can enjoy the warm waters and beauty of many color of fish underwater at coral reef kingdom. Lunch and fresh fruit platter will be served on board whilst you laze around in the tropical sun! On the return journey we will take you to Phu Quoc hidden treasure "Sao Beach" with it’s white sands and turquoise water, it’s an absolutely must see! Tour ends around 5pm
strTitle: Southern Phu Quoc Island Snorkeling and Fishing Day Trip

strIntroduction:
Phu Quoc Snorkeling and Fishing tour to the North – A special trip to visit the north of Phu Quoc Island. Especially, it is a good opportunity to experience exciting activities: snorkeling and fishing.

Between 8am - 8:30am your driver will pick you up at the hotel in Duong Dong Town and transfer to the pier to get the boat for the northern trip.
You will cruise along the coastline until arriving at ’’turtle island’’ and “Finger island” to enjoy unspoiled water beauty of coral reef kingdom for snorkeling and fishing, lunch on board.
After lunch, you will have opportunities for empty sun drenched beaches under those coconut trees will be found around the northern and northeastern part of the island. After that, the captain cruises slowly back to town and just in time to catch the sunset. Transfer back to hotel. Tour ends around 5pm.
strTitle: Northern Phu Quoc Snorkeling and Fishing Day Trip

strIntroduction:
Phu Quoc is an island off the coast of Cambodia in the gulf of Thailand that became part of Vietnam while the French administrated the region and has remained so ever since. It is very close to Cambodia - you can see the mainland from the northwest of the island - but can be reached by fast boat in around 2.5-3.5 hours from the towns of Ha Tien and Rach Gia in the Mekong Delta.

At 5pm our driver will pick up you for transfer to the pier. We start cruising slowly into the sunset along with other fishermen boats for an exciting night! As the sun disappears, the boat will anchor at the best spot. Where you will most likely can catch squid and our crew will show you a secret technique, and method to get your catch of squid, exactly the local fishermen do, to earn their living. Fishing gear and baits will be provided, so be ready for an experience of a lifetime! Our crew will be happy to cook the squid you catch for you before we head back. This is absolutely a local experience not to be missed.
strTitle: Sunset BBQ and Night Squid Fishing in Phu Quoc

strIntroduction:
On this Phu Quoc boat tour, you will have the opportunity enjoy water activities such as snorkeling, swimming, and fishing, plus enjoy an overall tour of the nearby islands. Lunch and dinner are included.

Your guide picks you up at your hotel in Duong Dong (pickup from other areas is available for an additional fee) at midday to begin your tour with vehicle transfer to the harbor. 

Hop aboard your tour boat, and enjoy a late lunch on board as you cruise around Phu Quoc and neighboring islands. Go swimming or snorkeling with provided equipment, and enjoy an exploration of the island. When it's time for sunset, relax on board to watch it, and then your captain will anchor the boat so you can experience night squid fishing, a popular activity on Phu Quoc. Once the sun has gone down, start fishing for squid, and then a traditional fisherman's meal will be served for dinner before you head back to your hotel to end your tour.

Food options
Lunch: Fish or chicken with ginger, eggs, vegetables, noodles with seafood, potato soup, and rice
Dinner: Noodles with vegetables and seafood, barbecue squid, and rice soup with squid
strTitle: Phu Quoc Islands Day Trip Including Snorkeling and Sunset Fishing

strIntroduction:
Welcome the Phu Quoc! This overnight camping and boat trip gives you plenty of time to explore Phu Quoc island. With this tour, you have chance to take part in exciting activities such as: visiting Sao beach, swimming, sunbathing, snorkeling, and fishing all while overnight camping on the beach with BBQ party!

Day 1: Boat tour - Camping on the beach (L,D)
Pick up and transfer by car to visit the South Tips of the island.
Board the boat. Stop along some floating houses & fishing villages.
Fishing at the popular spots – Snorkeling around corals & swimming.
Lunch will be served on board. Later we head toward a private island to prepare our camping tent and watch the sunset and enjoy private “BBQ Beach Party”.
Late evening you can try “Night Squid Fishing”.

Day 2: Snorkeling - fishing - back to the hotel (B,L)
After Breakfast we pack our tent and make our way to the next hot spots.
For some more snorkeling and fishing, relax –swimming-sunbath on the top of the boat
Light lunch will be serve as the boat continue cruising to our final stop To the famous “Bai Sao Beach” for a walk along the white sandy beach and for a swim before transferring by car back to hotel.
strTitle: Overnight Phu Quoc Beach Camping Tour Including BBQ and Squid Fishing

strIntroduction:
With this getaway, you are given 5 days to explore Phu Quoc island. You will have the chance to visit the Phu Quoc National Park, Cua Can river, and Dai beach. Take part in exciting activities such as swimming, sunbathing, snorkeling, and fishing.

Day 1: Saigon- Arrival
Upon your arrival in the Tan Son Nhat airport, your driver will pick you up and transfer you to your hotel. You will have the rest of your day free at your leisure.
Overnight in a Saigon hotel

Day 2: Saigon- Phu Quoc (B)
Enjoy breakfast at your hotel before your transfer to the Tan Son Nhat Airport for your flight to Phu Quoc. Once you arrive, a new driver will pick you up and transfer you to a hotel for check in. Enjoy free time for the rest of the evening.
Overnight in a Phu Quoc hotel

Day 3: Day tour to visit National park and Cua Can river (B/L)
At 9.30am, you will be picked up from the hotel and begin an exciting tour of Phu Quoc. Visit the fish sauce factory, sim wine factory, and pepper farm. Walk in the forest in a tour of the National Park before heading to Cape Ganh Dau for a beautiful view of Cambodia. Afterwards, head to Dai Beach to relax, swim, and possibly sunbath. For your last tour of the day, visit Cua Can River using either a motor boat or kayak. You will be dropped off at your hotel around 4:30pm.
Overnight in a Phu Quoc hotel

Day 4: Phu Quoc- Evening fishing tour (B, D)
Enjoy the day at your leisure until 5:00pm, when you will begin a sunset fishing tour. As the sun disappears, the boat will anchor at the spot where you will be most likely to catch a squid. The crew will show you a secret technique and method used by local fishermen to get your catch of the day. They will also be happy to cook the squid you catch before you head back to the hotel. Tour will end around 9pm. Overnight in a Phu Quoc hotel

Day 5: Phu Quoc- Saigon (B)
Spend the morning as you wish until you transfer to the airport for your departure flight.
strTitle: 5-Day Phu Quoc Island Tour from Ho Chi Minh City

strIntroduction:
Enjoy your honeymoon in the best way possible with this tour. With this tour, you will have plenty of romantic time to enjoy time with your partner. Enjoy cozy dinners or BBQ lunches while relaxing on the crystal-clear beach of Phu Quoc.

Day 1: Phu Quoc (D)
Upon arrival to Phu Quoc, you will be picked up and transferred to the resort for check in. Enjoy the evening at your leisure before enjoying a cozy dinner at a local restaurant for honeymooners.
Overnight in a Phu Quoc resort

Day 2: Explore Phu Quoc (B, L)
Phu Quoc is famous for having a variety of small islands including An Thoi archipelago in the South and Mong Tay & Doi Moi islets in the North. Most of them are uninhabited! A get-away to a wild island with someone special is the romance of a lifetime. You will know the meaning of remote and undiscovered as you head out in the charter boat to explore a hidden beach on an uninhabited island. A delicious BBQ lunch will be served on the beach accordingly.
Overnight in a Phu Quoc resort

Day 3: Free day in Phu Quoc (B)
This will be a free day to enjoy yourselves on the crystal sandy beach of Phu Quoc or any other activities you see fitting.
Overnight at the resort.

Day 4: Phu Quoc (B)
Enjoy the day at your leisure until it is time to head to to the airport
strTitle: 4-Day Phu Quoc Honeymoon Experience

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a scenic speedboat trip through the Mekong Delta. You’ll experience the old-world river life of the Mekong and enjoy a lesser-seen glimpse into rural Vietnam. Key cultural stops include a Cao Dai temple, a riverside market, a pagoda, evocative farmlands and local pottery workshops.

8am: Your guide will meet you in the lobby of your hotel and bring you by car to your boat at Ho Chi Minh City pier.
8:15am: The boat departs and you slip away from downtown Saigon via narrow canals and enter the verdant green tributaries of the Mekong Delta. A light breakfast will be served on board.
8:45am: Enjoy a brief stop at the ornate, overwater Tuong Van Pagoda, while your guide explains the importance of Buddhism to many people of the Delta.
9:30am: Visit a bustling, colorful riverside market full of local curiosities, tropical fruits and all manner of fish and shellfish. Great photo opportunities will be available during this visit.
10:30am: Reach the idyllic watery expanses of the Delta itself, known as the Delta of Nine Dragons for the 9 tributaries that splinter from the main Mekong River.
10:45am: Turn off the delta into small, winding canals of the Thu Thua area, shaded by a canopy of foliage as you drift along lazily.
Depending on the route, you will visit a traditional riverside house with huge Burmese pythons as pets, a quaint Mekong village and surrounding rice paddies. You will then head to a traditional farmhouse where you’ll sample coconuts and Mekong whiskey or you will visit a local merchant and try a range of Mekong produce, whiskey and wine. You’ll walk along the banks of the river to a traditional rural Vietnamese house where 3 generations live. Explore a charming village where you can try fresh coconuts from the tree. This variation provides fascinating insight into the life of the Mekong Delta region.

Note: Our tours are flexible. Your guide may combine parts from both routes.

12:30pm: Enjoy a traditional Mekong Delta lunch at a local pagoda prepared by our private chef. After lunch, you will visit an orphanage run by Buddhist monks.
1:30pm: Visit a colorful Cao Dai Temple.
2:30pm: Return to the speedboat and depart for Ho Chi Minh City.
4pm: Arrive back in Saigon where you will return to your hotel by car.
strTitle: Private Full Day Mekong Delta Tour by Speedboat

strIntroduction:
Take this 2 hour tour and discover Saigon. With this tour, you will have chance to visit the scenic, lush jungle canals with locals living a simple life. Take in the beautiful city skyline and bridges as it lights up at night.

Get picked up at your hotel and head to your departure point where you will explore the waterways in and around Saigon. See the true life of this amazingly diverse and rapidly changing city. You will leave an urban metropolis and just minutes away visit the scenic, lush jungle canals with locals living a simple life in surroundings that resemble the Mekong Delta. A light dinner will be served during your two-hour sunset tour.
Return to Saigon just after sunset to see the city‘s skyline and bridges lit up at night. Saigon is a non-sleeping city, just like Hong Kong, Singapore, which means you can literally wander around the whole city and enjoy both the hustle and bustle. Embrace the emptiness, the upbeat and the silence, the devil and the angel of the city by night.
strTitle: Ho Chi Minh City and Canals Boat Tour

strIntroduction:
Embark on a scenic speedboat journey from the heart of Ho Chi Minh City (aka Saigon) to the dense riverside jungles of Can Gio Mangrove Biosphere Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Travel via the green canals of the Mekong Delta, with its lush landscapes, and enjoy Vietnamese breakfast and lunch by the river. You can row through a lagoon and take a trek through a mangrove forest. This 8-hour tour provides an immersive experience in a natural wonder.

Your day trip starts when your guide meets you at your Ho Chi Minh City hotel in the morning and drives you to the city's central pier, Bach Dang, to board your speedboat. Then depart the city for the green tributaries of the Mekong Delta. A light breakfast of pastries or sandwiches, tropical fruit, and ca phe sua da (Vietnamese coffee) is served.

Stop by Can Giuoc Market, a bustling riverside market at the gateway to the Mekong Delta, and then watch the surrounding landscape start to change from riverside water palms to dusky mangrove swamps as you move from the delta toward Can Gio Mangrove Biosphere Reserve. In the mid-morning, arrive at the Giant Bat Lagoon and explore leisurely on a rowboat before trekking through the mangrove jungle. At midday, eat a traditional Vietnamese lunch at a private riverside location; your meal will include the Mekong Delta specialty, Elephant Ear Fish.

About an hour later, arrive at Vam Sat Ecological Center to visit a crocodile reserve, see monkeys in their natural habitat, watch for exotic and migratory birds, and perhaps enjoy some crab fishing. You can also take another mangrove forest walk. In the afternoon, start heading back to Ho Chi Minh City, arriving back at the central pier in the late afternoon. The staff returns you to your hotel by car.
strTitle: Private Can Gio Mangrove Reserve Tour by Speedboat from Ho Chi Minh City

strIntroduction:
Spend a day exploring Bangalore, known as India’s Silicon Valley and City of the Future, strolling through Lalbagh Botanical Gardens, visiting temples and palaces, and learning about the city’s rich history linking it to its colonial past. Your private guide will give you an insider’s view of one of South India’s most fascinating urban centers, including feasting on a delicious lunch of local specialties. Hotel transfers and all entrance fees are included.

Learn about the culture and history of Bangalore, one of South India’s most vibrant cities, on this 7-hour private tour beginning at your hotel between 8:30am and 9am.

Your local guide will first introduce you to the ISKCON Sri Radha Krishna Temple, one of the largest Hare Krishna temples in the world. You’ll next visit Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace and museum, an example of Indo-Islamic architecture that was originally built from solid teak, including intricately carved pillars and balconies.

Your tour continues at the Lalbagh Botanical Gardens, home to more than 1,000 plant species and the Glass House, a conservatory modeled after London’s former Crystal Palace. After a leisurely stroll, you’ll enjoy an included buffet lunch at a popular restaurant.

Drive past the Bangalore Palace, the High Court, Cubbon Park, and Vidhan Sabha where the Karnataka legislature meets. Your guide will explain the significance of Bull Temple dedicated to Nandi, and the Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple dedicated to Shiva.

Your tour will conclude at about 4pm with an included transfer to your hotel.
strTitle: Rich Culture of Bangalore Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Experience the grandeur and splendor of Mughal era by attending sound and light show at the famous Red Fort. Get to know about the various empires that came to power in the city and fell apart. The rich history of Delhi will leave you awe-struck.

The Lal Quila or the Red Fort, was built by Emperor Shah Jahan, whom also built the Taj Mahal, between 1638 and 1648. The red sandstone used in its massive outer wall gave it the name “Lal Quila” or the Red Fort. The Red Fort was the residence of the Mughal emperor and the capital of the empire till Bahadur Shah Zafar the last Mughal emperor was deposed by the British in 1857. An UNESCO World Heritage site since 2007, the Red Fort is one of the finest examples of the precision, grandeur and finesse of Mughal architecture.

Between 5pm and 5:40pm, our representative will meet you at your hotel in Delhi with a chauffeured air conditioned car and take you to the Red Fort, where you will witness an exciting sound and light show.

The tumultuous 5000 year history of Delhi comes alive in a spectacular son et lumière - sound and light show with the magnificent walls of the Red Fort as its backdrop. The show throws light on the past of this great city which has been witness to the rise and fall of various empires. The 60 minute show with its dramatic special effects and unique ambiance recreate the grandeur of a bygone era leaving you with an unforgettable experience.

After witnessing the glorious and tumultuous history of Delhi, the chauffeur will take you to a popular Indian restaurant, where you will dine on a delectable spread of Indian delicacies.

After dinner the chauffeur will drive you back to your hotel around 10pm to 11pm.
Show Timings - Feb. to Apr. 8:30pm to 9:30pm; May to Aug. 9pm to10pm; Sept. to Oct. 8:30pm to 9:30pm; Nov. to Jan 7:30pm to 8:30pm
strTitle: Exciting Evening at Red Fort's Sound and Light Show with  Dinner

strIntroduction:
The marvelous city of Agra welcomes you to a land brimming with rich culture and history. Bustling with life and myriad colors.Tthis enchanting place offers a magnificent experience to its discerning travelers, often leaving the visitors asking for more.

Home to the beautiful jewel of India - The Taj Mahal; Agra spreads an aroma of love and calls out to all the history lovers for a ride back to the glorious past. However, this is not all; there are many other amazing sites scattered around the city that are worth a visit. Therefore, we offer you an incredible tour to this stunning region with our extensive package that will cover all the hotspots in Agra.

Our driver will pick you up at 6:30am sharp from your hotel in New Delhi with a Luxury AC Car.After a 3-4 hour journey in our comfortable car by expressway, you will reach the beautiful city of Agra.

With a warm smile, you will be welcomed by our English speaking guide along with Garlanding. He will give you a brief on the city and, right way, take you to the most breathtaking manmade structure – The Taj Mahal. Built by Emperor Shah Jahan as a memorial for his beloved wife, this white marble beauty symbolizes eternal love. It is an admirable edifice, sitting amidst the perfect symmetry of Charbagh Garden, the water canals and beautiful fountains drawing a large number of tourists all across the year. After you are mesmerized by this wonder of superior architectural grandeur, you will be provided with a complementary lunch at a Luxury local restaurant.

Once you devour the culinary flavors of Agra, you will be directed to encounter another glorious monument – The Agra Fort. It was built in the 16th century by great Mughal emperor Akbar. Known as the treasure house of the Mughal Empire, it fascinates tourists with its large spacious rooms, brilliantly constructed mosques and impeccably designed chambers. It includes many stunning palaces like the Jahangir Palace, Sheesh Mahal and the Khas Mahal.

So finally, after treating your eyes with these pleasurable sights, you will be taken for a tour of the Marble Factory and some famous shops in the city (so you can embark on a shopping spree!).

After enjoying a fun-filled day at Agra, you will be taken back to Delhi in a comfortable cab ride.
strTitle: Private Luxury Tajmahal day Tour by Express Way From Delhi

strIntroduction:
Witness the splendor of one of the most magnificent cities in India: Agra. The city is home to many sights, including the Taj Mahal, Agra Fort and the Tomb of Akbar the Great. Through our full-day tour, you'll marvel at the beautiful architecture and immerse yourself in the city's rich history.

Our driver and guide will pick you up from either your Agra hotel, the railway station or bus stop at 6am, in order to catch the magnificent Taj Mahal at sunrise. If you prefer to sleep-in, you can email us your preferred start time. Commissioned by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in loving memory of his wife Mumtaz in 1632, the Taj Mahal has been acclaimed by archaeologists as the finest example of Mughal architecture, reflecting combined elements of Persian, Turkish and Indian styles.

After visiting the Taj Mahal, make your way back to the hotel for breakfast. We'll then drive to the Agra Fort, a monument constructed with red sandstone and white marble. The Agra Fort features magnificent palaces, large rooms, brilliantly constructed mosques, and beautifully carved chambers, including Diwan-i-Khas, Diwan-i-Am, Moti Masjid, Mina Masjid and Nagina Masjid.

Next, we'll visit the Tomb of Akbar the Great. Standing majestically in the suburbs of Agra, the tomb is one of India's well-preserved monuments and is made up of red sandstone adorned with breathtaking inlay work of marble that is done in geometric and floral designs.

After the tomb visit, we'll take a lunch break at a local restaurant - at your own expense. After lunch, we'll drive to the marble factory and some shops. After you're done with your shopping, you will be dropped off at your hotel or the railway station.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Taj Mahal City Tour

strIntroduction:
The 6-day trip starting at the capital exploring different parts of North India. This tour has everything to convey you a memorable traveling experience with your closest and dear ones. It lets you explore almost everything - from palaces like forts to deserts. It allows you to become familiar with Indian rich cultural heritage.

Day 01 Delhi – Jaipur (D)
Pick up from Delhi, Gurgaon hotel or airport and drive to Jaipur city. Upon arrival to Jaipur, visit Amer Fort and JalMahal, and then check in at a hotel. In the evening, you will visit City Palace and the facade of Hawa Mahal. A short trip to the jewellery making work shop. Overnight stay at a hotel followed by buffet dinner.

DAY 02: Jaipur – Jodhpur – (B,D) After breakfast, drive to Jodhpur its around 332 Kms, upon arrival check in at a hotel, after fresh up, evening will be free for own activity and relaxation. Overnight at a hotel followed by buffet dinner.

DAY 03: JODHPUR – Jaisalmer (B,D) After breakfast, check out from hotel, vsit Mehrangarh Fort & Jaswant Thada Memorial with local expert guide. Followed by drive to Jaisalmer. Overnight at Jaisalmer Hotel, where you'll have a buffet dinner..

DAY 04: JAISALMER (B,D) After breakfast, This day is planed with a tour of the local delights at Jaisalmer exploring its many havelis and forts with Local Guide. The finest experience is the trilling camel ride across the Thar Desert at sunset and witnessing the dunes of Sam in the evening. Overnight stay at hotel followed by buffet dinner.

DAY 05: Jaisalmer to UDAIPUR – (B,D) After breakfast, drive to Udaipur, its around 550 KM full day drive, en route lunch (Own expense) also explore local sights and villages of Rajsthan while driving. On arrival Udaipur, check in at a hotel and get rested for tomorrow after a delicious buffet dinner.

DAY 06: UDAIPUR- Delhi (B) After breakfast visit Jagdish temple, Jagmandir, Sahelion ki Bari, tour ends with a splendid boat ride across the Lake Pichola. The view of the city of Udaipur is exceptionally beautiful from the boat ride.

After boat ride, you have a lunch (own expense) around 2 to 3 PM, drop-off at airport and fly back to New Delhi. On arrival to Delhi continue your onward journey or overnight stay at a hotel (own cost we could provide airport to hotel Ttansfer) . Udaipur to Delhi Flight is included in this package.
strTitle: 6-Day Private Royal Rajasthan Tour from New Delhi with Desert Camel Safari

strIntroduction:
The Golden Triangle Tour with Varanasi Tour is an ideal tour to witness the wonders of four beautiful and enchanting cities in India. The trip starts at Delhi – the Capital of India, followed by a tour of the marvellous city of Agra which is a proud resident of the Taj Mahal and the Agra Fort and ‘Pink city’ – Jaipur and ends at the spiritual city of Varanasi. This tour covers North part of India. It is one of famous North India Tour.

DAY 01: DELHI – AGRA (D)
Pick up between 7:30 – 8:30 AM from Delhi NCR hotel or Airport, drive to Agra. Upon arrival, check into the hotel. The first stop of the day is at the white Mable wonder – the Taj Mahal. This mausoleum was built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. Next stop is the Red sand (Agra Fort) stone creation of Akbar, built in 1565, the Agra Fort. You will be also taken for a tour of the Marble Factory and some famous shops in the city (so you can embark on a shopping spree!) followed by an overnight stay in Agra.
DAY 02: Agra -Fatehpur Sikri- Jaipur (B, D)
After breakfast at hotel. Drive to the Jaipur. Enroute you will be taken to Fatehpur Sikri On arrival, check in to the hotel. After fresh up drive to Chowki Dhani here you will enjoy mouth-watering dinner experience at the Chowki Dhani.Over night at hotel.
DAY 03: JAIPUR (B, D)
After breakfast starts with a trilling ride to the magnificent Amber fort. The next stop of the day is the Jal Mahal or the water Palace. A trip to Jaipur is incomplete without visiting the City Palace. The tour continues with a visit to the Hawa Mahal Palace and not to forget the complex architectural beauty – the Jantar Mantar. Evening some shopping in famous shops. Overnight stay at the hotel.
DAY 04: JAIPUR – Delhi- Varanasi (B, D)
Morning after breakfast at Hotel in Jaipur. Later you will be taken back to the Delhi or Jaipur airport to board in Varanasi Flight, on arrival Varanasi airport meet and Greet with our Representative and transfer to Hotel. Evening free for own activity. Overnight at Hotel.
DAY 05: Varanasi (B, D)
Wake up early in the morning and enjoy the boat excursion exploring a new view of the River Ganges. Even you can catch a glimpse of the bathing Ghats where the cremations being carried out. After ride back to Hotel have breakfast and drive to Sarnath. After Sarnath Back to Varanasi you can ascertain the unique architecture of the famous temples and especially the BHU. Other places you can visit appear as Kala Bhavan that signifies the holy creations. Evening, get the opportunity to view the ritual rites during the evening on the banks of the River Ganges. Overnight at hotel
DAY 06: Varanasi – Delhi (B)
Morning after breakfast, day free for own activity, later as per flight schedule transfer to Varanasi airport to board in Delhi Flight. On arrival Delhi airport proceed to your onward journey.
strTitle: Private 6-Day Golden Triangle  Agra Jaipur with Spiritual Varanasi from New Delhi

strIntroduction:
As one of the most popular attractions in North India, the city of Khajuraho deserves the name of 'Symbol of Medieval Heritage'. It encases the largest group of medieval Hindu and Jain temples, famous for their erotic sculptures that present distinction in artistry and eminence in architectural style.

Between 7am-9am, you will be picked up by your English-speaking guide and driven to the Khajuraho Group of Monuments. The Western group of temples contain the most accomplished Khajuraho temples with 84 towers, the Kandariya Mahadeva, dedicated to Lord Shiva and decorated with a profusion of sculptures with intricate details, symbolism and expressiveness of ancient Indian art. It also houses Devi Jagdamba Temple with its sensually carved statuary. The temples are famous for their architectural symbolism and erotic sculptures.

Afterwards, your guide will take you to the Eastern group of temples that house the largest Jain temple dedicated to Parsvanath. Although the Khajuraho group of temples were built together, they were dedicated to two different religions - Hinduism and Jainism. It suggests a tradition of acceptance and respect for diverse religious views among Hindus and Jains. Visit the temples of Brahma, Hanuman, Javari and Vamana.

Next you will be taken to the Southern group of temples through a local village. In the Southern group of temples Duladevo is a latest rendition that was built when creativity of Khajuraho was on its peak. It differs from Khajuraho traditional form as it has a wooden structure, which adds to its grandeur and represents later periods of architecture. One more Chaturbhuj temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is famous for its 3-meter high statue of Vishnu. After your visit to all groups of temples, you will be taken to a local market for shopping (approx. 1 hour) and then transferred back to your hotel or Khajuraho airport if you prefer.
strTitle: Half-Day Khajuraho Temples Tour

strIntroduction:
Experience the grandeur and splendor of Chandela king's story, learn about the 10th Century to the present day during the 50-minute show in English, view exclusive temples, and attend the light and sound show at the famous Western Group of temples complex.

You will be met in your hotel lobby by the driver at 6pm. You will the drive to the Western group of temples where you will enjoy a 50-minute the light and sound show on the Western Group of temples complex.

Amitabh Bachchan, one of the biggest stars of Bollywood, narrates the story of magnificent temples in his majestic voice.

Enjoy a 50-minute, entertaining and informative show. This light and sound show brings back to life the time of the great Chandela Kings and tells the story of the exclusive temples from the 10th Century to the present day.

After the show, you will be taken to a famous local restaurant where you will enjoy a mouthwatering dinner (fixed menu). After dinner, you will be dropped back at your hotel.

Please be aware: tour is subject to cancellation if there is any rain as it operates outdoors.
strTitle: Evening Excursion: Western Group of Temples including Light and Sound Show and Dinner from Khajuraho

strIntroduction:
Orchha is a small village set amongst the hills. It is a wonderful valley formed by crystal-clear waters of Betwa River that flows beautifully along its banks. Here, you will see many pristine and charming historical monuments, from which you'll learn the stories and legends of war and peace, of love and hate, and of war and destruction. It is a place famous for Bundela paintings, which are the imprints of Bundela dynasty that once ruled the area. This tour will take you to Jehangir Mahal, Raj Mahal, Rai Parveen Mahal, Chaturbhuj Temple and more.

Morning pick-up from your hotel in Khajuraho lobby and drive to Orchha. On arrival in Orchha you will visit Jehangir Mahal, a 17th-century monumental palace in commemoration of emperor Jehangir, and witness stunning beauty characterized by delicate chhatris and intricate trellis work.

Later visit Raj Mahal and Rai Parveen Mahal. Raj Mahal was constructed in 17th-century and designed based on bold manifestation of various religious themes. It is crowned by beautiful chhatris and decorated by exquisite and colorful murals inside. Rai Parveen Mahal, a two-story brick palace, was built in remembrance of Rai Parveen, a 16th-century great poet and musician. You will become awe-struck upon seeing the skillfully carved recesses through which sun rays fall upon the main hall and others chambers, creating a prismatic view.

You will also go to the Chaturbhuj Temple. Decorated with various symbols of religious significance, this majestic temple is mounted upon a giant stone platform. You need to walk steep stairs to reach this temple. Its interiors are emphasized by high, vaulted walls and charms of the exteriors are accentuated by subtle ornamentation. Experiencing this temple you will find a deeply-embedded sense of sanctity and experience peace of mind. If time permits, you can also visit attractions, such as Laxminarayan Temple, shrines of Siddh Baba Ka Sthan, Jugal Kishore, Janki Mandir, Phool Bagh, Cenotaphs and the Hanuman Mandir at Ochharedwara.

Whenever you become hungry, just let us know our guide he will take you to an amazing restaurant where you will enjoy a mouth-watering lunch. After your tour, you will be dropped off at Jhansi railway station by your chauffeur. Assistance boarding the train will be available. You can also return to Khajuraho and be dropped off at your hotel in Khajuraho.
strTitle: Private Tour: Orchha Day Trip from Khajuraho

strIntroduction:
Let's flee to Khajuraho, a religious haven that will send shivers down your spine with its very aphrodisiac appeal. One of the biggest attractions in North India, the city of Khajuraho is rightly termed as a 'Symbol of Medieval Heritage'. The city encases the largest group of medieval Hindu and Jain temples, famous for their erotic sculptures that present distinction in artistry and eminence in architectural style.

Day 1 [D]
Upon arrival to Khajuraho Airport or Railway Station you will be greeted by your driver and transferred to the hotel to check in and relax. Later you will visit the recently opened ASI Museum. That evening visit some local shops and enjoy a light and sound show at Western Group of Temples. After the show your driver will take you to a good local restaurant where you will enjoy dinner before being taken back to your hotel for your overnight stay.

Day 2 [B]
After breakfast your guide and driver will take you to the famous Western Group of Temples. The temples are divided directionally. The Western Group of Temples contains the most accomplished of all the Khajuraho Temples with 84 shikharas, including the Kandariya Mahadeva dedicated to Lord Shiva. It also houses the erotically charged temple of Devi Jagdamba with the sensually carved apsaras and mithunas.

Next you will visit the Eastern Group of Temples. These temples house the largest Jain temple dedicated to Parsvanath. The absence of all sexual motifs in this group highlights the Hindu tradition of withdrawing from the worldly to attain salvation within the self. The temples of Brahma, Hanuman, Javari and Vamana shouldn’t be missed.

Next you will visit the Southern Group of Temples via a local Village. The Southern Group of Temples are only two in number but no less splendid. Duladevo is a later rendition that was built when the creative fecundity of Khajuraho was at its zenith. It departs from the Khajuraho form slightly as it has wooden structures that adds to its grandeur and hearkens an age of newer methods of architecture. The other temple of Chaturbhuja’s claim to fame is the three meter high statue of Vishnu at its heart.

After visiting the temples you will be driven to your hotel to check out and dropped off at Khajuraho Airport or Railway Station. Hotel check-in/Check-out time is 12pm (Early check in & Checkout subject to availability) .
strTitle: Private Tour: 2-Day Temples of Khajuraho with ASI Museum and Light and Sound Show

strIntroduction:
This evening tour delivers dinner and a show, Udaipur style. First, enjoy a spectacular sound and light show depicting hundreds of years of Mewar heritage and history (in English), then savor dinner. Hotel pickup and drop-off, private transportation with a driver, tickets (including reserved seating), and dinner included.

After pickup at your Udaipur hotel at 6pm, travel for one hour in a private car with a driver to City Palace. Enjoy a 1-hour sound and light show called The Legacy of Honor from reserved elevated seats. The show, which is presented in English, was created to preserve the 1,500 year history of the Mewar region of India.

Shriji Arvind Singh, the present custodian of the House of Mewar, narrates the show's 12 episodes in his distinctive baritone voice, depicting the devotion of the dynasty's founding father, Bapa Rawal, the glory of Rani Padmini and Chittorgarh, and the sacrifice of Panna Dhai before the establishment of Udaipur in the 16th century.

(Following the English language production, the show is presented in Hindi from a script written by Pandit Narendra Mishra, the official court-poet of the House of Mewar. The richness of the Hindi language and the poetic composition are a treat for lovers of the Hindi language.)

After the 1-hour show, enjoy dinner at a local restaurant before being driven back to your hotel, arriving around 9pm.
strTitle: Sound and Light Show at Udaipur's City Palace with Dinner

strIntroduction:
Spend your evening enjoying the amazing Mohabbat The Taj show that depicts the romantic love story of Emperor Shajahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal in the famous theater Kalakriti Cultural and Convention Center. You will be blown away by the creative dance and dramatic lighting with the 12’ x 12’ Taj Mahal replica as well as the lavish lifestyle of the Mughal Empire. The live show is in both Hindi and Urdu languages and interpretation is available in English, French and German through headphones.

Your driver will pick you up at your hotel lobby in Agra at 5:30 pm and transfer to the famous theater Kalakriti Cultural and Convention Center.

Over 80 talented artists lively perform a story Mohabbat The Taj depicting the romantic love story of Emperor Shajahan and his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal in a world class theater. This will be subsequently followed by an entertaining light and sound show over the 12’x12’ Taj replica. During the one and half hours you will not only be touched by the beautiful story but also to experience the lavish lifestyle of the Mughal Empire. Their grandeur and extravaganza is well put forward in the creative dance performances.

After the show our driver will drive you to a popular Indian restaurant for a mouth-watering dinner. After dinner we will drive you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Evening Tour of Mohabbat The Taj Show in Kalakriti Cultural and Convention Center

strIntroduction:
Located in Aravalies, Ranakpur provides a picturesque view you must see. Here you will embark for Ranakpur Jain Temple, a Byzantine art temple built in the 15th century. You will be amazed by the 40 ft high pillars inside the temple, intricately carved in appealing designs. As you go deeper inside the temple, you will be blown away by the centuries old tree standing with all its grandiosity, beauty and charm.

Your driver will pick you up from your hotel in Udaipur and drive to Ranakpur to visit India's Seven Wonders, Jain Temple. Jain Temple, considered as heaven on the earth, is located in the mountain ranges of the Pali district. The Ranakpur Jain Temple was built during the reign of the liberal and gifted monarch Rana Kumbha in the 15th century. This temple is world famous for being one of the five most important Jain temples in India. It is comprised of five spires, 20 domes, 29 halls and 420 pillars. Almost every inch of material used in its construction is alive with lavish and delicate carvings and no two pillars are alike. The ingenuity of the layout is such that the entire structure is bathed in natural light that streams in from the open-air courtyards within the temple.

The large complex of the temple houses Chaumukha Temple, Parsvanath Temple, Neminath Temple, Amba Mata Temple and Surya Temple. After visiting the temples, enjoy lunch and be driven back to your hotel.
strTitle: Half-day Excursion of Ranakpur Jain Temple from Udaipur

strIntroduction:
Udaipur, known as the Venice of the East, boasts several sparkling lakes against a backdrop of the Aravail hills. Include the magical Lake Palace and the massive City Palace, there are some luxury hotels that were converted from the famous historical locations and featuring epic courtyards and stunning paintings. Join this full-day tour to experience the city of Udaipur!

At 9:00 am the driver will pick you up from your hotel in Udaipur and visit the City Palace, the most famous architectural marvel of Udaipur. This magnificent palace is a complex that includes Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal palaces and various other buildings. It houses a museum with rich collection of royal costumes and Rajput weaponry. Amar Vilas is the highest point of this palace. Here you will be amazed by wonderful hanging gardens with fountains, towers and terraces.

Afterwards the driver will take you to Shree Jagdish, a world renowned temple of Lord Vishnu. This 3-story and 79-feet-high temple was built by Maharana Jagat Singhji costing more than 1.5 million rupees. It is owned and managed by the royal family of Udaipur. The main Jagdish Temple is located in the center surrounded by four smaller temples of Lord Ganesha, Sun God, Goddess Shakti and Lord Shiva. It is known for 32 steps and 50 pillars.

You will continue to Saheliyon Ki Bari (Garden of Maids), which is hailed as the most beautiful garden in Udaipur. After the garden visit you will stop by a local restaurant or a hotel for lunch. Later on proceed to Lake Pichola and enjoy a boat ride on the lake. The pristine lake is surrounded by palaces, temples, bathing ghats and elevated hills from all sides. In the orange bloom of dusk, as you ride across the lake, you will see several charming patches of islands, such as Lake Palace, Jag Mandir Palace and Dudh Talai.
