The tour ends after the boat ride and your driver will take you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Udaipur Day Tour with Boat Ride

strIntroduction:
Udaipur is called "The Jewel of Mewar" because of its natural beauty, magnificent castles and far-stretching lakes all over the landscape. Be prepared to be mesmerized by the stunning beauty and overwhelming tranquility of Udaipur. Join us for this relaxing tour in Udaipur and Mount Abu.

Day 1 : Udaipur (D)
We will pick you up at Maharana Pratap airport, railway station or your hotel in Udaipur. Meet your representative who will accompany you to your hotel and check in. You will have free time for the rest of the day to relax. The dinner will be served at the hotel.

Day 2 : Udaipur (B,D)
After breakfast you will visit the City Palace built by Maharana Udai Singhji and also the towers over the scenic lake Pichola with some amazing collection of various artifacts. Take it easy for the rest of the day. Dinner will be served at the hotel.

Day 3 :Udaipur – Mount Abu (B,D)
After breakfast we will drive to Mount Abu (approx. 3 to 4 hours). Upon arrival you will proceed with hotel check-in and have free time for the rest of the day. Dinner will be served at the hotel.

Day 4 : Mount Abu (B,D)
After breakfast you will visit magnificent Dhilwara Jain temples built in 11th century and in the evening enjoy a boat cruise through Nakki Lake at sunset. Dinner will be served at the hotel.

Day 5 : Mount Abu - Udaipur (B)
After breakfast you will be transferred to Udaipur and, before the tour ends, we can drop you off at the Maharana Pratap airport, railway station or your hotel in Udaipur.
strTitle: Private Tour: 4-Night Udaipur and Mount Abu Tour

strIntroduction:
Udaipur is a small city in the Western State of Rajasthan with some artificial lakes and lavish palaces. Apart from its history, culture, and scenic locations, Udaipur is also known for the palaces from Rajput period and many of which have been converted into luxury hotels. It is often called the "Venice of the East", and is also nicknamed the "Lake City". You will also visit Ranakpur for its famous 15th century Jain temples. The temple is a masterpiece of architecture with 24 pillared halls and 80 domes that are supported by 400 columns.

Day 1: Udaipur - Ranakpur - Udaipur
Upon arrival to Udaipur airport or railway station you will be greeted by a representative and transferred to the hotel. You can also choose to be picked up at your hotel in Udaipur. After check-in you will be transferred to Ranakpur to visit the 15th century Jain temples. The temple is a masterpiece of architecture. It has 24 pillared halls with 80 domes that are supported by 400 columns. The upper and lower parts of the domes are linked by brackets that have deities' sculptures. Above all you would be amazed to see at a height of 45 feet engraved nymphs playing the flute in various dance postures. Each column is intricately carved and you will never find two columns with identical design. After the temple, you will be taken back to the hotel in Udaipur for overnight stay.

Day 2: Udaipur (B)
After breakfast you will start your excursion at the stunning palaces of Udaipur. First, you will visit City Palace with a local English-speaking guide. It is one of the most famous architectural marvels in Udaipur. Then, you will continue to see Shree Jagdish Temple, a world renowned temple of Lord Vishnu. After visiting Jagdish Temple, you will be taken to Saheliyon Ki Bari (Garden of Maids), which is hailed as most beautiful garden in Udaipur for its lush green lawns, marble art and fountains.

Later, you will be taken to a local restaurant or a hotel for lunch at your own expense. After lunch you will continue the tour to Lake Pichola. Enjoy a boat ride at the lake with perfect backdrop of lush green hills. The pristine lake is enveloped by range of lofty palaces, temples, bathing ghats and elevated hills from all sides. Lake Pichola is an artificial fresh water lake created in the year 1362 A.D. and named after the nearby Picholi village. After the boat ride you will be taken back to the hotel for overnight stay.

Day 3: Udaipur (B)
After the breakfast you will check out and get transferred to the airport, railway station or your hotel in Udaipur for your onward journey.
strTitle: 2-Night Private Tour: Udaipur and Ranakpur Tour

strIntroduction:
Udaipur with magnificent castles and far-stretching lakes sprinkled all over the landscape is also called 'The Jewel of Mewar'. Situated on the banks of the shimmering Lake Pichola, it is one of the most romantic cities of Rajasthan. Be prepared to be amazed by its stunning beauty and overwhelming tranquility.

Day 1: Udaipur
Upon arrival at Udaipur Airport (Maharana Pratap Airport) or railway station meet with the representative. You can also be picked up at your hotel in Udaipur. After pickup you will be transferred to the hotel for check-in and fresh up. Later on you will enjoy boat ride at Lake Pichola. With the perfect backdrop of lush green hills, Pichola Lake is the oldest lake in Udaipur and one of the most beautiful lakes in Rajasthan. The pristine lake is enveloped by range of lofty palaces, temples, bathing ghats and elevated hills on all its sides. In the orange bloom of dusk, as you ride across the lake, you will see several charming patches of islands, such as Lake Palace, Jag Mandir Palace and Dudh Talai. After boat ride your driver will drop you back at hotel for overnight stay at the hotel.

Day 2 : Udaipur
Morning after breakfast in hotel, chauffeur will drive you to visit some of the most stunning palaces in Udaipur. First you will visit City Palace with a local English-speaking guide. City Palace is one of the most famous architectural marvels of Udaipur and also a perfect illustration of architecture. Thereafter your chauffeur will drive you to Shree Jagdish Temple, a world renowned temple of Lord Vishnu, and the Saheliyon Ki Bari, meaning Garden of Maids, as one of the most beautiful gardens in Udaipur for its lush green lawns, marble art and fountains.

Later on you will stop by a local restaurant or hotel for lunch at your own expense. After Lunch drive to the area near Lake Pichola and stop by some famous shops. When the tour ends, as per your flight and train schedule you will be transferred to the airport or railway station for your onward journey. You can also choose to be dropped off at your hotel in Udaipur.
strTitle: 2-Day Private Tour in Udaipur

strIntroduction:
Varanasi is a picturesque city located on the western banks of Yamuna river. It is considered an important city in India because it has carries the legacy of Indian tradition and culture through centuries and passes it on following generations. Join the tour and experience the mysticism of river Ganga adds to the spiritual aura to this city.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Varanasi in the morning and transferred to Sarnath, a “UNESCO World Heritage site” as one of the holiest Buddhist places, Sarnath is a sacred place considered for attainment of enlightenment. It is the place where Gautama Buddha delivered his first sermons and claimed the place as an important pilgrimage site for his followers.

Later on you will visit Chaukhandi Stupa, an elevated structure surrounded by octagonal tower. It is the gateway to Sarnath and is adorned by lush green lawns from all sides. Then continue to Dhamek Stupa, a remarkable structure built of stone and brick. This cylindrical pillar is engraved with delicate floral carvings of Gupta origin. Afterwards visit Mulagandha Kuti Vihar, a modern temple that encases unrivaled frescoes of Japanese painter, and Sarnath Museum that houses some of the finest examples of Buddhist art and culture.

After visiting Sarnath you will enjoy lunch at a local restaurant. After lunch continue visiting other famous temples and marvelous holy structures. The beauty of these temples is characterized by their uniqueness and distinct appeal. Although some of them are worn out and some are mere ruins, you can easily see the diversity and an acute fineness in craftsmanship. In the evening, you will witness the ritualistic rites held every evening on the banks of Ganges. When the tour ends, the driver will take you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Spiritual Varanasi Tour with Visit of Sarnath and Evening Ritualistic Rites

strIntroduction:
Hailed as one of the holiest Buddhist places, Sarnath is considered a sacred place because it is believed that Gautama Buddha delivered his first sermons there and claimed the place as important pilgrimage site for his followers.

At 9:00 am you will be picked up from your hotel in Varanasi and transferred to Sarnath, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Upon arrival you will visit Chaukhandi Stupa, an elevated structure surrounded by octagonal tower. It is the gateway to Sarnath surrounded by lush green lawns from all sides. Then stop by the Dhamek Stupa, a remarkable structure built of stone and brick. The cylindrical pillar is engraved with delicate floral carvings of Gupta origin.

Afterwards you will visit Mulagandha Kuti Vihar Temple. Its structure encases unrivaled frescoes by a Japanese painter and is a rich repository of Buddhist literature. Later you will be taken to visit the Sarnath Museum that houses the finest specimens of Buddhist art and culture. It treasures an abundance of sculptures including Buddha and Bodhisattva images. After the tour ends, your driver will take you back to your hotel in Varanasi.
strTitle: Private Tour: Sarnath Day Tour including Sarnath Museum

strIntroduction:
Varanasi, one of the most sacred and oldest cities in India, is located at the banks of the Gange river. Aarti, Agni Pooja is a performance in which a commitment is made to Lord Shiva, Mata Gange, Surya, Agni as well as the whole universe. Gange aarti is performed daily in the evenings by a group of priests at the Dashashwamedh Ghat.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Varanasi at 5:00 pm and transferred to Dashashwamedh Ghat for the aarti performance. Upon arrival you will board on a boat and enjoy 1-hour aarti performance starting at 6:45 pm Gange aarti is a magnificent ritual, performed daily in the evenings by a group of priests . All priests are students of Vedas and Upanishads and led by the head priest of the Gangotri Seva Samiti. It is performed with brass lamps and all priests, participating this pray ceremony wear traditional Dhoti and Kurta clothes.

Around 8 pm after the performance you will be transferred to a famous Indian restaurant to enjoy mouthwatering dinner. After dinner you will be taken back to your hotel.
strTitle: Evening Excursion: Magnificent Ganga Aarti with Dinner

strIntroduction:
Embark on a unique boat tour that will give you the opportunity to explore the Varansi and Ganga Ghat at sunrise. Witness the Morning rituals, special features of the various Ghats and see the various activities and professions related to the religious death ceremonies. Receive insights from a knowledgeable tour guide throughout the duration of your tour.

Your guide will meet you in your hotel in Varanasi between 5am-6am and drive you to Ganga Ghat to board the boat. This unique 2-hour morning boat tour will take you to explore the beautiful Ghats and temples with morning rituals . During your boat ride, your guide will give you a brief explanation about the Ghats and all related subjects before witnessing a burning ghat where the dead bodies are cremated. You will also have the opportunity to see the various activities and professions related to the religious ceremonies after people pass away. When the tour ends, you will be taken back to your hotel.
strTitle: Ganga Ghat and Morning Rituals Guided Boat Tour in Varanasi

strIntroduction:
Varanasi, as the cultural capital of India, is a picturesque city located on the western banks of Ganga river. It has carried the legacy of Indian tradition and culture for centuries and passed it on the following generations. The city oozes with spiritualism and philosophy and embraces a fine blend of religions like Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism. Besides the Hindu temples, ashrams, ghats, Buddhist Stupas and Jain Temples, the pure mysticism of river Ganga adds to the spiritual aura wrapping this city.

Day 1:
Upon arrival you will be picked up from the airport or railway station in Varanasi. You can also choose to be picked up at your hotel there. Later on you will be transferred to check in to the hotel and relax. Afterwards you will visit the famous Sarnath, the “UNESCO World Heritage site”. Sarnath is a sacred place considered for enlightenment. It is the place where Gautama Buddha delivered his first sermons and claimed the place as an important pilgrimage site for his followers after attaining spiritual enlightenment.

Here first you will visit the Chaukhandi Stupa, an elevated structure surrounded by octagonal tower. It is the gateway to Sarnath and is surrounded by lush green lawns. Next stop by the Dhamek Stupa, a remarkable structure built of stone and brick. This cylindrical pillar is engraved with delicate floral carvings of Gupta origin. Afterwards you will visit the Mulagandha Kuti Vihar, a temple speaking of modernity. This structure encases unrivaled frescoes by a Japanese painter and is a rich repository of Buddhist literature.

In the evening you will be taken to visit Sarnath Museum. This is a museum that houses the finest specimens of Buddhist art and culture. It treasures an abundance of sculptures including Buddha and Bodhisattva images. After the museum your chauffeur will take you to witness Ganges arti, the ritualistic rites held every evening on the banks of Ganges. After Ganges arti you will be taken back to the hotel and stay overnight.

Day 2:
In the early morning, you will be taken on a boat excursion on the holy river Ganges where you will see the bathing ghats and cremation site. As you watch people taking holy dips in Ganges and executing the worshiping rituals on the ghats, you will feel the spirituality of the locals and it might lead you to the deeper insight into your existence in this universe.

After Ganges boat trip, you will be driven back to the hotel for breakfast. After breakfast your chauffeur will take you around Varanasi to visit some famous temples, Banaras Hindu University, Bharat Kala Bhavan and many other marvelous holy structures. The beauty of the temples are characterized by their uniqueness and a distinct appeal. When the tour ends, your chauffeur will transfer you to the airport, railway station or your hotel in Varanasi for your onward journey.
strTitle: 2-Day Private Tour: Spiritual Varanasi with Sarnath

strIntroduction:
Kerala is referred to as God’s own country. It is indeed a beautiful mixture of its colonial past and the serenity of nature. On your first day, you will get the chance to explore the town of Kochi. On the following three days, you will spend good amount of time in Munnar - the gateway to the hills of South India. Munnar has a lot to offer with its tea gardens, waterfalls, the Shola forest and the Eravikulam National Park. One of the highlights of this tour is the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary-- a humble home to many wild animals and colorful birds. Stay overnight on a houseboat and experience the backwaters of Kerala.

Day 1: Kochi
Upon arrival to Kerala, our representative will greet you at the Cochin International Airport, Ernakulam Junction railway station in Kochi, or your hotel in Kochi. You will be taken your hotel first for check-in. Kochi is one of few places in India that has managed to preserve the remnants of its colonial past with utmost care. The Chinese fishing nets, St. Francis Church, Santa Cruz Basilica, Jewish Synagogue and the Mattancherry Palace are just some of the things you'll see. In the evening, you will get an opportunity to witness the icon of Kerala’s culture – a Kathakali dance performance. Overnight stay in hotel.

Day 2: Kochi - Munnar
The day starts with breakfast at the hotel. With all its colorful landscape, breathtaking sights and mesmerizing view, Munnar is certainly a great destination to visit in God’s own country. The journey to Munnar is beautiful as the road stretches along the waterfalls. Upon arrival, you will check in to the hotel with your own personal time in the evening.

Day 3: Munnar
After breakfast at your hotel, you will start exploring Munnar by visiting the Eravikulam National Park, which is a famous habitat of the rare mountain goats called the Nilgiri Tahr. You will also visit Mattupetty Dam and Echo Point where you can see the lustrous green carpet of the tea garden. At the end of the day, you will return to the hotel for overnight rest.

Day 4: Munnar - Thekaddy
After breakfast, we will drive to Thekaddy. The most exciting part of this tour is a visit to the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary. The special animals in this region include wild elephants, nilgiri langur monkeys, sambar deer, wild bison, and colorful birds. One of the main attractions is an optional boat ride at your own expense. Overnight stay at hotel or resort.

Day 5: Thekaddy - Houseboat in Kumarakom
After breakfast, the day is dedicated to exploring the magical backwater of Kerala. We will take you on board a beautiful houseboat to glide over the enchanting backwaters of Kerala. The night will be spent in the comforts of the houseboat itself and all meals are included during your stay on the houseboat.

Day 6: Houseboat in Kumarakom - Kochi
Breakfast at houseboat in the morning and check out. We will take you back to Cochin International Airport, Ernakulam Junction railway station in Kochi, or your hotel in Kochi.
strTitle: 6-Day Private Tour: Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary and Backwater Houseboat Cruise in Kerala

strIntroduction:
Experience the Beating Retreat Ceremony with ceremonial closing of gates and lowering of flags of India and Pakistan. Witness the BSF and Pakistani Rangers marching towards the gates from their respective sides. An unique experience not to be missed while your stay in Amritsar.

You will be picked up from your hotel at 2:30pm and proceed to Wagah Border to witness the afternoon parade ceremony. Watch ceremony from the VIP or foreigner Gallery. (Indian Passport holder Not eligible for VIP Entry, they have sit to in common gallery) 

Located at about 29 km from Amritsar on the Grand Trunk, Wagah border post has become famous for the ceremonial closing of gates and lowering of flags of India and Pakistan. BSF and Pakistani Rangers march towards the gates from their respective sides. After the gate is open, the soldiers salute each other and start lowering the flags. The flags are carefully folded and carried back. The ceremony reaches a crescendo with the soldiers returning to the border line for the final handshake and the blowing of the bugle marks the end of the ceremony. As the ceremony climbs to its apogee, cries of Jai Hind and Pakistan Zindabad render in the air.

After the parade ceremony, your driver will then take you to a local restaurant for a mouthwatering dinner. You can choose form a fixed menu or buffer dinner. After dinner your driver will drop you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Day Tour of Beating Retreat Ceremony at Wagah Border including Dinner from Amritsar

strIntroduction:
Amritsar, meaning the pool of the nectar of Immortality, is a part of the great Indian multifarious spiritual tradition but stands luminescent as an institution in itself. Deriving its name from the legends of knowledge, healing and spiritual immortality in the pool surrounding the Golden Temple, Amritsar is a paradoxical landmark on the terrains of North India.

You will be picked up at your hotel in Amritsar around 09:00 AM and transported to the Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib) with your English-speaking tour guide. The Golden Temple is a prominent Sikh Gurdwara built by the fifth Sikh guru, Guru Arjan in the 16th Century. After Golden Temple, visit Jallianwala Bagh, a public garden that houses a memorial of national importance, established in 1951 to commemorate the massacre by British occupying forces.

After Jallianwala Bagh explore Hall Bazar and other local bazaars. Later enjoy your Lunch at a local restaurant. After some relaxation around 3 PM drive to Wagah Border for the evening beating retreat ceremony. Wagah border post has become famous for the ceremonial closing of gates and lowering of flags of India and Pakistan. When the ceremony reaches a crescendo, the soldiers return to the border line for the final handshake and afterwards no glance is exchanged and the gates are close. Watch the ceremony from the VIP or foreigner gallery (Indian Passport holder Not eligible for VIP Entry, they have to sit in common gallery). When the ceremony ends, you will be taken back to your hotel in Amritsar.
strTitle: Private Tour: Golden Temple, Jallianwala Bagh and Evening Wagah Border Beating Retreat Ceremony

strIntroduction:
Explore the rich history of Amritsar through this 2-day tour. Along the way, you'll visit the Indian-Pakistan border to witness the Beating Retreat ceremony, a daily military practice from both country's army, and the Golden Temple, which attracts over 100,000 worshipers daily.

Day 1: [D]
We will pick you up from Amritsar airport or railway station and transfer you to the hotel for check-in. Around 2:30 PM our driver will pick up from the hotel lobby and drive to the Indian-Pakistan border town of Wagah to witness the parade ceremony. The Wagah border post has become famous for the ceremonial closing of gates and lowering of each country's flag. After the ceremony, drive back to the hotel for dinner. After dinner, transfer to Temple  After dinner, drive out to get a night view of the Harmandir Sahib, commonly known as the 'Golden Temple.' Afterward, return to the hotel for the night.

Day 2:
After breakfast, explore the Golden Temple with a local English-speaking tour guide. The Golden Temple was built in the 16th century by the fifth Sikh guru, Guru Arjan, and is a prominent Sikh Gurdwara. Afterward, visit Jallianwala Bagh, a public garden that houses a national memorial. Established in 1951, the memorial commemorates those who were massacred by the British during a peaceful celebration of the Punjabi New Year. After visiting the garden, explore local bazaars, including Hall Bazar, before heading back to the hotel for check-out. After checking out, drop off to the airport or railway station.
strTitle: 2-Day Private Tour: Golden Temple with Evening Wagah Border Ceremony in Amritsar

strIntroduction:
Our private overnight Jaipur tour is an excellent way to explore the royal city of Rajasthan.Jaipur is also known as ‘pink city’ and is famous for its rich culture and colourful past. The beautiful city is surrounded with Aravali hills. The magnificent Jal Mahal is located in the middle of Mansagar Lake. Jaipur has a lot to offer its visitors including Birla Temple or Lakshmi Narayan Temple, Amer Fort, Hawa Mahal and many more, including a camel ride.

Day 01: Delhi - Jaipur (L,D)
Our representative will pick up you from Delhi Hotel at 07:00 AM and drive you to the beautiful city, Jaipur. On arrival at Jaipur, we first visit Jal Mahal. Jal Mahal also known as Water Palace, it is located in the middle of Mansagar Lake. It is considered one of the romantic destinations of Jaipur here you will Enjoy camel Safari today or next day Morning.
After our visit to Jal Mahal, we proceed to hotel and check in. Rest for some while and have lunch in Hotel, in the evening drive to Birla Temple (Explore own by own) . Birla Temple is also known as Lakshmi Narayan temple and is located in Moti Doongri. Birla Temple is brilliantly designed with intricate carvings on the outer walls of the temple. Later in the evening return to hotel and after dinner, night spent in Jaipur.

Day 02: Jaipur – Delhi (B)
In the morning after breakfast, we check out from hotel, and explore Pink City with Local Guide and visit Amber Fort . Amber fort is constructed with red and white sandstone. It displays perfect blend of Hindu and Muslim style of architecture. Later stop at JalMahal (Water palace) and enjoy camel Ride if you missed first day.

After JalMahal Visit Hawa Mahal, known as ‘Palace of Winds’ and is designed in the shape of Lord Krishna’s crown. It was designed by Lal Chand Ustad and constructed with red and pink sandstone. The 5-storey beehive structure amuses its visitors the most. Later we visit City Palace.The magnificent City Palace of Jaipur is a palace complex which features many buildings including Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal. City Palace also features a museum where rich collection of Rajput warriors is brilliantly preserved. Our Jaipur tour is completed with the visit of City Palace. We drive back to Delhi and reach Delhi in the evening and drop you Delhi Airport or Hotel as per your choice.
strTitle: 2-Day Private Pink City Jaipur Tour From Delhi: City Palace Hawa Mahal with Camel Ride

strIntroduction:
You will witness the splendour of one of the most magnificent city in India. Agra is a beautiful city also known as a Taj City, Agra stands on the banks of river Yamuna. The greatest tourist attraction in Agra is Taj Mahal & Fort, Taj Mahal is one of the current Seven Wonders of the World . Experience the charm of Mughal era and witness the wonderful example of Mughal art & architecture.

Day 01: New Delhi – Agra (L,D)
Your driver will pick you early in the morning at 7am from New Delhi Hotel. Later He will drive you to Agra. Agra is located at a distance of approx. 235 KM from New Delhi. After a 4-5 hours’ journey we reach Agra. On arrival at Agra around 11 AM and Check in Hotel after fresh up, warm welcome by your English Speaking guide and short intro about your tour and proceed to Visit epitome of love- Taj Mahal
The majestic view of Taj Mahal is breath taking and attracts heavy tourist population throughout the year. Taj Mahal was constructed by Shah Jahan in loving memory of his wife Mumtaz.. Acclaimed by the archaeologist’s world over as the finest example of Mughal architecture, it reflects a style that combines elements from Persian, Turkish and Indian architectural styles.

After TajMahal visit enjoy your complementary Lunch at Local Restaurant..After Lunch, visit Agra Fort, Agra fort was known as the treasure house of Mughal Empire. The monument was constructed with red sandstone and white marble. Agra fort features magnificent palaces, large rooms, brilliantly constructed mosques and beautifully carved chambers. Diwan-i-Khas, Diwan-i-Am, Moti masjid, Mina Masjid and Nagina Masjid are main attractions inside the fort. After Fort Visit Driver will take you at Marble factory & some famous shops. Later back to Hotel and enjoy your dinner at Hotel.. Overnight at Hotel.

Day 02 : Agra – Fatehpur Sikri – New Delhi (B)
Morning after breakfast, check out from Hotel and chauffeur will take you to visit Fatehpur Sikri. Built in the honour of Saint Sheikh Salim Chisti, Fatehpur Sikri was Akbar's capital and is hailed for its imperial contents. It is a perfectly preserved red sandstone town, which encases several imperial palaces, castles, tombs & chambers, each of which is a living proof of precious Indian Architectural Heritage. The inner citadel of this city houses prominent evidences of Mughal epoch and their highly refined architecture, skilful artistry, exceptional craftsmanship and a blend of two or more styles of constructions. Here, you will get to see some finest monuments namely Diwan-i-Am, Diwan-i-Khas, Panch Mahal, Buland Darwaza, tomb of Saint Sheikh Salim Chishti, and Jama Masjid (one of the largest mosques In India). Here, experience the charm of Mughal era and witness the wonderful example of Mughal art & architecture. After completing your visit, you will be driven to Delhi Hotel or Airport,
strTitle: 2-Day Private Taj Mahal Agra Tour From New Delhi with Fort and Fatehpur Sikri

strIntroduction:
The marvelous city of Agra welcomes you to a land brimming with rich culture and history. Bustling with life and myriad colours. This enchanting place offers a magnificent experience to its discerning travellers, often leaving the visitors asking for more. Home to the beautiful jewel of India - The Taj Mahal; Agra spreads an aroma of love and calls out to all the history lovers for a ride back to the glorious past. However, this is not all; there are many other amazing sites scattered around the city that are worth a visit. Therefore, we offer you an incredible tour to this stunning region with our extensive package that will cover all the hot spots in Agra.

The driver will pickup you up between 6am - 6:30AM from your hotel in New Delhi .After a 3-4 hour journey in our comfortable Car; you will reach the beautiful city of Agra. With a warm smile, you will be welcomed by our English speaking guide. He will give you a brief on the city and, right way, take you to the most breathtaking man made structure – The Taj Mahal. Built by Emperor Shah Jahan as a memorial for his beloved wife, this white marble beauty symbolizes eternal love. It is an admirable edifice, sitting amidst the perfect symmetry of Charbagh Garden, the water canals and beautiful fountains drawing a large number of tourists all across the year. After you are mesmerized by this wonder of superior architectural grandeur, you will be provided with a complementary lunch at local restaurant.


Once you devour the culinary flavours of Agra, you will be directed to encounter another glorious monument – The Agra Fort. It was built in the 16th century by great Mughal emperor Akbar. Known as the treasure house of the Mughal Empire, it fascinates tourists with its large spacious rooms, brilliantly constructed mosques and impeccably designed chambers. It includes many stunning palaces like the Jahangir Palace, Sheesh Mahal and the Khas Mahal.

So finally, after treating your eyes with these pleasurable sights, you will be taken for a tour of the Marble Factory and some famous shops in the city (so you can embark on a shopping spree!).After enjoying a fun-filled day at Agra, you will be taken back to Delhi hotel in a comfortable cab ride.
strTitle: Private Taj Mahal and Agra Fort Tour From New Delhi with Lunch

Morning after breakfast, we check out from hotel, visit Amber Fort, After Fort stop at Jal Mahal. Jal Mahal also known as Water Palace which is located in the middle of Mansagar Lake. Here you can do some photography from outside. After Jal Mahal drive to Hawa Mahal. Hawa Mahal is also known as ‘Palace of Winds’ and is designed in the shape of Lord Krishna’s crown. It was designed by Lal Chand Ustad and constructed with red and pink sandstone. Later we visit City Palace. strIntroduction:
Explore the City of Mahabalipuram, known for its outstanding historic specimens and an incredible architectural invention. Explore the grand temples and shrines that adorn the city. Also visit the Kanchipuram City, a sanctified place with several Hindu temples depicting the Hindu culture and tradition. This tour will take you to stone-cut temples, including Shankaracharya Seer, Mahishasurmardini Caves, Shore Temple, Krishna Mandapam, Arjun’s Penance and Panch Rathas.

Your tour will begin with a pickup between 6:30-7:00 AM from your hotel in Chennai and proceed for full-day guided tour. To kick off the tour, your guide will brief you about the history of Mahabalipuram and Kanchipuram.

Chennai to Mahabalipuram is aproximately 36 miles. Mahabalipuram is the former capital of the Pallava Kings and is famous for its splendid 7th and 8th-century art and architecture, especially the stone carvings. You will start your tour by visiting the 7th-century magnificent Shore Temple which is surrounded by lush gardens. Next, you will visit Arjuna's Penance, a 1900-square-foot rock block and rock cut caves from the 6th and 7th centuries. Later visit the 7th- century Five Rathas Shrine which has the world's largest stone relief.

Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant at your own expense and then drive to Kanchipuram. Kanchipuram is known as the golden city of a thousand temples. It is one of seven sacred cities of India and has some of the most grand and majestic temples. With their striking architectural marvel, these temples reflect architectural experimentation, restructuring and refinement that was completed during different dynasties. Kanchipuram was the capital of the Pallava, the Chola and the Vijayanagar kings. Visit historic temples like the Kailasanatha Temple, Vaikunda Perumal Temple, Kamaskhi Amman Temple and Ekambareshvara Temple. All of these are excellent sites of the architectural splendor of the medieval period. When the tour ends, you will be driven back to Chennai and dropped off at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Mahabalipuram and Kanchipuram Caves and Temples Day Tour from Chennai

strIntroduction:
Travel around the temples of South India. The journey starts from Chennai and takes you to the holy places where Hindu religion developed its identity. Next, you will travel to Kanchipuram-Mahabalipuram, where you can visit the famous temples such as Kailashnath and Ekambareswarar, and become familiar with world famous UNESCO World Heritage sites. Last but not least, you will visit Tanjore, Madurai, Rameshwaram and Kanyakumari.

Day - 1 Chennai - Kanchipuram - Mahabalipuram (D) Pick up from Chennai airport, railway station or hotel between 07:00 AM – 11:00 AM, drive to Kanchipuram and visit the Ekambareswarar and the Kailashnath temples. Take in the complete serenity of the birthplace of Lord Shiva. The temple stretches over 29 sq feet (9 sq m) and is one of the largest temples in the area.
Later, drive to Mahabalipuram, check in your hotel, and later explore the city. This entire city boasts amazing monuments and sculptures carved out of stone. See famous tombstones such as he Five Rathas, and Arjuna’s penance carved in bas-relief style. You will also see Mahishasura Mandapam and the Shore temple. Return to the hotel for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 2 – Mahabalipuram – Tanjore (B,D) After breakfast, drive to Tanjore, and upon arrival check-in to your hotel.This destination is regarded as the most religious destination in South India. Brihadeshwara was constructed by the Chola King and exhibits the features created 11th century. View the ancient manuscripts and books in the library. Return to hotel for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 3 Tanjore – Madurai (B,D) This morning after breakfast drive to Madurai, on arrival check-in at your hotel. You will visit the famous Meenakshi Temple constructed using 100 pillars. You will experience a beautiful night ceremony inside the temple. You will also have the chance to visit Thirumalai Nayak palace and Gandhi Museum. Return to the hotel for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 4 Madurai – Rameshwaram – Madurai (B,D) In the morning after breakfast, you will take a day trip to Rameshwaram. Here, you can explore the ancient history of Ramayana and take in the coastal scenic beauty. Ramanathaswamy Temple represents one of the foremost places where tourists come to pay their tribute. Later in the evening, you will return back to Madurai for dinner at the hotel and stay overnight.

Day 5 – Madurai - Kanyakumari (B,D) After breakfast, drive to Kanyakumari, on arrival check in to your hotel. You will see Kanyakumari, the end point of India, and take in the overwhelming natural beauty. This is where the three seas surrounding India merge into one. You will witness creations of Swami Vivekananda while you visit Vivekananda Memorial. This memorial is the site where Swami Vivekananda meditated and achieved his ultimate fate. In the evening, enjoy a sunset view, and return to the hotel for overnight stay.

Day 06 – Kanyakumari – Trivandrum (B) You will watch the sunrise in the morning, and return back to the hotel for breakfast. After breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Trivandrum Airport for your onward journey.
strTitle: Private Tour: 5-Night South India Tour of UNESCO Heritage Temples

strIntroduction:
Spend a day in the sparkling city of Mumbai and get a complete view of India's Economic Hub.You will be overwhelmed by the spirit of the city and the rich heritage it houses. Exploring the famous British-built landmark, the Gateway of India and Prince of Wales Museum is a must for every visitor in this city. The drive through the city will let you see the city from close quarters. You get to visit the famous historical buildings, open-air laundries better known as dhobi Ghats. A relaxing evening at the astounding Marine drive, popularly named, the Queen’s Necklace awaits you after touring the city. Here, you get to experience the mighty aura of the majestic Arabian Sea.

You will be picked between 09:30 – 10:00am from your hotel to start your sightseeing in the amazing city, Mumbai with local An English Speaking Guide will accompany you.

The famous monument, the main tourist attraction in Mumbai, the Gateway of India is decked with four turrets and its yellow basalt stone structure has delicate latticework carved in it. Stands the rich and famous Royal Taj Mahal Hotel. This hotel is a witness of priceless memories of this glorious city. The Taj Towers located near the hotel is another appealing building for its wonderful architecture.

Listed next on your trip is the exclusive Prince of Wales Museum, (closed on Monday). Built between 1904 and 1914, this museum was used as a hospital during the First World War. The museum stores an invaluable collection of one of the best art found in India. The exquisite display of antiques, miniature paintings, jade, china and many other artefacts is spellbinding.

Then, you will catch a glimpse of the other famous buildings of Mumbai as we drive you past the University of Bombay, High Court of Bombay and Crawford Market. Situated at the crest of the Malabar Hills is the Hanging Gardens. Here you can enjoy the much wanted greenery amidst all the concrete and cement structures. A drive on the Malabar hill will give you an impression about the posh residential area of the city of Mumbai. You will also be taken to visit the esteemed Gandhi Memorial Museum (Mani Bhavan) and the religious Jain Temple.

Recognized as the world's largest outdoor laundry, the Dhobi Ghat is exclusive to the city of Mumbai. Watch the washer men or the 'dhobis' provide an efficient service, gathering dirty laundry, cleaning it and returning it perfectly ironed, and all this at an exceptionally small price. They remove persistent stains by soaking clothes in a boiling vat of caustic soda. They dry the clothes on long bright coloured lines and use heavy wood‐burning irons for neatly pressing the clothes. The spectacular site this dhobi ghat provides is a photographer's delight, though the locals here find it bewildering that their daily work arouses such interest among visitors.

After visiting the Dhobi Ghat, We head towards the drive past Bandra Worli Sea Link.

Evening around 4 – 5 PM we will take you to the beautiful Marine Drive, popularly known as the Queen's Necklace. Here, you can sit and relax (30 – 60 Minutes) taking in the spellbinding view the Arabian Sea offers. This is one of the most favourite places of all Mumbaikars and becomes a favourite of every person visiting the city- such is the aura of the place. After spending a splendid day in this lovely beautiful city of Mumbai, later we drop you back to the hotel marking the end of your trip here.
strTitle: Full-day Mumbai City Tour Including Gateway of India Dhobi Ghat Museum and Marine Drive

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this half-day trip to Sanjay Gandhi National Park from Mumbai. There you will explore the Kanheri caves - an important testimony of ancient monastic life of India and thanks to its convenient trade-route location, occupied continuously since the 1st century BC to the decline of Buddhism in 9th century AD. You will be able to explore the mixture of Hinayana Buddhism and the Mahayana architecture.

Once you are picked up in the morning by your driver, you will head off to the Sanjay Gandhi National Park


Once there, you will explore Buddhists caves at Kanheri, that are more than 2000 years-old. Its carvings and architectural styles portray the influence of the austere Hinayana Buddhism and the following Mahayana culture.

Carved into a cliff face, it served as a home to a large settlement of monks, whose daily life was filled mostly with study and prayers. You can admire various artefacts, such as water cisterns, intricate rock-carved stairways, halls and exquisite dwellings of senior monks.

Apart from admiring the caves, which are slightly hidden from the tourists, you can explore the part itself. Spread over a vast region of 9000 hectares, it is a home to various species of birds and animals, some of them endangered.

After sightseeing you will enjoy lunch at a local restaurant, before heading back to your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day Private Trip to Sanjay Gandhi National Park from Mumbai Including the Kanheri Caves

strIntroduction:
Spend two nights in the sparkling city of Mumbai and get a complete view of India's Economic Hub with Ancient Elephanta Caves and you can explore the antiques of the bygone eras concealed in the nooks and corners of these caves. You will be overwhelmed by the spirit of the city and the rich heritage it houses. Exploring the famous British-built landmark, the Gateway of India and Prince of Wales Museum is a must for every visitor in this city. The drive through the city will let you see the city from close quarters. You get to visit the famous historical buildings, open-air laundries better known as dhobi Ghats. A relaxing evening at the astounding Marine drive, popularly named, the Queen’s Necklace awaits you after touring the city. Here, you get to experience the mighty aura of the majestic Arabian Sea.

Day: 01 – Mumbai (D)
Pick up from Airport, Hotel and Railway station as per your schedule, transfer to Hotel and Check In. after some relaxation Evening around 4 – 5 PM we will take you to the beautiful Marine Drive, popularly known as the Queen's Necklace. Here, you can sit and relax (30 – 90 Minutes) taking in the spellbinding view of Arabian Sea. After lovely evening back to Hotel and enjoy dinner at Hotel and get retired for Night.
Day: 02 – Mumbai (B,D)
Morning after breakfast You will be picked between 09:30 – 10:00 hrs from your hotel to start your sightseeing in the amazing city, Mumbai with local An English Speaking Guide will accompany you.Start your tour visiting main tourist attraction Gateway of India, It is decked with four turrets and its yellow basalt stone structure has delicate latticework carved in it. Stands the rich and famous Royal Taj Mahal Hotel. This hotel is a witness of priceless memories of this glorious city. The Taj Towers located near the hotel is another appealing building for its wonderful architecture.
Listed next on your trip is the exclusive Prince of Wales Museum,(closed on Monday). Built between 1904 and 1914, this museum was used as a hospital during the First World War. Then, you will catch a glimpse of the other famous buildings of Mumbai as we drive you past the University of Bombay, High Court of Bombay and Crawford Market. Situated at the crest of the Malabar Hills is the Hanging Gardens. Here you can enjoy the much wanted greenery amidst all the concrete and cement structures. A drive on the Malabar hill will give you an impression about the posh residential area of the city of Mumbai. You will also be taken to visit the esteemed Gandhi Memorial Museum (Mani Bhavan).
Recognized as the world's largest outdoor laundry, the Dhobi Ghat is exclusive to the city of Mumbai. Watch the washer men or the 'dhobis' provide an efficient service.After visiting the Dhobi Ghat, We head towards the drive past Bandra Worli Sea Link. Later we drop you back to the hotel. Evening enjoy dinner at Hotel & get retired for Night.
Day: 03 – Mumbai (B)
Morning after breakfast, check out from Hotel and driver will pick up you from Hotel (Your luggage will be in Car) and drive to Gateway of India where you will drop in Boat to Elephanta Island. On arrival at Elephanta caves enjoy a Toy train Ride with Local English speaking guide. Later explore World Famous ancientness Elephanta Caves later back to Gateway of India by Boat around 3 – 4 PM, where your driver will pick and drop back to Hotel or Airport as per Choice. Your trip end here.
strTitle: 3-Day Private Mumbai City Tour with Elephanta Caves and Evening at Marine Drive

strIntroduction:
Discover the City of Palaces, Mysore, on this private full-day tour including transportation from Bangalore, entrance fees, a local guide, and a buffet lunch. You'll learn about the heritage and history of the city’s art, architecture, and palaces as you visit Mysore Palace, Chamundeshwari Temple, Chamundi Hills, and St. Philomena's Church before returning to Bangalore.

Your adventure begins with an included pickup at your Bangalore hotel at 7:30am for the three and a half hour drive to Mysore. Your local guide will greet you, covering all monument entrance fees, making your first stop at the Mysore Palace in the city center. Also called Amba Vilas Palace, the former home of the Wodeyar family Maharajas is a museum displaying paintings, jewelry, costumes, and other royal family relics. After exploring the palace and museum, you’ll enjoy an included buffet lunch at a popular restaurant. Chamundeswari Temple, on Chamundi Hills, about 13 kilometers from the city center is the next stop on your journey. Your local guide will explain the meaning of the intricate carvings on the structure’s seven-story Gopura, or monumental tower, and its significance to the city’s former Maharajas. You can see a panoramic view of the city on the drive back to Mysore, and visit St. Philomena’s Catholic Church, one of the tallest in Asia, modeled after Cologne Cathedral in Germany. You’ll say goodbye to your guide and a private driver will make the included three and a half journey back to your hotel, dropping you off in Bangalore at about 7:30pm.
strTitle: Private Day Tour of Mysore from Bangalore

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this 1-night private tour of Mumbai and explore its culture, heritage and history. See the famous British-built "Gateway of India", other historical buildings, and see "dhobi Ghats" - open-air laundries, enjoy a relaxing evening at Marine drive, and much more. The order of the attractions visited on the second day can be customized according to your needs and interests.

Day: 01 – Mumbai Arrival (D)
Once you are picked up by your guide, you will check in your hotel  at around 1pm after check in relax some time later you will explore the Marine Drive, popularly known as the "Queen's Necklace". Once you have relaxed and taken in the beautiful sea view, you will get back to your hotel, just in time for dinner. 
Day: 02 – Mumbai Custom Day of Sightseeing (B)
After breakfast you will be picked up (9:30am – 10am) from your hotel and head off to the Gateway of India, accompanied by your English-speaking guide. Make sure to notice the delicate latticework carved in it. Then you will pass by the Royal Taj Mahal Hotel and The Taj Towers (located near the hotel), both famed for their architecture. Next you will see the Prince of Wales Museum, built during 1904 - 1914, and served as a hospital during the First World War. The museum´s collections showcase one of the best art found in India, displaying exquisite antiques, miniature paintings, jade, china and much more (closed on Monday).

Later, you will drive past University of Bombay, High Court of Bombay and Crawford Market and stop by at the Malabar Hills´ Hanging Gardens. And then visit the esteemed Gandhi Memorial Museum (Mani Bhavan) and the religious Jain Temple.

Then you will head to the world's largest outdoor laundry "the Dhobi Ghat" - exclusive to Mumbai, where you can watch the "dhobis" at work. 

By driving past the Bandra Worli Sea Link you will head back to the point of departure or Mumbai airport or any hotel within city.
strTitle: Private Overnight-Tour of Mumbai Including Gateway of India and Dhobi Ghat

strIntroduction:
Bangalore accumulates amazing wildlife and natural resources that form this private tour. Spend a day out in the Bannerghatta National Park, exploring its flora and fauna by taking a safari and visiting India's first butterfly park.

At 7:30am you will be picked up from your hotel after breakfast and transferred to Bannerghatta National Park, situated 24km (15 miles) from Bangalore. Upon arrival at 8:45am you will wait for ticket counters to open at around 9-9:30am. Meanwhile, you can take a walk around the park.

Bannerghatta National Park is a popular tourist destination with a zoo, a pet corner, an animal rescue center, a butterfly enclosure, an aquarium, a snake house and a safari park. There are ancient temples in the park for worship and it is a good destination for trekking. Within the national park area are six rural villages enclosed within three large enclosures for sheep and cattle farming.

Your tour starts at the “Herbivore Safari” where you can get a glance at the herbivorous animals. The major creatures you see here is a bison and other members of the large deer family. From here, drive towards the “Bear Safari” to get a look on the wild bears residing inside the woods. After you complete the “Bear Safari”, it's time to watch the wild tigers at the “Tiger Safari”. Next, move towards the “Lion Safari”, where you can see some lions resting in the bamboo park, while others get a refreshing bath.

Once completed the safari part of the tour, continue to the Butterfly Park gate. In 2006 the butterfly park was opened as an enclosure to the park. It houses a butterfly conservatory, a museum, and an audiovisual room. Within the conservatory, the environment has been designed to support over twenty species of butterfly. It is a humid tropical climate, with an artificial waterfall and appropriate flora to attract butterflies. The conservatory leads to a second and third dome, which house a museum containing dioramas and exhibits of carefully preserved butterflies. The Park was conceptualized as one integrated center that would support education, conservation and research activities with exclusive focus on butterflies as flagship ambassadors of conservation.

If you have missed the zoo previously, now you can get a quick look to the place after which you will have your lunch (at your expense). The area accumulates multiple local bistros, the Dosa camps and other fast food centers. When the tour ends, you will be transferred back to your Bangalore hotel.
strTitle: Bannerghatta National Park Private Day Tour with Butterfly Park and Safari from Bangalore

strIntroduction:
Nandi Hills, a short distance from Bangalore, is a summer resort also known as Nandidurga. This place was one of summer retreats of Tipu Sultan. An ancient Nandi temple with a thousand-year-old sculpture of Nandi is situated on the hill, which gives it its name. There are several smaller hills around the Nandi Hills which can be visited on foot. Also visit Tipu’s Drop, Gavi Veerbhadra Swamy Temple and more. Don't miss the mesmerizing view of Amruth Sarovar!

You will be picked up at your hotel in Bangalore between 6:00 AM - 7:00 AM depending on the season and then transferred to Nandi Hill (approx. 65 km from Bangalore city).

Standing at a height of 4851 feet above sea level, Nandi Hill greets you on your arrival. Have breakfast at a local restaurant while enjoying the gorgeous view and ambiance of the place. Then you will be taken to visit the Tipu’s Drop, which is a 600 m high cliff face. It is rumored that the condemned prisoners were pushed to their death from here. There are a number of beautiful temples found in these picturesque hills including the Gavi Veerbhadra Swamy Temple. After the exploration of the temples, you will stop by a museum to learn more about Nandi Hills.

Afterwards enjoy a lunch break at a local restaurant followed by the amazing view the Amruth Sarovar. The Amruth Sarovar is a mesmerizing lake with clear lucid water filled to the brim all year round. Depending on your preference, the weather and water level, sometimes you can go down the lake and enjoy the cool beautiful water. There is another water body in this region that heightens the beauty of Nandi Hills - the Arkavathi River. This river originates on the south west of the hills and you can catch a glimpse of some beautiful bungalows with impressive gardens built by the British. The lush greenery of the forest is enhanced by the sunflower gardens and grapevines. The flora and the fauna add to the attraction of this place. After the tour ends, you will be dropped off at your hotel around 4:00 - 5:00 PM.
strTitle: Private Tour: Nandi Hill Full-Day Tour including Lunch and Hotel Transfer from Bangalore

strIntroduction:
The Jaipur city tour is a great trip for exploring and experiencing Rajasthan. You will get a chance to visit historically famous and significant places in the city, all with a stunning blend of Mughal and Rajasthani architecture.

You will be picked up at 8:30 am from your hotel lobby, and drive first to see Amber Fort, located in the ancient capital, Amber, in Jaipur. After Amber Fort, see Jal Mahal's (Water Palace) architectural beauty, and  the beautiful Man Sagar Lake, that surrounds it. Here you will enjoy a camel ride.

Next you will see City Palace, a great blend of Mughal and Rajasthani architecture. Founded by Maharaja Jai Singh, this palace has numerous palatial structures including Chandra Mahal, Badal Mahal, Mubarak Mahal, City Palace Museum and the Govind Dev Temple. It also holds a collection of around 2000 weapons, armor and dresses of Mughals and Rajputs.

After City Palace, visit Hawa Mahal (Air Palace), a five storey façade, built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in the shape of a pyramid with 953 small windows all in decorative lattice style. 

After the City Palace, your guide and driver will take you to some of the famous shops and boutiques nearby for you to explore. After shopping, you will return back to your hotel.
strTitle: Jaipur Pink City Full-Day Tour Including Lunch and Camel Ride

strIntroduction:
An hour-long ferry ride from Mumbai reaches you to the Elephanta Island, a representative of the past eras. This island houses the ancient Elephanta Caves and you can explore the uniqueness of the bygone eras concealed in the nooks and corners of these caves.
Carved out of a solid rock and motivated by Shiaivism, the Elephanta Caves are bound to arouse in you a calm and reverential sense. As you walk past the skillfully carved sculptures, the pleasant rhythms of chisel and hammer strike the chords of your heart and bring about a stirring experience. Perfectly chiseled rock surfaces, skilfully done, near perfect carved sculptures, intensely cut chambers, intricate art exhibited in stonework, fine and mellow columns – all seek for undeviating, dedicated attention from its visitors. These deeply and perfectly sculpted pieces of art, found at this manifestation of relic India, allow you to perceive divination in the true sense of the term.

After you are done with your breakfast, our chauffeur, will pick you up at 8:30am from your hotel to kick start your trip to the Gateway of India followed by the grand Elephanta Caves.

The famous monument, the main tourist attraction in Mumbai, the Gateway of India is decked with four turrets and its yellow basalt stone structure has delicate latticework carved in it. The structure exhibits the amalgamation of Hindu and Muslim architectures. To the opposite of this grand monument, stands the rich and famous Royal TajMahal Hotel. This hotel is a witness of priceless memories of this glorious city. The Taj Towers located near the hotel is another appealing building for its wonderful architecture.

From the Gateway of India, you will be taken by a ferry boat to the Elephanta Island. The ferry boat is a type of luxury boat which ferries you around the harbor and reaches you to the lovely Elephanta Islands after a journey spanning nearly one hour fifteen minutes.

Now that you have reached the Elephanta Islands, let us throw light upon the whereabouts of what you can expect to find here.
After you reach the island, you have the option of walking on foot or taking a toy train to the main attractions of the place. Elephanta Island is a serene and spellbinding land blanketed in calmness and peace. The island is covered with lush green trees and monkeys dotting the place. It is advised that you do not carry food while strolling around to prevent troubles caused by the monkeys.

You will have to walk approximately 120 steep steps to get to the entrance of the temple, after you get down from the toy train. You might take the pony services offered, if you do not want to toil climbing up to the temple.

Spread over an area of nearly 60,000 square feet, the magnificent Elephanta cave complex comprises of massive rock carved temples, dating back to the ancient 5th century. These temples are sworn in the name of Lord Shiva, in particular. You will notice skilfully chiseled corridors and chambers as you walk through the temples. Treading past each bend, you will also find intensely sculpted art forms. Various images are depicted in the engraved rock surfaces, fluted pillars, dedicated, skillful stone work and structures chiseled out of the huge rocks. Catch a glimpse of the magnanimous Shivalingam, situated at the western end of the temple.

After you have completed touring the outstanding and exemplary Elephanta Island, you will be ferried back to the Gateway of India at 13:30 hrs. From the harbor, our appointed chauffeur will drop you back to your hotel, marking the end of the memorable tour.

Note - The Afternoon boat leaves at 2:30pm(last boat at 3pm) and will return back to the Gateway of India by 6pm.
strTitle: World Famous Ancientness Elephanta Caves Tour with Toy Train Ride

strIntroduction:
Discover the magical Mysore Palace on this day-trip tour. Visit the old city of Srirangapatna, whose history is deeply connected with Mysore. Learn about the heritage and history of this amazing city and explore the art and architecture of its palaces. You will be swept away by the charm of this city.

Day 1: Bangalore - Srirangapatna - Mysore
Your chauffeur will pick you up from your hotel in Bangalore or Bengaluru International Airport around 8 am and drive to Mysore. En-route visit the old city of Srirangapatnam, and Dariya Daulat palace which also houses a museum. Next, visit Gumbaz, the burial chamber of a sultan and his family.

Later drive past the famous Ranganathaswamy Temple & Tipu Sultan Mosque. After visiting Srirangapatnam, have a delicious lunch at a local restaurant (own expense). Upon arrival Mysore check in Hotel, and have an evening visit to Brindavan Gardens complete with a fountain show. Later you will return back to the hotel for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 2: Mysore - Bangalore (B)
Wake up early in the morning, and have breakfast. Around 8:15 am, you will check out of the hotel, and be picked up by your chauffeur. You will be driven to Chamundeshwari Temple, and see it's 7-story tall Gopura decorated with intricate carvings. After your temple visit, head back to Mysore.

After Chamundeshwari hill Visit the Mysore Royal palace, located in the heart of the city. The palace has been converted into a museum. While on the way back to Bangalore, visit St. Philomena’s Cathedral, a Roman-Catholic church. When the tour ends, you will be dropped off at your hotel in Bangalore or Bengaluru International Airport.
strTitle: Private Tour: 2-Day Mysore Palace and Srirangapatna Tour from Bangalore

strIntroduction:
This private overnight Jaipur tour is an excellent way to explore the royal city of Rajasthan, Jaipur! Jaipur is also known as "pink city" and famous for its rich culture and colorful past. The beautiful city is surrounded by Aravali Hills. Jaipur has a lot to offer including the magnificent Jal Mahal located in the middle of Mansagar Lake, Birla Temple (also called Laxmi Narayan Mandir), Amer Fort and Hawa Mahal. Experience the unique dinner at the famous restaurant Chokhi Dhani and enjoy an evening of Rajasthani traditional dance and dinner!

Day 1 (D)
You will be picked up from your hotel, airport or railway station in Jaipur (recommended arrival time between 11:00 AM-3:00PM). After pickup proceed to hotel for check-in and get some rest. In the late afternoon, you can go to the Birla Temple and explore it on your own. The Birla Temple, also known as Laxmi Narayan Mandir, is located in Moti Doongri and known for its brilliant design with intricate carvings on the outer walls of the temple. In the evening, drive to the famous restaurant Chokhi Dhani (good review on TripAdvisor) and enjoy Rajasthani traditional dance and dinner. After diner return to hotel and stay overnight in Jaipur.

Day 2 (B)
In the morning after breakfast check out from hotel and visit Amber Fort. It is constructed with red and white sandstone and displays perfect blend of Hindu and Muslim style of architecture. Later stop at Jal Mahal, also known as "Water Palace", located in the middle of Mansagar Lake. It is considered one of the romantic destinations of Jaipur.

After Jal Mahal visit Hawa Mahal, known as "Palace of Winds" and is designed in the shape of Lord Krishna’s crown by Lal Chand Ustad and constructed with red and pink sandstone. Later proceed to the magnificent City Palace of Jaipur, a palace complex that features many buildings including Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal. City Palace also features a museum where rich collection of Rajput warriors is brilliantly preserved.

By the end of the tour your guide and driver will take you in some famous handicraft and jewelry shops where you can buy some gift and souvenir. After shopping you will be dropped back to your hotel, airport or railway station in Jaipur city.
strTitle: Private Tour: 2-Day Jaipur Tour Including Amer Fort and Chokhi Dhani Dinner

strIntroduction:
This unique private tour in Hyderabad will give you an unforgettable experience. Hyderabad, also known as a pearl city of India, has a lot to offer. Visit the world-famous Charminar and Salar Jung Museum. Learn more about the history and modernize culture of Hyderabad.

You will be picked up at your hotel in Hyderabad between 09:00 AM – 09:30 AM and greeted by your driver before proceeding to this full-day Pearl City tour. En-route or at the first monument, your local English-speaking guide will join you and explore the city of Hyderabad with you.

Visit one of the oldest fort Golkonda Fort that is situated 11 km (6.8 mi) west of Hyderabad. If you are traveling on Monday, Golkonda Fort will be closed and you will visit the Birla Temple instead. Afterwards visit the Qutub Sahi Tombs, the royal cemetery of the seven Qutub Shahi kings who ruled Golconda for nearly 170 years. It is located at Ibrahim Bagh near Golconda. Later your guide will take you to one of the oldest mosques Mecca Masjid followed by a delicious lunch at a popular local restaurant.

After lunch your next monument will be the word-famous Charminar, also known as "the icon of Hyderabad". Later stop by the Salar Jung Museum and the Chowmahala Palace, a palace of the Nizams of Hyderabad state. When the tour ends, you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Hyderabad City Tour of Charminar and Salar Jung Museum

strIntroduction:
Discover the historical city of Delhi on your visit to India. Explore the heritage sites and learn about the diverse culture of this amazing city. Get to know about the golden past of India and Delhi which has been serving as its capital city since time immemorial.

At 9am the driver will meet you at your hotel lobby and drive for full day Delhi city tour with English-speaking local guide.
Start your tour from most magnificent monument Red fort.

Red Fort The Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan built the Red Fort as his ruling palace. Also known as ‘Lal Qila’, it is one of the most magnificent monuments in Delhi. Red Fort has two main gateways; Lahori Gate and Delhi Gate, situated on the center of the Western and Southern sides, respectively. After the fort tour your will enjoy a rickshaw ride. Then move to India Gate and drive by parliament and president house.

Then, visit India Gate Center of the city, India Gate is almost similar to its French counterpart that honors around 70,000 Indian soldiers who lost their lives while fighting for British Army during the World War I. Here you can do photography and drive to Humayun Tomb. Humayun's Tomb was built in 1565 A.D., posthumously, in the memory of Humayun by his widow Hemida Banu Begum. Also known as Tomb of the Perfect Man or 'Insan-i-Kamil', which now stands as a UNESCO Heritage site.

After Humayun Tomb driver will take you to Lotus temple (Humayun Tomb Visit will be only on Monday instead of Red Fort)
The Lotus Temple which is located in South Delhi is also known as 'Bahai House of Worship'. This 20th century wonder made of marble, dolomite, cement and sand is dedicated in December 1986. This temple represents the Baha'i faith - founded by Baha'ullah, an independent world religion. The Lotus Temple is in the form of a white half-opened lotus flower.

After Lotus Temple visit, guide will take you in famous Handicraft shops where you can buy some of gifts etc .. Later enjoy Lunch at Local Restaurant. After lunch driver will take you Qutub Minar. It is a victory tower, Qutubuddin Aibak laid the foundation of Qutab Minar in 1199 AD and it was completed by his successor Iltutmish in 1368. Qutub Minar is 72.5 meters tall. Built in red sandstones, the inscriptions of verses of holy Quran and some elaborated carvings have been displayed on the tower. After Qutub Minar, the driver will take you back to your hotel in Delhi. 

Note – the order of visiting attraction may change depends on your hotel location
strTitle: Full Day Old and New Delhi Capital City Tour Including India Gate, Red Fort and Lotus Temple

strIntroduction:
Our 3 day Taj & Pink city tour offers you to witness the splendor of one of the most magnificent cities in India. Agra & Jaipur, both are beautiful cities known as a Taj City, Agra & Pink City Jaipur. The greatest tourist attraction in Agra is Taj Mahal & Fort, Taj Mahal is one of the current Seven Wonders of the World. The Jaipur city is surrounded by beautiful Aravali hills. The magnificent Jal Mahal is located in the middle of Mansagar Lake. Jaipur has a lot to offer its visitors including Birla Temple, Amer Fort, Hawa Mahal and many more.

Day 1 New Delhi - Agra
Our driver will pick you up early in the morning from your hotel in New Delhi or airport. Later, he will drive you to Agra. Agra is located at a distance of approx. 235km from New Delhi. After a 4-5 hours’ journey we reach Agra.

On arrival at Agra around 11am, we will first check-in at the hotel after a quick fresh-up, visit epitome of love- Taj Mahal.
Taj Mahal was constructed by Shah Jahan in loving memory of his wife Mumtaz. Acclaimed by the archaeologist’s world over as the finest example of Mughal architecture, it reflects a style which combines elements from Persian, Turkish and Indian architectural styles.

After a lunch at a local restaurant (own expense), visit Agra Fort Agra fort known as the treasure house of Mughal Empire. The monument was constructed with red sandstone and white marble.

We will then visit Marble factory & some famous shops. Head back to the hotel and enjoy your dinner at the hotel. (Taj Mahal closed on every Friday)

Day 2 – Agra – Fatehpur Sikri- Jaipur
After check out from the hotel and chauffeur will take you to visit Fatehpur Sikhri.
Built in the honor of saint Sheikh Salim Chisti, Fatehpur Sikhri was Akbar's capital and is hailed for its imperial contents. Here, experience the charm of Mughal era and witness the wonderful example of Mughal art & architecture.

After completing your visit, you will be driven to Jaipur, enroute you will enjoy lunch at Rajasthani restaurant (own expense). On arrival to Jaipur, check-in to the hotel, we''ll visit Birla Temple (without guide) and back to the hotel, enjoy your dinner at the hotel.

Day 3 – Jaipur – Delhi
After checkout from the hotel, visit Amber Fort . Amber fort is constructed with red and white sandstone. It displays perfect blend of Hindu and Muslim style of architecture. After Fort stop at Jal Mahal. Jal Mahal also known as Water Palace which is located in the middle of Mansagar Lake.

We will then drive to Hawa Mahal. Hawa Mahal is also known as ‘Palace of Winds’ The 5-storey beehive structure amuses its visitors the most. Later we visit City Palace. The magnificent City Palace of Jaipur is a palace complex which features many buildings including Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal. City Palace also features a museum, where rich collection of Rajput warriors is brilliantly preserved. Our Delhi-Jaipur tour is completed with the visit to City Palace.

After that, the driver will take you back to your Delhi hotel or airport between 7 to 9pm.
strTitle: 3-Day Private Taj Mahal, Agra and Jaipur Tour from Delhi

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the past glory of the Mughal era. Walk through the old lanes of Delhi, cross the busy bazaar areas, buy anything that catches your fancy, and experience the wonders of relics, monuments that still hold the memoirs of the era. This tour will overwhelm you. Old Delhi, rich iconic post colonial capital of India, is indeed a life-giving elixir to a hibernating soul due to its unlimited dearth of aesthetic heritage culture and affluent variety of food.

Morning after breakfast around 09:00 AM,our driver will pick up you from your Hotel and drive to old Delhi, en route local guide will join you , drop at Red fort, now walking tour will start, Guide will take you at Red Fort and give your brief about Red fort from outside, do some Photography and walk through to Chandni Chowk area, visit Chippiwada Temple, Sheesh Ganj Gurudwara from outside. Later you be enjoy, Rickshaw Ride up to Fatehpuri market, it is wholesale market of spices , pulses and dry fruits.


Now walk through narrow lanes of Chandni Chowk. Old Delhi’s famous bazaars such as Kinari Bazaar, provides traditional Indian wedding commodities. Be enthralled by the jewelry market, Dariba Kalan. Ballimaran has leather products in store for you, and a huge collection of bangles in Bangle market. Ending with finger licking food at Pranthe wali gali(famous street of Indian pancakes). There is a wide variety of marvelous architecture in different shops of this small city.

After having Parntha now walk to Jama masjit guide will give you brief about this Mosque, here your driver will be waiting and board in Car and drive to heart of New Delhi Connaught place, en route your will visit outside view of Raj Ghat, it is a memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. Originally it was the name of a historic ghat of Old Delhi on the banks of Yamuna River. In Connaught place here you will see tall buildings of city and walk through in famous handicrafts tourist shop, where you can by some gifts or famous kashmiri woollen shawls.

Your tour end here and driver drop you back your hotel.
strTitle: Private Old Delhi Walking Tour Including Rickshaw Ride Famous Foods

strIntroduction:
Complete serenity that exists over Alleppey is really difficult to explore in the recent urbane civilization. Moreover, the clear waters and the narrow canals through which you move always give you the thrilling experience that is difficult to forget. Enjoy the relaxing houseboat with lunch followed by sightseeing in Alleppey. Visiting Alleppey will be an unforgettable experience that you can treasure for the rest of your life!

Between 9.30 – 10:00AM you will be picked from Cochin International Airport or your hotel in Ernakulam and then proceed to Alleppey, also known as Alappuzha, to board your houseboat lunch cruise.

The houseboats consist of eco-friendly materials that can be the woods or the ropes. Here, the original concept came from the way that was innovated to carry rice from the underwater farms. Board the boats and enjoy a happy ride that gives you a cozy feeling around the Punnamada Lake Alleppey. Inside the cruise, you can feel the ultimate comfort completely separated from the external anarchy. Simply, you get the feel of the eternal nature as the boat crosses the backwaters channels around Alleppey. The entire scenic beauty will take you to a different world similar to heaven. The cruise takes approx. 3 hours and you will be served with the lunch and tea.

After the relaxing cruise, enjoy some sightseeing to explore Alleppey. Move around the paddy fields that extend with a boundless destination. See the coconut palms, Chinese nets and the extensive fields create a finicky beauty that attracts the tourists who visit here any time without any limitations. Chirping migratory birds make the amazing calls that get echoed breaks the complete silence around the lagoons. On the West side of Alleppey you can get a view of the endless Arabian Sea that carries the immense glory of nature. The natural flowing rivers, the small lakes and the lagoons accumulate the crystal clear water that increases the overall beauty of the place. As the place is situated near the sea if you look on the maritime map, you can get a consummate location that is difficult to identify. When the tour ends, you will be transferred back to Cochin International Airport or your hotel in Ernakulam.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Alleppey Houseboat and Sightseeing Tour including Transfer and Lunch

strIntroduction:
This tour is the best attraction and evening tour of Pearl City Hyedrabad. Tour includes pilgrimages places to men made lake and beautiful evening laser show. This Hyderabad tour will take you Birla Temple, NRT Garden, and marine drive look Necklace road. Men made Husain sagar lake give you unique experience of statue View. Evening enjoy laser show at Lumbini park.

You will be picked up at your hotel in Hyderabad by 2:00 PM and start this exciting tour in the Pearl City of Hyderabad.

Later your local English-speaking guide will join you and start your tour with a visit to the Birla Temple that combines architecture of Orissan and South Indian temples devoted to Lord Venkateswara (Vishnu). The temple also has separate shrines for various Hindu gods and goddess including Shiva, Shakti, Ganesh, Hanuman, Brahma, Saraswati, Lakshmi and Saibaba.

Afterwards go to a famous long strip of boulevard popularly known as Necklace Road followed by the NTR Garden. NTR Garden is a leisure and entertainment centre located on the bank of Hussain Sagar, named after the late N. T. Rama Rao film star and former Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh. It offers lots of recreation facilities, such as toy train, car cafes, Japanese garden, restaurants, roaring cascade, fountain, gopuram, and is also known for an imposing entrance plaza with Nandi Bulls.

After NTR garden enjoy a relaxing boat ride in Husain Sagar lake with scenic view of lake. Husain Sagar Lake is one of largest lake in Asia and connects two city - Hyderabd and Secundrabad. It was created on a stream of the River Musi by Sufi Saint Hussain Shah Wahi in 1562, during the rule of Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. You will also see the large Lord Buddha statue located in the centre of the .lake. After the boat ride, stop by the Lumbini Park nearby that is maintained by the Buddha Purnima Project Authority. The park was constructed in 1994 and occupies an area of 7.5 acres and is named after the garden as the birth place of Prince Siddhartha, who later became Lord Buddha. The park also contains a statue of Lord Buddha.

In the evening around 7:15 PM, enjoy an exciting laser show at the Lumbini park. The laser show is conducted by a theme related to the history of Hyderabad with laser, animation equipment, aqua screens integrated with musical fountains and water jet fountains synchronized with music for a period of 30-45 minutes. After the show enjoy a delicious dinner at a local restaurant. When the tour ends, you will be dropped back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Evening Hyderabad City Tour including Boat Ride, Laser Show and Dinner

strIntroduction:
Welcome to the world’s largest film city Ramoji Film City! Book this special package that includes "Star Experience" entrance ticket, hotel transfer in Hyderabad and lunch. Ramoji Film City is founded by Ramo ji Rao in 1996. It is a unique corporate rendezvous, where the carpet beneath your feet is over 2000 acres and the ceiling is another unending vastness, and fosters creativity and encourages imagination. Catering to the requirements of the Film World, which includes regional, National, Hollywood and in-house productions, Ramoji Film City is an enchanting blend of man-made wonders and nature’s pristine beauty. If you are planning a trip to Hyderabad, you should never miss this special opportunity!

Your driver will report to your hotel lobby in Hyderabad around 8:30 AM and then proceed to the famous Ramoji Film City in Anaspur Village, Hayathnagar Mandal (approx. 1 hr drive/30 km).

Your driver will hand you the entrance ticket and your ticket includes a welcome package of privilege chocolate box, welcome drink and snacks on arrival. Your ticket also has privilege entry to Action Studio, Filmy Duniya, Spirit of Ramoji, Stunt Show, Ranger and Borasura. Your ticket is "Star Experience" category with special advantage of limited queue to attractions. Also enjoy lunch included in the package at a AC restaurant.

Your driving will be waiting outside of Ramoji Film City and, by the end of the day, meet your driver and be transferred your hotel in Hyderabad.
strTitle: Ramoji Film City Star Experience Package including Hotel Transfer and Lunch

strIntroduction:
Join this full-day tour to experience both the beautiful nature of Shivanasamudra Waterfalls and fascinating history of ancient Somnathpur! Visit the Shivasamudra Waterfalls surrounded by lush green forests and witness true beauty of Karnataka. Enjoy the soothing sound of gushing water while capturing mesmerizing views with your camera. Also go to the ancient temples of Talakadu, also known as "city of lost temples" and learn about its sculptures and architecture. Your knowledgeable guide will give you a lot of historical insight about the temples buried under sand every year.

Your chauffeur will pick you up from your hotel in Bangalore by 7:00 AM and drive to Shivasamudra Falls situated on the banks of River Kaveri. It is the second biggest waterfall in India and also known for one of the first hydro-electric power stations in Asia. Also enjoy a wonderful breakfast included in the package!

Shivasamudra divides the river Kaveri into twin waterfalls named Gaganachukki and Bharachukki Falls (13 km from each other). These magnificent waterfalls plunges 320 feet into gorge, breaking into a cloud of misty foam. The waterfalls are surrounded by the lush green hill forests of the Kaveri Wildlife Sanctuary. The spectacular waterfalls will certainly take your breath away. The sound of gushing waters has a soothing effect. Enjoy the calm and tranquil ambiance. Don't forget to bring your camera to capture the mesmerizing view of the waterfalls.

Later, drive to Somnathpur funded in the 13th century and ruled by rich and powerful rulers. The Hoysalas were the last dynasty that ruled this region. They had played a major role in constructing temples in the region and surrounding places.
