Enjoy a sumptuous lunch at a local restaurant and then proceed for the Chennakesava Temple, also known as a Keshava Temple. The temple is built on a star-shaped platform and has three carved pinnacles and shrines dedicated to Lord Janardhana, Venugopala and Kesava.

Somnathpur is also famous for sandalwood oil, incense sticks and other handicrafts. There are many local artisans that are involved in production of teak, ivory, rosewood and sandalwood carvings. It is also famous for Mysore style painting of gods and goddesses. After the tour, your will be taken back to your hotel in Bangalore.
strTitle: Private Tour: Shivanasamudra Waterfalls and Ancient Somnathpur Full-Day Tour from Bangalore including Breakfast and Lunch

strIntroduction:
Discover the ancient cities of Belur, Halebeedu and Shravanabelagola on this day tour from Bangalore. Visit some of the oldest temples, constructed during Hoysala dynasty, learn the stories behind these monuments, some of which are around 1,000 years old and get to know about the Hindu gods worshiped in these temples. Admire the rare ancient sculptures that depicts scene from Hindu mythologies, dating back to the golden ages in India.

You will be picked up at 7:30am from your hotel for this tour. During the trip you will visit the Hoysala period temples of Belur, Halebeedu and witness Asia’s tallest monolithic stone statue of Gomateshwara at Shravanabelagola, which is a prominent Jain pilgrimage center.
After reaching Yediyur village, enjoy your breakfast with local Idli and Dosa. Then, proceed to Shravanabelagola, famous for its great statue of Lord Gomateswara, situated in Manjunath Temple in Dharmasthala. The statue symbolizes renunciation, self-control, and subjugation of ego as the primary steps towards salvation.

Make a stop for lunch at a local restaurant and then, you will be transferred to Belur, located in Hassan district. Visit the Chennakeshava temple which is a fine example of Hoysala architecture. It was consecrated by the famous Hoysala king Vishnuvardhana to mark his victories in 1116 AD against the Cholas. Later, drive to Halebeedu which was the ancient capital of Hoysala dynasty. 'Halebeedu' actually means 'ruined city' as it was ruined by the Moghul sultanate twice. Visit the famous Hoysaleshwara temple which is comprised of two shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva. The walls of the temple have carvings of different deities of Hindu mythology and stories from Mahabharata, Ramayana and Puranas.Afterward. Once this tour is over you will be transferred back to your hotel in Bangalore.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ancient Temples of Belur, Halebid, Shravanabelagola from Bangalore

strIntroduction:
Book this overnight private tour for your loved one and enjoy a romantic candlelight dinner on houseboat! Experience the complete serenity, clear waters and narrow canals in Kumarakom/Alleppey and create this unforgettable memory together.

Day:01 Kochi - Kumarakom/Alleppey (L, D)
You can choose pick up time between 9:00 AM–1:00 PM as per your comfort and will be picked up at your hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam, Cochin International Airport, Railway Station, or Cochin Port.

Proceed to Alleppey/Kumarakom to board your houseboat. Have a welcome drink and after fresh-up have lunch on the houseboat while enjoying scenic beauty of backwater. You can see coconut palms, Chinese nets and the extensive fields creating an unique beauty that attracts visitors around the world. Chirping migratory birds make the amazing calls that get echoed breaks the complete silence around the lagoons. On the West side of Alleppey, you can get a view of the endless Arabian Sea that carries the immense glory of nature. The natural flowing rivers, the small lakes and the lagoons accumulate the crystal clear water that increases the overall beauty of the place. As the place is situated near the sea if you look on the maritime map, you can get a consummate location that is difficult to identify. 

In the evening, enjoy a romantic candlelight dinner on the houseboat with your loved one! Stay overnight on the boat.

Day 02: Kumarakom - Kochi (B)
In the morning, enjoy the beauty of backwater at sunrise while having breakfast on-board. Check out around 09:00 AM and drive back to your hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam, Cochin International Airport, Railway Station, or Cochin Port.
strTitle: Overnight Private Tour: Romantic Kumarakom and Alleppey Houseboat Tour with Candlelight Dinner

strIntroduction:
Hyderabad Tour will give you a unique experience, this city knows as a pearl city of India. During your tour you will visit world famous Charminar . And come to know rich culture of this city. This tour will give the feel of Historical and modernize culture.

You will be picked up in the morning and meet the driver in your Hotel lobby between 9 – 9:30 am. You will then proceed to a full-day Pearl City tour. 

The first stop on your tour will be at the oldest Golkonda Fort (closed on Monday's), followed by Qutub Sahi Tombs, Qutub Shahi tombs are the royal cemetery of the seven Qutub Shahi kings who ruled Golconda for nearly 170 years. It is located at Ibrahim Bagh near Golconda. After the tombs, you will head to one of oldest mosques, Mecca Masjid . 
After your busy morning, you will have an opportunity to have lunch. Whenever you are feeling hungry, let your Guide or driver know and they will take you to a good local restaurant.

After Lunch, you will visit your next monument, the world-famous Charminar know as an icon of Hyderabad. Next, stop at the famous Salar Jung Museum, followed by the palace of the Nizams of Hyderabad state, know as Chowmahala Palace. 
After Chowmahala Palace, your driver will drop you back off at  your Hotel. Your tour stops can be Monuments order can be customized based on your hotel location.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-day Hyderabad City Tour of Golkonda Fort, Charminar Mosque and Museum

strIntroduction:
Book this full-day trip to explore two amazing cities in a day - Auroville and Pondicherry. Visit the spiritual Matrimandir in Auroville that took 37 years to build and also all the spiritual belongings of Auroville Aurobindo Ashram in Pondicherry. Visit the Pondicherry Museum and sculpture gallery to learn more about the unique history of Pondicherry.

In the morning, you will be picked up at your hotel in Chennai by 7:30 AM and then drive to Pondicherry.

En-route visit the sanctified Matrimandir in Auroville. Matrimandir, also known as the Temple of The Mother, is an edifice of spiritual significance for practitioners of Interal yoga that took 37 years to build and was initiated by The Mother of the Sri Aurobindo Ashramthat.

Upon arriving in Pondicherry, visit the Sri Aurobindo Ashram, a spiritual community (ashram) with only one location in Pondicherry. Also stop by the Pondicherry Museum along with the sculpture gallery situated at the Bharati Park that represents the beautiful artifacts of the historic eras. Moreover, you can ascertain the famous sculptures that signify the rare collections from the Arikanedu Roman civilization. Overall, it gives a remarkable knowledge about the French culture that prevailed in the particular area. Apart from these, you can also perceive the snail shells that consist of the different shapes and structures. Stop by a popular local restaurant for lunch around noon and after sightseeing you will be dropped off at your Chennai hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Auroville and Pondicherry Full-Day Tour including Lunch from Chennai

strIntroduction:
Kolkata, also known as the "City of Joy", is a city that beautifully embodies the Indian native traditions with the ghosts of its colonial past and now is slowly moving to reform itself in the lines of a modern India. The city was the first capital of the British who ruled India for 200 years. Thus, it has a lot of structures that were built during the time of the British rule in India. Visit the famous Victoria Memorial and Howrah Bridge and take a Tonga Ride to the St. John’s Church. You will also enjoy the delicious Bengali cuisine for lunch!

You will be picked up at your hotel in Kolkata at 9:45 am and start the day with a mouthwatering breakfast at your own expense. Later go for an enchanting tour to explore the wonders of the famous City of Joy – Kolkata.

The first stop is the monumental symbol of Kolkata – Victoria Memorial. Victoria Memorial is designed by Sir William Emerson as an example of Indo-Saracenic style. The architecture of Victoria has elements from the Mughals that adds to the elegance of the structure. The beautiful garden was designed by Lord Redesdale and Sir David Prain. This special memorial was established to honor Queen Victoria. In the year 1906, the foundation stone was laid down to support this beautiful structure. Now this epitome of elegance is converted into a stunning museum.

The adventure continues with an exciting Tonga ride, a heritage ride along the VIP circle area. Drive by the St. John’s Church, one of the first architectural wonders created by the British. It was initially a cathedral, but now it is converted into a church. Later visit the St. Paul’s Cathedral. It is a beautiful structure initiated by Bishop Daniel Wilson established in the year 1839. It was designed by a famous engineer of that time – Major William Niam Forbes and was assisted by C. k. Robinson. It was heavily influenced by the tower and the shrine of the Norwich Cathedral. In 1934, a major earthquake effected Kolkata and the tower was badly affected. The tower was then rebuilt keeping the structure Harry tower of Canterbury Cathedral. In the year 1874, St. Paul’s was consecrated.

Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant followed by a visit to the symbol of Kolkata – Howrah Bridge. The bridge connects two major cities of West Bengal – Howrah and Kolkata. The area around Howrah Bridge is the house of two major places – Mullik Ghat and a colorful flower market. Finally, visit the famous South Park Street Cemetery. In the 19thcentury, it was marked as one of the largest Christian cemetery outside America and Europe. It was first established in 1767 and in use till the year 1830. When the tour ends, you will be transferred back to your hotel in Kolkata.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Kolkata City Tour of Victoria Memorial, Howrah Bridge and Tonga Ride

strIntroduction:
Touted as the cultural capital of India, Varanasi is a picturesque city located on the western banks of Yamuna river. It has carried the legacy of Indian tradition and culture for centuries and passed it on to the following generations. The city is full of spiritualism and philosophy and embraces a fine blend of religions like Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism. Not only the Hindu temples but also ashrams, ghats, Buddhist Stupas and Jain Temples add to the spiritual aura wrapping this special city of Varanasi.

Day 1
You'll be picked up from Varanasi Airport , Varanasi Junction railway station or your hotel in Varanasi and transferred to the hotel. After check-in and some free time, you will be taken to Sarnath - the UNESCO World Heritage site.

Hailed as one of the holiest Buddhist places, Sarnath is a sacred place where Gautama Buddha delivered his first sermons and claimed the place as an important pilgrimage site for his followers after attaining spiritual enlightenment. Later the same day you will visit Sarnath Museum. The museum houses the finest specimens of Buddhist art, culture and treasures. After touring around Sarnath, your driver will take you back to the hotel where you will rest for the night.

Day 2
You are invited to an early morning boat ride on the holy river Ganges. During the ride you will see the bathing ghats and cremation site. After Ganges boat trip, you will return to the hotel and enjoy breakfast. After savoring a delectable breakfast, your driver will take you to visit some famous temples followed by Banaras Hindu University, Bharat Kala Bhavan and many other marvelous holy structures. The beauty of these temples are characterized by their uniqueness and a distinct appeal. Although some are mere ruins, you can easily see the diversity and an acute fineness in craftsmanship.

In the evening, you will get to witness the ritualistic rites held every evening on the banks of Ganges.Thereafter, your driver will take you back to the hotel to rest for the night.

Day 3
After enjoying breakfast, you will check-out from the hotel and the driver will take you to Varanasi Airport , Varanasi Junction railway station or your hotel in Varanasi.
strTitle: 2-Night Private Tour: Spiritual Varanasi Tour

strIntroduction:
Discover the historical city of Kochi. Visit the churches, synagogues and museums in the city. Also a gateway to Kerala, Kochi is situated on the south-west coast of the India. The city was the first European settlement in India. Its location between blue waters of the Arabian Sea and Kerala’s emerald backwaters, its rich medley of Indian and foreign architecture make it a favorite tourist spot. It is also the industrial and commercial capital of Kerala.

Your guide and driver will pick up you from your hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam at 2pm and proceed for the Kochi city tour.

The first stop on your tour will be the Jewish Synagogue. The Synagogue is the oldest synagogue in India built in 1568, it attracts tourist all round the year. The synagogue is decorated with Chinese tiles and Belgian chandeliers.

Next you will visit St Francis Church, the first European church of India. The church was built in 1516. it is famous for being the initial burial place for Vasco de gama which was later taken to Lisbon. Then see The Dutch Palace- built by the Portuguese in 1557 as a gift to the Raja of Cochin. It is a 2-storied building around a central courtyard and also has numerous temples. It is also known as Mattancherry palace.
Next, you will see the Indo-Portuguese Museum- established by Dr. Joseph Kureethra to protect the rich heritage of Portuguese influence on the city. The museum has five main sections including the Altar, Treasure, Procession, Civil Life and Cathedral.

Your tour will take you next to see Chinese Fishing Nets- set up on teak wood and bamboo poles, these fishing nets has its origin in China. These were introduced by Chinese explorer Zheng He. It has become a major tourist attraction.

After sightseeing, your driver will take you to the theater for Kathakali Dance Show. Kathakali is a classical dance form, and is deeply embedded in the culture of Kerala. One of the important cultural icons of Kerala is this majestic dance. After the show enjoy dinner at a popular local restaurant and then be transferred back to your hotel around 9pm.
strTitle: Private Tour: Kochi City Tour and Kathakali Dance Show including Dinner

strIntroduction:
Explore the Chennai city on this day-trip. You will have the chance to visit one of the longest beaches in the world, Marina Beach. You will also catch a glimpse of the Kapeleeshwar temple and Fort St. George, St. Mary’s Church and Kalakshetra. After your trip you will be returned to your hotel.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Chennai by 9:30 am and proceed for this exciting Chennai city tour with your local tour guide.

First, you will explore St. George Fort, located on the banks of the Bay of Bengal. Historically know as a white town, It was built by the British East India Company in 1640 AD. The fort is believed to be the first establishment of the British in India. It is a military architecture marvel, and now the fort is serving as the administrative headquarters of the legislative assembly of the state of Tamil Nadu. 

The most popular structures inside the fort include St. Mary's Church, Museum, Wellesley House and Clive House.
You will visit The Fort Museum, which contains a large selection of arms and armaments, and exhibits a wide range of artifacts dating back to the British period.

Next, you will visit the Kapaleeshwar Temple, built around the 7th century CE. It is a fine example of Dravidian architecture
and is dedicated to Lord Shiva, called Kapaleeshwar. The statue of his wife, Parvati, is also situated in the temple and known as Karpagamabl. You will also see several other temple houses other shrines that are dedicated to lords such as Ganesha, Muruga and Sani Bhagvan.

Following your temple visit, you will tour the Government Museum and Art Gallery of Chennai. This is one of the best museums in India. Afterwards, you will visit Marina Beach where you can relax and unwind, and watch the sunset. After your trip, you will be transferred back to your hotel around 4:30 pm.
strTitle: Private Day Tour: Chennai City Tour of Museum, Art Gallery, Temple Kalakshetra and Beach

strIntroduction:
Join us to explore the 80-feet Athirappilly Falls near the Valparai hill station and Vazhachal Falls! The Athirappilly Falls is part of the Chalakudy River surrounded by green forest and the Vazhachal Falls has a wide range of flora and herbal plantation. In addition to the mesmerizing nature, enjoying your lunch at a luxurious resort/restaurant will make this private tour even more unforgettable.

Your driver will pick up you from your hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam by 8:30 AM and drive to the Athirappilly.

Athirappilly is known for its scintillating waterfall with a height of over 80 feet. This breathtaking waterfall joins the river Chalakudy that is 5 km from the hill station Valparai. Valparai is famous for its serene tea-estate and it is also the proud habitat of elephants. The highest density of the enormous Indian elephants is found here. Geographically, it is also an important corridor between Parambikulam and Malayattur.

On arrival Athirappilly enjoy the mesmerizing view of Athirappilly Falls followed by a delicious lunch at a luxurious resort/restaurant. After lunch you will visit another waterfall called the Vazhachal Falls. The Vazhachal Falls is also a part of the Chalakudy river with a wide variety of colorful flora and herbal plantation. This plantation is maintained by the forest department of India. After a heartfelt trip to the Athirappilly and spending the whole day in the nature, you will be dropped off at your hotel in the evening.
strTitle: Private Day Tour: Athirappilly Falls and Vazhachal Falls Adventure from Kochi including Lunch

strIntroduction:
This is a perfect tour for people who enjoy night life and modern night cruise with DJ. Take the popular catamaran boat cruise and enjoy the fresh ocean breeze and mesmerizing view. Also visit the Conception Church with a panoramic view of Panaji City from Altinho Hill and the Maruti Temple by road. Enjoy a mouthwatering dinner at a popular local restaurant before you call off the night.

Your driver will pick you up at your hotel in Goa by 4:00 PM and start this special night tour. Board the popular catamaran style cruise with western or Indian DJ while enjoying the fresh ocean breeze.

Cruise gently down the river to the Dona Paula Bay, past the Adil Shah Palace which was the first building of Panjim that was built by the Sultan as his summer palace and used to housed the Goa Secretariat. After the cruise travel by road and see the Immaculate Conception Church with a panoramic view of Panaji City from Altinho Hill. Also visit the Maruti Temple followed by a mouthwatering dinner at a popular local restaurant. After dinner you will be dropped off at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Goa Sightseeing and Night Cruise with Dinner and Hotel Transfer

strIntroduction:
Kerala is a beautiful mixture of unique architecture and serenity of nature. On your first day, you will spend good amount of time in Munnar - the gateway to the hills of South India. Munnar has a lot to offer with its tea gardens, waterfalls, the Shola forest and the Eravikulam National Park.

Day 1: Kochi - Munnar (D)
After breakfast, you will be picked up from your hotel around 1 pm. You will tour the area for 4-5 hrs, first visiting the most beautiful hill station call Munnar. With all its colourful landscape, breathtaking sights and mesmerizing view, Munnar is certainly a destination to visit in 'God’s own country'. The journey to Munnar is beautiful as the road stretches along the waterfalls. You will then arrive at the hotel and check in to spend your own personal time in the evening. Enjoy dinner at Hotel, and relax for the night.

Day 2: Munnar (B,D)
After breakfast at the hotel, you will start exploring Munnar by visiting the Eravikulam National Park, which is a famous habitat of the rare mountain goats called the Nilgiri Tahr. You will also explore Mattupetty Dam and Echo Point with it's lustrous green tea garden. You will be also taken to the Tea museum. After your day excursion, you will return to the hotel to enjoy dinner and overnight rest.

Day 3: Munnar - Kochi (B)
After breakfast, you will check out from your hotel and drive to Kochi to be dropped at the airport, Ernakulam hotel or railway station.
strTitle: 3-Day Private Tour of Tea Valley and Munnar Hill Station from Kochi

strIntroduction:
A visit to Kochi would be incomplete without experiencing the mesmerizing art form of Kerala region – the Kathakali dance. Kathakali is a classical dance form that traces its origin in Kerala. Kathakali is deeply imbibed in the culture of Kerala and is one of the important cultural icons of Kerala. Also enjoy a delicious dinner and convenient hotel transfer in Kochi or Ernakulam.

Your driver will pick you up from the hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam at 5:30 pm and drive to the Cochin Cultural Center to enjoy the popular Kathakali Dance Show.

From 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm enjoy the classical dance form of Kerala. The act begins with the Kelikutto and it is the call for the audience to shift their attention as the act is about to get started. Kelikutto is followed by Todayam. In this part, two allotted characters evoke the blessing of the Divine. This is consecutively followed by an entertaining dance piece purapaddu. Once the dance piece ends, the musicians take the stage and take the audience on a breath taking musical journey. This particular section of the act is called Melappada. Pakka or the minukku does not get the opportunity to do a debut on the stage. All the other characters perform a debut in the Tiranokku section. This marks the beginning of the performance or the scene to be narrated.

After the dance show you will be taken to back to a hotel restaurant for dinner. You will be transferred back to your hotel after dinner.
strTitle: Kochi Evening Excursion: Kathakali Dance Show including Dinner and Hotel Transfer

strIntroduction:
Discover the historical city of Kochi (Cochin) on a private half-day tour. Visit the city's churches, synagogue, and museums with a personal guide. Kochi's rich medley of Indian and foreign architecture makes it a favorite destination off the coast of India, with the beautiful blue waters of the Arabian Sea and Kerala’s emerald backwaters on either side.

Your private guide and driver will pick you up from your hotel in Kochi or Ernakulam in the morning. Settle into your air-conditioned vehicle and begin your half-day city sightseeing tour of Kochi.

Your first stop will take you inside Paradesi Synagogue, the oldest Jewish synagogue in India. Built in 1568, the place of worship is decorated with Chinese porcelain tiles and Belgian chandeliers. (Only the exterior can be seen when it is closed on Fridays and Saturdays.) Next up is a visit to St. Francis Church, the first European church of India. After a look around, continue on to the Dutch Palace (closed on Fridays).

Your tour proceeds to the Indo-Portuguese Museum, established at Fort Kochi to protect the rich heritage of Portuguese influence on the city. Afterward, your guide points out the Chinese fishing nets set up on teak wood and bamboo poles; these oft-photographed cantilevered fishing nets have their origin in China.

After completing your city tour, your driver will take you to a popular local restaurant for a South Indian–style lunch, before you are returned to your hotel in the afternoon.
strTitle: Private Tour: Kochi City Tour of Churches, Chinese Fishing Net and Museum

strIntroduction:
Book this overnight tour and discover the historical city of Kochi by visiting some of the most famous churches, synagogues and museums in the city, as well as taking in cultural traditions. Stay at a 3 or 4 star hotel in the city.

As a gateway to Kerala, Kochi is situated on the south-west coast of the India and was the first European settlement in the country. Its unique location between the blue waters of the Arabian Sea and Kerala’s emerald backwaters, combined with its rich medley of Indian and foreign architecture, make Kochi a special place to visit. 

Day 1 – Kochi (D)
Upon arrival at Cochin International Airport or Ernakulam Railway station, or your hotel in Kochi, you will be picked up by your driver, usually around  2:00 pm. Check-in to the hotel in Kochi and take some time to freshen up and and relax before heading out to the Kathakali Dance Show. Kathakali is a classical dance form originated in Kerala and an important cultural tradition.  After dance show you will be dropped back at the hotel for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 2 – Kochi (B)
In the morning, enjoy breakfast at the hotel. After check-out your guide and driver will pick up you at the lobby at 9:30 am and take you on a tour of Kochi. Visit the Jewish Synagogue, St Francis Church, Dutch Palace, Indo-Portuguese Museum and Chinese Fishing Nets. The Jewish Synagogue is the oldest synagogue in India, built in 1568, and is decorated with Chinese tiles and Belgian chandeliers. St. Francis Church is the first European church of India, dedicated to St. Anthony. The Dutch Palace was built by the Portuguese in 1557 as a gift to the Raja of Cochin. It is a two-story building around a central courtyard with numerous temples. It is also known as Mattancherry palace. The Indo-Portuguese Museum was established by Dr. Joseph Kureethra to protect the rich heritage of Portuguese influence on the city. Your guide will tell you more about all of these attractions. 
Finally, visit the famous Chinese Fishing Nets, which are set up on teak wood and bamboo poles. These were introduced by Chinese explorer Zheng He and have become a major tourist attraction. After completing your city tour around 1:30 pm, your driver will drop you off at Cochin International Airport, Ernakulam Railway station, or your hotel in Kochi.
strTitle: 2-Day Private Tour: Kochi City Tour including Kathakali Dance Show and Chinese Fishing Net

strIntroduction:
This tour commences with a walk from the yellow basalt stone to the Gateway of India. That is one of the most famous attractions of the city of Mumbai. It incurs a huge tourist turnover, all year round. The structure is an amalgamation of the Hindu and Muslim architectural styles. The arch has been constructed in the Muslim style, while the engravings, carvings and other decorations have done in the Hindu style of art. The Royal Taj Hotel proudly stands opposite the Gateway of India. This Hotel holds several memories of Mumbai and of the Taj Towers, whose architectural structure is a sight to behold.

Morning our driver and guide will pick up from Hotel lobby at 9AM,. The tourists are taken to the Gateway of India and are dropped there. The Gateway of India, one of the most famous architectural structures of Mumbai pulls a lot of tourist attraction. Its construction bears witness of both the Muslim and Hindu styles of architecture.


The Royal Taj Hotel stands opposite the Gateway of India. This place is indeed a treasure trove of several invaluable memories of this heritage city and of the Taj Towers, which is amazing architectural structure in its own terms.

Then the walk proceeds towards the Regal Theater. This theater had been designed by Charles Stevens and the interior had been planned by Karl Schara. It opened in the year 1933, and Regal Cinema extended its name to Regal Circle and at that time it was the only Art Deco cinema present.

After that, the tourists are taken to view the Prince of Wales Museum from outside. This place had been designed by George Willet. The foundation stone had been laid in the year in the 1905 by the visiting Prince of Wales and it was completed in the year 1914.This walk continues to the Elphinstone College. This is found opposite to the museum. It’s a 19th century, majestic Gothic-Victorian style university campus, complete with balconies, balustrades, gargoyles and turrets. Slightly further north of the college, on Mahatma Gandhi road itself, lies another building of historical importance.

Further down the road is the University of Bombay, which had been established in the year 1857 at the Town Hall. In the year 1874, it was shifted to the new complex near Oval Maidan. At present, this University is among the best ones in the country and ranked among the top 500 universities of the world.

The walk continues to the Flora Fountain. This fountain is a beautifully structured stone fountain, located in the Fort business district in the midst of South Mumbai. It’s heritage architecture, constructed by the Agri‐Horticultural society of Western India.

After viewing the fountain, the walk proceeds to the Victoria Terminus Railway Station, which is now known as the Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, which carries a lot of Historic importance and at present is the headquarters of the Central Railways. This 19th century architecture built with both structural and technical brilliance was considered as a UNESCO World Heritage List on 2nd July, 2004.
After all the tiring walking, the next lap is on taxi. The tourists are on a short taxi ride for about 2 kms for 10 minutes, from the VT station to a small cafe, with a nostalgic aura, Cafe Samovar, which is located in the Jehangir Art Gallery. 

After the relaxing break of snacks at the Samovar Cafe, the tourists are taken back to their respective Hotels.
strTitle: Private Heritage Mumbai Colaba Area Walking Tour with Transfer

strIntroduction:
Discover the best of the city of light in a day including Notre Dame Cathedral, Louvre's masterpieces, the historical area and Montmartre, the most picturesque village in the capital.

In 8 hours, you will know most of the history of Paris from its origins to its present day. Your tour starts at 9:00am in front of the Notre Dame Cathedral, the medieval symbol of Paris, built over the course of 200 years and considered an emblem of economical prosperity and religious power. Then, you will step in to see its magnificent stained glass windows and learn about its architecture, its treasures, its medieval life and some historical events, all in just one hour.

After your visit of Notre-Dame de Paris, embark for a 90-minute city walking tour, which will unveil the secrets and past of the main monuments and buildings bringing them back to life. The old entrance of the Louvre will mark the end of the city tour and the beginning of our visit to the most visited museum in the world. You will admire its most famous masterpieces such as the Venus de Milo, the Victory of Samothrace, the Mona Lisa and other Renaissance and French paintings as well as a few other jewels.

Your gastronomic break will take place either in an excellent "creperie", typically French or in a restaurant on Rivoli street. Montmartre will be your last stop. This bohemian neighborhood that hosted artists such as Vincent Van Gogh, Toulouse-Lautrec, Picasso, Maurice Utrillo, Manet, Modigliani, revolutionized art history.

A unique small-group experience that will end at 5pm at the foot of the Sacred Heart Basilica, a national vow dedicated to expiate an immoral nineteenth century.
strTitle: The Best of Paris in a Day

strIntroduction:
Come explore the island's tropical rainforest by zip lining through some of the tallest and longest zip lines on the island. Afterwards refresh yourself at the Labas Beach at Marigot Bay. End the tour by sampling some of the rums and liquors made right here at the St. Lucia Distillery before returning to your hotel or cruise ship. Enjoy a day where you can zip, dip and sip!

Don't just see St Lucia, taste and experience St Lucia. This tour takes you to the interior of the island allowing you to explore the rainforest from way, way up. You will zipline through some of the tallest and longest lines on the island all the while enjoying the flora and fauna of this tropical island paradise. Next, there will be a drive through a quaint fishing village were you can get a better view of true island living.

The next stop will be at the Labas Beach in Marigot Bay, said to be one of the most beautiful bays in the Caribbean. This beach is only accessible by a water ferry so you can relax and cool off here.

Next stop will be at the St. Lucia Distillers, home of the popular Chairmans Reserve Rums, Bounty "The Spirit of St. Lucia" and the Marigot Bay line amoungst many other. Relax and enjoy the rum buffet before visiting the "Rumm Shop" where you will have the opportunity to buy some of what you just sampled.
strTitle: St Lucia Zipling, Beach and Rum Tasting Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore the best sights the beautiful island of Saint Lucia has to offer.  View the famous pitons from Tet Paul, tour the drive in volcano and Diamond Water Falls and Botanical Gardens.  This tour has an approximate duration of six hours,

Now that you have decided to visit the beautiful island of St Lucia be sure to explore the best sights the island has to offer.  Whether you are coming from the North or South of the island, this tour will take you to Tet Paul Nature Trail for phenomenal views of the world famous Piton Mountains and views that take in both the southern and western coasts of the island.

In addition, we will tour the Caribbean's only drive-in volcano and visit the Diamond Falls and Botanical Gardens to explore the flora and fauna of this tropical island paradise. Along the way, we will be a drive through several quaint fishing villages where you can get a better feel of true island living.
strTitle: The Best of St Lucia Tour

strIntroduction:
Come join thousands of other fun-loving, beer-drinking travelers to celebrate Oktoberfest in Germany. Spend your day drinking beer, singing on the table tops and eating delicious Bavarian food. And the fun doesn’t have to end there: head back to your campsite for the biggest party outside of the beer halls to enjoy barbecue, live music and entertainment.

Oktoberfest is the biggest and best traditional beer festival in Europe. Head to the festival grounds with a guide and experience German beer and culture at its best.

Start the day off with a good hearty breakfast at your campsite before making your way into the beer halls with a fun, experienced guide on public transportation. The journey is less than 30 minutes from campsite to beer hall. Spend the day drinking beer, singing song's, making friends, eating delicious Bavarian food and jumping on carnival rides.

In the evening you will be served a delicious dinner back at the campsite and get ready for another party: Stoketoberfest! This is the legendary Stoke campsite and the biggest party outside of the beer halls. When the beer wenches pack up their steins for the day, the campsite is gearing up with gallons of free-flowing beer and sangria, great DJs and live bands, delicious BBQs and carnivalesque celebrations with 2,500 or more international guests every night.
strTitle: Munich Oktoberfest Overnight Camping Package Including Breakfast and Dinner

strIntroduction:
This is a canyoning adventure in a beautiful location surrounded by plenty of turquoise waterfalls. Enjoy a 35 m rappel in the main waterfall and then jump into 8 different water pools.

The tour starts at 7am when you are picked up from your hotel. First, you will be driven for about 1 hour and 40 minutes before arriving to Mil Cascadas. 

The guides will then provide you with the certified equipment for the activity which includes a wetsuit, helmet, harness and descender. You will do a short trek before getting to the rappelling station. There, you will do a 35 m rappel in the main waterfall.

Afterwards, you will continue your way through the Granados river jumping into 8 waterpools with different heights, from 2 to 10 meters approximately. After the last jump you will need to hike back for about 30 minutes. The tour ends with a drop off at the original departure point.
strTitle: Day Tour: Canyoning at Mil Cascadas from Cuernavaca

strIntroduction:
Canyoning adventure with 12 incredible rappels in the heart of the Tepozteco mountain!

You will be picked up at 7am from your hotel in Cuernavaca. Then, you will be driven for about 45 minutes before arriving to the starting point in Tepoztlán. 

Guides will then provide you with the certified equipment for the activity which include: wetsuit (in rainy season), helmet, harness, and a descender. You will do a 40 minute trek before getting to the entrance of the canyon. After this point, you will enjoy 12 thrilling rappels along with breathtaking views of the beautiful canyon! 

After the rappels, you will do another 40-minute hike where you will need to climb down rocks and trees until you finally arrive to the magical town of Tepoztlán.
strTitle: Paso Tlahuica Canyoning Tour

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a canyoning adventure with 8 astonishing rappels deep inside a beautiful forest. You will have an unforgettable experience with professional guides and all necessary equipment.

You will be picked up from your hotel, house or at a meeting point in Cuernavaca. Then, you will drive for about 1 hour before you arrive to the starting point in Santo Domingo Ocotitlán.

Your guide will then provide you with the certified equipment for the activity which includes: wetsuit (in rainy season), helmet, harness, and a descender. From there, you will start your adventure and will do a 40-minute trek before you get to the entrance of the canyon. Once you reach the canyon, you will enjoy 8 thrilling rappels and marvel yourself with a beautiful forest. The highest rappel you will find is of 15 meters (50 feet).

After this great adventure, you'll head back to your hotel.
strTitle: Ojo de Agua Canyoning Adventure from Cuernavaca

strIntroduction:
Canyoning adventure with 3 fun rappels.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Cuernavaca at 7am. Then, you will be driven for about 45 minutes before arriving to the starting point at the Chalchitepelt mountain in Tepoztlán, Morelos. 

Guides will then provide you with the certified equipment for the activity which include: wetsuit (in rainy season), helmet, harness, and a descender. You will do a 40 minute trek trough a magnificent forest before getting to the entrance of the canyon. After this point, you will enjoy 3 easy rappels of 8 (26 ft), 15 (50 ft) and 20 (65 ft) meters!

You will be taken back to your hotel at the end of the tour.
strTitle: Cañón del Tesoro Canyoning Adventure

strIntroduction:
In this tour you will go on a hiking adventure in Tepoztlán with 2 optional rappels.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Cuernavaca. Then, you will be driven for about 45 minutes before we arrive to the starting point at a mountain in Tepoztlán, Morelos. 

Guides will then provide you with the certified equipment for the activity which include: helmet, harness, and a descender (if optional rappel is chosen). You will walk trough beautiful trails in "El Cerro de la Luz" (Light Mountain) where breathtaking views will be reveled.

You can choose to do 2 small optional rappels, adequate for beginners. You will admire the Tepozteco pyramid from above. A great trekking adventure for all the family!

You will be taken back to your hotel in Cuernavaca at the end of the tour.
strTitle: Camino de la Luz Hiking Adventure

strIntroduction:
This memorable 5-hour day is set against the backdrop of one of Tuscany's most exclusive properties and gives you a unique glimpse of life behind those famous villa walls. This experience allows beginners and experienced cooks alike to come together for camaraderie, cooking, learning, eating, drinking, and taking in the villa and exclusive access to the private gardens. Just a few miles from Lucca’s medieval walls, explore this historical villa for an unique culinary experience. A hands on class with three course meal, local wines, a certificate of culinary attendance, recipe booklet and custom apron are included.

Giuseppe, your instructor, welcomes you to the secret villa kitchen in this historical renaissance villa. The residence, located within acres of manicured Italian gardens, replete with fountains, grottoes, waterfalls and mythological statues. As you drive to the property you will be following the renowned Lucchese Villa Trail, unfolding like a postcard amidst olive groves and vineyards. Explore, create, savor and remember, while discovering some of Tuscany's hidden treasures.

Chef Giuseppe will welcome to the villa at 10:30am with a glass of Prosecco and sampling of gastronomic specialties accompanied of course with a tasting of local top-quality extra virgin olive oil. The hands-on preparation and instruction of a three course meal in the villa's historic kitchen will follow, approximately 3-hours will be spent on the specific menu you are tackling. Needless to say, a cooking class in Tuscany would not be complete without learning how to make hand-made pasta with a seasonal sauce. A second course of either poultry or beef will be featured based on the heritage recipes. As a finale, try a typical biscotti or Florentine Zuppa Inglese.

Normally, lunch will be ready by 1:30pm and is based on your morning lesson efforts and paired with local wines. For vegetarians, a menu will be prepared accordingly with the season. A Certificate of Culinary Attendance in Tuscan Specialties will be presented to you, along with a recipe booklet and a custom apron. Sure to be the highlight of your Tuscan holiday.
strTitle: Cooking Class in an Historical Villa from Lucca

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a hands-on cooking experience with this 5-hour class in Lucca. Join Chef Giuseppe - a veteran of cooking classes in Italy, the US, Canada, the Caribbean, and Mexico - for a shopping trip at the market to purchase ingredients. Sample some Tuscan specialties and prosecco. Prepare a 4-course meal, which you'll eat at the end of class.

Make your way to the cooking class location in the historic center of Lucca, easily reached from your central lodging.

Walk with the chef to a market for a tour and to pick up ingredients. Learn about some of Lucca's specialty purveyors of local produce, gourmet foods, maybe even visit a local wine shop. The day's menu will take us where we need to go.  Along the way you will learn about and sample some of the region's delicacies while we do our shopping. Then it's back to the 18th century palace, just a short walk from the shopping district.

Don your apron, sip on prosecco or coffee (your choice) and begin your cooking experience with a tasting of four extra virgin olive oils from the local area to compare and contrast and gain knowledge about selecting, purchasing, using, and storing authentic EVOO. Giuseppe grew up on an olive oil mill property and can share many stories and tips on the old and the new methods of processing. You will also taste local cheeses and honeys from Tuscany accompanied by the famous gusti focaccia.

Then, you will begin to tackle the menu. Chef Giuseppe chooses offerings relating to the seasons of Tuscany, so menus will vary by time of year, but always include one starter, two pasta or risotto courses, one dessert, wine from the region, Nespresso, and limoncello. (Dietary restrictions can be taken into account when notified in advance.)

The spacious kitchen and prep area is fully air-conditioned, and designed with both elegance and modern convenience in mind. It is a comfortable venue, also allowing you a peek inside an authentic Tuscan 'palazzo' dwelling, with high, vaulted, and chestnut-beamed ceilings and antique wood and marble floors.
   
You will sit down to an authentic meal in your spectacular dining room complete with fresh flowers, pressed linens, and classical music to ensure that lunch is one of your most memorable meals in Tuscany.

There is nothing more organic and convivial than cooking with friends, and sitting down to the bounty of the Tuscan region - prepared by you.  We hope that the recipes and techniques that you experience with us will bring you memories - and good meals at home - for many years to come.
strTitle: Cooking Class in Lucca's Historic Center

strIntroduction:
Set out on a leisurely 2-hour float along Alaska’s Talkeetna River. Learn about the area’s flora, fauna and history from your expert guide as you float 7-miles (11 km) among stunning mountain scenery. Spot beaver lodges, view untouched boreal forest, marvel at peaceful riverside beaches and keep an eye out for local wildlife — including bald eagles, grizzlies and moose.

Embark on a 2-hour, leisurely family friendly float along Alaska’s Talkeetna River, known for its calm, glacial-fed waters.

Your 7-miles (11 km) adventure begins with complimentary pickup at your Talkeetna lodging based on the specific departure time you choose.

Once onboard, set out along the river’s peaceful waters, listening to your rafting guides’ as they share some of their own personal experiences and bits of local history. Keep a sharp eye for views of Denali and the Talkeetna Mountains, as well as spawning salmon, giant ferns and fresh water streams. You may also spot some resident wildlife, including bald eagles, moose and grizzly bears.

Learn about the area’s flora and fauna during a few brief stops along the way.

Along with round-trip hotel transport your tour includes rain gear such as a poncho and rubber boots, as well as a personal floatation device.
strTitle: Talkeetna River Float Trip

strIntroduction:
Get to know the culture of Mexico by taking part in a unique experience: an ancient Mayan Temazcal Ceremony, led by an authentic shaman. For the Mayan people, this ritual in the Home of Hot Stones was a source of health and energy. Learn about the power of volcanic stones and the aromas of herbs as you are guided by a shaman through four stages of purification. After finding peace and relaxation, kick back in a hammock with a light dinner of tropical fruits and natural drinks.

Meet your guide in your hotel lobby (for the private tour) or at the meeting point in Cancun (for the shared tour) between 4pm-5pm to begin this truly unique experience. Head to the Home of Hot Stones, the lodge where the temazcal ceremony takes place. Listen to an introductory talk from the temazcalero guide, who will answer questions, then participate in a salute around the fire.

After a small cleaning ceremony with copal (resin) and aromatic herbs, enter the temazcal and feel the heat of the volcanic rocks as their red light glows in the darkness. Breathe in the aromas of herbs and copal as your body is purified of physical and energetic toxins. Be guided through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat by the temazcalero using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera, and refreshing teas. Enjoy the ceremony's curative powers as you listen to live singing accompanied by musical instruments.

After the session in the temazcal (during which you can leave the room or ask the shaman to increase/reduce the heat at any time), refresh by taking a cold bath. Then kick back in a hammock and have a light snack of fresh, seasonal fruit and natural beverages. Because of its interactive character, the length of the temazcal session can vary, though it generally lasts about 90 minutes.

Leave feeling refreshed, renewed, and filled with positive energy. The tour concludes with a drop off back at your hotel or the meeting point in Cancun.
strTitle: Private or Shared Temazcal Unique Mayan Ritual from Cancun

strIntroduction:
Visit two most famous archaeological sites in Yucatan: Ek Balam (translated from the Mayan language "black jaguar") and the "New 7th Wonder of the World" - Chichen Itza. Swim in a beautiful cenote with crystal clear water, surrounded by exotic plants. In the second part of the tour you will visit to tequila faсtory where you can see the production process and taste this wonderful drink. No crowds, no lines on your private prehistoric adventure.

You will visit the famous archaeological site, lost in the jungle - Ek Balam (translated from the Mayan language "black jaguar"), where you will see the mysterious sculpture "angels" who guard the entrance to the "kingdom of the dead" in the form of the mouth of a rattlesnake. From the Preclassic until the Postclassic period, it was the seat of a Mayan kingdom. The site is noted for the preservation of the plaster on the tomb of Ukit-Kan-Lek-Tok, a king buried in the side of the largest pyramid.

Then you will visit the "New 7th Wonder of the World", one of the last cities of mysteriously vanished Maya civilization - famous Chichen Itza. Pyramid of Kukulkan, the Temple of Warriors, and the world's largest golf ball Pok Ta Pok, the Temple of the Jaguars, the Observatory and other buildings of the city will appear before you and will amaze with its greatness.  You will see Chichen Itza in the best time to visit , when there are no crowds

Later you will swim in a beautiful cenote with crystal clear water, surrounded by exotic plants and magical singing of wild birds. It's a natural pit, or sinkhole, resulting from the collapse of limestone bedrock that exposes groundwater underneath. Especially associated with the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico, cenotes were sometimes used by the ancient Maya for sacrificial offerings. Cenote water is often very clear, as the water comes from rain water filtering slowly through the ground, and therefore contains very little suspended particulate matter.

The culmination of the tour will be visiting of tequila faсtory where you can see the tequila production process and taste this wonderful drink.
 At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Chichen Itza, Ek Balam Cenote, and Tequila Factory

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a 3-hour tour to get a view into Mexican life. Enjoy your own local experience with a personal guide tasting real local Mexican food like taquitos, elotes or esquites, a delicious dessert like marquesita or a typical ice cream. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

After hotel pickup arround 7pm from Cancun or 6pm from Riviera Maya, you'll be driven to the center of the city. You will take a walk to the Palapas square in the very heart of Cancun where live music or shows bring locals to come to have fun. There, as locals, you will try real Mexican food like taquitos, elotes or esquites, a delicious dessert like marquesita or a typical ice cream.

After that you will be driven to the local night life zone to enjoy a refreshing cocktail in a nice bar. Be local, be real! If you look for a very special experience this is for you. Transportation from your hotel is included.
strTitle: Shared Tour: Local Cancun Nightlife and Food Tasting

strIntroduction:
Fly round-trip from Cancun to Mexico City in one day, which you'll spend sightseeing with a private guide. During this full-day tour you'll visit many of the key landmarks that make the Mexican capital city so special. Stop by the Palacio Nacional (National Palace) and Catedral Metropolitana (Metropolitan Cathedral), then walk down the Paseo de la Reforma and see Diego Rivera's famous murals at the presidential palace. You'll also visit Teotihuacan, a UNESCO World Heritage site, to marvel at the Aztec pyramids.

Get picked up from your hotel between 5 and 6am, then take the early flight from Cancun's airport to Mexico City. Meet your professional local guide at the airport in Mexico City, and begin with a sightseeing tour around the city center. Visit the Catedral Metropolitana (Metropolitan Cathedral, one of the oldest in Latin America) and see the Presidential Palace with its famous murals by Mexican artist Diego Rivera. Stroll down the Paseo de la Reforma, considered to be the most beautiful avenue in Mexico City, which is famous for having a large number of monuments and memorials.

After the city tour, you will discover the city "Where men become Gods". See the famous pyramids of the Sun and the Moon and visit the Basilica of our Lady of Guadalupe. Once you have completed the city tour, enjoy a delicious lunch and make your way back to the airport for your flight back to Cancun. After landing in Cancun, you will have a driver ready to bring you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Mexico City By Air in One Day from Cancun and Riviera Maya

strIntroduction:
This is an unique opportunity to get acquainted with the culture of Mexico. Enjoy a 14-hour guided trip to the famous ancient city Chichen Itza, followed by lunch and a visit to the breathtaking Ik Kil cenote. Experience one of the ancient Mayan ceremonies in the Home of Hot Stones with a real shaman. It is a good combination of an interesting historical tour and total relaxation in Temazcal.

Your tour begins with hotel pickup early in Cancun or Riviera Maya. Board a vehicle and drive to Chichen Itza and arrive at approximately 10:30am. Chichén Itzá was a center of commercial and religious power and is considered one of the most important vestiges of pre-Hispanic culture. See its main landmarks, including El Castillo. Explore the site with your guide for 2-hours.

After, your driver will be waiting to take you to the Sacred Blue Cenote of Ik Kil (place of the winds), where you can swim in the waters of this natural well inside a cave covered with lush vegetation. Then, enjoy a lunch buffet at the cenote's restaurant. After lunch, head to the lodge where the Temazcal takes place. Your arrival is slated for 5-6:00pm, the best time to enjoy this unique experience, which will start with an introductory talk from the "temazcalero" guide, who will answer questions, followed by a salute around the fire. After a small cleaning ceremony with the copal and aromatic herbs, you will enter the temazcal and start experiencing the heat of the volcanic rock and its red light in the darkness. The aroma of herbs and copal will allow you to feel at ease, purify the body and create space to get rid of bad energies and purify intentions. Using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera and refreshing teas, the temazcalero will guide you through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat (by opening the door of the temazcal), and enjoy the curative powers along with songs and musical instruments.

At any moment, you may leave the temazcal or ask the guide to increase or reduce heat. This experience will allow you to find a space of positive and curative energies towards the body and spirit, as well as relaxation. All of this is done in a healthy and safe place. Afterward, relax in a hammock and at the end of the excursion you will have a light dinner with tropical fruits and natural drinks.

Leave Temazcal at 7-8pm and arrive back in Cancun between 9 and 10:00pm.
strTitle: Private Tour Chichen Itza, Cenote and Unique Mayan Ritual in Temazcal

strIntroduction:
Have a unique opportunity to get acquainted with modern and ancient Mexican culture during this private, full-day tour. Enjoy a private, guided tour of the ancient city of Chichen Itza — one of the world’s New Seven Wonders; visit the stunning Ik Kil cenote and marvel at the cave formations as you swim in its fresh waters; and finish off the day by participating in a Mayan purification ceremony with an authentic shaman. Lunch, round-trip transport from your Cancun hotel, and the services of a personal guide are included.

After a 7am–8am pickup from your Cancun hotel, board an air-conditioned coach destined for the UNESCO-listed Chichen Itza — one of the New Seven Wonders of the world. After driving for around two hours, arrive at the ancient archaeological site and enjoy a 2-hour tour with your private guide.

Learn about fascinating history of the area during your comprehensive tour, exploring prominent features like the Ball Court–famous for its incredible acoustics–and the Temple of Warriors. Hear about the mysterious shadow snake that appears during certain times of the year, and snap pictures of the El Castillo pyramid before concluding the tour.

Next, travel to the Ik Kil cenote; a naturally formed swimming pool with clear, fresh waters. Take a dip in the underground cave before tucking into a buffet lunch of traditional Mexican fare at the cenote's on-site restaurant. 

Around 5pm-6pm, arrive at the lodge where the temazcal ceremony–a Mayan ritual that's considered by locals to be a source of health and energy– takes place. Listen to an introductory talk from the temazcalero guide, then participate in a salute around the fire. After a small cleaning ceremony with copal (resin) and aromatic herbs, enter the temazcal and feel the heat of the volcanic rocks as their red light glows in the darkness.

Breathe in the aromas of herbs and copal as your body is purified of physical and energetic toxins. Be guided through several intervals of increasing and decreasing heat by the temazcalero using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera, and refreshing teas. Enjoy the ceremony's curative powers as you listen to live singing accompanied by musical instruments.

After the session in the temazcal (during which you can leave the room or ask the shaman to increase/reduce the heat at any time), relax in a hammock and snack on a light dinner of fresh, seasonal fruit and natural beverages. Leave the lodge between 7pm-8pm feeling refreshed, renewed, and filled with positive energy. The tour concludes with a drop off back at your Cancun hotel between 9pm-10pm.
strTitle: Private Tour: Chichen Itza, Cenote and Unique Mayan Ritual in Temazcal from Cancun

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a unique and one-of-a-kind tour in Cancun by visiting the famous Market 23 (Mercado 23) and Market 28 (Mercado 28). You will be guided by a professional chef and enjoy a Mexican gourmet lunch. The private tour is guided by a professional chef with years of experience working in one of the best restaurants in Cancun.

After hotel pickup, meet your professional guide and a personal chef at Mercado 23 (Market 23) and start your tour by walking through the market and choosing the ingredients for a Mexican gourmet lunch, which you will prepare later. 

As you explore Market 23, your guide will share with you the origin and history of the local ingredients you see around. After getting all the ingredients for lunch, you will head to a restaurant where you will take part in a lunch cooking class. There, you will learn about some cooking techniques and then enjoy a delicious gourmet lunch right there. After lunch, enjoy free time at Market 28 (Mercado 28) which is famous for its huge variety of souvenirs and low prices.

In November 2010, Mexican gastronomy was recognized as Immaterial Patrimony of the Humanity by the UNESCO. This tour will give you an insight into local food, and your personal chef will share tips and recommendations. You will be dropped off at your hotel at the end of the tour.
strTitle: Private Cooking Master Class of Mexican Gourmet Cuisine and Markets Tour in Cancun

strIntroduction:
See the famed archaeological site of Tulum from two perspectives–by land and by sea–during this private, full-day tour from Cancun. Take a personalized tour of the ancient Maya ruins, then head out into the Caribbean Sea for a snorkeling adventure on the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef. For lunch, travel to a traditional Mexican 'rancho' in the heart of the rain forest. Sample regional specialties at the ranch as you get a feeling for what modern Maya life is like. Round-trip, private transport from your hotel is included.

Between 8am-9am, meet your personal guide in the lobby of your Cancun hotel. With just you and your party, travel by private vehicle to the famous Tulum ruins — a UNESCO-listed World Heritage Site. Explore the ancient city–the only Maya ruins located on a beach–and imagine what life was like for the Maya who lived there centuries ago. Learn about structures like The Castle and the Temple of Frescoes from your guide before seeing the ruins as the ancient Maya did when they arrived into port: by boat.

Admire Tulum from your new viewpoint out at sea as you depart for a few hours of snorkeling on the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef. Using the provided snorkeling gear, paddle through the clear waters to see a large variety of tropical fish and other marine life in their natural habitat. 

Cap off your tour with a visit to a Maya rancho (ranch) located deep in the rain forest. Sit down to a buffet lunch with dishes typical of the region like cochinita pibil (spicy pork), nopales (cactus), and guacamole. Say farewell to your guide at the end of 8 hours, when you are dropped back off at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Tulum Land and Sea with Snorkeling and Lunch in Mayan Ranch

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a day trip to two must-see pyramids: Coba and Chichen Itza. This unique full-day tour will give you the chance to see two very important archaeological zones in Yucatan. Lunch plus a visit to breathtaking Ik Kil cenote is also included, as well as pickup and drop-off from hotels in Tulum and Riviera Maya.

Your tour begins with hotel pickup between 8- 8:30am in Tulum or Riviera Maya. You will board a vehicle and head to visit the temples of one of the most impressive archaeological sites of the Maya culture, Coba.

Coba in Maya means “water stirred by wind” and it is an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. You can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. If you feel more adventurous, you can climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula Nohuch Mul (“large mound”) and get a breathtaking view as a reward. 

Then you will board a vehicle and drive to Chichen Itza to arrive at around 12:30pm. To avoid the heat first you will visit the 'Sacred Blue Cenote' of Ik Kil ("place of the winds"), where you can swim in the waters of this natural well inside a cave covered with lush vegetation. Then, you will enjoy a buffet lunch at the cenote's restaurant. 

The culmination of the tour will be visiting to the legendary Chichen Itza. You will explore the site with your guide and stay there for about 2 to 3 hours without the crowds. Chichén Itzá was a center of commercial and religious power and is considered one of the most important vestiges of pre-Hispanic culture. See its main landmarks, including El Castillo.

You will leave Chichen Itza at around 4:00pm and arrive in Tulum or Riviera Maya between 6-7pm.
strTitle: Private Coba and Chichen Itza Ruins with Lunch and Cenote Ik Kil Swim from Tulum

strIntroduction:
A full-day tour that will give you the chance to see two very important archaeological sites in Yucatan. Coba and Chichen Itza. 
Your tour begins with hotel pickup around 08.00 a.m. Arrival to Coba around 9:00 am, just before the heat. 

After a great time here, your driver will be waiting to take you to the 'Sacred Blue Cenote' of Ik Kil (place of the winds). Then a delicious lunch will be awaiting at an authentic restaurant supporting Maya families. Around 1pm you will be driven to one of the seven wonders in the World: Chichen Itza

Hotel pickup at 8am in Playa del Carmen. Arrival to Coba will be around 9:00 am.  Coba in Maya means “water stirred by wind” and it is an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. You can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. If you feel more adventurous, you can climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula Nohuch Mul (“large mound”) and get a breathtaking view as a reward.  

After a great time here, your driver will be waiting to take you to the 'Sacred Blue Cenote' of Ik Kil where you can swim in the waters of this natural well inside a cave covered with lush vegetation. Then, you will enjoy a buffet lunch at the cenote's restaurant. 

After lunch, you will head to visit one of the seven wonders of the world, the most important and impressive archaeological site of the Maya culture - Chichen Itza.  You will explore the site with your guide and stay there for about 2 to 3 hours. Chichén Itzá was a center of commercial and religious power and is considered one of the most important vestiges of pre-Hispanic culture. See its main landmarks, including El Castillo. 
Arrival to Playa del Carmen will be around 6:30pm.
strTitle: Private Day Trip: Coba, Chichen Itza and Ik Kil Cenote from Playa del Carmen

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a unique and one-of-a-kind tour in Cancun by visiting famous Market 23 (Mercado 23) and Market 28 (Mercado 28). You will be guided by a professional chef and enjoy lunch. The tour is limited to 12 people, ensuring a small-group atmosphere. The tour is guided by a professional chef with years of experience working in one of the best restaurants in Cancun.

After hotel pickup, meet your professional guide and a personal chef at Mercado 23 (Market 23) and start your tour by walking through the market and choosing the ingredients for a Mexican gourmet lunch, which you will prepare later.

As you explore Market 23, your guide will share with you the origin and history of the local ingredients you see around. After getting all the ingredients for lunch, you will head to a restaurant where you will take part in a lunch cooking class. Here, you will learn about some authentic cooking techniques and then enjoy a delicious lunch right there. After lunch, enjoy free time at Market 28 (Mercado 28) which is famous for its huge variety of souvenirs and low prices.

In November 2010 Mexican gastronomy was recognized as Immaterial Patrimony of the Humanity by the UNESCO, This tour will give you an insight into local food and your guide will share tips and recommendations. You will be dropped-off at your hotel at the end of the tour.
strTitle: Mexican Gourmet Cuisine and Markets Tour Plus Cooking Class

strIntroduction:
Get to know the culture of Mexico by taking part in a unique experience: a 4-hour Mayan 'temazcal' ceremony, led by an authentic shaman. For the Mayan people, this ritual in the 'home of hot stones' was a source of health and energy. Learn about the power of volcanic stones and the aromas of herbs as you are guided by a shaman through four stages of purification. After finding peace and relaxation, kick back in a hammock with a light dinner of tropical fruits and natural drinks. Upgrade for a private experience including round-trip hotel transport from Tulum.

Meet your guide in your hotel lobby (for the private tour) or at the meeting point in Tulum (for the shared tour) between 4pm-5pm to begin this truly unique experience. Head to the "hot stone house," the lodge where the temazcal ceremony takes place. Listen to an introductory talk from the temazcalero guide, who will answer questions, then participate in a salute around the fire.

After a small cleaning ceremony with copal (resin) and aromatic herbs, enter the temazcal and feel the heat of the volcanic rocks as their red light glows in the darkness. Breathe in the aromas of herbs and copal as your body is purified of physical and energetic toxins. Be guided through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat by the temazcalero using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera, and refreshing teas. Enjoy the ceremony's curative powers as you listen to live singing accompanied by musical instruments.

After the session in the temazcal (during which you can leave the room or ask the shaman to increase/reduce the heat at any time), refresh by taking a cold bath. Then kick back in a hammock and have a light snack of fresh, seasonal fruit and natural beverages. The tour concludes with a drop off back at your hotel or the meeting point in Tulum.
strTitle: Private or Shared Mayan Temazcal Ritual from Tulum
