strTitle: Private or Small-Group Temazcal Maya Ritual from Playa del Carmen

strIntroduction:
An unique experience to celebrate the union of your souls forever in a Mayan sacred ceremony, in a ritual lead by a shaman. An ancient mayan tradition full of mysticism and a deep spiritual meaning. The ceremony can be done in the heart of the rainforest near a cenote which the Mayan people considered sacred or on a beautiful beach. 

The ceremony can be done in the heart of the rainforest near a cenote which the Mayan people considered sacred or on a beautiful beach. Both magical locations, where only nature will be the witness of the union of two souls guided by a shaman.

Under the wonderful sounds of nature, a tiny footpath will guide the happy couple to start the ritual  evoking the 4 cardinal points asking for permission and blessings and asking the sky , mother earth, and superior beings to consolidate and strengthen their love in the coming years.

The ceremony is accompanied by copal incense smoke that purifies the environment and is complemented by songs, drums, flutes and traditional Mayan dances.

This is a non-religious, symbolic ceremony without legal value . It’s a ritual where two souls undertake spiritually and share this wonderful experience surrounded by a magical setting.
strTitle: Symbolic Mayan Wedding Ceremony from Tulum

strIntroduction:
Visit several of the Mayan culture's most significant archaeological sites on this full-day tour with a small group. Go to the biosphere reserve of Sian Ka'an, a UNESCO-listed World Heritage Site, and soak in the beauty of the Muyil ruins located there; then explore Tulum. Enjoy a traditional Mexican buffet lunch before spending the afternoon at Coba; an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. Climb the tallest pyramid on the Mayan peninsula before being returned to your Playa del Carmen hotel in the early evening.

Get picked up from your Playa del Carmen hotel at 8am, then drive for about 90 minutes to the UNESCO-listed World Heritage Site of Sian Ka´an biosphere. See birds, butterflies, and abundant wildlife as you arrive at the Muyil ruins around 10:30am with your small group. Small and lush, the ancient site was an important religious center dedicated to the Mayan moon goddess.

Next, drive for 35 minutes to arrive at Tulum around noon. Explore the archaeological site considered to be the most beautiful icon of the Mayan culture in the Mexican Caribbean. Enjoy spectacular views of the ruins on the white-sand beaches. 

Relax for an hour over a buffet lunch of traditional Mexican dishes, then continue your archaeological experience at Coba; an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes, and cenotes. Walk under the trees and observe exotic birds and other animals, and climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula for beautiful panoramic views.

The tour concludes around 5pm, when you're delivered back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour to Muyil, Tulum, and Coba from Playa del Carmen

strIntroduction:
Visit several of the Mayan culture's most significant archaeological sites on this private, full-day tour. Go to the biosphere reserve of Sian Ka'an, a UNESCO-listed World Heritage Site, and soak in the beauty of the Muyil ruins located there; then explore Tulum. Enjoy a traditional Mexican buffet lunch before spending the afternoon at Coba; an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. Climb the tallest pyramid on the Mayan peninsula before being returned to your Tulum hotel in the early evening.

This action-packed day of visits to three of the most important archaeological sites on the Yucatan Peninsula begins with a pickup from your Tulum hotel at 8am. Board a comfortable, air-conditioned minivan and drive for about 30 minutes to the UNESCO-listed World Heritage Site of Sian Ka´an biosphere.

Follow your private guide and keep your eyes out for birds, butterflies, and other abundant wildlife during a short walk to the Muyil ruins located in the reserve. Small and lush, the ancient site of Muyil was an important religious center dedicated to the Mayan moon goddess.

Continue to the restored ruins of Tulum, the archaeological site considered to be the most beautiful icon of the Mayan culture in the Mexican Caribbean. Enjoy spectacular views of the ruins on the white-sand beaches, and relax over a buffet lunch of traditional Mexican dishes. After lunch, drive to Coba; an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes, and cenotes. Walk under the trees and observe exotic birds and other animals, and climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula for beautiful panoramic views.

The tour concludes around 6pm, when you're delivered back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour to Muyil Ruins, Tulum, and Coba from Tulum

strIntroduction:
You will visit three of the most important archaeological sites of the Mayan culture: the Muyil ruins, Tulum and Coba.

You will be picked up at 8am and will head to Muyil. This incredible archaeological site is located on the mainland side of a lagoon in the Sian Ka´an Biosphere.

Muyil, is considered the largest ancient Maya site within the reserve. This site, where numerous subterranean chambers have been found, has a very different feel from other Mayan sites. Muyil was an important religious center on the Caribbean dedicated to Mayan moon goddess.
Imagine a walk down with birds, butterflies and abundant wildlife in the Sian Ka´an biosphere and feel yourself a real explorer of these virgin trails.

After Muyil you will be driven to Tulum, the archeological site that is considered as an icon of the Mayan culture in the Mexican Caribbean and the most beautiful of the Yucatan Peninsula. This ruin site is the only one located on the beaches of the Caribbean. You will enjoy the spectacular views of this place. Get the most incredible pictures of your trip at this unique place.

We will have a break to have a delicious Mexican lunch.

After lunch this archeological experience will continiue at Coba.

Coba is an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rainforest, lakes and cenotes. You can walk under the trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. You will be able to climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula called “Nohuch Mul” (Great Mound) and get a breathtaking view as a reward.

You will be back to your hotel around 6:30pm.
strTitle: Private Tour to Muyil Ruins, Tulum and Coba from Cancun

strIntroduction:
You will visit two of the most important archaeological sites of the Maya culture. Coba, the tallest Maya pyramid surrounded by rainforest, lakes and cenotes, and Tulum, an icon of the Maya culture in the Mexican Caribbean and the most beautiful of the Yucatan Peninsula.

The culmination of this tour will be a unique and amazing experience of the ancient Maya Civilization, a ceremony in the "home of hot stones" with a real shaman. Temazcal is a unique opportunity to get to know the culture of Mexico closely.

Your tour starts in Coba that in Maya means “water stirred by wind” and it is an ancient Maya Urban Center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. Visit the temples of one of the most impressive archaeological sites of the Maya culture. Then you can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. If you feel more adventurous, you can climb the tallest pyramid in the Peninsula “Nohuch Mul” (“large mound”) and get a breathtaking view as a reward.

Then, you will be driven to Tulum, the archaeological site that is considered as an icon of the Maya culture in the Mexican Caribbean and the most beautiful of the Yucatan Peninsula. This ruin site is the only one located on the beaches of the Caribbean.  You will enjoy the spectacular views of this place. Get the most incredible pictures of your trip at this unique place.

To culminate the tour you will experience the Temazcal a Maya ritual considered a source of health and energy. After a small cleaning ceremony with the copal and aromatic herbs, you will enter the temazcal and start experiencing the heat of the volcanic rock and its red light in the darkness. The aroma of herbs and copal will give allow you to feel at ease, purify the body and create space to get rid of bad energies and purify intentions. Using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera and refreshing teas, the temazcalero will guide you through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat (by opening the door of the temazcal), and enjoy the curative powers along with songs and musical instruments. 

In any moment, you can leave the temazcal or ask the shaman to increase or reduce heat. This experience will allow you to find a space of positive and curative energies towards the body and spirit, as well as relaxation. All of this is done in a healthy and safe place. 

After the session in the temazcal, you can take a cold bath and then enjoy fresh fruit of the season and waters. Because of its interactive character, the length of the temazcal session varies, but it is usually 1.5 hours long.
strTitle: Private Coba, Tulum and Temazcal Combo Tour from Cancun

strIntroduction:
Visit two of the Mayan culture's most significant archaeological sites on this private, full-day tour. Go to Coba and climb the tallest pyramid on the Mayan peninsula; then explore Tulum, the archaeological site considered to be the most beautiful icon of the Mayan culture in the Mexican Caribbean. Enjoy a traditional buffet lunch before participating in a 'temazcal' purification ceremony led by an authentic shaman, then return to your hotel feeling relaxed and refreshed .

You day begins with a pickup from your Playa del Carmen hotel at 9am, where you'll board a comfortable, air-conditioned minivan and drive approximately 90 minutes to Coba: an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes, and cenotes (naturally formed, underground swimming pools). Walk under the shade of tall trees and observe exotic birds and animals on your way to some of the most impressive Mayan ruins on the Yucatan Peninsula. Climb the tallest pyramid on the peninsula, Nohoch Mul (“large mound” in the Mayan language) to be rewarded with sweeping panoramic views of the area.

Board the minivan for a short drive to Tulum, the archaeological site considered to be the most beautiful icon of the Mayan culture in the Mexican Caribbean. Enjoy spectacular views of the ruins on the white-sand beaches. Enjoy a buffet lunch of Mexican dishes typical of the region before participating in a Temazcal ceremony: a Mayan ritual that's considered by locals to be a source of health and energy. Head to the "hot stone house," the lodge where the temazcal ceremony takes place. Listen to an introductory talk from the temazcalero guide, who will answer questions, then participate in a salute around the fire. After a small cleaning ceremony with copal (resin) and aromatic herbs, enter the temazcal and feel the heat of the volcanic rocks as their red light glows in the darkness. Breathe in the aromas of herbs and copal as your body is purified of physical and energetic toxins. Be guided through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat by the temazcalero using aromatic herbs, mud, honey, aloe vera, and refreshing teas. Enjoy the ceremony's curative powers as you listen to live singing accompanied by musical instruments.

After the session in the temazcal (during which you can leave the room or ask the shaman to increase/reduce the heat at any time), refresh by taking a cold bath. Then kick back in a hammock and have a light snack of fresh, seasonal fruit and natural beverages. Because of its interactive character, the length of the temazcal session can vary, though it generally lasts about 90 minutes. Leave feeling refreshed, renewed, and filled with positive energy. The tour concludes with a drop off back at your hotel in Playa del Carmen.
strTitle: Private Coba, Tulum and Temazcal Combo Tour from Playa de Carmen

strIntroduction:
Visit two of the most important archaeological sites of the Yucatán Peninsula on this private tour from Tulum. Get a personalized look at ancient Tulum on the Caribbean coast and climb the tallest Maya pyramid at Coba. Finish with a shaman-led purification ceremony inside a ‘temazcal' — a type of ancient Maya sweat lodge heated by hot stones. A buffet lunch and round-trip hotel transport are included.

After hotel pickup in Tulum, you’re whisked away by private vehicle to Coba, meaning ‘water stirred by wind’ in the Mayan language. Take a personalized tour of this ancient urban center surrounded by rainforest, lakes, and cenotes. Walk under the trees and observe birds and other wildlife. View the temples of one of the most impressive Maya archaeological sites and, if you feel more adventurous, climb the tallest pyramid in the Yucatán Peninsula: Nohoch Muul. A view from the jungle canopy will be your reward.

Next, you’re driven to the Tulum ruins, perched above a white-sand beach on the Mexican Caribbean. Stroll the restored grounds with your guide and learn the significance of structures such as El Castillo.

After a buffet lunch is served, participate in a shaman-led Maya ritual in a temazcal, a sweat lodge that is considered a source of health and energy. After a cleansing ceremony, you will enter the temazcal and feel the heat of the volcanic rock glowing in the darkness. The aroma of herbs and copal allow you to feel at ease, purify the body, and create space to rid the spirit of negative energy.

Using mud, honey, aloe vera, and refreshing teas, as well as songs and musical instruments, the temazcalero guides you through four intervals of increasing and decreasing heat by opening the door of the temazcal, allowing you to experience its curative powers.

Following your 1.5-hour session, take a cold plunge and bite into fresh fruit, then relax on the return to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Coba, Tulum and Temazcal Tour from Tulum

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a day trip to two must-see pyramids: Chichen Itza and Coba. This unique full-day tour will give you the chance to see two very important archaeological zones in Yucatan. Lunch plus a visit to breathtaking Ik Kil cenote is also included, as well as pickup and drop-off from hotels in Cancun and Riviera Maya.

Your tour begins with hotel pickup early in Cancun or Riviera Maya. You will board a vehicle and drive to Chichen Itza to arrive at around 9:30am, just before the crowds and heat. You will explore the site with your guide and stay there for about 2 to 3 hours. Chichén Itzá was a center of commercial and religious power and is considered one of the most important vestiges of pre-Hispanic culture. See its main landmarks, including El Castillo. After a great time here, your driver will be waiting to take you to the 'Sacred Blue Cenote' of Ik Kil ("place of the winds), where you can swim in the waters of this natural well inside a cave covered with lush vegetation. Then, you will enjoy a buffet lunch at the cenote's restaurant.
After lunch, you will head to visit the temples of one of the most impressive archaeological sites of the Maya culture, Coba. Coba in Maya means “water stirred by wind” and it is an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. You can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. If you feel more adventurous, you can climb the tallest pyramid in the Mayan Peninsula Nohuch Mul (“large mound”) and get a breathtaking view as a reward.
You will leave Coba at about 4:30pm and arrive in Cancun around 6:30pm.
strTitle: Private Chichen Itza and Coba Ruins with Lunch and Cenote Ik Kil Swim  from Cancun

strIntroduction:
In November 2010, the Mexican gastronomy was recognized as Immaterial Patrimony of the Humanity by the UNESCO.

It’s a short adventure through the jungles to a private ranch where you can feel the exotic atmosphere, silence and touch of ancient time. This tour is including your own participation in cooking master class and tasty lunch by a special ancient menu.

This culinary tour will take you back to ancient times. You will know about cuisine of different Indian tribes such as the- Maya, Azteca, Toltec, Zapotec, Mixtec. Traditions of Indian cuisine brought to the world such products as chile, tomatoe, cacao, vaina of vanilla, corn.

During this tour you will see traditional Mexican utensils, like a molcajete- Indian mortar with the pestle, made of stone; metate- stone to mill used for the processing of the seeds. You will prepare some of the dishes using “Fogon”, the main detail of ancient kitchen, “comal”- king of cooking, till our time at Mexican’s villages using it to prepare handmade tortillas. With the chef you will learn to prepare original Mexican tortillas and fill them with Oaxaca cheese and grasshoppers, as well as salbutes or panuchos – different types of tortillas filled with beans (friijol), cheese, corn, chicken, pork pieces and onion.

You will learn about traditions, food, Mexican products and techniques, flavors, chiles, etc., you will be able to try authentic prehispanic food and Maya Cuisine.
strTitle: Pre-Hispanic Cooking Class in Tulum

strIntroduction:
Get up close and personal with the beautiful whale sharks during their annual visit to Quintana Roo. Whale sharks are the largest fish species in the world and can grow up to 65 feet long. On this tour from Tulum you’ll ride to Cancun and then be taken out to sea where you’ll have the privilege to see and swim with these gentle giants. Beverages, snacks and a meal of freshly prepared ceviche will be provided.

The adventure begins with an early morning pickup from your Tulum hotel (private option).  Small group tours will be picked up from the San Francisco grocery store. Your driver will transport you to Cancun. From there, you will take a boat ride to the waters surrounding Isla Mujeres, Contoy and Holbox. This is the area where whale sharks come to feed on plankton and where the Caribbean Sea meets the Gulf of Mexico. 
Once you spot the whale sharks, you will get ready to swim in pairs, accompanied by a guide. Your guide will instruct you on the best way to swim with the whale sharks.

The trip ends with a light meal of delicious, fresh ceviche prepared right before your eyes. Then you will return to the port to board the transportation back to the hotels.
strTitle: Whale Shark Tour from Tulum

strIntroduction:
Have an unforgettable day as you and your loved one renew their vows in beautiful Riviera Maya at a private villa by the sea. This symbolic wedding ceremony in Cancun is to become the most romantic experience of your trip to Mexico. Your package includes a professional wedding photographer, natural flowers decoration, romantic music, ceremony coordinator services and more.

Close your eyes and imagine how the perfect wedding on the beach should look like: turquoise sea, white sand and magnificent cliff next to the small lake. This and much more you can find in a private location designed especially for a unique and romantic experience as you renew your vows.

Your vows renewal package includes private transport from your hotel in Cancun and all the luxury and privacy to make this an unforgettable occasion. The day after your arrival to Cancun or Riviera Maya, a wedding coordinator will reconfirm all the details and establish the timetable of the ceremony.

The location will be especially designed for the wedding ceremony with natural flowers and unique details. There is a room for the bride to get ready and you will have a wedding planner with you before and after to make sure everything is set the way you want to. The bride will be given a bouquet and the groom will get a buttonhole. There will be professional music playing during the ceremony and champagne and fresh fruits will be served for the couple.

You and your loved one will also receive a gift certificate to commemorate this special day. You will get photographs taken by a professional photographer and leave with memories to keep.
strTitle: Vows Renewal Package in Cancun and Professional Photographer

strIntroduction:
During this private tour, you will see Mexico City's city center and its main sights. Afterwards, you will pay a visit to Teotihuacan and see the famous pyramids of the Sun and the Moon. The tour will end with a visit to The Basilica of our Lady of Guadalupe. Full day excursion. Lunch is not included.

Mexico City is a city of contrasts, the largest metropolis in the world.  The private tour begins with a sightseeing trip around the city center, including a visit of the Plaza of Constitucion or Zocalo, the political center of the country. Observe the Cathedral and the National Palace with the famous murals of Mexican artist Diego Rivera and Templo Mayor. You will see also The Palace of Fine Arts.

Next, you will pass on the most beautiful street in Mexico City, Paseo de la Reforma, which is famous for a huge number of monuments and memorials, the most impressive is the monument of Angel of Independence.

After the city tour, you will discover the city "Where men become Gods". See the famous pyramids of the Moon and the Ketzalkoatl, climb the highest pyramid in Mexico, Pyramid of the Sun (64 meters) to enjoy the "alien" landscape view from a height.

Then you will visit the Basilica of our Lady of Guadalupe before returning to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour of Mexico City, Teotihuacan Pyramids and Lady of Guadalupe Cathedral

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this private tour in Mexico City and see the colorful and exotic ethnic markets in Mexico. Then, visit “Garibaldi Square” famous for the Mariachis and visit the Tequila and Mezcal Museum where you'll get a tasting. You'll also ride on a trajinera in Xochimilco. Your tour includes transport and a professional guide.

The tour begins with a visit to one of the most famous, colorful and exotic ethnic markets in  Mexico. Here you will see a variety of fruits and vegetables, real Mexican products and all the different kinds of chiles, and if you wish, you can taste traditional Mexican dishes and natural fruit juices and water.

Then, you will go to “Garibaldi Square” famous for the Mariachis.  There a welcome Margarita cocktail will be waiting for while you become familiar with the processes of production of tequila and mezcal - beverages that glorified Mexico to the world. The museum's collection consists of more than 300 bottles - they are different in appearance, shape and color, but based on the tasting, you will understand the tequila, distinguished by its appearance and endurance.

Next visit will be to the floating gardens of Xochimilco, located in the south of Mexico City. Floating island (chinampas) were built by the Aztecs in the middle of Lake Xochimilco to cultivate flowers and vegetables, to be delivered to the city on the flat boats called - trajineras. Today Xochimilco canals are popular for mexicans to celebrate or just to have a picknic with family or friends accompained by mariachis or marimba.

During the tour in Xochimilco, you can try the typical Mexican cuisine, and buy souvenirs directly from the trajineras. Your tour ends with hotel drop-off.
strTitle: Private Tour in Mexico City: Ethnic Markets, Tequila and Mezcal Museum and Xochimilco

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a private day trip to the colonial city of Taxco that is situated in the mountains in the very heart of the country. You'll then visit Xochicalco that in nahuatl language means “Place of flowers”. Both of these places have been declared World Heritage sites by UNESCO and you'll get to see and admire each. Your tour includes a guide and transport.

After hotel pickup, the first half of the excursion will take place in the colonial city of Taxco. You will board a private vehicle and start driving there. Taxco is situated in the mountains in the very heart of the country. It was declared a World Heritage city by the UNESCO. Thanks to strict building laws, new buildings have to preserve the same Spanish baroque architecture style to keep the atmosphere of the past.

You'll walk around the and admire its colonial style, such as the Temple of Santa Prisca, a church of more than 250 years old, built in the New World Baroque style that is an icon of the town. Learn from your guide about why it is the oldest mining center of the continent and how its silver mines have existed since the colonization. Today, in almost every corner of the town there are shops where you can buy silver jewelry produced in the region.

You will then head to Xochicalco that in nahuatl language means “Place of flowers.” This is also a World Heritage city, declared by the UNESCO. The most emblematic building in this ancient ceremonial center is the Temple of the feathered Snake because of the recognized reliefs of the ancient Mesoamerica. The Acropolis is also located here. You'll also see the astronomical observatory that was built to study the movement of the sun. Inside this observatory, a hallway and a large chamber with more than eight meters, allows the penetration of sun rays projecting on the floor of the cave a hexagon.

After exploring these two wonderful places, you will be dropped-off back at your Mexico City hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Taxco and Xochicalco Day Trip from Mexico City

strIntroduction:
Visit Teotihuacan and Tula, two legendary cities of Mesoamerica on a private, full-day tour from Mexico City. Teotihuacan is also called City of the Gods and contains the remains of the Aztec Empire. In Tula, you will be amazed by the big stone sculpture of warriors, known as “Atlantes," from the Toltec Empire. Your tour includes private transport and a professional guide.

Begin with pickup from your Mexico City hotel at 8am. Board the private vehicle and begin the 1.5-hour drive to Teotihuacan, also called “City of the Gods.” Your guide will take you around Teotihuacan, which contains some of the most important ruins from Mesoamerica. You will be amazed with the beautiful buildings and the mysteries of the Pyramids. Take a walk on the 'Avenue of the Dead' and the buildings that surround it. This avenue is the backbone that connects the Pyramid of the Moon, Pyramid of the Sun and other buildings. Climb up 210 feet (64 meters) to the Pyramid of the Sun, the tallest pyramid in Mexico and enjoy the panoramic views. According to the legends of the city, you can make a wish at the top! 

Then, travel to the ancient capital of the Toltec Empire — Tula, where you will be amazed by the big stone sculptures of Toltec warriors called “Atlantes.” These statues sit atop of the Temple of Tlahuizcalpantecutli, also known as “Temple of Morning Star." With your guide, explore other parts of the ancient capital like the “Burned Palace" and the ruins of a court used for a ball game.

This tour is private to ensure personalized attention while visiting some of the most historically rich sites in Mexico. All entrances fees are included. Food and drink is not included. The tour ends after approximately 10 hours with drop-off back at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Teotihuacana and Tula Archaeological Sites from Mexico City

strIntroduction:
Visit Ek Balam and Chichen Itza on this private day trip from Playa del Carmen. You'll get to see the main buildings of these important archaeological sites and then swim in the refreshing waters of a cenote. You'll end the tour visiting a tequila factory where you'll get to learn about the process and taste this famous, Mexican drink. Your tour includes a private guide and transport.

You'll be picked up from your hotel in Playa del Carmen and head to the archaeological site, lost in the jungle, of Ek Balam. Its name is translated from the Mayan language "black jaguar" and you'll get to see the mysterious sculptures ("angels") guarding the entrance as well as the Palace, the Observatory, the ball game court and much more.

You'll then visit Chichen Itza which is considered one of the "New 7th Wonders of the World" and one of the last cities of Maya civilization. Enjoy this complex full of  knowledge and beauty and see the Pyramid of Kukulkan, the Temple of Warriors, the Temple of the Jaguars, the Observatory and more. Later, head to a cenote and swim in it surrounded by exotic plants and magical singing of wild birds. Cenote water is often very clear, as the water comes from rain water filtering slowly through the ground, and therefore contains very little suspended particulate matter.

To end the tour, visit to tequila faсtory where you can see the tequila production process and taste this wonderful drink.  At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Day Trip: Ek Balam and Chichen Itza with Cenote and Tequila Factory

strIntroduction:
Ek Balam is an archaeological that blends elements from several Maya architectural styles while Chichen Itza is one of the "New 7th Wonders of the World".  You'll visit both of these places plus a beautiful cenote on this private tour. Then, you'll head to a tequila faсtory where you can taste  and see the production process of this very Mexican product. 

You will be picked up from your hotel in Tulum and head to Ek Balam, an archaeological site that blends elements from several Maya architectural styles. Learn from your guide about this once very important city. You will be able to admire the entrance to the tomb of an important king, which resembles the mouth of a snake and see mysterious sculptures in human shapes, with wings on their backs. You'll also see incredible buildings like the Palace, the Observatory, the ball game court and much more.

Later you will visit an archaeological site full of  knowledge and beauty: Chichen Itza. It is considered a cultural Heritage of Humanity and one of the last cities of Maya civilization. See the Pyramid of Kukulkan, the Temple of Warriors, and the world's largest golf ball Pok Ta Pok, the Temple of the Jaguars, the Observatory and other buildings of the city.

After this interesting experience, swim in a beautiful cenote surrounded by exotic plants and magical singing of wild birds. Especially associated with the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico, cenotes were sometimes used by the ancient Maya for sacrificial offering. Finally, visit a tequila faсtory where you can see the tequila production process and taste this wonderful drink.
 
At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Chichen Itza, Ek Balam Cenote and Tequila Factory from Tulum

strIntroduction:
Visit the most important ancient Mayan towns in the Yucatan Peninsula including Chichen Itza and Uxmal, as well as the capital of Yucatan: Merida. Swim in the crystal waters of Ik-KIl cenote, learn about cacao-making process and the colonial lifestyle. This tour will allow you to b become a real expert in the Maya culture in only 2 days.

Day 1: Cancun - Chichen Itza - Merida (B) (L) After breakfast, you will head to Chichen Itza, the most important aMayan site in Mexico. Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the new 7 Wonders of the World, you will be able to explore this place. You will find advanced archaeoastronomic knowledge in this city as you visit its main landmarks with your guide. Visit the pyramid known as the "The Castle" or temple of Kukulcan , the largest ballgame court of the Mesoamerica, the skulls temple, the Jaguar’s temple and the Observatory. Then, head to the beautiful Cenote (sinkhole) of Ik-kil, where you will be able to swim in. You will then enjoy lunch and head to Merida where you will spend the night. Day 2: Merida - Uxmal - Cancun (B) (L) After breakfast, you will enjoy a city tour of Merida, known as "the white city". During the tour, you will enjoy a panoramic view of Montejo Avenue, the monument to Motherland, the Main Square, the Cathedral and Government Palace. You will then depart to Uxmal, “the three times built”, to see the place and learn all about the Guesser Pyramid, the Quadrangle of the Nuns, Governor’s Palace and the ballgame court. Then you will have lunch and head back to Cancun where your adventure ends.
strTitle: Private 2 Day Yucatan Peninsula Highlights Tour Chichen Itza Ik-kil Merida and Uxmal

strIntroduction:
Ek Balam translated from the Mayan language as black jaguar, is a well-preserved Maya City which you'll get to visit on this private tour. See its main buildings and then see flocks of pink flamingos in their sanctuary in the Gulf Coast. Finally, go tequila tasting at a factory. Your tour includes transport and a guide. 

You will be picked up early in the morning and head to visit the famous archaeological site, lost in the jungle - Ek Balam (translated from the Mayan language "black jaguar"). Here, you will see the mysterious "angels" sculptures who guard the entrance to the "kingdom of the dead" in the form of the mouth of a rattlesnake. From the Preclassic until the Postclassic period, it was the seat of a Mayan kingdom. The site is noted for the preservation of the plaster on the tomb of Ukit-Kan-Lek-Tok, a king buried in the side of the largest pyramid.

Then, you will visit the Gulf Coast to ride in a small boat in one of the most beautiful nature reserves of the Yucatan Peninsula. Sailing mangroves, you'll watch a reserve of birds in their natural habitat. You will see the Cayman crocodiles, and you will watch flocks of pink flamingos in their sanctuary. After a walk around the park a natural spa will be waiting for you.

The culmination of the tour will be visiting of tequila factory where you can see the tequila production process and taste this wonderful drink.
At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ek Balam, Pink Flamingos Sanctuary and Tequila Tasting Factory from Cancun

strIntroduction:
Walls, pyramids, sculptures, friezes and stelae will show you the artistry of Maya architecture in Ek Balam. An ancient Maya city, which you'll visit and get to see the twin pyramids temple, the Pok-Ta-Pok playground and more. Then, see flocks of pink flamingos in their sanctuary in the Gulf Coast and top-off your tour with a tasting at a tequila factory. Your tour includes a guide, transport and entrance fees.

After hotel pickup, head to Ek Balam, an ancient city that knew its glory before Chichen Itza. You'll see the mysterious sculptures in human shapes, with wings on their backs as well as the Palace, the Observatory, the ball game (pok ta pok)  court and much more.

Then, in the Gulf Coast, you'll board a small boat to one of the most beautiful nature reserves of the Yucatan Peninsula. Some shallow lakes and high concentration of salts that are next to other lakes is the home of the only colony of pink flamingos in the north hemisphere. This biosphere is home to a large variety of wildlife species. You will see the Cayman crocodiles, birds in their natural habitat and the experience of  a natural spa.

To end the tour, you will visit a tequila faсtory where you can see the tequila production process and taste this wonderful drink. At the end of the tour you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ek Balam, Pink Flamingos Sanctuary and Tequila Tasting Factory from Playa del Carmen or Tulum

strIntroduction:
Coba in Maya means “water stirred by wind” and it is an ancient Mayan urban center surrounded by rain forest, lakes and cenotes. Just in Tulum you will get the most beautiful photos of all your vacation. This private tour includes transport and a professional guide.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Cancun, Playa del Carmen or Tulum and head to the ancient Maya city lost in the rainforest known as Coba. Here, you will enjoy a guided tour and learn the history of this place. Then, you have a chance to climb the highest pyramid of the Yucatan Peninsula (42 meters) which offers a breathtaking view of the jungle. You can also ride a bicycle or rickshaw on the untouched jungle, where hidden ancient temples with hieroglyphs of the Maya Civilization lie. 

You can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. After this visit, head to the archaeological site of Tulum where you'll also have a guided tour and be amazed at the stunning views of the Caribbean coast. Here, you have the opportunity to take the best pictures of one of the most beautiful places in Mexico and in the world. After the tour, you will have a delicious lunch and then head back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Tour: Coba and Tulum with Lunch from Cancun or Riviera Maya

strIntroduction:
Your guide and photographer will tell you all about two of the most important archaeological sites in the Peninsula of Yucatan, Coba and Tulum. You also will have the opportunity to get professional and unexpected pictures of all your trip. Your private tour includes lunch and transport.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Cancun, Riviera Maya or Tulum and head to the ruins of Coba. Your guide will not only tell you about these two amazing archaeological sites but he will also take the best pictures of your best moments in the tour.

You will be driven to Coba, an ancient Maya city lost in the rain forest and enjoy a guided tour here. Then, you'll have the chance to climb the highest pyramid of the Yucatan Peninsula (42 meters) and admire breathtaking views of the jungle. You can also ride a bicycle or rickshaw on the untouched jungle, where hidden ancient temples of the Maya Civilization lie. You can walk under the tall trees and observe exotic birds and other animals that live there. During this time, your guide/photographer will take pictures of you and your group so you can just enjoy.

Then, you'll head to Tulum and will be amazed at the stunning views of the Caribbean coast. Learn all about this archaeological site and have your photographer take the best pictures of you in such a pretty place. You will then enjoy a delicious lunch and then head back to your hotel. You will take all pictures with you in a USB drive.
strTitle: Private Tour: Coba and Tulum with Photographer and Lunch from Cancun or Riviera Maya

strIntroduction:
Swim and snorkel with the largest fish in the world — the whale shark — on this seasonal tour. Head out toward Isla Mujeres, Contoy, and Holbox by boat, where these gentle giants feed on plankton from May to September. You have the convenience of hotel pickup and drop-off in Cancun, plus your choice of a small-group or a private tour with your own companion or group.

Your tour begins with hotel pickup in Cancun and the Riviera Maya by air-conditioned minivan. From the pier, you will take a boat ride to the clear offshore waters surrounding Isla Mujeres, Contoy, and Holbox, where the Caribbean Sea meets the Gulf of Mexico and whale sharks come to feed on plankton during the months of May to September.

The boat capacity is limited to a maximum of 10 passengers, allowing for a small-group experience with certified guides — naturalists and biologists who explain everything about the whale sharks and their habitat. Alternatively, opt for a private tour for 2–6 travelers and receive even more personalized attention.

On arrival at the site chosen by your guide, take advantage of the remarkable opportunity to swim up close to the world's largest fish. Splash into the water, snap on your provided snorkel gear, and explore this area teeming with sea life. Prior to your excursion, you can request photos and videos, available for purchase.

After this trip of a lifetime, you will be taken back to your hotel in Cancun or the Riviera Maya.
strTitle: Whale Shark Swim Adventure in Cancun

strIntroduction:
On this private tour, you'll visit Ek Balam, an ancient Maya city that knew its glory before Chichen Itza. You'll also see the sanctuary of pink flamingos, a landscape with a beauty and colorful hard to believe. Enjoy these two wonderful places accompanied by a professional photographer guide who'll capture all your special moments so you can take them with you at the end of the tour. Your private day trip includes transport and entrance fees.

Your tour begins with early hotel pickup in the morning. Your guide not only will tell you about Ek Balam and Río lagartos but will also catch your best moments during the trip.

First, you'll visit Ek Balam. Lost in the jungle, this place has the mysterious "angels" sculptures who guard the entrance to the "kingdom of the dead" in the form of the mouth of a rattlesnake. See the main buildings of this archaeological site and learn from your guide about the most recent restoration work done. Your photographer guide will take the best pictures of you and your group so you don't have to worry about this and simply enjoy the place.

Then, head into the Gulf Coast and take a boat ride to one of the most beautiful nature reserves of the Yucatan Peninsula. Sailing mangroves, you'll watch a reserve of birds in their natural habitat, you will see the Cayman crocodiles, and after a walk around, you will be able to experience a natural spa. Your photographer and you will choose the best shots here as well.

Once done, you'll be dropped-off back at your hotel and take a USB with all the pictures taken during the tour to take unforgettable moments with you.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ek Balam and Pink Flamingoes Sanctuary with Photographer from Cancun, Tulum or Riviera Maya

strIntroduction:
The annual Monarch butterfly migration is one of nature’s great spectacles and a top attraction for visitors to Mexico’s central highlands. From 60 million to one billion Monarch butterflies goes from eastern Canada to central Mexico for more than 2,500 miles. The Monarch butterflies spend their winter hibernation clustered in small areas of the Monarch Butterfly Biosphere Reserve.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Mexico City in the morning and go to the Reserve “El Rosario”. Every year Monarch butterfly travel around 3200 miles to spend the winter in the forests of Michoacan which for this period when these amazing insects are there, forests turn into orange color. Butterflies arrival occurs at the beginning of November when Mexico celebrates the Day of the Dead and mexicans believe that these butterflies are the souls of the dead.

Also during the tour, you will walk or ride a horse along the coniferous forest to the top of the hill, where the Butterfly Valley lies. Become a witness of this amazing natural phenomenon only from November to March. Do not miss the opportunity to join us in this amazing journey.
strTitle: Private Tour to the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary from Mexico City

strIntroduction:
A magical journey in Huatulco. Enjoy the pristine atmosphere, take a refreshing swim in the clear lagoon waters, and indulge in a waterfall massage.

Visit La Gloria coffee plantation, built over 100 years ago. Explore the grounds and learn about local coffee production and the rich history of this world-class organic coffee.

A set of 30 waterfalls, the largest 20 meters high, formed waterfalls Copalitilla. About an hour from Huatulco is an ideal place to spend the day swimming in the natural pools that form, while cycling or taking long walks. In the area of the waterfalls there are also caves and tunnels to explore; and a wide variety of flora and fauna. It is an excellent destination for ecotourism.

The Llano Grande waterfall is part of the Copalita River, the Copalitilla.

You will be gone a full day. The falls are just amazing!! There are places to swim and cool off in the water. After your hike up to the falls you will find a coffee plantation and an awesome meal. The ride up and back is very bumpy – be prepared.
strTitle: Day Trip to Magical Watefalls and Coffee Plantation from Huatulco

strIntroduction:
Learn about the entire process of cultivating and transforming coffee beans into a delicious drink. Pluma Hidalgo is a small mountain village set in Oaxaca’s Sierra Madre. Just a 50 minutes car ride from downtown Huatulco out over the Pacific Ocean at an altitude of 1350 meters (over 5,000 feet) above sea level.

Known as Mexico’s coffee mecca, the exuberant tropical vegetation that surrounds this magical village high in the mountains provides the perfect conditions for producing some of the best Arabica coffee in the world.

Pluma coffee is recognized around the world for its distinguished and penetrating aroma. In fact, the coffee’s aromatic scent is so strong that an open bag of fresh roasted grains would fill a whole house with its smell. This last feature seems to be caused by the two different kinds of air that reach Pluma Hidalgo: the salty breeze from the nearby Pacific Ocean (that can be seen in bright and drafty days from certain viewpoints of the mountain village) and the cold wind coming down from the cliffs that surround the town.
strTitle: Private Coffee Tour from Huatulco

strIntroduction:
During this tour, you will have the opportunity to visit two colonial cities with a completely different style. Cuernavaca, “The City of Eternal Spring" and Taxco, a renowned silver center.

You will enjoy the breathtaking scenery on the highway through the Sierra Madre mountains to Cuernavaca, “The City of Eternal Spring”, where you will visit the ancient Cathedral one of the oldest in American continent. The building was built around 1526 and raised to Cathedral in 1891. This monument is a part of the group of monasteries that were declared World Heritage Sites by UNESCO in 1994.

You will continue to Taxco, a renowned silver center, and a beautiful and unique colonial city that preserves its XVIII century atmosphere. You will visit Santa Prisca Church (baroque architecture). The charm and magic of Taxco will involve you in a kind of romanticism that can only be found in Mexico's most magical towns. You'll walk to a local restaurant for lunch (not included).

We will be back at your hotel in the evening.
strTitle: Private Tour to Cuernavaca and Taxco from Mexico City

strIntroduction:
Puebla City, also called “Puebla City of Angels”, is the second most important Spanish colonial city, located southeast of Mexico City and west of Golf of Mexico's main port, Veracruz, right at Central Mexico. According to the legend, a bishop was told by angels the specific location of the future city of Puebla. By the "City of Angels" there is a picturesque road, guarded by two active volcanoes Popocatepetl and Iztaccihuatl, snow-capped peaks that rush into the sky. The city itself will amaze you splendid colonial architecture, historical monuments, among them Rosario Chapel, Convent of Santo Domingo, the city's cathedral, protected by UNESCO.

Church and houses decorated with "talavera" ceramic tiles, views of the surrounding mountains and volcanoes make this city a dream for lovers of beautiful photos and antique architecture. Now if your main weakness is the food, the "gastronomic capital of Mexico" will not disappoint you. Be sure to try the sauce "mole poblano", combining the taste of chocolate and hot chili peppers, as well as the famous stuffed peppers - "chiles en nogada."

This beautiful place hosts also the smallest volcano in the world - Cuexcomate. Its total height is 13 meters, and the diameter does not exceed 23 meters. Cuexcomate is considered an inactive volcano. In addition to its small size, this volcano has another unique feature. Inside, there is a spiral stairs that lead into the interior of the crater. Streams of lava are impressive not only for volcanologists, but also to ordinary tourists.

After that, you will go to Cholula - an ancient Indian city glorified by a pyramid of Toltec civilization, which is considered one of the largest pyramids in the world. At the top of the pyramid was built the church of the Blessed Virgin Comforter. It is believed that the city of Cholula was once an important political and ceremonial center of Mesoamerica during the classical period, which was a spectacular image of Teotihuacan in its heyday.
strTitle: Private Day Trip to Puebla from Mexico City
