strTitle: Private Day Trip to Puebla and Cholula from Mexico City

strIntroduction:
Combine some of the Yucatan's most popular attractions into one full day with this private adventure tour. Visit the ancient beachfront Maya ruins of Tulum with a local guide, then plunge into the cool waters of a cenote (underground pool) for a swim. After a traditional Mexican lunch in a restaurant, head to Akumal to swim with wild turtles and relax on a Caribbean beach. Round-trip transport from your Cancun, Riviera Maya, or Tulum hotel is included.

You will be picked up from your hotel between 7-8am and transferred to a natural park to swim in breathtaking cenotes. A cenote is a natural pit, or sinkhole, resulting from the collapse of limestone bedrock that exposes groundwater underneath. Especially associated with the Yucatán Peninsula of Mexico, cenotes were sometimes used by the ancient Maya for sacrificial offerings. Its water is often very clear, as the water comes from rain water filtering slowly through the ground, and therefore contains very little suspended particulate matter. The groundwater flow rate within a cenote may be very slow.

Then, you will visit Tulum arqueological zone, where with the help of a professional historical guide you will become real experts in the history and culture of Mayan civilization. The ruins are situated on 12-meter (39 feet) tall cliffs, along the east coast of the Yucatán Peninsula on the Caribbean Sea. Tulum was one of the last cities built and inhabited by the Maya; it was at its height between the 13th and 15th centuries and managed to survive about 70 years after the Spanish began occupying Mexico. One of the best-preserved coastal Maya sites, Tulum is today a popular site for tourists.

Once your Tulum visit is over, the "nature" part of the tour is waiting for you again in Akumal, where you will be allowed to swim with wild turtles in their natural environment, guided by a professional. It is one of the most beautiful beaches on the coasts of the Caribbean Sea. It has a particular appeal for those interested to have a unique snorkeling experience due to its rich marine life (mainly turtles) in shallow waters. If you come to Akumal you must get in the water and go snorkeling right away! At the end of this tour before heading back to your hotel, you will taste delicious, authentic Mexican food for a lunch.
strTitle: Yucatan Peninsula Full-Day Private Tour: Akumal, Tulum Ruins and Cenote Swim

strIntroduction:
Feel the wind on your face on an full-day tour of of Dalat city and its surroundings by motorbike. See a beautiful train station from the 1930s, visit Linh Phuoc village and vegetable farm, and marvel at the greenhouses of a flower farm.

Travelers will not be riding their own motorcycle on this tour, they will be riding along with their guide

Discover one of the most beautiful cities in Vietnam on a full-day scenic tour of Dalat and its surroundings by motorbike.

Following a pick-up from your hotel, your driver will take you to the Vallee d'Amour (“Valley of Love”), and take a short cut to a flower garden to see more than 2,000 different varieties of flower. Pass the historic railway station, built in the 1930s as a reflection of French colonial rule. The unique cogwheel rail line was destroyed in the Vietnam War, but has been faithfully restored to take passengers to Linh Phuoc village.

You can either ride the train, or travel by motorcycle to the village, where there will be time to admire the dragon pagoda. Visit a red wine factory to learn how Dalat wine is produced. Along the way, admire the many villas of the city’s French district.

Next, admire the cascades of Datanla waterfall. Continue to Paradise Lake to see its famous meditation center and one of the most beautiful views of the area. Return to Dalat city center to see the Hang Nga guesthouse, known as “Crazy House” for its unconventional design.
strTitle: Full-Day Motorcycle Tour of Dalat and Paradise Lake

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the pleasant climate and friendly people of Dalat as you explore the area on the back of a motorbike. Visit pagodas, villages, vegetable farms, and a coffee plantation. Stop at a silk factory to see the process of making silk.

Travelers will not be riding their own motorcycle on this tour, they will be riding along with their guide

Head out in the morning on the back of a motorcycle to visit the dragon pagoda and then on to the Lat village for a chat with the village leader and a sip of his cane wine. This type of wine is a specialty of minority groups living in the highlands.

On this full-day tour you’ll continue exploring the countryside with a visit to a vegetable farm, a greenhouse flower farm, a coffee plantation, and a silk village. Observe the silk-making process from caring for the silkworms to the factory. You’ll also see a mulberry plantation and the Elephant Waterfall.

When you return to Dalat city, your guide will show you one of the city’s most unusual attractions, known as the Crazy House due to its architectural style.

You’ll have some time to enjoy Vietnamese coffee at a local café and also to see how the locals make rice wine.
strTitle: Full-Day Motorcycle Tour of Silk Village from Dalat

strIntroduction:
This 3-day tour from Da Lat to Nha Trang by motorcycle is one of the best ways to see the central highlands of Vietnam if you're feeling adventurous. You'll ride on the back of a motorcycle with a driver-guide, and enjoy activities like swimming in the pool of a waterfall. Travel along country roads, eat regional food (own expense), see local farming practices, and enjoy one night at a homestay for a more authentic experience (you'll spend the second night at a hotel). This is a one-way tour and does not return to Da Lat, so make sure you have your own accommodation in Nha Trang.

Day 1: Da Lat – Lak Lake
100 miles (160 km)
Depart Da Lat in the morning and head into the countryside, stopping on the way for a quick visit at the 'crazy house.' Travel along the country road, passing by agriculture sites such as a vegetable farm, greenhouse flower farm, and coffee plantation. Visit a silkworm factory, see rice-wine making, and check out Elephant Falls. You'll arrive at Lak Lake to visit to Jun village, home to the ethnic minority M’nong people, and cross the lake by boat to reach Lieng minority village; along the way, enjoy plenty of photo ops of the landscape and a chance to see locals fishing and farming. In the late afternoon, check in at the long-stilt house for your overnight stay.

Overnight: Homestay at a long-stilt house

Day 2: Lak Lake – Buon Ma Thuot
87 miles (140 km)
Get up early in the morning and head toward the city of Buon Ma Thuot, stopping for half an hour of trekking to top of Elephant Rock mountain. Then get back on the road, riding on the motorbike with your guide and taking in views of rice paddies along the way. Continue to Buon Ma Thuot, and then take the Ho Chi Minh Trail to visit Dray Sap Falls, Gia Long Falls, and Dray Nur Waterfalls. Go swimming in a natural pool, taking in the natural beauty near Yokdon National Park. Return to Buon Ma Thuot in the late afternoon for your night there.

Overnight: 2-star Eden hotel

Day 3: Buon Me Thuot city – Nha Trang
115 miles (186 km)
Leaving Buon Ma Thuot, stop to visit Ede minority village and check out a rubber plantation to see how workers collect rubber from trees; you'll also see cocoa and black pepper farms. Then ride down Phoenix Pass, and a stop for lunch (food and drinks at your own expense) on the way to Nha Trang. In the afternoon, visit Duc My hot spring, and see how the local people make brick. Then enjoy a roughly 20-km ride along the coast to see why the Nha Trang beach is considered one of the most popular in Vietnam.

Arrive in Nha Trang in the late afternoon to end your 3-day motorcycle tour.
strTitle: 3-Day Motorcycle Tour from Da Lat to Nha Trang

strIntroduction:
Travel on the back of the motorbike to see everyday life in Vietnam, enjoy the local foods and see where much of it comes from by checking out farms growing vegetables and fruits. Stop by to see how silk products are made as well.
  • Travelers will not be riding their own motorcycle on this tour, they will be riding along with their guide
  • This tour does not return to Dalat. Please be sure to prepare accommodations in Mui Ne

Day 1: Dalat – Di Linh (8:30 – 16:30)
What to see: Riding along a country side road again with a visit of Datanla waterfall, a chance of ride on a roller coaster, the combination between mountain, paradise lake and the Truc Lam meditation center to make the area to be the most beautiful view of all Vietnam… another ride through an agricultural farm to see people farming with vegetable farm and strawberry farm; the visit of Silk village (visit all the process of making silk in the village such as mulberry plantation for silkworm, bamboo basket making, silkworm keeping and silk factory) and the Elephant falls.. A visit of K’ho Chil minority village and a chat vs the village leader to understand more about their histories, cultures
Where to stay: 2* Julliet resort

Day 2: Di Linh – Mui Ne (8:30 – 16:30)
What to see: A soft ride 24 km lead you through lead you through a mountainous are full of roadside plantations of black pepper garden, rubber tree and green coffee, then you will travel off main highway 50 km east along Highway 55 to Da Mi Hydro Electric Station. This is an off-the-main-highway road with spectacular views of mountainous areas, small farms, rivers, a panoramic view of one of the largest lakes in the region, small towns, and friendly people. Then we will travel along a very old but beautiful country road with many minority village and many opportunities for taking photos. You will enjoy the fresh dragonfruit at a dragonfruit plantation. Arrive at the very beautiful coast of Mui Ne Beach in the afternoon just relaxing and swimming.
strTitle: 2-Day Motorcyle Tour from Dalat to Mui Ne

strIntroduction:
On this 4-day motorcycle tour of Vietnam, you'll have the chance to see how some of the country's 5 exports such as rice, coffee, cashew nut, black pepper and rubber are produced. You'll visit local ethnic peoples, see how local silk and bamboo crafts are made, swim in the lakes and waterfalls along the way, and navigate the Cu Chi Tunnel complex.
  • Travelers will not be riding their own motorcycle on this tour, they will be riding along with their guide
  • This tour does not return to Dalat. Please be sure to prepare accommodations in Ho Chi Minh City

Day 1: Da Lat - Lak Lake ~ 160 km (8:30 – 16:30)
What to see: Riding along a country side road with a beautiful view of agricultural farm, keep travel along Highway 27 with visits to the green house flower farm; a coffee plantation; the Silk village (visit all the process of making silk in the village such as mulberry plantation for silkworm, bamboo basket making, silkworm keeping and silk factory) and the Elephant falls.. Arrive at Lak Lake with a visit to the “Jun” minority village (M’Nong). Check-in at the long-stilt-house for over-night stay.
Where to stay: Homestay at Jun village

Day 2: Lak Lake - Dak Mil ~ 120 km (9:00 – 16:00)
What to see: Crossing the Lak Lake by boat or ride on an elephant to Lieng minority village, with many opportunities of taking pictures of people farming and fishing; Continue travel to Buon Me Thuot City. Then take the Ho Chi Minh Trail to visit Dray Sap, Gia Long falls, and the Dray Nur falls. Go swimming in the natural swimming pool in the middle of the park with very clear waters, and then visit the national park. Arrive to Dak Mil with a visit to a beautiful lake in the area, then have some time to wander around the town.
Where to stay: Bao Trang Hotel (standard room with air-conditioning and hot/cold shower)

Day 3: Dak Mil - Dong Xoai ~ 185 km (8:00 – 17:00)
What to see: Keep going on the Ho Chi Minh Trail you will learn more about Vietnamese war, stop over at Dakmil lake with beautiful view, about 70 km along the Cambodia border with the real Ho Chi Minh trail (tiny road among the forest). The beautiful ride in the country road will lead you into many plantations such as: mango, black pepper and coffee plant...you have a chance of enjoying the famous central highland coffee...
Where to stay: Thanh Sang hotel (standard room with air-conditioning and hot/cold shower)

Day 4: Dong Xoai - Sai Gon ~ 165 km (8:00 – 17:00)
What to see: With a visit of the Cu Chi Tunnels, an immense network of connecting underground tunnels northwest of Ho Chi Minh City. Take a shortcut and cross the Cu Chi River by ferry, while on the way visit people making rice wine and rice paper, a cashew nut plantation and a rubber tree plantation. We'll end the tour navigating the busy traffic at Ho Chi Minh City to your city hotel ~ 5:00 pm, end tour.
strTitle: 4-Day Motorcycle Tour from Dalat to Ho Chi Minh City

strIntroduction:
Hop on a motorcycle and enjoy an extended tour through Vietnam. Enjoy a traditional gong music show, visit the a monument dedicated to North Vietnamese radio operators, see the way of Vietnamese making rice paper and rice noodle and much more. See the differences between traditional houses between many ethnic group peoples.
  • Travelers will not be riding their own motorcycle on this tour, they will be riding along with their guide
  • This tour does not return to Dalat. Please be sure to prepare accommodations in Hoi An

Day 1: Dalat - Lak Lake ~ 160 km (8:30 – 16:30)
Visit the Dragon pagoda, taking the country road to visit: Dalat agriculture farm with plenty of vegetables, the greenhouses for flower, coffee plantation, the silk village (Visit all the process of making silk such as silkworm keeping, mulberry plantation, silk factory...) and the Elephant waterfall. You also have time to enjoy Vietnamese coffee in the local cafe and watch the way of Vietnamese making rice wine. Arrive at Lak Lake with a visit to the Jun Minority Village (M'Nong). Check-in at the Home stay in Jun village with M’Nong minority people
Day 2: Lak Lake - Buon Me Thuot city ~ 140 km (9:00 – 16:00)
on the way heading to Buon Me Thuot city, you have half an hour trekking to top of the Elephant rock mountain, back on the road again, on the back of the motorbikes you will have opportunities to observe the panorama view of rice paddy field along the road. Continue travel to Buon Me Thuot City. Then take the Ho Chi Minh Trail to visit Dray Sap, Gia Long falls, and the Dray Nur falls… go swimming in the natural swimming pool in the middle of the park with very fresh water, and then the national park. Back to Buon Me Thuot city again for overnight at 2* Eden hotel
Day 3: Buon Me Thuot city - Plei Ku ~ 195 km (7:30 – 17:30)
What to see: Travel north along the Ho Chi Minh Trail with a visit of the War monument for the former north radio operator soldiers, spectacular views rubber plantations; and cashew and black pepper gardens. On the way you also take time to see the way of Vietnamese making rice paper and rice noodle...Take a short visit to Sea Lake in Plei Ku City. Another change for swimming, do the kayaking on the lake, hide insight the pine tree forest, you will see the paradise park for the lovers...overnight in Pleiku
Day 4: Plei Ku - Kon Tum ~ 140 km (8:30 – 16:00)
Visit another minority village which Ba Na people and their traditional Rong house... back to Kon Tum with a visit of a very old and unique wooden church; and an orphanage to share your feeling with the homeless children...stay at 2* Kon Klor resort
Day 5: Kon Tum - Kham Duc ~ 170 km (8:30 – 16:00)
Traveling ~ 42 km north from Kon Tum, we will visit the Dakto village; a major battlefield during the American war; and Charlie hill with popular song: Nguoi o lai Charlie. Stop over in Daklei province to see Trieng Minority Village and try crossing their tiny hanging bridge, use for transfering things from one side of the river to the other... On the way stop over at the hot spring Dak Ha, and enjoy fresh bathing in a spring river... Over night stay in Be Chau Giang hotel, Kham Duc.
Day 6: Kham Duc - Hoi An (finish) ~ 161 km (8:00 – 16:00)
Taking Highway 14E to Hoi An. With visits to Incense home making, Chopstick making factory, Ktu tribe village.
strTitle: 6-Day Motorcycle Tour from Dalat to Hoi An

strIntroduction:
– Dong Xoai (170 km)
Visit the Cu Chi tunnels, an immense network of connecting underground tunnels located to the northwest of Ho Chi Minh City. See how rice wine and rice paper are made and visit cashew nut and rubber tree plantations

Day 2: Dong Xoai – Bao Loc (195 km)
Leaving Dong Xoai you’ll ride along a country road, Take in the stunning views of the mountains, Overnight at Bao Loc

Day 3: Bao Loc – Da Lat (140 km)
Make a brief visit to the Chicken minority village, and then ride into the mountains, making another quick visit to a mushroom farm. Enjoy stops at the Datanla Waterfall, and at Paradise Lake, where you’ll see one of the largest meditation center in Vietnam.

Day 4: Da Lat – Lak Lake (160 km)
Visit a Dalat farm that grows vegetables, a greenhouse to admire the flowers, a coffee plantation, a silk village, and the Elephant Waterfall. Enjoy Vietnamese coffee at a local café and then see how Vietnamese rice wine is made. When you arrive at Lak Lake you’ll visit the Jun minority village Overnight at a home stay with M’Nong minority people.

Day 5: Lak Lake – Buon Me Thuot City (140 km)
Ride to Buon Me Thuot city and then take the Ho Chi Minh Trail to visit Dray Sap, Gia Long Falls, and the Dray Nur Falls. Stop for a swim in a natural pool in the middle of the park. Overnight at the 2* Eden Hotel.

Day 6: Buon Me Thuot City – Plei Ku (195 km)
Travel north along the Ho Chi Minh Trail and stop to visit the war monument to the former North Vietnam radio operator soldiers. A brief stop to visit Sea Lake in Plei Ku city. Enjoy a swim if you like, go kayaking on the lake, or take a walk in the pine tree forest.
Day 7: Plei Ku – Kon Tum (140 km)
Stop at another minority village, where the Ba Na people live in their traditional communal Rong house. Travel back to Kon Tum, stopping at a very old and unique wooden church, and at an orphanage to visit the children who live there.

Day 8: Kon Tum – Kham Duc (170 km)
Travel to Dakto village, which was the site of a major battle during the American War. Stop in Daklei province to see a Trieng minority village and try crossing their tiny hanging bridge! Continue on your ride and stop at the Dak Ha hot spring and enjoy bathing in the fresh spring waters. Overnight at Kham Duc

Day 9: Kham Duc – Hoi An (161 km)
Take Highway 14E to Hoi An. See how incense and chopsticks are made. Cross the Thu Bon River by ferry to My Son, the land of the Cham Pa Kingdom. You’ll arrive in Hoi An in the afternoon, marking the end of the tour.
strTitle: 9-Day Motorcycle Tour from Ho Chi Minh City to Hoi An

strIntroduction:
Discover the magic of Istanbul with a full-day Istanbul City Tour (from 9:00am to 4:00pm). Visit the most important popular sites of Istanbul. Guide, transfers from hotel & lunch included.

Visit the most important popular sites of Istanbul in one full day tour.
Duration: 9:00am to 4:00pm.
Visit the most important popular sites of Istanbul in one full day tour.
St Sophia Museum, Byzantine Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar.
Lunch is included.

  • Aya Sofya (St Sophia), 
  • Byzantine Hippodrome, 
  • Blue Mosque, 
  • Topkapi Palace 
  • Grand Bazaar 
Please Note:
Topkapi Palace is closed on Tuesdays and replaced with Underground Cistern & Turkish and Islamic Arts Musuem.
The Grand Bazaar is closed on Sundays and will be replaced by a visit to the Spice Bazaar.
strTitle: Istanbul Classics with lunch

strIntroduction:
Cappadocia is full of otherworldly natural sites, most notably the fairy chimneys, tall, cone-shaped rock formations clustered in Monks Valley. Perfect for anyone want to explore Bronze Age homes carved into valley walls by troglodytes (cave dwellers) and later used as refuges by early Christians.

Once picked up from your hotel the first stop is Esentepe, followed by a visit to Uchisar Castle. You will then visit Goreme open air museum and Ortahisar castle. Afterwards, you visit the Pasabag Fairy Chimneys, followed by Devrent Valley.

This tour duration is from 9:00am to 4:00pm, and lunch is included in the tour.
strTitle: Cappadocia North Tour with Lunch

strIntroduction:
Cappadocia is full of otherworldly natural sites, most notably the fairy chimneys, tall, cone-shaped rock formations clustered in Monks Valley. Perfect for anyone want to explore Bronze Age homes carved into valley walls by troglodytes (cave dwellers) and later used as refuges by early Christians.

Once picked up from your hotel your hotel you will head to Pigeon Valley and then Red Valley. After visiting the cave churches you will head to an underground city. Afterwards you visit Cavusin village and lastly Avanos town where you learn about hand-made pottery.
Lunch is included in tour price.
strTitle: Southern Cappadocia Tour with Lunch

strIntroduction:
Discover Turkey with an award winning tour operator. Mention Turkey and visions of sultans and harems, amazing mosques, belly-dancers, ancient ruins, Gallipoli and the ANZAC campaign, stunning coasts and the breathtaking natural landscape spring to mind, and this is exactly what this tour has.

Day 1 SaturdayIstanbul and the Bosphorous
Welcome to Istanbul. You will be transferred to your hotel and at 13:00 we will have a short visit to the Egyptian Spice Bazaar and a cruise along the European and Asian shores of the Bosphorous.
Overnight Istanbul 5 star Dosso Dossi Downtown Hotel or similar.

Day 2 Sunday Ankara, Cappadocia
After breakfast we drive towards the nation's capital, Ankara to visit Anitkabir, the Mausoleum of the famed Mustafa Kemal Ataturk before continuing on to the surreal landscape of Cappadocia.
Overnight Cappadocia Boutique Cave Blue Valley Hotel or similar.(B, D)

Day 3 Monday Goreme, Underground City
Today we tour the Goreme Open Air Museum, Pasabag, Uchisar Castle and Kaymakli Underground City. Photo opportunities are everywhere so have your cameras ready! Carpet weaving has long traditions in Turkey and at a carpet village we learn how carpets are made by hand and what determines their value. Tonight, don’t miss the optional Turkish folklore evening featuring folklore and belly dancers… a night you won’t forget!
Overnight Cappadocia Boutique Cave Blue Valley Hotel(B, D)

Day 4Tuesday Konya, Pamukkale
Leaving Cappadocia we head south along the ancient Silk Road just as the ancient traders did. Along the way we visit Sultanhani Caravansary, before stopping at Konya to tour the Mevlana Museum.
Overnight Pamukkale 5 star Colossae Thermal Hotel or similar (B, D)

Day 5 Wednesday Pamukkale, Aphrodisias
Visit the ruins of Hierapolis, the Temple of Apollo, Necropolis, and stroll over the magnificent white calcium terraces of Pamukkale. We then drive to Aphrodisias, the famous city of Aphrodite.
Overnight Kuşadası 5 star Suhan or similar (B, D)

Day 6Thursday Ephesus
Absorb yourself in history today with a guided tour of Ephesus and a visit to the site of the Temple of Artemis. Feel the mystical atmosphere of the ancient city and theatre. This afternoon we will enjoy a display of locally handcrafted leather goods before driving back to our hotel
Overnight Kuşadası 5 star Suhan or similar (B, D)

Day 7 Friday Izmir to Istanbul Old City
After breakfast you will be transferred to the airport for your morning flight to Istanbul. Upon arrival, tour the exotic city that spans both Europe and Asia visiting the Blue Mosque, St Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace and the Hippodrome. (Optional Bosphorous By Night Dinner Cruise )
Overnight Istanbul5 starDosso Dossi Downtown Hotel or similar (B)

Day 8 SaturdayIstanbul
Your day is free until your return transfer to the airport where your tour concludes.
(B)
(B - Breakfast, L - Lunch, D - Dinner)
strTitle: 8-Day The best of Turkey Tour Meals And Guide Included

strIntroduction:
Mention Turkey and visions of sultans and harems, amazing sites, belly-dancers, ancient ruins, stunning coasts and the breathtaking natural landscape spring to mind, and this is exactly what this tour has. Discover Turkeys magic with an award winning tour operator. This 5 day tour offers discovery and new experiences.

Day 1 Pick up between 6:15 am - 6:45 am from your hotel in the old city of Istanbul, Taksim or 7 am from Sultan Hostel, we then depart for afternoon tour of Gallipoli. We visit the WWI battlefields of Gallipoli including Lone Pine and Chunuk Bair Memorials, ANZAC Cove, The Nek, Johnston's Jolly, original trenches and tunnels.
Overnight Çanakkale 4 star Iris Hotel or similar (D)

Day 2 Troy, Acropolis of Pergamum
Step back in time today as we visit Troy and its famed Trojan Horse, followed by a tour of the magnificent acropolis of Pergamum. Its impressive temples and library made it a renowned cultural and political centre in its time.
Overnight Kuşadası 3 star Suhan Seaport Hotel or similar (B, D)

Day 3 Ephesus, Kusadasi
Absorb yourself in history today with a guided tour of Ephesus and a visit to the site of the Temple of Artemis. Feel the mystical atmosphere of the ancient city and theatre before continuing to former Greek village of Sirince, famous for its fruit wines. Carpet weaving has long traditions in Turkey and at the carpet village we learn how the carpets are made by hand and what determines their value.
Overnight Kuşadası 3 star Suhan Seaport Hotel or similar (B, D)

Day 4 Pamukkale, Hierapolis
This morning we will enjoy a display of locally handcrafted leather goods before heading to the magnificent white calcium terraces, known as Travertines, in Pamukkale where we also tour the ancient city of Hierapolis. Take a dip, amongst ancient columns, in the hot springs that were used in Roman times for their therapeutic powers.
Overnight Pamukkale 5 star Colossae Thermal Hotel or similar (B, D)

Day 5 Marmaris
After breakfast you will be transferred to Marmaris and our tour concludes upon arrival in Marmaris at approximately 12:00pm
(B)
(B - Breakfast, L - Lunch, D - Dinner)
strTitle: 5-Day Aegean Explorer Tour From Istanbul

strIntroduction:
Want to go cruising along the beautiful Turquoise waters of the Mediterranean Sea? Discover tiny islands and secluded bays, blue crystal clear water and days of endless sunshine, with this amazing 7 day gulet from an award winning tour company. Jump onboard and indulge in one of our cruises along the mighty Turkish coastline.

Day 1
We begin boarding our Gulet in Bodrum at 15:30pm. Relax with a welcome drink at the pre-cruise information session. Enjoy an onboard dinner while meeting the other passengers.
Overnight Bodrum Harbour, Gulet Cabin, Gulet, (D)

Day 2
After breakfast, we sail to Orak Island for lunch and then cruise to our overnight stop at Cokertme, a small and picturesque fishing town.
Overnight Çökertme, Gulet Cabin, Gulet,(B, L, D)

Day 3
Early start as we cruise for Yedi Adalar (Seven Islands). Spend the day amid beautiful island panorama before arriving in Kufre.
Overnight Küfre Bay, Gulet Cabin, Gulet,(B, L, D)

Day 4
After breakfast we set off for Longoz. Overnight in Karacasogut village, just 25km away from Marmaris. Overnight Karaca Söğüt. Gulet Cabin, Gulet (B, L, D)

Day 5
From Marmaris the yacht sails to Sedri Adasi (Cleopatra Island). We spend the afternoon sailing to English port for our overnight stop.
Overnight English Harbour, Gulet Cabin, Gulet, (B, L, D)

Day 6
Today we cruise to Kargili Bay for lunch. This afternoon, we sail to Kisebuku for our night stop.
Overnight Kisebuku (Alakisla Buku), Gulet Cabin, Gulet,(B, L, D)

Day 7
Early morning sail to Pabucburnu. After lunch in Yaliciftlik Bay, we sail back to Bodrum for our final night on the yacht.
Overnight Bodrum Harbour, Gulet Cabin, Gulet ,B, L, D)

Day 8
After breakfast, we disembark at approximately 10:30am. (B)

(B - Breakfast, L - Lunch, D - Dinner)
strTitle: 8-Day Magical Gulet Cruise In Bodrum Including Meals And Crew

strIntroduction:
This 12-day tour offers you the best tourist destinations of Turkey, foremost museums with informative and experienced guides and comfortable transport.

Full itinerary below.
strTitle: 11 Night Spirit of Turkey tour: Istanbul, Cappadocia, Beysehir, Antalya, Pamukkale, Kusadasi and Gallipoli

strIntroduction:
This amazing tour from an award winning tour operator of Turkey and the Greek Island covers many highlights. We offer a great mix of history, culture and lazy island life from Istanbul to Athens that includes three overnight cruises on the Aegean Sea.

Day 1, Thursday- Istanbul
Upon being transferred to your hotel, the remainder of the day is at leisure.
Overnight 4-star Mercure Istanbul Taksim Hotel.

Day 2, Friday -Istanbul Old City
After breakfast, enjoy a fully guided tour, visiting the Blue Mosque, St Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace, and the Hippodrome.
Cruise between two continents on the stretch of water that separates Europe from Asia in the afternoon with an optional 'Half day Bosphorous cruise'. Overnight Istanbul Mercure Istanbul Taksim Hotel (B)

Day 3, Saturday- Gallipoli Battlefields
Visit the WWI Battlefields of Gallipoli including Lone Pine and Chunuk Bair Memorials, ANZAC Cove, The Nek, Johnston's Jolly, original trenches and tunnels. Overnight Çanakkale Büyük Truva Hotel (B, D)

Day 4, Sunday-Troy, Acropolis of Pergamum
Visit Troy, home of the Trojan horse. Tour the acropolis of Pergamum. Its impressive temples and library made Pergamum a renowned cultural and political centre in its time. Overnight Kuşadası Boutique Ilayda Avantgarde Hotel (B, D)

Day 5, Monday- Ephesus, Kusadasi
This morning we will enjoy a display of locally handcrafted leather goods before heading to the magnificent white calcium terraces, known as Travertines, in Pamukkale where we also tour the ancient city of Hierapolis. Take a dip, among ancient columns, in the hot springs that were used in Roman times for their therapeutic powers. Overnight Kuşadası Boutique Ilayda Avantgarde Hotel (B, D)

Day 6, Tuesday Kusadasi, Patmos
Today you will be transferred to Kusadasi port, to join your Aegean cruise for a midday departure to the Greek Isle of Patmos.
Overnight Between Patmos - Rhodes Cruise Cabin Celestyal Olympia Cruise Ship (B, D)

Day 7, Wednesday Rhodes
You have full day to explore Rhodes at your own pace with a late afternoon departure.
Overnight Between Rhodes - CreteCruise CabinCelestyal Olympia Cruise Ship (B, L, D)

Day 8, Thursday Crete, Santorini
This morning you have time to explore the Island of Crete before sailing onto Santorini for the picturesque cliff top sunset.
Overnight Between Athens - SantoriniCruise CabinCelestyal Olympia Cruise Ship (B, L, D)

Day 9, Friday- Athens
Early arrival to Athens, you will be met and drive to your hotel and remainder of your day is free to explore.
Overnight Athens 4-star Titania Hotel (B)

Day 10, Saturday- Athens Old City
Have a half-day tour to visit Acropolis, stop at the stadium where the first Olympic Games of the modern era were held. Admire the Olympian Zeus and Hadrians Arch. Visit the museum at the Acropolis, the towering entrance of Propylaia, the Temple of Nike, and the most famous of Greek relics, the Parthenon. Overnight Athens 4-star Titania Hotel (B)

Day 11, Sunday- Athens
After breakfast, say goodbye to new friends before transfer to the airport.
strTitle: 11-Day Aegean Treasures Tour From Istanbul Ending In Athens

strIntroduction:
Mention Turkey and Greece visions of sultans and harems, amazing sites, belly-dancers, ancient ruins, stunning coasts and the breathtaking natural landscape spring to mind, and this is exactly what this tour has.

Day 1 Wednesday Kusadasi
Welcome to Kusadasi! Check into your hotel at your leisure and the rest of the day is yours, free to explore this harbour side resort town. Tonight you meet your guide and fellow travelling companions.
Overnight Kuşadası 5 star Ilayda Avantgarde HotelView page in a new window / Suhan (D)

Day 2 Thursday Kusadasi, Samos
Leaving Turkey, we take a ferry to Samos and depending on ferry schedules; we may head straight for Mykonos or spend a day exploring lush-green Samos.
Overnight Mykonos4 star (Hotel to be advised) (B)

Day 3 Friday Mykonos, Delos
Free day today. Spend the day on the beach, stroll around the town or take a trip to one of the small villages or take an optional day trip to the neighbouring island of Delos. This Mecca of Ancient Greece is today an island wide, open-air museum.
Overnight Mykonos 4 starHotel (B)

Day 4 Saturday Mykonos to Santorini
Revitalize with an early morning swim and wander the charming white-washed narrow alleyways of Mykonos Town before an afternoon ferry to Santorini.
Overnight Santorini 4 star Hotel (B)

Day 5 Sunday Santorini optional boat trip
Take an optional boat trip in the world's biggest volcanic crater above sea level. Visit the active volcano, swim in the warm thermal waters and take a therapeutic mud bath.
Overnight Santorini 4 star Hotel (B)

Day 6 Monday Santorini to Athens
Soak up the sun on the black sand beaches before we board an afternoon ferry to the mainland.
Overnight Athens 4 starTitania Hotel(B)

Day 7 Tuesday Athens Acropolis
This morning you will have half day tour and visit Acropolis, stop at the stadium where the first Olympic Games of the modern era were held. Admire the Olympian Zeus and Hadrians Arch. At the Acropolis visit the museum, the towering entrance of Propylaia, the Temple of Nike and the most famous of Greek relics, the Parthenon.
Overnight Athens 4 star Titania Hotel(B)

Day 8 Wednesday Athens
After breakfast, we say goodbye to our new friends before being transferred to the airport.
(B)


(B - Breakfast, L - Lunch, D - Dinner)
strTitle: 8-Day Aegean Escape Tour From Kusadasi

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this 12-night tour of Greece with a small-group of no more than 15, as well as a professional guide. See incredible locations such as Istanbul, Mykonos, Santorini, and more. Enjoy daily breakfasts, as well as round-trip transportation from the Athens International Airport to Istanbul Atatürk Airport.

Embark on a tour throughout the Mediterranean over the course of 13-days. Immerse yourself in the culture of each region as you take daily sightseeing tours.
strTitle: 12-Night Magical Aegean Tour from Athens

strIntroduction:
Discover Athens and some of Greece's most famous islands as you soak up both sun and culture during this 5-day tour. Enjoy a breadth of highlights out on the depths of the ocean. Relax comfortably at night in inclusive hotel rooms so you can be ready for the next day's sights. After your fill of Grecian wonders, conclude your tour with a taste of Turkey - the country of course.

Day 1 (Wednesday): Athens
You will be transferred to your hotel with the rest of the day free to explore this ancient city. In the evening, you will meet your tour leader and fellow traveling companions.
Overnight: Athens 4-star Titania Hotel

Day 2 (Thursday): Athens Acropolis (B)
In the morning, you will start your half-day tour with a visit to the Acropolis. At the Acropolis visit the museum, the towering entrance of Propylaea, the Temple of Nike and the most famous of Greek relics, the Parthenon. Next, you'll stop at the stadium where the first Olympic Games of the modern era were held. There will also be time to admire the Olympian Zeus and the Arch of Hadrian.
Overnight: Athens 4-star Titania Hotel

Day 3 (Friday): Athens to Santorini (B)
You will depart early morning for the breathtaking Island of Santorini, where you can soak up the sun and relax on the beach or perhaps explore the picturesque capital Firá.
Overnight: Santorini 4-star hotel

Day 4 (Saturday): Santorini (B)
Take an optional boat trip in the world's biggest volcanic crater above sea level. Visit the active volcano, swim in the warm thermal waters and take a therapeutic mud bath.
Overnight: Santorini 4-star hotel

Day 5 (Sunday): Santorini to Mykonos (B)
You will arrive in Mykonos and explore the white-washed town or head for the beach before experiencing the completely outrageous Mykonian nightlife.
Overnight: Mykonos 4-star hotel

Day 6 (Monday): Mykonos (B)
Your tour will take the day off and enjoy free time - spend the day on the beach, stroll around the town or take a trip to one of the small villages. This settlement of Ancient Greece operates in modern day as an island-wide open-air museum.
Overnight: Mykonos 4-star hotel

Day 7 (Tuesday): Mykonos, Samos (D)
You will catch the next midnight ferry heading towards the island of Samos and make your way to Turkey with free time to explore the town of Samos or Kusadasi (depending on ferry schedules).
Overnight: Kuşadası Boutique Ilayda Avantgarde Hotel

Day 8 (Wednesday): Kusadasi (B)
After breakfast, your tour concludes with a goodbye to your new friends.

strIntroduction:
Book this 3-night tour to explore the beautiful city of Kuang Prabang located on the confluence of the Nam Ou and the Mekong River and is made up of distinctive colonial architecture and dazzling temples. Saffron clad monks replace vehicles in this timeless, atmospheric city, as they often scurry the small streets. Experience the top of Mount Phousi with astonishing views over LuangPrabang at sunset, Pak Ou Cave, Khuang Si Fall and more.

DAY 1: LUANG PRABANG
Upon arrival at the Luang Prabang International Airport you will be met and transferred to hotel for check-in. Relax for the rest of the day. Overnight stay at the hotel in LuangPrabang

Hotel: Le Palais Juliana Hotel
Room Type: Deluxe room

DAY 2: LUANG PRABANG [B]
After breakfast start your full-day city tour with a visit to the Royal Palace Museum that hosts a range of interesting artifacts. Then enjoy a short-guided tour seeing the city’s oldest temple and the magnificent Wat Xiengthong with its roofs sweeping low to the ground, which represents classical Laotian architecture. Afterwards visit the Arts and Ethnology Center to learn about Laos’ many ethnic cultures before we head out of town to see the weaving villages of Ban Xiengkhong and Ban Xienglek before we return to the city to visit to Wat Mai. Then climb up to the top of Mount Phousi for an enjoyable exploration of the sacred, gilded stupa as well as a panoramic view of the city at sunset and the Mekong River. Finally, visit the famous night market, where you can find a lovely selection of handmade textiles made by local and hill tribe people surrounding Luang Prabang. Overnight stay at the hotel in Luang Prabang.

Hotel: Le Palais Juliana Hotel
Room Type: Deluxe room

DAY 3: LUANG PRABANG – PAK OU CAVE – KHUANG SI FALL [B]
After breakfast embark on a cruise upstream on the Mekong River and enjoy a breathtaking view of the tranquil countryside. Witness the mysterious Pak Ou Caves - two linked caves crammed with thousands of gold lacquered Buddha statues of various shapes and sizes left by pilgrims. En route you will stop at the village of Ban Xanghai, where known for local-made rice wine. On return disembark the boat to visit traditional villages and then take a short drive to Ban Phanom, a village famous for its hand weaving tradition.

In the afternoon, visit local villages of ethnic minority groups at Ban Ouay, a Hmong village, Ban Ou a Laoloum Village and Ban Thapene, and Khmu Villages. Then go to the beautiful Khuang Si Waterfall where you can cool off with a refreshing swim in the pools or walk along the forest trails. Return to Luang Prabang and overnight stay in the hotel.

Hotel: Le Palais Juliana Hotel
Room Type: Deluxe room

DAY 4: LUANG PRABANG [B]
There is no itinerary planned for the day. After breakfast you will be transferred to the Luang Prabang International Airport for your departure flight.
strTitle: 3-Night Experience Laos Private Tour from Luang Prabang

strIntroduction:
Don't miss the opportunity to see whirling dervishes perform the Mevlevi Sema Ceremony at Istanbul's Hodjapasha cultural dance theatre. Proclaimed as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO.

Duration : 1 hour
Don't miss the opportunity to see whirling dervishes perform the Mevlevi Sema Ceremony at Istanbul's Hodjapasha cultural dance theatre. The ceremony features a complex musical repertoire called 'ayin' and the whirling dance performed by the dervishes represents the mythical journey of man's spiritual ascent through mind and love to perfection. It is a tradition more than 800 years old, and in 2005 it was proclaimed as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO.

The ceremony starts after a 15 minute classical instrumental performance by a traditional Turkish orchestra and lasts for around 45 minutes. It is accompanied by 360 degree video special effects projected on the walls of the beautiful historic building and some amazing lighting, adding to the atmosphere of this captivating ceremony. The total duration is one hour, and seats are numbered, so be sure to book early.
strTitle: Whirling Dervishes Show From Istanbul

strIntroduction:
Steep yourself in Turkish history on this 7-hour tour of Priene, Miletus, and Didyma, departing from Kusadasi. A guide will not only escort you to all these significant and fascinating places, but illuminate them with historical tales, facts, and anecdotes. Visit the ruins of Didyma, located at a short distance to the northwest of modern Didim. Tour the port of Priene and see Miletos. This tour includes hotel pickup and drop-off.

Depart from your hotel in Kuşadası in the morning, after meeting your guide. Relax on a 2 hour drive to your first stop: Priene, which was one of the most active ports of the Ionian Federation. The city is the oldest example of geometric city planning.

Next is the town of Miletos, where Turkish philosophers and sages pondered many things, and which has provided its alphabet to the rest of the classical world. Continue to Didyma’s Temple of Apollo, where well-known oracles once made it one of the most sacred places of antiquity.

After hearing many stories of these city’s pasts, kick back on the ride back to Kuşadası. At the end of the tour you will be transferred to your hotel.
strTitle: Priene Miletus Didyma Day Tour From Kusadasi

strIntroduction:
Discover the magic of Istanbul with a one day, 7-hour transcontinental Istanbul city tour. Visit the most important popular sites of Istanbul, including the Egyptian Spice Bazaar, Beylerbeyi Palace, the Bosphorus Bridge, and Camlica Hill, in the company of a local guide and the comfort of a private car. The transfer from your hotel and lunch are included.

The magnificent Bosphorus Strait is the meeting point of continents, separating Istanbul into Europe and Asia and giving this city its distinct energy. Crossing the Bosphorus takes you from the bustling historic shores of the Europe, with its bazaars and mosques, to the calmer palace-dotted Asian shores.

Your private climate-controlled car will collect you from your hotel for a 7-hour 9am tour. Accompanied by a helpful and informative guide, discover the fragrant shops in the Spice Bazaar, where vendors sell smoky pepper and cinnamon alongside flowering teas and sugary Turkish Delight.

Winding through the bustling backstreets of the bazaar, arrive at the oasis of the Rustem Pasha Mosque. Take a quiet moment to take in the intricate red and blue tiles that decorate the interior of the mosque. Designed by world-famous Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan, this is one of the loveliest mosques in Istanbul.

Continue on to Asia by boat, crossing the strait by a Bosphorus Cruise. With the salty breeze blowing in your hair, enjoy a Turkish lunch as you pass the Bosphorus Bridge, also known as the 15 July Martyrs Bridge, built in 1973.

Admire Beylerbeyi Palace, an Asian-side residence of Ottoman sultans with opulent decorations and a prime location on the waterfront. (The palace is closed on Mondays and Thursdays, and is replaced with the Imperial Yildiz Park and Yildiz Porcelain Factory.)

Explore Camlica Hill, with its sweeping views of the Istanbul skyline, and soak in the scope of this city on the Bosphorus. Your tour concludes at 4:00pm, when you will be transferred back to you hotel.
strTitle: Tour of Istanbul's Two Continents with Lunch Included

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a magical culinary morning, where you will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to a local kitchen to learn how to cook traditional Turkish cuisine during a special 2-hour workshop. When your meal is finished, you will have lunch at a rooftop restaurant with new friends you've made from this cultural experience. Your transportation to and from your hotel is included in the tour, which begins at 11:00am.

 Learn to cook a traditional Turkish meal with instruction from a professional local chef. Turkish cuisine is one of the richest in the world, known for fragrant grilled meats, thick tart yogurts, fresh olive oil, and crisp seasonal produce.

Before your class, a climate-controlled vehicle will take you from your hotel to the meet your fellow students for your Turkish cooking class. The class is 2 hours long and will last from 11:00am to 1:00pm. A local chef serves as the instructor at a hotel kitchen, where you will learn to cook traditional Turkish cuisine. Discover the cultural context of each mouthwatering dish and the special techniques to prepare local cuisine like a true Turk. Following the session, enjoy a delicious Turkish meal of your own creation on the rooftop restaurant. Your instructor will provide recipes, so you can show off your new Turkish culinary skills upon your return home. At the conclusion of the meal, a car will return you to your hotel.
strTitle: Turkish Cooking Class with Lunch in Istanbul

strIntroduction:
You will be collected from your hotel and escorted around Istanbul city by night seeing some of its most iconic architecture. Once finished you will enjoy dinner with panoramic views.

Discover the magic of Istanbul at night. This night time experience is provided by an award winning tour operator.
A short drive to the boat to cruise up the Bosphorus. The waterway lies between Europe and Asia and passes under the suspension bridges whilst viewing Ottoman summer palaces, waterside mansions and modern villas lining the European and Asian shores. The panoramic view of Istanbul from the Bosphorus at night with dinner, traditional fol dancing and belly dancing will be memorable experience for you. Dinner included.
strTitle: Bosphorus Night Cruise with Dinner Included From Istanbul

strIntroduction:
Istanbul is a city which enchants its visitors with its night life activities. This night excursion allows you to experience a night of good food and good fun, with the chance for you to belly dance the night away. This evening not only includes your transfers but a dinner and 2 local drinks. Ideal for anyone who wants to experience Istanbul as a local.

Once collected from your hotel in the evening you will take a short drive to an exclusive night club through the illuminated city. Five course dinner will be served including two local drinks. After dinner, enjoy the floor show of traditional belly dancers, traditional folklore dancers and singers from various regions of Turkey.
strTitle: Discover Istanbul at Night With Dinner Included

strIntroduction:
Sail down the coast of Barcelona during this 2-hour boat tour. With a small group, depart Port Olimpic just after sunset and admire the city's architecture, landmarks, cityscapes, and mountain scenery from your unique viewpoint on the water. Head into the deep blue Mediterranean Sea as you relax on deck, or in the boat's comfortable cabin, with your beverage of choice.

Make your way to Port Olimpic around 5:30pm (depending on the time of year), and board a Beneteau Oceanis Clipper with the rest of your small group. Settle into the modern, spacious, and comfortable boat and sip an included beverage as you set off on a 2-hour sailing journey. You may also bring your own drinks and snacks to enjoy during the cruise.

Glide along Barcelona's coastline and admire the architecture of La Sagrada Familia, Montjuic, Torre Acbar, Tibidabo, and the towers of Barcelona from your unique perspective on the water. Take in the mountain scenery and the beautiful, deep blue colors of the Mediterranean Sea. Relax as your professional skipper navigates the boat through the water, and toast the sunset with the provided bottle of cava (sparkling wine).

At the end of two hours, return to the marina at Port Olimpic to conclude the experience.
strTitle: Small Group Sunset Cruise in Barcelona

strIntroduction:
Experience the thrill of the desert in a 4WD land cruiser! Leave the city and see the vast desert surround Dubai. Enjoy the adrenaline of sand bashing before heading to the desert camp where your adventure continues with camel riding and sandboarding. Enjoy a BBQ dinner and evening entertainment before heading back to the city.

    Escape the urban sprawl of Dubai on a 6-hour adventure into the desert. Driving across the dunes in 4WD Land Cruisers, your ultimate destination will be a traditional Arabic Bedouin camp.

    The tour departs in the afternoon, heading across the desert of Dubai with several photo-stops during an exciting dune drive to your first destination, a camel farm. Continue across the desert, pausing to watch the beautiful sunset, before reaching the campsite where you will have the opportunity to take a camel ride. Try some sand boarding, or get a henna painting on your hands or feet.

    Having worked up an appetite, relax over a delicious barbecue dinner and try the famous Arabic shisha water pipe. Before you return to Dubai or Sharjah, you will get one final treat as you watch a belly dance performance around the campfire by starlight.

    It is a must-do tour for anyone visiting the UAE, whether on vacation or business, and will give you memories to share with your family and friends back home. Your return time to Dubai or Sharjah will be approximately 21:00.
strTitle: Evening Desert Safari in 4WD from Dubai

strIntroduction:
Ride a camel in the desert, go dune bashing in a Land Cruiser, experience quad biking in the open desert, and learn sand skiing – the latest craze in the U.A.E. This adventure sports package is available as a half-day excursion from Dubai.

Experience an exhilarating adventure in the vast Dubai desert! Your half-day excursion begins with an early-morning pick-up from your city hotel.

You’ll ride to a campsite in Al Aweer, where you’ll have the unique experience of a camel ride. After a short break, your adventure continues with sand cruising in one of the biggest sand dunes in the region.

Experience the breathtaking thrills of sand skiing, or sandboarding, which is currently a big craze in the U.A.E. After a quick lesson you’ll be ready to head down a dune safely on a mono-board.

Small dune vehicles or ATVs are also available for driving on the dunes by yourself. Race up and down a track that was especially created for this purpose.
strTitle: Desert Adventure Sports From Dubai

strIntroduction:
Book a private transfer from Dubai International Airport to your accommodation in the city. Arrive with your transportation worries taken care of. Let Marhaba's friendly and exclusive service get your stay in Dubai off to the perfect start.

Marhaba, or ʻWelcomeʼ in Arabic, is our exclusive meet and greet service that makes the airport something to look forward to—for you, your clients or your loved ones. From speedy clearance through arrivals or departures to helping with transfers, baggage and family travel, we ensure a swift, smooth and safe passage through the airport. We even have our own lounges, reserved for Marhaba customers.

So whether you want to treat yourself, roll out the red carpet for a friend, or simply ensure your guests arrive relaxed, knowing theyʼre in safe hands, Marhaba will deliver on your promise of a warm welcome.
strTitle: Marhaba Services with One-Way Transfer to Hotel in Dubai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy drinks and snacks at At.Mosphere on level 122 of Dubai’s Burj Khalifa, and gaze at the panoramic views of the city’s skyline and Arabian Gulf. The ticket includes round-trip transfers from any hotel within Dubai city.

At.Mosphere is the world’s highest lounge bar, sprawling over 1,030 square meters on level 122 of the Burj Khalifa. Situated just 2 levels below the At The Top observatory deck, there's plenty to take in as you enjoy drinks and light snacks surrounded by stunning views of Dubai’s futuristic skyline and the Arabian Gulf.

Holder of the Guinness World Record for the Highest Restaurant from Ground Level, the innovative lounge and restaurant offers a unique dining concept. Choose to dine at the restaurant, or unwind in the lounge overlooking the world’s tallest performing fountains. Whether you’re a connoisseur of fine dining, or simply want to relax, At.Mosphere promises an experience like no other.

Soak up the dramatic décor of deep shades of amethyst and patterned velvets. An ideal stopover for a mouthwatering lunch or afternoon tea, the mood shifts in the evening, with soft lounge music to accompany the impressive views. Round-trip transfers from any hotel within the city limits of Dubai ensures a perfect experience.
strTitle: AtMosphere Lounge at 122nd floor of Burj Khalifa Tower with Private Transfers

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a introduction to Dubai on a 4-hour private tour by car and see the city’s contemporary architecture and waterfront. Ride a traditional water taxi and a modern monorail, and get optional entry to the Burj Khalifa(at additional cost); the world’s tallest building.

Discover a city of contrasts on a private 4-hour sightseeing tour of Dubai’s modern sights and historic monuments. Giving you a great introduction to the city, especially if you are short of time, see some of the most popular sights and visit picturesque landmarks that combine fabulous skyscraper architecture with the rich culture of the Middle East.

You will get ample time at each stop to photograph the striking buildings, such as the billowing sail-shaped Burj Al Arab and the Atlantis Hotel. Learn how the city came about and see old attractions, such as the Mosque, Al Fahidi Fort, spice and gold souks.

Stop at Dubai Creek and take a water taxi across the harbor. Drive along Jumeirah Road, passing the Dry Docks, Historical Union House, and beautiful Jumeirah Mosque.
strTitle: Private City Tour Includes One Way Monorail and Water Taxi

strIntroduction:
Experience latest sports craze - Bubble Soccer during this 1-hour session in Dubai. Climb inside an inflatable bubble and challenge your colleagues, friends or family with this hilarious and unique twist on the traditional soccer game.

Get set for some bubble soccer fun and experience the latest sports craze as it arrives in the United Arab Emirates in Dubai. Climb into an inflatable bubble and smash into each other, rolling across the grass, and bouncing around in teams of 6 to 12 participants. Bond with your colleagues as part of a team building exercise, or simply have fun with your friends and family.

You will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to the indoor or outdoor venue, depending on a season and weather. Play in 2 teams with an equal number of players. There’s no need for a goal keeper as the goals are much smaller than in normal soccer. Try to score goals in a marked area. Apart from the standard rules, bumping, bouncing, rolling, flipping over, and smashing into each other are tactical parts of the game. After the game you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Bubble Soccer with Private Transfer

strIntroduction:
Marvel at the 10 million liter Dubai Aquarium Tank, one of the largest suspended aquariums in the world. Head under the surface in the Aquarium Tunnel and watch divers feed sharks and rays. End your day with an ice skating session at the Dubai Mall.

The 10 million liter Dubai Aquarium tank, located on the ground level of the Dubai Mall, is one of the largest suspended aquariums in the world. It is home to thousands of aquatic animals, including 400 sharks and rays. It also boasts the largest collection of sand tiger sharks in the world.

The Guinness World Record-winning acrylic panel in front of the aquarium tank provides free viewing to the public from all 3 levels of the Dubai Mall. Its 48 meter walk-through tunnel features 270-degree views from 11 meters below the surface of the tank.

You can choose to go on an optional glass-bottom boat ride, which will give you unique views of the tank from beneath your feet. If you want to experience a dip in the tank you can opt for a cage snorkeling experience. (Note that optional activities incur additional charges.)

If you’re feeling adventurous you can add a shark dive to your program. This once-in-a-lifetime opportunity will bring you within inches of a large variety of sharks and rays.

The Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo recreate the fascinating marine environment in near-perfect detail and gives you the opportunity to walk right through it. Located on the ground floor of the Dubai Mall, the 48-meter-long Aquarium Tunnel takes you 11 meters under the surface.

Watch divers feed the sharks and rays and meet an aquarium educator who will share secrets of these amazing underwater animals with you.

Continue your journey into the aquatic world at the Underwater Zoo, where you’ll learn more about the amazing creatures that inhabit the rivers and the oceans.

Located on Level 2, above the Aquarium Tank, the Underwater Zoo leads you through 3 ecological zones. See otters, piranha, Humboldt penguins, Caiman crocodiles, lionfish, giant spider crabs, seahorses, garden eels, archerfish, arapaima, water rats, paddlefish, cichlids, and many more aquatic animals in 40 individual displays.

Look straight down into the 10 million liter tank from a glass floor that hovers above the aquarium. The kids will love it!

Set your spirit free on ice at the Dubai Mall's new sensational Olympic-sized ice rink. Whether you want to learn to skate, perfect your technique, play ice hockey, socialize with friends, or just have a great time, this spectacular venue is the coolest place to hang out, any time of the year.
strTitle: Underwater Zoo, Dubai Aquarium and Ice Rink Entrance Ticket

strIntroduction:
Immerse yourself in the history and culture of ancient Turkey with this full-day private tour of Ephesus, the preserved ancient city. Follow a private guide through some of the area’s most popular sites, including the House of the Virgin Mary and the city’s Parliament House, Temple of Domitian, and Memmius Monument. Then head to a nearby carpet cooperative to see local women preserving Turkey’s carpet-making tradition.

Travel back in time to the Roman Period during this full-day tour of Ephesus. With help from a private, highly skilled tour guide, gain new insight into Roman engineering, lifestyle, and art and culture while touring the most visited ancient site in Turkey. Start the tour at the House of Virgin Mary, believed to be the final living place of the biblical heroine. Located 6 kms (3.7mi) from Ephesus and surrounded by pine and olive trees, the house is made of stone and is very small. Outside is a "wishing wall” where visiting pilgrims have tied their personal reflections on paper or fabric.

Next, travel to Ephesus, learning about the history of the surviving Roman structures from the guide while walking through the magnificent Marble Street of the city. Visit 2,000-year-old structures including the Parliament House, Temple of Domitian, Memmius Monument, and Heracles Gate. Along the way, marvel at mosaic covered pavements, bathhouses, public toilets, and shops. See the third largest library in the Ancient World, the theater where St. Paul preached, and the Terrace Houses, and hear more from the guide about what daily life in Ephesus was like.

In the afternoon, travel to a local carpet cooperative to see how Turkish carpets are woven. Continue on to the Ephesus Archaeological Museum, which displays important artifacts excavated from Ephesus and neighboring regions. After touring the museum, head to St. John’s Basilica to see where the apostle John died and was buried after his missions in Anatolia. Finally, visit the Temple of Artemis (Diana), one of the seven wonders of ancient World, before ending the tour.
strTitle: Legendary Ephesus Full Day From Kusadasi

strIntroduction:
Explore roman history with the most classic private Ephesus tour. Good choice for people who interested in ancient history and want to see everything possible in one day. You will visit the most significant places in one private Ephesus tour.

Ephesus is an important place in Christian history as it is recognized as the final residence of Mother Mary. During the second half of the first century Christians were heavily persecuted under the Roman rule. According to tradition after the crucifixion of Jesus, St John did bring Mother Mary to Ephesus with him to hide escape persecution. They did spend their last years in Ephesus which was a very prosperous trading city. The House of the Virgin Mary is located 6 kms (3.7mi) from Ephesus and surrounded by pine and olive trees. It is made of stone and looks very small and humble. Outside the house is a "wishing wall" which pilgrims have used by tying their personal intentions on paper or fabric. A water source is also located nearby, believed to have miraculous powers of healing. The shrine was visited by several popes.

After Mary’s house, your guide will escort you at sights in Ephesus, informing you about history of outstanding Roman structures as you walk through the magnificent Marble Street of the city. Ephesus is the most visited ancient site of Turkey and the third largest city of the Roman Empire after Alexandria and Rome. Once it was a trading center of Asia province of the Roman Empire known as Asia Minor. During your stay in Ephesus, you will be amazed by two thousand year old structures such as the Parliament House, Temple of Domitian, Memmius Monument, Heracles Gate, mosaic covered pavements, bathhouses, public toilets, the Third Largest Library of the Ancient World, the shops, the Largest Theater of Turkey where St. Paul preached and many others.

In the afternoon a local carpet cooperative will be visited to see how Turkish Carpets are woven by local women. And then you will proceed to Ephesus Archeological Museum which displays important artifacts excavated from Ephesus and neighboring regions. Touring in the museum will give you a complete idea about what life was like in ancient times.

After your visitation of museum, your guide will take you to the oldest mosque of Selcuk Town. Isa Bey Mosque, which built at 14th century by the first Muslim family that settled in West Anatolia. You will have a great information about architecture of Islam how was like at the beginning of Ottoman Period.

The last historical spot of your tour will be the Temple of Artemis (Diana) which was one of the seven wonders of ancient World.
strTitle: Classic Ephesus Full Day Private Tour

strIntroduction:
Walk through the oldest part of modern Nuuk and imagine the first steps of colonization of Greenland on this 2-hour guided tour.

This guided tour is for anyone interested in Greenland’s colonial history and its impact on present-day society.

During this walk around Colonial Nuuk, you will be told about the encounter between the Inuit and European culture, and their mutual impact on the development of present-day society. The statues and buildings all contribute to the story of the rapid transformation of the old Inuit way of life; the struggle for survival and adaptation by the colonizers, and the inevitable clash of beliefs and merge of cultures.
strTitle: Historical City Walk of Nuuk

strIntroduction:
Eat your lunch while taking in the sight and atmosphere of Nuuk Icefjord, and get a feel of every-day life in the small settlement of Kapisillit.

This tour is for travelers who love the wind in their faces, the salty spray of the sea, and who don’t mind a bit of hiking.

The boat ride to Kapisillit takes approx. 2.5 hours and takes us through the eastern part of the Nuuk Fjord system. The mountains flanking the fjord are some of the oldest in the world and provide precious material for local artists. Take in the vastness of the fjord while keeping a lookout for whales, seals and white-tailed eagles.

From the bottom of Kapisillit Fjord, we will hike - approx. 45 min. - up to the plateau overviewing the Icefjord. It is an area rich in plants and wildlife, and the ice backdropping the landscape is a majestic sight. With the Icefjord in sight, we will eat our lunch while enjoying the immense silence only interrupted by the glacier calving in the bottom of the fjord.

Before heading back to Nuuk, we will stop by Kapisillit - the last permanent settlement in Nuuk Region - and visit one of the local families.

Highlights:

  • Look for whales, seals, reindeer, arctic fox, snow hares, eagles
  • Enjoy your lunch by the majestic Icefjord
  • Visit a local family in Kapisillit
  • Enjoy the beauty and vastness of Nuuk Fjord system
strTitle: Icefjord Hike and Settlement of Kapisillit

strIntroduction:
Climb one of the steepest mountains in Nuuk region and enjoy a panoramic view of the city’s natural surroundings. You'll get a full experience of Kingittorsuaq as we climb our way to the summit, taking in the vastness of our local habitat

This tour takes you on a beautiful boat ride past the Kobbefjord - some 30 minutes from Nuuk Harbour - to the small bay of Pupik, where you will go ashore and begin the challenging climb of Kingittorsuaq. The mountain is one of Nuuk’s hallmarks and is used by locals for interpretation of weather conditions in the region. It is a relatively steep mountain and only committed hikers make their way to its summit which provides a stunning view of Nuuk region. 

The climb is challenging and we advise that only experienced hikers go on this tour. There is no need for climbing gear.

This is a full-day tour - you will need to bring a lunch pack and water, and there are no paved paths on the hike so you should wear suitable footwear
strTitle: Full-Day Guided Climb Up Kingittorsuaq Including Boat Ride

strIntroduction:
Join us on this guided hike from Kobber fiord to Nuuk Fjord through green low land, along a mountain lake until we descend upon the neighboring Nuuk Fjord - where the boat will pick us up and bring you back to Nuuk. This tour is for travelers who like a combination of physical activity and cruising.

We depart from Nuuk Harbour and start the tour with a short boat ride - approx. 30 min - to the Kobbe Fjord east of Nuuk. Half-way up the fjord, we will go ashore and begin our hike north-east toward Nuuk Fjord.

First part of the hike goes through beautiful valley landscapes, taking us up to 350 metres above sea level, from where there is a view of Nuuk Fjord, the mountain of Sermitsiaq, and the mountainous landscape of both fjords. It is a breathtaking sight. After a short rest, we head down toward Nuuk Fjord, passing several gushing waterfalls on our way. The hike takes approx. 4 hours.

Once we reach the shore of Nuuk Fjord, we get back into the boat and head home toward Nuuk, arriving at the harbour approximately 1 hour later.
strTitle: Back Country Hike from Kobber Fjord to Nuuk Fjord

strIntroduction:
Get a feel of ancient Inuit life, historical cultural encounters and introduction of European modern life.

This tour is for travelers interested in the history and cultural development of Nuuk region 

Kangeq Island and its settlement lies at the very mouth of Nuuk Fjord, just 20 km west of Nuuk. To its north-west lies Hope Island, named by the Norwegian missionary Hans Egede, whose arrival and settlement on the island ultimately lead to the Danish colonization of Greenland. 

Although abandoned, Kangeq shows clear evidence of modern European culture with its wooden houses and the small church which - in the days of colonisation - also served as a school for the settlement’s children. 

Human habitation on Kangeq has been dated back as far as the Paleo Eskimo people of the Dorset Culture which, along with Kangeq's rich history of art-making, storytelling, hunting and kayaking during the days of colonization, highlights the settlement’s historical and cultural significance.

Highlights :      

  • Look for humpback whales, seals, and white-tailed eagles
  • Enjoy the calm inlet between Kangeq and Hope Island
  • Imagine the comings and goings of ancient cultures
  • Get a feel of the modernisation of Greenland
strTitle: Ancient Settlement of Kangeq

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this unique dining experience in the bottom of Qooqqut Fjord. Do some fishing just off the coast and bring back your catch to be prepared at a remote restaurant close to the mouth of the fjord. You can literally have your fish and eat it too. Be sure to keep your camera handy and be on the look-out for humpback whales, seals and white-tailed eagles.

This 5-hour tour is for travelers who enjoy being self-reliant. Qooqqut is a tiny settlement about 50km east of Nuuk, just one of many local summering spots. There, Restaurant Qooqqut Nuan offers a rare dining experience with food made from with fresh, local produce and ingredients, including your catch of the day. Enjoy a beautiful view of Qooqqut Fjord from the restaurant.

The boat ride takes about 1.5 hrs, giving you a small taste of the vast Nuuk Fjord system and the local wildlife. Your guide will, as always, be on sharp lookout for whales spouting. On the way, the boat will stop to jig for cod and redfish, your dinner, while you soak-in the stillness and scenery of the dramatic, mountainous Nuuk Fjord system. Upon arrival at the restaurant, the owner and skill-full chef of Qooqqut Nuan will prepare and serve your catch of the day. A truly unique experience.
strTitle: Half-Day Fishing in the Fjord and Dining in Qooqqut

strIntroduction:
This small-group tour is perfect for travelers who like a combination of physical activity and leisurely dining. Explore the hinterlands of Nuuk with an exploration hike and enjoy a delicious dinner that you caught yourself. It will prepared in Restaurant Qooqqut Nuan by the small settlement of Qooqqut.

Depart from Nuuk Harbor and start the tour with a short boat ride, approximately 30 minutes, to the Kobbe Fjord east of Nuuk. Along the way be on the lookout for whales, seals and white-tailed eagles. Half-way up the fjord, you will go ashore and begin your hike northeast toward Nuuk Fjord.

The first part of the hike goes through beautiful valley landscapes, taking you up about 1150 feet (350 m) above sea level, from where there are amazing views of Nuuk Fjord, the mountain of Sermitsiaq, and the mountainous landscape of both fjords. It is a breathtaking sight.

After a short rest, head down toward Nuuk Fjord, passing several gushing waterfalls on your way. The hike takes approximately 4 hours.

Once you reach the shore of Nuuk Fjord, you will get back into the boat and head toward the settlement of Qooqqut. On the way there, you will make time to fish for your dinner, usually cod or redfish, which will be prepared by the skillful staff of Restaurant Qooqqut Nuan upon arrival.

After a tasty dinner, you will return to Nuuk by boat, arriving at the harbor at around. 10:00pm.
strTitle: Hike and Dine Day Tour from Nuuk

strIntroduction:
Indulge in an exotic adventure in Dubai! Join this desert safari along with friends or family where you will be driven over the expansive sand dunes and into a Bedouin campsite to experience traditional Arabic welcome filled with loads of entertainment.

A “must do” in Dubai, this tour takes you across the desert with several photo-stops for about 15 minutes during an exciting dune drive to a camel farm. The drive continues with a stop to watch the beautiful sunset and click memorable pictures before proceeding to the campsite where you will have the opportunity to ride a camel, go sand boarding, and get inked with henna on your hand or feet.

After working up an appetite, you will be served a delicious barbecue dinner and you could even try the Shisha, the famous Arabic water pipe. You will watch the belly dance and the Tanoura dance around the campfire under the sky canopy. Having done with the entertainment and the delicious dinner, the guests will be dropped back to their hotel.

Anyone with a carefree spirit will be delighted to join this adventure that is both adrenaline-rushing and entertaining.
strTitle: Dubai Desert Safari With Hotel Transfers Included

strIntroduction:
The Dubai City Tour gives you a glimpse of the Old Dubai that speaks of the Old day’s market traders and merchants of pearls to a transformation of the New Dubai full of art and magnificent skyscrapers.

The tour starts with a peek of the Dubai Creek that flows through the main business location of Bur Dubai and Deira, followed by few minutes’ drive to the Dubai Museum that marks the history of Dubai. There after we pass through Shindagha Tunnel built underwater in year 1975 and head towards the Deira to visit the famous Gold Souq and Spice Souq. On our way out from the Old Dubai we head towards the new Dubai with our first stop at the magnificently structured Jumeirah Grand Mosque open for both Muslims and Non-Muslims. After a quick photo stop at the Jumeirah Grand Mosque we pass through Jumeirah Beach and take a view of the rich lifestyle of Dubai with globally renowned structured mansions and palaces and head towards the Burj Al Arab for a photo stop.

The tour continues towards the world’s largest manmade island known as Palm Jumeirah also located on the shores of Arabian Peninsula giving you a vibe of the place where world richest population has come together and privately owns the most expensively designed villas and town houses built on the fronds of the Palm Jumeirah Island. Further, there is a stopover in front of the famous Atlantis, The Palm and then we drive back through the Sheikh Zayed Road giving the view of Down Town Dubai along with the world’s tallest tower; Burj Khalifa. With this we end the Dubai City Tour and head towards the drop off locations.
strTitle: City Tour of New and Old Dubai

strIntroduction:
Visit the reconstructed Temple of Garni to view the classical Hellenistic temple near Garni, the only Greco Roman colonnaded building in Armenia and the former Soviet Union. Geghard is a Medieval Monastery that is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site carved out of the adjacent mountain side, surrounded by cliffs.

You will be picked up from your hotel where the tour will start at 10am and last approximately 4-5 hours. The first stop is Garni, a Pagan Temple referred to as the well known symbol of pre-Christian Armenia that was converted into a royal summer house. After exploring the grand structure you will then stop at Ararat ARC where we'll have a fantastic view to mount Ararat, a snow capped dormant volcano situated in Turkey. From here you will visit the UNESCO listed Geghard Monastery Complex. Some of the churches are situated in caves, whilst others are dug out of the surrounding rock face. You will then be transferred back to Yerevan.
strTitle: Day Tour to Garni Geghard Armenia

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the golden Autumn in Armenia. The tour starts in Yerevan where you can enjoy a 4 night, 5 day tour that includes hotel, breakfast, lunch and dinner, and all entrance fees.

Day 1:

Arrive at Zvartnots International airport where you are picked up by a driver and transferred to a hotel. In the evening you will be taken to one of Armenian restaurants to enjoy dinner and Armenian music.

Day 2:
After breakfast you will have a day trip to Garni Pagan Temple and afterwards go to Geghard Monastery Complex of 13th century. Have lunch at Geghard Gorge before heading back to your hotel.

Day 3:
After having breakfast at hotel, you will be taken to saint Hripsime church of the 7th century. Then you will move to the oldest Christian cathedral in the world, Echmiatsin and then Saint Gayane church. Have lunch at Echmiatsin before going back to hotel.

Day 4:
After breakfast at the hotel you will be taken to Ararat Konyak factory in Yerevan. After enjoying the tour in the factory you will move to Tsitsernakaberd genocide museum. Have lunch in Yerevan in one of the Armenian restaurants, then you will have fee time. In the evening there is a walking tour of Yerevan to see the last day in the evening lights.

Day 5:
Transfer to airport
strTitle: 5 Day Tour to Golden Autumn In Armenia

strIntroduction:
You are welcomed to ring in the New Year in Armenia with a special New Year celebration program with traditional Armenian food, fireworks, a lot of fun and entertainment.

This tour package will give you an insight into New Year and Christmas traditions. Armenian's believe that you will spend the year just the way they welcome it, so make your holidays memorable and joyful by taking on this fun-filled celebration program.
strTitle: New Year in Armenia

strIntroduction:
Discover Armenia in 8 days on this historical and cultural tour that will give you the general image of Armenia. Go back in history and enjoy a mix of ancient and modern.

Enjoy 8 days in Armenia discovering landmarks, mountains and shopping malls.
strTitle: 8-Day Spring in Armenia Tour

strIntroduction:
The tour starts in Yerevan, Armenia, and takes 13-14 hours. Visit the longest cable car in the world and Tatev monastery complex, including 3 monasteries and a winery with tasting.

The tour starts at 7am early in the morning. You will have breakfast on the road. The first stop is Khor Virap, which is the closest place to mount Ararat. You will then continue to Areni wine factory where you can enjoy wine tasting. After tasting why not buy some of the local produce.

You will then move on to Halidzor village where you will take the longest cable car in the world at almost 6km length. During the ride you will enjoy breathtaking views above Vorotan gorge and once at the top you will get to Tatev monastery complex, one of the biggest monasteries in Armenia. You will then return to Halidzor village by cable car. Continue the tour to Noravank monastery, the only only place where you can see God Fathers face carved. Enjoy the lunch with fantastic view of the red cliffs before returning to Yerevan.
strTitle: Day Trip to Tatev Monastery

strIntroduction:
A day tour tour that starts in Yerevan and includes Garni pagan temple, Geghard monastery complex and Sevan lake with Sevanavank.

The tour starts 9:30 in the morning. You will be picked up from hotel and your first stop will be the Arc of Ararat, where you can enjoy the fantastic view of mount Ararat. You will then move onto Garni pagan temple, which is the only pagan temple in Armenia. Pagan Temple referred to as the well known symbol of pre-Christian Armenia that was converted into a royal summer house. 

Then you will be taken to UNESCO listed Geghard monastery complex of 13th century. The tour continues to Sevan lake and Sevanavank, where you can enjoy the lunch with Sevan lake Iishkhan (trout). You will then be transferred to Yerevan.
strTitle: Day Trip to Garni,Gegard and Lake Sevan

strIntroduction:
All-inclusive tour package covering the whole of Armenia. The tour starts from Yerevan and visits all points to showcase the lengthy history and vibrant culture in Armenia.

Day 1: Arrive at Zvartnots International airport. Transferred to 3* hotel. Evening Welcome Dinner at Armenian National Show.

Day 2: Garni Pagan Temple and Geghard Monastery.
