Day 3: Visit Ejmiatsin Cathedral and Saint Hripsimé Church before moving to Zvartnots.

Day 4: Visit Tsisternakaberd genocide memorial and Matenadaran manuscripts museum. Vernisaj for the afternoon.

Day 5: Visit Amberd where you will see the Armenian Alphabet Monument, move to Stepanavan, Lori Berd and Stepanavan Dnepropark. Overnight in Stepanavan.

Day 6: Visit Tumanyan Museum, Qobayr and the Haghpat Monastery. Overnight in Dilijan.

Day 7: Visit Monastery Goshavanq and enjoy lunch at Parz Lich. Overnight in Tsaghkadzor.

Day 8: Visit Tsaghkadzor Cable car before enjoying Tea/coffee in the mounts. Walk through the forest to Sevan Lake Sevanavanq. Overnight in Tsaghkadzor.

Day 9: Visit Noratus and Selim Qarvansaray. Overnight at Jermuk.

Day 10: Visit Jermuk waterfall and enjoy a massage. Lunch in Jermuk on the river bank. Visit Aters to see special cars (optional). Ride the Jermuk Cable road, have dinner in the mount. Overnight in Jermuk

Day 11: Visit Shaqe waterfall, Halidzor. Lunch at Tatevatun, before taking the Tatev wings Cable Car to Tatev monastery. Overnight in Goris.

Day 12: Trip to Khndzoresk moving bridge and caves. Return to Goris. Optional walking tour to Old Goris village at 21:00.

Day 13: Noravanq monastery, lunch at Noravanq. In the afternoon visit Areni winery, then visit Khor Virap before going back to Yerevan.

Day 14: Free day in Yerevan

Day 15: 19:30 Faraway party at Havana restaurant before transferring to airport.
strTitle: 16-Day Tour of All of Armenia

strIntroduction:
Spend unforgettable 10 Days in Armenia. Includes almost all of Armenia with Nagorno Kharabagh .

Day 1: (D only)
Arrival at Zvartnots International airport, pick up to your 3-star hotel (one of the best ranked hotels in Yerevan), and welcome dinner.

Day 2: (B/L/D)
After breakfast you will be taken to Garni pagan temple which is the only pagan temple remaining in Armenia, then afterwards is a visit to Gegard monastery, one of the UNESCO World Heritage sites. Lunch will be at Geghard Gorge with a fantastic view and then back to the hotel in Yerevan.

Day 3: (B/L/D)
Breakfast at the hotel then a trip to Tsakhkadzor (Valley of Flowers), a very famous resort in the summer and winter. You'll then continue your trip to Sevan Lake, where you'll stay overnight in Sevan or Tsaghkadzor (a 4-star hotel)

Day 4:(B/L/D)
Breakfast at the hotel then to Noratus, which is the biggest crosstone yard (2500 Khachkars). Then onwards to Selim Qarvansaray. Lunch will be provided where you can relax on the river bank, then on to Jermuk (overnight in Jermuk in a 3-star hotel).

Day 5: (B/L/D)
After breakfast at the hotel, you will be taken to the Jermuk waterfall and water gallery, and afterwards move to Goris. Afterwards, you'll be travelling to the Old Goris caves at night (this is optional). At the end of the day, you'll be staying overnight in Goris in a 4-star hotel.

Day 6:(B/L/D)
After breakfast, you'll move on to one of the most exciting days of the tour. You'll visit Tatev monastery , which is the biggest monastery complex in Armenia; to get there, you'll use the longest cable car in the world. After lunch with a breathtaking view of Tatev Gorge, the group will continue to Nagorno Kharabagh. On the road, you will visit the city of Shoushi, the capital Stepanakert, and then to Vank village. Overnight will be at the 4-star hotel right at the mountain with clean fresh air and gorgeous views.

Day 7:(B/L/D)
In the morning enjoy a traditional village breakfast with natural products from the region. Then you'll visit one of the most beautiful monasteries, Gandzasar, that translated means a treasure mount and fully deserves its name. Then back to Goris for the overnight stay again.

Day 8:(B/L/D)
After breakfast, you'll travel to Noravank monastery and have lunch there at the monastery overlooking a view of the cliffs. Afterwards you'll be taken to Khor Virap and then back to the 3-star hotel in Yerevan.

Day 9:(B/L/D)
Free day in Yerevan to peruse the city at your leisure. 

Day 10: (B only)
The tour program is over, and you'll be transported from the hotel to the airport.
 
Please note: The tour includes breakfast, lunch and dinner (except on Days 1 and 10), plus hotel accommodation for the whole period.
strTitle: 10-Day Exploration of Armenia and Nagorno Kharabagh

strIntroduction:
The tour starts In Yerevan, Armenia. Includes 3 night 4 day hotel stay in 3* accommodation with 3 meals a day, breakfast, lunch and dinner, welcome dinner, entrance fees to attractions and tickets, tours and trips.

1st day:
Arrive at Zvartnots International airport. You will be picked up and transferred to your 3* hotel in the centre of Yerevan. In the evening you will enjoy a city tour covering Yerevan at night before enjoying a welcome dinner.
2nd day:
Wake up and have breakfast at the hotel. After breakfast you will visit Garni Geghard and Sevan lake.
3d day:
After relaxing you will visit Khor Virap, Areni Winery and Noravanq before returning to Yerevan.
4th day:
You will be transferred to the airport.
strTitle: 3 nights 4 days in Armenia

strIntroduction:
The tour starts In Yerevan, Armenia and includes 4 nights in 3* accommodation with breakfast, lunch and dinner, 4 day tours with entrance fees and tickets included; alongside a guide, transportation and a welcome dinner.

1st Day:
Arrival Zvartnots International airport. You will be picked up and transferred to Hotel Areg, a 3-4* hotel and one of the best ranked hotels in Yerevan. In the evening you will enjoy a city tour, Yerevan by night. You will then be taken to an Armenian National Show where you will enjoy a welcome dinner.
2nd Day:
Day two will begin with breakfast before being taken to Garni Pagan Temple, Gegard Monastery. You will then have lunch at Geghard Gorge before moving on to view Ejmiatsin cathedral. Afterwards you will return to the hotel for dinner.
3d Day:
Enjoy breakfast, then visit Khor Virap and Areni Winery, where you can taste the local produce. Afterwards you will move onto Noravanq Monastery before having lunch at Noravank. After lunch visit Jermuk spa town before heading back to Yerevan for dinner.

4th Day:
On the fourth day have breakfast before visiting Sevan lake, Dilijan and Goshavanq Monastery. Relax at lunch in the forest restaurant, then continue onto Haghartsin monastery and return to Yerevan.

5th Day:
Transfer to airport
strTitle: Discover Armenia in 4 Nights 5 Days

strIntroduction:
A day tour starting from Yerevan to the St Ejmiatsin (Echmiatsin) Cathedral and Hripsime and Gayane Churches.

In the morning visit Etchmiadzin Cathedral. This is the mother church of the Armenian Apostolic Church located in the city of Vagharshapat, Armenia. Most scholars believe this to be the first Cathedral, but not the first church built in ancient Armenia. It is also believed to be the oldest cathedral in the world
After visiting the Cathedral you will visit Saint Hripsimé Church, which is one of the oldest surviving churches in Armenia. The church was erected by Catholicos Komitas atop the original mausoleum in 395 AD that contained the remains of the martyred Saint Hripsimé. The church was dedicated to Saint Hripsimé and the structure was completed in 618 AD.
The third visit will be to Church of Saint Gayane that was built by Catholicos Ezra I in the year 630. It is located within walking distance from the Etchmiadzin Cathedral. This is a 7th-century Armenian church in Vagharshapat (Etchmiadzin) the religious center of Armenia. St. Gayane.
strTitle: Day Tour to Echmiatsin Cathedral, St Hripsime and St Gayane Armenia

strIntroduction:
A day trip from Yerevan to lake Sevan Peninsula, Sevanavank, Tsakhkadzor and Kecharis Monastery.

Be transferred from Yerevan to Sevan lake. Sevan Lake is your first stop and is on the Sevan peninsula with Sevanavank. Enjoy a fantastic view of the "Blue Queen" of Armenia. The moving onto Tsaghkadzor, the valley of flowers. Here you will take the rope way up to the mount. After a short walk enjoy tea or coffee with the fresh air of Mount Teghenis. Afterwards move back to Kecharis Monastery. Lunch is not included but can be arranged in Sevan. The restaurants in Sevan lake are famous for fish (Ishkhan or trout) or in Tsaghkadzor in a local restaurant. You will then be transferred back to Yerevan.
strTitle: Day Tour to Sevan Lake, Tsakhkadzor Rope Way and Kecharis Monastery in Armenia

strIntroduction:
The tour starts from Yerevan, Armenia and includes the main attractions of country. Includes hotel accommodation for the whole period, tours and trips, entrance fees, a guide and full board with meals included.

Experience Armenia in this 7 day trip.
strTitle: Discover Armenia in 7 days

strIntroduction:
Explore the history and culture of Eastern Europe. This tour starts from Tbilisi and includes 2 countries: Georgia and Northern Armenia.

1st day: Arrival at Tbilisi international airport with included transfer to the hotel in Tbilisi. In the evening you'll be taken to Tbilisi Funicular to enjoy the fantastic view of the city while eating dinner. Afterwards, enjoy a walk on the Bridge of Peace and then back to the hotel.
2nd day: After breakfast you'll be taken to Samebo cathedral, the biggest religious building in Georgia and southern Caucasus. After visiting, you'll head to Armenia with your overnight stay in Ijevan.
3d day: After breakfast you'll be taken to Goshavank monastery complex and moving to Sevan lake. Lunch at the lake, and then the group will travel to Yerevan for the overnight stay (3* hotel).
4th day: Breakfast at the hotel; afterwards you'll visit Yerevan's famous Konyak factory. Enjoy the shops (with possibility to buy), and then you'll visit the Tsitsernakaberd Genocide Museum. Lunch will be in the city, with free time after.
5th day: After breakfast it'll be time for a day trip to Garni pagan temple, which is more then 2000 years old. After, you'll be taken to Geghard monastery complex. Enjoy the lunch at Geghard Gorge with a fantastic view, and then you'll head back to Yerevan. In the evening, dinner will be local Armenian cuisine, with Armenian national music.
6th day: Enjoy the last breakfast in Yerevan and travel to the Northern part of Armenia. Visit to Haghpat and Odzun monasteries, and overnight in Alavaerdi (close to the Georgian border).
7th day: After breakfast, the group will travel to Georgia. You'll get to visit the Narikala Fortress by a cable car. OIvernight stay will be in Tbilisi.
8th day: Transfer to Tbilisi International Airport.
strTitle: 8-Day Tour of Armenia and Georgia

strIntroduction:
Don't miss one of the world's most famous archaeological sites with this 3-hour tour of Pompeii, including a transfer from any point in Naples.

Get picked up from any point within central Naples and travel to the nearby archaeological site of Pompeii, the town buried by the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 A.D. and preserved nearly intact throughout the centuries.

The tour will introduce the lifestyle of ancient Pompeii. See astonishing villas, shops and public buildings that archaeologists brought back to light.

Stop at a local shop on the way back to look at the productive process of cameos and corals.
strTitle: Pompei Excursion from Naples

strIntroduction:
Visit the Royal Palace of Caserta, built by the King of Naples, Charles of Bourbon and designed by the architect Luigi Vanvitelli in 1752. You can admire the beautiful park that stretches over 3200 yards (3 km) long with its fountains, great waterfall and majestic gardens. Inside the palace, you will find 1200 rooms in the heart of Baroque-style. In the afternoon, you will stop at an outlet mall for some shopping.

Depart from Naples in the morning from either your hotel or cruise port, and you will travel to Caserta, approximately 45 minutes away, where you will visit the amazing Royal Palace. It is the largest palace in the world and has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1997. Several movies were filmed here, including Star Wars Episodes I and II.

In the afternoon, visit La Reggia Designer Outlet for your lunch of pizza in the show cooking-style, then spend some free time for shopping among the major brands such as Prada, Armani, Roberto Cavalli, and Vercase.

In the late afternoon, you will be brought back to your departure point.
strTitle: Private Tour: Royal Palace of Caserta and Shopping Tour from Naples

strIntroduction:
In the old city center you will be guest of this charming restaurant within a local's home. The host is a vegan and her food mixes perfectly traditional and vegan values. The house is located in an area with over three centuries of rich cultural history to it. So come learn how dinner is made, and then eat this delicious meal.

The program starts with a transfer from any part of Napoli city to this amazing home restaurant in the old city center. The menu will depend on the fresh ingredients available that day. You will spend some time socializing with other guests and enjoy a great vegan dinner. The owner will explain how to prepare some dishes and she will answer any questions you may have as she goes. 
The house is very big and there are 2 cats living there, in spring and summer the dinner will be eaten in a big terrace surrounded by ancient buildings (when the weather permits)

After the dinner you will be transferred back to the hotel and end of services.
strTitle: Vegan Dinner in Home Restaurant in Naples with Transfer

strIntroduction:
Night visit to the active Volcano Solfatara with transfer and pickup from any place of Napoli city. During the visit there will be a brief wine tasting of Falanghina wines.

The guided evening visit of the Solfatara is an amazing experience, it will leave a unique memory and the emotion will be great.

An expert guide of the site will illustrate the most important places with stories both serious and playful, freely mixing history, science and mythology.

The path will lead you through the site and then onwards to the steamy fumaroles, where an experiment involving geothermal cuisine takes place; fresh blue fish from the Gulf cooked in the steam of a fumarole at 160°! Anchovyes will be matched with typical Falanghina from Campi Flegrei, a native wine.

The tour lasts about two and a half hours.
strTitle: Night Guided Visit of Solfatara with Transfer and Brief Wine Tasting

strIntroduction:
Special evening tour to discover Naples by night having a sightseeing of the ancient village of Marechiaro (including tour by boat operated from April to October). Enjoy a great pizza in a famous Pizzeria and discover parts of the city you would not see by yourself.
Pick-up from any part of Naples city.

An evening tour starting with a pickup at your accommodation in the city of Naples, followed by a transfer to the Pizzeria where a table will be waiting for you. Enjoy a pizza of your choice, together with a soft drink and you may also choose a dessert (extras to be paid on the spot).

After the pizza, transfer to a bay close to Naples (approx. 20 minutes) to start the sightseeing by boat (on a typical goiter); the sightseeing by boat is operated from April to October and it will last about 1 hour. You will be accompanied by a tour leader throughout all evening, you will also have a written description of the locations approached during the sightseeing.

After the tour, transfer back to the accommodation. This tour is subject to weather condition.
strTitle: Neapolitan Pizza and Naples Night Sightseeing by Boat

strIntroduction:
Discover one of the most important producer of typical wine in the Vesuvius area. Explore the wineyards with the tour guide and be amazed by the anecdotes you will receive, have a typical lunch served with all different types of wine. Transfer from any part of Naples or towns listed is included; available transfer options from Salerno, Caserta and Avellino. From any other location transfer can be quoted on demand.

Departure from any part of Napoli city or other cities as per tour options, arrival to the location will be approximately after 40 minutes drive. Once arrived, you will visit the wineyards with a local guide: you will be guided through the yards and provided with explanation of the cultivation stage, type of grape and cultivation systems. The visit will end on the main terrace or in the restaurant, depending on the weather. After the tour a typical lunch with different types of wine will be served.

The menu:

Starter: 'Pan e Pumarol', a typical bread with organic tomatoes and extra vergin olive oil.
Main Course: Pasta di Gragnano allo scarpariello (tomatoes, basil, cheese).
Second Course: grilled organic vegetables, provolone cheese DOP, salami, bacon, olives, sun-dried vegetables.
Dessert: Mum Angela's plum cake with homemade organic jam. 

The visit will last approximately 2 hours in total.
strTitle: Wine Tour and Lunch with Winetasting and Vineyard Visit

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a nice dinner, based on a fish menu, in a typical Neapolitan restaurant with a panoramic view of the city.

If every time you have been abroad you always wanted to taste the typical dishes, go out for dinner as a local citizen, trying to feel as you are living there and every place you have been to you were looking for several restaurants without knowing what to choose, try this Dinner in Napoli experience.
This is where our philosophy comes from: give you the chance to choose between many restaurants, many dishes and go out for dinner with us. Here in Napoli you can find the best kitchen in the world. After choosing the date and time we will pick you up, passing through the most beautiful parts of the city giving you the time to do some sightseeing and to take pictures and then we will bring you to the restaurant to enjoy an unforgettable dinner. We will be with you during all the evening and we will be there to assist you with anything, even if you want us to take photos of you during this great experience.
strTitle: Dinner in Napoli - Seafood Menu

strIntroduction:
Sit down to dinner in a charming Naples restaurant to savor a meat-based menu of local specialties. Join a local guide for a brief tour before dinner, on the way from your hotel to the restaurant, to learn about the sights and also to ensure a memorable meal. Get dropped off at your hotel after dinner.

Get picked up at your hotel and travel to a charming restaurant in Naples for an authentic dining experience.

Enjoy a brief tour of this historic city en route from your hotel to the restaurant, passing through the most beautiful parts of Naples, with time to do a little sightseeing and take some photographs. Dine in style on Neapolitan specialties (a meat-based menu) with the advice of your guide to steer you in the right direction.

If every time you have been abroad you always wanted to taste the typical dishes and go out for dinner as a local citizen, trying to feel as you are living there, and in every place you have been to you were looking for several restaurants without knowing what to choose, try this dinner in Napoli experience.
strTitle: Dinner in Napoli - Meat Menu

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a walk through some of Napoli's famous streets, led by an expert guide and end the night with a delicious Neapolitan Pizza in a historical Pizzeria.

If every time you have been abroad you always wanted to taste the typical dishes, go out for dinner as a local citizen, trying to feel as you are living there and in every place you have been to you were looking for several restaurants without knowing what to choose, try this dinner in Napoli experience.

This is where our philosophy comes from: give you the chance to choose between many restaurants, many dishes and go out for dinner with us. Here in Napoli you can find the best kitchens in the world. After choosing the date and time we will pick you up, passing through the most beautiful parts of the city, giving you the time to do some sightseeing and take pictures. After that, you will be taken to the restaurant to enjoy an unforgettable dinner. We will be with you during the evening and we will be there to assist you with anything, even if you want us to take photos during this great experience.
strTitle: Sightseeing Tour and Pizza in Napoli

strIntroduction:
Visit the Campi Flegrei volcanic area and explore ancient Roman sites at your own pace on this Solfatara of Pozzuoli visit from Naples. Travel from Naples into the Campi Flegrei volcanic area — home to the mighty Solfatara of Pozzuoli. Explore the site and marvel at the jets of steam and bubbling mud pools you find. Then, take in top sites of interest from the Roman era such as the Acropolis of Cuma, the Baths of Baia and the Flavian Amphitheater (own expense) before returning to Naples.

Following a convenient pickup in Naples at a time to suit your schedule, leave the city behind and travel into the Italian countryside to the Solfatara of Pozzuoli — a crater located in the Campi Flegrei volcanic area.

On arrival, enjoy admission to the site and explore at your leisure. During your visit, watch jets of hot steam shooting from the fumaroles and see sulphurous mud pools bubbling in the geothermal terrain.

From here, travel onward to local sites of interest including the Acropolis of Cuma, the Baths of Baia, the Flavian Amphitheater and the Temple of Serapis, and enjoy free time to explore the historic sites at your own pace (own expense).

Afterward, return in comfort to Naples to conclude your tour.
strTitle: Transfer from Naples to Volcano Solfatara with Entrance Ticket

strIntroduction:
Forty meters below the characteristic and lively streets of the historic center of Naples, you find a different world. Isolated by time, unexplored until recently, but deeply connected with the current world above. It’s the heart of Naples, and the place from which the city was born. To visit it is to travel 2,400 years in the past. Every historic epic, from the foundation of Neopolis, to the bombs of WWII, has left it’s mark on the walls of the yellow tufa stone, the soul of Naples, the stone with which the city was built. Come, join this magical 2.5 hour journey back in time.

You will be collected in Naples at a prearranged time and location and transferred to the Naples Underground (if the option with transfer is selected). Traveling back in time, you'll descend flights of stairs in and emerge into the honeycombed underground, with its haunting and mysterious history.

Descending approximately 40 meters below ground, you'll witness a few of the tuffaceous cavities, excavated in the 4th century, and used as cisterns for the water supply of the city for approximately 23 centuries. The environment is spacious and illuminated, except for a short segment where the tour is optional, but full of charm as each person is given a candle to light their own path. The walking surface is smooth and straight. You will visit the air raid shelters from the Second World War too, the War Museum and the Hypogeum Gardens, as well as the Greek-Roman Aqueduct. This part of the tour will last approximately 1-hour.

You'll also visit in the remains of the ancient Roman Theater of Neapolis by entering through a typical Neapolitan house at ground floor. The emperor Nero kept a private dressing room here, for when he performed his shows in Naples. This part of the tour will last approximately 20-minutes.

After the tour of Naples Underground, pizza with soft drink will be served at a typical pizzaria nearby, if this option is selected.
strTitle: Guided Naples Underground Tour with Transport

strIntroduction:
Discover one of the Mediterranean's most beautiful islands on this 7-hour day trip to Capri. In the morning, embark from Naples via ferry and discover this enchanting locale, long a destination for jet-setters and style-seekers. In the comfort of an air-conditioned vehicle, discover the town of Anacapri, the Villa San Michele, the Gardens of Augustus, and indulge in a traditional local lunch, all while drinking in the stunning scenery. Ferry transit and entrance fees are payable at your own expense.

At 9am, meet your guide at the Port of Naples, where you’ll board a ferry. Your destination is Capri, a Mediterranean island as famous for its style and jetset appeal as it is its beautifully rugged scenery. It’s approximately an hour’s trip to the island, during which you can drink in the Mediterranean views.

Upon your arrival on Capri, you’ll head to your first stop: the town of Anacapri, located at the base of Mt. Solaro. Admire its tranquil streets before venturing to the Villa San Michele, built by Swedish physician Axel Munthe in the 19th century. Today, the villa is a place of remarkable natural beauty, and is accompanied by lovely gardens. After you wander, stop for a traditional local lunch.

Next, venture to the town of Capri, where you can linger in the famous main square. See the town’s picturesque walking streets (including the Via Camerelle, Via Tragara, and Via Le Botteghe), browse the cafes and boutiques, and admire the Gardens of Augustus, too.

After you’ve had time to discover Capri’s charms, board another ferry back to the port of Naples, where the tour will end around 4pm. Entry fees to sites and ferry transit are not included in the itinerary price.
strTitle: Full-Day Capri Highlights Tour

strIntroduction:
Discover the history and culture of the famous Whirling Dervishes during this 1-hour at Istanbul’s Hodjapasha. Wander the Whirling Dervishes’ museum and learn about their traditional ceremonies, clothing, musical instruments and tools. Read about the famous mystic Rumi and enjoy some of his best poems before experiencing a traditional Whirling Dervish ceremony, one of the most important rituals in Turkish culture. 

Immerse in an important part of traditional Turkish culture during this visit to a 1-hour Whirling Dervish museum and ceremony. Sip on a complimentary soft drink in the lobby and wander the exhibitions featuring traditional clothes, instruments and tools from the mystical Sufis.

Watch a short film about the famous mystic Rumi and enjoy classical Turkish music during a concert performed by a traditional orchestra. Then prepare to be mesmerized as a Whirling Dervish ceremony begins, compete with 360-degree special effects and a beautiful, historic setting.

This evening of cultural music and dance lasts approximately one hour and seating is first booked, first served. The Whirling Dervish ceremony has been preserved on UNESCO’s list of Intangible Heritage of Humanity and is an approximately 800-year-old Turkish tradition.
strTitle: Whirling Dervishes at Hodjapasha

strIntroduction:
Beginning in Arusha, you'll head out to some of Africa's most famous safari destinations to see the wild drama of the African savannah play out before your eyes. Afterwards, you'll take a much deserved rest on the white sand beaches of the fabled spice island of Zanzibar.

Bush to Beach Safari trip to Tanzania includes everything you need for two weeks of excitement and relaxation.The Northern National Parks are a true African experience, and one of Tanzania's main attractions. The entire Tanzanian ecosystem is on display here: birds, reptiles, mammals, and the mighty Savanna Acacia trees. The parks stretch across a varied landscape, from wooded hills in the north to the southern grassy plains.
strTitle: Bush to Beach Safari Adventure

strIntroduction:
Get a comprehensive look at the food, culture and history of Dhaka during this 10-hour city sightseeing excursion. Explore historic sights like Parliament House and Lalbag Fort, and get a glimpse of Dhaka religious landmarks like the Hindu Dhakeswari Temple and Star Mosque. You’ll also get to sample local cuisine during an included lunch and make an afternoon stop at a Dhaka street food market (seasonal).

Receive a morning pickup from your Dhaka hotel between 8:00 am to 9:00 am. You will then make the day’s first stop at the Dhaka Parliament House, a massive structure designed by American architect Louis Kahn.

Later in the morning between 9:30 am to 11:30 am you’ll move towards Dhaka University to see Dhakeswari Temple. This state-owned Hindu religious site is considered the spiritual heart of the Hindu community in Bangladeshi capital. You’ll also get a quick look at the National Museum. Continue from there to Star Mosque, a beautiful Islamic site adorned with stars, and admire an Armenian Orthodox Church.

You’ll then take a break for a lunch of authentic local Dhaka cuisine before proceeding to visit Lalbag Fort and to see the intricate architecture of Ahsan Manzil. Head next to Sadarghat, Dhaka’s busy port area. If time permits, you’ll take a boat ride from here to explore daily life for Dhaka residents along the river banks.

During Dhaka’s annual Ramadan observance, the tour continues to the jam-packed street food market that sets up shop just before the sunset and quickly vanishes after sundown. If it is not the month of Ramadan, you may instead visit Banga Bazaar, known to locals as “the cheapest market in the world.” At the bazaar you can also check out Nilkhet book market or enjoy a horse cart ride. At the end of the day, you’ll receive a drop-off back at your hotel.
strTitle: Old Dhaka Discovery Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Chittagong is a port city and also the second biggest city in Bangladesh. The city is blended with natural beauty like rivers, sea and green hills along with some historic establishment of the British period. The city is a bit different from other cities of Bangladesh because of its natural beauty and less contamination. Experiencing Chittagong with us will make you savor the city life, historic stations and natural beauty.

9:00 am – 10:15 am: We will pick you up at your hotel in Chittagong City and drive towards the “Baizid Bostami Majar”. Although it is considered to be a ritual place for traditional Muslim, you will see masses of other religion paying their tribute to the tomb. There are some old rear turtles that are considered as sacred animals and feed with special food (available for purchase at the nearby shops) by the visitor as a symbol of fulfillment of their wish.

10:45 am – 11:30 am: Moving towards the middle of the city, we will have a walk in World War II Cemetery. Afterwards visit a museum located in Chittagong Circuit House built from the British period. The museum interprets the lifetime of one of the most illustrious president in the history of Bangladesh who was seasoned in the very house.

11:45 am -12:45 pm: Walking from the museum, we will look at some establishment of British period like Railway Station, 7 Jongson road, tiger pass and more.

12:45 pm- 1:30 pm: We will have lunch at a popular local restaurant and begin moving towards Vatieary.

2:00 pm - 3:00 pm: Visit the Vatieary Lake and experience a walk in the famous Ship-breaking Yard Shops and findout how every part of a ship reused and reinvented.

4:00 pm – 5:30 pm: Go to the Patenga Sea Beach and roam around the nearby beach market. You will love the roaring sea and its waves crashing over the rocks.

5:30 pm – 6:30 pm: The river Karafuli is next to the city and meets the sea in the nearby area. We will travel to the Estuary of the river and set for some fresh breath. You may enjoy spicy crab fry and snakes while sitting on the rampart of the river. We may have a boat ride on the Karnaphuli River if time and tide permit (depending on the weather and availability).

6:30 pm - 8:00 pm: Head back towards your hotel using the river sided road and enjoy the golden sunset at the sea port. We will drop you off at your hotel in Chittagong City after the tour is concluded.
strTitle: Chittagong City Day Tour

strIntroduction:
This day tour will take you to experience the authentic culture and heritage of the Bengali nation. From the deep history of Mugal Empire to British transformation. The tour will show you the past and future of Bangladesh and experience the capitalist transformation based on the its history.

Morning Start:
8:00 am – 9:45 am: We will pick you up from your hotel or place of residence in Dhaka start moving towards Sonargaon (approx. 1 to 1.5 hours).

9:45 am – 10:15 am: First we will visit Goaldi Mosque built in 1519 A.D. in a village named Goaldi in Sonargaon by Mulla Hizabar Akbar Khan during the reign of Sutan Hussain Shah.

10:30 am – 11:30 am: We will go to Shadar Bari that used to be a King's palace but now is converted to Folk Art and Craft Museum and also cover the newly constructed building of folk art as well. We will travel around the campus briefly and you will experience the authentic culture and inheritance of the Bengali nation.

11:45 am – 1:00 pm: We will visit the Panam City built in 1900. Some wealthy Hindu colon business men used to live here but they left during India Pakistan partition. The rich architecture and the single road divided colonial system buildings are the highlights of the tour.

Lunch :
1:00 pm – 2:00 pm: We will have lunch at a local restaurant with local food that is usually a little spicy. Otherwise, please notify us after booking.

2:00 pm – 3:00 pm: We will impose a unique primary school made of bamboo and is renowned for its unparalleled invention. During this period, you can meet local children and people and have a glance of their country spirit.

3:00 pm – 4:00 pm: We will have a boat ride to Meghna River, one of the three major rivers that makes Bangladesh a wetland.

Afternoon Return Journey:
4:00 pm – 6:30 pm: Drive back to hotel in Dhaka by a different path. You will savor the sunset as well as the country life.
strTitle: Sonargaon Day Tour from Dhaka

strIntroduction:
Visit Srimangal for a relaxing getaway. Embrace Srimangal's green and tranquil environment with forest and natural wetland. Enjoy the tea garden and make your weekend special and unforgettable. Relax in the evening or create a schedule that works for you in Dhaka.

Day-1: Reaching Srimangal
• Pick up at 7.00 am from the hotel/residence, transfer to Bus stop which will take you to Srimangal. It is a 4-5 hours journey from Dhaka. We will provide private vehicle for a group of 3 person or more.
• Check into the eco-resort in Srimangal. You may also ask us to book resort in tea garden which might be confirmed up on availability.
• After lunch, explore nearby tea gardens in Srimangal by Riding Cycle. Visit a tea factory to see the process of making tea.
• After returning to the hotel and freshen up, go for dinner on a local restaurant.
• Overnight stay at Srimangal.

Day-2: Exploring wildlife at Lawachara National Park, Srimangal
• Start early morning for a rewarding wildlife trek through the Lawachara National Park. We take the 3 hours trail for the maximum opportunity to see wildlife, specially the Hollock Gibbons for which is this forest famous for.
• After breakfast, continue sight-seeing. Lunch at a local restaurant.
• Return to the hotel and take some rest.
• Spend the evening by riding local boats at the beautiful Madhabpur lake.
• Dinner at a local restaurant. Overnight stay at srimangal.

Day-03: Hiking at Rajkandi Reserve Forest to Hamham Waterfalls or Baikkar Beel
• Start early morning and drive toward Rajkandi Reserve Forest on a old model 4×4 car through a broken muddy road. Arrive at Kalabanpara village in the edge of the forest in 1.5 hours, and start laborious trekking through the Rajkandi Reserve Forest to discover Hamham Waterfalls. You need to track 3 hours through the up and down hills to reach the waterfalls. Upon arrival on the waterfall, we’ll have 01 hour break to have lunch, and start our return journey. we’ll hike 3-4 hours through knee deep water to Kalabanpara, and drive back to Srimangal in the evening. If water level is higher than usual because of rain, we’ll return on the same hilly way.

OR

• Very Early in the morning we towards Baikkar Beel for bird watching. You will find thousands of birds chanting your name and roming around. We will walk through the bush and ride watch tower to have a close look at the birds life.
• We will have lunch and start our return journey to Dhaka leaving back tea garden in the evening.
• Drop at your hotel/residence at late evening. End of the tour.
strTitle: 3-Day Srimangal Tour

strIntroduction:
Witness Bangladesh's beautiful rivers, back waterways and channels through this all-inclusive tour. Bangladesh is a riverine country with about 700 rivers and tributaries flow through its land, totaling in about 15,000 miles (24,140 kilometers) in waterway length. This tours starts with the river cruise from Dhaka and takes you to Dhaka via waterways. Along the way you'll visit archaeological places in Bagerhat and a backwater trip in Barishal to watch floating market activities.

Day 1
3:30pm to 5:30pm: We will meet you at your place of residence or hotel and start our journey to Sadarghat; the steamer terminal is one of the most crowded places of Dhaka.

6pm to overnight: After experiencing the busy port, our paddle steamer will pick you up at 6pm, just in time for dinner. After dinner, you can step outside for a breath of fresh air and take in the surrounding areas.

Day 2
6am to 10am: There's no need to wake up so early unless you're interested in capturing the scenic beauty of village morning; otherwise, you can lie in bed and enjoy breakfast in your room. During this time the streamer will pass through a number of rivers and reach Hularhat.

10:30am to 2:30pm: You will be taken to different places in Bagerhat such as Khan Jahan's mausoleum, Shat Gombuj (Sixty Dome) Mosque and a museum. We will have lunch in Traditional Restaurant near Steamer Station.

2:30pm to 6:30pm: We will try to see the returning steamer to reach Barishal, if time allows. Otherwise, we will catch a local bus to reach Barishal. You will check in to a hotel and stay overnight.

Day 3
5:30am to 8:30am: In order to catch the floating market, you'll need an early start. Traveling via Tuk Tuk, you'll reach the bank of Shondha River from where you will start back water trip.

8:30am to 5pm: You will be exploring the backwater trip and riverside life of Bangladesh by local engine boat. On the path you will find unique floating vegetable gardens, colorful floating market. If it’s during the rainy season, you may find a wood boat market along with Guava Market most of the day. You'll move through rivers and canals, where you'll learn about different fishing techniques and how the river plays a lively part in village life. You'll have lunch in a homely restaurant and after you'll take a trip to the Guthia Mosque.

6:00pm to overnight: You will start the return overnight journey to Dhaka by steamer. If your trip lands on a full moon, you'll be able to enjoy the view from the roof.

Day 4
When the cruise ends, we will take you back to your hotel in Dhaka.
strTitle: 3-Night Paddle Steamer and Backwater River Cruise

strIntroduction:
Travel to Agra from New Delhi in private air-conditioned transportation to visit one of the world's most iconic monuments, the Taj Mahal. The Taj Mahal is probably the best known monument to love that was ever built. Your full-day private guided tour also includes visits to the Agra Fort and Mehtab Bagh. In addition, you will enjoy lunch in a multi-cuisine restaurant.

Enjoy a day trip from Delhi to experience the Mughal Heritage in Agra. A private car with a private chauffeur will pick you up from your hotel in Delhi, Noida or Gurgaon. You’ll travel on the new expressway by air-conditioned car, and then, upon arrival at Agra, you will meet your guide for the day.

You will make your first stop at the Taj Mahal, one of the most extravagant expressions of love ever created. Your guide will share his insight and will teach you about the history of the Taj Mahal, which was built in the 17th century by Emperor Shah Jahan as a memorial to his beloved wife Mumtaz.

After touring the Taj Mahal, you will head to the nearby Agra Fort, built in 1565 A.D. It is another majestic creation of the Mughal Emperor Akbar. Your guide will help you explore the majestic red-sandstone fort which is comprised of many fairy-tale palaces such as Jahangir Palace and the Khas Mahal, audience halls such as the Diwan-i-Khas, and two very beautiful mosques.

After your time at Agra Fort, enjoy a lunch break at an air-conditioned multi-cuisine restaurant. After lunch you’ll head to the Mehtab Bagh. From here you will be able to enjoy the stunning view of the of the rear side Taj Mahal, with its image reflected in the mighty river Yamuna.

After your time at the Mehtab Bagh, you can explore the local handicraft markets and shopping centers of the city. Here you can look for marble inlay work, fine quality carpets, Zari and embroidery, leather goods and more. In the evening, drive back to Delhi, Gurgaon or Noida and arrive in your hotel around 6pm.
strTitle: Taj Mahal and Agra Full-Day Private Guided Tour from Delhi by Car

strIntroduction:
Have you watched the sunrise over the marble mausoleum of the Taj Mahal or explore the impressive walled exteriors and inner paradise of the Red Fort? This private city tour will show you the Taj Mahal from the Mehtab Bagh on the other side of the Yamuna River, looking inside the romantic temple to Mumtaz Mahal, wife of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan. You will also visit the abandoned city of Fatehpur Sikri that is also known as a Ghost Town.

6am - Pick up from your hotel in Agra, Agra Cantt. Railway Station or Agra Airport and leave for the sunrise view of Taj Mahal.

8am - Proceed to the Taj Mahal which was built in the 17th century by Emperor Shah Jahan for his beloved wife Mumtaz.

11am - Visit the Agra Fort, built in 1565 A.D another majestic creation by the Mughal Emperor Akbar.

1pm - Lunch break.

2pm - Just after Lunch proceed to the tour of Fatehpur Sikri (approx. 45 km/1 Hour drive). Fatehpur Sikri also known as Ghost City was built by Emperor Akbar in the 16th Century with marvelous red stones work in the palaces.

5pm - Visit Mehtab Bagh for Sunset View of Taj Mahal.

7pm - After the full-day tour, return to your hotel in Agra, Agra Cantt. Railway Station or Agra Airport.
strTitle: Private City Tour: Taj Mahal Sunrise and Sunset in Agra

strIntroduction:
See the sun rise and set over the world-famous Taj Mahal, and explore Agra Fort and Fatehpur Sikri on a private full-day tour from Delhi traveling by express train through the countryside. Your local guide will share stories of rulers, palaces, wealth, and revenge, show you some of the monuments’ most intriguing details, and even take photos as you pose for the camera. Transportation to and from your Delhi hotel or the airport, round-trip train tickets, and meals on the train are included.

5AM : You’ll be picked up at your hotel from anywhere in Delhi/Noida/Gurgaon/Faridabad/Ghaziabad by air conditioned car for the transfer to the New Delhi railway station.

6AM : Depart from the New Delhi railway station for Agra. Driver will show you the seat. Enjoy the speedy, fully air conditioned express train with breakfast on board.

8:10AM : Meet your private guide and driver at the Agra Cantt railway station, looking for the sign (placard) with your name at exit.

8:15AM : Begin your private tour in an air conditioned car, accompanied by your guide; visit the Taj Mahal.

  • The Taj Mahal was built in the 17th century by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan as a memorial for his beloved wife Mumtaz.

11AM : After touring the Taj Mahal you’ll head to the nearby Agra Fort.

  • Agra Fort was built in 1565 A.D. and it is another majestic creation of the Mughal Emperor Akbar.

1PM : Enjoy a lunch break at an air conditioned multi-cuisine restaurant.

2PM : Just after Lunch proceed for the tour of Fatehpur Sikri (23 miles/1 Hour Drive).

  • Fatehpur Sikri also known as Ghost City, built by Emperor Akbar in the 16th century, with marvelous red stones work in the palaces.

After Fatehpur,  spend your last hour enjoying a bite to eat or coffee at a nearby restaurant.

5PM : Later, you’ll be transferred to the Agra Cantt railway station for the return journey to New Delhi. Supper will be served in the train.

7:30PM : A driver will pick you up at the New Delhi railway station for the transfer back to your accommodation.
strTitle: Private Day Trip by Train: Taj Mahal, Agra Fort, and Fatehpur Sikri from Delhi

strIntroduction:
Your local expert and driver will pick you up and let you enjoy Berlin in a private 4-hour tour with its history, art, architecture and flair! Book a private custom tour in a nice sedan for up to 2 people or a luxurious van for up to 3 to 6 people to get a tailored itinerary and experience all the major highlights of Berlin including pickup and drop off at your hotel.
This is a premium service, all vehicles are equipped with air conditioning, WiFi and refreshments. The service will be carried in a Mercedes Benz S-Class, VW Phaeton, Mercedes V-Class, Mercedes Benz Viano or equivalent.

Explore Berlin in a 4-hour private custom tour and choose from the following interesting topics:

Berlin's Jewish heritage in the quarters Mitte, Charlottenburg, Schöneberg and visit the memorials, the Jewish Cemetery in Weissensee and the Jewish Museum.

Put a focus on World War II history and the Cold War period, visit Wilhelmstrasse, see the place where Hitler's bunker was, see Topography of terror former Nazi headquarters, Checkpoint Charlie, drive to the Allied Museum (airlift) or to the German-Russian Museum in Karlshorst -- where the capitulation was signed, emphasizing the Russian point of view -- passing by the monumental Sowjet Memorial in Treptow.

See the Berlin Wall and retrace the history of the German division and reunification at Bernauer Strasse Wall Memorial, find some other wall remains throughout the city, maybe visit the corresponding section in the German Historical Museum.
strTitle: Private Custom Berlin Wall and Third Reich Half-Day Tour with Guide in Luxury Vehicle

strIntroduction:
The Golden Circle is one of the most popular routes in Iceland which brings you to experience not only Iceland’s nature, but also geology and history. This tour also comes with an additional adventure to the Langjokull Glacier on a 4x4 Super Jeep. Visit Þingvellir (Thingvellir) National Park where Viking settlers stood centuries ago to edict national laws, Geysir geothermal area, Gullfoss, the spectacular golden waterfall, and Langjokull, the second largest glacier in Iceland where you will have the option to take a snowmobile ride as well.

Our first stop takes us to Thingvellir National Park where the oldest parliament was founded in the world over 1000 years ago. Many crucial events in Icelandic history took part here and it is also on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Here you will also see how the earth is ever so slowly pulling apart along the North-America and Eurasian tectonic plates.

Next, visit the Geysir geothermal area in Haukadalur where you can see geysers, hot springs, steam vents and eerie blue algae. Although the Great Geysir is relatively dormant, Strokkur, also being one of the largest and most powerful geysers and erupts almost every 5 minutes.

Then, proceed to Gullfoss waterfall, which many consider to be the queen of Icelandic waterfalls, as it is both high and mighty and stumbles in a deep gorge. Gullfoss is in fact two separate waterfalls, the upper one has an 11m drop and the lower one has a 21m drop which is beautifully angled, creating a dramatic cascade. Here you will have a lunch break at Gullfoss Café, before trying out our Super Jeep vehicles off road to the second largest glacier in Iceland, the Long Glacier, Langjokull. The ride will take you across glaciers and highlands, splashing through rivers and the rough terrain. You will enjoy the landscape from your Super Jeep while occasionally stopping to see the incredible sights.

After an off-road ride, head to the amazing 3,000 years-old Kerið crater before driving back to Reykjavik. At Kerið crater you will also have the option to walk into the crater at a minimal entrance fee (EUR 2/USD 3).

Snowmobiling on Langjökull glacier is optional and is offered at an additional price. Also please note that this activity is subject to weather conditions.

Optional Activity: 1 hour of snowmobiling
There is an additional activity available at an additional cost (22,200 ISK for double rider; 28,200 ISK for solo rider). This will be available after booking.

Once onsite at Langjokull, you have the option of being outfitted with a snowsuit, insulated mittens and a safety helmet then given clear and precise instructions for handling these powerful machines. Led by the experienced mountain guide, the snowmobiles shoot off in single file for an hour of often high-speed driving along the carefully chosen route over the glacier. The return journey down from the glacier provides further unmissable photo opportunities on this action-packed day.
strTitle: Private Golden Circle Super Jeep Glacier Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
See Iceland’s diverse landscape on this 9-hour private tour from Reykjavik. Drive past volcanoes, find waterfalls and see the dramatic rock formations on black sand beaches. Enjoy a flexible itinerary and convenient pickup and drop-off at your hotel.

Your tour begins at 8:30am when your private guide picks you up at your hotel in a rugged 4x4 vehicle. Drive south through the diverse Icelandic landscape to your first stop.

Visit Urriðafoss, also known as the trout waterfall. It falls down the margin of the Þjórsárhraun lava field, which is the largest lava field in Iceland. 

Hop back in the Jeep and go to Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss waterfalls. Feel the mist as you walk behind the Seljalandsfoss waterfall for a different view. Then, head to Skogafoss, one of the largest waterfalls in Iceland. See if you can spot a rainbow through the spray on a sunny day.

Next on the agenda is Dyrholaey, a high headland extending to the sea. Walk along the black sand beaches and observe the rock formations.

The last stop on the tour is Reynisfjara. Spend time on the black sand beach and wander around the basalt rock columns and sea stacks.

The tour concludes with drop-off at your hotel.
strTitle: South Coast Volcano Private 4x4 Jeep Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
Are you ready for an adrenaline boost? This 8-hour private tour takes you to some of Iceland's most exceptional and varied sites, such as glaciers, volcanoes, waterfalls, and a black beach, all while enjoying the excitement of a super jeep ride and the undivided attention of a private guide.

Dressed in warm clothing, get picked up from your centrally located Reykjavík accommodation at 8:30am, ready for an 8-hour adventure.

Head east out of the city to get some off-roading action in Thorsmork Valley, a beautiful woodland surrounded by rugged mountains and glacial rivers, which is only accessible year-round on 4×4, and scheduled buses during the summer months. Buckle up and enjoy the thrill of splashing through glacial rivers. The super jeep then takes you to Gigjökull glacier, a calf glacier of the notorious Eyjafjallajökull volcano which erupted in 2010.

Hop back onto Highway 1 and head for the spectacular waterfalls of Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss. Seljalandsfoss is just over 196 feet (60 meters) tall and surrounded by beautiful cliffs and slopes. There is a footpath behind the waterfall where, depending on road conditions, you can walk for a view from behind the plunging water. Skogafoss is one of the biggest waterfalls in Iceland, which also measures around 196 feet (60 meters) and boasts a width of 82 feet (25 meters). On sunny days it is not unusual to to see a double rainbow through the spray.

Continue east along the south coast to your last stop, Reynisfjara where you find not only a black beach, but also basalt rock columns, caves, and sea stack.

Finally, with a camera and head full of memories, get dropped off back at your Reykjavík accommodations around eight hours after you set out.
strTitle: South Coast Volcano and Glacier Private Super Jeep Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
The experience of watching the display of Northern Lights swirling in the sky is beyond words. Many consider this once-in-a-lifetime experience a bucket list item. This 4-hour Super Jeep tour takes you out into the darkness for a unique experience in search of nature's incredible light show.

During the winter months from mid-September to March, when there is complete darkness in the sky, there is a chance to see the awesome display of Northern Lights. The lights, also known as Aurora Borealis, are created when the upper atmosphere of the earth is sufficiently disturbed by particles in solar wind from the Sun. The level of ionization and excitation of different components in the atmosphere orchestrate light shows of varying colors and complexity. The phenomenal display of colors from greenish yellow to beautiful shades of blue, red, pink, purple or even white is a sight that is unforgettable. Iceland is one of the few countries situated close enough to the polar region where you can see the Aurora at kp strength (from 0 to 9) level 3 and above virtually anywhere in the country with clear sky.

Leave the light of the city in the evening on this approximately tour and head out into the dark night in Super Jeeps. The Jeeps are specially modified for the wild Icelandic terrain, which allows them to be to driven off-road where needed. Search for the best locations to view this fabulous solar display swirling in the sky in a symphony of magical colors and shapes.

The Northern Lights area natural phenomenon and is weather dependent, sighting is therefore not guaranteed. The tour will not leave town if weather conditions are not right and reschedule for another night. It is highly recommended to book the tour on the first night(s) of your stay in Iceland to maximize the chance of catching the lights. Also, the location for the tours are not fixed. Your experienced guides will bring you to the location to the best of their knowledge to maximize your chances of catching the lights.
strTitle: Night of Northern Lights Super Jeep Private Tour

strIntroduction:
Snaefellsnes is often also called Iceland in Miniature. While it may only take 3 hours to circumvent the whole peninsula, craters, glacier, and eerie rock formations, the vast geology diversity can take you the whole day just to have a closer look at its wonders. It’s also believed that one of seven mystical energy centers of the world is situated here, so pack up and get ready for a boost.

Start the day taking a northwestern direction towards the Snaefellsnes peninsula. The majestic Snaefellsjokull is the main attraction of the Snaefellsnes National Park. Possibly due to it’s special magnetic properties, some people believe that this is one of the seven energy centers of the world. Then it's time for a stop at Búðakirkja church, which is one of the landmark churches in Iceland. The distinctive black church is very popular among locals for weddings.

Moving along the south coast of the peninsula, it's time to make a stop at Arnarstapi. It is a humble fishing village that also used to serve as an important trading port in the past. In the summer months, you have the option take a short hike over to our next stop, the spectacular basalt rock formations at Hellnar.

Move on to the western coast of the peninsula where you find Dritvik Bay. It is a black pebble bay with a series of oddly shaped rocks protruding from the ocean. Here you can also test your strength - there are four big stones that were used to test fishermen.  At the north western corner of the peninsula, find Saxholl crater, a reddish brown crater from the oxidation of iron in the volcanic soil.

The last stop of the day is Kirkjufell, a beautiful and symmetrical mountain that is also known as the Church Mountain. This free-standing mountain is very popular among photographers.
strTitle: Snaefellsnes Peninsula Private 4X4 Jeep Tour

strIntroduction:
See a wide variety of Iceland’s landscape, including glaciers, volcanoes, valleys, and waterfalls, all while enjoying the excitement of a super jeep ride on this full-day private tour. Enter Thorsmork valley, an oasis of clear-water creeks set in a unique location between three glaciers, Eyjafjallajökull, Mýrdalsjökull, and Tindafjallajökull. Venture into a deep canyon, take a short hike through a moss-covered valley, and even walk behind a teeming waterfall at Seljalandsfoss. This private tour ensures total attention from your dedicated guide. 

Dressed in warm clothing, get picked up from your hotel at 8:30am. Meet your private guide, jump aboard the super jeep, and get ready for a full day of adventure.

Head east out of Reykjavík toward Gigjökull glacier, a calf glacier of the notorious Eyjafjallajökull, the glacier-covered volcano which erupted in 2010 and caused travel chaos across Europe. Next stop is Stakkholtsgja canyon, which is about 6,561 feet (2 kilometers) long and up to 328 feet (100 meters) deep. Where weather conditions allow, pend some quality time here and venture into the mystical canyon.

Move on to Basar, a site that is very popular among hiking enthusiasts. Here, take an optional leisurely 30-minute hike. A lush forest has developed in the middle of the mostly moss-lined valley, which makes for an interesting change of scenery.

Hop back onto Highway 1 to find your last stop, the spectacular Seljalandsfoss waterfall. Seljalandsfoss is just over 196 feet (60 meters) and is surrounded by beautiful cliffs and slopes. There is a footpath behind the waterfall where, depending on road conditions, you can actually take a walk behind the waterfall for a different view. Take advantage of the magnificent photo opportunities here before hopping back into the jeep for the 1.5-hour drive back to your Reykjavík hotel.
strTitle: Eyjafjallajokull and Thorsmork Private Super Jeep Private Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
Make the most of your short time in Iceland by taking this 13-hour private 4x4 jeep tour from Reykjavík. The tour covers most major sites along the south coast of Iceland, including Seljalandsfoss Skógafoss waterfalls, the black beach and basalt columns of Reynisfjarna, and the magnificent glacier lagoon of Jökulsárlón.

Get wrapped up in your warmest clothes and meet your guide at 8am at your centrally located Reykjvík hotel. Get ready for a full day, 13 hours, of adventure through Iceland's wild southern coast.

Jump aboard the 4x4 private jeep and head southward to the two waterfalls of Seljalandsfoss and Skógafoss. Seljalandsfoss is just over 197 feet (60 meters) tall and is surrounded by cliffs and slopes. There is a footpath behind the waterfall where, depending on road conditions, you can actually take a walk behind the waterfall for a different view. Skógafoss is one of the biggest waterfalls in Iceland, carrying water from the two powerful glaciers of Eyjafjallajökull and Myrdalsjokull. The waterfall also drops 197 feet (60 meters) and is 82-foot (25-meters) wide. On sunny days it’s not unusual to to see double rainbow through the spray created by the waterfall.

Continue east to Reynisfjara. Here you find not only a black beach, but also basalt rock columns, caves, and sea stacks. Carry on to nearby Vík, the southernmost village in Iceland, before checking out Eldhraun lava field. This lava field was created in one of the biggest eruptions in recorded history. The eruption from 1783 to 1784 might even have been one of the causes of the French revolution due to the catastrophic impact it had on the climate in not only Iceland but also Europe. Eerie formations of lava tubes are found here, in the warmer months they look like a field of moss bubbles.

As you move on to Skaftafell National Park, you can take an optional glacier hike at Svinafellsjökull glacier tongue, which is one of the more than 30 outlets of the vast Vatnajökull glacier. During the hike, an experienced glacier guide runs you through the basics of how to safely use essential equipment like crampons and axes so that you can enjoy the panoramic view of the glacial ice structures in security. Vatnajökull is the largest ice cap in Europe by volume. The average thickness of its ice is 1,312 feet (400 meters), with maximum thickness of 3,280 (1,000 meters).

The next stop is the magnificent glacier lagoon, Jökulsárlón. Get your camera ready to spot icebergs floating in the lagoon. The main lagoon measures about seven square miles (20 square kilometers). Up until 1932, it was covered in thick glacial ice, but then the glacier started to retreat, and nowadays more than 330 feet (100m) of ice breaks away each year to reshape the lagoon and fill it with huge spectacular icebergs.

From Jökulsárlón you turn around and head back towards Reykjavik, getting dropped off back at your hotel around 13 hours after you set out.

Please note: Please advise the tour operator f you wish to book this tour in the winter months. Due to the shorter lengths of days, the itinerary may need to be changed or reshuffled.
strTitle: Glacier Lagoon and South Coast Iceland: Private 4X4 Jeep Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
See the sites on Iceland’s popular Golden Circle during this 9-hour private tour from Reykjavik. Learn about Iceland’s nature, geology and history as you visit Thingvellir National Park, Geysir geothermal area, the Gullfoss waterfall and more. Enjoy personalized attention from your guide and a flexible itinerary. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

Your tour begins at your hotel at 8:30am when your guide picks you up in a rugged 4x4 vehicle. Drive to Thingvellir National Park where the oldest parliament in the world was founded over 1,000 years ago. While at this UNESCO World Heritage Site, see how the earth is slowly parting the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates.

Next, visit the Geysir geothermal area to see geysers, hot springs, steam vents, and blue algae. Although Geysir is relatively dormant, watch Strokkur, a large and powerful geyser nearby erupt about every five minutes.

Continue on to Gullfoss Waterfall, a two-tier waterfall with a dramatic cascade. Watch as glacier water tumbles into a deep gorge and enjoy a coffee break at the cafe.

Stop by Faxi, a small waterfall before going to Fridheimar, a greenhouse cultivation center. See how pesticide-free tomatoes and cucumbers are grown with Iceland’s geothermal power.

The final stop is Kerið, a 3,000 year old crater. Walk around the crater (own expense) before driving back to Reykjavik where the tour concludes at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Golden Circle Classic 4x4 Jeep Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
Pressed by time but what to see more? This is a compact tour that combines some of the most famous waterfalls in of South of Iceland and The Golden Circle, which is a popular route in Iceland that brings you to experience not only Iceland’s nature, but also geology and history. We will cover Þingvellir (Thingvellir) National Park where Viking settlers stood centuries ago to edict national laws, Geysir geothermal area and Gullfoss, the spectacular golden waterfall, Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss.

Pressed by time but what to see more? This is a compact tour that combines some of the most famous waterfalls in of South of Iceland and The Golden Circle, which is a popular route in Iceland that brings you to experience not only Iceland’s nature, but also geology and history. We will cover Þingvellir (Thingvellir) National Park where Viking settlers stood centuries ago to edict national laws, Geysir geothermal area and Gullfoss, the spectacular golden waterfall, Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss.

Our first stop takes us to Thingvellir National Park where the oldest parliament was founded in the world over 1000 years ago. Many crucial events in Icelandic history took part here and it is also on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Here you will also see how the earth is ever so slowly pulling apart along the North-America and Eurasian tectonic plates.
Next, we will visit the Geysir geothermal area in Haukadalur where you can see geysers, hot springs, steam vents and eerie blue algae. Although the Great Geysir is relatively dormant, Strokkur, also being one of the largest and most powerful geysers, it erupts almost every 5 minutes.
We then proceed to Gullfoss waterfall, which many consider to be the queen of Icelandic waterfalls, as it is both high and mighty and stumbles in a deep gorge. Gullfoss is in fact 2 separate waterfalls, the upper one has a 11m drop and the lower one with 21m, beautifully angled creating a dramatic cascade.

After Gullfoss we will head south, driving towards Eyjafjallajokull to find our final stops, Seljalandsfoss and Skogafoss. Seljalandsfoss is just over 60m surrounded by beautiful cliffs and slopes. There is a footpath behind the waterfall where depending on road conditions we can actually take a walk behind the waterfall for a different view.

Skogafoss is one of the biggest waterfalls in Iceland. Also measures around 60m in drop, it boasts a width of 25m. On sunny days it’s not unusual to see double rainbow through the spray created by the waterfall.


Highlights of the The Golden Circle and South Coast Waterfall Private Tour
  • Thingvellir National Park
  • Geysir
  • Gullfoss
  • Fridheimar
  • Eyjafjallajokull
  • Seljalandsfoss
  • Skogafoss
strTitle: The Golden Circle and South Coast Waterfalls Private Tour from Reykjavik

strIntroduction:
Make your very own chocolate bar! With unique flavors such as caramelized ginger and spicy chipotle pepper, you can create your own work of art! Learn how chocolate is made bean to bar in this informative tour.

Learn about the origins of chocolate and how it is made bean-to-bar in Hawai‘i by tasting it in 3 forms: the delicious lychee-tasting fruit juice of cacao, a fresh roasted cacao bean and a flight of 5 of our most popular chocolate flavors. Finally, make your very own chocolate bar using Hawai‘i grown and made chocolate, choosing from a delicious selection of fruits, nuts and spices to flavor your bar, from toasted coconut to spicy chipotle pepper or Hawaiian sea salt. Finally, you will get to try Oahu’s award-winning chocolate and see how we make it, in this delicious and informative tour!
strTitle: Make Your Own Chocolate Bar Class in Chinatown Oahu

strIntroduction:
Pair an art gallery with a dash of whimsy, and you get the Trick Eye Museum in Seoul. Inspired by the visual art technique of 'trompe l'oeil,’ the museum features paintings that give each 2D-piece a 3D-illusion. Step into or beside the art, and snap photos that have you popping out of the portrait or mural. Then, freeze boredom out of your life inside the Ice Museum, part of Trick Eye, and discover rooms made entirely of ice. Post your amusing and bizarre pics on social media and watch the thumbs-up numbers climb.

Bring your camera and make your way to the Trick Eye Museum, located in the vibrant Seoul district of Hongdae, teeming with Hongik University students and pulsing with the latest nightclubs. The museum is inspired and named after trompe-l’oeil, an art technique that uses realistic imagery to trick the eye into an optical illusion of making painted objects appear in 3D.

Inside, two-dimensional paintings on the museum walls, floors and ceilings seem to pop out and come to life, and have been specially designed for photos. Let your imagination fly as you step into the paintings and capture the most creative poses with your camera. On-site staff are available to help you achieve your trompe-l’oeil art.

Wander through various thematic halls, named Masterpiece, Fantasy, Adventure, Comic, Romantic, Bon Voyage and Illusion Painting. Snap photos that show you climbing out of a portrait, catching money flying out of a dump truck and heaving a huge piece of sushi out of a picture frame.

Get lost in the 'Mirror Maze'; or, change up the pace and check out an educational program on Greek mythology or a current exhibit of a contemporary artist.

Cool things down at the Ice Museum, housed inside the Trick Eye Museum. Walk through a kitchen and living room, watch a TV, ride in a car and pull the reins of a sleigh, all made entirely of ice.

Thirsty or need a snack? Mosey over to the main hall, decorated like Greece’s Santorini, and settle in the café for a cup of hot organic coffee and a muffin (own expense). Scroll through your photos at a table that, you guessed it, features trompe-l’oeil — a hand reaches out of the tabletop for your coffee.
strTitle: Trick Eye Museum Entrance Ticket

strIntroduction:
Adventure through Belize on this tour of the Maya Ruins in the ancient city of Caracol. This guided tour explores jungle archaeological sites including pyramid temples, plazas and monuments. Journey to the Mountain Pine Ridge with stops at Rio On Pools and Rio Frio Cave for a refreshing swim in the crystal waters. Enjoy a homemade Belizean style picnic lunch with soft drinks and rum punch. This tour includes guide, entrance fees, lunch with drinks and round-trip transportation.

Caracol is a major and dominant site in Maya history. It is a fantastic site to visit, and it is an expansive city covering nearly 80 square miles and rivaling the ancient metropolis of Tikal in size, power and riches. A subtropical forest south of San Ignacio sits near the Guatemalan border, set high on the Vaca Plateau in the heart of the Chiquibal Forest Reserve. Caracol is accessed through the Mountain Pine Ridge, a beautiful area with flowing rivers and hidden caves.

Embark on a 1.5-hour drive from our office up rough dirt roads and through small Maya Villages and scenic countryside. Arrive at the sprawling archaeological site of Caracol and learn about the anthropology and archaeology, as well as the flora and fauna of the area including rare and endangered wildlife such as Keel-billed Motmots, Tapirs, Jaguars, Oscillated Turkeys, Gibnut (the “Royal Rat”) and Coatimundis.

Caracol had a huge population center at its peak, with over 150,000 inhabitants and 30,000 structures. You might get lucky and see a family of howler monkeys in the trees over the ancient Maya ball-courts, or revel at the engineering and architectural sophistication of the Maya people as you climb up the temple pyramid structure of Caana (Sky Temple), the highest man-made building in Belize still to this day. Once at the top, nearly 135 feet above the plazas, you will get impressive panoramic views of Belize and neighboring Guatemala.

The histories of the inhabitants of Caracol are documented by scribes of the past in hieroglyphics and carvings on the monuments, stelas, and altars that are found throughout the site. Caracol has a very unique history from other major ancient cities in the region, and your guide will illuminate the rich and complicated past of this glorious civilization with a fully guided tour of the excavated portions of the Caracol site.

After touring the ruins, refresh with drinks and a picnic lunch. We then continue back through the Pine Ridge where we take a break at the Rio On Pools, a series of natural swimming holes, and the lush Rio Frio Cave to cool down and relax in the clear water.
strTitle: Caracol Maya Ruins Tour Including Rio On Pools, Rio Frio Cave and a Picnic Lunch

strIntroduction:
See the best of Belize organic farming on this 2-hour leisurely horseback ride around a San Lorenzo Farm. If you’re looking to spend a shorter period of time horseback riding and want to see something other than Mayan ruins, come learn about organic farming in Belize!

A short drive from our main office will take us to a beautiful and scenic organic farm with stables. Your driver will take you out of the hustle and bustle of San Ignacio town in a private vehicle.

Once you reach the stables you will be fitted with your horse and an expert horseman guide will show you the lush productive gardens of fruits, herbs and vegetables. This short guided tour of the farm includes a slow-paced horseback ride through the property with stops to view, discuss and learn about the natural exotic fruits, vegetables and medicinal plants that grown in Belize, as well as some local cattle.

This trip also includes guiding your horse through the picturesque Mopan River. Transportation back to San Ignacio is also included. Choose between a morning tour (9am) or afternoon tour (1pm).
strTitle: Horseback Riding and Tour in San Lorenzo Organic Farm

strIntroduction:
A pleasant half day ride through the Belize rainforest on the banks of the Mopan River and through a private organic farm to the Xunantunich Archaeological site. This is a fabulous way to tour the Maya ruins and also enjoy watching wildlife along the riverbanks and in the jungle. A Belizean style lunch is included and you also pass through the little village of San Jose Succotz.

Our most popular tour activity is a pleasant half day horseback ride to Xunantunich.

The tour begins at the stables, a family-owned horseback riding establishment where over 45 horses call home. Your transportation to the stables from San Ignacio is included.
When you arrive, meet your local Belizean guide for the day and then mount your horses to depart!

The ride to Xunantunich includes a well maintained trail through a large private farm and along the banks of the Mopan River in the village of San Jose Succotz. You will cross the river on an ancient hand-operated ferry, and then ride your horse up to Xunantunich. When you arrive, prepare to dismount and let your horse rest while you can spend as much time as you desire exploring Xunantunich by foot. Afterwards, we will ride to the nearby Benny’s Kitchen for a delicious lunch of traditional Belizean dishes before returning to Hanna Stables.
This horseback ride includes lots of nature viewing of local birds and plants.

Tour duration: 4-6 hours, depending on speed and desire to explore.

No previous horseback riding experience is required; riding helmets are supplied. Weight limit: 250 lbs (113.4 kg) per person.
Capacity: We can take single riders, couples, or groups of up to 15 people. There is no minimum amount of people needed to book.
strTitle: Horseback Ride to Xunantunich Maya Ruins Including Traditional Lunch

strIntroduction:
Barton Creek Cave is the entrance to the Maya Underworld and can only be accessed by canoe. A peaceful and ancient realm awaits as you glide into the cave to see the amazing crystal formations and learn about the history of this sacred place. This tour also give you a combination with a choice of zipline, butterfly farm or waterfall to make it a full-day tour, which also include a delicious lunch!

We begin our journey through farmland where you can see the Mennonite community of Upper Barton Creek and experience their traditional lifestyle. We reach Barton Creek Cave, much of which is still to be explored and stretches for miles, of which 4.5 miles is navigable by open canoe. At the entrance of the cave we board our canoes, switch on our headlights and start to slowly paddle into the cave passage. While floating deeper into the passage we learn about the geology, archaeology and Maya history of these caves.

Our lights will bring crystal formations that are millions of years old to life. After exploring the caves, we turn around our canoes and float back to where we park them and complete our half-day tour with a refreshing swim.

Barton Creek Cave with Jungle Zipline:
Stop at our longest aerial canopy zip lining tour which is more than 2,700 feet. Each of our four tours offers you a return to the main platform on a 500 feet run via our jungle lift platform. This 2-hour tour is for zip line enthusiasts and combines the Explorer and Intermedio levels in over 2,700 feet of zip line, comprised of 9 runs and 15 platforms that take you over and through the jungle.
This is a safe and exhilarating way to see the jungle like never before flying through the treetops!

Barton Creek Cave with Butterfly Farm and Botanical Garden:
Visit the Belize Butterfly Ranch and Botanical Collections. Here, you will be able to see flocks of exotic butterflies of various species, from iridescent blue to gorgeous orange, dazzling yellow to intriguing gray. There is also a botanical collection of over 120 species of plants, including orchids, many of which are critical to the butterflies’ reproduction and rearing.

Barton Creek Cave with Big Rock Falls:
Big Rock Falls is a 150 feet waterfall flowing over the granite boulders of Privassion Creek. We hike down the escarpment hidden deep in the Mountain Pine Ridge where we come to the stunning waterfall and the crystal pool into which the cascading water sprays in a cooling mist.You can scramble over boulders and see the water rushing past you as you plunge into the pool below.
strTitle: Full-Day Barton Creek Cave with Optional Zipline, Butterfly Farm Or Big Rock Falls

strIntroduction:
The Macal River is a beautiful jungle river that flows directly through the heart of San Ignacio Town. Canoe up the river and see exotic wildlife and small villages along the banks of this lush river. Enjoy a half day or full day on the river, paddling, exploring medicinal trails and swimming. Iguanas, birds and stunning trees and flowers will be seen along the way too. Full-day tours include lunch, but half-day tours do not.

The Macal River is a magnificent jungle river and the perfect waterway to enjoy a Belize canoeing trip adventure. The river originates in the Maya Mountains and flows through limestone hills and jungle toward San Ignacio town and then onto Belize City after its confluence with the Mopan River. This river is the main watershed for San Ignacio town and the center of life for the community.

Leave San Ignacio at 9am in our canoes up the river, passing under the historic Hawksworth Bridge and then away from civilization into the green jungle. Lined with cliffs and cave openings, with iguanas perching on mammoth trees above, the scene is almost prehistoric. Non-excavated Maya sites dot the riverbanks, and as villagers bathe and wash their clothing, horses and cattle come to the water to drink.

You will see wildlife along with way including a variety of bird species and possibly see the tracks of larger mammals such as tapirs, white lipped peccary, armadillo, and even jaguars in the mud of the riverbank. Colonies of bats roost under limestone ledges and the water shimmers in the sun against the white rocks.

We continue up the river toward Chaa Creek Resort, a premier luxury eco-resort which is home to a medicinal plants trail, Blue Morpho butterfly farm, and natural history museum. Chaa Creek is host to many environmental conservation and sustainable tourism projects such as Archaeology Research, Bay Palm Reforestation, Agroforesty Research, Vascular Plan Cataloguing, Birds Without Borders and Howler Monkey Reintroduction.

After touring the natural environment of the property with your guide, we have a picnic lunch (included in the full-day option) and continue back down river toward San Ignacio, where we end at the wooden bridge.

A half-day tour upriver won’t go quite as far but we will stop at the picturesque village of Cristo Rey, a quiet and lush village and a humble community of mainly Maya descent. Here we park our canoes and then take a short hike to a beautiful, hidden spring-fed waterfall at Monkey Falls for a fresh dip.

Time frame: 9am to 4:30pm for the full-day tour option, and from 9am to 1pm for the half-day tour option.
strTitle: Macal River Canoeing and Rainforest Medicinal Trail

strIntroduction:
The ancient Maya culture is still alive in the quaint village of San Antonio as the humble Mennonite settlers have a thriving and productive community in the village of Barton Creek.
