Experience these two cultures firsthand and see some beautiful scenery along the way. Includes a local homemade lunch.

Located on the road to the Mountain Pine Ridge, the village of San Antonio was named after St. Anthony of Padua when a Spanish Priest who visited regularly from the town of Benque Viejo del Carmen brought a statue of St. Anthony to the Village.

The statue can be seen in the Catholic Church near the Village Square. Prior to the name change, San Antonio was known in the local Yucatec Maya dialect as “Osh Multun Kakab” which translates to “Three Mound Virgin Forest”. Today, villagers casually refer to their village as “Tanah,” which is the Maya term for “our home.”

This is mainly an agricultural community and the local residents grow crops such as peanuts, corn, squash, and beans, much like their ancestors. There are currently three Women’s Groups in San Antonio.  One group operates the community bakery, the other specializes in pottery, local jewelry and embroidery, and the most recent group makes hammocks, embroidery and clothing. Local Maya lunch included with your tour.

After a visit to Barton Creek Community, we will learn about the Mennonites. Although originally of European descent and heritage, many Mennonites have been born and raised in Belize, creating a unique blend of culture and spirituality. The Mennonites are much like the Amish, living a humble and religiously pious lifestyle. The Mennonites of Belize are peaceful, hardworking people and the more remote communities of Barton Creek retain a very traditional and simple way of life, relying on their knowledge and strength to farm and survive in the jungle with few modern amenities.

The communities are very conservative and the women wear bonnets and long dresses while the men wear denim overalls and hats. They use horse drawn buggies for transportation and till their farm fields with horses. In the most remote communities they still use horses to drive their sawmills. The Mennonites of Barton Creek are very restrictive on their use of machinery and they produce many agricultural crops without any modern machinery. They are highly productive people and produce honey, milk, eggs, poultry, beans and other staple crops.

Come and explore this fascinating and reserved culture on a trip through the jungle and back in the time to help us remember how things were before cell phones, cars, iPads and even before electricity. Return to San Ignacio in the afternoon.
strTitle: Maya Village and Mennonites of Barton Creek Cultural Tour

strIntroduction:
Enjoy spectacular jungle scenery and waterfalls as you camp overnight in the world's first Jaguar Reserve. End your trip with an amazing kayak journey down the South Stann Creek through a national park and banana plantation. All transportation, entrance fees, equipment, professional guide and meals included, so all you have to bring is your sense of adventure!

Deep in the heart of the Maya Mountains of southern Belize is an unspoiled wilderness, set aside for protection as the world’s first Jaguar Preserve, known as the Cockscomb Basin. This vast roadless area is home to a plethora of wildlife, including a variety of exotic plants and rare insects, mammals and birds.

You can hike to hidden waterfalls, look out from scenic overlooks of the entire rainforest Basin and Victoria Peak, as well as lush jungle riverbanks where you can see tapir and jaguar tracks. Look out for howler monkeys, which were reintroduced to the reserve and whose population is increasing each year!

Cockscomb Basin is a 2 hour drive along the stunning Hummingbird Highway and the Southern Highway, which pass through jungle hills, citrus orchards, and rangeland. You'll also pass through the traditional Mayan village of Maya Center.

From Maya Center, you'll head into the heart of the reserve on a rough dirt road. Stop at the ranger post and have an opportunity to see a small museum with the history of the reserve, which was established by the renowned researcher, Dr. Alan Rabinowitz, (aka “The Indiana Jones of Wildlife Protection”) who documented his time in the reserve in the early 1980s and his jaguar research in the autobiographical book, Jaguar. An extensive trail system branches out from the ranger station and you'll explore the reserve on foot with refreshing river and waterfall swims. Walk in the footsteps of Dr. Rabinowitz and his Mayan assistants who were instrumental in protecting this reserve for generations to come.

Here, you'll set up camp at the national park campground where and take a leisurely hike through the jungle to embark on a river tubing excursion. Float in the fresh cool waters of the South Stann Creek and revel in the beauty of the rainforest environment. End the day with the jungle cookout and share stories with other guests and the rangers.

In the morning, after a hearty breakfast, set out on the South Stann Creek with a kayak and go deep into untouched jungle in the direction of the Caribbean Sea. Pass through a private banana plantation and meet your land transport at San Roman, a small Mayan village, along the Southern Highway. This is an amazing and unforgettable adventure in one of the last few wilderness areas in the world where jaguars roam free.
strTitle: Cockscomb Basin Jaguar Reserve Overnight Camping with Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Actun Tunichil Muknal is a mysterious and beautiful portal to the ancient Maya and their traditions, ceremonies and spirituality. This cave system served as a ceremonial site where the Maya performed sacrifices and other ceremonies as they dealt with extreme and harsh conditions in times of drought.

Explore this lush area surrounded by beautiful jungles, and the cave entrance is traversed by swimming across a crystal clear spring fed pool. Spend 3 hours in the cave after hiking in through the rain forest. Here you will see stunning artifacts, altars and the crystallized skeletons of the sacrificed girl, The Crystal Maiden.

Taking a journey into the Maya underworld at Actun Tunichil Muknal (ATM) or the “Cave of the Stone Sepulchre” for one of the most enlightening, epic and unique experiences of your life.

Leave the world of the living behind as you venture into the heart of the ATM Cave with your licensed guide. Recently deemed the #1 Sacred Cave destination in the world by National Geographic, the ATM cave is not only beautiful geologically with its crystalline stalactites and stalagmites, but also historically, as is a natural museum of ancient Maya artifacts, as well as a sacred burial place.

This is the final resting place of “Crystal Maiden,” an ancient Maya ceremonial victim, as well as the remains of 13 other sacrificed men, women and children. Your professional guides have led government officials, National Geographic, Discovery Channel, The British High Commission and US Embassy officials into the ATM Cave.

This sacrificial site is accessed by a 45 minute drive from our office in San Ignacio.
Here we enter the Tapir Mountain Nature Reserve and park our vehicles at the ranger post. From this point on we are on foot, hiking through the jungle for approximately 45 minutes to the entrance of the cave. To access the cave we swim across a small spring- fed pool and wade into the dark underworld of the cave that allows us access the extensive underground maze of tunnels, passageways and chambers, climaxing in the ceremonial chamber housing stoneware, ceramics, the famed crystallized skeleton of the “Crystal Maiden”.
We spend approximately 3 hours in the cave at the guidance of our experienced guides.

Leave your cameras behind and experience the power of ancient spirits with your mind, body and soul. This is not only a physical adventure but a journey into the spiritual realm.
We enter back into the jungle world and hike to our vehicles where we relax and enjoy a homemade picnic lunch with water and soft drinks before driving back to San Ignacio.

Time-frame: 7:20am to 4:30 pm.

Difficulty level: Moderate (involved some easy swimming and life jackets are provided for non-swimmers, who will also be escorted by our highly trained guide).

What to bring: Hiking sandals or trainers, socks (for preservation reasons), extra set of dry clothing, extra sandals or flip flops, small backpack, liter of water, bug spray, snacks, swim wear with shorts.
Please note: Cameras are not allowed and only the guide will carry a dry bag into the cave.
strTitle: Actun Tunichil Muknal Cave Tour and Picnic

strIntroduction:
Tikal is an ancient metropolis just a short distance across the border in Guatemala. Enjoy the spectacular temples and sprawling archaeological site with your professional guide. Listen as they provide the history and significance of the structures, monuments and stellar of the Maya civilization from centuries past. Bring your passport and take this great opportunity to discover this amazing UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Tikal is an ancient Maya ceremonial center located just across the border in Peten, Guatemala, just 19 miles north of Lake Peten Itza and the quaint town of Flores.

We will drive you the Belize-Guatemala border, only a short 15 minute drive from our office. When you arrive at the border we will pay your border fees and assist you with your crossing, where you will meet your guide. Your guide will drive you for another 1.5 hours before arriving at Tikal National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Along the way we will pass small villages, beautiful lakeside scenery and rolling hills with rainforest and agriculture.

Upon arrival to Tikal, entrance fees included, your guide will then provide an in-depth 4-hour tour of this magnificent site. Our guide speaks fluent English. Tikal is known for its massive pyramid temples, monumental plazas, palaces and stelas. This is a very significant site in the history of the region, and Tikal was the most powerful metropolis in the area for many centuries. It was a prominent player in the Mesoamerican trade route which extended up into modern day Mexico, as well as Belize and beyond.

You will also have time to view wildlife such as howler monkeys, parrots and toucans, coatis and oscillated turkeys, as well as a sample of some of the modern-day local Guatemala culture. After an extensive tour of the site, we make our way to a local restaurant for a warm lunch (included), including vegan and vegetarian options. After lunch we will have the opportunity to purchase some crafts and souvenirs before heading back across the border to Belize.

Tikal is a unique and impressive Guatemalan archaeological site within close proximity to our Belize headquarters. Take the plunge and get the best of both worlds
strTitle: Day Trip to Tikal Maya Ruins Including Lunch

strIntroduction:
Explore the best of Belize caving and enter the underworld of the ancient Maya in the Crystal Cave and magnificent Blue Hole National Park. Go spelunking into the crystalline caverns and ancient Maya ceremonial site where the Maya people practiced sacrifice and sacred rituals. After venturing into the cave chambers, you'll have the chance to cool down in the refreshing waters of the cenote, the inland Blue Hole, in its lovely rainforest setting.

Locally known as the Mountain Cow Cave, the stunning and other-worldly Crystal Cave is located deep in the jungle in the heart of the Blue Hole National Park along the scenic Hummingbird Highway.

Leave San Ignacio in the morning to head toward Belmopan, where we proceed to the scenic Hummingbird Highway, crossing the green mountains while passing orange orchards, pineapple plantations, and rain forest-draped valleys along the way.
Blue Hole National Park is a picturesque, protected and easily-accessible area managed by the Belize Audubon Society.

After a 50-minute hike through the tropical forest, we reach the cave entrance, where we rappel 15 feet into the vast entrance of the cave. We will traverse through the large chambers of the cave, sliding down mud ramps and scrambling along rocks. This is a challenging descent into Xibalba, the Maya realms of the underworld. Your guide will show you the shimmering formations in the cave, along with artifacts, and a skeletal remains of sacrificial victims from the ancient Maya times. We'll witness the times of past as we discover centuries-old fire pits, wall carvings, pottery, and relics, as well as impressive crystal formations and stalactites and stalagmites.

This tour is physically demanding, but well worth the effort as we walk in the footsteps of the Maya ritual leaders and see the evidence of their ceremonies with our own eyes. After our cave exploration you can take time to eat your hearty homemade lunch and soft drinks, and to swim in the refreshing waters of the Blue Hole, an inland cenote (a deep sinkhole which has filled with rain and spring water).
strTitle: Day Trip To Crystal Cave and Blue Hole National Park

strIntroduction:
Escape the heat of the lowlands and explore the nature reserve of the Mountain Pine Ridge. Discover where cool rivers flow through pristine forests and caves while waterfalls provide beauty and mystery.  Swim, hike, and relax in the natural scenery on an outing into the more remote areas of Cayo District. Here ancient ruins and ancient geology combine in a modern setting for an amazing experience in nature!

The Mountain Pine Ridge reserve is over 100,000 acres of protected forest. It is comprised mainly of Honduras pine and some wetlands, the Macal River valley and some subtropical forest. The area is mainly granite and limestone, and is home to numerous rivers, springs, waterfalls and caves. This is truly a nature lover’s haven! There is a small forest ranger post and very little habitation, except for a couple of isolated Maya communities and a small settlement of Mennonites. A former logging settlement at San Luis is now abandoned because the area has been protected since the 1940s.

This stunning and unique natural habitat is home to numerous bird and mammal species, and is a great place for birdwatching and enjoying the peace of the natural environment. The first feature of the reserve that we will explore is the Rio Frio Cave, the source of the Rio Frio river and the largest cave entrance in Belize. Our next stop is the Rio On Pools, a series of shimmering natural swimming holes and rock water slides that allow for cooling relaxation and meditation. Enjoy a water massage from cascading waterfalls that run over a wide river bed and smooth granite rocks.

Take a homemade picnic lunch break at the pools followed by a short drive to our next destination, the fabulous Big Rock Falls, a 150-foot waterfall on Privassion Creek. Here, the cool spray of mist from the waterfall refreshes swimmers in the clear, deep pool below. This day of hiking, spelunking, swimming and possible wildlife watching is not to be missed!
strTitle: Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve from San Ignacio

strIntroduction:
Imagine floating on a clear cool river through ancient caves lined with crystals and filled with mystery. Your Belize cave tubing adventure will be an unforgettable experience as you see the best of Belize inland activities with amazing scenery and a relaxing day in the jungle and on the river. Everything is provided, from equipment, to guide to food. All you have to do is bring yourself and your sense of adventure!

We make our way on the Western Highway for a 1-hour drive, approximately, and then along a dirt road for about 30 minutes. On our arrival to the Caves Branch site, we gear up with helmets, waterproof headlamps, and of course, our inner tubes. We take a flat hike through the jungle for about 45 minutes before entering one of the many cave entrances and passages that make up the cave system.

We hop in the water in our tubes and float toward the first of three cave passages. The river meanders in and out of the caves system and we are carried along by its current to another world. Floating downstream through the cave passages we learn about the geology and ancient history of the limestone cave system. We also learn about the Maya culture and the indigenous inhabitants of the area who have used the caves for ceremonial purposes for thousands of years.

There is opportunity to stop for a snack and swim in a beautiful natural swimming hole before continuing through the last of the passages, the most active of the three caves. Here you can view amazing cave formations and see colonies of bats. At the exit of the last cave, we have a 20-minute river float through the lush rainforest that leads us back to the parking area. We then have a homemade picnic lunch before driving back to San Ignacio.
strTitle: Full Day Cave Tubing Including a Picnic

strIntroduction:
Discover Mandalay's best food, delve into a local culture, explore morning markets and taste delicious treats on this tour. An English-speaking local guide takes you off the beaten track seeking out places rarely visited by tourists.

Everyone will meet at the shop in Mandalay at 8 am and you will be introduced to your guide and start your tour. You will be transported by a classic rickshaw to explore the best snacks that Mandalay has to offer.

From famous morning noodle dish mohinga to Myanmar pancake, samosa, Mandalay salad, Shan noodles and numerous sweet snacks, this fun tour will give you an introduction for the wonderful food culture in Myanmar. By learning more about the food culture, you will also understand why Myanmar people always walk around with a smile on their faces. Our resident food enthusiasts will explain the details some secrets behind this delicious food. The tour concludes at 11:30 am at the shop. Bring your camera, your sense of adventure and your appetite!
strLocation: Mandalay,Republic of the Union of Myanmar
strTitle: Mandalay Tea Shop Foodies Tour

strIntroduction:
Take an enjoyable bicycle ride through an area of Mandalay rich in history and light on traffic. Ride small trails and finish with an enchanting sunset at this most famous of bridges: U Bein.

You will be picked up from your hotel in Mandalay between 12.30pm-1.30pm depending on the timing of sunset and then drive south from Mandalay to get out of the traffic. As the sprawl lessens, we find ourselves in the dry zone where the inhabitants can sustain an agricultural livelihood thanks to ancient canals.

You will start the bike ride and take a leisurely ride through farmland and villages where locals will be pleasantly surprised to see you and call out with greetings. Along the way you will stop by the hometown of the Mayor U Bein after whom the bridge is named. Also learn more about a Muslim community that has lived here for the last two hundred years. You will have the opportunity to explore the shady paths through the ancient capital of Ava and finish our ride at U Bein Bridge.

U Bein Bridge spans 1.2 km and was reportedly built by Mayor U Bein from salvaged teak wood that was left behind in the move of the capital from Amarapura to Mandalay in 1859. Although the bridge has been repaired in the past, the pillars are still the original wood. After relaxing in the last light of the day, you will be taken back to your hotel in Mandalay arriving by 7:30pm.
strLocation: Mandalay,Republic of the Union of Myanmar
strTitle: U Bein Bridge Sunset Cycling Day Tour from Mandalay

strIntroduction:
Join the cycling tour to discover a different side of Mandalay! This fantastic Mandalay bike tour pedals through local roads and villages rarely seen by tourists, introducing them to the authentic local culture and lifestyles. Explore markets, see traditional handicrafts and meander through rice paddies by bike while accompanied by a fun local English-speaking guide.

Everyone will meet at the local tour operators office in Mandalay. From here you will begin your ride, taking the back roads out of town. You will pass through fresh markets and lively neighborhoods as you head to the northeastern part of the city.

After a short pedal you will find yourself in the countryside, where farmers tend to their fields and villagers go about daily rituals that have remained unchanged for decades. Water buffalo lazily roll in the mud, goats nibble at the foliage as friendly locals wave from all directions.

As you continue on your bike ride we will stop at a fresh market where you will learn about the variety of produce offered. Next, continue on and see live bamboo weaving, used to construct roofs, walls, fans and more. Later, enjoy a walk in the countryside through a typical Myanmar village and learn about their way of life and the different crops they use. On the way back to town the tour will stop at a local tea shop for some delicious snacks and tea. Return to the departure location by 12 pm at noon. Your tour will conclude here.
strLocation: Mandalay,Republic of the Union of Myanmar
strTitle: Morning Cycling Tour in Mandalay

strIntroduction:
Visit archeological wonders and charming villages on two-wheels with this fantastic Bagan biking day tour. See some of Myanmar's most impressive sites, discover lesser-known pagodas and learn about local life while cycling with an English-speaking Bagan resident.

We start from our conveniently located shop and ride through the back lanes to get into the temple plains. We quickly leave the sealed, busy roads behind and venture off onto dirt tracks, only accessible to bikes and horses.

It's not long before we are pedalling alongside ancient brick structures, pausing to visit some of the most famous monuments like Shwesandaw, Ananda and Shwezigon as well as several hidden gems. When biking we'll often be greeted by friendly farmers working in the fields next to our bike lanes and we will be sure to seek out an elevated temple to climb up for a different view of the Bagan Plain.

Aside from temples, Bagan is still a buzzing little town and we'll be sure to explore some of the traditions and lifestyles of its people. The village roads are lined with single-story bamboo houses standing adjacent to unique 1950s, brick warehouses. Kids on a break from school, snack vendors and a menagerie of pigs, cows and the occasional horse greet us along the way. We'll stop to see the production of local treats and pay a visit to the friendly neighbours.

We cap off the morning with a visit to a tea shop where we will sample unique snacks and, of course sip a cup of sweet Myanmar tea. Then we'll travel by local truck or van back to your hotel concluding the tour around 12-1pm.
strLocation: Republic of the Union of Myanmar,Old Bagan
strTitle: Bike Brilliant Bagan

strIntroduction:
Uncover magical Central Park during a private 1 or 2-hour pedicab ride. Visit popular sites including Strawberry Fields, Bethesda Fountain and Bow Bridge, as well as the filming locations of over 300 movies. If choosing to do the 2-hour tour you’ll also get to see Belvedere Castle, the Shakespeare Garden, Delacorte Theater, Alice in Wonderland, the Onassis Reservoir and the Eldorado Building. This private tour offers a more personalized experience. 

After meeting up with a friendly guide/driver, hop in a traditional pedicab and enjoy a tour of one of New York City’s most famous destinations, Central Park. Chose from a 1 or 2-hour tour, both of which will encompass some of the park’s most popular sites.

In the 1-hour tour pay a visit to Strawberry Fields, the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace, Bow Bridge, Tavern on the Green, The Literary Walk, The Plaza Hotel, Sheep’s Meadow and Balto, plus the gorgeous Dakota Building and The Henry Frick Mansion.

If on the 2-hour tour, visit all the same sites as well as Belvedere Castle, the Shakespeare Garden, the Onassis Reservoir, the Delacorte Theater, Alice in Wonderland and the Eldorado Building. Both options provide the opportunity to see famous locations and under-the-radar finds while learning about the history of the famous park from a friendly, knowledgeable guide.
strLocation: New York City,United States of America
strTitle: Central Park Pedicab Tours

strIntroduction:
Embark on this 11.5-hour day tour from Hanoi's Old Quarter to Mai Chau. Within one day, visitors will explore the natural and cultural beauties of this rural area. Enjoy a traditional lunch, along with a bike ride through the villages as you observe locals go about their daily lives.

Begin your day with a pickup from your Old Quarter hotel in the early morning. While enroute, you will take a short break to stretch your legs. Continue driving afterwards, then at 11:30am, stop for a short 30-minute break to take photos of the Mai Chau Valley. Capture the beautifully green landscape and mountains that surround the village. Once you are done taking photographs, make your way into the village, where you will enjoy a traditional lunch.

After your lunch has settled, take a 2-hour bicycle ride with your local guide. The ride will be suitable for beginners and experienced bicyclists alike. See farmers working in the fields, locals weaving scarves, and take time to visit the surrounding peaceful villages. Bring your camera along so you may look back on this unique experience. Come 3:00pm, it will be time to finish your ride and board the van to head back to Hanoi. The guide will bring you back to the hotel between 6:30-7:00pm.
strTitle: Day Tour to Mai Chau from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
This small-group day trip leads you to the famous Halong Bay and through the most attractive areas of the Tonkin Gulf. Our well-designed cruising route offers you an excellent opportunity to see the most beautiful high points, in and around the water of the World Heritage site, in a very relaxed way. You witness the tranquil beauty and breathtaking scenery from sundeck of a comfortably traditional junk, from which you can enjoy the bay landscapes and the serene floating village which is slowly passing by.

Itinerary
7:15am - 7:30am: Optional pickup at far located hotels (Intercontinental Westlake, Fraser Suites, Sheraton, Thang Loi, Hanoi Club, Sofitel Plaza).

7:45am - 8:30am: Pick you up at your hotel in Old quarters area for 3.5 hours bus ride through the country side of the Red River Delta to Halong City. Water buffaloes, paddy fields (rice transplanting time: February and June) and daily Vietnamese farm life are on both sides of the way.

12pm:You will arrive in Halong City around noon, where you will board a traditional wooden junk and start the cruising trip to the center of the bay. Fresh seafood lunch (vegetarian menu available) is served while on the boat. Get ready for exotic photos and absorbing the most magnificent natural splendors, limestone bedrocks and sheer cliffs of tiny islands highlighted with fanciful names: Fighting Cocks (symbol of Halong Bay), Duck (quick swim is an optional choice), Finger, Incense Burner, and Stone Dogs. Stop for a rowing boat trip around Ba Hang Floating village then keep cruising to the most beautiful cave named Thien Cung (Heaven Palace Grotto) and explore huge chambers adorned with stalactites and stalagmites. Continue to enjoy this relaxing cruise on the way back to Halong harbor, where a waiting vehicle will transfer you back to Hanoi.

8:00pm - 8:30pm: Drop off at your hotels. Trip ends.
strTitle: Full-Day Halong Tour including Bamboo Boat Ride from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Halong Bay is a spectacular natural wonder. The dramatic scenery dotted with islets makes this an excellent semi-sheltered, open water location for kayaking. This day trip is ideal for keen novice and experienced kayakers alike. This Halong full-day group tour will surely leave you with unforgettable travel memories from Halong Bay.

Itinerary
7:30am – 07:45am: Optional pickup at far located hotels (Intercontinental Westlake, Fraser Suites, Sheraton, Thang Loi, Hanoi Club, Sofitel Plaza).

8am – 8:30am: Free pick up at your hotel (in Old quarters). Enjoy the interesting 3.5 hour drive to Halong city where you can observe Malaysian life and culture passing by.

12pm: Arrive in Halong city. You will board a wooden junk and cruise through the most beautiful place of the bay with the famous islets such as Cock Fighting, Dinh Huong islets, all while enjoying fresh seafood lunch (on boat).

You'll also visit Thien Cung Cave (haven grotto). After the visit, take 30 minutes kayaking trip around the islands and water tunnels to feel more deeply the charm of the place that considered the heaven on earth.


4:30pm: You will return to Halong tourist wharf and take the bus back to Hanoi.


8pm – 8:30pm: Drop you off at your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Halong Tour including Kayaking from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Ready for this unique experience then board Alova Gold Cruise, for 2 days & 1 night exploring the breathtaking and peaceful view of Halong bay. Start cruising and enjoy our special feast of Vietnamese dishes while the cruise slowly slide on the romantic waves of Halong Bay. Relax on the sundeck or take part in our activities as kayaking, swimming, visiting Sung Sot cave and Ti Top Island, cooking class. With Alova Gold Cruises excellent service in hospitality you will feel home. The tour guides are friendly and knowledgeable and this tour is friendly and safe for families with children and we guarantee you 100% satisfaction. We depart daily from Hanoi or Halong Bay, Bai Chay Harbor.

Day 1: Hanoi – Halong (L,D)
07:45 – 8.30 am – Pick up service by shuttle bus from hotel/stay and starting to drive to Ha Long Bay
10:30 – Stopping over to stretch the legs on the way
12:45 – Evening: Boarding Alova Gold Cruise & Cruising on the bay
- Welcome mocktail
- Safety briefing & check in cabin
- Lunch with Vietnamese dishes
- Kayaking & swimming at Ti Top Island or relaxing
- Cooking class and happy hour
19: 30 – Dinner with Vietnamese dishes & enjoying a romantic night at bar or doing squid fishing


Day 2: Halong – Hanoi (B,L)
07:00 – 9.30 am:
- Wake up call
- Captain Breakfast
- Visiting Sung Sot cave.
09:30 – Check out the room and clear the bills
10:00 – 12.30:
- Our chef shows how to carve vegetables into flowers
- Disembarking the cruise
- Lunch with Vietnamese dishes
12:30 – Get on shuttle bus to go back to Hanoi
14:00 – Short stop to stretch the legs
16:30 – Saying goodbye to you at your hotel/stay. Trip ends
strTitle: Overnight Halong Bay Cruise on the Alova Gold

strIntroduction:
Hoa Lu is the ancient capital with a tourist destination which will bring you to cultures and history of Vietnam capitals. The area is also one of out standing beauty with natural limestone peaks whose splendor is often said to surpass that of Halong Bay. Hoa Lu and Tam Coc are regarded as the Halong Bays on land due to its unique geological formations.

Between 8am - 8:30am your guide and driver will pick you up at the hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter. You will then travel Hoa Lu which is a 2.5 hour drive. You will appreciate the length of the drive when you arrive at the historic capital of Vietnam and the famous ancient temples of Le and Dinh Dynasties. 

After lunch, you will be taken by boat to visit Tam Coc and see the beauty of the karst formations as you pass along their base you will row into one of many caves carved through the limestone. You will cycle for an hour on quiet roads through villages, rice fields, rivers and rocky outcrops in Tam Coc and also in Bich Dong. Your driver will go to Hanoi and drop you off at your hotel around at 6pm.
strTitle: Hoa Lu and Tam Coc Day Trip from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
The Trang An Tourism Complex in the northern province of Ninh Binh which has officially been included in the UNESCO’s World Heritage Committee. The eco-tourist attraction located to the East of Ninh Binh, has an area of 31-miles (2000 ha), and is divided into 5 parts. You will find that these cultural locations are interesting and beautiful.

8am - Your tour guide and driver will pick you up at your hotel in Hanoi city. You will depart for Ninh Binh province 75 miles (120 Kms) and arrive at Trang An - Bai Dinh Pagoda.
10:30am - You will arrive at the Buddha Prayer location where you will see the largest pagoda in Vietnam which is called Bai Dinh Pagoda. This Buddha statue stands 32-ft. (10-meters) tall, and weighs a massive 100-tons. You will then have lunch in a local restaurant with some local special dishes such as Goat meat with elderberry, and a traditional Vietnamese pork storage vessel .
1pm -  Depart to Trang An where you will see amazing beauty. You will take a boat trip to visit the cave complex of, Sang Cave, Toi Cave, Ba Giot Cave. You are going to find mystery and wilderness in the scenery of the mountains, and rivers at Ha Long on the land of Ninh Binh. 
4pm - Return back to the car and go back to Hanoi.
6pm to 6:30pm - Once you arrive back to Hanoi your driver will take you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Hanoi Private Day Tour: Bai Dinh Pagoda and Trang An Caves

strIntroduction:
Cuc Phuong National park in Ninh Binh is the destination of this excursion. Through this special trip, tourists explore the beauty of nature by visiting the dense, grass jungle valley, seeing the giant ancient tree and various fauna and flora. In addition, rare primates are available for tourists to see and take photographs.

In the morning, tour guide and driver will pick you up at the hotel (8:00AM) and transfer to Cuc Phuong National Park (140km). Upon arrival, visit the Endangered Primate Rescue Central where the rare primates of Vietnam are reared and rescued, the Ancient grotto.

Then trekking through the dense, grass jungle valley to the giant ancient tree where enjoy the beauty of fauna and flora. You will have opportunity to visit the dense, grass jungle valley and see the giant ancient tree and various fauna and flora. At the end of the day, return to Hanoi and drop off at your hotel.
strTitle: Private Cuc Phuong National Park Day Trip

strIntroduction:
Discover Bangkok at your own pace with this private 4 hour city tour from the comfort of your own dedicated taxi with chauffeur. Be collected from your hotel, and then with tips and insights from your chauffeur, you can explore Bangkok your way and in your own time.

Take in the city highlights, all with time to spare to find that restaurant, that bar or that fruit market. Anything you want to see, just ask your chauffeur.

Your chauffeur will not only drive you anywhere in Bangkok City, they will help you find the local ticket office, advise the best place to charter a catamaran and even point out where to enjoy the best local cuisines.

With multiple departure times available every day, and comfortably seating 3 passenger, this clean, punctual and friendly service is ideal for the first time visitor or for that last minute shopping trip before catching a flight.

This course is the charter of the Bangkok city only.
strTitle: Private: 4-Hour Bangkok City Tour By Chauffeured Taxi

strIntroduction:
Explore Bangkok at your leisure with a private 4 hour city tour from the comfort of your own private VIP minivan, with chauffeur. Be collected from your hotel, and then with tips and insights from your chauffeur, you can explore Bangkok your way.

Treat your party to a leisurely cruise in Bangkok city, all from the comfort of your private VIP minivan. Anything you want to see, anywhere you want to visit, just ask your chauffeur.

Your chauffeur will not only drive you anywhere in Bangkok City, they will also help you find the local ticket office, advise the best place to charter a catamaran and even point out where to enjoy the best local massages, shopping and delicious cuisines.

With multiple departure times available every day, and comfortably seating 9 passengers, this clean, punctual and friendly service is ideal for the first time visitors or for that last minute shopping trip before catching a flight.

This course is the charter of the Bangkok city only.
strTitle: Private: 4-Hour Bangkok City VIP Tour by Chauffeured Minivan

strIntroduction:
Explore the ancient city of Ayutthaya like a VIP and travel from Bangkok in the comfort of a privately chauffeured minivan. See the UNESCO sights at your own pace during this full-day private tour. Customize your itinerary and choose from several morning departure times. Pricing is per group, based on a maximum of nine people.

At your chosen departure time you'll receive hotel pickup, then settle into your private, 9-passenger minivan for the drive to Ayutthaya, located about 50 miles (80 km) north of Bangkok.

This full-day tour is ideal for any group that wants a more personal and customized experience. You'll see the Historic City of Ayutthaya through the eyes of your own guide, who leads you through the magnificent ruins and ancient temples of the UNESCO World Heritage site. Many temples are still intact, such as Wat Phra Sanphet, Wat Mongkhon Bophit, Wat Panangcherng, and Wat Chai Mongkol, known for its large bronze statue of the Reclining Buddha.

Set your own agenda at your own pace, then use your professional chauffeured service for the return trip to Bangkok.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ayutthaya by Chauffeured Minivan from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Discover Bangkok and Ayutthaya at your own pace with this private 8 hour city tour from the comfort of your own dedicated taxi with chauffeur. Be collected from your hotel, and then with tips and insights from your chauffeur, you can explore your way and in your own time.

Take in the city highlights, the ancient city of Ayutthaya, all with time to spare to find that restaurant, that bar or that fruit market. Anything you want to see, just ask your chauffeur.

Your chauffeur will not only drive you anywhere in and near Ayutthaya, they will help you find the local ticket office, advise the best place to charter a catamaran and even point out where to enjoy the best local cuisines.

With multiple departure times available every day, and comfortably seating 3 passenger, this clean, punctual and friendly service is ideal for the first time visitor or for that last minute shopping trip before catching a flight.

This course is the charter of the Ayutthaya district only.
strTitle: Private: 8-Hour Ayutthaya Tour By Chauffeured Taxi from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Discover the vibrant city of Bangkok and its magnificent temples, then explore the UNESCO-listed Historic City of Ayutthaya while accompanied by a private guide. Travel like a VIP in the comfort of a chauffeured minivan from Bangkok. Customize your itinerary and explore at your own pace, choosing from several morning departure times. Pricing is per group, based on a maximum of nine people.

At your chosen departure time you'll receive hotel pickup by private, 9-passenger minivan. This full-day tour of Bangkok and Ayutthaya is ideal for any group that wants a more personal and customized experience. Visit Buddhist temples, starting at Wat Traimit with its Golden Buddha made of solid gold. Take time to include Wat Pho, the city's most extensive temple including its colossal Reclining Buddha, and see the chedis (stupas) of Wat Benchamabophit.

Then settle in for the drive to Ayutthaya, located about 50 miles (80 km) north of Bangkok. You'll see the Historic City of Ayutthaya through the eyes of your own guide, who leads you through the magnificent ruins and ancient temples of the UNESCO World Heritage site. Many temples are still intact, such as Wat Phra Sanphet, Wat Mongkhon Bophit, Wat Panangcherng, and Wat Chai Mongkol, known for its large bronze statue of the Reclining Buddha.

Set your own agenda at your own pace, then use your professional chauffeured service for the return trip to Bangkok.
strTitle: Private Tour: Bangkok Temples and Ayutthaya by Chauffeured Minivan from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Explore the popular seaside resort town of Pattaya, on Thailand's east coast, from the comfort of a private chauffeured minivan. Be collected from your hotel, and with local insights from your chauffeur, the next 9 hours are as flexible as you need.

Pattaya, a vibrant and cosmopolitan city, built around the wide, crescent shaped bay of Ao Pattaya, is only 93 miles (149km) from Bangkok.

Packed with hundreds of beer bars, go-go clubs and massage parlors, it's 10 million annual visitors also come for the mega shopping centers, cultural and action-packed attractions and international restaurants.

Bangkok, Thailand's vibrant capital, is one of the world's most exotic and colorful cities, offering a unique blend of the tradition and ultra-modern. As fun as the city is, it is always a great idea to head towards the country side to experience the rural Thai culture, as life can be remarkably different.

Both cities are yours to explore at your own pace with 9 hours of private use of this chauffeured minivan. Anything you want to see, just ask your chauffeur.

With multiple departure times available every day, and comfortably seating 9 passengers, this clean, punctual and friendly service is ideal for any group that wants a more personal and customized experience.

This course is the charter of the Pattaya district only.
strTitle: Private: 9-Hour Pattaya Tour by Chauffeured Minivan from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a unique and unforgettable night out at Bangkok's legendary Calypso Cabaret at the Asiatique entertainment complex and enjoy a spectacular show performed by Thailand's famous transgender artists. The 1.5-hour show includes dazzling costumes, Japanese geisha dancing, Korean pop songs, and tributes to global icons such as Elvis, Beyonce, and Lady Gaga.

Make your own way to the Calypso Cabaret Theatre, located at the Asiatique The Riverfront entertainment complex. Depending on the option chosen, arrive at either 8pm or 9.30pm in time for the 8.15pm or 9.45pm show, or kick off your evening with a delicious dinner and cultural dance performance before the main event begins. 

Then, settle into your seats for the 1.5-hour show and prepare to be entertained by the spectacular dancers, singers, and performers, dressed to the nines in dazzling costumes and towering heels. Journey through Asia as you enjoy Japanese geisha dancing, listen to Korean Pop, and are serenaded with Chinese love songs, then sing along to hits by icons like Beyonce, Elvis, and Lady Gaga. 

Before or after the show, take time to explore the Asiatique The River Front entertainment complex, howe to over 1,500 shops, restaurants, and bars.
strTitle: Calypso Cabaret Show Ticket

strIntroduction:
Lotus Valley Golf Resort, designed by golf legend Gary Player, is located to the east of Bangkok, and only 50 minutes from Suvanabhumi International Airport.
These packages include return hotel transfers, green and caddy fees, plus a golf cart, and will suit the golf devotee or those simply in need of some time out on the green.

Lotus Valley Golf Resort has two conventional loops of nine holes and a par 72, championship length of 6,955 yards from the tips.

Every hole presents those chasing par with an easier path to the green, or for those chasing a birdie, a more risky route. Both have their challenges and will certainly put your skills to the test.

True to Player's style and in leaning towards the traditional Scottish design, players can enjoy the close cut fairways and fringes that feature around the greens.

As would be expected from a golf resort of this quality, is the The Lotus Leaf Restaurant, which can be found overlooking the 18th green. Widely known for its extensive selection of Thai, Japanese, Chinese, and Western cuisine, the view from the outside terrace is a favorite setting for those post-round drinks.

The booking Process:
Your booking will be submitted as On Request for the next available Tee Off slot, within the time range selected. You will receive a reply with a confirmed spot within your requested time range.
strTitle: Golf Tour Package: 2 Players at Lotus Valley Golf Resort Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Explore Damnoen Saduak Floating Market and the city of Bangkok like a VIP on this private full-day tour. Travel in the comfort of a chauffeured minivan and customize your itinerary while you explore each site at your own pace. Select from several morning departure times. Pricing is per group, based on a maximum of nine people.

At your selected departure time you'll receive hotel pickup by private, 9-passenger minivan. This full-day tour of Bangkok and Damnoen Saduak Floating Market is ideal for any group that wants a more personal and customized experience.

Discover the vibrant atmosphere at the Pak Khlong Talat flower market before a visit to several Buddhist temples, starting at Wat Traimit with its Golden Buddha made of solid gold. Take time to include Wat Pho, the city's most extensive temple including its colossal Reclining Buddha, and see the chedis (stupas) of Wat Benchamabophit.

You'll make a stop for authentic cuisine in Chinatown (own expense) before setting off for the bustling Damnoen Saduak Floating Market, located about 70 miles (110 km) west of Bangkok. Step back in time and observe the traditional way of bartering while vendors sell fruits, vegetables, and other produce from small shops on the riverbanks and directly from boats floating along the network of canals through the village.

Set your own agenda at your own pace, then use your professional chauffeured service for the return trip to Bangkok.
strTitle: Private Tour: Floating Market and Bangkok Sightseeing by Chauffeured Minivan

strIntroduction:
Explore the ancient city of Ayutthaya and the Floating Markets of Damnoen Saduak, like a VIP and at your own pace, from the comfort of your private chauffeured minivan.
Be collected from your hotel, and with local insights from your chauffeur, the next 9 hours are as flexible as you need.

Ayutthaya, a Unesco World Heritage site, is approximately 50 miles (80km) north of Bangkok and home to some of the most ancient and magnificent ruins and temples.

Many are still intact, such as Wat Phra Sanphet, Wat Mongkhon Bophit, Wat Panangcherng and Wat Chai Mongkol, known for its large bronze statue of the reclining Buddha.

Soak up the atmosphere of the bustling and vibrant floating market of Damnoen Saduak. Located around 70miles (110 km) west of Bangkok, you will take a step back in time when you witness the old style and traditional way of Thai trading.

Fruits, vegetables and other produce, are bought and sold from small merchant shops on the river banks to the many traditional boats trading directly from the river as they float along the network of canals.

To truly experience the magical city of Ayutthaya and the excitement of the floating markets of Damnoen Saduak, is to set your own agenda and your own pace. With 9 hours of private access to this professional chauffeured minivan service, with the local knowledge and recommendations from your driver, you are free to take all the time you need.

With multiple departure times available every day, and comfortably seating for up to 9 passengers, this clean, punctual and friendly service is ideal for any group that wants a more personal and customized experience.
strTitle: Private: 9-Hour Ayutthaya and Floating Markets Tour by Chauffeured Minivan from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Broadway high kicks, mimed pop songs, choreographed movements, and melodrama all add to the fun of this tongue-in-cheek Mambo Cabaret Show in Bangkok. You'll be mesmerized by the glamour of Thai 'Lady Boys' who dance and sing in dazzling evening dresses and stilettos. Add to the excitement with a post-show dinner upgrade at a traditional Thai restaurant.

Make your way to the Mambo Cabaret Show venue in Bangkok to pick up your admission ticket. Settle into your deluxe or VIP seat and be prepared for 80 minutes of seductive — and sometimes humorous — entertainment on stage. Established in 1997, Mambo Cabaret provides viewers of all genders with an energetic performance by Thailand's 'Lady Boys.' 

If you select the upgrade upon booking, continue your night out with dinner after the show. Stop by Nopparat, a restaurant conveniently located next to the Mambo Cabaret Show theater, for an authentic Thai dinner complete with a traditional dance performance.
strTitle: Bangkok Mambo Cabaret Show Ticket

strIntroduction:
Vintage was designed by renowned US golf architect Arthur Hills, in fact his only golf course in Thailand.
These packages include return hotel transfers, green and caddy fees, plus a golf cart, and will suit the golf devotee or those simply in need of some time out on the green.

The Vintage Club is 50 minutes from downtown Bangkok and close to Suvanabhumi Airport. Several Thai PGA and Thai LPGA events have been staged at Vintage. It was designed by the up and coming US golf architect Arthur Hills and is one of his only Asian creations.

The course retains many of the natural surroundings like marshes with reeds and multi-colored bougainvillea plants to give the golfer the feeling that he is in the Thai countryside rather than at a championship course in the outskirts of Bangkok.

The caddies are excellent, speak good English and are extremely knowledgeable about golf and the golf course. Locker rooms, restaurant, and pro shop are all located here. The locker rooms are airy, well-appointed and offer additional stream room, Jacuzzi and massage.

The booking Process:

strIntroduction:
It is the best spa in Bali. Most comfortable and luxurious place for ayurveda packages, stone massage, chocolate treatment to refresh your body and soul.
Inspired by the beauty of Bali's natural environs, the spa you will experience will present a natural relaxation and treatment assortment for health and beauty. Spa guests experience treatments from head to toe, and find it a perfect way to indulge in holiday pleasure, reviving, energizing, refreshing and pampering their way into a brighter complexion. The spa offers a complete range of body treatments for stress reduction and restoring health and beauty, and is a total retreat in the name of well being.

Anika Spa is dedicated to travelers, busy professionals or couples who seek a retreat where they can rejuvenate both body and soul. Free pick up service is available within the Kuta, Seminyak, Sanur and Nusa Dua areas, if you are going to catch up with your flight after the experience, you can be transferred to Ngurah Rai Airport.

Treatments range from the traditional massage options, comprised of a full body massage using aromatherapy oil and combining the acupressure and stretching techniques of Balinese style, and will provide a sense of serenity and well being and will improve blood circulation.
strTitle: Balinese Style Spa Experience before Flight Departure with Transfer

strIntroduction:
This package includes 2.5 hour Bali cycling, 2.5 hour rafting experience and 2 hour volcanic treatment. This is an alternative offer to get away from main roads and busy towns to discover an abundance of exotic nature environment with Bali Cycling Trip to enjoy the naturally beautiful village with plural life, breath taking at river valley with jungle forest and exotic green rice field. After cycling tour, having fun at Telaga Waja river for rafting experience and following with a 2 hour volcanic treatment.

You will be picked up in your centrally located hotel in Bali.

Please note that all our Bali cycling trip are sightseeing based and are not a race experience, just ride your bike, light pedaling, and easy gear shifting, with smooth suspension. Your instructors will help you navigate your bike in a true off-road track to 2.5 hour for exploring the nature, ending with lunch at a restaurant.

Afterwards, get ready to explore the beautiful panorama and the extremely exciting Telaga Waja river in Karangasem. This rafting is 10 miles distance and about 2.5 hour.

Ending your adventure by enjoying a complete range of body treatments; stress reduction, restore health and beauty, and total wellbeing. Featuring traditional herbs, fresh fruit, and plants blended with aromatherapy to attain relaxation essence as well as harmony body and soul. Balinese Massage is based on the traditional Javanese method to improve blood circulation, muscle relaxation, and tension relief.

After this, you will be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Bali Adventure Day Tour: Cycling, Rafting and Volcanic Spa Experience

strIntroduction:
Join us on enjoy our Balinese Rijsttafel cuisine - A Dutch word meaning 'rice table', including of a number of dishes that make a good introduction to our food.

You will be picked up at your centrally located hotel and start your Rijsttafel dinning adventure. Menus including:

• Sate: Often seen in other south Asian cuisines, but originally from Indonesia - which is why ours is the best!
• Nasi Goreng: The easiest introduction to our cuisine - fried rice with a selection of meats and seafood in a mixture of mild spices.
• Sambal: Rather hot chili sauce - if you want more heat, ask for a side-order.
• Rice: The best foil if you mix with sambal

You can also choose Rijstafel Special: a luxurious mix of some of Indonesia's best-loved dishes.
strTitle: Balinese Rijsttafel Dinner at Warung Nia

strIntroduction:
Off-road driving in Jeep cars. Obstacle course driving in a beautiful nature area at Österlen, south east Sweden. 1 hour from Malmö and 1 hour 30 minutes from Copenhagen.

The trail is located with views of the ocean and cornfields, just outside Glemmingebro between Ystad and Simrishamn, in the beautiful area of Osterlen. About 1h 30 min from Kastrup Copenhagen airport. The trail offers four challenging stock obstacles and a couple of up-and-downhills. Feel how the car you drive behaves going up or down, when the side angle is up towards 38 degrees or when you just see the blue, or gray, sky going up the teeter totter. Just a couple of stone throws away from our trail is a number of good restaurants and cafes.


You will use cars of the brand Jeep. For a really good reason. It’s Jeep that is original for four wheel-drive vehicles. You have the following Jeep models: Jeep Wrangler Unlimited, Wrangler, Cherokee and Grand Cherokee. The cars are model year ’06 or newer. They are all inspected, serviced, understated and “in service”.
strTitle: 4WD Off-Road Driving Experience in Osterlen

strIntroduction:
Discover the cultural side and traditional sites of Dubai and get to know the Bedouin customs and traditions. Learn about the early days of settlement in Dubai and visit Dubai’s most interesting museums and its old districts.

Your 4-hour cultural tour of Dubai begins with a transfer in a private luxury car to the historic Al Shindaga district, characterized by its narrow streets. where your tour begin at the house of H.H. Sheik Said.

As you’ll see on your walking tour that the district is now home to art galleries museums and restaurants, but you’ll still get a sense of Dubai as it was at the turn of the 20th century. Its also a place where you will get the chance to visit to the Camel Museum, and then the Horse Museum, Heritage Village, and the Diving Village.

Then you continue to Al Fahidi Fort, which was a fort converted to a museum in 1971 to preserve the culture and the heritage of the city. Experience the traditional style of local life, and see how the wind towers were used to cool most Bedouin summer houses.


Your walking tour will take you along the narrow streets, where you’ll see Indian temples and the old market or Mina Bazaar. Enjoy crossing the glittering Dubai Creek by traditional abras (water taxi boats). Your luxury private car will be waiting after your visit to the Spice & gold Market to transfer you back to your hotel or one of your desired location .

strTitle: Cultural Tour Of Dubai

strIntroduction:
Your adventitious full day private tour is combined between a visit to the Dubai’s most interesting water park (Aquaventure) followed by high end open buffet lunch at Atlantis, The Palm and a awesome evening Desert Safari is where you will get the adrenaline high while you’re riding the red dunes.

You will enjoy an adventurous 12 hours of water and desert activities. Your private full day tour will begin by a visit to the Palm Island, Jumeirah, where you will plunge into one of the most exciting water parks in the world ( the Aquaventure, Atlantis) .

You will feel the high speed sliding from the tower of Neptune which is a steep slide that will throw you into an aquarium full of sharks but don’t be frightened you’re protected by a glass window; if you’re having kids they will also adore their dedicated area which is called the splash children play.

You will find out that you can spend hours drifting around, chilling, thrilling and spinning in a very long river of 2 km, as the aquaventure in is the biggest and the most exciting water park in the region.

By midday you can enjoy an international buffet lunch with plenty of varieties right before your second half day out in Dubai starts when the 4x4 jeep safari will come to pick you up for about an hour drive toward the red dunes, where you will be able to visit the camel farms and Bedouin camps.

Get the adrenaline high with a spectacular drive across the magnificent sand dunes in a luxury four wheel drive vehicles till you reach one of the highest points. A photostop is provided then you continue to the Alibaba Bedouin village (literally in the middle of nowhere).

You will admire the sunset over the dunes with an unforgettable photostop that’s offered to save your memories of the day. Upon arrival to the camp you will have the chance to experience a free camel ride, you will be served with some Arabic coffee with cardamom then your safari guide will lead you to your dedicated sites. The Entertainment began while you’re enjoying a delicious barbecue dinner prepared and served under millions of stars. Then there is a time to relax under our traditional Arabic tents with their flooring carpets. Stretch your legs and smoke some water pipes (shisha) and do not forget to ask the henna lady to draw you a temporary tattoos on your hands or feet.

An oriental dancer will be there to entertain you for about half an hour dance,she might ask you to join her onto the dance floor so please do not hesitate to practice some belly dancing and have some fun.

As your journey ends heading back to your place of stay in Dubai; a lot of memories to share with your friends and families.
