This fantastic night tour will give you the opportunity to enjoy spectacular sightseeing of Dubai with several photo stops near the biggest city monuments such as Burj Al Arab and Atlantis. You will be amazed by the different colors of lights making the Marina skyscrapers a magical wonder.

Your professional guide will pick you up from your place of stay and you will be driven toward the impressive Dubai Marina where everything around you is illuminated. Here you will enjoy taking several photos with different backgrounds.

We will return back to our luxury vehicle and head to the Palm island Jumeirah named as the 8th wonder that has changed the geographic map of the of the world. We will drive for about five kilometers (3.1 miles) around this magnificent man-made achievement before you enjoy a second photo stop at the majestic Atlantis that exposes the ingenious technologies used to allow engineers to build this jewel.

Your journey will continue toward Burj al Arab that is standing proud at the coast of Dubai 321m high. This structure is designed to amaze you as a visitor as it is a top holiday destination.

We will then visit Madinat Jumeirah (known as the little Venetia) which is home to 40 restaurant and bars. This unique architecture will remind you of the water canals in Venice with its little boats floating around this amazing resort .

Your tour will end by a visit to the city's most visible marvel the Burj Khalifa, half a mile high and almost twice as tall as the empire state building. It is the tallest skyscraper in the world and home to 35,000 people.

Special Offer - Book by February 1st, 2017 to save 10% off our previously offered price! - Book Now!
strTitle: Dubai City Tour By Night With Burj Khalifa Ticket

strIntroduction:
Your full day tour will take you away from the hustle and bustle of the city toward the east coast side of the UAE with a marvellous drive through different mountains and desert landscapes that will fulfil your memories before you land in one of the resorts to swim. Grab something to eat and do some snorkelling.

You will enjoy different landscapes heading toward the city of marvels Fujairah that sits at the mouth of the important trade route at the Indian ocean.

Your first stop will be at the Arabian wild life park which is one of the most interesting things that defines the emirate of Sharjah, the zoological park, houses the world’s largest collection of the Arabian wild life, demonstrating the diversity of the fauna found in the peninsula and creating awareness of the species in danger.

Your full day tour continues through the HAJAR mountains with different photo stops such as the Friday market home of traditional carpets, pottery and fruits.

You will get also to explore the Fujairah fort that is perched high on a hill together with the heritage that describes the history of the city at its best.

Your journey continues to the snoopy island where you will relax and get tainted at the beach Wright before you will enjoy a delicious lunch with different varieties of food.
Get to do some snorkelling and enjoy the different coral reefs that the island offers before heading back to Dubai.


Please note: that on Fridays and Saturdays the Arabian wild life park is closed
strTitle: Full Day East Coast Tour Including Snorkeling And Lunch

strIntroduction:
This awesome combo tour of Dubai will enable you to enjoy taking several photo-stops at the different city landmarks and savor the tastes of variety of dishes while cruising at the Dubai creek, on-board of a traditional wooden boat .

Get ready to explore the city with an orientation tour of Dubai. Your friendly local guide will show you the biggest highlights and landmarks starting with a photo stop at the very famous Burj Al Arab hotel which is a league of its own with its stupendous sail-boat style and luxurious fitting.

Your tour continues toward Palm Island Jumeirah, created using a land reclamation method which has become the world’s largest artificial island and home of some very famous five star hotels such as the majestic Atlantis Hotel.

Enjoy taking some pictures of al Bastakiya, now part of Dubai's quaint old quarter which houses the very famous Al Fahidi Fort which was turned into a museum since in 1971.

Enjoy a short ride by Abra(water taxi) toward the spice and gold market where you can bargain for your purchases.

The evening time you will find yourself stepping on-board into one of the typical Arab boats called Dhow dinner cruise, relax and enjoy cruising Dubai creek where you will come across spectacularly illuminated structures like Sheik Said’s House.

Enjoy these sights while partaking a delicious buffet dinner and an excellent selection of beverages, this sturdy boats are fantastic for a romantic dinner or simply for relaxation.

Special Offer - Book by February 1st, 2017 to save 38% off our previously offered price! - Book Now!
strTitle: Dubai City Tour With Dhow Cruise Dinner

strIntroduction:
The tour will take you to visit and explore 4 of the Northern parks of Tanzania: 1 night in Tarangire, 1 night Manyara, 1 night Serengeti and 1 night Ngorongoro. All the parks are home to small and large animals including birds and reptiles, accommodation can be at the standard lodge, 4 star lodges, luxury 5 star lodges, luxury tented camp or budget camp. You will enjoy and experience nature, wildlife, habit and habitat of the fauna and flora in the natural areas. You will also explore the local customs and culture.

Day 1: Arusha- Tarangire National Park
At 0800am, pick up from your hotel in Arusha town, with your packed lunch drive to Tarangire National Park for game viewing. At 13:00  enjoy your lunch in the park's picnic area. Dinner and overnight in Roika.
Meals: Full Board
Accommodation: Roika Tented lodge/Similar/Campsite FB

Day 2: Tarangire - Lake Manyara Park
After your breakfast at 08.30am, drive from Tarangire with your packed lunch to Manyara park for game viewing. At 13:00, enjoy your lunch in the park's picnic area. Lodge/Campsite for Dinner and overnight. BougainVillea safari lodge/ Twiga Campsite FB

Meals: Full Board
Accommodation: Bougainvillea safari lodge/Similar/ Campsite FB

Day 3: Manyara to Serengeti
After breakfast at 08:00am, drive from Manyara with your packed lunch and game en rooted to the great Serengeti Plains via Ngorongoro Conservation Area. After lunch, enjoy at your own leisure the Serengeti Serena Lodge or proceed with your game drive around Seronera or trace the direction of the migration. Dinner and Overnight in Serengeti at Katikati tented Camp/Seronera Wildlife Lodge/Campsite. FB

Meals: Full Board
Accommodation: Serengeti Katikati Tented Camp/Seronera Wildlife Lodge FB/seronera campsite

Day 4: Serengeti– Ngorongoro
After breakfast, drive and game en-route to Ngorongoro Conservation Area. It is your option whether you pass by Olduvai Gorge, a historical site whereby the early man lived or you can also pass by the Maasai boma if you are interested in the real African life tradition and culture (extra cost), after your lunch, the en-route adds to the crater rim for your dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Sopa lodge/ Simba Campsite. FB

Meals: Full Board
Accommodation: Ngorongoro Sopa lodge/ Simba Campsite- FB


Day 5: Ngorongoro Crater - Arusha
After breakfast, descend into the crater floor with your lunch box for game viewing. The famous Ngorongoro Crater is rich with wildlife, each species have their own territories, so this is a very good time to visit the crater as it is during the end of November to December, also during the end of the long rain season. Late April to May, numbers of animals come out to feed, so spotting them become very easy. Your packed lunch will be served on the crater floor at the picnic site near Lerai forest or hippo pool. Late afternoon ascend the crater and drive back to Arusha town. Dinner and overnight at your Hotel.
strTitle: Backpackers Safari: 5-Day Guided Tour from Arusha

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this 3-days safari tour to Tarangire NP Lake Manyara NP and Ngorongoro Crater. All meals and camping accommodation will be included for both vegetarian and non vegetarian. Availability to upgrade to budget lodge, mid range accommodation or luxury accommodation.

Day 1: Arusha to Tarangire National Park
After breakfast, you will leave at 08:30 to Tarangire National Park for game-viewing with a packed lunch for a picnic, after lunches proceed with game-viewing. Dinner and overnight stay at Kigongoni Campsite FB.

One of the most noticeable things on entering the park are the baobab trees that rise up form the grass. With their massive trunks, they are instantly recognizable. There are animals that usually move northwards of the park during the wet season including the wildebeests, zebras, Thompson's gazelles, buffalos, elands and hartebeests. The elephant population in this park was estimated to be around 6'000 in 1987, but numbers are believed to have fallen since then due to poaching.

Day 2: Tarangire to Lake Manyara National Park
After breakfast you will drive to Lake Manyara National Park for game-viewing, you will have picnic lunch at Manyara and after lunch continue your game viewing. Dinner and overnight stay at Twiga Campsite FB.

A major attraction of the Lake Manyara National Park are the tree-climbing lions. Unfortunately there is no guarantee that you will spot them. However, there are other things to see - elephants, hippos, zebras, impalas, buffalos, baboons, plains animals as well as huge variety of bird-life, both resident and migratory.

Day 3: Lake Manyara to Ngorongoro Crater and back to Arusha
After breakfast drive to Ngorongoro with packed lunch, descend into the crater floor for game-viewing. The famous Ngorongoro Crater is rich of wildlife, each species have their own territories. Your packed lunch will be served on the crater floor at the picnic site near Lerai forest or hippo pool. In the evening you will drive back to your accommodation at Arusha.

The conservation area encompasses Ngorongoro Crater, Embagai Crater, Olduvai Gorge - famous for its palaeontological relics - and Lake Masek. The Crater is a home to small number of black rhinoceroses, sustains a huge population of ungulates and has the most concentrated numbers of lions.
strTitle: 3-Day Safari Tour to Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park and Ngorongoro Crater from Arusha

strIntroduction:
Embark on an unique guided day trip to the Tarangire National Park. This trip will provide you with a brief but unforgettable African wildlife safari experience and the chance to witness all the beauty of Tanzania.

Your tour starts with you being picked up from your hotel in Arusha town and then heading south to the stunning Tarangire National Park. You will arrive at the Tarangire national park for game viewing. In the afternoon you will stop for a picnic lunch. Your afternoon game-drive will reveal all the wonders of Tarangire, with the highest number of elephants in the whole of the northern Tanzania parks, exceeding Lake Manyara and Serengeti. There have also been an estimate of 550 bird species recorded there, making it a great attraction for any bird lover.

Tarangire National Park displays a diverse number of wildlife such as: elephant, lesser and great kudu, African buffalo, cheetah, fringe-eared Oryx, leopard, lion, Masai giraffe, spotted hyena, common zebra, white-bearded wildebeest, warthog, eland, olive baboon, bat-eared fox, impala, common waterbuck, bushbuck, coke's hartebeest, gerenuk, and bohor reedbuck.

Conclude your tour back in your hotel in Arusha.
strTitle: Tarangire National Park: Guided Day Tour from Arusha

strIntroduction:
This tour will give you opportunity to observe wildlife in their natural habitat starting in Arusha National Park, Tarangire, and Lake Manyara, Ngorongoro Ndutu/Olduvai end in Ngorongoro Crater.

Day 1: Arusha National Park
Early morning after breakfast, pick up from hotel in Arusha town with your packed lunch box and drive to Arusha National Park for game view buffaloes, bush buck, giraffes, hippos and many water birds living in and close to the water. In the late afternoon drive back to the hotel in Arusha town for dinner and overnight At Pamoja Expedition Lodge.

Day 2: Tarangire National Park
After breakfast you will be picked up from hotel in Arusha town 0830hrs and drive to Tarangire National Park. Spend Full day exploring Tarangire, one of Tanzania’s ‘secret’ wildlife havens… teeming with large populations of elephant, predators and their fleet-footed prey. Late evening drive to Manyara (Mto wa Mbu) for dinner and overnight in Manyara.

Day 3: Lake Manyara National Park
In the morning after breakfast at 0830hrs pick up from your hotel/lodge drive to Manyara for full day game viewing. Enter the Great Rift Valley and ManyaraNational Park. The lake’s waters sustain a bountiful avian population, including flamingoes, as well as numerous pods of hippos, dinner and Overnight Manyara- http://www.twigacampsitelodge.com/

Day 4: Ndutu/Olduvai
08:00 after breakfast drive to Ngorongoro Conservation area for game drive around Ndutu Area. The Ndutu area in southern Serengeti is the best place to be for the annual wildebeest migration. Elephant, lion, zebra and Thomson gazelles, cheetah, leopard, buck, hyena, bat eared fox, African wildcat etc., are here all year round. At 1330hrs break for lunch, after lunch drive to Olduvai Gorge, site of Louis and Mary Leakeys renowned archaeological discoveries. Their findings include some of the man’s earliest known ancestral remains, dinner and overnight in Ngorongoro Conservation Area- Rhino Lodge.

Day 5: Crater – Arusha
In the morning after breakfast at 0700hrs descends into the crater for crater tour. At 1215hrs ascend the crater and drive to the lodge for hot lunch. After lunch drive back to Arusha town.
strTitle: Tanzania Budget Lodge Safari From Arusha Town

strIntroduction:
Hike Kilimanjaro’s Machame Route with a mountain guide and porters on a 7-day trekking expedition that includes all park entrance, rescue, and camping fees, meals, and transport from Arusha to the mountain gates. Follow the mountain’s most popular trail through a variety of habitats, from low-lying rainforest to the Shira Plateau and Uhuru Peak.

Day 1: Machame Gate – Machame Huts

Begin hiking after transfer from Arusha, following the trail through thick rainforest to the edge of the low Alpine zone, with a total walking time of 5–7 hours.

Distance/ Altitude gain: 3.5 miles (5.5 kilometers)/ 3,940 feet (1,200 meters)

Day 2: Machame Huts – New Shira Camp

The trail gets steeper as you climb through the low alpine zone surrounded by moorlands and marshes, earning views to Kibo and Mount Meru. Total walking time of 4–6 hours.

Distance/Altitude gain: 3.5 miles (5.5 kilometers)/ 2,690 feet (820 meters)

Day 3: New Shira Camp – Lava Tower – Barranco Huts

Leave the Shira Plateau for the “Garden of the Senecios,” then hike past the dramatic Lava Tower, an imposing formation of volcanic rock. Total walking time of 5–7 hours.

Distance/altitude gain: 6.2 miles (10 kilometers)/ 440 feet (135 meters)
Note: altitude gain to Lava Tower is 2,590 feet (790 meters)

Day 4: Barranco Huts - Karanga Camp

Enter the high alpine zone and scramble the Barranco Wall; keep hiking over rolling terrain until you arrive at Karanga Camp, for a total walking time of 4–5 hours.

Distance/altitude gain: 3.5 miles (5.5 kilometers)/ 185 feet (55 meters)

Day 5: Karanga Camp - Barafu Huts

Continue along a scenic traverse to Barafu, your final camp before attempting the summit of Uhuru Peak. Total walking time 4–5 hours.

Distance/altitude gain: 2.2 miles (3.5 kilometers)/ 2,105 feet (640 meters)

Day 6: Summit Attempt: Uhuru Peak via Stella Point

Start hiking in the dark, walking up Kibo to the summit rim, then continuing past Stella Point to the trip’s final goal: the summit of Uhuru Peak. Enjoy the view from the highest peak on the African continent before beginning the descent to Millenium Camp. Total walking time varies between 10 and 16 hours.

Distance/altitude gain: 3 miles (5 kilometers) ascending, 6.2 miles (10 kilometers) descending/ 3,980 feet (1,215 meters)

Day 7: Millennium Camp – Machame Gate

Continue descending to the original starting point of the hike, where you’ll meet a driver for the return trip to Arusha. Total hiking time 5 hours.

Distance/altitude: 12.5 miles (20 kilometers)/ 6,530 feet (1,990 meters)
strTitle: 7-Day Mount Kilimanjaro Trek Via Machame Route From Arusha

strIntroduction:
This package gives you time to relax in 8 days 7 nights as expected visiting Northern Circuit National Parks in Tanzania. Parks to be visited is inclusive of Arusha national Park, Tarangire National Parks, Lake Manyara National Parks, Serengeti National Parks and Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Three days on this tirp must be spent in Serengeti National Parks whereby chances to meet and see wildebeest,
migration are so high depending on immigration Calendar dates.

Day 1- Arusha National Park.
Your day tour begins from your hotel pickup at the morning, followed by the short drive to nearby Arusha National Park. Often overlooked by visitors to Tanzania, this is nevertheless a special place: your driver-guide will show you the ,marvelous and awesome Ngurdoto Crater and the splendid resident wildlife of different species.


Day 2- Tarangire National Park.
Pick up from your hotel or Lodge at Arusha at around 07:30 am and drive to Tarangire National Parks for Full day game drive. Here, You will have to carry with you a lunch box and 1.5 ltrs of bottled mineral water as you will have a pick nick lunch within the National Park. Tarangire National Parks is famous of having the largest number of elephant which are said to be its home in Northern Tanzania. It is also noted for its splendid baobab trees, rolling savannah and acacia woodland. Dinner and overnight to be spent at Sopa Lodges as well as breakfast.

Day 3- Lake Manyara National Park.
Pick up from the Lodge at 07:00 am and drive for about two hours to Lake Manyara National Park again for a full day Game drive. Lake Manyara is well known and it is famous for its tree climbing lion and in spotting wildlife it won’t let you down. The Park is a corridor for the great migration of huge herds of mammals towards the north and the south. Over 500 bird species are available in this park, we do expect that you can be able at least to spot an impressive hundred a day. Flamingos dot the lake surface joined by myriad other water birds that are the best spotted at the end of the dry season. The better place that you can encounter Palm-nut vulture is lake Manyara National park than any other place. Lion, Spotted hyena, serval, cracal, leopard and cheeter are more prolific in other parks, keeping an eye out will reap High rewards here. Full body Accommodation will be booked for you at Sopa lodges.
Day 4- Ngorongoro Conservation
After early breakfast, We drive to Ngorongoro conservation and descends in to the Crater floor for 6 hrs game viewing with picnic lunches in Ngorongoro Crater.

Day 5-8 Serengeti National Parks.
After breakfast, the Fifth day to Eighth day of this safari package will be spent taking another game drive in Serengeti National Park, Here, We target to give you a lifetime exposer and memorable safari ever thought as you can spend even more days without repetition of the same places and adventures. Spotting of wild animals of different species is not limited except time. Mid afternoon we drive back to Arusha town for drop off.
strTitle: 8-Days Luxury Safari in Arusha National Parks

strIntroduction:
This tour is short but you can have a chance to see big four, most accessible from Dar es Salaam. Within its 3230 square. km its set between the Uluguru Mountains to the north and the Lumango Mountains to the south-east. Mikumi hosts buffaloes, giraffes, elephants, lions, pythons zebras, leopards crocodiles and many more just to mention a few.

Pick up from your hotel and drive to Mikumi National Park, On arrival you start with game drive after few hours you stop for lunch and after lunch you proceed with game drive.

Mikumi National Park is Tanzania’s fourth – largest National Park and the most accessible from Dar es Salaam. Within its 3230 square kilometers, its set between the Uluguru Mountains to the north and the Lumango Mountains to the south-east. Mikumi hosts buffaloes, giraffes, elephants, lions, pythons zebras, leopards crocodiles and many more just to mention a few.

At 3pm drive back to Dar es salaam where you will be dropped at the hotel!
strTitle: Mikumi National Park Guided Safari Day Trip from Dar es Salaam

strIntroduction:
Embark on a brief yet unforgettable African wildlife safari experience in Arusha National Park and make the best of your stay while in Tanzania!

Meet your professional tour guide/driver who will pick you up from your hotel in Arusha and will deliver a short safari info briefing, after which you travel east to the Arusha National Park. This small but beautiful Tanzanian National Park is the closest national park to both the famous Arusha “safari town” (30 km) as well as the Kilimanjaro International Airport, thus making it ideal for 1-day safaris. Not only is the animal life in the park abundant, but it is also one of the most beautiful and topographically varied parks in Tanzania. The park’s three most significant features include the rugged Mount Meru (Tanzania’s second highest peak at 4566m), the notably different coloured Momela Lakes, and the 3km wide Ngurdoto Crater, which was formed about fifteen million years ago!

Enjoy lunch at the Momela wildlife lodge and do an exciting morning game drive and afternoon game drive, visiting both the Momela Lakes and the Ngurdoto Crater. Wildlife which could be seen include African buffalos, elephants, hippos, giraffe, warthogs, antelopes, zebras, blue monkeys and sometimes a rare leopard or hyena. Late afternoon depart for Arusha where you will end your safari adventure. You will be taken to your hotel, which ends your tour package services.
strTitle: Arusha National Park Guided Day Safari Tour

strIntroduction:
The filming location for many of the classic Tarzan movies, Lake Manyara offers a glimpse into Africa as you've always imagined it. Home to an astounding variety of birds as well as an impressive variety of mammals, Lake Manyara is a uniquely beautiful park and a must-see on any northern circuit excursion.

After breakfast you are met by your professional tour guide/driver, who will deliver a short safari info briefing, after which you travel west to the Great Rift Valley and the Lake Manyara National Park. You will travel through the agricultural and fresh produce market town of Mto Wa Mbu, which is situated next to the entrance of the Lake Manyara National Park. 

The Lake Manyara National Park is one of Tanzania’s most dramatically located African wildlife areas, consisting of a massive but shallow soda lake (covering two-thirds of the park) at the foot of the Great Rift Valley’s western escarpment. The park’s varied habitat attracts a wide variety of animals, including one of Africa’s densely populated African elephants herds, Lake Manyara’s famous tree-climbing lions, as well as large flocks of flamingos, attracted by the algae in the lake. You will enjoy a picnic lunch inside the park and do exciting morning and afternoon game drives, in search of the tree-climbing lions. Late afternoon you depart for Arusha from Lake Manyara where you will end your safari adventure. You will be taken to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Safari in Lake Manyara National Park from Arusha

strIntroduction:
This day trip is designed for the purpose of those who are limited with time and budget. Enjoy the birding excursion at Lutembe bay Entebbe and experience bird-life and different species of birds like Lead-colored Flycatcher, African Green Pigeon, Black-necked Weaver, Holub's Golden Weaver and many other birds.

Leave Kampala early in the morning at around 6:30am and set out for the Lutembe Bay birding experience. It is a gazetted ramsar Site and an important birding spot for an excursion.

Expect to see numerous water, grassland and woodland bird species notably; the sun bird species that include; Marico Sunbird, Scarlet-chested sunbird, Green-headed Sunbird and Green-throated Sunbird, Blue-breasted Bee-eater, Cape Wagtail, Africa Wattled Lapwing, Senegal Lapwing, Yellow-throated Long craw, Yellow-browed Camaroptera, White-headed Saw-wing, White-browed Scrub-robin, Brown-backed Scrub-robin, Lead-colored Flycatcher, African Green Pigeon, Black-necked Weaver, Holub's Golden Weaver, Speckle-breasted Woodpecker, Africa-Pygmy Kingfisher and so many other species of bird.

Break off for your lunch from 1pm to 2pm, where after you will embark on your bird experience within the Lutembe bay.

Time allowing, you shall continue to UWEC (Uganda Wildlife Education Centre) in Entebbe for another birding experience and expect to see; the rare Shoebill stork and many other birds.

Conclude your tour back in your hotel in Kampala around 5pm.
strTitle: Full-Day Bird Watching Guided Tour To Lutembe Bay Entebbe from Kampala

strIntroduction:
On this day trip, you will hike on the Marangu Route up to Mandara Hut for lunch. The short treks are geared for people who like to hike but reaching the summit isn’t a “must do”, and allow one to experience the excitement of hiking on the highest peak on the African continent.

All trekking inside of the Tanzania National Park require the services of a certified Kilimanjaro guide, and the Marangu route is the only route where short treks are allowed.

After breakfast at your hotel, you will meet your guide, drive to the Kilimanjaro National Park Gate (about 1 hour), register and commence the climb.

Walk through the rainforest to the encampment. A side trip to Maundi Crater is a good way to see the surroundings including Northern Tanzania and Kenya. In the rain-forest, look for towering Eucalyptus trees, bird life, and Colobus monkeys.

After lunch, hike back to park gate and drive back to Moshi.
strTitle: Mount Kilimanjaro Short Trek from Arusha

strIntroduction:
The snake park provides various activities, take a guided tour and learn about some of the most dangerous snakes in the world, from the Black and Green Mamba, Egyptian Cobra, Puff Adders and many more. Check out the 3m plus crocodiles at feeding time.You can also enjoy your personal Maasai guide who will take you on a spectacular tour of the Maasai Cultural Museum, to jumping on a camel and going on safari to the local village.

Meserani Snake Park is located 25km western of Arusha city well accessible and tarmac road make it easier in getting there. It is an exceptional treasure of Arusha that provide relaxations, excitement and educational tours you have ever had. The guided tour at Meserani will take you through Maasai Cultural museum and learning various venomous and non-venomous snakes in the world including vipers, crocodiles, raptors and many more to see. 

Later visit a camel ride site and take a short ride around. After lunch, visit a Maasai Village to see the traditional houses and lifestyle of the Maasai.

Before driving back to Arusha, pass via Ol Doinyo Orok, then stop by a shop for your window shopping or buying some stuff to take back home with you before concluding your tour in your hotel.
strTitle: Meserani Snake Park Guided Day Tour in Arusha

strIntroduction:
These short trips are designed to serve those who are limited on time, or as a refresher for travelers who have visited the parks in the past, because Tarangire National Park is accessible within a day. These tours have been planned for everyone to enjoy, and be left with a thirst to come again.

The safari will start in the morning, and head out to Tarangire National Park. Upon arrival you'll go straight for game viewing in the park. At 1pm the tour will break for a picnic lunch. Your afternoon drive will reveal all the mesmerizing wonders of Tarangire. The park is often referred to as the 'Elephant Playground', with herds of about 300 of these mighty mammals, most of the time seen in the park along Tarangire River.

In addition to the large herds of elephants, Tarangire is also home to buffalo, giraffes, warthogs, waterbuck, impala, lions, wildebeest, zebras, bushbuck and gazelle, while gerenuk and fringe-eared Oryx are local favorites. Lake Burungi's marshy shores are a lure for these mammals, as well as many beautiful bird species. Look out for Giant kingfishers, hoopoe and the delightfully-named "White-bellied go-away bird".

At the end of the day you'll be driven back to your hotel in Arusha for drop off.

Accommodation: NIL

Basis: Full body: Tea/coffee & Picnic lunch

Tour type: Guided game drive
strTitle: Full-Day Safari in Tarangire National Park in Tanzania

strIntroduction:
The five days trip given in this itinerary is a basic camping that will expose you to cover the large part of the Northern Circuit National parks which are considered to be the most famous among others. The coverage includes Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area and its Crater as well as Serengeti National Park.

Day 1: Arusha to Tarangire Np
Pick up from the lodge at in 08:00 am after breakfast at your lodge of choice in Arusha town. Here lunch boxes will be prepared and be taken on the way. After breakfast, the safari will start from Arusha to Tarangire National parks for game drive. Game viewing until 13:00 hrs for Pick nick Lunch. After the whole day game drive then you will spend your overnight and dinner at Roika Tented camp lodge FB.

Day 2: Tarangire NP to Lake Manyara NP.
After breakfast, A drive of about 1 hour to the next tour will began to Lake Manyara National Park, The park is sometimes described as “The Emerald of Africa” with the Lake behind and the wall of the Rift valley on the right. You will see Impala and water buck in the forest glades and klipspringer on the rocks near the western end Manyara. An overnight will be spent at the Twiga campsite Lodge FB.

Day 3: Lake Manyara NP to Serengeti NP
After breakfast, Earliest possible in the morning (as agreed) a drive from Lake Manyara National Park with your lunch boxes then driving to Serengeti National Park via Ngorongoro Conservation Area, Mostly referred to as the home of the big Five. Cultural tourism can also be done since Maasai boma are also located along the way to Serengeti. Dinner and overnight at Katikati tented camp lodge/ Totolise lodge FB

Day 4: Serengeti to Ngorongoro NP
After breakfast at 08:00am a drive from the campsite and within Serengeti Plain for game viewing will start and continue until the lunch hour. At 12:00 pm we break for Picnic lunch. At 5:00 pm we will be driving to Rhino lodge for Dinner and overnight FB.

Day 5: Ngorongoro Crater to Arusha
After breakfast at 8:00 am, we drive to Ngorongoro crater for game viewing with your lunch boxes. Late afternoon you will enjoy en route game drive back to Arusha for drop off.

Please note: The hotels detailed above are as a reference only and are subject to change based on availability and other conditions beyond our control. An alternative hotel with similar standards, quality and comfortability will be offered as a substitute"
strTitle: 5 Days Safari In Tarangire, Lake Manyara, Ngorongoro and Serengeti NP From Arusha Town

strIntroduction:
This short trip is actually designed for travelers with very short time to spend at the National Parks. It's perfect for those who have visited Tanzania and would like to refresh their memory with a short trip. However, it does not mean, you cannot plan and organize for an entire day trip. Like many other trips, they have been planned to ensure that everyone who books it, is enjoying their time and left with a thirst to come again and again to Ngorongoro.

Ngorongoro crater is now considered one of the wonders of the world and you will be able to witness this with your own eyes. The start of this safari will be from your hotel in the morning right after breakfast. Your first visit you will witness the Volcanic caldera (Largest in the world) a mixture of flora, fauna and also witness permanent water in the crater floor that makes and sustain lives of more than 25,000 mammals and reptiles. You may be able to witness the black rhino since their shelters are at the floor of the crater along with many other mammals like leopards, hyenas, wallowing hippos, water bucks, elephants, lions, hyenas, jackal, baboons and many more. Ngorongoro is far more unique as it is defined as a multiple usage area where the indigenous people, the visitors and the wildlife are protected and in fact the home of the big five in the world.
strTitle: Private Tour: Ngorongoro National Park Day Trip

strIntroduction:
The two days trip given in this itinerary will expose you to cover just two of the National Parks of your choice as you have been given an opportunity to decide. The two National Parks are within the Northern Circuit National parks which are considered to be the most famous among others. The coverage will either be Tarangire National Park or Lake Manyara National Park and Ngorongoro Conservation Area with its Crater.

Day 1: Arusha town to Tarangire National Park.
After breakfast, pick up from your lodge/hotel drive to Tarangire National Park for a full day game drive with picnic lunches.
In the Park you will be able to see the big number of elephants, other animals, baobab trees and large batch of colorful and exclusive bird species which give wonderful sightings which make Tarangire a popular safari destination.
Late evening drive to Kigongoni Lodge for dinner and overnight.

Day 2: Tarangire NP to Ngorongoro National Park.
After early breakfast descends in to the Crater floor for about 6 hours game viewing with picnic lunches in Ngorongoro Crater. Here justification of why is it considered as one of the wonder of the world.
Ngorongoro is one of the true wonders of nature and home of Rhinos, Elephants, Lions and many other species. Late in the afternoon we drive back to Arusha town for drop off.
strTitle: 2 Days Safari From Arusha Town, Tanzania

strIntroduction:
Experience truly remote and wild places of Northern Tanzania on this comprehensively private Tanzania safari. The tour will let you experience the great wildebeest migration in the impressive Serengeti view wildlife up close in the magnificent Ngorongoro crater and walk with masai in the Ngorongoro highland.
This safari itinerary combines luxury tented lodges with permanent wilderness luxury lodges. All safaris use well-maintained and extended Toyota Land Cruisers, with roof hatches for unobstructed and up-close game-viewing and private Tanzanian safari guide.

Day 1: arrive in Arusha Arrive anytime at Kilimanjaro International Airport (JRO) and get your private transfer to Arusha at Moivaro Lodge. The rest of the day is at leisure. Stay at Moivaro Lodge, which is beautifully located on the coffee farms and is a perfect place to prepare for your adventure. You will have a pre-safari briefing and an equipment check at the hotel. It will also be checked that you have the appropriate mandatory medical coverage and travel insurance for your safety.
Day 2: A full day game drive in Serengeti National Park. Depending on the time of the year and the migration of the herds you can expect to see wildebeest, lions, elephants, giraffe, zebras, Monkey, baboons, hippos, rhinos, antelopes as well as a multitude of birds. Dinner and overnight at Serengeti Simba Lodge. Full board.
Day 3: Another full day game drive in Serengeti National Park. After breakfast you will take the packed lunch and proceed with the game drive in the Serengeti National Park. The migration can be seen on a long chain approximately 40 km heading to the south western direction. At around 12:30 and 13:00 break for your lunch. After having your lunch you will proceed with your game viewing following the move of the migrants on the southwest of the park. Approximately 1.3 million wildebeest, 250,000 gazelles and 200,000 Zebras have been recorded sharing the short grass. Dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Serena Lodge. Full board.
Day 4: Serengeti to Ngorongoro Crater An early morning game drive in the Serengeti followed by picnic lunch on the way to Ngorongoro crater. We will stop at Olduvai Gorge, the site of Louis and Mary Leakey’s renowned archaeological discoveries. Their findings include some of man’s earliest known ancestral remains. Dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Serena Lodge: Full board.
Day 5: Game drive in Ngorongoro Crater Today you will descend 2000 feet (over 600 meters) to the floor of the Ngorongoro Crater for your crater tour. Here you we will explore the forest areas inhabited by monkeys and elephants, the lake area, where we may see flamingos. You will also visit the open Savannah where the lions hunt. Picnic lunch will be served in the crater. Dinner and overnight at your lodge/Hotel in Arusha town.
strTitle: Tanzania 5 Days Private Safari - Wildebeest Migration from Arusha

strIntroduction:
You will be taken to Mikumi national park, which is Tanzania's fourth largest park based in southern circuit and it even covers a distance of 3230km.

This park is famous for tree climbing lions and it's bordered with both Udzungwa and Uluguru chain of mountains. The safari will starts from Dar es salaam and it takes approximately 4hrs which covers about 320km.

Day 1: Arrive in Dar es Salaam.
Upon arrival at the Dar ES Salaam International Airport, you will be met by a driver who will transfer you to the Transit Motel for an overnight stay.

Day 2: Dar es Salaam to Mikumi National Park.
At around 7:30 AM, you will be picked up from your Motel and driven to Mikumi National Park with your packed lunch. Arrive for an afternoon game drive that will last until sunset. Enjoy an evening drive to the Morio Motel in Mikumi town for dinner and an overnight stay. All meals included

Day 3: Return to Dar es Salaam.
After an early morning (sunrise game viewing) game drive, return to your accommodation for breakfast and prepare to check out. By noon, you will start driving back to Dar es Salaam and have lunch at Morogoro Town. Your guide will bring you back to the airport in the early evening.
strTitle: 3-Day Safari in Mikumi National Park

strIntroduction:
You get unparalleled access to the famous Tanzania national parks: Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara National Park, Ngorongoro Crater, and the great Serengeti national Park.

This is a suggested or sample of Northern safari itinerary - it can be adapted to suit your own personal needs and preferences, or to any seasonal changes and migratory animal movements.

Day 1: Arusha - Tarangire National Park
At 0800hrs, pick up from your hotel in Arusha town, with your packed lunch drive to Tarangire National Park for game viewing. At 1300 hrs take your lunch in the park picnic area, Evening drive to your Campsite for Dinner and overnight.
Day 2: Tarangire - Lake Manyara National Park:
After your breakfast at 0830 hrs drive from Tarangire with your packed lunch to Manyara park for game viewing. At 1300 hrs take your lunch in the park picnic area. Late afternoon drive to your Campsite for Dinner and overnight.
Day 3: Lake Manyara National Park To Serengeti National Park
After breakfast at 0800 hrs drive from Manyara with your packed lunch and game enrooted to the great Serengeti Plains via Ngorongoro Conservation Area. After lunch on your way, proceed with your game drive enroute towards Seronera campsite for Dinner and Overnight.
Day 4: Serengeti – Ngorongoro:
In this day you will wake up early in the morning for morning game drive in Serengeti, then back for breakfast at the camp. After breakfast, pack your equipments and with your packed lunch drive and game en-route to Ngorongoro Conservation Area. It is your option whether you pass by Olduvai Gorge a historical site whereby the early man lived and can also pass by the Maasai boma if you are interested in the real African life tradition and culture for extra costs, after your lunch en-route adds to the crater rim for your dinner and overnight at Simba Camba campsite.
Day 5: Ngorongoro Crater - Arusha
After breakfast, descend into the crater floor with your lunch box for game viewing. The famous Ngorongoro Crate is rich of wildlife, each species have their own territories. Late afternoon ascend the crater drive back to Arusha town for your onwards arrangement.
strTitle: 5 Days Tanzania Budget Camping Safaris

strIntroduction:
This is an ultimate day trip from Arusha. You will enjoy and experience nature, wildlife, habit and habitat of the fauna and flora in the natural areas.

Your day tour begins with your hotel pick-up at the morning, followed by a pleasant drive westwards to Lake Manyara National Park. First of all, we enjoy this morning with an introduction to northern Tanzanian culture, taking a short beak to fascinating Mto wa Mbu village. Incredibly, this 'village' is actually home to over eighteen thousand inhabitants, drawn from 120 different tribes.

Lake Manyara is rightly famous for its tree-climbing lions, but they're far from the only highlight: by the end of an exhilarating afternoon, you could easily have spotted elephant, hippo, wildebeest, buffalo and giraffe, plus many other species. Pink-hued flamingos, one of 400 bird species recorded here, provide a splash of colour. Late afternoon drive back to your hotel in Arusha.
strTitle: Full-Day Lake Manyara Tour from Arusha

strIntroduction:
Embark on our ultimate day trip to Arusha Nationanal Park. You can book at any time of your convenience,  You will enjoy and experience nature, wildlife, habit and habitat of the fauna and flora in the natural areas. 

Your day tour begins your hotel pickup in the morning, followed by the short drive to nearby Arusha National Park. Often overlooked by visitors to Tanzania, this is nevertheless a special place: your driver-guide will show you the marvellous Ngurdoto Crater and the splendid resident wildlife. In a park which is the only place on Tanzania's Northern Circuit where the acrobatic black and white colobus monkey can be easily seen.

Also present here are leopards and hyena, though an elephant sighting would be rare and lion are absent. But there is every chance to see giraffe and zebra, waterbuck and dik-dik. Enjoy the colorful birdlife with trogon, turaco and flamingo among the many species, while you break for picnic lunch, in this delightful setting. Your driver-guide is dedicated to helping you identify them all! After your time in the park, you will return to your Arusha accommodation.
strTitle: Full- Day Arusha National Park Safari from Arusha

strIntroduction:
Visit Lake Manyara National Park and Ngorongoro Crater on a two-day, private safari tour from Arusha that includes park entrance fees, meals, and accommodations at a safari lodge. Watch for tree climbing lions, hippos, flamingos, and big game on morning and afternoon game drives each day, while exploring the dramatic landscape of Tanzania’s Rift Valley.

Day 1: Arusha – Lake Manyara National Park (L, D)

Begin with an early pickup at your accommodations in Arusha, then travel to Lake Manyara National Park, where you’ll enter the northern part of the park for a morning game drive. This is the perfect place to spot big game such as buffaloes, elephants, and tree climbing lions: though it’s one of Tanzania’s smallest parks, Lake Manyara’s diverse landscape of 11 different ecosystems supports a thriving wildlife population.

Break for a picnic lunch, then drive into the southern part of Lake Manyara National Park, navigating between bubbling hot springs and hippo herds. During rainy season months you’ll see millions of flamingoes that color the horizon bright pink, along with pelicans, cormorants, and other birds. In the late evening, drive to a nearby safari lodge for dinner and overnight.

Overnight: The Octogon Safari Lodge (or similar)

Day 2: Ngorongoro Crater – Arusha (B, L)

After breakfast, drive over the edge of Ngorongoro Crater for a full day of game viewing. This is another prime place to see great flocks of flamingos and water birds, along with endangered black rhinos, elephant, zebras, gazelle, and top predators that include lions, cheetah, and leopards.

You’ll have a picnic lunch so you won’t miss out on any time in the park, with an afternoon game viewing session that stretches into the late evening. This tour concludes with return transfer to Arusha and drop-off at your accommodations.
strTitle: 2-Day Lake Manyara and Ngorongoro Crater Private Safari from Arusha

On this Tour, you get unparalleled access to the famous Tanzania national parks: Lake Manyara National Park, Ngorongoro Crater, and the great Serengeti national park.

Overnight at Rhino Lodge Or Similar

After breakfast, descend into the crater floor with your lunch box for game viewing. The famous Ngorongoro Crate is rich of wildlife, each species have their own territories. strTitle: 4-Day Wildlife Adventure from Arusha: Lake Manyara, Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater

strIntroduction:
Walk through Magamba rain forest a home to black and white colobus monkeys, visit an old trench dug by the German during World War 1, the guide will provide an explanation of German and British Colonial history.

Day 1: Walk through Magamba rain forest a home to black and white colobus monkeys, visit an old trench dug by the German during World War 1, the guide will provide an explanation of German and British Colonial history. Day 2: After breakfast walk through traditional villages and learn about typical traditional life style of washambaa, forests, pottery women group to Mtae a World view point with spectacular views overlooking Maasai plains, Mkomazi game reserve, Tsavo west in Kenya and also on clear days Kilimanjaro can be seen on the horizon, a good point for sun rise and sunset and overnight in Mambo Cliff Inn. FB

Day 3: Drive from Mtae to – Mazumbai Forest- A special highlights are the tea farms & the tea factory and the Mazumbai forest. Do evenings walk around Mazumbai forest and sport different types of chameleon, butterflies and black and whit colobus monkeys Overnight at Mazumbai rest house. FB

Day 4: A full day hike in Mazumbai forest rainforest, untouched forest which can fulfill your need of seeing Primary forest which remains all over Western Usambara Mountains. strTitle: 3-Day Safari to Ngorongoro Crater Tarangire and Lake Manyara National Park

strIntroduction:
The Wildebeest Migration in East Africa, also known as “The Great Migration” takes place between Tanzania's Serengeti National Park and Kenya's Masai Mara and is one of the greatest wildlife spectacles on the planet. Thousands of wildebeest and zebra’s migrate between the Serengeti and the Masai Mara, constantly driven by their search for fresh grazing. The massive herds are closely followed by predators (lion, hyena and cheetah), making the most of every opportunity to catch their next meal.

The precise timing of the annual wildebeest migration depends on the rains. It is a very unpredictable and spontaneous natural event, with calving season taking place in the Serengeti between January and mid-March. The wildebeest migration starts to head towards the Western Serengeti in May or June.

DAY 1: ARUSHA TO LAKE MANYARA PARK
After your breakfast at 8.30am drive from Arusha with your packed lunch to Manyara park for game viewing. At 1pm take your lunch in the park picnic area, evening drive to your lodge for Dinner and overnight at Manyara. Twiga Campsite.
DAY 2: MANYARA TO SERENGETI
After breakfast at 8am drive from Manyara with your packed lunch and game en route to the great Serengeti Plains via Ngorongoro Conservation Area.
After lunch at leisure in the lodge or proceed with your game drive around Seronera trace the direction of the migration.
Dinner and Overnight in the Seronera Campsite.
DAY 3: SERENGETI CENTRAL AREA:
After breakfast leave with your lunch for game drive on the Serengeti Park acacia Savannah in the central to the east region. Around 12.30pm and 1pm break for your picnic lunch, thereafter proceed with tour afternoon game drive. Evening drive to your Campsite for your dinner and overnight.
DAY 4: SERENGETI SOUTHERN AREA
After breakfast take a packed lunch with you and continue with game viewing on Serengeti Park. Aprox 1.3 million wildebeest, 250,000 gazelles and 200,000 Zebras have been recorded sharing the short grass/water which is the source of food for the millions of Animals in this Area. Dinner and overnight at Serengeti Katikati Tented Camp.
DAY 5: SERENGETI – NGORONGORO
After breakfast with your packed lunch drive and game enroute to Ngorongoro Conservation Area. After your lunch en route adds to the crater rim for your dinner and overnight Lodge at Ngorongoro Simba Campsite.
DAY 6: NGORONGORO – CRATER
After breakfast , descend into the crater floor with your lunchbox for game viewing. Your packed lunch will be served on the crater floor at the picnic site near Lerai forest or hippo pool.
Later ascend the crater for your dinner and overnight on the crater rim, Campsite.
DAY 7: NGORONGORO – TARANGIRE
This morning after breakfast leave Ngorongoro with your lunch box to Tarangire Park for game drive. Evening drive to your lodge/ campsite for dinner / overnight at Tarangire Kigongoni Campsite.
DAY 8: TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK
After breakfast at leisure in you lodge until lunchtime and this time you take your hot lunch. After lunch at 3pm,drive for evening game viewing on Tarangire Park. 5pm back to your Campsite.
DAY 9: TARANGIRE TO ARUSHA
After breakfast, leave Tarangire with your packed lunch to Arusha town, Afternoon drive and arrive in Arusha town where your tour ends
strTitle: Great Serengeti Migration Trail

strIntroduction:
With plentiful ways to experience the culture, we give you a chance to interact with locals, hunting with the Hadzabe bushmen, gather roots and seeds with the Datoga women. Maasai villages,Explore Serengeti National park(Home of migration trails) Ngorongoro Crater and Tarangire National Park.

Day 1: Arrive to Tanzania
Arrive in Arusha. Transfer from arrival point to Sakina Campsite for overnight-BB
DAY 2: Arusha to Tarangire
You depart Arusha with a lunch box across Monduli plains toward Tarangire for lunch at at the campsite.
After lunch, at 3.30pm for a walk accompanied by Maasai men and your guide to explain the native birds, animal tracks, and plant-life of the area that you will encounter during your walk.
Overnight at Tarangire Camp
DAY 3: Tarangire National Park
After an early breakfast, you depart the camp with picnic lunch and proceed to the park for a full day game drive.
Overnight at Tarangire N. Park- Kigongoni Camp
DAY 4: Datoga tribe cultural Tour
After breakfast, you proceed to south of lake Manyara to visit the Datoga tribe who are related to the Maasai. They are nomadic cattle herders who move from one place to another in search of green pastures for their cattle.
Overnight at Campsite
DAY 5: Lake Eyasi( Walking tour)
After breakfast, depart Tarangire with your lunch box, and drive across the Rift Valley escarpment to Lake Eyasi via Gibb’s Farm. Gibb’s
Overnight at Campsite
DAY 6 : Hadzabe Cultural Tour ( Bushmen)
Wake up early for a pre-sunrise breakfast. Drive from the camp for approx. 20 minutes to locate the nomadic Bushmen (Hadzabe). In the company of the bushmen, you will hunt on foot using traditional weapons i.e. bows and arrows.
Later depart the camp at 04:30P and drive to lake Eyasi to view flamingoes enjoy the sunset over the Rift Valley Escarpment.
Overnight ati Campsite
DAY 7 : Lake Eyasi - Ngorongoro Crater
You break camp at Lake Eyasi after breakfast and drive to Ngorongoro Crater with a picnic lunch. You descend to the crater floor for a full day game-drive.
Overnight at Simba Campsite.
DAY 8: Ngorongoro - Serengeti National Park
You break camp with picnic lunches after breakfast to drive to Serengeti National Park via Ol-duvai Gorge where the Leakey family discovered the remain of the early man “ Zinjanthropus Bosei” .
Overnight– Seronera Campsite.
DAY 9-10- Full day game drive in Serengeti
Full day game-drive in the Serengeti National Park with game viewing in areas where the animals are most concentrated.
Overnight Seronera Budget Campsite.
DAY 11: Serengeti to Arusha- Kilimanjaro Airport
After breakfast, you depart Serengeti for Arusha with game-viewing enroute.
Lunch in Arusha upon arrival
strTitle: Bushmen Cultural tour and Wildlife Adventures

strIntroduction:
Ngorongoro Crater is one the largest intact caldera in the world and one of the most spectacular sights in the whole of Africa
You will enjoy and experience nature, wildlife, habit and habitat of the fauna and flora in the natural areas, also peoples and culture.

Arusha to Ngorongoro Crater:
In the morning at 7am pickup time from your hotel or stay in Arusha town, with your packed lunch, drive on tarmac road 190km to Ngorongoro gate.
Drive on and descend into the crater floor with picnic lunches for a day game drives. Ngorongoro Crater is one the largest intact caldera in the world and one of the most spectacular sights in the whole of Africa. All the BIG FIVE Rhino, Lion, Leopard, Buffalo and Elephant live in this wonderful caldera, others are Zebra, Hippo, Wildebeest, Hyena and more. Birds includes flamingos on the Soda lake, Geese, Storks, Vultures and more.

Your lunch will be served on the picnic site at Ngoitokok swamp, a Hippo pool, after lunch proceeds with afternoon game viewing while ascending the Crater and drive back to Arusha.
Tour ends here.
strTitle: Full-Day Day Trip to Ngorongoro Crater From Arusha Town

strIntroduction:
This is a Mountain Climbing through Machame route, it is the opportunity to get on the roof top of Africa, 5895m above sea level. Mt.Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa located on the North East of Tanzania, covered by permanent snow. Machame route most popular and one of the most scenic route on the mountains. All climbers sleep in tents (tents are included) and meals are served in a dinner tent or on a blanket outside. It is done over 6 days, so acclimatization is easier, and the success rate is fairly high. With the Machame/South Circuit route, you will circle halfway around the mountain with great views from all angles. This route is approximately 40 km versus 20 km on the Marangu route. Climbers descend down the Mweka trail and stay at the Mweka camp the final night on the mountain.

ARRIVAL DAY
- Pick up from Kilimanjaro International Airport and transfer to Arusha town for dinner and overnight.

DAY 01: Machame Gate to Machame Camp
Elevation (m): 1830m to 3100m
Elevation (ft): 6000ft to 10,200ft
Distance: 18km
Hiking Time: 5-7 hours
Habitat: Montane Forest

DAY 02: Machame Camp to Shira Camp
Elevation (m): 3100m to 3840m
Elevation (ft): 10,200ft to 12,600ft
Distance: 9km
Walking Time: 4-6 hours
Habitat: Moorland

DAY 03: Shira Camp to Lava Tower to Barranco Camp
Elevation (m): 3840m to 4630m to 3860m
Elevation (ft): 12,600ft to 12,700ft
Distance: 15 km
Walking Time: 5-7 hours
Habitat: Semi-desert

DAY 04: Barranco Camp to Barafu Camp
Elevation (m): 3860m to 4600m
Elevation (ft): 12,700ft to 15,100ft
Distance: 13km
Hiking Time: 8 hours
Habitat: Alpine Desert

DAY 05: Barafu Camp to Summit to Mweka Hut
Elevation (m): 4600m to 5895m (and down to 3100m)
Elevation (ft): 15,100ft to 19,300ft (and down to 10,200ft)
Distance: 7km ascent / 23km descent
Hiking Time:6- 8 hours ascent / 7-8 hours descent
Habitat: Stone scree and ice-capped summit

DAY 06: Mweka Camp to Arusha
Elevation (m): 3100m to 1830m
Elevation (ft): 10,200ft to 6000ft
Distance: 15 km
Hiking Time: 3-4 hours
Habitat: Forest
After breakfast, we continue the descent down to the Mweka Park Gate to receive your summit certificates. At lower elevations, it can be wet and muddy. Gaiters and trekking poles will help. Shorts and t-shirts will probably be plenty to wear (keep rain gear and warmer clothing handy).
From the gate, continue another hour to Mweka Village. A vehicle will meet you at Mweka village to drive you to the Hotel in Arusha for dinner and overnight.

DEPARTURE
This day you will be transferred from the hotel in Arusha town to Kilimanjaro international Airport to connect to your flight back home.
strTitle: 6-Day Kilimanjaro trekking Machame or Whisky route

Day 10: EXCURSION in ZANZIBAR

strTitle: 14-Days Bush to Beach Holiday From Arusha: Tarangire National Park, Lake Manyara and Ngorongoro

strIntroduction:
Northern Tanzania safari is an essential destination on everyone's travel list. The Serengeti's Great Migration is one of the most amazing wildlife spectacles, whilst being on safari on the Crater floor of the extinct volcano at Ngorongoro is a game viewing environment that has no equal. Away from the tourist hotspots, quieter parks such as Tarangire are superb for game viewing yet often overlooked to their more famous neighbors.
Lake Manyara's game concentrations are not nearly as high as surrounding parks but there are a number of unique species that are reason to safari here

All our Tours start and finish in Arusha town. The nearest International Airport is Kilimanjaro International Airport(45Km from Arusha). Arusha Airport- 10Km from Arusha town. Shuttle/Flight from Nairobi to Arusha can be arranged.
Day 01:Upon your arrival meet at Kilimanjaro international Airport and transfer to your hotel in Arusha for bed and breakfast B/B. Pamoja expedition Lodge.
Day 02: ARUSHA NATIONAL PARK
In the morning drive to Arusha national park with your packed lunch for game viewing. Break for a picnic lunch then continue with game viewing at Arusha National Park. Dinner and overnight at Outpost Lodge -Full board (FB)
The park has actually changed its name a number of times form Ngurdoto Crater National Park to Mount Meru National Park.
Day 03: TARANGIRE NATIONAL PARK
After breakfast transfer to Tarangire national park with your packed lunch for game viewing, enjoy a picnic lunch at Tarangire then continue with your game viewing until late evening, dinner and overnight, / Kigongoni Campsite. FB
Day 04: LAKE MANYARA NATIONAL PARK
- After breakfast transfer to Lake Manyara national park for game viewing, lunch then after lunch drive to the park again for a second half game viewing. Dinner and overnight, Twiga Campsite. FB
Day 05: SERENGETI NATIONAL PARK
- After breakfast transfer to Serengeti national park via Ngorongoro conservation area, with your lunch box and game en-route. Dinner and overnight, Seronera Campsite FB
Day 06: SERENGETI / NGORONGORO
After breakfast with your packed lunch drive and game en route to Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Pass by Olduvai Gorge a historical site whereby the early man lived its your option whether you pass by the Maasai boma if you are interested in the real African life tradition and culture for extra costs, After your lunch en route adds to the crater rim for your dinner and overnight at Ngorongoro Simba Campsite. FB
Day 07: NGORONGORO CRATER - ARUSHA
- After breakfast, with packed lunch descend into the crater for a full day game viewing. Have your picnic lunch in the crater at hippo pool or Lerai forest. Evening drive back to Arusha for dinner and overnight at your Hotel/Transfer to the Airport for your flight back home.
strTitle: 7 Days Tanzania Backpackers Safaris

strIntroduction:
This is an ultimate day trip from Arusha, You can book at any time of your convenience,  You will enjoy and experience nature, wildlife, habit and habitat of the fauna and flora in the natural areas. 

Your day tour begins with your hotel pick-up in the morning, before heading south to the stunning Tarangire National Park. We arrive at the Tarangire national park for game viewing, Afternoon you will stop for a picnic lunch. Your afternoon game-drive will reveal all the wonders of Tarangire, a National Park often referred to as the 'Elephant Playground'. Herds of up to 300 of these mighty mammals are sometimes seen in the park.

Serengeti may be better known, but Tarangire in the dry season easily rivals it for animal densities. As well as the herds of elephant Tarangire is home to buffalo, lion, wildebeest, zebra and gazelle while gerenuk and fringe-eared Oryx are 'local specialties'. Lake Burungi's marshy shores are the lure for these mammals and the waters attract many beautiful bird species, too.

Look out for giant kingfishers, hoopoes and the delightfully-named white-bellied go-away bird. Tarangire is noted for its splendid baobab trees, rolling savannah and acacia woodland. At the end of an inspiring afternoon amongst the wildlife, drive back to your hotel in Arusha.
strTitle: Full-Day Safari to Tarangire National Park from Arusha

strIntroduction:
Visit some of the most important sites and major locations in northern Israel in the comfort and luxury of a small group. Departing from Tel-Aviv, explore the beautiful and historic city of Nazareth, Tiberias and churches along the way to the Sea of Galilea, including Jesus's family home and sites of his miracle work and teachings. A small group tour in a new, air-conditioned coach ensures you all the time you need to fully experience and marvel at the many sites and views you will encounter along the way.

Starting with pick-ups from your hotel in Tel-Aviv, begin the 2-hour drive north along the coastal highway towards Nazareth, passing along the way lush green landscapes and a wonderful view of the Mediterranean as well learning on the cities and places you will pass by as you prepare for the rest of the trip.

The very first site you explore in the historic city of Nazareth where, according to the New Testament, Jesus spent most of his childhood is the Basilica of the Annunciation – a breathtaking church located in the center of the city and is believed to be built on the house of the Virgin Mary and Joseph, parents of Jesus.

From there, a short walk to the nearby St. Joseph’s church - that stands where once Mary's husband Joseph lived and worked as a carpenter, a profession Jesus practiced as well.

After basking in the glory and beauty of Nazareth, continue onwards with your trusted guide, through Kfar Cana, where Jesus turned water into wine, and onto the popular resort town of Tiberias, found on the shores of the Kinneret, otherwise known as the Sea of Galilee.
Drive along the sea to visit Capernaum and view the ruins of the excavated ancient synagogue where Jesus taught his disciples, and was near the home of some of his apostles. Continue to Tabgha , the site of the miracle of fish and loaves located at the foot of the Golan Heights.

Travel south along the shore to reach Yardenit, where the Jordan River flows out of the sea of Galilee towards the dead sea.

It is here that Jesus is said to have been baptized. Having followed in the footsteps of Christ, return to Tel Aviv.
strTitle: Biblical Highlights of the Galilee On A Small Group Tour From Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Break away from Tel Aviv on this 10-hour tour and head to Caesarea there you'll enjoy a walking tour of the city. Explore the ruins that include the aqueduct, theater, and palace. Afterwards, head to Haifa for a view of the beautiful Bahai gardens, followed by a tour to Megiddo, known as Armageddon. Continue to Acre where you will visit the underground Crusader City before your return back to Tel Aviv.

Meet your guide at your Tel-Aviv accommodations before departing through the coastal road to Caesarea, the ancient Roman capital. Enjoy a walking tour of the site as you explore the ancient ruins and archaeological excavations including the aqueduct, the palace and other fascinating findings. Afterwards, head to the city of Haifa, where you will stop for a panoramic view of the marvelous terraced Bahai gardens, the port, and the bay.

Continue to Megiddo, also known as Armageddon; Learn the history of this site that served as a battle field through different times in History. Enjoy the fascinating surrounding view of the Jezreel Valley. Proceed along the coastal road to Acre for a visit the of underground Crusader city and crypt. Explore the narrow alleyways of the old city bazaar, port, and the mosque. Return to your point of departure at the end of your tour.
strTitle: Full-Day Pearls of the Western Galilee Tour from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Head out of Jerusalem for the day to see some of the bucolic Israeli countryside and marvel at the site of Caesarea, an ancient spot of Roman ruins on this small-group tour. Then check out the northern town of Haifa and its amazingly verdant Bahai gardens. Finally, stop by Megiddo, a spot that has been inhabited since since 7,000 B.C. On the way back to Jerusalem, make a short stop at seaside Acre to stroll along the coast and see the active local market.

Depart Jerusalem a guide by your side, and head north along the coastal road. Enjoy the views of the sea as you head to the archaeological site of Caesarea. Once there, enjoy a guided walking tour of what was once a thriving port city dedicated to Roman emperor, Augustus Caesar, exploring ruins that include an aqueduct, a theater, a citadel, a palace, and a hippodrome (stadium). Continue the journey onto the beautiful port city of Haifa, enjoying a panoramic view of the impressive Bahai gardens and the entire Haifa bay.

Next stop is at the national park of Megiddo, also known as site of Armageddon; learn the impressive history of this site that served as a battle field to different armies; admire the beautiful scenery of the surrounding Jezreel valley. 

Finally head to the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Acre (or Akko). Visit the Crusader City, complete with underground passages and crypts, the old port, and colorful markets. Having indulged in all the historic town has to offer, your explorations come to a close and return to Jerusalem.
strTitle: Pearls of Western Galilee Day Trip from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Start the day with a magnificent panoramic view from atop of Mount of Olives overlooking the Old City and the Judean desert. Continue to visit Mount Zion where the Tomb of King David and the Room of Last Supper are located. Enter the Old City and tour the Jewish, Christian and Armenian quarters. Explore Jerusalem and learn the various aspects the city has to offer, religious, historical and archaeological. Visit the Wailing Wall, also known as the Kotel. Walk through the Via Dolorosa to the Church of Holy Sepulchre. At the end of your tour in Jerusalem, you will be driven to Bethlehem for an overview of Shepherds' filed and visit the Church of Nativity.

Leave your hotel to start your full day tour to Jerusalem and Bethlehem. The first stop is at Mount of Olives, named after the olive groves that covered it once. Enjoy the breathtaking view of the old and new city of Jerusalem, the Temple Mount and the Dome of the Rock.

Next, head to Mount Zion to visit the Tomb of King David and the Room of Last Supper located near the Dormition Abbey. This Abbey was built by the Bishop of Jerusalem in the fifth century and known for it's impressive Architecture.

Following the program, you head to the old city to and walk through the Armenian and Jewish quarters to soak-up some of the different cultures of the city. Walk through the Cardo, the ancient Roman road, view the Western Wall and continue to the Christian quarter. Then walk through the Via Dolorosa, and visit the church of Holy Sepulchre, which is a major Christian pilgrimage site since its creation in the fourth century.

Leave Jerusalem and drive to Bethlehem. Cross the border (on own) and join your local guide for an overview of the Shepherds' field, where the star of nativity was said to appear. Visit manger's square and enter one of the oldest churches in the world, the Church of Nativity. Cross back to meet your Israeli guide who will escort you back to your point of departure.
strTitle: Jerusalem and Bethlehem Tour from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Your full day group tour to Jerusalem starts with a drive in an air-conditioned coach from Tel-Aviv to first stop at Mount of Olives for a panoramic view of the city. We continue to visit Mount Zion with the room of last supper, Dormition Abbey and King David’s Tomb, before moving on to the Old City . Experience the religious, historical and interesting aspects this beautiful city has to offer visiting the Jewish, Armenian and Christian quarters ; Walk through the Cardo and hear the history of this ancient roman road ; Visit the Western Wall .
Walk the way of sorrows, Via Dolorosa to get to the Church of holy Sepulchre. On the way out of the Old city , enjoy the authentic market place . We end our day tour with a visit to Yad Vashem , the memorial to the Holocaust before returning to the point of departure.

After Tel-Aviv hotel pick ups, our small group tour departs to Jerusalem, the holiest city in the world. The first stop is Mount of Olives, where you will enjoy a panoramic view of the city.

We then proceed to Mount Zion, home to the room of the Last Supper, which commemorates Jesus last supper with his disciples;
the Dormition Abbey, a marvelous church marking the site where Virgin Mary is said to have died and arrive to visit King David's tomb.
We enter the Old City to discover it's different quarters. We walk through the Armenian and Jewish quarters , through the Cardo, the recently excavated Roman road to the Wailing Wall (Kotel). We then continue to the Christian quarter where we walk through the Via Dolorosa, the “Way of Sorrows” to visit the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Passing by the local oriental bazaar market, we head towards the vehicle; we drive to the New City where we stop for a visit at Yad Vashem, Israel’s memorial to the Holocaust.

Note: Yad Vashem is closed on Saturdays and Jewish holidays. On these days we substitute a visit to the Holocaust memorial with a visit to the picturesque neighborhood of Ein Karem, traditionally known as birthplace of John the Baptist ; We stop by Mary's spring and continue to visit the impressive Church of John the Baptist before returning to the point of departure .
strTitle: Jerusalem Full Day Tour from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Engage in this 8-hour Jewish heritage tour and explore Jerusalem in its entirety. Start with a journey to Mount Scopus before heading towards the Old City. There, you will visit areas such as the Kotel, King David Tomb, the Davidson Center, and more. An English-speaking tour guide will be there to lead you and your small group of no more than 15 on this exploration of the Jewish religion.

Start your day with a pickup from your Jerusalem accommodations between 9-9:30am. Begin your journey with a trip to Mount Scopus for a for a spectacular panoramic view over Jerusalem and the Judean Desert. From here, the group will head towards the Old City to observe and explore the amazing sites connected to the Jewish Heritage. While en route, stop at Mount Zion, home to King David’s Tomb.

Upon your arrival in the city, walk through the Cardo, the ancient Roman road, before heading to the Jewish quarter. Here, you will observe the Wailing Wall, known to most as the Kotel and one of the holiest sites in the city where visitors pray and place their notes in its cracks. The day will continue with a trip to the Davidson Center for a tour of the Southern Kotel excavation site. Afterwards, proceed to the Ammunition Hill, once a stronghold for the Jordanian army and a memorial site in modern days. The next visit will be at Mount Herzl, where you will visit the national cemetery where all of Israel's greatest leaders are buried. Finally, make your last stop at Yad Vashem, the memorial to the Holocaust .

At the end of the tour, your guide will return you to your hotel.
strTitle: Small-Group Jewish Heritage Tour from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Your journey starts with a trip to Mount Scopus, which offers spectacular views over Jerusalem and the Judean desert. From there, head towards the Old City to learn the history of the Jewish heritage. Your day will include visits to the Western Wall, Tomb of King David and the archaeological p historical sites marking the Jewish heritage. En route we stop at Mount Zion, home to King David’s Tomb.

Upon arrival to the heart of the city, explore the Cardo, an ancient Roman road before heading to the Jewish quarter. Observe the Wailing Wall, known as the Kotel, part of the wall that surrounded the Second Temple, and one of the holiest sites in the city, where boys celebrate their Bar Mitzva and others pray and place their notes in its cracks. Your day continues with a trip to the Davidson Center, a subterranean exhibition center, and a tour of the Southern Kotel excavation site. Continue on to the Memorial Hall at Ammunition Hill, once a stronghold for the Jordanian Army. The next visit is the national cemetery at Mount Herzl, burial place of Israel's greatest leaders, followed by a visit to Yad Vashem, the memorial to the Holocaust. Your day ends as you return to point of departure.
strTitle: Small Group: Jewish Heritage Tour of Jerusalem from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Visit Independence Hall in Tel Aviv, Latrun, the armored corps museum, Beit Guvrin national park, Rehovot and the Ayalon institute.

Your journey begins with a trip to Independence Hall in Tel Aviv. It was here that Israel’s Declaration of Independence was signed in 1948. Continue on to Latrun, located between Tel Aviv and Jerusalem,and visit Yad La-Shiryon, once a British police fort, today the building serves as a memorial for fallen soldiers and features the Armored Corps Museum, which houses a broad range of tanks. Your next stop is at Beit Guvrin, declared by UNESCO as a world heritage site. Enjoy exploring the caves and other archaeological remains.  Continue on to the Ayalon Institute, which once served as a secret ammunition factory. It was here that the Hagana – an underground military unit that would eventually become the Israeli Defense Force – built bullets and arms to repel attacks by Palestinian Arabs.

Your day ends as you return to our departure point.
strTitle: 9-Hour Israel Heritage Tour from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Explore this fascinating 8-hour tour of the city of Tel Aviv. Visit the Diaspora museum. Tour Jaffa and learn the history of this ancient port city and the restored artists' quarter. Visit the hip district of Neve Tzedek, as well as, Nahalat Benyamin, the pedestrian mall of the city, and the colorful Sheinkin street known for its unique shops and youthful ambiance. Enjoy the view of Tel Aviv promenade and beachfront as you ride back to your hotel.

Meet your guide in the lobby of your hotel to start the day. For your first stop, travel to the campus of Tel Aviv University for a visit to the Diaspora house, otherwise known as the ‘Museum of the Jewish People.' The museum houses a broad range of exhibits and covers nearly 3,000 years of history. Leaving the campus behind, travel through Tel Aviv’s busy streets on the way to the city center.

Make a stop at Rabin Square, the site of the assassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin in 1995, and then continue on to Old Jaffa, a port city that dates back more than 8,000 years, one of the oldest continually inhabited places on the planet. Visit the artists quarter next and explore the old ruins that are scattered about the city. From Old Jaffa, you will head to Neve Tzedek, the first Jewish neighborhood to be built outside of Jaffa’s walls. Continue on to Nachlat Binyamin, the colorful street market, enjoying the street musicians, the handmade artifacts and jewelry. The final stop is Shenkin Street, home to an array of cafés, antique shops, and a general energetic atmosphere. Explore the Carmel market which offers goods from fresh produce to clothing and various food and sweets. You will also make a visit to the Diaspora Museum to explore the history of Jewish people.

After some shopping, return back to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Tel Aviv City Tour

strIntroduction:
Spend a day in Israel's center of entertainment and business with this 9 hour trip to Tel Aviv from Jerusalem. Visit the Diaspora Museum and Rabin Square, where the assassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin took place. Walk through the Neve Tzedek neighborhood and enjoy the colorful Nahalat Benyamin market with its live musicians, artifacts, and handmade jewelry. Explore the old port city of Jaffa and its artists' quarter. End the day with a stroll through Sheinkin Street, known for its unique shops and youthful ambiance.

Begin your day trip with a pick up from your Jerusalem hotel and start the drive toward Tel Aviv and Old Jaffa.

Tel Aviv, declared by UNESCO as World Heritage site for its Bauhaus-style buildings, is considered to be Israel's center of business and entertainment. Begin with a trip to the campus of Tel Aviv University to visit the Diaspora Museum, otherwise known as the 'Museum of the Jewish People.' The museum houses a broad range of exhibits and covers nearly 3,000 years of history.

Drive through Tel Aviv’s main streets and stop at Rabin Square, site of the 1995 ssassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin.

Continue on to Old Jaffa, an old port city, to visit the artists' quarter before exploring the old ruins.

Driving from Jaffa, your next stop is at Neve Tzedek, the first Jewish neighborhood to be built outside of Jaffa’s walls. From there, visit the Nahalat Binyamin, with its colorful stands offering a wide selection of handmade jewelry, artifacts and live musicians.

Your next stop is Sheinkin Street, known for its antique shops, cafes and youthful ambiance. Conclude your day as you return to your original departure point.
strTitle: Tel Aviv City Tour from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Your tour starts with a breathtaking view from Mount of Olives, where you can bask in stunning panoramic views of the Holy City. This is followed up with a visit to Mount Zion, home to the Hall of the Last Supper, the Church of the Dormition, and King David’s Tomb, before moving on to the Old City itself. You'll take in the sights as the tour makes its way through the Armenian and Jewish quarters of the city – including the recently excavated Roman road (Cardo) – before visiting the world-renowned Wailing Wall (Kotel). Continuing on into the Christian Quarter, you will pass along the Via Dolorosa (the “Way of Sorrows”) and take the time to visit the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Your day continues at the New City, visiting Yad Vashem, Israel’s memorial to the Holocaust.

You start your day tour with a visit to Mount of Olives for a panoramic view of the Old City . You will continue to Mount Zion to visit the Room of Last Supper, the Church of the Dormition, and King David’s Tomb, before moving on to the Old City itself. Then enjoy the surrounding sights of the Old City as the tour makes its way through the Armenian and Jewish quarters of the city – including the recently excavated Roman road (Cardo) – before visiting the world-renowned Wailing Wall (Kotel). Continuing into the Christian Quarter, you'll pass along the Via Dolorosa (the “Way of Sorrows”) and take the time to visit the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Then proceed to the New City, to visit Yad Vashem, Israel’s memorial to the Holocaust.
strTitle: Jerusalem Full Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Go back in time to visit several ancient sites on this 10-hour small-group tour to Bethlehem and Jericho from Tel Aviv. Take in amazing historical highlights, such as the birthplace of Jesus Christ and Zacchaeus’ sycamore fig.
