Your journey begins, after getting picked up at your central Tel Aviv hotel, with a drive through the Judean Desert toward Jericho. Along the way, you will pass the Good Samaritan Inn before stopping at sea level to enjoy the magnificent scenery.

Arrive in Jericho, one of the oldest inhabited cities in the world, and admire the lush greenery that is in stark contrast to the dry desert you have passed through. Visit Zacchaeus’ sycamore fig, one of the city’s most famed attractions, before moving on to an overview of the Mount of Temptation, where Jesus was tempted by the Devil.

Your time in Jericho also includes a visit to Tel e-Sultan, an archaeological site that has uncovered more than 20 settlements dating back thousands of years.

Venture next to Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus Christ. Your excursion takes in the Church of the Nativity and Manger Square. On the way out of the city, you will see the numerous shepherd fields that surround Bethlehem. 

Please note: Cable car passage up the Mount of Temptation in Jericho is not included in the cost of this tour.
strTitle: Bethlehem and Jericho from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Spend a day exploring the historic cities of Jericho and Bethlehem on this 8-hour tour from Jerusalem. Drive through the Judean Desert en route to Jericho. Enjoy the surrounding scenery as you head to Jericho, the oldest city in the world. After touring the city, you will head to Bethlehem, and view the shepherds' fields.

Get picked up at your central Jerusalem hotel and begin the trip toward Jericho, driving through the Judean Desert. Along the way you pass the Good Samaritan Inn before stopping at sea level to take in the magnificent scenery that surrounds you.

Arrive in Jericho – considered to be one of the oldest inhabited cities in the world – and admire the lush greenery that is in stark contrast to the dry desert you have passed through. Visit Zacchaeus’ sycamore fig, one of the city’s most famed attractions, before moving for an overview of the Mount of Temptation, where Jesus was tempted by the Devil. Your time in Jericho also includes a visit to Tel e-Sultan, an archaeological site that has uncovered more than 20 settlements dating back thousands of years.

Leaving Jericho behind, venture to Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus Christ and the childhood home of David. Your excursion takes you to the Church of the Nativity and Manger Square. Leaving the city, you observe the numerous shepherd fields that surround Bethlehem before making the journey back to Jerusalem.

Please note: Cable car passage up the Mount of Temptation is not included in the cost of this tour.
strTitle: Bethlehem and Jericho Tour From Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Spend a relaxing day at the Dead Sea with this 10-hour tour from Tel Aviv. Enjoy the scenery driving through the Judean Desert. Experience a Dead Sea 'float,' enjoy a mud bath, relax for a few hours, and return full of energy. You will also have the opportunity to stop at a Dead Sea cosmetics shop to purchase Israel's well-known products.

Get picked up at your central Tel Aviv hotel and drive through the Judean Desert toward the Dead Sea.

At 1407 feet (429 m) below sea level, the shores of the Dead Sea represent Earth's lowest point on land. Enjoy the views on the way and make a stop at a Dead Sea products shop. 

Your next stop is at one of the private beaches, where you can indulge in a natural mud baths, floating in mineral rich and therapeutic waters, and more. No trip to the region is complete without taking a dip in the Dead Sea itself. Marvel as you float on the saline-heavy waters, and be sure to try out the natural Dead Sea mud that accumulates upon its shores.

After a day of relaxation, you will return to your original departure point.
strTitle: Dead Sea Relaxation Tour from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Spend a day relaxing on the Dead Sea with this 8-hour trip from Jerusalem. Drive through the Judean Desert to enjoy its fascinating views and stop at a Dead Sea cosmetic products shop before continuing to one of the shores of the Dead Sea.

Get picked up from your Jerusalem hotel and drive through the Judean Desert to reach the Dead Sea.

Stop at one of the cosmetics shops specializing in Dead Sea products. Set on the shores of the Dead Sea to indulge in a mud bath. No trip to the region is complete without taking a dip in the Dead Sea itself. Marvel as you float on the saline-heavy waters and be sure to try out the natural Dead Sea mud that accumulates upon its shores.

After a day of relaxation, return to your departure point.
strTitle: Small Group Dead Sea Relaxation from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Explore the historic sights of Jerusalem on this 6-hour tour from Tel Aviv. Enjoy an amazing panoramic view over the city and its surroundings from the Mount of Olives. Visit Mount Zion, a religiously and historically significant location that houses the Church of the Dormition, the Hall of the Last Supper, and the Tomb of King David. Go into the heart of the old city to explore its historical beautiful locations, including the Jewish quarter, the wailing wall and the Church of Holy Sepulchre. The tour ends at 1:30pm in the Old City. Return to Tel Aviv is not included.

Get picked up at your central Tel Aviv hotel to head for the historic city of Jerusalem.

Begin your visit to Jerusalem with an amazing panoramic view over the city and its surroundings from the Mount of Olives. From there continue to the second stop at Mount Zion, a religiously and historically significant location that houses the Church of the Dormition, the Hall of the Last Supper, and the Tomb of King David.

Enter inside the Old City walls to explore the Armenian quarter. Pass along the Cardo, an ancient Roman road that has been restored and is now part of a shopping arcade. Move on to the Jewish Quarter and head for the Western Wall, also known as the Wailing Wall or the Kotel. Many see it as the largest praying location in the world.

Continue on into the Christian Quarter where you pass along the Via Dolorosa, the route taken by Jesus. Conclude your tour with a visit to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre.

The tour ends at 1:30pm in the Old City of Jerusalem.

Please note: Return to Tel Aviv is not included.
strTitle: Half Day Small Group Tour to Jerusalem from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Your half day tour of Jerusalem begins with a drive to the Mount of Olives, then onto Mount Zion, a religiously and historically significant location before heading to the Hall of the Last Supper, and the Tomb of King David.

Your half day tour of Jerusalem begins with a drive to the Mount of Olives, which offers stunning views over the city and its immediate surroundings. The second stop brings you to Mount Zion, a religiously and historically significant location that houses the Church of the Dormition, the Hall of the Last Supper, and the Tomb of King David. Enter the Old City walls and proceed to explore the Armenian and Jewish Quarters, passing along the Cardo, an ancient Roman road that has been restored and is now part of a shopping arcade.

Move on to the Jewish Quarter and head for the Western Wall, also known as the Wailing Wall or the Kotel. Your journey continues on into the Christian Quarter where you pass along the Via Dolorosa, route of the agony, concluding with a visit to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. Your tour ends at around 13.30 in the Old city. Return to your point of departure on your own.
strTitle: Half Day Small Group Tour of Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
Visit the birthplace of Jesus Christ and childhood home of David. Walk through Manger Square at the heart of the city, and visit the Church of the Nativity. The tour ends in Jerusalem.

Be picked up and drive to Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus Christ and childhood home of David. Upon arrival, we walk through Manger Square at the heart of the city, and visit the Church of the Nativity. This somewhat unassuming establishment is built on the spot where Jesus is said to have been born.

After touring the church move on to the Milk Grotto, where the Holy Family is said to have taken refuge during the Massacre of the Innocents. The tour of the city also includes a visit to the shepherd’s field, one similar to that which Joseph would have worked. Before leaving Bethlehem, there’s time to visit one of the many souvenir shops, which specialize in everything from jewelry and ceramics to pendants and olive wood carvings. With the half day tour at a close, return to Jerusalem.
strTitle: Half Day Bethlehem Tour from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Leave Tel Aviv for the day and travel through the Judean Hills and on to the Dead Sea on this 11-hour guided tour. In a small group of no more than 15 people, ride a cable car to the mountaintop to explore the ancient fortification of Masada, where King Herod built palaces, and learn the story of its historic siege. Then relax while floating in the mineral-rich waters of the Dead Sea.

Your day begins with an early morning pickup from your Tel Aviv hotel.

Departing Tel Aviv, your journey takes you through the Judean Hills and on to the Dead Sea, the lowest point on Earth. Stop to visit a Dead Sea cosmetics shop to browse products made from Dead Sea minerals, before continuing the journey south along the shores of the salt lake to Masada.

Ascend by cable car and visit the impressive mountaintop fortress that was once home to King Herod. See the remains of the wall, palaces, and synagogue and hear the heroic story of of the Zealots who managed to fend off the Roman army before committing mass suicide.

After your historical trip to the fortress, descend by cable car and drive to one of shores of the Dead Sea for the opportunity to float in its mineral-rich water, which many believe contains therapeutic qualities. Enjoy a natural mud bath and the sensation of floating on water.

Feeling youthful again, return to to Tel Aviv and conclude your tour with a hotel drop-off.

Please note: The trip does not include a visit to Qumran.
strTitle: Full-Day Masada and Dead Sea from Tel Aviv

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a fascinating full day trip to Israel's biblical highlights of the north visiting the town where Jesus spent his childhood, the remarkable Church of Annunciation located in the city center and believed to be built over the house of Mary and Joseph and the small church of St. Joseph. You will also be driven through Cana where Jesus turned water into wine, and head north onto the resort town of Tiberias and onto the shores of the Kinneret lake, known as the Sea of Galilee. You will also see the ruins of the excavated ancient synagogue where Jesus taught before continuing to Tabgha, located at the foot of the Golan, where Jesus performed the miracle of the fish and loaves.

After you have been picked up from your hotel in Jerusalem, drive to Tel-Aviv to start your exciting full day tour to the north visiting Nazareth and the Sea of Galilee. You will then be driven along the coast to visit the city of Nazareth where Jesus spent his childhood. Proceed to Tiberias and visit the history rich sites surrounding the Sea of Galilea. Stop at Tabgha where Jesus performed the miracle of the fish and loaves and view the ruins of the synagogue where Jesus taught at Capernaum.
Your journey continues as you drive south along the shore to reach Yardenit, and the Jordan River. It is here that Jesus is said to have been baptized. Before ending your day and returning to point of departure, you will stop to visit the famous baptismal site at Yardenit. Having followed in the footsteps of Christ, you will be returned to the point of departure.
strTitle: Small Group Tour to Biblical Highlights of the Galilee from Jerusalem

strIntroduction:
This Galapagos' Best Excursions Pass is the only bundled tour package to the four best day-trips on the islands for 20% less than retail price.

Along with private transfers from and to the airport, tours and excursions included in this trip are: a Galapagos History Excursion, a Tortuga Bay Tour, a Yacht Tour to Santa Fe Island and a visit to a Sustainable Coffee Plantation.

This is the only flexible product in the market that will allow you to create your own schedule while staying on the islands.

1. Galapagos History Excursion and Airport to Hotel Private Transfer

We will welcome you at the Baltra airport to take you to your hotel on the Santa Cruz island. Your transfer will begin by bus ride to the tip of the Itabaca channel, where you will proceed by public ferry service in the Island of Santa Cruz. On the way, visit the lava tunnels and a Turtle reserve. Visit to the Scientific Charles Darwin Station, where you can learn more about the Galápagos Island and observe Giant Turtles in captivity.

Available everyday with airport pick-up.

2. Tortuga Beach and Bay Tour (8 hours)

In the morning excursion to Tortuga Bay Beach, after 40-minute walk (approx.) we will arrive at one of the most beautiful beaches in the Islands with time to swim and enjoy the beach. Free time for lunch (not included). In the afternoon tour around the bay aboard a yacht, we start with a visit to “La Lobería”, named because for the presence of sea lions. Here you will be able to swim or snorkel.

Next, we precede to the “Canal del Amor” (Channel of Love). Observe reef sharks from a viewpoint; from here we continue with a short walk to see the marine iguanas that inhabit in “Playa de los Perros”. We will also visit Punta Estrada.

Tour available on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday. Pick-up Hours: 7:45 – 8:15am

3. Santa Fe Island in Yacht Tour

Depart at 8:00am where we navigate for approximately 45 minutes in an exclusive artisan fishing yacht.

The tour begins once we arrive at Santa Fe, where we will watch birds in the cliffs of the island. We will enter the Santa Fe Bay and do a dinghy ride to observe colonies of sea lions, blue footed boobies and marine iguanas. If conditions are favorable, we will be able to observe “Tintoreras” or Galápagos Sharks. On this island we will find sea turtles, stingrays and a wide fish diversity in the Marine Aquarium area.

The tour will proceed to “Playa Escondida” for snorkeling, where we will be able to see Galapagos sharks and a colony of sea lions, then returning to Puerto Ayora in the afternoon.

Available everyday with pick-up hours: 6:00am – 8:00am

4. Sustainable Coffee Plantation Excursion and Hotel to Airport Private Transfer

Our tour guide will pick you up at your hotel to go to the canal of Itabaca, where a ferry will take you to Baltra Island. In the way, visit a coffee plantation which is part of a social responsibility program. This organic coffee cultivation contributes to the conservation of plants and soil making a model of sustainable tourism.

Available everyday with airport drop-off.
strTitle: Galapagos Top Excursions Pass

strIntroduction:
The Capilla del Hombre is the tribute museum to the most important Ecuadorian visual artist of all times, Oswaldo Guayasamín. Here you will find pre-Columbian archaeological objects, artifacts of colonial times and all the work and collection of this famous artist. Included in your ticket is the access to Guayasamín's Home, the same place where he lived and worked in his later years. Enjoy one of Quito's best attractions and sit down to enjoy the incredible view of Quito that the site offers!

In the Capilla del Hombre you will see the "Eternal Flame" advocating for peace and human rights, and the "Tree of Life", where the remains of the artist are. Included in your ticket is access to both Capilla del Hombre, the art museum, and Guayasamín's home, the same place where he lived and worked in his later years. Enjoy this attraction and sit down to enjoy the incredible view of Quito that the site offers!

Museum admission includes guided tours available in Spanish, English and French, starting every 20 minutes. The tour is about 45 minutes per museum, so we recommended scheduling at least 2 hours for this visit. The attraction features lockers for backpacks or luggage. Photography is not allowed inside the museum, but you can photograph the exterior and gardens.

The pass is valid for six months, but you can easily visit the attractions in few hours. At each attraction, simply present your voucher (either paper or mobile) at the ticket counter, and your pass will be scanned for entrance. You should only scan your ticket once at each attraction so you will have access to all 2 attractions.
strTitle: Capilla del Hombre and Guayasamin's Museum

strIntroduction:
Quito's Top Attractions Pass is a single pass that grants access to the top five (5) things to do in Quito, Ecuador. Save 15% on attraction entrances by purchasing this pass and get direct entry into each attraction—no queuing or wasting time!

Attractions included are: Mitad del Mundo (Middle of the World), Iglesia de la Compañía, Quito Tour Bus, Capilla del Hombre and Museo de la Ciudad y El Carmen Alto.

Save 15% off the combined vendor price at each attraction and use it over a six (6) month period. This pass makes traveling faster, cheaper and simpler by using one single ticket to enter all attractions. Upon purchase, you will immediately receive a voucher with a barcode (one per person) allowing for DIRECT entry into all attractions.

Quito's Top Attractions Pass includes entrance to the following attractions:

  • Mitad del Mundo: Middle of the world monument located on the equator (full access to ethnographic museum and sky deck)
  • Iglesia de la Compañía: Quito's most ornate church located in the city's historic district
  • Quito Tour Bus: A hop-on hop-off double decker bus that travels throughout the city, including audio tours in Spanish and English
  • Capilla del Hombre: The museum and home of Quito's most famous artist, Oswaldo Guayasamín
  • Museo de la Ciudad y el Carmen Alto: A two for one entrance into Quito's history museum and the former convent across the street

Quito's Top Attractions Pass does not include a tour guide and transportation to all of the attractions; however, at the majority of the attractions, guided tours are offered in English and Spanish at the front desk (for an additional fee). Additionally, Quito Tour Bus serves as a great means of transportation to Iglesia de la Compañía and Museo de la Ciudad y el Carmen Alto, as well as other key sites in the city.

The pass is valid for six months, but you can easily visit all of the attractions in two days. At each attraction, simply present your voucher (either paper or mobile) at the ticket counter, and your pass will be scanned for entrance.

You should only scan your ticket once at each attraction so you will have access to all 5 attractions.
strTitle: Quito's Top Attractions Pass

strIntroduction:
Tour the Equator aboard the only double-decker bus from Quito. Visit Pululahua, the viewpoint of the crater, one of only two inhabited craters in the world. Bilingual guides will lead through the Museum Intiñan, the Middle of the World and the Ethnographic Museum, complete with VIP access during this 7-hour tour.

At 11:00am you will board the bus in the Naciones Unidas in the middle of the city in Quito Ecuador. All buses are two floors and include a bilingual guide (Spanish and English). On the first stop to the Equator, you will go to Pululahua to see a small town inside of a crater, one of only two inhabited craters in the world. Afterward, visit the Museum Intiñan accompanied by bilingual guides. Here you can see various demonstrations of natural phenomena, gravity and balance manifested in the equatorial zone.

Finally, continue on to the Middle of the World to visit the Ethnographic Museum and all the attractions from where you can get some of the best photos with one foot in each hemisphere. Visitors can enjoy the views from the middle of the world's monument at a height of 30 meters of the equinoctial valley.

Mitad del Mundo is a park that includes a nine level ethnographic and interactive museum. Experience Ecuador's main climates through a 4D movie theater and understand the differences between every region in the country.

Ciudad Mitad del Mundo also has a planetarium, a miniature model of colonial Quito in its permanent exhibit, an exhibition of Guayasamin paintings and several pavilions of different countries. At the end of our visit we will head back to Naciones Unidas on the tour bus. All entrance fees are included.
strTitle: Full-Day Mitad del Mundo Tour

strIntroduction:
Get the full experience of the Northern part of the country in a day trip that includes a visit to the world famous indigenous markets, a boat tour in the Cuicocha lake (located in an active volcano crater) and the sacred Peguche waterfall. The tour also features a visit to the Quitsato Solar Clock on the equator, a taste of the best bizcocho pastry in the country, and if there's enough time, a visit to the house of a famous Ecuadorian musician from Otavalo.

This tour provides transportation from Quito to all attractions on this day-long tour to the Otavalo markets, Cuicocha lake and surrounding areas. The tour begins in Quito with a pickup at 9 am at Naciones Unidas Bulevar.

ITINERARY:

We arrive at the Quitsato Solar Clock located on the Equator. You will stay here for 45 minutes and board the bus again to head to the nearby Mirador de San Pablo Lago. Enjoy the view of the lake and after a short visit, you'll enjoy a taste of the best bizcocho pastry cake in the country.

Then, we go to famous the Otavalo market, the largest indigenous market in South America, where you will have 2 hours of free time for shopping and lunch (on your own). Otavalo is world famous for its craft fair, offering countless products created by the hands of skilled and experienced craftsmen. In this market, you can find a variety of textiles, wood crafts, balsa carvings, key chains, jewelry, paintings, antiques and more.

The highlight of this tour will be at the Cuicocha, the active volcano with a lake in the middle. We will take a boat tour traveling around the islets of the lake and explore the living species of this natural wonder.

To finish the tour, we will walk to the Peguche waterfall. It's a spiritual place where the inhabitants go for a sacred bath on the eve of Inti Raymi. And if there is time, we will visit the workshop of Ñanda Mañachi, a family that crafts traditional musical instruments, including panpipes, charangos.

Around 5 pm we will head back to Quito.
strTitle: Otavalo Tour with Quito Tour Bus

strIntroduction:
Explore Venice city center and make your way to the Murano island. Walk through hidden Venice and visit Colleoni Glass Factory with a local guide. Enjoy a private performance of an expert glass Master, modelling glass with blowing and sculpture techniques. Learn about the glass tradition during your workshop and choose between mosaic, glass beads jewelry and a private session with a glass master.

Discover the Murano glass tradition by watching and working with local masters and craftsmen.

Depart from Venice city center with our authorized local guide, and walk for approximately 15 minutes through hidden streets before reaching the Murano island by public transportation (not included).

Visit Colleoni Glass Factory and assist in a private performance of an expert glass master with a demo of blowing and sculpture technique. Then, choose one of the available workshops and make your own object in Murano glass.

Whichever type of activity you choose will permit you to work with a local craftsman and make your personalized item.
strTitle: Murano Glass Factory Experience: Factory Tour and Workshop

strIntroduction:
Private tour discovering a unique Venice with a qualified guide that will let you discover the city of Marco Polo and his treasures. By walk, gondola and private boat you will discover this romantic city on the water.

A 6-hours tour will include entrance to Doge's Palace, external visit of the surrounding buildings of San Marco with a qualified guide, a private gondola ride, round trip with a private water taxi, a seafood lunch and a glass factory visit with a performance from an expert glass master.

You will be picked up by an expert guide at your Venice Hotel.

The tour will start in San Marco square with a description of the surrounding monuments and visit in the interior of Doge's Palace.
Through hidden streets away from the touristy route we will see the most picturesque corners and canals.
Your guide will introduce the history of Venice from the origins and will be glad to answer at your questions

By gondola you will have an intimate moment and discover the Grand Canal with all his monuments from the water. After the gondola ride, we will still admire the city by private boat and through small canals where we will reach Murano Island. Here you will have an unforgettable typical seafood lunch (other menus available). Enjoy a short walk on the silent island and visit an ancient glass factory where you will admire expert glass masters at work, creating objects with the famous blowing technique.
After the performance you will visit the show room and receive a 20% discount on purchase (shipping possible)

Return to hotel or city center with private boat.
strTitle: Private Tour: Venice Walk, Gondola, and Private Boat Tour ending on Murano Island with Venetian Lunch and Glass Factory Visit

strIntroduction:
Take part at the Colleoni Glass Factory tour and admire an expert glass Master creating an object with the blowing and the sculpture techniques. At the end of the tour, bring home a glass souvenir to remember this unique experience.

Enjoy a guided tour of the Colleoni Glass Factory and admire an incredible glass master performance.

Learn how the Murano glass is made and see where the glass is handled to create fabulous designs. An expert master will create two objects with the most popular techniques, blowing and sculpture.

After the demonstration you can visit the show rooms and receive a 20% discount on purchase.

Also, an original glass item will be given as a present to each participant at the end of the tour.
strTitle: Venice Murano Island Glass Factory Tour with Glass Blowing Demonstration

strIntroduction:
Departing from the heart of Venice you will visit the most beautiful islands of the lagoon: Murano, Burano and Torcello. A private boat tour with friendly guide driver will let you discover the best of Venice like a local.
You will reach the island of Murano with possibility either to visit a glass factory or to stroll around its quiet streets. Then you will reach Burano, a fisherman island with picturesque houses and great local biscuits. The last island of the tour will be Torcello, with the first Basilica of Venice.

Get on board on a typical Venetian motor boat named "topetta" and start discovering the lagoon of Venice.

Departing from the city center, enjoy a ride through picturesque canals and the lagoon, and visit the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello.
Murano is famous since the XII Century for the artistic glass production. If you wish you can visit a glass factory and watch an expert glass master in action. The island is also rendered for San Donato Cathedral, San Pietro Church, the Glass Museum and a very quite and relaxing atmosphere.

Burano is a fisherman island with nice local sea food restaurants and colored houses. Some lace laboratories are still open and do not miss to taste the delicious "Bussola", the typical biscuit of the lagoon.

Torcello is the island where the first inhabitants of Venice have settled, and you can see the first Basilica of the city.
strTitle: Private Excursion by Typical Venetian Motorboat to Murano, Burano and Torcello

strIntroduction:
Travel by private taxi boat through the Grand Canal from Venice with your guide to reach Murano Island. Visit the historical center with its 7th-century cathedral and watch a glass-blowing demonstration in a glass factory. Here, you will also be able to try on the Cinderella glass slipper. If it fits, you will receive a piece of Venetian glass as a special gift! Enjoy free time in the showrooms and a special 20% discount on purchases.You then will be able to return to the city center at any time by public transportation (own expense).

Meet your private local guide at your hotel reception desk. Board the private water taxi and travel along the Grand Canal through Venice and the lagoon to reach the island of Murano.

Once we arrive at Murano Island, you will walk through the historical center and visit the Cathedral of Santa Maria e Donato, a 7th-century church of rare Romanesque style with original mosaics. After a 15-minute walk through Murano's quiet streets, you will reach the glass factory.

Here, you will spend about 20 minutes observing the glass masters at work. Watch them make two different objects with their famous technique for glass-blowing and sculpture.

Would you like to try on the glass slipper? If your foot fits, you will become the Cinderella of the day and will receive a special present. You can choose from a multi-colored flower vase, a dish with 'millefiori' decoration, or a Venetian wine glass (called 'goto'). You will also receive free time in the showrooms and a special 20% discount on purchases.

The tour ends in the glass factory. You can return to the center of Venice or continue easily to Burano and Torcello at any time with public transportation (on your own). The boat station is approximately 300 meters from the glass factory (ticket not included).
strTitle: Murano by Private Watertaxi Including Glass Blowing Demo with Hotel Pickup

strIntroduction:
See the best of Venice while totally relaxing during this 7-hour private tour over land and water. Discover important places including San Marco and the Rialto bridge, hidden corners, picturesque canals and incredible bridges. Take a traghetto to cross the Grand Canal with locals, as well as a ferry to reach Murano. Once in Murano, enjoy a 3-course lunch and then visit a glass factory with a performance of an expert glass master. End with a taxi ride to admire the venetian lagoon and its canals.

After meeting up with a friendly local guide in Venice, set off for a city tour on land. Explore some of Venice’s most popular areas including San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge and fish market. Follow the guide to discover lesser-known areas like hidden square, ancient churches and picturesque bridges.

Along with the guide, tour the inside of the private gardens of historic churches and houses of the Doges. Then follow dozens of locals as they board a local public Traghetto to cross the Grand Canal. Switch to another local service to Murano Island before feasting on a delicious 3-course Italian meal.

After lunch, travel to an ancient glass factory to learn how glass masters create multicolored objects with a pipe and admire the local art. Then hop on a water taxi and travel back to San Marco square, admiring the lagoon along the way.
strTitle: Venice by Land and Water: Murano Island with Typical Lunch

strIntroduction:
Discover the best of Prague on this 4-hour private walking tour with a local guide. Have a say in the itinerary and enjoy a tailor-made tour by your own personal guide. What better way is there to explore Prague than having your own itinerary.

After being picked up from your hotel, you will discover the real life of the city step-by-step at your own preference and with your private guide.

Perhaps you would like to include a visit to all the great sights of Prague, or maybe you are more interested in baroque architecture (rather than modern sights)? Hear about Jewish Prague, the choice is yours. This tour is fully customized for you with the option to include all the attractions or themes you wish to see and hear about!

Your itinerary depends on your preferences, the city sights you would like to see and your mood on the day. Your local guide will show you the best of Prague's past and present in a private tour tailor-made for you! Listen to stories about the city and be hear the answers to all the questions about the city and life in Prague you always wanted to know.
strTitle: Private Guided Walking Tour of Prague

strIntroduction:
Join an 8-hour private day trip from Prague to the historic town of Kutná Hora, a site on the UNESCO protected list. Discover the former royal mint, its Bone Chapel and more with your private local driver-guide.

Enjoy a private 8-hour tour from Prague to the medieval village famous for silver mining in the middle ages and UNESCO listed town of Kutna Hora. 

Your private local guide and driver will pick you up from your hotel and take you directly to Kutna Hora. He will show you not only the main attractions but also other interesting places you wouldn't otherwise see in cramped bus tour or by exploring the city by your own.

As your guide is born & raised here, he knows all about Kutna Hora's history. Explore hidden streets and off the beaten path places tourists usually don't get to see - even only a few locals know them. Apart from the main sights, there's something else travelers shouldn't skip.

Join this tour and discover more than others.
strTitle: Private Day Trip from Prague to Kutna Hora by Car Including Lunch

strIntroduction:
Instead of going to a restaurant, accept this invitation to eat delicious home-made meal at Local's place and enjoy Czech hospitality at its best! 

Let's spend a pleasant afternoon / evening with a local friendly family and taste the real Bohemian meals cooked with love. Meet your local guide Vlasta at your hotel, then follow her to her house out of Prague (by public transportation). As you walk inside, her whole hospitable family is there to greet you with a warm smile and full table.

Some of the dishes of the 4-course menu are from recipes that have been handed down from her ancestors for generations. 

Begin your meal with an aperitif and end with a coffee & good conversation.

Your local guide Vlasta will be with you from the beginning to the end, to translate everything and ensure you get the most out of your time.

If you have dietary requirements, just let them know ahead of time and they gladly cater to your needs. The menu is seasonal and based on what produce is ripe when you visit.
strTitle: Private Home Dinner with a Local

strIntroduction:
There is no better way to see the sights and learn the history of Naples than by joining a bike tour. You get to have fun and socialize, have some exercise and be entertained by your knowledgeable guide. Especially recommended for cruise passengers and short-break tourists. It will be the best day you'll spend in the capital city of South Italy!

Understand all facets of Naples in one bike tour: Naples' sea promenade and the scenic districts of Mergellina and Posillipo with great view on the huge gulf of Naples and the Mt Vesuvio; the incredibly reach in history old town with its wide art and archaeology heritage, the colourful street markets and the unique gastronomy.
Tours begin with a brief introduction to Naples before hopping on the bikes. You will stop every couple hundred yards (meters) to talk about the sights and for photo opportunities. Along the way you will stop at a coffee bar where you can experience Naples as the locals do!
strTitle: Naples Guided Tour by Bike

strIntroduction:
See Thailand's most interesting attractions in miniature at Siam Park. This park holds many of the attractions throughout Thailand but also around the world and is well worth a visit. This private or group tour will give you an insight into what Thailand has to offer and ensure you want to spend more time in the country seeing these great attractions for real.

This group tour takes you to Mini Siam and Mini World which are located just north of Pattaya. This is one of the most interesting attractions in Pattaya with many of the most important and historical sites of Thailand showcased here in miniature (1:25 scale). Other world renowned attractions can also be seen. Walking through this park gives you a bird’s eye view of Thailand and will surely inspire great memories.

Be amazed by the distinguished craftsmanship of each of the 100 small constructions. This tour will make you feel that you need to visit more of Thailand. We end the tour dropping you off back at your hotel.
strTitle: Mini Siam Park with Transport from Pattaya

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a canoe trip at one of the most beautiful Southern Thailand islands.

Explore the stunning natural beauty of southern Thailand's islands with the convenience of your own canoe. Marvel at the bright white beaches surrounded by towering limestone cliffs, the blue of the Andaman sea and the green of the island’s lush vegetation. “Room Island,” or Koh Hong, is one of the most beautiful islands in the south. Protected by the Thai government for its wildlife, Koh Hong is full of monkeys, lizards and a variety of birds. Take a walk on one of the island's nature trails or simply relax in the sun: white sandy beaches await you. Koh Hong is also known for its lagoon, one you only can reach from the water and has the most stunning island scenery one can ever imagine. Be mindful, after this day, you do not want to leave.
strTitle: Full-Day Canoeing in Koh Hong from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Explore Thailand's Chiang Rai region on this private day trip to the historic former capital city, Chiang Saen; the border of three countries (Laos, Thailand, and Myanmar), known as the Golden Triangle, and the hill tribe villages of Mae Sai. You'll travel with a dedicated private guide and vehicle, with entrance fees and lunch included.

After morning pickup from your hotel in Chiang Rai by your private guide, head to the historical city of Chiang Sean, the former capital of the Lanna Kingdom.

Once known as Wiang Hiran Nakhon Ngoen Yang, the city passed on its title of capital to Chiang Rai in 1262, and vestiges of its past glory are still evident. See the ruins of the old double city walls, antiques, and the distinctive, Buddhist sculpture style that evolved in the late 13th century.

Continue your private day tour to the spot where Thailand, Laos, and Myanmar (formerly Burma) meet, known as the Golden Triangle. It is here that the extensive trading of opium and papaver (poppy) took place between the three neighboring countries. Moving on, make your way to Mae Sai, a small trading town on the Thailand–Myanmar border and the northernmost point of Thailand. Here you will enjoy lunch at a local restaurant chosen by your guide.

After lunch, continue to Doi Mae Salong to visit the Akha hill tribe at Baan Samyak village and the Yao hill tribe at Baan Pong Pa Kham village. Learn about the culture and traditional hill tribe lifestyle of rural northern Thailand before making your way back to Chiang Rai, where your tour ends with hotel drop-off in the early evening.
strTitle: Private Full-Day Tour to Chiang Saen, the Golden Triangle, and Hill Tribes of Mae Sai from Chiang Rai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a full day tour of Doi Tung and visit the villa of Thailand’s Princess Mother. We also visit the temple known as Wat Phra That Doi Tung and encounter a number of different hill tribe minorities. We finish our day with a trip to Mae Sai market, located on the Thailand-Myanmar border.

Your full-day private or group tour of this northern part of Thailand begins in the morning with a visit to Doi Tung. The site is a major environmental and socio-economic development project that was initiated by Her Royal Highness Srinakarindra, the Princess Mother, mother of His Majesty the King of Thailand. Your tour includes admission to the Doi Tung Royal Villa.

The late Princess Mother chose to build this home in the north of Thailand where she could enjoy periods of rest and also work on her Doi Tung reforestation project. A visit to the temple known as Wat Phra That Doi Tung is also included on the tour.

During your travels it’s likely that you’ll encounter a variety of hill tribe minorities and there will also be plenty of opportunities to stop and take photographs of the scenery.

You’ll enjoy lunch en route at a local restaurant. In the afternoon you’ll drive to the northernmost point of Thailand, making a stop in the market town of Mae Sai, on the Thailand-Myanmar border. The market is well known for its variety of products from Myanmar, China, and Laos.
strTitle: Doi Tung Hill Tribes and Mae Sai Market Tour from Chiang Rai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a comfortable transfer to Samchong Pier by air-conditioned vehicle. Visit the Lungkhai Fruit Garden. Sample seasonal Thai fruits and a traditional dessert.  Leave the pier and head to Phang Nga Bay by long-tail boat or speed boat. Arrive at James Bond Island. Have lunch at Suan Lung Khai. Relax at the waterfall. Depart from Phang Nga to Krabi.

Land transfer by air-conditioned vehicle to visit Lungkhai fruit garden, test some of Thai fruit on season & Thai desert, Lunch at fruit garden after lunch continue to Samchong Pier depart from the pier and head to Phang Nga Bay by long-tail boat or speed boat, arrive at James Bond Island, Visit Suan Lung Khai, return to mainland, depart from Phang Nga to Krabi
Enjoy a comfortable transfer to Samchong Pier by air-conditioned vehicle. Visit the Lungkhai Fruit Garden. Sample seasonal Thai fruits and a traditional dessert.  Leave the pier and head to Phang Nga Bay by long-tail boat or speed boat. Arrive at James Bond Island. Have lunch at Suan Lung Khai. Relax at the waterfall. Depart from Phang Nga to Krabi.
strTitle: James Bond Island Tour in Phang Nga Bay

strIntroduction:
Watch a spectacular show of Thai dance and see over 100 performers on one of the world's biggest theater stages. Feast on a Thai buffet and western cuisine during this tour. Have a fun night with your family in Phuket.

Just like its sister theatre in Siam Niramit Bangkok, the Phuket show is very well put together by a professional and inspiring team; just sit back, relax and enjoy the historical perspectives of Thai arts and culture throughout this fantastic 70-minute performance.

Phuket Siam Niramit show is an extraordinary performance featuring more than 100 performers, enhanced special effects, superb set designs, lavish costume and one gigantic stage that featured in the Guinness Book of Records.

For the tour, you will be picked up from your Phuket hotel and taken to the theater on the Tiamruammit Road. Arrive in time to enjoy the theater’s other facilities, such as the pond of the Village of the Four Regions, the displays of kites and Khon masks, a chance to ride on an elephant that will feature in the show later, or an invigorating Thai massage from qualified masseurs.

The must-see show is performed on a gigantic stage that utilizes special effects and the world's most advanced technology to produce a realistic, stimulating and inspiring performance. It will take you back through the history of Thailand and former Siam.

Before the show begins, enjoy the restaurant service included as part of your package, offering a delicious buffet selection of both Thai and Western cuisine.

Once the show is over, you will be transferred back to your hotel in Bangkok, having witnessed the show that the Bangkok Post called “A feast for the eyes.”
strTitle: Evening Siam Niramit Show and Dinner from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Join this exciting 3-hour city tour of Manilla for a chance to get to know this historical city in an interesting way! Step back 400 years as you soak up the historical atmosphere of this great city. Take it all in and get to know local life as your wander the streets on foot.

Your tour will begin with a pickup from your hotel in Manilla. From here, you will be taken on a 3-hour guided tour of the city with the most historically and culturally significant landmarks in the Philippines.

Step back in time as you are taken on a journey through the city’s history with a walk through Manila’s original walled quarter. You will wander through churches, past plazas, cobbles, taking in tales of conquistadors, treasure ships, battles, wars and even a golf course! You will leave this tour with a new-found appreciation for the city and its history.

You tour will conclude with a drop-off back to your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day City Tour of Manila

strIntroduction:
Discover the bustling city of Bangkok with this exciting 4 hour tour exploring 3 stunning temples. See the Golden Buddha statue at Wat Traimit, visit the magnificent Reclining Buddha at Wat Pho and admire the beautiful architecture at the Marble Temple.

We take you to 3 of the most stunning temples Bangkok has to offer on this 4 hour tour. If you are interested in learning more about Buddhism and its history, as well as experiencing the busy city life, this tour is for you.

Discover Wat Traimit with its 5.5-tonne Golden Buddha statue before exploring Wat Pho, boasting the 43-meter long Reclining Buddha. Wat Pho is regarded as the first center of public education and is sometimes called Thailand’s first university. Mural paintings, inscriptions, and statues found in the temple educated people on varied subjects such as literature, warfare, archaeology, astronomy, geology, and meditation. Wat Pho is also considered home of the traditional Thai massage.

You will end the tour with a visit to Wat Benchamabophit (the Marble Temple). This temple represents an outstanding combination of Italian Carrara marble and classical Thai architecture.
strTitle: Half-Day Bangkok City and Temples Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore Taal Volcano, the smallest but also one of the most active volcanoes in the Philippines, on this guided, full-day hike from Manila. This complex volcano, located on the island of Luzon in the Philippines, thrills hiking enthusiasts with its astonishing beauty. After a short boat ride from the other side of the lake, an average trek of not more than an hour awaits. Along the way, steamy vents welcome visitors, a constant reminder that the volcano is indeed active and breathing. Lunch and a Manila hotel pickup and drop-off is included on this small-group tour.

This is a once-in-a-lifetime, private tour to hike picturesque Mt. Pinatubo and view the turquoise waters of the volcanic Crater Lake.

The driver provides a pickup from a Manila hotel, followed by a trip to Mt. Pinatubo. From a nearby resort, board an old 4x4 Filipino Jeep and enjoy a thrilling drive across Crow Valley, featuring moon-like terrain with vast ash fields and rocky rivers. Hike up towards the summit, passing through sandy cliffs and up a single-trail mountain path. The views of Crater Lake are breathtaking and worth every minute of the hike. Relax at the top and take in the incredible surroundings, basking in the sun and enjoying the views of the water.

The tour ends with a journey back to Manila and a hotel drop-off.
strTitle: Full Day Trekking Taal Volcano with Lunch from Manila

strIntroduction:
Take an exhilarating open-air ride through bustling Bangkok by tuk-tuk — a three-wheeled, covered motorcycle unique to Thailand. You'll wind through city streets on a personalized half-day tour of the capital and its cultural highlights, including Pak Khlong Talat Flower Market and Chinatown. Hotel transport, snacks, and private guide included.

Start your tuk-tuk tour of Bangkok with pickup from your hotel in the morning. Set out for city sights with a unique itinerary that can be customized to your personal interests. Greet your private guide and hop aboard one of the most vital types of transportation vehicles used in Thailand, named for the sound made by its small-capacity, two-cycle engine.

Motor around town to explore some of the highlights, such as the chalk-white Phra Sumeru Fortress, built on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. Stop by Wat Ratchanadda, famous for its Loha Prasat (Metal Castle), and see the Bangkok City Pillar Shrine (Shrine of the City God). Wind through Ban Baat village, Chinatown, and the Pak Khlong Talat Flower Market.

Local snacks will be provided along the way, and your 5-hour tour ends with transport back to your hotel.
strTitle: Unique Bangkok Tuk-Tuk Tour

strIntroduction:
Offering alms to the monks is a Buddhist tradition and an experience that should be tried whilst staying in Thailand. This private 2.5 hour tour is a great way to see this tradition close up in Bangkok.

The monks generally leave their temple before sunrise with their alms bowls. You will be transferred to a nearby temple area in order to take part in this fascinating tradition.

You will be picked up from your hotel at around 5.30am and transferred to your nearest temple, where you can experience this tradition. Food is provided to donate to the monks and your guide will explain how to take part in the alms giving process.

You will need to remove your shoes, lower your upper body and put your palms together in front of your chest (what is called the "Wai") to make the monks understand you want to offer alms. You will be blessed in return and wished for great fortune.

At the end of this Buddhist ritual, you will be driven back to your hotel where you should return by 7.30am.
strTitle: Morning Alms Tradition in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Tai-chi is originally a traditional Chinese martial art that has been recognized worldwide for its defense techniques and health benefits. This private tour will give you a typical early morning experience with the locals.

Experience this graceful art in Lumpini Park, which is the largest park in Bangkok and very well located in the heart of the city. It will undoubtedly help to focus on positive energies through a series of slow movements and is always a very rewarding experience.

A 6.30am early start will get in tune with the locals. We will transfer you to Lumpini Park, where you will have a 45 minutes tai-chi group lesson given by a master. This experience will re-focus and energize you through a series of slow movements and is for everybody a rewarding experience.

At around 8.30am we will transfer you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Tai-Chi in Lumpini Park Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Learn the basics of Thai massage during a 5-day course at one of the most renowned Thai massage schools in Bangkok, Wat Po Thai Traditional Massage School. During the course, you'll be trained to understand the key parts of Thai massage: relax, relieve muscular fatigue, reduce pain and tension headaches, regain joint mobility, and more.

Each day in the morning, you will be picked at your hotel in Bangkok and driven to Wat Po Massage School where your class is held for five days. You'll be driven back to your hotel in the late afternoon, and you can spend your free time relaxing or exploring the city on your own.

Class schedule:
Day 1: Introduction to Thai Traditional Medicine and Thai Massage
Day 2: Precaution and Prohibition of Thai Massage
Day 3: Masseur/Masseuse posture
Day 4: Massage position, technique, steps, and procedure
Day 5: Welcome and give advice to customers

Please note: this course includes transfers only; accommodation and meals are at your own expense.
strTitle: 5-Day Thai Massage Course at Wat Po Thai Traditional Massage School in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Learn how to meditate and discover how to master your mind at the Vipassana meditation center of Wat Mahathat, a Buddhist temple in Bangkok. It's an ideal way to escape the city's hustle and bustle and re-focus your energy to a calmer state of mind. Round-trip hotel transport is provided in addition to your 2-hour session.

After pickup from your hotel in the early evening, you're transferred to the Vipassana meditation center at Wat Mahathat — one of 10 royal temples in Bangkok as well as the headquarters of Thailand's largest monastic order.

You will be welcomed on arrival before your 2-hour meditation class begins. During the session, your instructor will familiarize you with typical meditation techniques that promote relaxation and build internal energy, or life force, meant to reinforce your well-being and a peaceful state of mind.

Following this authentic Thai experience, your guide transports you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Evening Meditation Class at Wat Mahathat Temple in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
This private tour of Bangkok takes you behind the scenes of the Thai capital. Walk with a personal guide through some of the city's most interesting districts. You'll learn all about the dynamic local culture while you travel around streets and canals by Skytrain, tuk-tuk, and long-tail boat.

Your personalized walking tour of Bangkok starts in the morning with pickup from your hotel. You'll use local means of transportation — BTS Skytrain, private long-tail boat, public express boat, and tuk-tuk (three-wheeled motorcycle) — to explore some of the city's cultural attractions.

Among the highlights are a visit to a fresh flower and vegetable market as well as a traditional village. Stop by a Muslim mosque and Wat Pho (Temple of the Reclining Buddha). A boat ride along the khlongs (canals) of Bangkok shows you more of local life.

Conclude your customizable, 5-hour tour at the BTS station at Siam Square, from where you are free to enjoy the rest of your day.
strTitle: Half-Day Cultural Walking Tour of Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Join this full-day biking tour for an exciting chance to get away from the big city for a while. Visit a coconut plantation to see how coconut sugar is harvested and processed, ride a wooden paddle boat through the famous floating market, Damnoen Saduak, pedal to a first-rate Thai restaurant for a fabulous lunch on the Mae Klong River, wander the grounds of a tree-covered temple, and more!

Your day will begin with a pickup from your Bangkok hotel at approximately 7am. You will have a few non-cycling sites to see before hitting the bikes. Once on the bike you will visit the famous coconut sugar village, a local floating market and Tha Kha, with a canal boat ride. See vendors selling fruits, local Thai food, local Thai sweets, and creative souvenirs.

After this, enjoy the beautiful countryside as you cycle to Amphawa. Cycle through coconut farms and fruit plantations. Visit an auspicious temple that is covered by all four types of Banyan tree and an ancient army camp before stopping at the Amphawa Floating Market. This market is famous among local Thai visitors. Amphawa is a very crafty market with both boats selling food and shops selling all manner of craft products. (Please note: this market is a weekend market only.)

The total cycling distance is not more than 42km and is mostly on flat roads. Breaks are taken regularly at scheduled stops or at any place where you can come across something interesting. Support vehicles will follow you the entire way, so at any time during the tour you are welcome to swap the bike for the air-conditioned vehicle if you wish.

You will return to your hotel at approximately 7pm.
strTitle: Full-Day Floating Market and Biking Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Bangkok has a reputation as one of the finest places to discover food and no Bangkok trip is complete without experiencing a food tour.
Join one of our tours and walk your way through its most yummy districts.

Half-day Morning Street Vendors tour
7.30am: Pick-up from your hotel in Bangkok and transfer to the street markets to start our 4 hour walking foodie tour. You will visit many sites on the way including Wat Phrasri Maha Uma Dhevi, a Hindu temple, and one of the major tourist attractions. Across to Wat Kaek (which is the nickname of this temple) is our first market to visit: a variety of dishes such as mild soup with vegetables & pork, pork leg with rice and flat pink seafood noodles are waiting for you to taste. Next market is Klong San for dishes such as sticky-rice with fried pork, congee with boiled-egg & pork and Chinese Herb Shiliang juice. Lastly, we visit Thadindaeng market where there are many local Chinese food stalls such as Pot-Stewed Duck, the famous Éclair Bakery and Healthy Chinese Herb juice. We transfer you back to your hotel at around 12.30pm (Subject to change due to local condition)

Half Day Afternoon - Bangkok Side-Walk (Foodies) Tour
12:30pm: Pick-up from your hotel in Bangkok and transfer to the Bangkok Side-Walk 4 hour tour. We start at Tha-Prajan pier next to Grand Palace for a dish of Spicy lemongrass flavored flat noodles with pork & fish balls, special squid cakes, yellow curry with beef or chicken, Garlic bread & Oliang juice (Chinese coffee).
We then cross the Cross Chao Phraya River to Rachawong pier by local ferry to try some more dishes such as; Nam Rak-Bua á healthy Chinese Herb juice & Thai-Japanese pancakes. Walk through Yaowarat area which is locally known as the place to purchase gold (China Town). Taste boiled Chinese pasta squares with crispy pork, “Jab Gung” Chinese noodle with pork or chicken, “Pae-Guay” Chinese desserts & fresh coconut juices. We then transfer you back to your hotel 5.30pm. (Subject to change due to local condition)

Evening - Shop-Chim-Chill (Foodies) Tour
We pick you up at 5.30pm from your hotel in Bangkok and transfer you to China Town to experience our 3 hour Shop Chim Chilli food tour. We taste a variety of dishes such as Hong Kong noodles, Dim-Sum (Pan-fried taro cake, steamed pork rib with preserved soya bean), Grilled Jumbo Prawn with Thai seafood chilli sauce, Fried battered mussels, Chinese Bun, Old Chinese Herbal-Drink, Black Sesame Dumpling in Ginger Tea and Thai Tropical Seasonal Fruit.
Transfer back to your hotel around 9.30pm. (Subject to change due to local condition)
strTitle: Bangkok Foodies Tour

strIntroduction:
Samut Songkram is a province of fertile land, ripe with plants and crops, offering to visitors local culture, Thai history and beautiful nature. A unique day tour to discover the diversity of one of the smallest, yet naturally rich, provinces of Thailand. Combine culture, nature and adventure for the perfect day out!

Itinerary
8.30am - You will be picked up at your hotel in Bangkok and transferred to Samut Songkram, one of the smallest provinces in the country but features an abundance of natural resources.

10am - Upon arrival, hop in a traditional long tail boat to reach the mangrove forest, the largest in Thailand, covering over 2,000 rai (approx. 320 ha). Whilst there, guests will join a tree planting activity and then invited to feed the local monkeys under supervision before heading for a well-deserved lunch. A Thai set lunch will be served in a local restaurant in the village.

1pm - We continue our day by visiting a popular scallop and mussel farm, here you can collect scallops from a pedal boat. After your fishing experience we will be served a refreshing Thai dessert.

2.15pm - We then join our afternoon activities by boarding a local bus called a songtaew (literally "two rows"), for about 5 minutes to reach a lake where one can go kayaking, you can also experience a jet-ski ride or other water sports activities are available.

4pm - After a much rewarding day, it is time to leave this natural sanctuary and head back to your hotel in Bangkok town, arriving back at your hotel around 5.30pm.
strTitle: Full-Day Thai Nature and Adventure Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Welcome aboard for an enchanting journey along the historical Chao Phraya River. Cruise either up-stream or down-stream between Bangkok and the ancient capital of Ayuthaya, staying overnight alongside a traditional Buddhist temple. Once a rice barge, the exotic boat is now a floating boutique hotel. There is no better way to sample the leisurely life along the River of Kings. Just one day’s journey can transport you back through hundreds of years of Siamese culture and history. View life along this waterway of Thai life in style.

Upstream Itinerary
Day 1 12.30pm: Transfer from your Hotel in Bangkok to board Mekhala Cruise. Start cruising up the Chao Phraya River. Passing the Grand Palace and the Temple of Dawn. Arriving at Pathum Thani in the afternoon, you will visit a fresh market where locals shop for food. At sunset, the Mekhala will dock at Wat Kai Tia, a Buddhist temple located in a tranquil rural village. An exquisite candlelit dinner of mouth-watering Thai cuisine will be served on the deck. You will spend the night on board the boat, in your air-conditioned cabin.

Day 2
We start the day by cruising to a small village of Baan Saladang, an aged-old Mon community who migrated from Burma to this area in the early 19th century. The villagers here have maintained their traditional life style, customs and natural surroundings. You will also see a collection of well-preserved Thai houses in this charming village. Afterwards, you can enjoy a delicious breakfast. Later in the morning, you will disembark and travel to Bang-Pa-In Summer Palace. The mansions reflect Chinese, Swiss, Khmer, Thai and European styles of architecture. Travel by long tail boat to the capital of Ayuthaya to visit the archeological site of the once glorious capital. After lunch at a local restaurant, return transfer back to your Hotel in Bangkok.

Downstream Program
Day 1: 7am Transfer from your Bangkok Hotel to Ayuthaya. Visit the archaeological site of the once glorious capital. After lunch at a local restaurant, cruise on a long-tail boat to Bang-Pa-In to explore the Summer Palace. After this visit, our guide will drop you off, to board the Mekhala boat. We now enjoy watching rural life along the “River of Kings” on board the boat. You will visit a small village of Baan Saladang, an aged-old Mon community who migrated from Burma to this area in the early 19th century. The villagers here have maintained their traditional life style, customs and natural surroundings. You will also see a collection of well-preserved Thai houses in this charming village. Soon after sunset, the Mekhala will dock at Wat Kai Tia, a local Buddhist temple set in a tranquil village. An exquisite candlelit dinner of mouth-watering Thai cuisine awaits you on the deck. You will spend the night on board the boat in your air-conditioned cabin.

Day 2: Today, we will leave the pier early for a visit at a morning market in Pathum Thani. You will observe a way of life as local people shop for food and fresh produce. Afterwards, you can enjoy a delicious breakfast. The boat will continue to Bangkok and you will be able to take in the sights of the Grand Palace and Temple of Dawn along the way. You will arrive in Bangkok in the morning approximately 11am. Disembark and return transfer to your Bangkok Hotel.
strTitle: 2-Day Mekhala Exotic Siam Cruise from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Nestled among perfect sunsets, unspoiled tropical beaches, and cascading mountains is a modern, beautifully appointed day spa. In a traditional Thai- structure, step over the threshold and travel back to a more gracious time and place where you are splendidly treated.

Lanna Secret Package:

Discover for yourself the soothing results of the Lanna Secrets treatment. As time-honored practices of Northern Thailand are employed, blocked energy pathways are reopened. Energy obstructions causing fatigue, weariness and muscular discomfort melt away. The relief begins as acupressure is applied during the Traditional Thai Massage. Then Thai Herbal Hot Compress follows, which dissolve soreness and further releases energy to the body. Finally, complete relief comes during an Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage as the powerful effects of herbal essential oils fuse with massage therapy bringing you to the next level of relaxation.

Oasis Pampering:

This therapy takes you to a new level of delight for 2.5-hours. After the skin is exfoliated with a body scrub using the product of your choice*, you will revel in the delicious sensations of a full-body Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage. Once your body feels young and alive, your face is pampered with a Thai Facial, the ultimate beauty treatment.

The Paradise of the Oasis:

This is your one-way ticket to paradise. Your stress evaporates when exposed to a Thai Herbal Steam treatment then a Body Scrub expels the toxins of modern life, using the products of your choice. Next, a Thai Herbal Clay Body Wrap draws out years of accumulated pollutants and contaminant. Then an Aromatherapy Hot Oil Massage erases residual tension … and finally you enjoy a refreshing, beautifying Thai Facial. After 4-hours of pampering, you emerge like a butterfly from its cocoon – transformed.

Seaside Sensation:

This session combines many of the most popular treatments requested at our seaside spas. First, enjoy a Thai Herbal Steam then take a quick dip in a Cool Pool. Then be pampered with an Aloe Vera & Lavender Body Scrub and the Aloe Vera & Lavender Body Wrap. To complete your pampering enjoy a 2-hour King of Oasis Signature Massage and Detoxifying Facial. Those who have experienced this treatment have exclaimed that it is the best therapy they have ever tried.
strTitle: Essential Spa Experience in Phuket including Transfers

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this authentic Thai cooking experience at a local cooking school. Your chef will teach you all the tricks to create delicious and beautiful Thai dishes to show off to your friends and family back home.

Thai cuisine is known throughout the world, as being one of the most varied and delicious. The flavors are divine. The aromas are enough to make your mouth water with anticipation and on top of that, it is fresh, healthy food!

Experience the preparation of the ingredients through the cooking process, and finish your day by eating great Thai food. Relax while you cook, with views of the Andaman Sea and the natural surroundings. The cooking areas are specifically designed for the greatest convenience and safety. They are very spacious that so you can work in comfort. Have an authentic cultural experience through learning how to cook Thai food in Phuket. 

You can enjoy learning the art of Thai cooking and then savor it at home with your family and friends. It will be a souvenir that you can cherish for a lifetime from your Thailand trip.
strTitle: Thai Cooking Class in Phuket

strIntroduction:
Learn to create some delicious, authentic Thai dishes to treat your loved ones back home. A professional and fun environment will help you to enhance your skills as you learn about the basics of cooking Thai food.

In recent times, Thai food has emerged as one of the world's favorite cuisines. Thai food is not just delicious; it is also extremely healthy with the emphasis on fresh ingredients and a subtle balance of flavors.

Most of the ingredients used in Thai cooking carry medicinal benefits. A wide range of fresh herbs and spices, such as cumin, nutmeg cloves or bay leafs plus, of course chili, ginger and garlic are always found in Thai kitchens. The proper use of these ingredients is regarded as a culinary art in Thailand.

Join this full-day cooking class at the Phuket Thai Cookery School to learn how to make these delicious dishes. A safe and professional environment will allow your skills to grow. Take them back home to show off to your friends and family!
strTitle: Thai Cooking Class at Phuket Thai Cookery School

strIntroduction:
The Blue Elephant Phuket has fully equipped facilities offering you the chance to put your hand to practicing Thai Cuisine. Enjoy the choice between morning or afternoon classes with morning classes running daily and afternoon classes running on Monday to Saturday. The Cooking Class is divided into 2 sessions and all classes are conducted in English. All ingredients are provided by the school.

In recent times, Thai food has emerged as one of the world's favorite cuisines. Thai food is not just delicious, it is also extremely healthy with the emphasis on fresh ingredients and a subtle balance of flavors.

Discover, relish and learn to create the many culinary wonders of Royal Thai cuisine at the world renowned Blue Elephant Cooking School in Phuket.

Guided by experience and knowledgeable instructors, you’ll feel confident enhancing your skills in a classroom equipped to make you learning experience memorable and successful.

This tour suits everyone, from tourists to locals to any looking to try something new and gain more personal skills. Whether you’re a top chef or new to cooking Thai food, you’ll have something to gain and treasure from this experience.

With choices of morning classes daily or afternoon classes from Monday to Saturday, you can find a time to suit you best.
strTitle: Thai Cooking Class at The Blue Elephant School in Phuket

strIntroduction:
Settle in to the relaxing ambience of the Oasis Spa, a healing retreat dedicated to soothing sore muscles and detoxifying skin. Choose from several treatment options that blend gracious service with stunning surroundings that add to your serenity. Pamper yourself with an aromatherapy oil massage, traditional Thai massage, or a Thai facial for 2 or 2.5 hours. Or opt for a 4-hour spa package with a rejuvenating herbal clay body wrap and body scrub, followed by a hot oil massage. Hotel transport is provided.

The Oasis Spa Chiang Mai offers a casual day spa experience, accented with teakwood walkways, exotic plants, private outdoor showers, individual treatment villas, and cheerful service; it is located at the foot of Doi Suthep, near trendy Nimmanhaenmin Road. The Oasis Spa Lanna is an elegant day spa where clients delight in the graceful pampering that defined northern Thailand's golden era; it is located within Chiang Mai's Old City, next to Wat Pra Sigha and within walking distance to Sunday Market (Walking Street).

Select from several spa packages:

Lanna Secret (2 Hours)
Many have found relief from aches and pains and even jet lag with this 2-hour treatment, which features a traditional, deep-tissue Thai massage that clarifies blockages and balances energy lines. Next, a Thai herbal ball hot compresses melts away stubborn pain and further relaxes the muscles for the aromatherapy oil massage that takes your body to a new level of relaxation.

Oasis Pampering (2.5 Hours)
This delightful therapy exfoliates the skin with a body scrub using the product of your choice. Then, revel in the delicious sensations of a full-body aromatherapy hot oil massage. Once your body feels young and alive, your face is pampered with a Thai facial, the ultimate beauty treatment.

Paradise of Oasis (4 Hours)
Feel your stress evaporate when exposed to a Thai herbal steam treatment. Toxins of modern life are removed during a body scrub, which uses a product of your choice. Years of accumulated pollutants and contaminant are drawn out of the body with the Thai herbal clay body wrap. An aromatherapy hot oil massage erases residual tension. Finally, enjoy a refreshing and beautifying Thai facial.
strTitle: Spa Treatment at Oasis Spa in Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
The Elephant Nature Park is a conservation project in northern Thailand, established in the 1990s with the goal of providing a sanctuary and rescue center for elephants. Home to dozens of previously distressed elephants from all over Thailand, the park gives you a chance to learn about the animals and help care for them. The area also offers a glimpse of rural life in Thailand as you admire the natural scenery of the valley, bordered by a river and surrounded by mountains. Lunch is included.

Your tour begins with pickup at your hotel In Chiang Mai in the morning for the 37-mile (60-km) picturesque drive through the agricultural countryside along Mae Taeng Valley

When you arrive at the Elephant Nature Park, hear the stories of the rescued elephants told by the staff, and learn about the problems the elephants faced before they found a new home here. You'll find out how the park is helping with the treatment and care of Thailand’s dwindling elephant population, and then get to work with some hands-on action.

First, help unload and distribute fruit so you can enjoy the chance to feed the elephants from the viewing platform by yourself. Then take a break for an included buffet lunch before walking with the staff to the river next to the park. After learning how to safely and properly bathe an elephant, you can decide if you want to get in the water to help scrub the backs of these giants as they splash around. If you do not want to participate, you can stay dry on the riverside overlooking the elephants below.

In the early evening, your time at the park comes to an end. Say goodbye to the elephants and staff, and make the drive back to Chiang Mai for hotel drop-off.

Please note: Timing is approximate and may vary according to local conditions and the elephants' needs on the day of your visit.
strTitle: 1-Day Ethical Choice Tour to the Elephant Nature Park with Private Transportation

strIntroduction:
Elephant Nature Park is a unique project set in Chiang Mai, Northern Thailand. This overnight stay allows you to get close and truly understand these wonderful animals.

Established in the 1990s their aim has always been to provide a sanctuary and rescue center for elephants. The park is located about 60km from the city center of Chiang Mai, and has become home for dozens of previously distressed elephants from all over Thailand. The area offers a timeless glimpse of rural life as it it is set in a natural valley, bordered by a river and surrounded by rested mountains.

On arrival an introductory orientation video and talk where you can learn all about our herd and the park is followed by a healthy lunch of fresh local produce then watch the elephants bathe in the river that borders our park. Discover how to communicate with them and learn with our trained staff. Observe how they play and interact in each of their social groups. Full dinner is provided at the park before settling into the parks huts for your overnight stay.

After breakfast you can go on an elephant walk to see the elephants roaming in the open pasture. Upon returning to the Park with the elephants you get to feed and bathe the herd. You will soon begin to identify different elephants by their shape, markings and attitude. Observe and enjoy the communications and interactions between these highly intelligent and loving elephants.

Elephant Nature Park´s Mae Taeng Valley location is naturally stunning. Combined with the company of a herd of rescued elephants you will have the chance to take numerous pictures and keep lifelong memories.

Food - Dinner and lunches at the park are casual affairs, the focus being on high quality locally grown produce prepared in Western and Eastern styles. The range on offer will suit all diets from vegetarian to Halal.

Accommodation - overnight visitors stay in traditional rustic bamboo fan cooled huts, in keeping with our natural surrounds. Mosquito nets are provided so you may sleep with your windows open; if you listen to the night you may hear the elephants whisper, rumble, snore and even the occasional trumpet. You may watch the elephants from your room or the dedicated observation platform.

*Overnight stays are all about spending time with the herd and do not adhere to a strict schedule; the best way to make the most of your visit is to relax, watch and learn from the elephants.
strTitle: 2-Day Ethical Choice Tour to the Elephant Nature Park

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a boat ride along the "River of Kings" and its quiet canals on a half-day tour of Bangkok from its canals. Learn about the "Venice of the East" as you make your way through the waterways, eventually arriving at Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn.

Nineteenth-century Bangkok was laced with klongs (canals), giving the capital the designation of the "Venice of the East." Take a boat ride along the surviving canals and the Chao Phraya River (River of Kings) and discover memorable vignettes of a traditional waterborne way of life that has remained essentially unchanged over the centuries.

The river and canals may be conveniently explored by public transport or via a traditional long-tailed boat. Eventually, make your way to Wat Aru, the Temple of Dawn. The Buddhist building stands diagonally opposite the Grand Palace, and is best known for a porcelain-encrusted, central pagoda which sparkles in the sun. After a tour of the grounds, you will return to your starting point.

Additionally, you have the option of taking this tour with a group or booking a private tour.
strTitle: Half-Day Bangkok Klongs and Wat Arun City Tour

strIntroduction:
Join this tour for a unique Island experience at the beautiful island of Balicasag! A special getaway located only an hour from the Coast of Panglao Island. Enjoy a motorized outrigger boat ride to this small almost circular, flat island approximately 25hectares in area. Explore the incredible island and snorkel in the crystal clear waters and diverse marine environments of Balicasag Island Marine Sanctuary.

Balicasag is a small island off the Coast of Panglao Island in Bohol. It is a marine sanctuary with white sand beaches and beautiful amazing vibrant corals in shallow and deep waters with different fishes making them their habitat. This island is a haven for snorkelers and divers and also for those who simply love to swim and go island hopping. You can even simply relax on the beach and soak up the sun shine if you wish.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel. After this you will enjoy a 45-60 minute boat ride to the beautiful Balicasag Island. Upon arrival, you will have the choice to explore the island how you wish. Feel free to snorkel, explore, or work on your tan! A delicious lunch will be provided on the island.

To complete the tour, you will be taken back to your Cebu hotel safely.
strTitle: Balicasag Island Day Trip

strIntroduction:
Explore the Cebu city’s rich past with a visit to its cultural and historical landmarks and discover the charm that has earned Cebu the honor of being the “Queen City of the South”.

Your day will begin with a hotel pickup. Your guide will meet you directly in your lobby, before taking you away on an adventure around Cebu!

This tour will take you to some of the cities greatest attractions! Visit Fort Pedro, the Cross of Magellan which is the site of the first mass celebration in 1521 now a famous landmark in Cebu, Santo Nino Church which houses the image of the Holy Child Jesus venerated by the Cebuanos as their Patron Saint. Drive through the Avenue of flags onward to the provincial capital, then proceed to drive up to Beverly Hills, a scenic subdivision to view the entire city.

Visit the Taoist Temple where both religious and non-religious visitors climb several steps to light joss sticks and have their fortune read.
To conclude the day, you will visit some handicraft stores and enjoy some shopping!
strTitle: Half-Day City Tour of Cebu

strIntroduction:
A nostalgic tour of the historical island Corregidor, about 30miles (48km) west of Manila. Also known as "The Rock" and considered as "one of the country's last military bastions", Corregidor island served as one of the harbor defenses of Manila Bay during the Second World War II and the last stronghold of the  Philippines and American Military forces.

You will be met by our tour coordinator at the hotel lobby at 6:45am, and transfer you to the jetty port where you’ll board a 150-seater ferry boat, which will bring you to the island, located about 26miles West of Manila. 

Upon arrival, visitors will board to the pre-war type streetcars called “tramvias” touring around the island fortress. Corredigor Island -- “The Rock” as it became known during World War II, was the last Filipino-American bastion to fall to the Japanese. Enjoy a guided visit to the island’s many “silent guns” and historical landmarks. Be mesmerized by the Light and Sound Show inside the cavernous Malinta Tunnel, which served as General Douglas McArthur’s headquarters during the siege.
