Lunch buffet will be served at the Corregidor Inn around 3pm, we will then take a ferry back to Manila and transfer to the hotel.
strTitle: Corregidor Day Trip from Manila

strIntroduction:
This incredible full-day tour to the Bohol countryside will take you on a memorable and fun-filled trip to Bohol's tourist attractions such as the world-renowned Chocolate Hills. Visit historical and cultural landmarks like the Blood Compact Shrine and Baclayon Church, then go sightseeing at the Chocolate Hills and Man-made Forest. Spend some relaxing time with the enchanting Loboc River Cruise. Also enjoy the pleasure of meeting the cute Tarsiers, the world's smallest primates

Your Bohol Island day trip begins with pickup from your hotel by air-conditioned coach. With your knowledgeable guide, tour Bohol’s scenic countryside, starting from the historic Blood Compact Shrine, a historical landmark commemorating the 1st Treaty of Friendship between the east and the west, before visiting the centuries-old Baclayon Church and Museum, view the adorable Tarsiers, the oldest known smallest primate that leaves in Bohol.

En-route to the Chocolate Hills, drive through the lush Mahogany Man-made Forest and the green farmlands in Bilar and Batuan. In Bilar visit a Butterfly Farm which showcases a variety of Philippine butterfly species.

View the awesome cone-shaped hills known as the Chocolate Hills from a viewing deck on top of one of these hills. Drive back to Loboc for a 50-minute river cruise along nipa-lined river on board a native catamaran.

A sumptuous lunch of local cuisine is served on board. The river cruise will surely relax both your body and mind as you view nature’s beauty of rolling hills, graceful coconut trees and green nipa-palms lining the riverbanks.
strTitle: Full-Day Bohol Countryside Tour Including River Cruise

strIntroduction:
Escape from the hustle and bustle of Manila for the day and head to Hidden Valley Springs Resort. As you explore this massive volcanic crater on foot with your guide, marvel at rare, lush flora and fauna and unwind with a dip in soothing natural hot springs. Top it off with a buffet lunch of traditional Filipino specialties.

Meet your tour guide at the lobby, a two-hour drive from Manila down South. You can find Hidden Valley Springs, a private resort that boast of a virgin forest, century old trees, giant ferns, wild orchids, a hidden waterfall and several spring pools consummates the exhilarating ambiance.

The resort being a crater of an extinct volcano has different pools with varying temperature, the sources of which are the hot springs that emanate from the bowels of the earth. Pass through the wooden bridge to the hidden falls or simply rest and enjoy swimming with the mineral spring pools of your choice.

This day tour includes a buffet lunch, afternoon snacks and use of the resort’s facilities. You will be transferred back to your hotel after the tour.
strTitle: Hidden Valley Day Trip from Manila

strIntroduction:
Spend the day snorkeling with tropical fish on an island-hopping excursion. You’ll cruise through the islands in a large motorized canoe called a 'banca,' dive and swim in the protected waters of Hilutungan Marine Reserve, and enjoy a picnic lunch of grilled meat or fish on a white-sand beach. There’s free time for relaxing on the beach, and spectacular views of the island-dotted waters of the Philippine Sea on your banca ride.

Jump on our banca, or motorized canoe and feel the breeze and fresh air as we travel to the Hilutungan Marine Reserve. As we arrive at the shore, hop off the boat to see the abundant marine life, and the variety of corals and reef dwellers. Enjoy snorkeling, swimming or simply laze at the island.

From here we will carry on to the next island, Sulpa, with more chances for both diving and dining. As the waters around Sulpa are deeper with more lively marine life, take the chance to use one of our snorkels and goggles free of charge, and explore the clear and beautiful waters. 

We will then return to Mactan or Cebu City, giving you a chance to relax and take in your surroundings after this unique island-hopping experience.
strTitle: Island Hopping Day Tour in Cebu

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a scenic drive along the south coastal road of Carcar followed by a short walk uphill to the waterfalls. A cozy trek... A peaceful river... A gentle hush of rushing ice cool water, all this and more in Kawasan Falls! You will surely enjoy the cool and deep fresh water and everything around just seems so relaxed, simple and very serene. Just nature as it should be.

From the hotel, we will drive 80miles (130km) southwest for about 3-hours to Badian, where Kawasan Falls is located. From the entrance, we will trek uphill for about 15-30 minutes passing through Matutinao River before reaching the first falls -- the largest of the three waterfalls. An uphill climb for 15 minutes will take us to the second falls and another to the third. 

Toilets and changing facilities may be found in the area – but please do not expect anything fancy – this is countryside after all. Savor the simple pleasures of life. Ride a bamboo raft towards the falls. A cottage is also available for us to stay in order to take our meals.
strTitle: Kawasan Falls Day Tour from Cebu

strIntroduction:
Rhythmical excitement is Manila after sundown. Start the evening with delicious Philippine gourmet dinner. Proceed to the adventure of the night as you visit one or two bars which boast of a different approach to live or sound entertainment. You may opt to be dropped off at a disco, the casino or walk along rows of night entertainment in Malate or Makati on the way back to your hotel.

The night of your life will begin with a pickup from your hotel in Manila. From here, you will be taken on a fascinating and exciting tour of Manila as we explore the city after sundown.

Experience the hospitality that Filipinos are known for as you partake in a sumptuous feast of exotic local dishes and delicacies in a traditional “barrio fiesta” atmosphere while watching a performance of Filipino talent.

After dinner, you will be taken on an adventure to visit one or two bars. These bars will be different from one another so you can experience different sides of Manila’s exciting nightlife.

At the end of the tour you will be taken back to your hotel, or you may opt to be dropped off at a disco, the casino or walk along rows of night entertainment in Malate or Makati on the way back to your hotel instead.
strTitle: Manila by Night

strIntroduction:
Commonly referred to as the “Eighth Wonder of the World”, the Banaue Rice Terraces will take your breath away. These 2000 year old terraces were hand-carved into the mountains of the Cordilleras by the Ifugaos. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is located approximately 1500m (5000 feet) above sea level and cover 10,360km2 (4000 square miles) of mountainside.

Enjoy the opportunity to meet with village folks in Banaue, and a glimpse of their way of life.

Day 1
Your tour will begin with a pickup from your hotel in Manila. From here, you will be taken to Banaue via North Expressway. Enjoy watching the stunning scenery as you pass by Rural towns markets, verdant farm lands and mountains. You may even get to stop to explore some of them, if time allows.

Stop in the beautiful sea-side town of San Jose for lunch for continuing on to Banaue. Along the way you will be given the chance to enjoy a photo stop at at Dalton Pass, the culminating point between the provinces of Nueva Ecija and Viscaya. Late afternoon arrival in Banaue. Overnight at Banaue Hotel. (Meals: L, D)

Day 2
Enjoy breakfast at your hotel before boarding a local Jeepney. Drive for about an hour to Banga-an Village, a traditional village nestled in a panoramic valley of terraces.

Exit the Jeepney on the main road of Banga-an and embark on a 2-minute walk on a descending trail. This will permit you with a closer look into the lives of the Ifugaos. Mingle with them and discover how their daily life goes on.

Return to the hotel at the end of the day. Overnight at Banaue Hotel. (Meals: B, L, D)

Day 3
Enjoy breakfast at your hotel before departing for Manila via the Philippine- Friendship Highway. Pass by the Central Plains of Luzon, the biggest rice farming province in the Philippines!

Arrive back at your hotel safely. (Meals: B, L)
strTitle: 3-Day Banaue Heritage Tour from Manila

strIntroduction:
Discover majestic Pagsanjan Falls on this day trip away from the hustle and bustle of Manila! With your local guide, enjoy exciting boat rides along rapids surrounded by the lush landscape and enjoy a scrumptious spread of traditional Filipino.

We will drive approximately 2.5 hours southwards from Manila, to reach the old town of Pagsanjan. Upon arrival, you will board on a dugout canoe, the skilled and accredited boatmen will take you to the falls or “Shoot the rapids”. As the boatman starts rowing upstream, you will past trees, vines, bush and local wildlife.

The first fall is 20 minutes away following by some minor falls. The boatmen will continue the ride to the main falls. The highlight of this trip is the rapid descent downstream known as “shoot the rapids”. Be prepared for the thrill of a lifetime as the expert boatmen maneuver the boat skillfully through turbulent waters.

Please remember to bring your changing clothes and waterproof your items as you will get wet through the falls. Lunch will be served and you will get change before we transfer you back to your hotel safely.
strTitle: Pagsanjan Falls Day Tour from Manila

strIntroduction:
Enjoy an early morning boat trip to the sea waters Southeast of Tagbilaran City on board a motorized outrigger boat. Relax as you float along the water, searching for some of the various marine life found in these waters, such as whales and dolphins. Other activities in this tour include swimming and snorkeling around Pamilacan Island, a village tour, picnic lunch.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel in either Tagbilaran City or Panglao Island. From here, you will be taken to board the motorized outrigger boat that will take you on an early morning trip to the sea waters of Bohol to Pamilacan Island for Dolphin and Whale spotting.

Afterwards, we will take on a leisurely visit to the island for a taste of small island life. Most islanders on Pamilacan are fishermen. They also make their livings from raising livestock or leading dolphin watching expeditions in the Bohol Sea.

You can relax on the island or you can choose to enjoy some snorkeling, with equipment included. Feast on lunch in a local restaurant before returning to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Pamilacan Whale and Dolphin Spotting Tour

strIntroduction:
’ll listen to a short briefing on the day before proceeding on to your shopping heaven!

You’ll visit 3 top shopping destinations during the tour. Search for the best bargains at the Greenhills Shopping Center and Tiendesitas, where you can find items such as arts, antiques, furniture, fashion, handicrafts and novelty items, pearls, and jewellery.
Visit Greenbelt and Glorietta in Makati for the new hype stores with some of the best upscale boutiques.

Finish the day at the Mall of Asia, which is the 4th largest shopping mall in the Philippines and the 13th in the world. Here you can find almost anything your heart desires.

Once the tour is complete, you’ll be taken back to your hotel safely.
strTitle: Half-Day Manila Shopping Tour

strIntroduction:
Have a leisurely drive through picturesque rural roads outskirt of Cebu City and be refreshed with the pastoral scenery on the way. Soak up in Philippine culture with visits to centuries old churches and colorful markets. Final stop is Carcar town, alive in a blend of Spanish Architecture seen in ancestral homes and local artistry in crafts like shoe making, basket weaving and delicacy cooking. Experience the true and genuine rural life with a water buffalo”carabao” ride, a tricycle ride, a drink of fresh coconut wine and basket weaving.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel lobby. From there, you will embark on an hour long leisure drive down south to Carcar City. Enjoy the pleasant scenery passing by along the way.

Carcar is a quaint and lovely southern Cebu town boasting of centuries-old St. Catherine Church and some Spanish-era houses surely to transport you back in time. See the sprawling countryside while taking in culture, architecture and new sights and sounds.

Ride on a water buffalo, locally known as a carabao, drink aged coconut milk locally known as tuba, ride a tricycle (a three-wheeled vehicle originally made from the scraps used to make Jeepneys) that can take about 4 people, enjoy basket weaving, and Carcar museum.

We'll take our lunch in one of the local restaurant before heading to Carcar Shoe Expo known for their beautiful and fine quality shoes and sandals. You can even go there and have a customized pair of shoe for you at cheaper prices.

After shopping at Shoe Display Center, we will then head back to your hotel in Mactan or Cebu City.
strTitle: Private Tour: Full-Day Southern Countryside and Carcar City Tour

strIntroduction:
A soft adventure tour to Taal Volcano, the country’s smallest active volcano, has bewildered trek junkies and hiking enthusiasts with its astonishing beauty. After a short boat ride from the other side of the lake, an average trek of not more than an hour awaits you. Along the way, steamy vents welcome trekkers, a constant reminder that the volcano is indeed active and breathing.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel lobby at 7am. You will then depart from Manila and drive approximately 2 hours south to Batangas. Drive down the winding road to a small local community along the lake called Talisay

At 10am, board a motorized outrigger boat to Taal Volcano Island 30 minutes away. Walk up the soft black lava sand for about 1 hour to the rim of the crater to have a close up view of the caldera. Marvel at the beautiful views before you.

Return to the lakeside for local lunch. Relax here before returning to Manila. Along the way, you may have the opportunity for a stop to buy souvenirs!
strTitle: Private Tour: Taal Volcano Trekking Adventure from Manila

strIntroduction:
Sit back, relax, and enjoy a picturesque drive south of Manila to the city of Tagaytay. Located on a ridge 2,200 feet above sea level, the city offers a panoramic view of Taal Lake and Volcano. Savor this awe-inspiring vista from atop one of the rest houses of former President Ferdinand Marcos.

Meet our tour guide at the hotel lobby around 7am, take an hour and half leisurely drive Southwest of Manila. Passing through Las Piñas, take a stop at St Joseph’s church which houses the famous “Bamboo Organ”, the first of its kind in the world yet is still being used during church services and international competition.

Drive upland and in Tagaytay along fruit and vegetable plantation. Stop at a ledge in Tagaytay to relax and enjoy the fantastic view of one of the smallest active volcanoes within a lake while taking the native Buko ice cream. “a volcano within a lake within a volcano”. The tour is one of the best and easiest way to take a glimpse of the countryside as the area boasts of farm lands planted with flowers; fruits; vegetables; coffee and palm trees.

Side trips to the Jeepney Factory (Manila’s famous commuter vehicle) and world Bamboo Organ in Las Pinas are included. You will be transferred back to the hotel afternoon.
strTitle: Full-Day Tagaytay City Tour from Manila

strIntroduction:
This full-day tour will take you to the historic and popular attractions of Bohol's capital city, Tagbilaran City, and the stunning paradise of Panglao Island. Visit centuries-old Spanish-style houses, churches and buildings. Go spelunking at Hinagdanan Cave. Be one with nature at Bohol Bee Farm and Shell Museum. Finally, cap off the trip with a fun-filled escapade at the island's white sand beach.

Your tour will begin with a pickup from your hotel in either Tagbilaran City or Panglao Island. From here you will begin your full-day tour.

Start the tour at Dauis Colonial Church and view the artesian well with miraculous healing waters inside the church, take a swim at one of the beaches on Panglao Island. Visit Panglao Church and watchtower, Hinaghanan Cave, stop for a snack or lunch at Bohol Plaza while enjoying the panoramic view of Tagbilaran Bay.

Continue to Tagbilaran City which consists of stops at St. Joseph Cathedral, "Sitio Ubos", Plaza Rizal, Provincial Capitol. Also visit the Bohol Museum which houses Bohol's flora, fauna and artifacts. Then go shopping for native products, pastries and other souvenir items at City's shopping centers and malls. Get to know the city.

After the tour, you will be taken back to your hotel safely.
strTitle: Full-Day Historical Tagbilaran City and Panglao Island Tour

strIntroduction:
Spend a relaxing day away from Manila on this tour of Villa Escudero Plantations, a coconut plantation located in the Philippines’ beautiful countryside. Experience Filipino culture and history as you ride a water buffalo-drawn cart through the plantation, listen to live local music, browse interesting artifacts at the museum, and enjoy a scenic lunch at the base of a calm spillway from Labasin Dam.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your centrally located Manila hotel at 7am. From here, enjoy a scenic 2-hour drive to Villa Escudero.

Unravel the rustic charm of a century age-old coconut plantation where a family of four generations live on. Experience a buffalo-drawn cart to transport you to the museum to see a collection of historic, religious, pre-hispanic and World War II artifacts.

The ride will transport you to a man-made waterfalls where lunch is served on tables set over a flowing stream. Enjoy a unique dining experience and one of the highlight of the tour. You can also take a refreshing cool swim in the pools.  There's a good cultural show on every Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

After the tour is complete you will be taken back to your hotel safely.
strTitle: Villa Escudero Day Trip with Lunch from Manila

strIntroduction:
Visit one of the most beautiful gardens in the Bangkok area and experience Thailand’s heritage at the Rose Garden Riverside. The Thai Village Cultural Show will introduce you to many customs of Thai life, such as traditional ceremonies and martial arts.

Enjoy an introduction to many customs and rituals of Thai life at the Rose Garden Riverside. On this 5-hour excursion to the outskirts of Bangkok you’ll take in the Thai Village Cultural Show that’s offered daily.

This is a wonderful opportunity to see performances of Thai dance, martial arts, and traditional ceremonies. Each day, over 150 performers take to the stage to entertain audiences with a variety of activities from Thai cultural heritage. The 60-minute action-packed show also features demonstrations of Thai marital arts, including Thai boxing and sword fighting.

See a traditional Thai wedding ceremony, and the ceremony of ordination into the Buddhist monk-hood. Marvel as traditional performers entertain you with dances from various regions of Thailand, including the rhythmic Bamboo Dance, the graceful Fingernail Dance, the Kala Dance, and the joyful Yoev Dance. You’ll also see elephants at work performing tasks that they normally do in the forests of northern Thailand.
strTitle: Half-Day Rose Garden Visit and Cultural Show from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Spend the day at Khao Yai National Park and experience the Thai jungle, including evergreen forests, grasslands, and lush waterfalls. This day trip from Bangkok includes a Thai lunch and round-trip hotel transport, with the option to upgrade for a private tour with a personal guide.

Your day begins with pickup from your hotel lobby in the morning, followed by a scenic drive to Khao Yai National Park. Make a stop at a viewpoint to enjoy the vista along the way. On arrival, go hiking with your guide through dry evergreen forest and grassland, where gibbons, monkeys, and hornbills are often seen. Take in the natural surroundings and let out your inner nature lover.

A delicious Thai set lunch will be served at local restaurant before a drive up to Haew Suwat Waterfall. After about an hour relaxing here, it's off to the park's second highest mountain, which features a superb viewpoint of wild elephants that sometimes come to the salt licks nearby.

At the end of the trip, you will be returned to your hotel in Bangkok.

Note: Upgrade for a private tour and enjoy a personalized itinerary with commentary from your very own guide.
strTitle: Full-Day Khao Yai Jungle Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Rejuvenate yourself at Phuket's Oasis Sky Breeze, a hilltop spa at Kata Beach. Select the treatment of your choice during a 2- to 5-hour spa session that may include an aromatherapy oil massage, traditional Thai massage, detoxifying facial, herbal clay body wrap, body scrub, and more. Be pampered in your individual treatment room and relax at the rooftop pool with ocean views. Hotel transport is provided.

With views of the ocean and Big Buddha, the Oasis Sky Breeze at Kata Beach in Phuket offers a mountaintop experience. Its nine individual treatment rooms, rooftop pool, and herbal steam room make it a place to reconnect with the earth’s beauty and restore inner harmony.

At booking, select from several spa packages:

Lanna Secret:
Discover the soothing results of a Lanna Secret treatment as time-honored practices of northern Thailand are employed. Blocked energy pathways are reopened so that obstructions causing fatigue, weariness, and muscular discomfort melt away. The relief begins as acupressure is applied with a traditional Thai massage, followed by a Thai herbal hot compress, which dissolves soreness and further releases energy to the body. Finally, complete relief comes during an aromatherapy hot oil massage as the powerful effects of herbal essential oils fuse with massage therapy.

Oasis Pampering:
This delightful therapy exfoliates the skin with a body scrub using the product of your choice. Then, revel in the delicious sensations of a full-body aromatherapy hot oil massage. Once your body feels young and alive, your face is pampered with a Thai facial, the ultimate beauty treatment.

Paradise of Oasis:
Feel your stress evaporate when exposed to a Thai herbal steam treatment. Toxins of modern life are removed during a body scrub, which uses a product of your choice. Years of accumulated pollutants and contaminant are drawn out of the body with the Thai herbal clay body wrap. An aromatherapy hot oil massage erases residual tension. Finally, enjoy a refreshing and beautifying Thai facial.

Seaside Sensation:
This session combines many of the most popular treatments at the seaside spa. First, enjoy a Thai herbal steam followed by a quick dip in a cool pool. Then be treated to an aloe vera and lavender body scrub plus an aloe vera and lavender body wrap. To complete your pampering, enjoy a 2-hour King of Oasis signature massage and detoxifying facial.
strTitle: Oasis Sky Breeze Spa: Kata Beach in Phuket Including Transfers

strIntroduction:
Devoted to your relaxation and rejuvenation of body and spirit, the Oasis Secret Garden Spa at Bangtao Beach in Phuket offers your choice of spa packages. Many individual treatment villas have private outdoor showers overlooking a tranquil lagoon. Pamper yourself with a selection that includes such delights as an aromatherapy oil massage, traditional Thai massage, detoxifying facial, herbal clay body wrap, body scrub, and more. Hotel transport is provided.

Located in the estuary of a tropical paradise, the Oasis Secret Garden Spa at Bangtao Beach is a hidden sanctuary in Phuket.

At booking, select from several spa packages:

Lanna Secret:
Discover the soothing results of a Lanna Secret treatment as time-honored practices of northern Thailand are employed. Blocked energy pathways are reopened so that obstructions causing fatigue, weariness, and muscular discomfort melt away. The relief begins as acupressure is applied with a traditional Thai massage, followed by a Thai herbal hot compress, which dissolves soreness and further releases energy to the body. Finally, complete relief comes during an aromatherapy hot oil massage as the powerful effects of herbal essential oils fuse with massage therapy.

Oasis Pampering: 
This delightful therapy exfoliates the skin with a body scrub using the product of your choice. Then, revel in the delicious sensations of a full-body aromatherapy hot oil massage. Once your body feels young and alive, your face is pampered with a Thai facial, the ultimate beauty treatment.

Paradise of Oasis: 
Feel your stress evaporate when exposed to a Thai herbal steam treatment. Toxins of modern life are removed during a body scrub, which uses a product of your choice. Years of accumulated pollutants and contaminant are drawn out of the body with the Thai herbal clay body wrap. An aromatherapy hot oil massage erases residual tension. Finally, enjoy a refreshing and beautifying Thai facial.
strTitle: Oasis Secret Garden Spa at Bangtao Beach Including Transfer

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the perfect sunset cocktail at Klong Muang Beach with your family and friends. The beach lies on the Krabi coast, a 15 minutes’ drive north of the main beach with a well-established village with shops and simple restaurants. For most of its length, there is nothing on this beach but coconut plantation. Round-trip hotel transportation is included.

Our driver will pick you up from your hotel in Aonang around 4:30pm and head to Klong Muang Beach. The beach has fine golden-white sand and reasonably deep water that is good for swimming especially on low tide. It is picturesque with beautiful views across the offshore islands, quiet and peaceful.

Some delicious snacks and beverages will be served by our staff, such as canapés - spring rolls with Plum sauce, chicken satay with peanut sauce, mini sandwiches, tuna mayonnaise in tomato, cucumber and carrot sticks with salad cream and some dry snacks), fresh fruit, a sunset cocktail, white wine, red wine, sparkling wine, local beer, soft drinks, water. A cold towel will be provided to cool you down. Enjoy the beautiful sunset views with your family and friends at Klong Muang Beach, a perfect spot to relax and unwind. Our driver will transfer you back to your hotel in Aonang around 7pm.
strTitle: Krabi Sunset Cocktail

strIntroduction:
Cruise down the Chao Phraya River and winding canals of Bangkok on board an authentic long-tailed speedboat. Watch the everyday lives of the local Thai community. Then cruise peacefully back at sunset, on board a converted rice barge.

Following a hotel pickup and transfer, climb aboard a speedy long-tail boat for a join cruise down the Chao Phraya River and along the winding canals (klongs), viewing the local Thai community going about their daily lives on this 4-hour sightseeing tour by water.

Then sail back to the city center on board a comfortable, converted rice barge, enjoying seasonal fruits and unlimited cold drinks as you cruise. Drift quietly along the Chao Phraya River as the sun sets over Bangkok, passing some of the capital’s renowned landmarks, such as the royal Grand Palace and the temple of Wat Arun, as well as the city’s luxury riverside hotels.
strTitle: Half-Day Bangkok Rice Barge and Longtail Boat Cruise

strIntroduction:
Visit the Bangkok home of the late Jim Thompson during this 4-hour guided tour. The American entrepreneur helped revive the Thai silk industry in the 1950s and 1960s. Discover a perfect example of authentic Thai architecture in the complex of six traditional Thai-style houses.

After a morning pickup for your hotel, see the house that is a perfect example of authentic Thai residential architecture and Southeast Asian art. Admire the teak structures that were purchased from several owners and brought to the present location from various parts of Thailand. Completed in 1959, this magnificent half-day tour is dedicated to one of the most remarkable achievements ever made by a foreigner in Thailand. An achievement that is as miraculous as his later disappearance in Malaysia’s Cameron Highlands was mysterious.
strTitle: Half-Day Tour of Jim Thompson House in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
On this private or non-private tour we visit the colorful and bustling Damnoen Saduak floating market, located 62 miles (100 km) west of Bangkok. See merchants paddling along congested canals selling their fresh produce to shoppers along the canal banks and try your hand at bargaining.

The Damnern Saduak floating market is actually a combination of 3 different markets. The principal market is at Ton Khem.
Merchants paddle their small boats piled high with fresh fruit and vegetables along the crowded, narrow canal, offering their goods to buyers standing along the banks of the canal. The canal is lined with food stalls and souvenir shops. If you’d like to buy souvenirs from the shops here, remember that bargaining is expected.

The floating market is at its best early in the morning before the crowds arrive and the heat of the day sets in. The best photos of this colorful scene are from the bridge at Ton Khem, which crosses over the canal. The market is bustling with activity from the early morning hours until around 11:00. The floating markets are at their best early in the morning before the crowds arrive and the heat of the day sets in.
strTitle: Half-Day Tour of Damneon Saduak Floating Market from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Explore the Vimanmek Mansion Museum on Bangkok’s Ratchawithi Road, which is within the Dusit Palace complex. Admire a miraculous fusion of European neoclassical style with traditional Thai motifs and early 20th-century modernization.

Located behind the National Assembly in Bangkok, the Vimanmek Museum is also known as the “Palace in the Clouds,” and is the world's largest golden teakwood mansion. On this 4-hour tour you will explore the museum complex, home to the treasures that King Chulalongkorn collected on his trips to Europe.

The 3-storey palace contains 81 rooms, including halls and ante-chambers. Removed from Ko Si Chang in Chonburi Province, it was rebuilt in the Dusit Palace in 1900 by the command of King Rama V. Many rooms maintain the atmosphere of the past.

Most of the buildings are now used as museums, including the outstanding Abhisek Dusit Hall, where you will find exhibits of Queen Sirikit's collection of masterful handicrafts created by rural people. Discover art objects that include the photography of King Bhumibol, as well as paraphernalia and portraits, ancient cloth, clocks, and royal carriages.
strTitle: Private: Half Day Tour of Vimanmek Museum in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Learn about Thai art, culture, and history during this guided half-day visit to the National Museum in Bangkok. Browse a vast array of artifacts showcasing the history of Thailand, and view one of the best collections of Southeast Asian art in the world.

Discover the vivid history of Thailand during this guided half-day tour of the National Museum in Bangkok. Bangkok's National Museum houses a vast collection of artifacts from all regions of Thailand, ranging from neolithic times to the modern Thai Kingdom.

Opened by King Rama V in 1874 to exhibit the antiques and gifts bestowed to him by his father. Popular items in the museum include Chinese weapons, gold treasures, precious stones, Khon masks, puppets, ceramics, clothing and textiles, woodcarving, and traditional musical instruments from throughout Southeast Asia. The museum also houses a collection of royal funerary carriages, including the massive and still-used Vajayant Rajarot that requires 300 men to pull.

In the company of your expert guide, you'll learn about the full range of Thai culture and history, as well as the traditional significance of Buddhism to the Thai way of life. Murals and sculpture provide the backdrop to learn about the Buddhist, Hindu, Vedic, and Animist traditions that combine to form Thai Buddhism, while textiles reveal the history of Thai royal diplomacy, ancient court life, and the evolution of Thai arts. Additionally, many of the significant remains of the former capitals Sukhothai and Ayutthaya are on display.
strTitle: Bangkok Half-Day National Museum Tour

strIntroduction:
Visit Ayuthaya, the former royal capital of Thailand on a 10-hour sightseeing tour from Bangkok. Explore ancient ruins, such as the Summer Palace of King Rama IV. Learn about Ayuthaya’s history as a major port and its eventual demise and more.

Escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and enjoy a day of cultural history, 45 miles (75 kilometers) north in Ayuthaya, the former royal capital of Siam from 1350 until its sacking by the Burmese in 1767.

Learn about the mix of cultures, which began in the mid-16th century when ships from Ayuthaya plied the Asian seas to trade with neighboring countries. When the Dutch showed up in the 17th century, Ayuthaya became an important port, with trade routes to China, Japan, Indonesia, Portugal, Holland, France and even Scandinavia.

Although the villages of the foreign traders that lined the Chao Phraya river were abandoned when the city was sacked by the Burmese, remnants survive to showcase the Ayuthaya’s glorious past.

Starting at the Bang Pa-In Summer Palace of the late King Rama IV, wander the weather-worn ruins of the most impressive temples and palaces of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. A lunch will be served at a local restaurant in Ayuthaya, an essential stop for everyone interested in a better understanding of Thailand’s rich heritage.
strTitle: Ayutthaya Full Day Coach Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
On this private or non-private full-day tour you will visit the former capital of Thailand, Ayuthaya. Explore the ruins of the old city, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and see the Summer Palace of King Rama V. Then cruise back to Bangkok in luxury and enjoy a delicious Thai buffet lunch!

Discover Ayuthaya, a World Heritage Site and the former capital of Thailand. Ayuthaya is a must-see destination and a historic port with cultural influences from China, Japan, Indonesia, Portugal, Holland, France, and Scandinavia.

The tour starts at the Summer Palace of the late King Rama V. We then continue to the magnificent ruins of the World Heritage Site of the old city of Ayuthaya, founded by King Ramathibodi I in 1350 and the capital of the country until its demise by the Burmese army in 1767.

You’ll return to Bangkok in luxury, cruising down the Chao Phraya River on a comfortable, air-conditioned cruise ship while enjoying a delicious buffet lunch on board. Upon arrival in Bangkok in the late afternoon, you’ll be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Tour to Ayuthaya from Bangkok including Lunch Cruise Return Trip

strIntroduction:
Travel back in time to see the world-famous bridge on the River Kwai, built during World War II by prisoners of war near the town of Kanchanaburi. Learn about the construction of the infamous “Death Railway” and the poignant JEATH War Museum.

Learn about the history of the Burma Railway also known as the “Death Railway,” on this 10-hour historical tour to Kanchanaburi, approximately 80 miles (130 kilometers) west of Bangkok.

Upon arrival, you will tour the well-kept Wat Cemetery, where there are an estimated 9,000 Allied soldiers graves. The soldiers perished whilst constructing the notorious "Death Railway,” which the Japanese had hoped would stretch all the way to the Burmese border.

Uncover the terrible history of the railway at the JEATH Museum, which takes its name from the first letters of the words Japan, England, America/Australia, Thailand and Holland. See the past recreated and relived with pictures and artifacts.

You will also ride a train along the original Death Railway track, with a sumptuous lunch awaiting at the disembarkation station. Return to Bangkok in the late afternoon for your hotel drop-off.
strTitle: Full-Day River Kwai Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
On this private or non-private tour, discover Bangkok's world-famous floating markets, then head to the infamous Bridge on the River Kwai. Visit Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, where the POWs who died during the construction of the Burma Railway are buried. The JEATH war museum gives a good insight into these hard times. We then head back in to the city.

Discover Bangkok's renowned floating markets before journeying onward to the infamous Bridge on the River Kwai.

Our first stop is Damnoen Saduak, where locals and travelers shop at the 3 official floating markets. We then visit the narrow canal flanked with food stalls and souvenir shops at Ton Kem, before venturing south to the more authentic markets of Her Kui and Khun Pitak.

After the markets, learn the history of Khwae Yai and its Bridge on the River Kwai, the bridge was built by World War II allied prisoners and forced laborers and known to be part of "Death Railway". The story is immortalized in Pierre Boulle's novel and David Lean's subsequent film adaptation.

Visit the well-kept Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, where an estimated 9,000 Allied soldiers who died constructing the Railway are buried. You will see touching pictures and artifacts from this harrowing event at the JEATH Museum, known in Thailand as the Wat Tai War Museum.
strTitle: Full Day Tour of Floating Markets and the Bridge on the River Kwai

strIntroduction:
Explore the highlights of Bangkok on a full-day private or non-private sightseeing tour that takes in the Grand Palace, Buddhist temple of Wat Pho, colorful flower market and panoramic views from the Wat Saket temple on Golden Mountain.

Take a full-day scenic sightseeing tour of Bangkok and see all the city’s highlights on a 9-hour excursion. Explore the Grand Palace, residence of the Kings of Siam since 1782. Built by King Rama I, it was the center of power for more than 150 years, and is now Bangkok's most popular tourist attraction.

Continue to the Wat Po temple with its Reclining Buddha. Sometimes called “Thailand’s first university,” the temple features beautiful murals, inscriptions, and statues on subjects such as literature, archaeology, geology, and meditation.

You then have the opportunity to relax with a 30-minute traditional massage, before we set sail on a long tail boat. Our boat trip takes us along the Chao Phraya River through the city’s canals (klongs). This will give you a great view of Bangkok's traditional way of life, away from the high-rise buildings. We will pass the Thonburi residential area and also stop at the “Temple of Dawn” (Wat Arun).

We then take a walk through the flower market and experience rural life in Bangkok. Discover a vast selection of orchids and tropical flowers. The tour's final stop is at Golden Mountain, a steep hill inside the Wat Saket temple compound, where panoramic city views are your reward. We then head back to your hotel.
strTitle: Full-Day Highlights of Bangkok Tour

strIntroduction:
An exhilarating experience from the moment the motor launch leaves Pattaya Bay until the return in the late afternoon, this excursion offers guests the opportunity to sail across the sparking aqua-blue waters of the Gulf of Thailand for over an hour and then anchor offshore from Koh Larn (Coral Island) for fun under the brilliant tropical sun. Enjoy a seafood lunch and fantastic snorkeling.

Once there, you can relax, swim, dive, snorkel or simply bronze yourself on the Island’s golden beaches. We highly recommend a boat to view the rich-in-coral underwater world, even admirable in 20 feet of water. The whole day is designed for maximum enjoyment and the unique experience of this idyllic tropical paradise. After a delicious lunch on the Island, board a glass-bottomed boat to view the beautiful coral formations before finally returning to Pattaya Bay. A very relaxing day out!
strTitle: Full Day Koh Larn Island Tour by Boat from Pattaya

strIntroduction:
Enjoy an entertaining cabaret show, the 1.5-hour-long Calypso Cabaret. See many of Bangkok’s most beautiful transvestites and transsexuals performing, acting, dancing, and singing on stage! This includes round-trip transfer and a complimentary soft drink.

End your day with an entertaining cabaret show, performed by Bangkok’s most beautiful transvestites and transsexuals. You will enjoy and be amazed by their talents, as well as their exotic, feminine looks. The show runs twice daily, contains a variety of glitter and glamour, as well as plenty of acting and other artistic performances.

The non-smoking theater is located at the basement of the Asia Hotel in Asiatique and can accommodate a maximum of 350 visitors. Your cabaret experience also includes round-trip transfer from and to your hotel, and a complimentary soft drink during the performance.
strTitle: Bangkok Calypso Cabaret Tickets and Transfer

strIntroduction:
Feast on authentic Thai cuisine and watch traditional Thai dances during a dinner and dance experience at the Sala Rim Nam Restaurant. Located on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. Watch as local life unfolds while you enjoy a sumptuous set meal.

Sample superb Thai cuisine at the Sala Rim Nam Restaurant on the banks of the Chao Phraya River in Bangkok.

Part of the Mandarin Oriental Hotel, the restaurant is located on the opposite side of the river, and features a richly decorated traditional Thai pavilion that creates the stage for two of the kingdoms' most rewarding cultural experiences - Thai cuisine and classical Thai dance.

Enjoy a lavish set dinner of exotic Thai food, served daily between 7-10pm. As you feast on classic dips and fragrant dishes, a traditional Thai dance performance, staged nightly at 8.30pm, will keep you fully entertained. Sit back and enjoy the lights of the city on the banks of the river.
strTitle: Private Thai Dinner and Dance at Sala Rim Naam Restaurant in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Climb aboard one of Thailand’s best boat restaurants and treat yourself to a memorable night cruising along the Chao Phraya River. Feast on a Thai or seafood dinner while listening to classical Thai music and watching the city sights float by.

Treat yourself to a memorable night out on board one of Bangkok’s best boat restaurants. Relax in comfort, and experience the warmth of Thai hospitality as you sail.

The Wan Fah is a high-class, luxury Thai-style boat restaurant, offering sumptuous cuisine to the accompaniment of Thai classical music. Cruise along the Chao Phaya River and see the city’s skyline illuminated as you pass fascinating sights, such as the royal Grand Palace and the golden spires of the temple of Wat Arun.

A succulent Thai set menu of fragrant and exotic dishes will be served as you cruise. Tuck into either a fresh seafood meal or authentic Thai menu and marvel as the river’s bustling life passes you by.
strTitle: Bangkok: Wan Fah Dinner Cruise

strIntroduction:
Take in Bangkok's spectacular sights by night on a dinner cruise from the River City pier. Relax with a drink in hand as the boat makes it way between the Pinklao and Taksin bridges, providing views of Wat Arun, Wat Phra Kaew, and other monuments.

Enjoy this 4-hour dinner cruise with the backdrop of the stunning night scenery on both sides of the Chao Phraya River, the cruise departs from Bangkok’s River City pier.

The captain will take the boat as far as the Pinklao Bridge, where you’ll have a unique opportunity to take in the views of 2 of Bangkok’s most spectacular sights at night: Wat Arun, the Temple of Dawn, and Wat Phra Kaew, the Temple of the Emerald Buddha.

After the photo stop at the Temple of Dawn and the Grand Palace, the boats cruises in the other direction, to the Taksin Bridge, and you’ll be able to admire the colorfully illuminated sights along the river en route.
strTitle: Bangkok: Grand Pearl Dinner Cruise including Transfers

strIntroduction:
Cruise the Chao Praya River through the cultural heart of Bangkok, aboard a luxury rice barge. Dine on traditional Thai cuisine with flavors from around the nation and experience Thai hospitality and culture at its finest, with this 4 hour river cruise.

Cruise along the Chao Phraya River, aboard an antique, teak wood, rice barge called the “Tahsaneeya Nava”. Feast on superb Thai cuisine as you drift along the “River of Kings,” experiencing Thai hospitality from the comfort and tranquility of the open-air cruise.

Constructed of solid hand-carved and polished golden teak, the “Tahsaneeya Nava” was built at a time when such raw materials were abundant in Thailand. It remains one of the few authentic antique rice barges operating on the Chao Phraya River, and the 2-hour dinner cruise will take you back to a less hurried time.

You will be welcomed on board with a rose-water sprinkling ceremony and jasmine garland presentation. Then, enjoy the subtle spices of a superlative range of traditional Thai dishes, including an assortment of hot and cold canapés. End with a delightful platter of traditional Thai desserts and fresh fruit.
strTitle: Loy Nava Rice Barge Dinner Cruise Including Transfers from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Experience Muay Thai, a form of Thai boxing, during a 3-hour match in Bangkok. Muay Thai is a sport developed long ago from combat training. See it first hand and feel the adrenaline rush as you see the sport played live at a boxing stadium in Bangkok!

Learn all about Thai boxing, and see a Thai Boxing match at one of the biggest stadiums in Bangkok.

See the strange rules, or lack of them, that allow the boxers to not only use their fists for punching, but their feet and knees for kicking or pushing, and their elbows for jabbing while striking any part of the opponent's body.

Still, the matches of today are much less bloody than those that took place years ago. Back then there were no gloves, the boxer's hands and arms were bound only with knotted starched cord, and things got gory pretty fast! Come and see Muay Thai in real time at one of the major boxing stadiums in the city!
strTitle: Thai Boxing Match including Tickets and Transfer in Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Explore the sights in the city of Phuket on this 4-hour guided tour. Visit the most famous beaches, explore the acclaimed Chalong Temple, enjoy shopping at local gemstone and cashew nut factories and admire the breathtaking views at Promthep Cape.

This orientation tour is designed to give visitors to Phuket a nice introduction to the island without having to invest in a full-blown excursion. The trip features a road tour that passes by Phuket’s most famous beaches, a visit to the acclaimed Chalong Temple, and a short outing from out of Phuket Town.

Famed for its Portuguese architecture, Phuket remains an outstanding holiday destination, not only due to its large variety of beaches but also due to its cultural importance to the southern part of Thailand. Visiting the Chalong Temple is a favorite for both Thai and foreign visitors. The temple’s highlight is a wax sculpture of the abbot housed in an air-conditioned Thai-style house next to the chapel.

You will also have the chance to see the most famous lookout point on the island – Promthep Cape. Additionally, guests who like to shop will not be disappointed as stops at local gemstone and cashew nut factories are also on the agenda.
strTitle: Private Tour: 4-Hour Phuket City Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore a tropical getaway on a full-day tour of Phang Nga Bay Island in the Andaman Sea. Site of the 1974 James Bond movie, “The Man With The Golden Gun,” the stunning limestone mountains and vegetation provide a constant dramatic backdrop. Lunch is included on Sea Gypsy Island.

Feel shaken and stirred by the dramatic scenery of Phang Nga Bay Island in the Andaman Sea on this 10-hour scenic coach and boat tour, and explore the cinematic backdrop to the 1974 James Bond movie “The Man With The Golden Gun.”

Follow in the footsteps of 007 and discover one of nature’s most unusual locations, just 45 miles (75 kilometers) northeast of Phuket. You will travel by air-conditioned coach through dazzling scenery, staring at the dramatic limestone mountains of Panak Island and Hong Island off the coast.

Approach Koh Tapu, now fondly known as “James Bond Island,” and continue by boat through the mangroves to visit silent caves, many with strange-shaped limestone rock formations. Gaze at the cliff faces that rise majestically out from the sea and are draped with rich tropical vegetation.

An afternoon lunch will be served at Koh Panyi (also known as “Sea Gypsy Island”), notably built over the water on stilts by Indonesian fishermen, providing some of the most breathtaking views in Thailand.
strTitle: Phang Nga Bay Island Full-Day Sightseeing Tour including Lunch from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Discover the unique beauty of the limestone caves at Phang Nga Bay by sea canoe on this full-day tour from Phuket. Experience canoeing around the mysterious network of caves. Later enjoy our Thai buffet lunch on back on board the boat and sail out to Lawa Island.

This full-day of adventure and excitement starts at Laem Sai Pier, from where you will sail to Phang Nga Bay by boat. Upon arrival at Phang Nga Bay, you will be able to explore the sea caves tunnels, and lagoons by specials sea canoes.

Discover a unique and hidden world as you paddle the sturdy canoe, weaving your way through a network of brilliant limestone caves to reveal the mysterious hidden world of the hongs (collapsed cave system inside the rock). Each interior of each island is different and provides a whole new atmosphere, only accessed by tough, purpose-designed inflatable canoes through sea-caves at low tide.

After returning to the boat, you will enjoy a Thai buffet lunch on board while slowly cruising to Lawa Island, where you can enjoy swimming, canoeing, or sunbathing on the sandy beach before returning to Phuket.
strTitle: Phang Nga Bay Full-Day Sea Canoeing Tour from Phuket

strIntroduction:
The Similian Islands cannot be visited by tourists between the 23rd of December and the 30th of December!

Discover one of Thailand’s most beautiful National Marine Parks on a full-day tour of the Similan Islands. Cross the Andaman Sea by speedboat and relax on white sand beaches or snorkel among coral formations and colorful fish.

Explore one of Thailand’s National Marine Parks on this 10-hour trip to the Similian Islands, located at the junction between the Andaman Sea and the Indian Ocean.

The islands were created from volcanic activity some 65 million years ago. Smoothed down by glacial ice, they now stand as granite-based islands, covered in rich foliage and home to superb corals.

Head approximately 54 miles (90 kilometers) northwest of Phuket to reach the islands by speedboat. Similan has gained great fame as a prime diving location and is consistently rated as one of the top international dive sites in the world.

Discover an abundance of marine life in crystal clear waters, and swim among attractive coral reefs. Marvel at the natural beauty as you try out a variety of activities, including snorkeling. Or simply relax on the white sandy beaches and enjoying a delicious National Park Restaurant lunch.
strTitle: Similan Island Speedboat Tour with Lunch from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Sail to the island of Phi Phi in the Andaman Sea by cruiser or speedboat and laze on white sandy beaches in the tropical sun. Snorkel in the turquoise waters to see an underwater wonderland, or soak up the colors of the limestone Viking Cave.

Set out by cruiser or speedboat from Phuket pier and sail over turquoise waters to the scenic Andaman landscape of Phi Phi Islands (Phi Phi Don and Phi Phi Le), about 27 miles (45 kilometers) from the mainland.

On arrival, you are free to relax on paradise beaches or take sightseeing excursions to Loh Sa Mah, Phi Phi Ley Cove, and Maya Bay where the blockbuster film The Beach (starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Tilda Swinton) was filmed. Lunch will be served at a beach front restaurant in the island.

A chance to observe the majestic underwater world is available for guests who want to snorkel. If you are more the exploring type and Phi Phi’s natural beauty is not enough, there is plenty to do on and off the island.

Phi Phi Ley is home to the Viking Cave, a large limestone cavern where ancient rock paintings can be found. Here, rock paintings are thought to be 3,000 to 4,000 years old, and provide a perfect spot to experience the colors and rhythms of this tropical hideaway.
strTitle: Phi Phi Island Full-Day Tour by Speedboat including Lunch from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Get a true feel for the island of Koh Samui as you check out its unspoiled beauty on a half-day trip. Choose from a private or shared tour and enjoy visits to a coconut plantation, temples, Na Muang Waterfall, and the charming town of Nathon.

Explore the Thai island of Koh Samui on a tropical half-day trip around this island paradise, and see the famous rock formations of Hin Ta and Hin Yai.

Visit a coconut plantation and see monkeys picking coconuts! While visiting try the fresh young coconuts which taste completely different to commercial coconuts available elsewhere in the world. See a demonstration by the locals that shows you how to make coconut milk by hand, and have a go at making the sweet drink yourself!

Next visit the small temple of Wat Kunaram, which contains the mummified relic of a monk who died and still remains in the lotus position. This is followed by a trip to see Na Muang Waterfall.

Finally make your way to Nathon, the old capital of the island. Wander around the shops and on the way back to your hotel, stop and visit the island’s most memorable landmark; Big Buddha, a statue that faces the surrounding bay.
strTitle: Koh Samui Island Half-Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Discover the beauty of Ang Thong National Marine Park on this full-day tour from Koh Samui. Admire the breathtaking scenery as you cruise to Thailand’s second national park, where you can explore natural caves, blue lagoons, and stunning rock formations.

This full-day tour takes you on a discovery of Ang Thong National Marine Park, the second national park created in Thailand consisting of 42 curiously-shaped islands. Departing from Nathong Pier on Koh Samui, you will head north by boat to the archipelago of islands, each consisting of its own individual character.

During this tour you will experience the beautiful sights of Ang Thong National Marine Park. You can explore natural caves, blue lagoons, and stunning rock formations. You will then take a trip to Mae Koh Island, where the inner salt lake is located.

You can enjoy lunch served onboard the boat while you cruise to Wau Ta Lab Island and the National Park headquarters, where you can enjoy sunbathing, swimming, snorkeling, or just simply relaxing on the white sandy beach while taking in the breathtaking views around you.
strTitle: Day Trip to Ang Thong National Marine Park from Koh Samui

strIntroduction:
Travel to Koh Tao and Koh Nang Yuan on a day tour by speedboat. Departing from Koh Samui, you will divide your time between the islands, spending your day swimming, snorkeling, and relaxing. You will also enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on the beach.

Visit 2 of Thailand's top idyllic islands in the vicinity of Koh Samui with a full-day trip. Enjoy riding in a speedboat to see Koh Tao and Koh Nang Yuan, and spending your day relaxing in paradise.

Your first stop is at Muang Bay on Koh Tao, a shallow dive site with lots of colorful fish. Here you can enjoy some snorkeling before enjoying lunch at a restaurant on another beach. Soak up the peacefulness and serenity of your surroundings and cool off in the clear waters.

After lunch, the speedboat takes you to the picturesque island of Koh Nang Yuan, which actually consists of 3 tiny islands connected by 2 strips of the whitest sand possible, allowing an easy passage from one to another. Here, it is possible to climb one of the hills to enjoy a panoramic view of your surroundings.
strTitle: Koh Tao and Koh Nang Yuan Islands Speedboat Day Tour from Koh Samui

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a scenic drive through the most historic areas of Chiang Mai, passing through a gate in the ancient city walls and crossing the moat. See 14th-century Wat Phrathat Doi Suthep and visit a Meo Pui hill tribe village, experiencing the unique culture.

Begin your half-day tour of the Chiang Mai area with a drive through the city’s most historic areas, passing through the gates of the ancient city walls and crossing the moat.

You’ll travel with an English-speaking guide and have the option of joining a group tour or taking a private tour of the area.

As the drive continues you’ll pass the city’s major attractions, the local market, and foreign consulates, before heading to the acclaimed temple, Wat Phrathat Doi Suthep.

The temple houses a holy relic of the Lord Buddha, and is considered by many to be the most sacred temple or wat in northern Thailand. Built by King Gue-Na in 1383, it is situated 3,500 feet above sea level. Reaching the temple requires climbing 300 steps to reach its top level, but at the top you’ll be treated to a panoramic view of the city.

Your final stop on the tour is a visit to the Meo Pui hill tribe village, a community known for its unique culture and its people’s colorful costumes.
strTitle: Chiang Mai Half-Day Tour of Doi Suthep and a Meo Hill Tribe Visit

strIntroduction:
Discover the villages of northern Thailand’s hill tribes on a full-day tour from Chiang Mai to the settlements of the Akha, Palong, and Padaung Karen peoples. Cruise along the Mae Kok River and lunch at a village restaurant in the tropical forest.

Explore the hill tribes north of Chiang Mai on this full-day tour round the mountain villages and tropical forest of northern Thailand.

Your 10-hour excursion starts with a scenic 3.5-hour drive to Thaton, former capital of an ancient Mon kingdom. Stop at a Hmong hill tribe village to learn more about the ethnic group that originated in southern China.

After lunch at a local restaurant, embark on a 30-minute boat trip along the Mae Kok River to Baan Mai. Then drive by minivan to discover hill-tribe villages of the Akha, Palong, and Karen peoples. See the brass rings that the Karen women wear on their necks; the number increasing according to their age.

Back in Thaton, explore the hillside temple of Wat Thaton and enjoy panoramic views of the villages, Mae Kok River, and dense rainforests of the mountain range.
strTitle: Hill Tribe Village Tour and River Cruise including Lunch from Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Discover the famous cottage industries of Sankhampaeng in Chiang Mai and see where a variety of local souvenirs and handicrafts are made. Find hand-carved teak wood products, Thai silk fabrics, lacquer ware and more, all available to buy.

Chiang Mai is the main center for high quality handicrafts in Thailand, with the Sankhampaeng area being the focus for all kinds of products, such as Thai silk items, hand-crafted furniture, and even eggshells decorated with unusual designs.

Watch the various stages of production of Thai silk, and see colorful paper umbrellas as they are made before your eyes. See skilled hands form celadon ceramics, and craftsmen carve teak wood into elegant furniture. Also fascinating to watch is the production of lacquer ware.

Buy unique silverware items direct from the makers, and discover other thriving handicraft industries of cotton, as well as antiques from Myanmar and beyond.
strTitle: Handicrafts and Souvenirs of Sankhampaeng Tour in Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Explore Thailand’s oldest marine park on a tour of Khao Sam Roi Yot National Park, and admire the unique coastal flora and fauna. Discover the diverse wildlife of the freshwater marshes, limestone mountains, and beautiful Phraya Nakhon Cave.

Immerse yourself in the stunning wilderness of Thailand’s Khao Sam Roi Yot National Park, a short 30-mile (50-kilometer) drive from Hua Hin.

Following a pick-up from your hotel, transfer by luxury vehicle to Sam Roi Yot, which literally translates as “300 Peaks.” One of Thailand's largest freshwater marshes, the park is home to a rich diversity of wildlife.

Admire the limestone mountains rising steeply to heights of up to 2,025 feet (605 meters), making this part of the coast especially beautiful. You will pass an abundance of pineapple plantations en route to the park entrance, and once inside discover the beautiful pavilion inside the Phraya Nakhon Cave, built by King Rama V.

After lunch, enjoy some free time to take a leisurely afternoon stroll along one of the white sand beaches. Look out for resident birds and mammals, such as the dusky leaf monkey (langur) and native serow goat antelope, as well as visiting Irrawaddy dolphins.
strTitle: Day Trip to Sam Roi Yot National Park from Hua Hin

strIntroduction:
Visit Chiang Mai’s most important historic temples, its old city walls, gates, and moat, and explore a local market. See the elephantine buttresses at Wat Chiang Man, the northern-style murals at Wat Phrasing and the enormous pagoda at Wat Chedi Luang.

Explore the cultural heritage of Chiang Mai, Thailand’s northern capital, on a half-day guided tour. In addition to visiting some of its most significant temples, you’ll see the old city walls, Thapae Gate, and a local market.

A highlight of this tour is Wat Chiang Man, the city’s oldest temple and famed for its chedi that is supported by rows of elephantine buttresses. Visit Wat Phrasing, home of the beautiful Lai Kham Chapel with its exquisite woodcarving and northern style murals.

You’ll also tour Wat Chedi Luang, and admire its enormous pagoda, which was partially destroyed by an earthquake in 1545. Wat Suan Dok, dating to the 14th century, originally was the site of the pleasure gardens of the Thai monarchy. Today it features several white chedis that contain the ashes of Chiang Mai’s former royal family.
strTitle: Half-Day City Temples Tour of Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a half-day arts and crafts tour through Chiang Mai. Discover the recently restored capital of Wiang Kum Kam, once King Mangrai's capital city. Visit Muang Kung pottery village and see Thailand's largest woodcarving center at Baan Tawai.

Tour Chiang Mai's craft hotspots, and discover the traditional techniques of the region's potters and wood carvers, beginning with an exploration of the restored settlement of Wiang Kum Kam.

Wiang Kum Kam was an early settlement that became King Mangrai's capital in the late 13th century. Flooding forced King Mangrai to move, but its original location remained important until the river changed course and buried the site in mud. Wiang Kum Kam was restored as a historical park during the 1980s, and it's set in a beautiful area surrounded by rice paddies and village houses.

Continue onward to Muang Kung, one of Thailand's most well-known pottery villages, before heading to Baan Tawai which, along with its nearby towns, forms the largest woodcarving center in Thailand.

Dozens of small workshops and factories produce imitation antiques and immense wooden elephants that are sold throughout the country. Bargains are plentiful, and if you spot a sculpture that you'd like to take home with you, larger shops provide packing and shipping services.
strTitle: 4-Hour Arts and Crafts Tour from Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Visit a Buddhist temple at sunrise and offer alms to the monks, on one of the most unique experiences you’re likely to have in Thailand. When visiting Chiang Mai, be sure to experience this early morning ritual that’s an important part of Thai culture.

A long-standing tradition in Thailand is the daily offering of alms to Buddhist monks. You can take part in this ritual on a 2-hour sunrise temple visit in Chiang Mai, which begins with a pick-up at your hotel at 6am.

Each morning before dawn the monks put on their distinctive saffron robes and quietly walk along the streets in their bare feet, carrying alms bowls and receiving boiled rice and condiments from local people along the way. In return, those giving alms receive blessings from the monks.

You can participate in this very special Thai custom by personally presenting alms. First you’ll enjoy a brief visit to the Sri Soda temple, and, religious festivals permitting, see the monks praying in the early morning. This activity makes for a unique addition to your holiday in Thailand.
strTitle: 2-Hour Sunrise Buddhist Temple Visit in Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the exhilarating views from the top of Wat Phrathat Doi Suthep, admire the Buddhist stupas at Wat Suan Dok, and witness the 7 spires of Wat Jed Yod in Chiang Mai. With hotel transfers, entrance fees and a local guide, take this 4-hour tour as private or join a group and explore the Temples of Chiang Mai.

Discover the most sacred temple in the north of Thailand, the Wat Phrathat Doi Suthep, tucked away in the mountains at an elevation of  3,520 feet (1,056 meters).
The temple is reached after climbing up 300 steps to the compound where you can take in the exhilarating view of the city of Chiang Mai, and the surrounding countryside.

You will then drive back down to the city center to visit some of the other impressive temples including Wat Suan Dok.
Dating back to the 14th century, it once served as the pleasure gardens to the Thai monarchy. Nowadays, it houses several white chedis (Buddhist stupas), containing the ashes of Chiang Mai’s former royal family, as well as one of the most famous Monk Schools in the whole of Chiang Mai.
You will also make a final visit to Wat Jed Yod, also known as the Temple of Seven Spires.
strTitle: 4-Hour Doi Suthep and Temples Tour from Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a boat ride along the Ping River with a stop at a Thai farmer's house for refreshments. Check out the local flower market, then visit the temple of Wat Chedi Luang and admire the artwork of the Lai Kham chapel at Wat Phra Singh temple.

Relax and explore Chiang Mai on a 3-hour expedition that takes you on a river cruise, stops off at the flower market, and visits local temples.

Upon leaving your hotel, make your way to the Wat Chai Mongkol boat pier. Here, board a boat where you’ll enjoy the river view from both sides of the Ping River on a relaxing cruise upstream to Chiang Mai town.

Next up is a quick visit to a Thai farmer's house, where fresh fruits and soft drinks will be served in the tropical garden. Then visit the colorful local flower market in Chiang Mai.

Finally, make your way to Wat Chedi Luang, a temple ground that was originally made up of 3 separate temples: Wat Chedi Luang, Wat Ho Tham, and Wat Sukmin. Then visit Wat Phra Sing, home of the beautiful Lai Kham chapel with its exquisite woodcarving and murals.
strTitle: Chiang Mai: Mae Ping River Cruise Flower Market and Temples Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore the beauty and culture of Doi Inthanon National Park on this 8-hour tour from Chiang Mai. Admire the views of Thailand’s highest mountain, explore the twin pagodas, visit the Karen Hill Tribe Village, and see the beautiful Vachiratharn Waterfall.

On this private 8-hour tour from Chiang Mai you will explore the culture and beauty of northern Thailand. This tour starts with a scenic drive through the mountainous countryside to Doi Inthanon National Park, home to a preserved forest and Doi Inthanon, the highest mountain in Thailand standing at 8,514 feet above sea level.

The tour continues with a visit to Phra Mahathat Napha Methanidon and Phra Mahathat Naphaphon Phumisiri, twin pagodas which were built to commemorate the fifth cycle birthdays of King Bhumibol Adulyadej and Queen Sirikit. Both pagodas share similar bases as well as the two-level walking path that surrounds them. The pagodas enshrine Lord Buddha’s ashes and Buddha images, and overlook the magnificent scenery of Doi Inthanon.

The tour continues with a visit to the Karen Hill Tribe Village and the Royal Project, followed by lunch at a local restaurant. Upon descending, you will stop at the beautiful Vachiratharn Waterfall before driving to Baan Tawai (Hang Dong District), a new cottage industries village that produces everything from woodcarving and pottery to classical Thai artworks.
strTitle: Private 8-Hour Tour of Doi Inthanon National Park including Lunch from Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Immerse yourself in the Thai culture with an authentic Kanthoke dinner show in Chiang Mai. During this 3-hour experience you will try out a variety of traditional dishes while being entertained by local dancers and hill tribes dressed in vibrant outfits.

Experience one of the most famous northern foods in Chiang Mai, the Kanthoke dinner, with a 3-hour dinner and show.

During this meal, you will sit on the floor and share a succession of tasty dishes, accompanied with sticky rice. This food is typical fare for Thai people living in the northern parts of the country. As you eat these small bowl dishes, local dancers dressed in traditional clothing will entertain you with the Sword Dance, Candle Dance, Fingernail Dance, and The Rumwong, where you will be invited to participate.

After the dinner, there will be a special hill tribe show featuring the various hill tribes of Northern Thailand. This is an excellent opportunity to see a number of tribes in rotation and to note the differences in appearance and costume.
strTitle: Chiang Mai: Kanthoke Dinner Show Experience

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a half day tour of Bangkok's Ancient Siam Park, one of the world’s largest outdoor museums.
Housing over 100 replicas and scale models of villages, markets and temples, the 200 acre grounds, only an hour from Bangkok, are yours to explore with this 4 hour access pass, including transfers.

As one of the world’s largest outdoor museums, Ancient Siam is a themed park, and is home to a collection of scale models, buildings and sculptures, recreated to represent Thailand's ancient culture and history.

Inside the park you will find small villages, lavish gardens, winding water ways, a small floating market and of course food and drinks. There are push bikes available for rent, a health care center, wedding and filming facilities, as well as comprehensive guides to the park with interesting historical facts.

Covering 200 acres, the grounds of Ancient Siam correspond roughly to the shape of the Kingdom, with each of the monuments lying at their correct places geographically. Some of the buildings are life-size replicas of existing or former sites, while others are scaled down. This vast park also houses several ethnological displays of artifacts and antiques. There are rural arts, ancient tools, hunting equipment and evidence of the long-term survival of a native culture.
strTitle: Half-Day Tour of Ancient Siam Park

strIntroduction:
Discover interesting sights in the Krabi province including the Tiger Cave Temple, Emerald Pool National Park, and a natural hot spring. Admire the breathtaking scenery and explore the natural beauty of the region on this full-day tour from Krabi Town.

This full-day tour takes you on a discovery of Krabi province as you visit the Tiger Cave Temple, relax in a hot spring, trek through the jungle, and visit the Emerald Crystal Lagoon. After the pick-up from your hotel, you will transport overland to visit the most renowned temple of Krabi – Wat Tham Sua (the Tiger Cave Temple). Located in a beautiful valley surrounded by vegetation thousands of years old, it serves also as a popular meditation center in the region.

If you want to admire the spectacular view from above, you can climb up the 600-meter high staircase, including 1,237 steps, leading to a large Buddha image and footprint on top of the cliff. Here the views a breathtaking and you can see a large part of the Krabi province.

After an early lunch at an excellent local restaurant, you will continue on the tour. The region has some great hot springs and one of these is easily accessible – here you can take time to relax and let the sounds of nature be your only companion.

Visiting one of the last remaining lowland forests in Thailand, you will walk along well-prepared trails passing many cascades and jungle pools, and enjoying the rich flora and fauna along the way. After a brisk walk you will reach the Emerald Crystal Lagoon, where you can relax and go for a swim.
strTitle: Full Day City and Jungle Tour from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Experience Thailand’s heritage at the Thai Village, which cultural show will introduce you to many customs of Thai life, traditional ceremonies and martial arts.

On this 5-hour excursion to the outskirts of Bangkok you’ll take in the Thai Village Cultural Show that’s offered daily. This is a wonderful opportunity to see performances of Thai dance, martial arts, and traditional ceremonies. Each day, over 150 performers take to the stage to entertain audiences with a variety of activities from Thai cultural heritage. The 60-minute action-packed show also features demonstrations of Thai marital arts, including Thai boxing and sword fighting.

See a traditional Thai wedding ceremony, and the ceremony of ordination into the Buddhist monkhood. Marvel as traditional performers entertain you with dances from various regions of Thailand, including the rhythmic Bamboo Dance, the graceful Fingernail Dance, the Kala Dance, and the joyful Yoev Dance. You’ll also see elephants at work performing tasks that they normally do in the forests of northern Thailand.
strTitle: Sampran Riverside Tour Rose Garden Thai Village and Cultural Show

strIntroduction:
See one of the world’s largest outdoor museums of over 300 acres, which contains over 100 replicas of Thailand’s famous authentic wooden villages, renowned temples and markets.

Over 100 replicas of Thailand’s famous authentic wooden villages, renowned temples and markets, are housed at the Siam Park. The museum follows Thailand’s geographical outline all the way from the south to the north of Thailand. Locally called “Muang Boran” – Ancient City – the park also houses several ethnological displays of artifacts and antiques. Rural arts, ancient tools, and hunting equipment, are evidence of the long-term survival of a native culture. You will see the most outstanding recreation of Thai architecture, history and way of life. This is a quick way to get to know the whole country's history and architecture.
strTitle: Half-Day Ancient Siam Park Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Enjoy an international buffet dinner, followed by popular theme show extravaganza for all the family.

Phuket’s most famous theme attraction combines a Las Vegas-style show with elements of Disneyland, and magical illusions to make for an unforgettable family experience. Phuket Fantasea is a combination of a festival village with carnival, games, handicrafts, and a modern theater.

The main draw is an awesome stage production based on Thai culture and history that features four dimensional effects, acrobatics, stunts, pyrotechnics and a 30 elephant circus. Before the show, guests will enjoy shopping at the Festival Village, filled with high quality products and locally made souvenirs.

Other features on this outing include cultural parades, craft demonstrations, and elephant rides. Guests will enjoy a sumptuous international buffet at the Golden Manohra restaurant.
strTitle: Phuket Fantasea Including Dinner and Transfers

strIntroduction:
One of Thailand’s, and perhaps one of the world’s, most extensive gardens can be found within a short drive from Pattaya. A perfect 5-hour romantic getaway for those looking to treat a special loved one. Tour this magical garden and throw all your worries away for the day.

Be picked up from your Pattaya hotel in morning or early after noon and head out to enjoy 600 acres of plants, flowers (such as a variety of orchids) and trees all collected and displayed here for a visit. Some species are unique and only found in here in Thailand. In addition, the village has a small open zoo and aviary where guests can see a funny elephant show featuring the magnificent symbols of Siam performing various tricks including bike-riding, playing football and a lot more.

The Nong Nooch Village presents a cultural extravaganza four times a day for approximately an hour, where you can witness the pomp and splendor of Thai tradition and ceremonies, graceful dances from all over the country, sword fighting, Thai kickboxing, and much more. This spectacular show features hundreds of multi-talented performers in a fascinating one hour show. Do not forget your camera.

Be taken back to your accommodations at tour's end.
strTitle: Half-Day Nong Nooch Village from Pattaya

strIntroduction:
Take a drive through the unspoiled scenery which greets you on your way to the Bang Saphan district, where you will board the already waiting speedboat to the tiny island of Koh Talu.

With clear, blue water and scenery that you are the only one on this island, clients are free to make it a very relaxing day out for sun bathing, swimming or snorkeling, being together with gardens of coral and the fish, swimming around you.

We will provide a delicious lunch. The rest of the time is for you to relax on the white sandy beach or swim in the crystal clear water before taking the speed boat back to the main land and comfortably bring you back to your booked accommodation.
strTitle: Full Day Snorkeling at Talu Island from Hua Hin Including Lunch

strIntroduction:
Over 3 day amazing days you will visit Phasuer Waterfall, Lod Cave with incredible stalactites and stalagmites, encounter the Meo, Lisu and Lahu Hilltribe villages and see the exotic ‘Long Neck Karen Tribe’. With 2 nights’ accommodation and meals included, your professional guide will ensure that your visit to the Mae Hong Son Province is one you will never forget.

Mae Hong Son Province lies 157 miles north west of Chiang Mai Province. This remote yet spectacular region of northern Thailand is your home for the next 3 days.

Itinerary:

Day 1: Arrival Mae Hong Son (L)
Arrive to Mae Hong Son airport and join your transfer to your hotel. Settle in with lunch at local restaurant then in the afternoon, enjoy the drive to Phasuer Waterfall. Visit a Meo Hilltribe Village at Na Pa Pag and a Chinese Village at Ban Mae Or, located 1200 meters above sea level. Enjoy a walk around the village and try some home-made Chinese tea. Overnight: Mae Hong Son.

Day 2: Mae Hong Son – Pai – Mae Hong Son (B,L)
Enjoy an early breakfast before visiting a local bustling morning market. Your drive to the Pai District is along a scenic route offering breathtaking views of this northern province. After a delicious lunch at a local restaurant you will fill your afternoon with a visit to the 5,465 ft long Lod Caves with amazing and natural stalactite and stalagmite formations before moving on to witness the remarkable culture of the Lisu & Lahu Hilltribe villages. A stop at the famous Fish Cave will then have you on your way back to Mae Hong Son. Overnight: Mae Hong Son.

Day 3: Departure Mae Hong Son (B,L)
Enjoy breakfast at leisure then take a boat trip along the Pai River home to the exotic ‘Long Neck Karen Tribe’ with their necks elongated by brass rings. A picnic lunch will be served then in the afternoon you visit the famous temples: Wat Phra Dhat Doi Kong Moo and Wat Jong Kham. Relax and settle in for your transfer to Mae Hong Son airport.
strTitle: 3-Day 2-Night Exploring the Mae Hong Son Region

strIntroduction:
