Head to the Kaeng Krachan National Park from Hua Hin and enjoy a full day in the Thai countryside. Experience the unspoiled jungle of the park and marvel at the 11-tiered Pala-U waterfall. Swim in one of the pools beside the falls and enjoy a Thai lunch.

Hidden in a forest in the Kaeng Krachan National Park, the Pala-U waterfall is located just 60 kilometers from your hotel in Hua Hin. On this full-day trip you’ll travel through scenic countryside and pass by pineapple plantations on the drive to the park. After making your way through the forests you'll eventually end up at the 11-tiered Pala-U waterfalls. Here you can enjoy a refreshing swim in the pools beside the falls. The more adventurous can climb up the falls as far as the fourth or fifth stage, while at the highest tier of the waterfall you can feed fish from the shore, even swim with them! A Thai set lunch is included as part of this tour program.
strTitle: Hua Hin: Day Trip to Kaeng Krachan National Park and  Pala-U Waterfall

strIntroduction:
Explore the north east of Thailand over 3 magical days taking in shrines to Buddha and monuments from the Khmer Empire in the Phimai Historical Park. With some meals and 2 nights’ accommodation included, you will experience a connection with this beautiful land like no other.

Itinerary:
Day 1: Bangkok to Khao Yai (L)
Departing Bangkok in the morning your journey for north east will arrive at Saraburi. Here you can visit the Phra Buddha Badh shrine which shelters the prints of the feet of Buddha and the many bells on temples throughout. Proceed to Lopburi, visiting Wat Phra Si Maha, the oldest temple with tallest Prang in Lopburi, before stopping at Phra Prang Sam Yod, a temple with three towers and impressive ornaments. Moving on to Prang Khaek, you will find the oldest monument and Khmer-style Hindu Shrine to be found in Thailand central region.
Lunch will be enjoyed at local restaurant before moving on to the National Park of Khao Yai. Along the way you will discover Wat Theppithak with its gigantic Buddha sitting on the hill and home to the fruits of Klang Dong markets. Your accommodation this evening is The Greenery Resort Khao Yai. Overnight: Khao Yai

Day 2: Khao Yai to Khorat (B,L)
Enjoy breakfast at the hotel before embarking on your drive throughout Khao Yai National Park. Situated on over 1242 miles of mountainous landscape, take in the cascades from Haew Suwat and Klong Kaew and its original suspension bridge made of bamboo. Make various stops en route to capture those picture-perfect opportunities and for lunch, then continue on to Korat, via Si Khiu.
Waiting ahead is Phimai Historical Park which protects one of the most important temples from the Khmer Empire. Facing Angkor, Cambodia, the temple marks the end of the ancient Khmer Highway. Your accommodation this evening is the Sima Thani Hotel or similar. Overnight: Khorat

Day 3: Khorat to Bangkok (B,L)
After breakfast at the hotel you will drive further north east to visit the impressive Khmer temples of Prasat Phnom Rung Historical Park, in the Buriram province. Known for Prasat Hin Pahom Rung, located on the top of the Phanom Rung Mount, it is thought to have been originally built in the 12th century A.D. Now partially restored to its original state, it is neighbored by Prasat Hin Muang Tam, which is believed to have been constructed in the 11th century. Both temples resemble the Angkor ruins of Cambodia.
Lunch will be enjoyed at a local restaurant before your return journey to Bangkok begins. You will arrive at your hotel in Bangkok later in the evening.
strTitle: 3-Day Empire of the Khmer Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Discover the unique culture and natural beauty of Krabi on this 6-hour tour. Walk around the local market and enjoy some shopping in Krabi Town. Admire the scenery while you take a long-tail boat ride past Khao Kanab Nam, the mangrove forest, and Koh Klang. Upgrade your 6-hour tour for a more personalized experience with a private guide.

After pickup from your accommodation, your driver-guide will take you to well-known Krabi landmarks. Start with a stroll around the local market, then head to the pier. Your 6-hour tour continues with a long-tail boat ride, where more impressive sights can be seen, such as the emblematic twin mountains of Khao Kanab Nam, extensive mangrove forests, and Koh Klang — considered one of the more pristine islands off the coast.

Upon your return back to the boat pier, you will stop off at a local night market where you will have sufficient time to shop around. Dinner is included at a local restaurant, before drop-off at your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day Krabi Culture and Mangrove

strIntroduction:
Prepare yourself for an amazing day out on the ocean with this full day ocean canoe adventure. Enjoy a relaxing canoe ride whilst taking in the beautiful landscapes such as beaches, cliffs and lush vegetation.

Explore the stunning natural beauty of southern Thailand's islands with the convenience of your own canoe. Marvel at the bright white beaches surrounded by towering limestone cliffs, the blue of the Andaman Sea and the green of the island’s lush vegetation.

“Room Island,” or Koh Hong, is one of the most beautiful islands in the south. Protected by the Thai government for its wildlife, Koh Hong is full of monkeys, lizards and a variety of birds.

Take a walk on one of the island's nature trails or simply relax in the sun: white sandy beaches await you. Koh Hong is also known for its lagoon, one you only can reach from the water and has the most stunning island scenery one can ever imagine. After this amazing day, you will not want to leave!
strTitle: Full-Day Ocean Canoe Adventure from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Explore the sights in the city of Phuket on this private 4-hour guided tour. Visit the most famous beaches, explore the acclaimed Chalong Temple, go shopping at local gemstone and cashew nut factories, and admire the views at Phromthep Cape. Round-trip hotel transport is included in your personalized sightseeing itinerary.

This orientation around Phuket is designed to give visitors an introduction to the island, starting with pickup from selected hotels. Motor around in your private vehicle while your guide offers personalized commentary on the sights. Learn about why Phuket remains an outstanding destination, famed for its Portuguese architecture, large variety of beaches, and its cultural importance in the southern part of Thailand.

The 4-hour itinerary features a road tour in the morning or afternoon. During your outing from Phuket Town, you'll pass by Phuket’s most famous beaches and head to the best lookout point on the island at Phromthep Cape. Visit Chalong Temple, a favorite for both Thai and foreign visitors. The temple’s highlight is a wax sculpture of the abbot housed in an air-conditioned Thai-style house next to the chapel.

Before concluding with hotel drop-off, your guide stops at a local factories that showcase gemstones and cashew nuts for ample shopping opportunities.
strTitle: Private Tour: Half-Day Phuket City Tour

strIntroduction:
Immerse yourself in the jungle outside Phuket on an adventure that will set your heart racing. Try out Flying Hanuman, a 3-hour experience of flying through the trees on zip lines and encountering the spectacular wilderness of Thailand, first-hand.

Get your fix of adventure and adrenaline on a 3-hour trip from Phuket to the jungle. Flying Hanuman is a thrilling experience that will have you flying from tree to tree via zip lines starting and ending at 28 different platforms spread throughout lush jungle forest.

You will be assigned to a small group of people and each group is accompanied by several experienced zip line guides that will assist you and instruct you all along the way to ensure your absolute safety. You will be tied to safety lines at the platforms at all times, and double safety lines while on the zip lines.

After pick-up from your hotel in Phuket, arrive at the Flying Hanuman welcome center for information and safety instructions. Receive your bandana, helmet, and equipment and then enjoy the activities in the jungle.

Activities include 28 platform, 15 zip-lines, 2 abseil points, 3 spiral staircases, 1 sky rail, and a 20-minute wilderness walk.

When you are done, you will return to the welcome center for a meal of seasonal fruits and to receive your free t-shirt. Then revisit the thrills as you are transported back to your hotel.
strTitle: 3-Hour Zip Line Jungle Adventure from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Experience the amazing Alcazar show! Prepare to be thrilled at this cabaret show as 400 ladymen perform dancing and singing in colorful costumes and bright smiles. This 2-hour show will certainly give you great memories to bring home!

Treat yourself to a fantastic, internationally renowned performance during a 2-hour Alcazar show in Pattaya. The Alcazar is a cabaret with the world’s most famous ladymen.

Shows such as this have been a favorite among locals and visitors alike for more than 20 years! 400 ladymen will leave you in awe with their artistic talents. They will perform various different acts ranging from comedic routines to more dramatic scenes. Either way you will not be able to tear your eyes away!

All this combined with brightly colored costumes, professional lighting effects, and a great set, this 2-hour show is not something you are likely to forget!

This show has wonderfully blended performances, stage design, costumes, and effects so well that it will be a spectacular show for all ages to enjoy. Truly a must-see for both locals and visitors!
strTitle: Alcazar International Cabaret Show in Pattaya

strIntroduction:
Experience the City of Mae Hong Son, located in the North- Western part of Thailand.  You will visit several temples within Mae Hong Son namely the "Wat Chrong Kham" and also the "Doi Kong Mu". Doi Kong Mu is well- known as the "Temple on the Hill". You will not only enjoy the culture but also an amazing scenery of nature and the city itself.

Join this small group tour led by a professional guide during your stay in Thailand. There are two departure options: the morning departure at 8:30am and afternoon tour at 1:30pm. The vehicle will stops at the main hotel's lobby to pick you up.

For the morning tour, you will depart from your hotel in Mae Hong Son to visit the town of the three mists, Mae Hong Son. We start with the morning market, known for its variety of fresh food. One of the oldest temples, Wat Jong Klang, definitely mends a visit it houses the oldest, most revered Buddha in the province, said to have been cast in Myanmar and recovered from the Pai River. It also has complex glass paintings and old ancient wood carving of the Lord Buddha. Both attractions were brought here from Myanmar in 1857.

Next visit, the Wat Phra Thad Doi Kong Mu, is known as “Temple on the hill”. Built 150 years ago, its sits atop a 250 meters high hill offering fine views down over the city, and the surrounding mountains and valleys. Wat Phra Thad Doi Kong Mou, which is situated on the mountains at an altitude of 1500 meters. The view of the fog, surrounding the complex is very impressive, especially in the morning time.

Please note that the afternoon tour does not include the morning market. You will be transferred back to your hotel in Mae Hong Son after the tour.
strTitle: Half Day City and Temples Tour of Mae Hong Son

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a fun night out in the lovely town of Hua Hin aboard an authentic samlor, a three-wheeled bike with a passenger seat. Explore the city, visit the old town, take part in the vibrant night life, and enjoy a traditional Thai seafood dinner.

Enjoy a fun night out in Hua Hin wheeling through the city on a special samlor vehicle, or a 3-wheeled bike with room for passengers. Let your knowledgeable guide take you through the vibrant city, stopping at some of Hua Hin's interesting sights.

Visit the beautiful railway stations, one of the symbols of the town, and visit Hua Hin's lively night markets. Barter and admire the colorful selection of goods, including fun souvenirs and delicious food.

Before the night is over, stop in at one of Hua Hin's famous seafood restaurants for some freshly caught fish. Look out over the beautiful Gulf of Siam and sink your teeth into the freshest fish you've ever tasted before you set off into the night again.
strTitle: Hua Hin Night Tour Including Dinner

strIntroduction:
Explore northern Thailand’s wildlife, hill tribe cultures, and forested parks on a full-day, private tour from Mae Hong Son for your group of up to 15 people. This tour combines nature and culture, and includes a traditional lunch at a local restaurant, entrance fees, and round-trip transport from your hotel in Mae Hong Son in a private vehicle.

Start the day with pickup in Mae Hong Son, then travel to Tham Plaa National Park, where you’ll find hundreds of carp in a scenic, shady river, as well as a small shrine dedicated to protecting the sacred fish. The next stop is a Lahu Na (or Black Lahu) hill tribe village, the perfect place to learn about the distinctive customs, costumes, and languages of northern Thailand’s diverse tribal communities.

After the village, continue to Tham Taralod Forest Park: ancient artifacts and prehistoric remains have been found in this protected area, and you’ll take a guided tour of a cave filled with colorful stalactites and stalagmites. Pause for lunch at a local restaurant, then spend the afternoon at a pair of villages that are home to White Karen and Lisu people, each with their own languages and traditions.

Throughout the tour, take advantage of your day with a private guide to ask questions about local culture, meet members of Thailand’s hill tribes, and gain insight into the rural area that surrounds Mae Hong Son. This tour concludes with drop-off at your hotel.
strTitle: Full Day Fish Cave and Hill Tribe Villages of Mae Hong Son

strIntroduction:
Chiang Rai Province in northern Thailand, is home to the small delightful city of Chiang Rai. This half day tour, with return hotel transfers, will show you the most historic temples and monuments, in and around the city, including the ornate and modern Wat Rong Khun temple.

Your half-day tour begins with a pick up from your hotel in Chiang Rai and a visit to Wat Phra Kaew, said to have been the original home of the famous Emerald Buddha.
From here, continue to the peaceful Wat Phra Singha, a beautiful example of Lanna Thai religious architecture.

Then make a stop at Oub Kham Museum and Lanna Heritage Conservation Centre. You will view an incredible collection of artifacts from the Lanna kingdom, including ritual objects and royal treasures. Time permitting, you may take a tour of the remarkable Wat Rong Khun.

Wat Rong Khun (also known as the White Temple) is an impressive modern temple. Its construction began in 1998, and its expected to take several generations. Marvel at this amazing and ornate white temple, originally conceived by renowned artist Chalermchai Kositpipat.

After Wat Rong Khun, head back into the city to visit Chiang Rai's busiest market before being delivered back to your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day Temples and City Tour of Chiang Rai

strIntroduction:
The village of Ya Pha, home to the fascinating Long Neck Karen Hill Tribe women, and learn of the significance of the heavy brass rings worn around their neck. Enjoy a motor boat journey to the Lisu Hill Tribe, some natural hot springs and a delicious lunch, on this full day excursion from Chiang Mai.

You will be collected from your Chiang Mai hotel and head out to the small village of Ya Pha, home of the fascinating Long Neck Karen Hill Tribe.
Here you will learn of the significance of the brass rings worn around their necks. The number of rings increases according to age and as their shoulder blades are gently pressed lower and lower, over time, their necks appear to lengthen.

From here you will make a stop at for lunch before casting off in a motor boat to visit the Lahu Hill Tribe village at Bann Pha Yai. Remarkably, this is the only village in this region of Northern Thailand with Lahu descendants.

Natural hot springs have been discovered in several areas in Thailand, and you will enjoy your visit to these natural phenomenons. After wards, you will make the journey back to Chiang Mai and arrive at your hotel approximately 6pm.
strTitle: Private: Full-Day Long Neck Village and Lahu Hill Tribes with Boat Trip Tour From Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
See the famous home industries of Sankhampaeng and experience how a souvenirs and handicrafts are being made. The Thai handicraft village displays of lacquer ware; teakwood carving and silverware making.

An opportunity to see the famous home industries of Sankhampaeng, where a variety of souvenirs and handicraft are being made. Chiang Mai is the main center for high quality handicrafts. In the area of Sankhampaeng, handicrafts are produced and visitors are always welcome to watch the production, and of course to purchase some of the goods.

You can watch the full steps of the production of the famous Thai Silk as well as of the colorful paper umbrellas. Skilled hands form the well-known celadon ceramics; other craftsmen transform teak wood with the help of simple tools into elegant furniture with delicate carvings. Also fascinating to watch is the production of lacquer ware, even eggshells are used to achieve unusual designs.

Silverware is on offer in such a great variety that even the most modest visitor will be tempted to buy some There are numerous other thriving industries with the community including cotton and traditional local products, antiques from Myanmar and more.
strTitle: From Chiang Mai: Home Industries Half Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Within the old walls and throughout the surrounding countryside, the city of Chiang Mai boasts a wealth of beautiful and historic Buddhist Wats (temples). Undoubtedly the most sacred of all, and your first stop on this half day excursion from Chiang Mai, is Phrathat Doi Suthep. This private tour also includes return hotel transfers and entrance fees.

Visit the most sacred temple in the north of Thailand, the Wat Prathat Doi Suthep in Chiang Mai. Tucked away in the mountains at an elevation of 3520 feet (1,056 meters) the wat itself is reached via a strenuous, 306-step staircase flanked by mosaic 7 headed naga (serpents)
To make the journey is intended to display devotion and worthiness to Buddha.

A spectacular example of northern Thai architecture and the exhilarating view of Chiang Mai and surrounding countryside, makes the climb well worth the effort.

Your next stop will take you back down to the city's center to visit some of the other impressive temples. Wat Suan Dok, dating back to the 14th century, once served as the pleasure gardens to the Thai monarchy. Nowadays it houses several white Chedi’s, containing the ashes of Chiang Mai’s former Royal family.

This temple also houses one of the most famous Monk Schools in the whole of Chiang Mai and the Wat Jedyod, also known as The Temple of Seven Spires.
strTitle: Half-Day Doi Suthep and Temples From Chiang Mai

strIntroduction:
Small group sightseeing tours of Wellington. This flexible two hour scenic tour includes stops at Mt Victoria and Old St Pauls. We have the perfect Wellington experience for you however if there is anything you would like to add just ask. We pick you up from your hotel and can drop you off where ever you wish back in the city. If you have limited time this is the best way to see the city.

We start off driving through the restaurant and entertainment district of Courteney Place before heading up to Mt Victoria for famous views over the city and out towards the Pacific Ocean.

Then it’s down Mt Victoria ridgeline and out towards the surfing beach at Lyall Bay before swinging round the wild south coast. We drop into Miramar, home of Wellington’s film industry, before heading back into the city round the bays – most famously Oriental Bay which gets packed with bathers on hot summer days.

Heading up into the western hills we climb for more spectacular views from the slopes of Ahumairangi and then drop down to the Botanic Garden and Wellington’s oldest suburb of Thorndon for a stop at Old St Pauls – a beautiful example of a wooden neo-gothic style church.

Swinging past Parliament and the Beehive we head back into the CBD where we can drop you off at Te Papa museum, the Cable Car, the Information Centre, your hotel or anywhere else you choose in the city center.
strTitle: Wellington City Scenic Tour

strIntroduction:
Maximise your time in New Zealand's capital with this private full-day tour. Enjoy a custom-made itinerary and visit Wellington highlights such as Te Papa Museum, the Botanic Gardens, and Cuba Street; take in the views from Mt Victoria and Te Ahumairangi; or ride the Wellington Cable Car. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

After being picked up from your central Wellington hotel at a time of your choosing, set out to explore the city by private vehicle. Having discussed your personalised itinerary in advance, your private guide will take you and your group of up to 9 people to the spots that interest you most. 

A typical sightseeing route begins with a drive through the entertainment district of Courtenay Place to the Mt Victoria lookout. You will then travel around the south coast of the Miramar Peninsula and have the option of a 1-hour or 15-minute coastal walk.

Continue through the suburb of Miramar, home of New Zealand's film industry, then travel back to town around the Harbour Bays, before climbing to take in the views from Te Ahumairangi. Travel down through the historic suburb of Thorndon with a stop at historic Old St Pauls.

Possible stops throughout the day also include a visit to the Te Papa National Museum and Art Gallery, a 50-minute Weta Workshop tour (must be booked prior to departure), a 2-hour visit to Zealandia Wildlife Sanctuary; a ride on the Wellington Cable Car; or visits to sights such as The National War Memorial Park and Great War Exhibition, Cuba Street,The Botanic Gardens, the Parliament building (free hour long tours available), the Museum of Wellington, Otari Gardens, or the Katherine Mansfield Birthplace Museum.

Your tour ends with drop-off at your hotel at a time of your choosing (typical tour length is 8 hours). 

Please note: All tours, activities, and entrance fees are at your own expense.
strTitle: Wellington City Scenic Private Tour

strIntroduction:
This private, customizable tour is the perfect way to see Wellington while your ship is docked. With the options to decide where you go, where you stop and for how long you spend at each location. You can even decide the duration of the entire tour, you are sure to get the most out of the wonderful city of Wellington. You will have up at 8 hours available for the tour. Port pickup and drop-off available for up to 9 people.

Enjoy a pickup from the port for up to 9 people. From here you can decide where you want to go, or you can take the standard tour.

The standard route begins with a drive through the entertainment district of Courtenay Place to the Mt Victoria lookout. You will then travel round the south coast of Miramar Peninsula and have the option of a 1 hour or short 15 minute coastal walk. The tour continues through the suburb of Miramar, home of the New Zealand film industry. You will then travel back into town around the Harbour Bays before climbing to take in the views from Te Ahumairangi. Travel down through the historic suburb of Thorndon with a stop at historic Old St Pauls.

Possible stops throughout the day also include Te Papa, the national museum and art gallery (only a part of it will be visited in the time available), Weta Workshop tour for 50 minutes (not included, advise prior to departure), The National War Memorial Park and Great War Exhibition, Cuba Street, Zealandia wildlife sanctuary (2-hour plus walk), The Botanic Gardens, Parliament (free hour long tours available), 5-minute Cable Car ride, Museum of Wellington, Otari Gardens, and the Katherine Mansfield Birthplace Museum.

Enjoy the freedom of exploring Wellington on your own terms. Don't worry about your ship as you can choose when you return guaranteeing that you will get back to your ship on time.
strTitle: Wellington Shore Excursion: City Scenic Private Tour

strIntroduction:
Spend a day deep sea fishing in the waters off the coast of Perth. Travel aboard a custom-built vessel that offers unsurpassed levels of comfort and safety, carrying the very latest marine technology for finding fish as well as the necessary safety. This trip is suited to novices or a fishing enthusiasts alike-- the crew will share a vast wealth of knowledge and fishing expertise. If you catch something, your crew prepares it so that you can take it with you at the end of the trip.

At 6am, make your way to Hillarys Boat Harbour to be welcomed aboard by the friendly crew. Enjoy a hot breakfast while you listen to a safety briefing, introductions and the plan for the day.

The experienced and dedicated crew know exactly where the fish are biting and have over 4,000 secret fishing spots. The fish they target in the ocean off Perth include Dhufish, Pink Snapper, Baldchin Groper, Queen Snapper, Mulloway, Silver Trevally Breaksea Cod, Red Snapper, Samson Fish and Mahi Mahi Your crew will even gill and gut your catch for you ready to take home.

Your deep sea fishing charter is fully inclusive of all fishing equipment including the very freshest fish bait, a hot breakfast, lunch sandwiches, snacks, water and soft drinks.

You’ll return to Hillarys Boat Harbour at 3pm. The crew will dish out the fish for you to take home after a great day of fishing.
strTitle: Deep Sea Fishing Charter from Perth

strIntroduction:
Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam and the country's second largest city. As the capital of Vietnam for almost a thousand years, Hanoi is considered one of the main cultural centers of Vietnam, where most Vietnamese dynasties have left their imprint. Even though some relics have not survived through wars and time, the city still has many interesting cultural and historic monuments for visitors and residents alike.

Enjoy full day sightseeing around Hanoi city - the capital of Vietnam, to discover culture, beauty, history and local life especially local food.

This morning your tour guide will pick you up from hotel. First stop is to the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, just next door is Ho Chi Minh's house on stilts where he used to live in the past. Lying to one side of the Mausoleum is the One Pillar Pagoda; built by King Ly Thai To in 1049 the structure has become an important symbol for the people of Hanoi.

Next, continue to visit Tran Quoc Pagoda the oldest pagoda in the city. Then keep walking to Quan Thanh Temple, as one of the Four Sacred Temples of the capital.

Keep forward to the Temple Of Literature, constructed in 1070, it is a temple of Confucius in Hanoi, Vietnam's first national university. the stop for lunch at a local restaurant

After lunch, proceed to visit the Ethnology Museum which focuses on the 54 officially recognized ethnic groups in Vietnam. You could choose any museum you like to visit in Hanoi.

This afternoon, you'll be transferred to the old quarters to visit daily life of local people there. It's great place to explore with plenty of photo opportunities all around you. Your guide will then take you back to your hotel, where you're tour will end,
strTitle: Full-Day Hanoi City History Tour

strIntroduction:
The food available in Hanoi’s narrow alleys and tree-lined boulevards is just as much a part of the city as its lakes and old world architecture. In fact, all of these elements combine with the indomitable spirit of the Vietnamese people to produce a lively culinary scene that is both diverse and confronting.

Hanoi Street Food Day Tour starts by walking 2.5 miles (4 kilometer) around old quarter '36 streets' to visit some famous and specialized- food families or stalls/ local restaurants, shops where they run their business every day, certainly you will watch and taste around 6-8 particular dishes. Visit Dong Xuan market to sample some local treats such as Banh Xeo (Crispy pancake) and Banh Goi (Pillow Dumpling). Your guide will explain the routine of Vietnam meal times and indigenous/unusual ingredients eaten. See dried goods and aromatics, the essentials of Vietnamese cuisine. Stroll up ‘food alley’ to see other dishes on offer. You will dip your fingers and wash your senses in the extraordinary Vietnam cuisine and experience Vietnam tradition through food.

This street food tour will give you an unique experience to try the foods of the local Hanoi people, we ensure the food is handled hygienically and provide a comfortable venue for the tastings. The benefit also goes back to the vendors or restaurants/ families as we buy directly from them. Enjoy the special egg coffee at one of the traditional family run coffee shop at the end of the tour.

Notes: This tour can be taken in the morning or afternoon. The tour may be subject to change due to weather conditions etc. The tour will be mostly conducted on foot so be sure that you are wearing comfortable walking shoes.
strTitle: Private Street Food Tour Adventure in Hanoi

strIntroduction:
A journey to Duong Lam village is a trip to trace back the origin of Vietnam’s culture and Vietnam’s traditions. This is also the great chance explore architecture of ancient houses while wander along its narrow alleyways, visit temples dedicated to the two kings born there, and most interesting of all, chat with locals living in the ancient houses.

Pick up at 9am and travel west of Hanoi to Duong Lam Village, a purely agricultural village of the Northern Red River delta where still preserve many hundred-year-old houses. Upon arrival, visit Ngo Quyen temple and Phung Hung temple, places dedicated to two national heroes Ngo Quyen and Phung Hung.

Bike to visit Mia Pagoda (other hamlet in Duong Lam Village), is built in 15th century and admire 287 statues of all sizes, along with are famous sculpture such as the statue of Buddha in the Himalayas and the statues of the Eight Viagra Deities. Continue riding around the village to discover the daily life and farming working of Vietnamese peasants along the terrace with a stop to visit ancient house back to 200 years ago.

Enjoy your special lunch with Vietnamese foods in an ancient house. Walk along tiny ancient alleys to visit Mong Phu communal house in Mong Phu hamlet and walk on foot to see local people living in the ancient village. Drive back to Hanoi where your tour ends.
strTitle: Duong Lam Ancient Village and Biking Tour from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
This trip provides us to explore the magnificent Halong Bay Day Tour Cruise within only one day trip from Hanoi. Here you can relax on the tanning deck and enjoy a 4-hour cruise in the bay and visit one of the most beautiful caves. The trip allows us to safe our time and still visits the most stunning area of Halong Bay.

At 08:00 AM, we will be met by your private tour guide at the lobby of hotel, then we all transfer to Halong Bay Cruise, Quang Ninh province. Driving along the Red River Delta with outskirt of Hanoi; Bac Ninh province, the home-land of “Quan Ho folk song” which is one of the World Culture Heritage of Vietnam, Hai Duong province where we will have a short stop for relax at around 10:00 or 10:30. Keeping on driving to Quang Ninh province we can see the land of coal, the land of sea…
We arrive at Bai Chay wharf at midday, welcome by crew team and we start enjoying 4 hour boat cruise trip. A delicious seafood lunch will be served when we completely relax on boat. We are both having seafood and seeing the wonderful sightseeing outside. Our lunch time ends is the time we walk into the Thien Cung cave (Heaven Palace cave) to see thousands of stalactites and stalagmites colored by hundreds of neon lights.

After 1 hour stay in the “Heaven Palace”, we are back to the boat for cruising along the World Nature Heritage part to see the Dog islet, Incense Bowl islet, Cock fighting islets Sail islet, Duck island, Turtle island….
At 04:00 PM, we finish our boat trip and back to our vehicle for transferring to Hanoi. At around 7 PM we will be back to Hanoi. Trip ends.
strTitle: Halong Day Cruise from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a spectacular small-group day tour discovering the Ninh Binh province and Red River Delta of Vietnam. This trip will surely bring you an unforgettable travel experience.

Depart your hotel this morning at 8.30am for the 2.5 hour drive through rural northern Vietnam to the site of Vietnam’s first capital, Hoa Lu. Visit the temples dedicated to Emperor Dinh Tien Hoang of the Dinh Dynasty (968-80), and Emperor Le Dai Hanh of the Le Dynasty (980-1009). The ancient Hoa Lu Citadel,most of which has since been destroyed, once covered an area of almost 2 square miles (3 square km).

In the late morning, head to Tam Coc for a Vietnamese lunch. Along the way, you will stop to take photographs of local villages and the stunning landscape.

After lunch board your private sampan. As the boat gently slices through the water, notice the enormous limestone karsts jutting out from the green rice fields giving rise to other name, 'Halong on Land'.

Should you feel adventurous, climb up to Bich Dong Pagoda on nearby Ngu Nhac Mountain, dating to 1428 and comprising three structures: Ha, Trung, and Thuong Pagodas, in ascending order before returning to Hanoi and your hotel in the late afternoon.
strTitle: Hoa Lu and Tam Coc Day Tour

strIntroduction:
Hanoi is the capital of Vietnam and the country’s second largest city. As the capital of Vietnam for almost a thousand years, Hanoi is considered one of the main cultural centers of Vietnam, where most Vietnamese dynasties have left their imprint. Unlock Vietnam’s rich history in its capital and cultural center. Discover a few of Hanoi’s most popular sights during this half-day highlights tour with a Hanoi local tour guide.

Get picked up at your hotel to visit Ho Chi Minh Complex, which reflects the historic figure and father of modern Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh (no entry Mondays or Fridays). After that, we go on to a wooden stilt house which was his temporary residence from 1954 till his deat, followed by a visit to One Pillar Pagoda, founded by King Ly Thai To in 1049. It has become an important symbol for the people of Hanoi.

Your next stop will be the Temple of Literature, which was built in honor of Confucius and is also Vietnam’s first university. This large temple and its meditative grounds functioned as a university for nearly a millennium and the names of its laureates remain carved into the tops of countless stone turtles.

Continue to West Lake and one of the oldest Buddhist pagodas in Hanoi, Tran Quoc which dates from the Ly Dynasty then walk to visit Quan Thanh temple.

Finish the tour with your guide by walking the busy old quarters of Hanoi to see and learn how locals make a living before being returned to your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day Hanoi Private City Tour

strIntroduction:
The Hoa Binh Hill tribes are located in the Northwest of Vietnam, 75km from Hanoi. Hoa Binh Province is home to six minority groups, including the Hmong, Muong, Dao and Thai. The area changed drastically after the largest hydro power plant in Southeast Asia was built, turning the Da River into a lake. Still, today the province boasts some of Vietnam most beautiful scenery and typical Muong culture. This tour to visit the Muong minority group will give you the opportunity to explore, learn, and truly experience rural life in Vietnam.


Depart from Hanoi at 8:30 AM for a picturesque, 2-hour drive to Hoa Binh Province (70 km West of Hanoi). Over the course of this tour, you will have the opportunity to experience day-to-day local village life hands-on. You will interact with local hill tribe people to gain a perspective on Vietnamese culture, society, and governmental structures. You will have an opportunity to learn about rice cultivation, tending livestock, and making shrimp baskets that all local livelihoods practiced throughout generations.
strTitle: Mountain Day Trip to Experience Muong Culture from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Have a fun-filled day learning about Vietnamese culture through cooking traditional cuisine and visiting the locals! This day tour will take you away from the bustling city of Hanoi, into the quaint Van Giang Village to meet your host family for the day and visit a local farmers market. Once you leave Hanoi over the Red River by vehicle, almost immediately the scenery changes to rural villages, age old pagodas and fields of rice. Follow a windy road for 40 minutes until reaching Van Giang District set on the edge of the plains of the Red River Delta.

Arrive at Van Giang Village’s morning market where the sounds and sights of the city seem far way from the rural life. Vegetable
sellers are seen trading their fresh produce, plucked from the fields that morning, as well as fish traders with their live catch. You well also observe, frogs and the endless stalls of cuisine: rice noodle soup, grilled meats served on a bed of fresh herbs as well as
sweet cakes and sticky rice puddings.

From the market, drive to a temple along the river banks that worships Saint Chu Dong Tu and his wife Princess Tien Dung. Princess Tien Dung has actually been honored as one of four immortal Vietnamese spirits. The temple is set on large peaceful grounds consisting of several large gates; pass through the yard into the main altar house where incense can be seen burning as it has for hundreds of years. The temple also houses rare wood engravings on its roof as well as two bach tho vases. Both vases have ancient non characters that were the ancient script of Vietnam before it became romanized engraved, in various styles on them.

You will then leave the temple and drive back to the village to take a stroll through Van Giang to the 200-year old home of Mr An, who at 65-years old, has one of the most impressive Bonsai collections in the district. His home which has been passed down through the generations is typical of rich landowners of that time. Large wooden beams and an open plan abode conform to Vietnam’s fung shei beliefs whilst the garden is filled with fruit trees and bonsai; some which are as old as the house. Upon arrival, enjoy a cup of green tea and get acquainted with the hosts to hear the villages’ history.

The family will then give a demonstration on how to prepare spring rolls, fish sauce, and cutting “chung” cake by special way from the
Northern regions of Vietnam. At the end of the tour, sit down to a traditional Vietnamese family style lunch. After the meal, return to
Hanoi.
strTitle: Van Giang Village Private Tour with Cooking Class from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a private arrival transfer from the Nadi International Airport to the Intercontinental, Natadola Bay. This is a private transfer for up to 15 people in an Alphard Hybrid car or Toyota HiAce van depending on the amount of people traveling. This transfer is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. You will travel in spacious modern vehicles, all with air conditioning as well as baby seats if required. Your transfer also includes stops at a supermarket and bottle shop before you get to your accommodation. 
Enjoy being meet at Nadi Airport by your own personal driver who will be waiting in the arrivals area holding a sign with your name on it. You and your party will each be greeted with a shell Lei necklace and escorted to your comfortable vehicle.

Your driver has been selected from a small, honest, reliable, hand-picked group of locals who will greet you with a big "Bula" smile and is looking forward to transporting you to your hotel or resort. 

This transfer is private for yourself and your party of up to 15 people only. Your driver will be happy to include a free stop at an ATM, supermarket, bottle shop or other stores along the way. Your driver will tell you the best supermarket which has a great bakery, excellent selection of goods plus a good stock of beer and wine. Ask your driver to make a stop at one of the butchery’s which has the best meat selection available.

Your transfer will be in a modern Alphard Hybrid car or Toyota HiAce van. All vehicles are fully air-conditioned and there are no additional charges for luggage.  

Upon confirmation you will be provided with a local phone number in case you need to contact your transfer provider at any time. If your flight is delayed, no need to worry, your driver will wait for you at no extra cost. You also have flexibility to change the date of your transfer, just let the provider know as soon as possible. All vehicles have the proper registrations and full insurances plus all drivers have been on a defensive driving course.
strTitle: Private Transfer: Nadi Airport to Intercontinental Resort and Spa

Your driver has been selected from a small, honest, reliable, hand-picked group of locals who will greet you with a big "Bula" smile and is looking forward to transporting you to the Nadi International Airport. 

This transfer is private for yourself and your party of up to 15 people. The standard vehicle is a spacious Alphard Hybrid (great for the environment) and for bigger groups modern Toyota HiAce Vans are available. All vehicles are fully air-conditioned. You can choose which type of vehicle will suit your family or group when you book and there are no additional charges for luggage.  

Upon confirmation you will be provided with a local phone number in case you need to contact your transfer provider at any time. You also have the flexibility to change the date of your transfer at no extra cost, just let the provider know as soon as possible. All vehicles have licensed registration and full insurance, all drivers have also completed a defensive driving course.
strTitle: Private Transfer: Suva to Nadi Airport

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a 6-hour shore excursion from your cruise ship's arrival into the Port of Lautoka on this private sightseeing tour. Your local guide will take you anywhere you wish to go upon arrival at the Lautoka Wharf, you just need to pay the entrance fees locally.

Choose from a wide variety of popular sightseeing options like the Mud Pools, Garden of the Sleeping Giant, the local markets, temple, waterfall walk and much more.

This 6-hour privately guided shore excursion from Lautoka is completely up to you. Choose where you wish to go and what to see from the attractions and activities on offer. It's super flexible and designed for those on a cruise ship docking at Lautoka Wharf.

Your guide will be waiting for you inside the Lautoka Wharf holding a sign with your name on it. You will then be escorted to your modern vehicle with air-conditioning that you will travel in for the day.

Your private/driver guide will be able to help you plan your itinerary for the day after discussing with you where you would like to go and what you would like to see. Your driver will advise the best way to plan your day.

On the day just pick what you want to do and your guide will take you there depending on the time allowed. All entry fees will be at your own cost. Your guide can stop at an ATM machine if needed.

Activities and experiences you might like to do on your tour may include the Lautoka Fresh fruit and vegetable market (Closed on Sundays), a walk around the Presidential Village of Viseisei (Closed on Sundays). Visit the Garden of Sleeping Giant which is a beautiful orchid garden (Open Monday - Saturday and Sunday (9am - 12pm). Take a dip at the Sabeto therapeutic Mud Pools & Hot Springs. Visit the Zip Line and enjoy unlimited zipping over forest and streams. Do the Waterfall Walk and enjoy a much deserved swim. Stop in and see the kids at a local orphanage, go to Church on a Sunday, visit a local school, do some shopping in Nadi Town. Visit the largest Hindu Temple in the southern hemisphere. Visit the historic Momi gun emplacement or go horse riding at Aviva Farms.
strTitle: Private Shore Excursion: 6-hour Sightseeing Tour from Lautoka Wharf

strIntroduction:
This is a 6-hour private shore excursion from your cruise ships arrival into the Port of Suva. Have your own private guide and vehicle to take you wherever you wish to go. You just pay the entry fees yourself. You will be picked up from inside the Suva Wharf. Choose from a wide variety of exciting sightseeing options like a guided tour to see the President’s Residence, visit the lovely botanical gardens, and the majestic Grand Pacific Hotel. Enjoy local food prepared using a traditional Fijian method known as Love. Enjoy an amazing demonstration of Fijian entertainment with fire and knife dancing.

This 6-hour privately guided tour is completely up to you on where to travel. You choose where to go and what to see. It's super flexible and designed for those on a cruise ship docking at Suva Wharf, pick up from the wharf will be at 9am (dependent on your cruise ships docking time). The idea is to look through all the options below and have a think about what you would like to see. On the day you'll discuss your preferences directly with your guide and they will then advise you on the best way to do the tour. Please be aware if your tour is on a Sunday as some options are not available.

Your guide will be waiting for you inside the Suva Wharf holding a sign with your name on it. This tour is always available, no need to check availability, we have plenty of vehicles and lots of excellent guides on hand. All our vehicles are modern and air-conditioned.

Here's a list of all the things to see and do for your tour that starts from Suva. On the day just pick what you want to do and your guide will take you there depending on the time allowed. All entry fees will be at your own cost. Your guide can stop at an ATM machine if needed.

This guided tour will take you to see the President's Residence and nearby Albert Park (where Kingsford Smith landed his small aircraft on his epic flight from USA to Australia in 1928). Visit the lovely botanical gardens. See the majestic Grand Pacific Hotel. A special visit to Colo-i-Suva Village where you'll be greeted by Filial warriors dressed in traditional costume. You'll see an amazing demonstration of Fijian entertainment with fire and knife dancing. Enjoy a traditional kava ceremony with the village chief. Lunch is a taste of lovo which is food cooked under an earth oven. Visit the waterfall and take a swim depending on the weather. Scenic drive along Princess Rd towards Nausori town. Back to Suva city for shopping at Tappoo’s or Jacks for souvenirs.
strTitle: Private Shore Excursion: Suva City Sightseeing Tour

strIntroduction:
Join this exciting private guided sightseeing tour of the Coral Coast with a local Fijian guide. See Iguana's at Kula Eco Park, visit Lawai Pottery village, drink fresh coconut juice at the local markets, walk the Sigatoka Sand Dunes, enjoy lunch at Natadola Golf Club restaurant then relax at stunning Natadola Beach!

This is your very own private guided tour with just you and your group along with an expert local Fijian guide. Your tour will be in a modern air conditioned vehicle and includes sightseeing and lunch.

Your day will begin with a pickup from your hotel at approximately 9am (can be flexible if required) from your hotel, cruise ship, or airport.

Enjoy the beautiful scenic drive in the Coral Coast as you make your way towards the first stop. Treat yourself to a refreshing coconut drink at the local fresh fruit and vegetable market. Not open on a Sunday.

Experience Fiji's sacred crested Iguana at Kula Eco Park, get up close and personal with snakes as well! Continue on and learn traditional pottery making skills at Lawai Pottery Village.

Walk the Sigatoka Sand Dunes and enjoy the stunning views - only suitable in the cooler months as it gets really hot out there. Visit Natadola Championship Golf Course which was designed by former Fijian world champion.

Included is lunch at Vatu Lo Restaurant, view the menu at the golf club. Enjoy the beautiful sea views and breezes as you feast.

Next stop is the stunning Natadola Beach walk barefoot on the soft white sands and enjoy the delightfully warm waters, go swimming or just relax. Snorkel gear is available for hire at the beach. There's always time for an optional beach massage by one of the local Fijian ladies who have setup shop right on the beach.
strTitle: Full-Day Coral Coast Private Guided Tour

strIntroduction:
On this full-day tour you will discover the offshore islands of Krabi with beautiful white sandy beaches and crystal-clear water. They are often referred to as the 4 Islands of the Andaman Sea - Koh Poda, Chicken Island, Tup Islets, and Phranang Cave Beach at the Railay Peninsula are the closest ones and are easily reached by longtail or speed boat on this popular one-day tour just off the coast from Ao Nang.

This Tour takes you to these unique limestone islands by a traditional long tail boat or convenient speedboat. Swimming, snorkeling, sunbathing, exploring, and photography are the main activities to enjoy. Expect plenty of sun, a rich variety of corals and fish, crystal-clear water, and white powdery beaches lined with coconut palms.

You will have a picnic lunch (rice box provided) on an island beach, and there will also be a couple of open water snorkeling stops, though do not expect to see much in the way of marine life. This trip is more about the beaches, with lots of white sand and great photo opportunities.

We will stop at Chicken Island, which got its name from a bizarre rock formation which resembles the head of a chicken. One end of the island consists of steep cliffs, while the other end has beautiful beaches along a peninsula. This peninsula gets flooded at high tide, creating a small island. At low tide you can walk between the Tup Islets and Chicken Island.

Itinerary will vary according to the tides, so that you arrive at the sandbank as close to low tide as possible.
strTitle: 4 Islands Tour to Spectacular Divided Sea by Longtail or Speed Boat from Krabi

strIntroduction:
This 8-hour tour takes you to the four Islands of Koh Lanta on board the big tour boat 'Hello Andaman' with two convenient decks and plenty of space. You will stop at Koh Kradan, Koh Chuek and Koh Ngai for snorkeling, and take a swim into the Emerald Cave or 'Tham Morakot' on Koh Mook, which is the highlight of this one-day tour. Choose the kayak option and marvel at the wonders along the coastline of the islands. Your tour includes round-trip transportation.

You will be picked-up from your hotel on Koh Lanta and transported to the pier near Lanta Old Town. You will board the comfortable tour boat 'Hello Andaman' with two decks and a lot of space. Enjoy hot coffee or tea with bread and jam while cruising smoothly to the Southern Islands of Koh Lanta.

Your first stop will be at Koh Chuak, which offers excellent snorkeling on the reef with colorful fish. The island is inhabited by sea eagles that are trying to catch fish around the rocky outcrops.

Continue to the highlight of the tour on Koh Mook, famous for its beautiful Tham Morakot (cave) which can be seen only when the tide is low. The entrance to the Emerald Cave is just high enough to swim through at the right tide. The sun colors the water in a palette of green, emerald and turquoise shades at the entrance, gradually fading as the cave winds inwards approximately 260-feet (80-meters) leading to an interior secret beach with clean white sand, enclosed by high cliffs open to the sky.

On the way to the next island, you will enjoy a Thai buffet lunch on board, with different menus to choose from, followed by fresh seasonal fruits. After arriving at Koh Kradan, you will have time to swim in crystal clear blue water and snorkel on a beautiful coral reef on the north side of the island which is easily visible from the surface. Famous mass underwater weddings are held here every year around Valentine's day. Remember that the boat will anchor east of the island, but there is no possibility to go ashore.

The last stop will be on Koh Ngai (or Koh Hai), a tiny mountainous island covered by moist evergreen forest. The completely unspoiled coastline is fringed by rocky headlands, beautiful white sand beaches and coconut palms. You will find it is the perfect place for walking and relaxing on the beach. When it's time to go back, you won't want to leave this perfect place. Enjoy an afternoon coffee or tea with biscuit on the way back to the pier. From there, the driver will take you back to your hotel.
strTitle: 4 Island Tour to Emerald Cave at Koh Mook by Big Boat from Koh Lanta

strIntroduction:
Your full-day tour is all about exploring Phang Nga Bay by speedboat from Phuket, which is home to over 100 islands and features the sheer limestone karsts that jut vertically out of the emerald-green water. Cruise to Hong Island where you can enter the Hong Lagoon by kayak. Continue to James Bond Island and discover the spectacular cliffs and caves at Phanak Island with your guide. Have lunch at the charming Panyee Island on stilts, and swim at Lawa or Na Ka Island depending on the tides.

Get picked up from your hotel in Phuket Town, Patong, Karon or Kata Beach by shared minivan. Start your full-day trip with a coffee or tea at Phuket Island Hopper Pier on Koh Siray and depart by speedboat to Phang Nga Bay. Phang Nga Bay is filled with more than 100 islands and rocky, limestone outcrops jutting high out of the emerald green sea.

First stop will be at Koh Hong, which is an uninhabited island, except for the birds, white-faced gibbons and giant monitor lizards that can often be spotted on the main white sand beach. Its interior is home to a large lagoon to which its Thai name 'Hong' refers. This is best accessed at low tide by kayak, as the diminishing water level makes its color change drastically from a deep emerald green to a clear turquoise.

Cruise further to James Bond Island, the highlight of your tour. With its signature rocky pinnacle, it has been a major attraction ever since it was featured in the 1974 Bond movie 'The Man with the Golden Gun.' Luckily it is under National Park protection and as a result no boats are allowed to go too close to the island. The best way to view James Bond Island is from the small beach on Khao Phing Kan.

Khao Phing Kan is a very high leaning rock that has some small caves inside. It’s pretty amazing and fun to check them all out. On its crowded eastern beach, there are stalls and stands selling knick-knack souvenirs, mostly made from shells and woods.

Visit Diamond Cave and the mangrove forest at Panak Island with your guide and explore the mysterious hearts of the island.

The tour includes a Thai style lunch at the charming Panyee Island, a nearby Muslim fishing village on stilts. You will have the opportunity to see daily life of a community unchanged over time.

Finish your day on a secluded beach at Lawa Island or Naka Island (depending on the tides). You will have time to relax on the beach and top off your tan or go swimming. You will then be returned to your hotel to share the photos of your unforgettable trip with your loved ones.
strTitle: Phang Nga Bay Deluxe Tour to James Bond and Hong Island from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Boossabakorn Spa in Ao Nang offers body wraps, facials and scrubs which can be combined with traditional Thai, oil or foot massages. Choose your genuine indulging therapy from one of the pampering spa packages and spend an intimate moment with yourself and for yourself.

Boossabakorn Spa is a full service day spa conveniently located in Ao Nang. The spa provides a welcome escape from the 21st century affliction of stress and information overload. Expect an extensive range of therapies based on ancient Thai healing traditions in a uniquely designed area with traditional carvings that will accentuate the sophisticated decorating and décor.

Experience soothing massages, energizing body wraps, revitalizing facials and scrubs with natural ingredients, such as tamarind, coconut and various herbs. Cleanse and rejuvenate the physical body in a herbal steam sauna, or calm nerves and redirect energy with a herbal body pack. Your skin will certainly be shiny and soft.

A traditional Thai massage session will make you feel both relaxed and energised through its unique combination of full body stretching and reflexology. Regular practice improves your whole posture and flexibility. The internal organs and blood and lymph circulation are also stimulated, which results in smoother functioning and better elimination of toxins from the body. Blocked areas of tension should open out and your body and mind should feel more balanced and refreshed.

The highly qualified therapists combine traditional essential oil along with their well trained techniques to fit your spirit and your necessity. No matter if you feel stressed or tired or even you just would like to be spoiled for supreme satisfaction and pleasure. The complete variety of treatment should have something suitable for your own personal fulfillment and requirement.

Relax, unwind and indulge as we pamper you from head to toe with one of the pampering Spa packages. The spa is daily opened from 10am to 10pm.
strTitle: Boossabakorn Deluxe Spa and Thai Massage Packages in Ao Nang

strIntroduction:
Discover one of the Andaman Sea's most beautiful islands on this 7-hour guided tour of Hong Island from Krabi. Enter the secret Hong Lagoon in a longtail boat and snorkel in the clear waters. Dry off on the white sandy beaches and bathe in the warmth of the sun. Kayak on the calm waters around Hong Island and find it’s secret lagoon.

After being picked up from your hotel in the morning, sail by longtail boat from Krabi to one of Thailand’s most stunning islands. This tour will take you to the main islands in the Hong group. On the way, stop at the rock island of Koh Daeng. Jump into the island's beautiful waters at and snorkel along the rocky ledges or take a walk through the mangrove forest. In the middle of the island lies the secret Hong Lagoon where you can be in harmony with nature. Kayak into this superb lagoon surrounded by huge limestone karsts and clear tranquil waters.

Enjoy a delicious lunch and refreshments on a tropical beach, giving you plenty of time to take in the beauty of the islands.

On this tour you will have the freedom to explore this beautiful island at your own pace. Paddle in the open sea by kayak (if kayak option is chosen), swim in the Hong Lagoon, snorkel, and relax on the beach. No matter what you choose, Hong Island is a place you won't easily forget.

Be taken back to your accommodations in Krabi at the end of the day.
strTitle: Hong Island Tour by Longtail Boat with Snorkeling and Optional Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Come aboard the convenient tour boat with 3 decks and plenty of space, and discover the beauty of the Angthong National Marine Park on a full-day tour from Koh Samui. Get a light breakfast while watching the majestic marine scenery slip by. Kayak along an amazing coastline and hike to the top of Mae Koh Island with a view to the emerald-green saltwater lagoon. Enjoy a genuine Thai lunch served aboard the tour boat and do some sightseeing before relaxing at Wua Talap Island - a sensational white-sand beach which is the ideal spot for swimming and snorkeling.

Start the trip with a pickup from your hotel on Koh Samui by air-conditioned minibus. Depart from Nathon Pier by fully equipped tour boat with 3 decks including a light breakfast while crossing the Gulf of Thailand with Angthong Archipelago as the final destination.

Arrive at Angthong National Marine Park and start kayaking under huge limestone cliffs through crystal blue waters along the coastline. Reach Mae Koh Island by kayak or set over by longtail boat if you have chosen the sightseeing option. Climb the steps to the top of the island in approx. 10 minutes and enjoy a fantastic view over the Emerald Lagoon which is also known as 'Talay Nai'. The salt water lake is surrounded by sheer cliffs and is definitely the highlight of this tour.

After this great adventure you will be ready to feast on a Thai buffet on board the tour boat, followed by fresh seasonal fruits.

Enjoy more kayaking at Wua Talap Island or hike along a 1640ft (500m) natural trail which leads to a view point with an impressive panoramic view over the picturesque setting of Angthong Marine Park. Please note that there is a little climbing passage along fixed ropes at the end of the trail. Another highlight is a short hike to the Lotus Cave, known as 'Bua Boke', with beautiful stalactite and stalagmite mineral formations. For people who are physically less active, there are a plenty of other activities available. Swim, snorkel or just relax on a beautiful beach with soul-warming sun, crystal-clear waters and powder-soft white sand. If you like to stay overnight on the island, we will drop you off at the park ranger head quarter and pick you up from there again the next day. There are bungalows and camping sites available.

The hours passed quickly without noticing, and it's already time to leave this wonderful place. On the way back to Koh Samui you can enjoy a cup of coffee or tea while admiring the last views of the astonishing islands. Arrive back at Nathon Pier and get transferred to your hotel where can look back on your day in the enchanting still of the evening.
strTitle: Samui Island Tour to Angthong Marine Park by Big Boat with Kayaking

strIntroduction:
From one platform to another and from tree to tree, adventurers balance themselves through an assortment of zip lines, tightropes, ladders, “flying” broomsticks, bicycles and even skateboards. Two courses ranging from a relatively easy section suitable for children as young as 6 up (and over 47", 120cm in height) to far more demanding sections suitable for thrill-seeking individuals of all ages.

Start with a pick up from your hotel and make your way to the park which is almost hidden beneath a dense jungle canopy and enclosed by piercing limestone cliffs lays Tree Top Adventure Park. Enjoy the staggering view from the canopy, across the Andaman Sea and islands.

Set in local countryside in the rural area of Ao Nam Mao just 7 km from Ao Nang, Krabi Fun Park is Ao Nang's latest adventure attraction.

Safety is the primary concern at Krabi Fun Park treetop experience and all steel rope lines are constructed using tried and tested methods that conform to the most rigid safety specifications. The harnesses provided are all imported from Europe and various sizes and types are available and fitted in a very professional manner at the beginning of every course. Everyone is fitted with safety gear, helmet, gloves and harness. Star with practicing on a low level zipline on which the safety procedures are taught.

There are two courses ranging from a relatively easy section suitable for children as young as 6 up (and over 120cm in height) to far more demanding sections suitable for thrill seeking individuals of all ages.

The easy course consists of 16 activities and takes only 20 minutes to complete. The medium course covers 21 activities over a distance of 1 km (approx. 1 hour); the hard course has 17 activities over 1.5 km and takes around an hour and a half to complete.

The Krabi Fun Park treetop activity is suitable for adults and kids of all ages and is possible even on a day with some rain so get ziplining amongst the trees for a fun day out. There are many more creative activities to enjoy as part of this tour – simply choose from the options below.
strTitle: Zipline Adventures in Krabi Fun Park with Optional Activities

strIntroduction:
Save time in Thailand with a bus ride from Bangkok to Chiang Mai by VIP coach with 36 reclining seats including a short stop to eat and drink something. Meet conveniently at Khao San Road in Bangkok 30-minutes before scheduled departure and get dropped off in Chiang Mai Old Town including a free hotel transfer within the old city.

Travel from Bangkok to the northern Thai city of Chiang Mai with a pre-booked ticket on a comfortable VIP bus with reclining seats.

This easy, fast, and safe journey can be booked up to 12 hours before scheduled departure. In Kamphaeng Phet, around halfway to Chiang Mai, you will make a short stop to eat and drink and to get refreshed.

Take advantage of a convenient meeting point directly at Khao San Road in the touristic center of Bangkok at least 30-minutes before scheduled departure. Ride by Thai Sriram VIP coach with 36 reclining seats to Chiang Mai including toilet on board the overnight bus. Arrive in the early morning in the old town of Chiang Mai from where you can get a free hotel transfer within the old town by the red pick-up car.

Sit back and relax in air-conditioned comfort, enjoying views of Thailand's beautiful landscapes on each leg of the journey. This travel option will add an extra smile to your adventure in the Land of Smiles.
strTitle: Bangkok to Chiang Mai Transfer by Tourist Coach with VIP Seats

strIntroduction:
Book a round-trip ticket by speedboat from Koh Samui or by catamaran from Koh Tao to the full moon party at Haad Rin Beach on Koh Phangan, which brings in the best party crowd on the planet. Enjoy a pick-up service on Koh Samui and return to your hotel at a selected time the next morning after the party.

Take the worry out of your transfer from Koh Samui or Koh Tao to the full moon party on Koh Phangan, with a round-trip ticket to Haad Rin Beach. Travel back to the starting point the next day after the party.

The easy, fast, and safe journey can be booked up to 12 hours before departure and requires no stopover en route. Take advantage of a convenient drop off service directly at the party location in Haad Rin on Koh Phangan. There are 2 different travel routes available. Travel from Koh Samui to Koh Phangan by speedboat or from Koh Tao to Koh Phangan by high-speed catamaran.

If you stay on Koh Samui, there is a free pick-up service from your hotel 1-hour before scheduled departure. Depart from Bang Rak Pier on Samui and cruise by speedboat directly to Haad Rin Beach on Koh Phangan. You can return back to Koh Samui the next morning after the party hourly from 1am until 7am.

If you stay on Koh Tao, you have to come to the meeting point at Mae Haad Pier at least 30-minutes before scheduled departure. Cruise by catamaran to Thong Sala Pier on Phangan, and ride further to the party location by minivan. After the party, get transferred from the party location at Haad Rin Beach to Thong Sala Pier by shared minivan between 5:30am and 6am, and depart to Koh Tao by catamaran at 8:30am.

Sit back and relax in air-conditioned comfort, enjoying views of Thailand's beautiful landscapes on each leg of the journey. Flexible travel options will add an extra smile to your adventure in the 'Land of Smiles.'
strTitle: Round-Trip Transfer to Full Moon Party in Koh Phangan by Speedboat

strIntroduction:
Join this luxurious sunset adventure and immerse yourself in the vibrant marine playground of Krabi. Get ready for an amazing voyage through the Krabi river and into the mangrove forest at Khao Kanab Naam. Get off the beaten path at the 4 Islands near Railay Beach and dive into the turquoise water of the Andaman Sea. Enjoy the astonishing beauty of the sunset aboard the 2-deck catamaran with air-conditioned cabin. Whether cool and elegant - the bar area is the ideal place to end the evening on a cozy note by having some freshly prepared BBQ skewers and canapes, with a good glass of wine or a drink.

Start the trip with a convenient pickup service from your hotel in Krabi Town, Ao Nang, Klong Muang or Tubkaek Beach by air-conditioned minivan.

Board the well-equipped luxury cruising catamaran with two decks and one air-conditioned cabin at Krabi River Marina. Start the cruise with a sightseeing tour on the Krabi River – a good way to see Krabi Town from a different perspective. Enter the evergreen mangrove forest and cruise to the twin mountains of Khao Khanap Naam, the symbol of Krabi.

Sail over to the 4 Islands near Ao Nang and stop either near Chicken Island or at Railay Beach depending on the tides. Then you will be off for 1 hour to enjoy snorkeling and swimming in the crystal clear water of the Andaman Sea. There are premium snorkeling masks and life jackets available on the boat, as well as kayaks and inflatable floating swans for the youngsters.

Relish the panoramic view of the Krabi coastline and enjoy the astonishing beauty of the sunset over the Andaman Sea on the sundeck while listening to soft music. Grab some barbecue skewers with beef, chicken, prawn or fish, and enjoy a delicious selection of canapes. Alcoholic drinks are available at the bar on the second floor.

While heading back to the marina, enjoy a fantastic night view of Thara Park and downtown Krabi. Furthermore, you can look forward to some authentic Thai desserts and seasonal fruits, before getting transferred back to your hotel, with unforgettable impressions and memories of this relaxing sunset cruise.
strTitle: Luxury Sunset Cruise Along the Coastline of Krabi

strIntroduction:
Feel like a VIP on this private 5-hour charter cruise by catamaran from Krabi. Explore the Krabi coast, Hong Island, or the 'Four Islands'; enjoy swimming, snorkeling or kayaking in the Andaman Sea; tuck into a BBQ dinner or canapés on-board (not included); then watch the sunset from deck. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included.

Your tour begins with pickup from your Krabi hotel an hour before departure and a transfer to Krabi River Marina by air-conditioned minivan. On arrival at the marina, hop aboard your private fully crewed catamaran, equipped with two decks, an air-conditioned cabin, and free Wi-Fi onboard. Set sail at 3pm along the Krabi River and soak up the scenery as you glide through Krabi Town, past the twin mountains of Khao Khanap Naam and through lush mangrove forests. 

Depending on your chosen itinerary, either cruise around the 'Four Islands', stopping at Railay Beach, Chicken island, Poda Island and Tup Islets and making a 1-hour stop to swim and snorkel in the crystal clear water of the Andaman Sea. Alternatively, opt for a cruise to Hong Island, where you'll have chance to swim in the island's hidden lagoon. There are snorkeling masks and life jackets available on the boat, as well as kayaks and inflatable floating swans.

After working up an appetite in the water, re-fuel with a delicious array of canapés or a BBQ lunch (extra cost; see additional information), order a drink from the on-board bar, or relax on deck as you watch the magnificent sunset over the Andaman Sea. 

While heading back to the marina, enjoy a fantastic night view of Thara Park and downtown Krabi. Arrive back at Krabi River Marina around 8pm, where a driver will be waiting to take you back to your hotel.
strTitle: Private Catamaran Charter Cruise from Krabi Coast

strIntroduction:
Spend an afternoon exploring sea caves (called 'hong') in Phang Nga Bay, including limestone caves and hidden, cliff-lined lagoons. Expect to see wildlife during a kayaking adventure with your guide and enjoy a Thai seafood buffet aboard the escort boat. Finish your trip after dark by floating your own self-made flower 'krathong' at a Loi Krathong festival and take part in the spectacular light show.

Your kayaking excursion in Phang Nga Bay begins with hotel pickup on Phuket Island at midday to avoid the crowds. Travel by luxury, air-conditioned minivan to Ao Po Pier and transfer to a modern, twin-engine escort boat. You're served a healthy and nutritious lunch on board.

During the boat ride, watch a raptor show and get a detailed briefing about the geological site of Phang Nga Bay. Learn the basics about entering the sea caves, or hongs, then start the first kayaking session with your guide. Paddle past karsts into limestone caves, set amid the dramatic setting of Panak Island, and glide through cliff-lined lagoons populated with macaques, water monitors, kingfishers, mud-skippers, egrets, sea eagles, and brahminy kites.

Returning to the main boat, you'll move on to a second island with two more sea caves to explore. Then, after dark, float your own candlelit flower boat during a Loi Krathong ceremony complete with fireflies and bio-luminescent plankton.

About 2 hours after sunset, eat a seafood (or vegan) buffet dinner including rice served with homemade Massaman curry, during the boat ride back to the pier. Your meal is prepared with fresh, high-quality ingredients from the local market; seafood is net-caught and chickens are free-range. On arrival, you're transferred back to your Phuket hotel or airport.
strTitle: Hong by Starlight Including Sea Cave Kayaking and Loy Krathong Floating from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Travel from Koh Samui to Phuket by high speed ferries and VIP coach via Krabi, in approximately 8.5 hours. Be collected from your hotel on Koh Samui or make your own way to the meeting point at Bang Rak Pier, ahead of your 9am departure. With a number of short stops in Surat Thani and Krabi to collect and drop-off fellow transferring passengers, your estimated time of arrival at Rassada Port in Phuket is 5:30pm.

Your transfer from Koh Samui to Phuket, will start with a ferry ride through the Gulf of Thailand to Don Sak Pier in Surat Thani. Switch to the VIP coach and ride further to Krabi on road. Please consider that the bus transfer may be switched to an air-conditioned minivan due to minimal passengers. From Krabi, you will take another ferry cruising through the Andaman Sea before reaching your island destination of Phuket.

This 8.5 hour journey over land and sea, offers spectacular views across the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea the comfort of air-conditioning aboard the coach with short stops at Donsak Pier in Surat Thani and Krabi to collect and drop-off other passengers.

With a convenient hotel pick up option available, your transfer will be stress free from the start so you are relaxed when you are dropped off at Rassada Port in the south of Phuket Town. From the pier you can make your own way to catch a taxi to your hotel.
strTitle: Koh Samui to Phuket by High Speed Ferries and VIP Coach

strIntroduction:
This speed boat tour will take you to 4 of the best 9 islands of the Similan Islands. Enjoy a convenient transfer directly from your hotel in Krabi to the starting point in Khao Lak where you will board the speed boat and head to the Similan Archipelago. Wild, unspoiled beaches, magnificent coral growth, prolific marine life, crystalline blue water and sensational underwater rock formations can be seen here.

Travel by van to Thuplamu pier in Khao Lak where you will be meet the speed boat to take you to the Similan Islands. Famous for the beautiful corals, white sand beaches and clear tropical waters, Similan snorkeling is definitely something do while in Thailand.

The Islands are situated 95 km north-west of Krabi and 65 km west of Khao Lak. It consists of nine densely wooded islands fringed with rocky outcrops and gorgeous beaches of fine talcum-powder-like sand forms the Similan Islands National Park. The islands are home to a huge variety of marine life of which many are rare and endangered species.

The islands are only open during late March and early April (Thailand’s hottest period).

Rising sea temperatures cause plankton blooms, which attracts a wealth of the larger animals into the area, resulting in chance encounters with, amongst others, schooling chevron barracuda, giant trevally, rainbow runners and reef sharks. There’s also a selection of rays including eagle, marbled and enormous but graceful and harmless mantas.

Touring by speed boat allows you to reach the Similans in the Andaman Sea north of Phuket in 90 minutes, providing lots of time to explore the underwater scenery in one of the world's premier dive sites. You will visit the Island No 4 (Miang Island), Island No 5-6, Island No 8 (Similan Island), and Island No 9 (Bangu Island).

Clear waters, healthy coral and plentiful fish, the Similan Islands are perfect for the beginner and experienced snorkeler.
strTitle: Snorkeling Day Trip at Similan Islands by Speed Boat from Krabi

With a convenient meeting point at Thong Sala Pier on Koh Phangan, your transfer will be stress free from the start so you are relaxed when you are dropped off at your hotel on Koh Lanta if not further than 7 Eleven in Klong Nin Beach.
strTitle: Koh Phangan to Koh Lanta with High Speed Ferry including VIP Coach and Shared Minivan

strIntroduction:
Snorkel the turquoise waters of Koh Nangyuan on this all day tour with a convenient pickup service on Koh Samui and a cruise by catamaran to Koh Tao. Discover one of the best snorkel sites of the Gulf of Thailand and swim among the coral reefs with colorful fish such as Mango, Tian Nok, Hin Wong, and Sairee bays. Visit the amazing Nangyuan Island, near Koh Tao, and stay in one of the most unique places on earth.

Spend the day in paradise on a full-day tour to the tiny island of Koh Nangyuan, a private island that consists of three smaller islands connected together by a beautiful sandbank. Together, these islands form three bays with crystal-clear water and no strong current, white sandy beaches, a variety of colorful fishes and fascinating coral reefs that offer optimal conditions for snorkeling.

A secret jewel of the Gulf of Thailand, just 15 minutes from its sister island of Kao Tao, and a quick crossing from Koh Samui.

You will be picked up from your hotel location of choice in Koh Samui by prior agreement, and then transferred by high speed catamaran to Koh Tao with a short stopover at Koh Phangan. Change to a smaller boat and speed across the water to the sandbars that make up Koh Nangyuan.

Marvel at the sandbar beaches formed by the ocean's currents, and discover the beautiful coral reefs of bays such as Mango, Sairee, Hin Wong, and Tian Nok. An authentic Thai lunch will be served at Nangyuan Restaurant, before time to explore Koh Nangyuan itself. The private island features a dive center and souvenir shop, as well as a breathtaking walk to the hilltop viewpoint.

Soak up the tranquility of a unique destination, far from the stress of modern life, and unwind from your day-to-day worries.
strTitle: Koh Nangyan Snorkeling and Koh Tao Tour by Catamaran Cruise from Koh Samui

strIntroduction:

With a short stop at Don Sak Pier in Surat Thani and Krabi to collect and drop-off fellow transferring passengers, your estimated time of arrival at your hotel on Koh Lanta is 5pm or 8pm.

Your transfer from Koh Tao to Koh Lanta, will start with a ferry ride through the Gulf of Thailand to Don Sak Pier in Surat Thani. Switch to the VIP coach and ride further to Krabi on road. Please consider that the bus transfer may be switched to an air-conditioned minivan due to minimal passengers. From Krabi, you will take a shared minivan to Koh Lanta including a ferry crossing.

This 10.5 hour journey over land and sea, offers spectacular views across the Gulf of Thailand in the comfort of air-conditioning aboard the ferry and coach with a short stopover at Donsak Pier in Surat Thani and Krabi at the Andaman Sea to collect and drop-off other passengers.

With a convenient meeting point at Mae Haad Pier on Koh Tao, your transfer will be stress free from the start so you are relaxed when you are dropped off at your hotel on Koh Lanta if not further than 7 Eleven in Klong Nin Beach.
