strIntroduction:
Spend the day on the emerald waters of the Gulf of Thailand on this full-day tour to Angthong Marine Park from Koh Samui. Start with a speedboat ride, and enjoy the rest of the day snorkeling among colorful coral reefs and kayaking in the idyllic environment of the park. Visit the islands of Phaluai, Wua Ta Lap, Mae Ko, Sam Sao, Hin Dap, Nai Phut, and Phai Luak, exploring their natural caves, crystal-clear lagoons, and rock formations. Lunch is included.

After pickup at your hotel, your day tour begins with the 45-minute speedboat ride from the Maenam pier on Koh Samui to Angthong Marine National Park, where you'll arrive in the mid-morning.

Translating to 'golden bowl,' Angthong occupies nearly 95 square miles (250 square km) and includes 19 square miles (50 square km) of fascinating karst topography and limestone islands that rise from the sea. Known for its natural beauty and untouched conditions, the marine park is home to 42 islands, all of which are uninhabited and undeveloped except for one—Koh Paluay—which is inhabited by so-called 'sea-gypsies' who still earn a living from fishing. The island looks like Koh Samui did 40 years ago, prior to the arrival of tourism and modern infrastructure.

During the day, you'll island-hop through the archipelago, visiting the park's principal islands (including Phaluai, Wua Ta Lap, Mae Ko, Sam Sao, Hin Dap, Nai Phut, and Phai Luak), where you can check out rock formations, lagoons, and caves. At midday, enjoy a Thai lunch at a local restaurant on the island of Woa Ta Lab, and spend the afternoon sunbathing, swimming, snorkeling, kayaking, or simply relaxing on the endless white-sand beaches of the islands.

Your tour ends with return to Koh Samui.
strTitle: Snorkel and Kayak Tour to Angthong Marine Park by Speedboat from Koh Samui

strIntroduction:
Spend a full day in the emerald jewel of Thailand on this speed tour to the Ang Thong Marine Park from Koh Phangan. Start the trip with a 45-minute speedboat ride, and enjoy the rest of your day snorkeling and kayaking in the idyllic oasis of the park.

Start the trip with a pickup from your hotel on Koh Phangan 1-hour before scheduled departure by air-conditioned minivan. Depart from Thong Sala Pier by speedboat and cruise through the Gulf of Thailand to the breathtaking beauty of Ang Thong Marine National Park.

Arrive at the first spot where you can snorkel under huge limestone cliffs through crystal blue waters along the coastline. Continue to Mae Koh Island and start paddling with a sit-on-top kayak along the coastline of the island. At mid-day, enjoy a delicious Thai buffet lunch near the Marine Park ranger station. Spend the afternoon sunbathing, swimming, snorkeling or simply relaxing on the endless white sand beaches of the island.

The next stop will be just a few minutes further by speedboat where you can climb the steps to the top of the island in approximately 10 minutes and enjoy a fantastic view over the Emerald Lagoon which is also known as 'Talay Nai'. The salt water lake is surrounded by sheer cliffs and is definitely the highlight of this tour.

The hours passed quickly without noticing, and it's already time to leave this wonderful place. Arrive back at Thong Sala Pier and get transferred to your hotel where can look back on your day in the enchanting still of the evening.

The archipelago of 42 islands occupies almost 250 square kilometers and includes over 50 square kilometers of surreal limestone islands and karst topography, which rise from the sea as dramatic rock cliffs and captivating rock formations.
strTitle: Snorkel and Kayak Trip to Angthong Marine Park by Speed Boat from Koh Phangan

strIntroduction:
Make more of your time in Thailand with an express transfer by Seatran ferry from Koh Phangan to Koh Tao through the Gulf of Thailand. Benefit from multiple departure times, a convenient meeting point at Thong Sala Pier, and a ferry ticket which gets you to Koh Tao by high speed ferry in air-conditioned comfort.

Travel from Koh Phangan to Koh Tao via air-conditioned high speed ferry. There are 3 departure times offered for this transfer with no stopovers en route.

Meet at Seatran Discovery booth at Thong Sala Pier on Koh Phangan at least 30-minutes before scheduled departure. Cruise by Seatran Discovery high speed ferry to Koh Tao with drop-off at Mae Haad Pier from where you can easily grab a taxi to your hotel.

Transfer with us will be relaxed and stress free with emergency assistance when you need it. Sit back and relax in air-conditioned comfort, enjoying views of the Gulf of Thailand on each leg of the journey.
strTitle: Koh Phangan to Koh Tao by High Speed Ferry

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a speedboat ride from Koh Lanta to the southern twin islands of Koh Rok Nai and Koh Rok Nok with white and fine sandy beaches. Snorkel in the crescent-shaped bay which is surrounded by both hard and soft coral reefs and walk on the beautiful beach of Ao Man Sai.

Enjoy a full-day snorkel tour to the southern islands of Koh Lanta with pick-up service directly from your hotel. You will leave at 9am from Saladan Pier on Koh Lanta and head over to Koh Rok Nok by speedboat where the first snorkeling place is awaiting you.

Move on to Koh Rok Nai for more snorkeling and swimming. After a plenty of water activities you will have lunch with a rich Thai buffet in shady dining area. Relax, sunbath, and walk around on the island. There is also a National Park Ranger Unit station on the island together with public tourist facilities such as camping area and toilets. You will even find a small shop selling items but it is very limited in terms of goods. After the break continue to the last site between Koh Rok Nok and Koh Rok Nai for more open sea snorkeling on coral reefs, before you return to your hotel.

Koh Rok is part of the National Park consisting of two tiny islands, Koh Rok Nok, and Koh Rok Nai. The islands are situated about 250m apart, and are separated by a crescent-shaped bay and surrounded by both hard and soft coral reefs. They are uninhabited with the exception of the National Park ranger station and as a result they are naturally gorgeous. Here you will find clean, white powder beaches, and crystal-clear water.
strTitle: Full-Day Snorkel Trip to Koh Rok by Speedboat from Koh Lanta

strIntroduction:
Escape the crowds from Phuket and explore the Phi Phi Islands for 6 hours in the afternoon. This exhilarating island-hopping tour takes you by speedboat to six different places with several stops or slow-downs at beautiful bays and beaches. Visit Monkey Beach on Koh Phi Phi Don, and see Pileh Cove, Loh Sama Bay and Viking Cave at Koh Phi Phi Leh. Have time to explore Maya Bay, a broken circle of crystal-clear waters surrounded by vertical rock cliffs. 

Your 6-hour trip starts with hotel pickup from your lobby to the pier on Koh Sirey, east of Phuket. After an introduction from your guide about what to expect, including current weather and sea conditions, you're served a light lunch.

Aboard the speedboat you'll reach the Phi Phi Islands in about 1 hour. Motor through Tonsai Bay to your first stop at Monkey Beach, named for the crab-eating macaque colony living here. Relax on the 328-foot-long (100-meter) strip of white sand at the foot of a cliff or swim in the emerald-colored water that laps the beach.

Continue to Phi Phi Don where you will have time to explore the island and do some sightseeing on your own. Then proceed onward to Loh Sama Bay for spectacular open-sea snorkeling. Back on the boat, cruise around the island to discover its magnificent natural beauty, with canyon-like fiords at Pileh Bay and the Viking Cave in which swifts’ nests are harvested to prepare bird’s nest soup.

After showing you these natural wonders, your guide heads toward the most famous beach of Phi Phi Island, filming site of The Beach, starring Leonardo DiCaprio. At Maya Bay, your guide will explain how, according to local legend, a sea princess helped lost travelers find shelter here during a major storm. At this postcard-perfect beach you can walk to the island's interior.

In the later afternoon you'll return back to the pier in Phuket where you're transferred your hotel.
strTitle: Half-Day Phi Phi Island Deluxe Tour from Phuket

strIntroduction:
After pickup from your hotel on Koh Lanta, you'll set cruise to Koh Ngai Island in the Southern Andaman Sea. Once youve reached your destination, explore the marine life around Koh Ngai with snorkeling, kayaking and fishing. Stretching over 300 meters, you're likely to see some larger sea animals, including barracudas, clown fishes, parrots and moray eels among the soft and hard coral while snorkeling at Koh Ngai Bay. Enjoy a delicious lunch at the beautiful Koh Ngai Resort, before moving to the next snorkel spot on the open sea. Enjoy an afternoon coffee or tea with biscuit on the way back to Lanta Old Town.

Get conveniently pickup from your hotel on Koh Lanta and head to the pier near Lanta Old Town. Board the comfortable tour boat 'Hello Andaman' with two decks and a lot of space. Enjoy hot coffee or tea with bread and jam while cruising smoothly to Koh Ngai in the south of Koh Lanta.

First stop will be just off the coast of Koh Ngai, where you can experience the thrill of open water fun fishing.

Continue to Koh Ngai (or Koh Hai), a tiny mountainous island covered by moist evergreen forest. The coastline is fringed by rocky headlands, beautiful white sand beaches and coconut palms. It's the perfect place for walking and relaxing at the beach. Take some beautiful pictures with fantastic scenery of those islands and the mainland of Trang in the background - just like postcard motives.

Enjoy a delicious Thai lunch at Koh Ngai Resort, with drinking water and seasonal fruits served.

Continue to an open water snorkel place where you can swim with colorful fish including clown fish and moray eels. Then you should give the inflatable kayaks a try, paddling your way around the islands and discover your own snorkeling spots.

When it's time to go back, you won't want to leave this perfect place. Enjoy an afternoon coffee or tea with biscuit on the way back to the pier. From there, the driver will take you back to your hotel.

Please consider that the tour program can be changed due to tidal and weather conditions.
strTitle: Day Trip to Koh Ngai by Big Boat from Koh Lanta including Snorkeling and Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Experience the highlights of the Phi Phi Islands including the world's famous May Bay aboard the Indonesian Pinisi Boat, The Freedom. The day is filled with cruising, swimming, snorkeling, beach, sun and fun. The schedule is designed to avoid the crowds so you can have the best scenery and experience on this full day trip from Krabi.

Depart from Ao Nang at 9am on the comfortable wooden sailing boat cruising towards the world renowned Phi Phi islands Maya Bay, the famous location of the movie “The Beach”. Just before lunch time you will have a brief stop for swimming while the team prepares the lunch served on board.

Enjoy a delicious Thai buffet lunch served on board before you arrive at Maya Beach at the most peaceful and beautiful time. Here you will have time to snorkel among the colorful reef fish and visit the beach.

After Maya Bay, continue on to view other highlights of Phi Phi such as Viking Cave, Hin Klang and Phi Ley Bay, before the final beach stop of the day at Bamboo Island. Enjoy the tranquil and beautiful beach while it is almost deserted. Leaving the beach around 4pm, boarding back to Freedom, you will find a refreshing cocktail punch, red and white wine, ice cold beer, soft drinks and canapés awaiting you. We continue the cruise slowly back to Ao Nang during the sun set, while listening to relaxing music during the spectacular Andaman sunset. Take the last change for snorkeling at Chicken Island – just before it is getting dark.

This tour takes place every Monday, Wednesday and Thursday leaded by a highly skilled professional English-speaking tour guide. On Mondays and Wednesdays, there is also a German guide available on request.
strTitle: Phi Phi Highlights and Sunset Cruise on the Wooden Sailing Boat

strIntroduction:
Spend your most amazing Krabi day with a visit to the volcanic hot spring waterfall and a relaxing stop at the freshwater jungle pool. Hike to the top of Tiger Cave Temple, one of the region’s most famous temples with a fantastic viewpoint over the coastal region of Krabi. The tour is lead by a highly experienced English-speaking tour guide.

In less than one hour drive from Ao Nang, there is the tropical lowland rain forest of Kao Prak Bang National Park. Here you can stroll through the lush and fragrant jungle to the Emerald Pool which is the perfect place to have a swim in crystal clear mineral enriched waters.

After a relaxing time continue on for a dip in the thermal Hot Springs, a naturally occurring volcanic spring, visited by many Thais who come to soak in the perfect bath temperature water which is believed to beneficial for health, particularly the skin.

From the National Park, you will stop on the way for a delicious Thai lunch in a local Thai restaurant before heading to Wat Tham Sua (Tiger Cave Temple), one of the most famous monasteries in Southern Thailand. You can meet the monks and see how they live in the beautiful surroundings and natural serenity of the caves. If you are feeling up to the task you are welcome to try out the 1237 (large!) steps to the top of this temple mountain and experience one of the most breath-taking views in Thailand – looking in all directions over lush forest, limestone karsts, and magnificent ocean. Or for the less energetic just enjoy watching the itinerant families of monkeys, who also share this temple home.

Make it happen now and book the standard option which includes a highly skilled English-speaking tour guide. If you require a German tour guide who speaks your mother tongue, please book the separate language option.
strTitle: Deluxe Jungle Tour to Tiger Cave Temple and Krabi Rainforest

strIntroduction:
Visit the 3 must-see attractions in Krabi by shared minivan including all the National Park fees. Walk along a shaded trail through the rainforest and bathe in the pure water of the Emerald Pond. Discover the Krabi Hot Springs and relax in the hot thermal water before visiting the most famous Buddhist temple in Southern Thailand, Wat Tam Suea.

Depart from your hotel in Krabi, sit back, and relax as you journey to Khlong Thom National Park. Pass by scenic views of the lush greenery and natural landscapes of the tropical rainforest as you travel south to the heart of Krabi.

Upon arrival, enjoy a soothing bath in natural hot springs, which provides a serene setting for both relaxation and rejuvenation. Then take a walk and see the exotic flora and distinctive fauna indigenous to Thailand.

Next, cool-off and swim in the clear turquoise waters of the Emerald Pool before enjoying a delicious Thai lunch at a local restaurant.

Continue the tour to the sacred Tiger Cave Temple, a famous meditation center for Buddhist monks. You can meet them and see how they live in the beautiful surroundings and natural serenity of the caves. If you’re feeling adventurous, climb a flight of stairs to the summit and marvel at the gigantic golden Buddha statue with one of the most breathtaking views in Thailand – looking in all directions over lush forest, limestone karsts, and magnificent sea.
strTitle: Krabi Jungle Tour Including Tiger Cave Temple, Crystal Pool and Krabi Hot Spring

strIntroduction:
During this relaxing day-long excursion to the exotic beaches and lagoon of Hong Island, you will also get to visit Pak Bia and Paradise Island. You will have lots of time for snorkeling, swimming and enjoying the sights and sounds of life on these incredible beaches. One of the highlight is a delicious Thai lunch in a beautiful setup right at the beach. The tour is leaded by a highly skilled tour guide in the German or English language.

Get conveniently picked up from your hotel in Krabi by spacious minivan in air-conditioned comfort. Depart by longtail boat from Nopparat Thara beach and cruise to Paradise Island, the first snorkel and swimming stop at a secluded beach. On this island you will also find park rangers who are looking after the swallow birds’ nests.

Cruise further towards Koh Pakbia where you can have a sim and relax while the staff will set up a beautiful and delicious Thai lunch right at the beach. One of the undoubted highlights during this day trip!

Continue to Hong Island, the main island with the famous lagoon. Hong in Thai means “room”, and the literal translation of the islands Thai name is “the island with the room” due to the gorgeous lagoon located in the center.

Head back to Krabi and get dropped off at your hotel to share the photos of your unforgettable trip with your beloved ones.

Make it happen now and book the standard option which includes a highly skilled English-speaking tour guide.
strTitle: Hong Island Deluxe Tour by Longtail Boat from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Take a 7.5-hour trip to the teeny island of Koh Nangyuan, one of the top recommendations for those staying on Koh Samui. Cruise by speedboat to Koh Tao and immerse yourself in natural beauty as you hop from one island to the next, participating in fun-filled activities such as snorkeling, sunbathing, hiking, and sightseeing. The Nangyuan island is actually made up of three little teardrops of land connected by a massive sandbar. It’s a place where post-card dreams are made: unique topography, blindingly white sand beaches, and shores teeming with fish and coral.

Start your day with a transfer from your hotel by minivan in air-conditioned comfort to Na Pralarn Pier in the north of Koh Samui and enjoy a light breakfast. Take off your watch and escape from Koh Samui to Koh Tao aboard the convenient speed boat.

Marvel at the sandbar beaches of Koh Tao formed by the ocean's currents, and discover the beautiful coral reefs of bays such as Mango, Sairee, Hin Wong, and Tian Nok. An authentic Thai lunch will be served at Nangyuan Restaurant. Put on your sunblock before it is time to explore Koh Nangyuan itself which features a dive center and souvenir shop, as well as a breathtaking walk to the hilltop viewpoint.

Enjoy a fun-filled day, with a choice of snorkeling, sunbathing, or hiking through the jungle to the Nangyuan viewpoint. Soak up the tranquility of a unique destination, far from the stress of modern life, and unwind from your day-to-day worries.

Be taken back to your accommodations after, or just be dropped off at the original departure pier.
strTitle: Snorkel Tour to Koh Nangyuan and Koh Tao by Speed Boat from Koh Samui

strIntroduction:
Take a one day tour by speed boat to the stunning islands of Phi Phi with pickup from your hotel on Koh Lanta. Snorkel in crystal clear water with colorful fish and beautiful coral reefs. Discover the famous Maya Beach, Phi Phi Le Bay, Monkey Beach, and Bamboo Island.

On this guided day tour you will discover the top attractions of the Phi Phi Island archipelago. The Phi Phi Islands are amongst the most striking in the world, with vivid-coloured limestone cliffs reaching perpendicularly out of emerald-green water, jungle-covered hillsides, white-sand beaches, and idyllic hilltop vistas along with dramatic caves and grottoes.

You will be picked up at 8am directly from your hotel and then depart from the pier on Koh Lanta to the first stop at Maya Bay. It is a stunningly beautiful bay that is sheltered by 100 meter high cliffs on three sides. Inside the bay there are several beaches, most are small and some only exist at low tide. The main one is around 200 meters long with silky soft white sand, underwater colorful coral, and exotic fish in exceptionally clear water; the whole bay is one big reef.

Next stop is at Monkey Beach, which is one of the top attractions of Koh Phi Phi Don. It is isolated from the main village, where the ferries arrive and most of the accommodation is, by a rocky and forested headland and sits under the largest mountain on the island.

Head over to Bamboo Island where you will enjoy a rich Thai buffet with Thai Massaman Chicken, Deep Fried Chicken, Stir Fried Chicken, steamed rice, fresh fruits, and soft drinks. After lunch you can explore the tiny island of Bamboo which is nothing like its big sisters. Here, there lies no high rocky peak, only a small beach of white sand that emerges from the turquoise waters.

Before heading back to Koh Lanta, you will have time to visit the main island called Koh Phi Phi Don. This little piece of paradise is composed of two rocky ends connected by a thin strip of sand. On each side are the turquoise and emerald coves, Loh Dalam Bay and Ton Sai Bay.
strTitle: Snorkel Tour to Koh Phi Phi by Speed Boat from Koh Lanta

strIntroduction:
Embark on a journey to James Bond Island by speed boat from Krabi. Follow in the footsteps of Roger Moore and visit the famous Khao Phing Kan with its needle formed limestone rock which is featured in the 007 movie "The Man with the Golden Gun". Experience sightseeing and canoeing on this 7-hour guided tour of the stunning limestone karst rocks in the Phang Nga Bay including "Lod Cave" and the Panyee floating village on stilts.

Following a pickup service from your hotel in Krabi, climb aboard the speed boat at Ao Thalane Pier and voyage over to the famous James Bond Island which is situated in the north of Phang Nga Bay.

It found its way onto the tourist map through its starring role in the James Bond movie “The Man With the Golden Gun” starring Roger Moore as 007, and is distinctive for its sheer limestone cliffs that jut vertically out of the crystal emerald-green water.

Discover the famous Khao Phing Kan, a very high leaning rock with tiny caves, where you can find stalls selling souvenirs mostly made from beautiful shells and wood. Walk around the James Bond Island and take a photo of Koh Tapu (also known as Nail Island or Spike Island). The limestone rock is around 20 meters tall with a diameter ranging from about 4 meters at the bottom and up to 8 meters at the top (hence the name of nail island).

Continue to Thalu Island, where you can take a guided kayak tour along the mangrove river and the giant stalactites caves & limestone cliffs (please book the kayak option). If canoeing isn’t your thing you can just enjoy the sights that James Bond Island and its surroundings has to offer!

Panyee floating village is where you will stop for lunch. The natural island of Panyee is a towering vertical mass of limestone. Nearly all of the village sits atop a huge network of stilts that clings to the edge of the island’s coastline and stretches out over the sea in a maze of raised platforms and walkways.

Cruise back to Ao Nang whilst enjoying a marvelous view to Hong Island and make a great conclusion to an unforgettable day.
strTitle: James Bond Island Day Tour by Speedboat from Krabi with optional Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Travel from Bangkok to Koh Tao, the diving island in the Gulf of Thailand, by VIP coach and Lomprayah high speed catamaran. Meet at Khao San Road in Bangkok 1-hour before scheduled departure and get conveniently dropped off at Mae Haad Pier on Koh Tao.

Travel from bustling Khao San Road in Bangkok directly to Koh Tao diving island via coach and high speed catamaran.There are two different departure times offered for this transfer to suit your needs. Two stop-offs in Hua Hin and Chumphon are required to pick up/drop off other transferring guests.

The island Koh Tao (Turtle Island) is so named because its outline resembles a turtle. It is renowned for its stunning natural beauty and excellent diving spots.

Meet at Lomprayah office at Khao San Road in Bangkok 1-hour before scheduled departure and ride via air-conditioned coach by road to Thung Makham Noi Pier in Chumphon. Switch to the high speed catamaran and cruise through the Gulf of Thailand to Koh Tao with drop-off at Mae Haad Pier from where you can easily grab a taxi to your hotel.

Transfer with us will be relaxed and stress free with emergency assistance when you need it. Sit back and relax in air-conditioned comfort, enjoying views of the Gulf of Thailand on each leg of the journey.
strTitle: Bangkok to Koh Tao Transfer by VIP Coach and High Speed Catamaran

strIntroduction:
Traveling by bicycle is a great way to appreciate and preserve Krabi’s amazing countryside. Enjoy the colorful wildlife that you see during this relaxed bike tour through lush green rainforests and typical villages peppered with many local attractions.

This mountain bike trek gives you the chance to explore Krabi by bicycle with no pollution and noise. Cycle through Krabi’s countryside for a rewarding experience. Most tourists will only ever see local people who live by the side of the main road as you speed past in your minibus. With this trip you will for sure encounter friendly and welcoming local people at small farming & fishing communities

A mountain bike will allow you to go off-road and explore dirt tracks that go back for miles behind the main roads. Misty hills, astonishing landscapes, high rise cliffs and a beautiful coast line are the main features on this eco tour trip.

The main highway network is also fairly cycle-friendly. The roads are generally not very busy. Local car drivers are very used to motorcyclists, so other two-wheeled road users won't be a problem for them.

This trip will take you to some of the finest and most spectacular unspoiled places you can imagine. Tracks, fire trails, backcountry single tracks as well as covering large distances in beautiful Krabi. At the same time, traveling by bicycle gives you a great sense of independence. With soil beneath your tires, the breeze in your face and the sounds of nature all around, you'll feel completely part of the surroundings.
strTitle: Krabi Countryside Eco Cycling Tour - Multiple Levels

strIntroduction:
Visit the world famous Phi Phi Islands in the Andaman Sea on a full-day tour from Krabi by speed boat. Swim and relax on the beaches of Bamboo Island, Maya Bay and Tonsai Beach and experience the marine life with two open water snorkeling stops over coral reefs at Monkey Bay and Hin Klang. Cruise around Phi Phi Lee Island and enter the famous Phi Lee Bay to see caves, lagoons and striking limestone cliffs in crystal clear turquoise water.

Enjoy a full-day of relaxation on this speedboat trip to Phi Phi Islands, lapped by turquoise waters and shaded by towering limestone rocks. Scene of the blockbuster movie “The Beach,” Phi Phi is a paradise destination just 30 miles from mainland Thailand.

Composed of 2 islets, Phi Phi Don is the larger, known for its fine beaches and coral formations. Above average tourist facilities are available along the 2 beautiful curved bays of Ton Sai and Lodalam. During the day you can visit Maya Bay, where “The Beach” was filmed, swim in some of the world's clearest water, snorkel at beautiful Hin Klang, and explore Viking Cave, where thousands of swallows nest.

Discover the hidden coves of Phi Phi Lee, such as Phi Lee Bay, where the limestone cliffs rise straight up from the waters and are only reachable by boat. Snorkel among the coral gardens of Ao Maya and Ao Lo Sama, or the isolated reefs of Bamboo Island. Completely uninhabited, and surrounded by flawless sand beaches, expect to see abundant reef fish and even the occasional leopard shark.

The only fixed point in the day is a buffet lunch, served in the canteen on Koh Phi Phi Don, after which you have an hour for shopping and exploration of the island.
strTitle: Phi Phi Island Tour by Speed Boat from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Travel from Bangkok to Koh Samui by VIP coach and Lomprayah high speed catamaran. Meet at Khao San Road in Bangkok 1-hour before scheduled departure and get conveniently dropped off at Mae Nam Pier or choose the drop-off option with transfer directly to your hotel on Koh Samui. Benefit from a morning and overnight transfer.

Travel from bustling Khao San Road in Bangkok directly to Koh Samui resort island paradise via coach and high speed catamaran. Koh Samui is a cosmopolitan melting pot, attracting both budget travelers and wealthiest holidaymakers dropping in for a weekend at one of the many resorts, bungalows or villas on the many white sand beaches of Koh Samui.

Meet at Lomprayah office at Khao San Road in Bangkok 1-hour before scheduled departure and ride via air-conditioned coach by road to Thung Makham Noi Pier in Chumphon. strIntroduction:
Indulge your senses with a full or half-day spa program in a secluded hot spring retreat located along the bank of Khlong Tom river just opposite the famous hot waterfall of Krabi. Relax in natural hot springs, and enjoy body treatments, hydrotherapy in hot and cold water pools, Thai yoga, and a traditional Thai massage.

Waree Raksa offers 14-units of tropical villas, cottages scattered around hot spring sources, exotic fruit orchard and tropical forest. Experience the award-winning day spa service designed to maximize the health benefits gained from the mineral water, hydrotherapy and the ancient knowledge of Thai spa.

Complete your perfect Krabi holiday experience with a full or half-day spa at Waree Raksa near Khlong Thom. Enjoy a full relaxation massage in one of our riverside cabanas. Dip into clear, odorless water with a PH value of 6.9, rich in beneficial minerals. The low salt level of the water is ideal for those on a salt-restricted diet. The water has been certified by Institute Romeis in Germany to be drinkable and rich in various beneficial minerals.

The benefits from the mineral content, water temperature and herbal properties of the spa's programs makes Waree Raksa a perfect place for hydrotherapy. Switching between hot and cool pools is considered a good exercise for the overall body systems, such as nervous system, blood circulation and respiratory system, and stimulate the temperature regulatory system in the body. This cell-level exercise revitalizes and energizes the body as well as improves the immune system and can relieve pain and sickness.

The source of 38 - 42 °C spring water was discovered by chance in 1989. Six large private hot water pools are designed to blend with the natural surroundings. A dip in the water will activate your body to maintain its body temperature, and lead to a strong immune system.

A lush tropical landscape features a large area dedicated to fruit orchards and an organic garden. You can also take part in the spa's adaptation of Thai yoga with body stretches and self massage to promote blood circulation.

One of Wareerak’s key philosophies is the holistic approach for well-being through the use of natural and organic remedies. All the products, treatments, food and drinks are made from 100% organic and natural ingredients grown within the local garden. Each remedy has been created by spa and herbal experts, and used by highly trained staff to ensure maximum health benefits.

To complete a perfect Krabi holiday experience, the day spa at Waree Raksa should not be missed.
strTitle: Waree Raksa Hot Spring Thai Spa and Massage Treatment in Krabi Rainforest

strIntroduction:
Transfer from Krabi to Koh Samui by VIP coach and high-speed catamaran. A hotel transfer can pick you up from your Krabi hotel or you can make your way to one of the meeting points. Multiple departure times are offered throughout the day.

Your Krabi to Koh Samui transfer includes a pick up from your hotel in Ao Nang, Ao Nam Mao and Krabi town only.
If you choose the With Hotel Transfer option, then your journey ends with your delivery to your Koh Samui accommodation.
If you choose the No Hotel Transfer option, then your journey ends at Nathan Pier, Koh Samui.

Krabi Hotel Pick Up
Hotel transfers are from hotels in Ao Nang, Ao Nam Mao and Krabi town only.
Krabi Meeting Point
If you stay in Klong Muang or Tubkaek, you must make your way to the meeting point in the ferry office in Krabi town.
If you stay at Railay Beach, you must make your way via 15 minute boat ride to the meeting point at Nam Mao pier.
Krabi to Koh Samui
Travel from Krabi to Don Sak Pier in an air-conditioned bus, then transfer to Koh Samui, one of the largest islands in the Gulf of Thailand, via a high-speed catamaran.
Koh Samui No Hotel Transfer
Your journey ends with your delivery to Nathan Pier, Koh Samui.
Koh Samui With Hotel Transfer
Your journey ends with your delivery to your hotel in Koh Samui
strTitle: Krabi to Koh Samui by Coach and High-Speed Catamaran

strIntroduction:
Embark on a cruise by speedboat to the southern islands of Koh Lanta. Enjoy a full-day excursion with plenty of water activities and beach life on Koh Cheuk, Koh Kradan, and Koh Mah. The highlight of this day trip is the Emerald Cave on Koh Mook, a lesser-known lagoon with a 280-foot-long (85-meter) tunnel.

Kick off your guided excursion with a morning pickup from your hotel lobby, and embark on a speedboat ride to the southern islands of Koh Lanta. Your first destination is Koh Chuek. Arrive there after 45 minutes and use provided gear for snorkeling and feeding the fish.

Next up is Koh Mook, the largest island on the trip and renowned for its Morakot Cave (Emerald Cave). The water cave entrance, located on the island's western side, is only accessible by boat during low tide and exits onto a white beach with an emerald pool surrounded by steep cliffs. After your explorations, continue on to the small karst islets of Koh Cheuk, Koh Maa, and Koh Waen, which offer great snorkeling spots, sea caves, and small sandy beaches located between Koh Mook and Koh Ngai. 

Later, a delicious lunch will be served on Koh Kradan, a stunning island with a spotless sandy beach surrounded by clear waters with magnificent corals, making it a perfect site for snorkeling. Further on, Koh Ngai is a charming island with a dramatic interior and a spotless sandy beach along its eastern coast. Mountainous and covered by tropical forest, the isle is surrounded by clear water and corals. Continue snorkeling around Koh Mam, where you will be able to feed the fish with bread or bananas. Thousands of giant bats can also be seen here.

Return to Koh Lanta in the afternoon for transfer back to your hotel.
strTitle: Island-Hopping Tour to Koh Chuek, Koh Kradan, Koh Mook and Koh Mah by Speedboat from Koh Lanta

strIntroduction:
Cruise by iconic longtail boat to the 4 Islands near Koh Lanta. Stop at Koh Chuak and Koh Maa for spectacular open water snorkeling, and walk along the white sandy beach of Koh Ngai. The highlight of the tour is the Emerald Cave on Koh Mook, with a 80 m swim to the hidden lagoon in the inner of the island.

On this full-day excursion you’ll experience the beauty of the southern islands of Koh Lanta. Get picked up from your hotel and head to the pier near Lanta Old Town. A traditional long-tail boat with an English speaking guide will be waiting for you, ready to depart to the 4 Islands on this fun-filled adventure.

After a ride of approximately 45 minutes you will arrive at the first destination. Enjoy great snorkeling in crystal clear water of Koh Chuak, a small karst islet with sea caves and small sandy beaches between Koh Mook and Koh Ngai.

Around an hour later visit Koh Mook, the largest island on this tour. It is best known for its Emerald Cave (also called Tham Morakot) and hidden lagoon in the center of the island. The entrance to the cave is located on the western side of the island and is only accessible during low tide. The cave itself winds for about 80 meters to its other exit, onto a white beach with an emerald pool surrounded by steep cliffs.

Continue to Koh Ngai to enjoy a delicious Thai picnic lunch on the beach, consisting of steam rice, fried mix vegetables, Massaman Curry with chicken and seasonal fruits. Koh Ngai is a charming island that features a dramatic interior and a spotless sandy beach along its eastern coast. Mountainous and covered by tropical forest, the island is surrounded by clear waters with magnificent corals, making it a perfect site for snorkeling.

Cruise further to the second snorkeling spot at Koh Maa where you can feed the fish with bread or bananas. Thousands of giant bats can also be seen here.

Depart from Koh Maa for the longtail boat trip back to Koh Lanta and arrive at the port in the old town at approx. 3:30pm. Then get transferred back to your hotel on Koh Lanta.

If you like exploring tropical islands, caves and snorkeling with amazing marine life then this is the trip for you!
strTitle: 4 Island Tour to Koh Chuak - Koh Mook - Koh Ngai and Koh Maa by Longtail Boat from Koh Lanta

strIntroduction:
Visit an untouched ecosystem at Ao Thalane Krabi in the afternoon after all the tour groups have gone. Explore paddling through mangroves and narrow canyons with your personal guide at your own pace and finish with amazing sunset over Hong Island and a BBQ dinner at a private beach.

Star the tour with an afternoon pick up from your hotel and drive 25 minutes to Ao Thalane, home to the most magnificent mangroves in Thailand. Kayak slow and silently upon sturdy “sit-on-top” kayaks that move almost unnoticed through different coastal ecosystems, passing mangrove, canyons and lagoons.

Spend an afternoon paddling in the cool shade of the untouched Ao Thalane canyons. These towering cliffs protect the endangered mangrove environment at the coast. You will explore various coves and lagoons.

If you have never kayaked before, don’t worry. Instruction is given at the beginning of the trip and the routes followed are relatively easy. The exercise is not really strenuous and even young kids enjoy it. Everyone has a life jacket on at all times. Kayaks are 3 seat kayaks. We use them as 2 seat kayaks, but if you have a child with you, then they can sit in the 3rd seat in the middle.

If you are lucky, you can see wild monkeys, in particular the crab-eating macaque, and other wildlife such as monitor lizards and several species of birds. During the trip your personal guide will tell you more about the local people and their way of life. After the kayak activity, you will have time to swim and relax at your very own beach.

The next destination will be Laem Jaa Mook Kway where you can hike up the short trail to the viewpoint. From here you can enjoy the amazing sunset over the Andaman Sea. After all that action, you can enjoy a delicious BBQ dinner before you will head back to the pier by longtail boat under a warm blanket before being transferred back to your hotel.

This trip is perfect for peacefully paddling the mangrove forest seeing plenty of wildlife and exploring limestone caves, canyons and lagoons without the crowds.
strTitle: Small Group Sunset Kayaking at Ao Thalane with BBQ Dinner

strIntroduction:
Explore the mangrove forest of Krabi by traditional longtail boat and encounter the abundant wildlife including fish, monkeys and birds. On this 4-hour tour you will cruise through Krabi’s wetland with narrow canals and hidden gems, and visit also the famous Khao Khanab Nam Cave and Koh Klang community with rice fields and water buffalo.

A local boatman will take you to the mangrove forests of Krabi in a traditional longtail boat where you can see the interesting sights including the Khao Khanab Nam Cave which lies in-between 2 mountains and displays impressive stalagmites and stalactites.

Time to stop at a local, floating restaurant near Baan Kanon on the banks of Krabi River for a delicious lunch including fresh fish.

You will enter the small canals of the mangrove forest and see different types of mangrove trees as well as local wildlife, including monkeys, birds and fish. You can also relax and enjoy a fish show with puffer fish, catfish, black kingfisher and crabs at a typical fish farm in the local Koh Klang community. On the small island of Koh Klang which is just in front of the mainland of Krabi, you can walk though the local community and see rice fields and water buffaloes.

Thailand only has a few areas that have been recognized as wetlands of the world and the mangrove forest of Krabi Province, covering an area of 100,000 rai (160 square kilometers) is ranked in the Ramsar List of Wetlands of International Importance. The protected area also covers 12 square kilometers of up to 2-kilometer wide tidal mudflats.

The area is popular with birdwatchers coming to spot some of the most diverse and rare species in the world including the Masked Finfoot and the Brown-winged Kingfisher to name just a few. The mangroves are a habitat for various species of wildlife including reptiles, birds and marine creatures.
strTitle: Mangrove Boat Tour in Krabi

strIntroduction:

strIntroduction:
Enjoy the morning kayaking through canyons and mangroves around Ao Thalane Bay and explore the beautiful emerald lagoon and snorkel in the reef at Hong Island.

Explore Krabi's beautiful scenery by sea kayak as move slowly through different ecosystems while observing wildlife, and manoeuvre through mangrove forests, canyons, caves, and lagoons.

On this small-group you'll discover a diverse ecosystem in an undeveloped environment without unpleasant crowds. Kayak through Ao Thalane Bay slowly and silently observing the wildlife up close. You will spot several species of birds and monkeys, in particular the crab-eating macaque monkey.

Stop for lunch and then travel by long tail boat to Hong Island, home to a group of islands with an array of towering limestone cliffs and white sandy beaches. Here you will have the chance to explore the beautiful emerald lagoon and snorkel amongst the abundant beds of coral, bright-colored crabs, and tropical fish.

Your guide will then take you back to you hotel, where this tour ends.
strTitle: Small-Group Sea Kayaking at Ao Thalane Bay and Hong Island from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Travel by speedboat to the Hong Island Archipelago and visit the main island of Koh Hong, including its hidden lagoon. See Koh Lading with its sheltered cove — home to thousands of birds, and view Koh Pakbia, which boasts impressive sandbanks and rock formations. If you select the kayak option at booking, you will have the opportunity to explore the emerald-green waters in a sit-on-top canoe. Round-trip hotel transport from Krabi or Ao Nang is included.

After hotel pickup in Ao Nang or Krabi Town in the morning, cruise by speedboat from the Krabi pier to one of the Andaman Sea's most stunning places. This full-day tour in the national marine park will take you to the main islands of the Hong Archipelago. On the way, stop at the rock isle of Koh Daeng, the best snorkeling spot for seeing colorful fish and corals.

Continue to Koh Hong, renowned for its vivid beauty, shallow coral reefs, and fine, sandy beaches. Jump into the island's clear waters and snorkel along the rocky ledges or take a walk through the mangrove forest. In the center of the half-circle-shaped island lies a secret lagoon, where you can opt to kayak while surrounded by limestone karsts dotting the tranquil waters. (The kayak session must be selected at booking.)

Enjoy a delicious lunch and refreshments on a tropical beach, with plenty of time to take in the beauty of the islands before you return to Krabi and your hotel.
strTitle: Hong Island Tour by Speedboat from Krabi with Sightseeing and Optional Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Embark on a journey to James Bond Island by a large longtail boat. Experience sightseeing and canoeing on an 8-hour guided tour of the stunning limestone karst rocks. Follow in the footsteps of Roger Moore, visit Wat Suwan Kuha Temple and Panyee floating village in Phang Nga Bay, and more.

Following a pick-up service from your hotel in Krabi, transfer to Phang Nga Bay by air-conditioned minivan to discover the famous filming locations of “The Man With the Golden Gun” in Phang Nga Bay.

After a short visit to Wat Suwan Kuha Temple, also known as “Monkey Cave,” climb aboard a traditional longtail boat at Tadan Pier near Phang Nga Town and voyage over to James Bond Island.

Phang Nga Bay found its way onto the tourist map through its starring role in the James Bond movie starring Roger Moore as 007, and is distinctive for its sheer limestone cliffs that jut vertically out of the crystal emerald-green water.

Discover the famous Khao Phing Kan, a very high leaning rock with tiny caves, where you can find stalls selling souvenirs mostly made from beautiful shells and wood. Walk around the James Bond Island and take a photo of Koh Tapu (also known as Nail Island or Spike Island). The limestone rock is around 20 meters tall with a diameter ranging from about 4 meters at the bottom and up to 8 meters at the top (hence the name of nail island).

Continue to Thalu Island, where you can take a guided kayak tour along the mangrove river and the giant stalactites caves & limestone cliffs (please book the kayak option). If canoeing isn’t your thing you can just enjoy the sights that James Bond Island and its surroundings has to offer!

Panyee floating village is where you will stop for lunch. The natural island of Panyee is a towering vertical mass of limestone. Nearly all of the village sits atop a huge network of stilts that clings to the edge of the island’s coastline and stretches out over the sea in a maze of raised platforms and walkways.

Cruise slowly back to the pier and make a last stop at Raman Waterfalls on your adventure. A place with an abundance of flora and fauna such as monkeys, deers, squirrels and birds.

Conclude your tour back in your centrally located hotel where you can make a great conclusion to an unforgettable day.
strTitle: James Bond Island Day Tour from Krabi by Longtail Boat with optional Kayaking

strIntroduction:
Trot or gallop across the sand, located right on Ao Nam Mao Beach not far from Ao Nang — an ideal location for horseback riding. The beach is always quiet, apart from local fishermen searching for crabs, making it seem much further away from the bustling center of Ao Nang. Your guide will match you to a horse that’s suited to experienced or novice riders for the 1- or 2-hour ride.

Meet your guide at your hotel in Ao Nang, Ao Nam Mao or Krabi Town—pickup is also available from hotels in Klong Muang and Tubkaek for an additional fee. If you’re traveling from Railay Beach, take the 15-minute boat ride from Railay East to Ao Nam Mao Pier for pickup upon arrival.

Safety-conscious staff match you to a trained horse that suits your skill level. The 1-hour guided horseback ride takes you along the deserted and windswept Ao Nam Mao Beach, which boasts beautiful views across the islands. If you'd like, you can even take your horses into the water. Opt for a 2-hour tour, and continue inland into the countryside, passing small villages and plantations.

Whether you are an experienced horse rider or a first-timer, you'll have a unforgettable experience riding along the beach, just kicking up the surf. 
Finish the ride with a return transfer to your hotel.
strTitle: Krabi Horse Riding at Ao Nam Mao Beach

strIntroduction:
Spend an unforgettable day on the water during this full-day boat tour of four islands from Krabi. A professional guide will steer you along on a large long-tail boat as you stop at some of the area’s most popular destinations to snorkel, swim in the water and relax on the sand. Feast on a delicious buffet lunch, sip on complimentary beverages and enjoy a BBQ dinner on the beach as you watch the sunset over the water. A visit to Poda Island is also included, giving you the perfect opportunity to watch the sunset before going for a night swim at Phranang Cave Beach.

Your full-day adventure at sea begins by boarding a long-tail boat, operated by a professional guide. Lifejackets and snorkeling gear will be provided for your convenience. The first stop of the day is at Lading Island, where you can look for fish using your snorkel gear or just enjoy time on the beach. When you arrive at the hidden lagoon of Hong Island a light buffet lunch will be served.

After a brief stop at Koh Daeng (‘Red Island’) for snorkeling on the reef spend the rest of the day cruising around the area’s four famous islands. If you’re lucky and catch low tide you can walk along the famous sandbar at Tup Islets or continue snorkeling at Tang Ming Island and Chicken Island. Then it’s on to Poda Island for some dreamy sunset viewing and a good chance to walk along the beach.

Phranang Cave Beach offers one last chance for a swim as well as an exciting bio-luminescent fire show. End the day of adventure with a delicious BBQ dinner on the beach at Railay Beach. Though sea and weather conditions can occasional change the itinerary, this tour is the perfect opportunity to get out of the city and enjoy a day on the water.
strTitle: Snorkeling and Sunset Tour at Hong Island and The Four Islands from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Visit Thailand's original rock climbing mecca, located on the Railay Beach. Half, full or multiple-day climbing courses are offered. Spend time top-rope climbing, bouldering and rappelling on the stalactite-dripping karst cathedrals.

Whether you are a novice climber, an expert climber, or somewhere in between, you will surely enjoy climbing the cliffs of Railay. This spot, located on a peninsula accessible only by boat from Ao Nang or Krabi town, offers routes of world-class quality, including single and multi-pitch climbs, right on the beach.

The karst topography of Krabi can seem otherworldly, with its tall spires of limestone and exposed cliffs, it is truly a climber's paradise. The rock is all limestone and part of the world’s largest coral reef, stretching from China down to Papua New Guinea.

During your course, you will be instructed by a professional and certified climber and spend time top rope climbing, bouldering, rappelling, and much more. You will be able to choose from 700 routes, ranging in skill level. All routes are graded and bolted.
Railay is also home to 2 of the most beautiful beaches on the planet, Pranang Cave and Tonsai Beach. With climbing spots right on the beach you will get to see splendid views out over the Andaman Sea.

Afterwards, recover from your day of climbing and relax on Railay’s beautiful white sandy beaches. Return to your hotel at your leisure and maybe even have a relaxing Thai massage to ease your sore muscles.
strTitle: Rock Climbing Courses at Railay Beach in Krabi

strIntroduction:
Paddle your way through Bor Thor, located in the Ao Luek district of Krabi Province. You'll kayak with a guide across spectacular rivers and inlets, and into stunning limestone caves to see archaeological artifacts and cave paintings. Select a half-day tour or upgrade for a full-day itinerary that includes a seafood lunch and additional time at Tha Pom. Round-trip hotel transport is provided from Ao Nang, Ao Nam Mao, and Krabi Town.

Bor Thor, one of the first settlements in southern Thailand, is a small coastal village rich with archaeological treasures, artifacts, and cave paintings. Many are only accessible by kayak, and your journey takes you paddling into the limestone caves for an up-close look.

After hotel pickup, travel on the mainland from Krabi to Bor Thor by shared minivan. You'll drive past a spectacular landscape of limestone cliffs and small villages along the way. After a safety briefing, hop into your sit-on-top kayak and paddle with your guide along the Marui River through several extraordinary caves and narrow river tunnels.

En route, stop to admire the stalactites and stalagmites of Tam Lod cave then continue through a tunnel to Tham Khao Wong lagoon, located in the middle of a mountain. Afterward, paddle over to Pee Hua cave to explore the ancient paintings and pictographs found inside. Finally, make your way through the cave's numerous grottos until you arrive at a viewpoint overlooking the mangrove forest and sprawling ocean.

This is where your half-day tour option concludes. If you upgrade for the full-day tour at booking, take a break for a provided lunch at a traditional Thai seafood restaurant by the river. After lunch, continue to Tha Pom, also known as Khlong Song Nam, meaning ‘canal of two waters.' Your guide will point out the place where seawater and freshwater come together at high tide and, when mixed together, creates crystal-clear water. Here, you can take a swim in the pristine waters before it's time to make your way back to the Bor Thor pier and transfer to your hotel.
strTitle: Small-Group Sea Cave Kayaking at Bor Thor from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Travel from Koh Phi Phi to Koh Phangan stress-free when you book this combined transfer ticket. Take the ferry from Phi Phi Island to Krabi, hop on a VIP coach to Don Sak Pier and make your way to Koh Phangan on the Lomprayah high-speed catamaran.

Meet the crew at Ton Sai pier on Koh Phi Phi Don and cruise through the Andaman Sea by ferry to your next destination, Krabi. Here you will arrive at Krabi Passenger Port and transfer onto a VIP Coach that will take you directly to Don Sak Pier in Surat Thani.

You will at arrive at the pier in the afternoon where you will transfer onto the Lomprayah high speed catamaran that will take you to Koh Phangan with a short stopover on Koh Samui to pick up/drop off other transferring guests.

Your transfer ends at Thong Sala Pier on Koh Phangan from where you can easily reach the party location at Haad Rin Beach or your hotel by taxi or other transfer arrangements. The staff will take care of you at each transfer point so much that you feel well and safe.
strTitle: Koh Phi Phi to Koh Phangan by Ferry Including Coach and High Speed Catamaran

strIntroduction:
The secrets to authentic Thai cooking, will be discovered in this small group cooking class, under the tuition of the professional Thai chef Ya. The Krabi Thai cookery course will introduce you, in theory and in practice, to the ingredients and dishes of classic Thai cuisine. From typical Thai fruits and vegetables, to the preparation of spicy Thai salads.

Choosing fresh ingredients is how you will start your class. You will discover the secrets behind cooking the perfect Thai meal as you combine rich colors, unique flavors and fragrant spices with delicious fresh produce. You will get a feel for authentic Thai culture through the preparation of authentic Thai cuisine.

Learn the art of balancing flavors and cooking complete dishes from scratch, with traditional utensils and techniques. The preparation of curry paste is one of the most unique and important aspects of Thai cooking, and you will learn about herbs and spices as you grind then together in a stone mortar.

Some of the menu items you may be cooking include: Curry Paste, Massaman Curry, Red Curry Chicken, Spicy Prawn Soup, Chicken Mint Salad, Pad Thai, Stir Fried Chicken & Cashew Nut, Stir fried sweet & sour, Fried Rice with Chicken/Vegetable.

Your class ends with you enjoying the Thai specialties that you have spent the day preparing.

Return home with your new culinary skills in stir-frying, making curries, Thai soups and salads, that will impress your friends and family.
strTitle: Ya's Thai Cookery School Class in Krabi

strIntroduction:

Select pickup from your Phuket hotel and/or hotel drop-off at your destination, or make your own way to the meeting point at Rassada Port near Phuket Town before your departure and hire a taxi at the other end. The trip that takes about 8 hours, including a number of short stops in Krabi and Surat Thani.

Your transfer from Phuket to Koh Samui will make short stops in Krabi and Surat Thani to collect and drop off other passengers before reaching your island destination at Bang Rak Pier.

strIntroduction:
Go kayaking through Krabi’s most beautiful bays and mangrove forests at Ao Thalane. Explore the diverse ecosystem while maneuvering through channels surrounded by towering limestone formations and observing the flora and fauna. Choose between a full-day tour with lunch and a swim at the beach, or a half-day option with a morning or afternoon departure.

After hotel pickup in Ao Nang, Ao Nam Mao, and Krabi Town, you'll depart by kayak from the pier in Ao Thalane. It's one of the most beautiful bays and mangrove forests, situated along the coast of Krabi and surrounded by small, offshore islands and towering karst formations that make narrow channels and canyons. 

This small-group day trip is specially designed with a maximum of six people to one guide, making it ideal for those who want to try kayaking for the first time or simply immerse in the tranquility of nature without the crowds. Explore Ao Thalane's diverse ecosystem, observe wildlife, and maneuver through mangroves, canyons, caves, and lagoons with your guide. You may spot several species of birds and monkeys, in particular the crab-eating macaque.

If you opt for the full-day tour, paddle up to the beach for lunch and a swim. Afterward, you'll be transferred back to your hotel.
strTitle: Small-Group Sea Kayaking at Ao Thalane Bay from Krabi

strIntroduction:
Explore the beautiful Phang Nga Bay on this thrilling speedboat tour from Krabi. Visit James Bond Island and opt to paddle by kayak through limestone sea caves featuring a thriving variety of wildlife. Continue to the pristine Hong Island and snorkel in the hidden lagoon. With a hotel transfer, soft drinks, snacks, and a sumptuous buffet lunch, this full-day excursion is the ideal way to experience the Ao Phang Nga National Park.

Your day begins with a transfer from your hotel in Krabi to Nopparat Thara Pier where your guide awaits you. Cruise by speedboat to Phang Nga Bay, which covers more than 154 square miles (400 sq km) and is home to some 100 islands. The bay consists of rocky, limestone outcrops jutting out of the emerald green sea.

James Bond Island (Khao Phing Kan) is your first stop and a remarkable highlight of the tour. The landmark was made famous due to its starring role in the James Bond film The Man with the Golden Gun. As it is under national park protection, no boats are permitted to get too close to the island. The best way to view James Bond Island is from the small beach on Khao Phing Kan, a high leaning rock that has some small caves inside. On its crowded eastern beach, there are stalls selling souvenirs, mostly made from shells and wood.

Moving on, you'll cruise out to Lot Noi Cave at Thalu Island. If you booked the kayak option, transfer to a canoe for an adventure paddle through sea caves found among the mangrove forests. 

The tour includes a Thai-style lunch at the charming Koh Panyee (Panyee Island), a nearby Muslim fishing village. The locals live in stilt houses and you will have the opportunity to observe firsthand the daily life of a community unchanged over time.

Finish your day by swimming in the crystal-clear waters that surround pristine Hong Island. Dry off by relaxing on a secluded beach before it’s time to get back on board for your return speedboat journey to Krabi. Your hotel transfer will be waiting for you at the pier.
strTitle: Full-Day Tour to Phang Nga Bay Including James Bond Island and Hong Island by Speedboat from Krabi

strIntroduction:
This spectacular open water kayaking tour takes you to Hong Island where you will explore the surroundings and venture through the hidden lagoon. Along the way you can take a break to swim and snorkel in the amazing coral reef. Hong Island is one of the most beautiful islands in the Andaman Sea. It is home to a group of islands with an array of towering limestone cliffs, white sandy beaches, crystal clear water and amazing coral reefs.

The tour departs from the Sea Kayak pier in Ao Thalane where you will take a longtail boat out to Hong Island. Start your adventure exploring the surroundings of Hong Island in open water by kayak, then venture into the hidden emerald lagoon for a snorkel and a swim.

Take a break and have lunch on the boat before the afternoon activities begin.

In the afternoon you will have free time to swim in the crystal clear waters, snorkel in the coral reef and do some more kayaking.

Before returning to the Sea Kayak pier enjoy a boat trip to some smaller islands around Hong Island. You can sit back and relax whilst taking in the spectacular scenery.

strIntroduction:
The Krabi Illumanorah show is a spectacular dance and light show, interpreting the traditional Thai folk tales of the Kinnaree (half bird and half woman figures) combined with the southern dance of Manora. In an outstanding evening program at Paka Showpark in Krabi, you can enjoy a terrific seafood buffet before immersing yourself in the folklore and legends of Southern Thailand with a spectacular light and sound experience.

What to do at night in Krabi? The Illumanorah show is the long awaited nightlife activity, a creative light and sound experience, interpreting the traditional Southern Thai folk tales of the Kinnaree (half bird and half woman figures) with a modern touch, and incorporating the southern dance of Manorah. The lighting, costumes, music and choreography combine to make a thrilling, mainly wordless show that impresses visitors of all ages. The performance starts at 8pm and lasts over one hour.

The show is held in the Paka Showpark, a brand new cultural venue in Krabi that is designed to welcome visitors with a unique architecture that reflects the charm of Thailand’s Southern Region. The Paka Showpark will convey the spirit of the Andaman Sea, filled with beauty and magic. In the evening, it will complete Krabi’s nightlife with activities, festivals, and Thai cuisine that will rotate to keep you coming back throughout the year for fresh new experiences.  

The theater, with over 200 seats, is located right at the highway Route 4 outside Krabi Town on the way to Tiger Cave Temple and Krabi Airport. You will be comforted as your 5 senses are soothed from the music, lyrics, choreography, traditional costumes, and the cultural colors that will come together to create a unique southern Thai flavor. Please consider that the stage is round, so there is no preferential seating.

Don't miss the optional seafood dinner buffet before the show, offering a large selection of Thai food and seafood, even a Halal section with separate seating is available. Alcohol is available at additional costs.

After the show you will have a chance to meet the performers and have your picture taken with them in costume at no additional charge. At the entrance area, there is also a small market selling local Thai products and souvenirs. Don't miss this unique show and cultural experience under the starry sky of Krabi.
strTitle: Illumanorah Dance and Light Show with Seafood Buffet in Paka Show Park Krabi
