strTitle: Private Arrival Transfer from Phu Quoc Island Airport to Hotel

strIntroduction:
Visit the Cai Be region of the Mekong Delta on this day trip from Ho Chi Minh City. You'll take a boat cruise along the Bassac River via Cai Be Floating Market, visit a local church, see a rice paper farm, and check out a coconut candy mill. Walk through fruit gardens, taste regional delicacies, and take a ride on a sampan (a wooden boat) through canals, plus go biking in countryside. Lunch is included.

After hotel pickup, your tour from Ho Chi Minh City starts with a drive along the highway to Cai Be, about 50 miles (85 km) from the city.

The Cai Be Floating Market is one of the top cultural features of the Mekong Delta. You can find anything here from fabrics to poultry and seafood to beverages, but the most popular commodity is tropical fruits. The Mekong countryside is a vast farmland for coconut, jackfruit, durian, rambutan, pomelo, pineapple, star apple, tangerine, and grapefruit, all of which are shipped across the country. Cai Be is also one of the Mekong Delta's main centers of rice production.

From the pier, take a boat trip on the Mekong River to Cuu Long Village, where you will then take a walk through the village to visit local workshops where rice paper is made to supply restaurants with the essential ingredient for spring rolls. Then hop aboard a sampan for another boat ride along the canals. Stop at local homes to enjoy dried fruits, taste honey tea, and watch a Tai Tu music show. Visit a coconut mill where coconut candy, a local specialty, is produced before heading to a restaurant on the island for lunch.

In the afternoon, visit local gardens to discover different types of fruits, and bike along country roads to meet local people. Then drive back to Ho Chi Minh City in the late afternoon to end your tour.
strTitle: Cai Be and Mekong Day Trip from Ho Chi Minh City

strIntroduction:
Halong Bay charter cruise is a good holiday package designed for honeymooners, family vacation, or group of friend of package tour for parent as a gift. This tour is only two days and concentrate on taking care clients as king and queen.

Halong Bay charter cruise is a truly a private tour to visit Halong Bay. When you travel as couple, honeymooners even with family or your group, the trip will be served on a cruise which is the most suitable. When you travel as a family tour, we arrange a private cruise enough for high comfort and exceptional service. This tour take for one night cruise, and being offer as indicated itinerary below:

Day 1: Hanoi - Halong bay (Lunch, Dinner included) Shuttle van will be always ready at pick up point in Hanoi at about 8:00AM. It take about 3 hours driving north east of Hanoi. Reaching boat pier, then board on to cruise around 12:00. Of course, well come drink will be served on arrival. Following with seafood lunch served as well. Cruise start through the bay, client can enjoy magnificent bay view of Cock fighting Islet, the Finger Island, and frog islet. 15.00 cruise docking at Dark and Bright lagoon where you can ride your kayak or sampan boat. Return to cruise for swimming around. Late of the day relax on deck and join cooking class and taste Vietnamese traditional food. In the evening, enjoy delight set menu dinner. Next end of the day can take part in squid fishing or relaxing at the bar.  

Day 2: Halong bay – Hanoi (Breakfast and lunch included)

It is so fresh morning you have here in Halong bay the world famous wonder. Get up early, you can join Tai Chi lesson, tea and coffee available there too. Then it followed by a light breakfast. This morning activity take places by visiting Amazing Cave, one of the biggest caves in Halong bay with beautiful stalagmites and stalactites covered as a grand art work by nature. Cruise more to explore great bay. And the boat disembark to Tuan chau Island and drive back to Hanoi.
strTitle: Halong Bay tour on private Prince Cruise exceptional holiday

strIntroduction:
Discover Vietnam’s Halong Bay with nearly 2000 islands and islets in various sizes and shapes, forming a spectacular seascape of limestone pillars. Enjoy time to experience kayaking while staying overnight on board during this 3 day 2 night cruise.

Day 1: Hanoi – Halong Bay (lunch, dinner) Pick you up from your hotel in city centre of Hanoi and start your first day journey at 8am. After 3 hours on the way, arrive and on the cruise as well as be served the lunch while starting the trip wandering Halong Bay. There are some of significant places you have to visit like Sung Sot Cave, sightseeing the amazing stalactites system and surprising by its beauty. Then, the cruise will stop let you enjoy kayaking along the hidden parts of the bay. After that, savor a buffet dinner on the cruise further along the limestone island of Fighting Cock, Turtle Island,… In the evening, relax in your cabin or join with others, participate in some activities such as dancing, night fishing… and overnight on the board.

Day 2: Halong Bay, visit islands, second great night on cruise (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Starting the second day with the sunset on the sundeck will be an unforgettable memory with passengers. After breakfast, continue your trip to tender boat to visit island. You will have all day to discover all this beautiful islands, visit more floating village, visit unique lagoons by row sampan boat or by the kayak, swim in the really water place. Return the the cruise at the late of the day. After dinner, should be squid catching activity. Spend the night on cruise.

Day 3: Ha Long bay, Tuan Chau Marina – Hanoi (breakfast)
The last day will be free on board cruising to other part of the bay, where visitors can see amazing more island in the area of World's wonder. Cruise reach the harbor of Tuan Chau Marina, the shuttle transfer with hotel drop off upon arrival in the capital.
strTitle: 3-Day 2-Night Halong Bay Cruise from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Explore a full day visiting the mysterious Perfume Pagoda, experience a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city and try to learn more about the religious culture of Vietnamese Buddhist as well as immerse in the amazing beauty with the combination between pure green waterway of Yen Stream and impressive sightseeing of Huong Son limestone mountains.

Pick you up at the meeting point, on the way to Perfume Pagoda in 2 hours. Arrive Duc Wharf, move to boat trip along Yen Stream to Thien Tru harbor. First, stop at Trinh Temple in 30 minutes, and then come to Thien Tru while looking at many weird shaped mountains and famous Hoi bridge of Perfume Pagoda. Next, enjoy nearly 2-hour trekking to Huong Tich Cave (or take optional cable in 15 minutes), where Trinh Sam Lord named 5 words “Nam Thien De Nhat Dong” means The First Cave in the South. There is lots of peaceful and beautiful scenery inside the Cave – Huong Tich Pagoda for visitors sightseeing. After that, back to Thien Tru harbor at 12pm to enjoy lunch at the local restaurant, then learn about Buddhism ancient architectural at Le Dynasty. Finally, return to the boat at 4pm, back to Hanoi in 2-hour on road, end your trip with a drop-off around 6pm.
strTitle: Day Trip to Perfume Pagoda from Hanoi

strIntroduction:
Experience 4 hours sightseeing in Hanoi, the capital city of Vietnam. Go through some popular tourist attractions such as the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, The Temple of Literature and Ngoc Son Temple in the heart of Sword Lake.

Welcome to little Hanoi by visiting the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, located in the centre of Ba Dinh Square, where the Great Leader of Vietnam read the Declaration of Independence to father the Democratic Republic of Vietnam. This place is always a memorable historically place to all Vietnamese people, also the site which organizes the important event of the city.

After that, visit The Temple of Literature, constructed in 1070 during Tran dynasty, a significant temple of Confucianism from 10th century in the most peaceful garden surrounded in Hanoi, also the first national university of Vietnam. There still remain 82 turtle steles carving names of Doctors who passed at the royal exams, small scattered pavilions and rock statues standing in the campus with 5 courtyards and 3 pathways inside the main gate.

Finally, come to Ngoc Son Temple on a little island in the northern of Sword Lake, where has famous ancient Turtle Tower, the symbol of capital city Hanoi. The temple is connected to the shore by The Huc Bridge curving like a red shrimp above the green surface of the lake. On the shore, there are Pen Tower, the Ink Slab, the Moon Contemplation Pavilion… surrounded by water and shaded by trees. Tourists can find some antique bells and a glass terrarium that is home to a 250kg turtle.
strTitle: Half-Day Hanoi City Tour

strIntroduction:
at a restaurant. The tour take 8 hours and client can have the flexible departure. And client also can choose some place to go.

After hotel pickup by private vehicle, you're taken to the first cultural site on your discovery tour. Tran Quoc Pagoda is the oldest Buddhist temple in Hanoi, situated on an islet on West Lake. From here, walk with your personal guide to Quan Thanh Temple, considered one of the Four Sacred Temples of the capital.

Next, you'll visit the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, a grand building housing the former leader’s glass sarcophagus, which stands in marked contrast to Ho's traditional stilt house next door. Nearby you'll come to One Pillar Pagoda, an important symbol of Hanoi built by King Ly Thai To in 1049. Continue to the 11th-century Temple of Literature, a significant Confucian temple where formal gardens and pavilions mark the site of Vietnam’s first national university.

After a traditional Vietnamese lunch at a restaurant in the center of Hanoi, visit Ngoc Son Temple on Hoan Kiem Lake, then finish your tour with a 1-hour cyclo ride around the Old Quarter, followed by hotel drop-off.
strTitle: Full-Day Hanoi Capital City Tour

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this memorable shore excursion from where your cruise ship tenders in Paihia. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to delve into the Northern Maori culture from the Ngapuhi confederation of tribes, New Zealand’s largest tribal nation by using the living landscapes and environment as the setting and natural backdrop for your tour.

The best part of your 3 hour tour is done in a Waka taua (traditional Maori war canoe) built from a mixture of composite and traditional materials. You will also visit a Marae (meeting ground), historical sites and learn the age old art of storytelling to share the traditions, customs and the compelling stories of the bygone era.

The activities are both interactive and educational where you will learn the ceremonial chants and haka of the magnificent Waka taua while absorbing the breath-taking natural and stunning beauty of the Waitangi river tidal estuaries, its rain-forest and the cultural living landscapes.

In 2012 this tour gained international recognition and prestige when National Geographic Traveler acknowledged this Maori war canoe voyage and cultural experience as being among “The world’s top 50 tours of a lifetime”.

The Bay of Islands in the deep blue depths of the South Pacific, is the most vibrantly Maori part of New Zealand and is the best possible place to immerse yourself in authentic traditional Maori culture that’s managed to roll with the punches of modernity without losing its color or its soul.

Make your way to the Waitangi boat ramp where you will meet your Ngapuhi guide.

On the first leg of the voyage the waka glides up the tidal estuaries of the Waitangi. In no time you realize this is an experience unlike any other in New Zealand. Engage with your Maori host who shares personal tribal and family histories. Enjoy panoramic views, vibrant and stunning colors that stretch the length of the river banks and beyond. The first leg of the voyage culminates with the arrival in the pool of the Haruru waterfalls. The magic of this place is brought to life by the skillful oratory of our storytellers who accompany you. Although it may seem like 5 minutes you have actually been on voyage for over an hour. 

The epic voyage continues passing by a Marae on the banks of the Waitangi. Here you might meet with local tribal members. You may even have time for a hello and some photo opportunities, view native birds, fish and wildlife. Enjoy your new found family and friends and say farewell with new lifelong memories, Mauri ora.

This 3 hour voyage is the safe and perfect combination of eco and authentic Maori cultural tourism.
strTitle: Shore Excursion: Bay of Islands Maori War Canoe Tour

strIntroduction:
Explore the calm waters of the Waitangi River estuary during a 3-hour voyage on a sturdy traditional canoe captained by an experienced local Maori guide. You'll learn native paddling techniques, visit Haruru Falls and look for wildlife, plus hear about Ngapuhi customs, legends and history. The guide teaches you a traditional war dance and takes you to see a Ngapuhi meeting house where you might get the chance to meet members of this Maori community.

Make your way to the Waitangi boat ramp where you meet your Ngapuhi guide. The Ngapuhi are the largest Maori tribe in New Zealand, and their ancestral home includes the Bay of Islands.

After a safety briefing, receive a life jacket and paddling lesson before stepping on board the 40-foot (12-meter) waka taua, a traditional-style canoe that is stable and sturdy. Set off on your tour through the tidal estuaries of the Waitangi River, traveling through a scenic landscape as you learn paddle techniques and how to maneuver your vessel. Your guide teaches you some Ngapuhi chants and a haka — a war dance that incorporates rhythmic foot-stomping, body slapping and chanting.

In about one hour, you'll arrive at Haruru Falls. Pause in front of the large waterfall to hear about the site’s spiritual significance, and then continue along the river to a marae on the riverside. A marae is the central meeting place of a Maori community and generally encompasses a meeting house decorated with intricate carvings, an open outdoor space, and cooking and eating areas. If you’re lucky, you might meet some of the local people before continuing your canoe tour.

Throughout your experience, you’ll hear stories of the Ngapuhi people, learn about age-old customs and look for local wildlife. After a fascinating three hours, your tour ends back at the starting point.
strTitle: Haruru Falls and Waitangi River Tour on a Traditional Maori Waka with Guide

strIntroduction:
the trail entrance to the Jigokudani Monkey Park, and takes you through farmlands with rice paddies, blueberry fields and apple orchards to a historic hot spring village with a 1300 year history.

The tour course is approximately 9.3 miles (15 km). 80% of the course is downhill while the rest consists of flat roads with some parts moderately uphill. It is a relatively easy course with no prior cycling experience necessary. 

During the tour, a knowledgeable tour leader will provide insight into local culture and history of the region and show you sights unique to the area. You will also get the chance to try local delicacies made by using hot spring sources.

The tour ends at Yudanaka Station where there will be time to experience a refreshing foot spa to rest before continuing your journey!

Tour itinerary:
1:30pm - Start at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info & Gift Shop.
4:00pm - Finish at Yudanaka Station. (Finishing time may vary depending cycling speed, taking photos, etc.)
strTitle: Bike Tour of the Snow Monkey Countryside

strIntroduction:
Soak up the beauty of the mountainous landscape while cycling your way to historic Obuse. After arriving in Obuse, Hokusai's beloved town, stroll around to discover the old town and its regional specialties.

Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between April and November. The dates are subject to change.

Obuse is a small town in northern Nagano Prefecture where you can still feel the atmosphere of Japan’s Edo Period. Obuse is famous as the town where Hokusai Katsushika, the world-famous Japanese artist known for his "Thirty-six Views of Mt Fuji" masterpieces and for various other ukiyo-e paintings, spent the last years of his life. Many of the town’s highlights are related to his work and to the work of his patron, Kozan Takai, the man who accommodated Hokusai during his stay in Obuse. The town has developed into a major tourist destination in the region.

On this Obuse tour, you will cycle approximately 11.8 miles (19km) from Yudanaka Station, the nearest train station to the Jigokudani Monkey Park, to Obuse. On the way down, you will stop by some cultural spots and go past farmland areas to provide insight into local culture. The entire cycle is about 2.5 hours of downhill or flat paved paths. After reaching the town of Obuse, a lunch made of Obuse’s specialty, chestnuts, will be served. Lunch is followed by an introduction of the town and some of its major sightseeing attractions, such as the Gansho-in Temple, historic streets, and famous sake breweries.

The tour concludes at the Obuse train station, where you can either go back to Yudanaka Station or head for Nagano Station.

Tour itinerary:

10am: Meeting/registration at GOEN, the restaurant located in front of Yudanaka Station.
10:15am: The cycling tour begins. You will cycle to some historical and cultural sites to learn about the local culture, while enjoying the countryside and natural scenery.
12:45pm: Arrival at the Gansho-in Temple, the backdoor of Obuse Town. Here you will be shown Hokusai's last masterpiece, a legendary bird drawn on a ceiling as big as 21 tatami mats.
1:30pm: Head to the central area of the Obuse Town to enjoy a delicious local lunch.
2:45pm: A brief walking tour will give you an introduction of the town.
3:15pm: Here you can enjoy free time at the Obuse town. There are many museums, souvenir shops, sake breweries, cafes, etc. to be explored.
4:25pm: Gather at the meeting point, then head to the Obuse train station.
4:30pm: The tour concludes at Obuse station. The train to Yudanaka departs at 4:42pm and the train to Nagano departs at 4:54pm.
strTitle: Full Day Cycling and Sightseeing Tour in Obuse

strIntroduction:
This tour takes you to several sake breweries in Nagano Prefecture where you get the chance to taste many different types of sake and learn about the brewing process as well as its cultural importance of Japan's national drink.

Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between the beginning of April and the end of October. The dates are subject to change.

Learn all there is to know about sake, Japan's beloved alcoholic beverage, on this day tour. Get taken on a journey to some of Nagano Prefecture’s sake breweries and become familiar with the brewing process and the cultural importance of sake.

Your day begins in Yudanaka with a visit to Yamanouchi’s own sake brewery, Tamamura, a place with over 200 years of history. Learn the basics on how to make the rice wine and get invited into tasting some of the specialty sake. After finishing your drink, you will be led back to Yudanaka Station where lunch and a tasting of local sake at Goen will be waiting for you.

With your lunch and first set of sake tasting behind you, the guide will take you on the train to Obuse where two more sake breweries are introduced to you. Obuse is a town famous for its chestnut confectionery and for being the beloved town of Katsushika Hokusai, the ukiyo-e painter best known for his “Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji.” You will have free time to wander around the old town and buy the chestnut ice cream or confectioneries if you’re feeling up for something sweet after all the sake.

After stopping by Obuse, make your way to Nagano City where one more tasting of Japan’s national drink will be waiting for you. At the end of the day, you will be able to call yourself a master of sake tasting.

One thing is for sure: you will get your fill of sake on this day tour.

Tour itinerary:

11am: Meet up in front of the Yudanaka Station and leave for the first sake brewery.
12pm: Get back at Yudanaka Station and enjoy a lunch at GOEN.
1:15pm: Leave for Obuse where two more sake breweries will be visited.
3pm: Enjoy wandering around Obuse in free time after visiting the two Obuse breweries.
3:45pm: Leave for Nagano City where you will be introduced to the last brewery of the tour.
5:30pm: End of the tour
strTitle: Full Day Sake Brewery Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction:
This full day tour brings you to the snow monkeys at the Jigokudani Monkey Park, followed by lunch and snow fun activities. The snow fun par to the tour takes place in the mountainous area of Japan, Shiga-kogen Highland, one of the biggest ski resorts in Japan!

Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between January 1st and March 31st. This tour is limited to groups of 2 people and more.

This tour starts at Nagano Station, and from there you will be taken to the Jigokudani Monkey Park. See the Japanese macaques warming up their bodies by bathing in hot springs. Your guide will tell you interesting facts about the park and the snow monkeys while you stroll around the park. After some time with the snow monkeys, head back for a delicious lunch at the restaurant near the Snow Monkey Park.

After lunch, head all the way up to a ski resort in the Shiga-kogen Highlands, one of the biggest ski areas in Japan. This mountainous area was the scene for the 1998 Winter Olympics and every year a huge amount of snow falls.

Visit the Ichinose ski area, which lies in the middle of the Shiga-kogen Highlands. These ski fields offer slopes with levels from beginner to intermediate, with lengths ranging from 1,000 to 2,000 feet (300 to 600 meters).

At Ichinose, enjoy the snow activity of your choice. Either slide down the slopes by snow sledge, or going up the slope on a ski lift for skiing or snowboarding. There may be some additional costs that can be incurred with discounted price if you are in need of rental gears or winter outfits (for more information about the rental price, please see below).

This tour will take you to the highlights of the Japanese winter. Join this snowy adventure.

Tour Itinerary:
8:45am - Meet at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit.

10am - Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park, where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around.

12:15pm - Have Japanese lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park.

1:45pm - Arrival at the ski resort. After preparations, you can enjoy your preferred snow activities as sledging, skiing, and snowboarding.

4:00pm - The end of snow activity. Prep for departure.

5:40pm - Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 5:50pm.

7pm - Arrive back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: Full Day Snow Monkey and Snow Tour in the Shiga-kogen Highlands in Nagano

strIntroduction:
Get taken all the way from Nagano Station to the world-famous Snow Monkeys and watch them bathe in their hot spring or frolicking around. After your visit to the monkeys, make your way to the historically important Zenko-ji Temple which houses the first Buddhist statue brought to Japan to learn all about the temple's practices and urban legends.

This tour will take you to see the most important attractions of Nagano City and the Yamanouchi area. You will take a scenic route to see the cutest monkeys in the world and afterwards spend time at the temple of Zenkoji and the bustling Nakamise shopping street, as well as having a sake tasting experience at the end.

Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45 am and will lead you to the Yamanouchi region here you get to meet the Japanese snow monkeys. These monkeys are world-famous for their rare habit of bathing in hot springs during winter. When at the Park, the snow monkeys will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys take a stroll along a tranquil forest trail to the lunch cafe. After a delicious lunch you will get back on the road and head to the Zenko-ji Temple.

The temple of Zenkoji is famous for holding the first Buddhist statue brought to Japan. This has made the temple an important pilgrimage site with people coming from all over Japan to pray for their place in Buddhist heaven. Zenkoji Temple has a special energy, and welcomes people of all faiths and religions. The temple grounds have many hidden gems to explore, such as the dark tunnel which runs under the temple. Here you can allegedly gain enlightenment if you find the "Key To Paradise".

After exploring Zenko-ji Temple, the guide will take you to one of Nagano's most historic sake breweries where you get the opportunity to try several types of sake. Nagano is one of the regions in Japan with a very active production of sake. Clean spring water in combination with a climate suitable for rice production creates the optimal environment for high quality sake. You can find yourself a good souvenir at Nagano's beloved sake brewery.

You will be taken back to Nagano Station where the tour concludes at 5pm.

Tour Itinerary:
8:45am: Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit.
10am: Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around.
12:15pm: Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park.
1pm: Leave the lunch restaurant and get taken to the historically important Zenko-ji Temple.
2:15pm: See the sights of the Zenko-ji Temple and learn the interesting facts. Enjoy up to 30 minutes of shopping on Nakamise Street.
4pm: Visit a sake brewery and enjoy tasting different types of sake.
4:45pm: Get on the bus and arrive back to Nagano station by 5pm.
strTitle: Full-Day Tour of Snow Monkeys, Zenko-ji Temple and Sake in Nagano

strIntroduction:
Stroll through a scenic forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to see the Japanese macaques frolicking around. You will eat lunch at a restaurant nearby the Park followed by a cycling tour into the regional countryside and through an historic hot spring town.

This tour will take you to see the world-famous Snow Monkeys that reside in Jigokudani followed by a bicycle ride through the countryside. 

Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45am. From Nagano Station, get taken to the Snow Monkey Park in Yudanaka. The region's snow monkeys are world-famous for their habit of soaking in hot springs during winter. These amazing macaques will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. 

After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys, stroll along a forest trail to a nearby restaurant where you will enjoy lunch before heading off to the Japanese countryside and a historic hot spring town by bicycle.

The route takes you mostly downhill through the Japanese countryside past rice paddies, apple orchards and rivers, as well as takes you to the old town of Shibu Onsen which has a history of over 1300 years with its hot springs. You will also have the chance to taste some local onsen town delicacies. 
You will learn about the history and culture of the region while riding your bike past rice paddies, orchards, and many more panoramic sights. The tour ends at Yudanaka Station where you can get the train back to Nagano Station or before getting on the train, take a relaxing foot bath for free!

Tour itinerary:
8:45am
Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit.

10am
Welcome to the Snow Monkey area!
Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around.

12:15pm
Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park!

1pm
Leave the lunch restaurant and get ready to see the Japanese countryside on bicycle! 

1:30pm
Start at the Snow Monkey Resorts Info & Gift Shop.

4pm
Arrive at the Yudanaka Station and get on the train back to Nagano. No need to cycle back up the hill. The train leaves from Yudanaka to Nagano Station at 16:43. (Finishing time may vary depending cycling speed, taking photos, etc.)

5:30pm
Arrival back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: Snow Monkey and Cycling Day Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction:
Nagano Prefecture's Togakushi is famous for its nature, soba (buckwheat noodles), shrines, and its history of ninja. Get taken on a hike though the region's rich nature followed by a traditional lunch and a visit to the Ninja House. Learn more about Japan's indigenous Shinto religion through the explanations of a knowledgeable guide.

The tour starts with a hike through a beautiful forest and past several lakes. Discover various types of wild plants and flowers as you walk along the hiking trail to Kagami-ike Lake with its stunning view of Mt. Togakushi. On days with no wind, you can see Mt. Togakushi reflected on the water's surface. You will also pass by a panoramic spot where you can enjoy a view of the Japanese Alps.

After a 2 hour hike, it is time for a lunch of Soba, or buckwheat noodles in English. It is a traditional dish for people in Nagano, and Togakushi especially is known for the distinctive taste of their soba made with region's clean mountain water. The dish comes with shrimp and seasonal vegetables tempura.

After lunch, take the bus to the entrance of pilgrimage path to the Togakushi Okusha Shrine. While the entire Togakushi area is regarded as sacred to followers of Shintoism, Togakushi Okusha Shrine is the most important place within the region and the very end of the regional pilgrimage. Approximately 300 Cryptomeria trees are lined beautifully along the pilgrimage path. It is more than impressive enough to make visitors ponder the sacredness of Japanese Shintoism.

After walking back from the Okusha Shrine, it is time for some recreation and learning at the Ninja Folklore Museum. At the museum, you will not only learn about the history and techniques used by the Togakushi ninja, you can also give escaping a ninja house filled with hidden doors and tricks a go. 


Tour itinerary:

9am
Meet at Nagano station directly in front of the Shinkansen exit at the information board towards the East Exit.
 - Take the bus towards Togakushi.
 - Start the hike through the forest trail with several ponds and mountain views.

12:45pm
Eat lunch at a local soba restaurant
 - Take the bus to Togakushi Shrine and walk past the Japanese cedars.
 - Go to the Ninja House that also holds a Ninja Folklore Museum.

5pm
Go back by bus to Nagano Station.

6:30pm
Arrive back at Nagano Station.
strTitle: Full Day Togakushi Nature Hike and Ninja Tour

strIntroduction:
This tour takes you from Yudanaka Station to the Snow Monkey Park via a panoramic walking route. You will have up to an hour of free time to enjoy the monkeys at Jigokudani Monkey Park. After you visit the snow monkeys, eat lunch at a nearby restaurant and get cycle back to Yudanaka Station by a different route.

The tour starts at 10am at the Japanese restaurant Goen, found in front of Yudanaka Station. Take a walk through a hillside path where you can absorb the beautiful nature Japan has to offer. 

After the forest walk you will arrive at Shibu Onsen where you can soak up the history and scenery of the historic hot spring town. The walk continues past the river and some panoramic views and concludes at the Jigokudani Monkey Park.

The Jigokudani Monkey Park is famous for its monkeys, as they are the only monkeys known to mankind that bathe in a hot spring. The monkeys don't enter the baths as much during the green season, but they are still lovely to see with their new-born babies. After the monkey park, you head back down the mountain via a different route to a delicious little restaurant for lunch.

Tour itinerary:

10am: Start/registration at GOEN, in front of Yudanaka Station.  Head on a forest trail for around 30 minutes to the statue of Heiwa Kannon. Go to Shibu Onsen, learn about its history and stories, and you can challenge yourself to eating an onsen egg. Hike for 30 minutes towards the Jigokudani Monkey Park while learning about the area and its inhabitants.
12pm: Spend about an hour at the Jigokudani Monkey Park.
1:30pm: Hike back down a different route and enjoy a delicious lunch at ENZA Cafe.
2:30pm: Take up the bicycle and start the cycling part.
4pm: Return at Yudanaka Station

Lunch is followed by a cycle through the Yamanouchi countryside past rice paddies, rivers and fruit orchards. The tour concludes at Yudanaka Station where you can choose to relax your tired feet in a free hot foot bath, relax at the restaurant Goen, or simply head back to Nagano by train.
strTitle: Walking and Cycling Day Tour in Nagano to Visit the Snow Monkeys

strIntroduction:
See the famous Japanese snow monkeys frolicking around and then get off the beaten track to hike your way up to the Shiga Highlands. Discover the flora and fauna of the Snow Monkey and Shiga region while absorbing the mountain scenery.

See the famous Japanese Macaques and hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands on this guided day tour.

The day starts with the meet-up at Nagano Station. From there, your guide will take you to the entrance of the Jigokudani Monkey Park and lead you to where the monkeys are be roaming around. These monkeys are famous all over the world for their tendency to bathe in the hot springs found at the park. The guide will tell you all of the facts and features that you would want to know about the fuzzy creatures.

After some quality time with the snow monkeys, the guide will take you to a restaurant close to the park entrance where you can rest your feet and enjoy a Japanese lunch.

After recouping your energy with lunch, the hike to the Shiga-kogen Highlands starts. You will hike 2.8 miles (4.0 km) up the Shiga-kogen Highlands to an altitude of 4900 feet (1500 m). Here, you can see the mountainous area where the snow monkeys and many other of Japanese indigenous animals reside. A knowledgeable guide will walk you through the various flora and fauna to be seen as you walk past the 33 Buddhist Kannon statues that have the function of protecting travelers passing by.

The Shiga-kogen Highlands is one of the most famous ski resorts in Japan, and was the setting for the 1998 Winter Olympics. It has more ski slopes than one can count. During the summer, however, the vast highlands are revealed in their green glory. On this hike, you will walk to the tallest waterfall of the Shiga-kogen Highlands and go past several of the famous lakes of the Shiga area.

The hike ends near Hasuike lake where you can see one of the biggest ski slopes in the area. From here, the guide will lead you back to Yudanaka Station where you can enjoy the onsen bath located next to the station. 

The hike to the Monkey Park and Shiga-kogen has impressive sights and scenery, whether it is cloudy or sunny. Be prepared though; the tracks are quite narrow and could be muddy. Good hiking shoes are highly advised! 

Tour itinerary:

8:45am
Gather at the Shinkansen exit of Nagano Station. Our staff will be there by 8:30am.

11am
Wander around the Jigokudani Monkey Park.

12:15pm
Have a lunch at the restaurant nearby the Jigokudani Monkey Park entrance.

1pm
Start the hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands.

3:30pm
Take a break with the backdrop of the tallest waterfall of the Shiga Highlands.

4:15pm
Arrival at the Biwaike Lake and walk the trail around.

5pm
Arrival at the Hasuike Lake and enjoy the view of a highland's ski resort. Take the bus back to Yudanaka.

5:35pm
Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 5:50pm (or 6:20pm) and arrives at Nagano at 6:59pm (or 7:24pm).
strTitle: Snow Monkey and Shiga-kogen Highlands Hiking Day Tour

strIntroduction:
This course is intended for the complete beginner or novice climber, who would like to learn the skills of safe rock climbing. The aim is to give you a simple, safe, effective and versatile system for rock climbing, which should allow you to develop your own climbing at the end of the course.

It is ideal for people who climb regularly indoors and want to gain experience and transfer skills to the more serious outdoor environment of multi-pitch climbing.


The course can be adapted to give useful preparation for the Alps, as it will give you a firm grasp of moving efficiently on technical ground and also a solid foundation of skills for security on steeper and more exposed rock terrain.
strTitle: Climbing day in Leysin

strIntroduction:
The educational method is accessible to all and made for everyone to evolve on an autonomous level across the different steps. It is a progressive and pragmatic training that combines theory and practice. The participant will keep the course support during practical exercises. Exams and questionnaires in throughout the various steps complete the program and allow each participant to evaluate their level of knowledge and adopt the right behaviour in the mountains.

This training is based on a balance of entertainment and education. Learning while having fun! 

ISTA differentiates itself with a unique methodology that places the individual in the centre.

The ISTA concept
The ISTA concept is unique and innovative, it is based on 4 pillars:
1) A unique language for everyone
2) A certified progressive training
3) The HFSA® – Human Factor Self-Assessment® (a human factor self-assessment system)
4) The BDA® system

BEFORE: Gaining knowledge, knowing how to manage and prevent risks
DURING: Master and target fighting spirit during an avalanche
AFTER: Positively and successfully manage the crisis

Trainings
100% created by mountain professionals and experts, ISTA is an international training program destined to winter sports practitioners all around the world. Our program provides the basics for anyone to evolve safely and freely with the pleasure of practising off-piste sports, whether on skis, ski touring, snowboard, heliski, snowshoes or snow bike. ISTA is based on an international certification system using a step-by-step method.
strTitle: Avalanche Training Course in Leysin

strIntroduction:
Perched like a crown overlooking the attractive city of Alicante is the bewitching Santa Barbara Castle. On this 3-hour tour, access parts of the fortress that are usually off limits to most visitors. Start with a 1-hour guided tour visiting the dungeons and cisterns, while hearing the sinister stories of events that happened here. Then visit Volvo Ocean Race museum. Finally, sit down and enjoy a traditional lunch that includes salad, paella and a drink.

Santa Barbara Castle is a true relic from the Middle Ages, and this tour is one of the best ways to learn about its long history, which dates back to the 9th century.
Depending on your time of arrival at the castle, perhaps choose to start with a 1-hour guided tour (departures at 11am and 12:30pm) of the dungeons and cisterns of the castle. This part of the tour allows you to access some parts of the citadel that are normally off limits to visitors.
Then, may choose to go to the top of the castle for jaw-dropping views of Alicante before taking in the exhibition at the Volvo Ocean Race museum.
Finally, tuck into a traditional lunch of salad and paella, washed down with a beer, wine, water or soda.

Please note: A minimum of two people per booking is required.
strTitle: Santa Barbara Castle and Volvo Ocean Race Museum Tour in Alicante

strIntroduction:
Sun-splashed Alicante is a mecca for great food and wine. This 2-hour gourmet food walking tour offers a delicious introduction to all that is edible in this cobblestone street–laced Spanish town. With a professional guide, sample everything from salted fish, nougat, cured meat, olive oil, sweet biscuits and, of course, local wine, which has long been noted for its superior quality. And if that’s not enough, you'll also learn all about the history of the region from the professional guide.

The area around Alicante has been inhabited for more than 7,000 years. That’s a lot of time for the people of this region to perfect their food and drink — and that they have. This 2-hour walking tour comfortably traverses the narrow cobblestone lanes of this city of 333,000 people, revealing all that is delicious and unique.

Start by drinking some horchata, one of the oldest beverages in the world, drunk by the pharaohs of ancient Egypt. Made with chufa or tiger nut, the drink was introduced to Spain during the Muslim presence on the peninsula from the 8th to the 13th centuries.

While strolling down the narrow streets of the city, learn about the history of the place from the local guide. There are many unique eats here. Try freshly backed coca de mollitas, a salty tart with a crumbled dough topping, and coca amb tonyina, a tuna-based pastry that is way more delicious than it sounds.

Other products to try include olive oil, cured meat, and salted fish, a dish that goes back to the ancient Roman occupation. You'll also sample Alicante's renowned wine. French monarch King Louis XIV apparently asked for some Alicante wine on his deathbed and Queen Elizabeth I was said to love wine from the area.

In the end, you’ll not only have an excellent primer on the food and drink of Alicante, you’ll have a belly full of high quality eats.
strTitle: Alicante Gourmet Walking Tour

strIntroduction:
Private tour through the fortress of Alicante. To begin this experience, a tour guide who will teach all the anecdotes that occurred within the walls of this castle. After that a typical lunch of Alicante will be waiting for you in front of the most beautiful views of the bay.

Live a unique experience. Live Alicante differently. Enjoy a private tour through the fortress of Alicante. To begin this experience, you will receive a tour guide who will teach all the anecdotes that occurred within the walls of this castle.

The tour starts with a 1 hour-guided tour, visiting the Santa Barbara´s Castle, where the participants will know the hidden corners of the fortress to know the darker and sinister stories about the events experienced in the Castle since the 9th century. The visit will end in the top of the Castle (called Macho), which offers the most beautiful views over the bay of Alicante province.

After 1 hour of visit, a table in the best area of the terrace of the Castle restaurant will be waiting for you. There you can enjoy one of the most traditional dishes of our province: A rice (paella) paired with an authentic wine from Alicante Designation of Origin (MO from Sierra Salinas Winery).
strTitle: Private Santa Barbara Castle Tour in Alicante

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a 1.5-hour segway tour in Alicante with your family and friends. You will make your way through the city's Old Town and will then head towards the famous beach promenade.

This 1.5-hour segway tour is an experience like no other. You will enjoy an amazing sightseeing trip from the Old Town of the city down to the beach and harbour area.
No previous experience is needed as you will learn fast how to ride your segway with the help and guidance of your guide.

You will pass by Alicante's landmarks and hot spots  such as: Basilica of Santa Maria; Postiguet beach; Palace of Carbonell; Port area; various Museums; Plaza Miro; breath taking corners of the Old Town; Castle of Santa Barbara; Oldest parks in the city; famous walk - Explanada de España; and more.You receive hints and tips of the city from your guide. Discover the local atmosphere and the streets of this city with your friends, family and rest of travelers.
strTitle: Alicante City Segway Tour

strIntroduction:
This 3-hour segway tour will take you through Alicante's hot spots on the beach, port and Old Town areas. Explore this coastal city and immerse yourself in the local atmosphere while listening to your guide's historical and cultural tips.

After meeting your guide at the departure point and receiving a security brief, hop on your segway and start this 3-hour experience.

You will head towards the Old Town area to admire the main landmarks of this city. From there you will make your way to the beach and port area as you cross through the main promenade and an urban park located right in the middle of the city.

Either if you know how to ride a segway or not, this will be an incredible experience. Feel the sun and the sea breeze as you make your way through Alicante with the explanations of your local guide.

At the end of the tour you will return back to the departure point.
strTitle: Alicante Segway XXL Tour

strIntroduction:
Combine a segway tour with a tapas and drinks tasting with this 2-hour experience. Discover Alicante's hidden corners and enjoy tapas and drinks as a local would do. Your guide will take you around the city and will take you through the best known areas for visiting and having a tapa.

Meet your guide at the designed start point and ride your segway through the Old Town and Ramblas areas for around 30 minutes. Discover the city centre's landmarks and atmosphere as your guide shows you around and goes through some historical events that took place in the visited areas.
From there, you will be taken to a local tapas bar where you will enjoy incredible tapas and drinks with the help of your guide. Learn which are the best known dishes and refreshments from this Spanish region and learn their local names as you recharge your batteries to continue with the tour in the later evening.
You will then head towards the harbour maritime district to discover the amazing coastline of this city. Once the itinerary comes to its end, you will head back to the starting point.
strTitle: Alicante Segway Tapas Tour

strIntroduction:
Book this 1-hour segway tour and enjoy the sights of the city's Old Town, maritime district and harbor as the sun is setting on the horizon. Amaze at the views and take spectacular pictures of your experience to take back home and remember your stay in Alicante.

Nothing is more captivating than watching the sunset in Alicante's Old Town. The light, shadows, sounds, and aroma's thrill the senses. In this tour you will be visiting all the hot spots of the city center, the maritime district and harbor.

Hop on your segway and discover this city's landmarks whilst your guide gives you a short historical or cultural hint of each visited place.

Enjoy a truly different experience as the sun begins to set in this coastal city and as you learn facts of this region and its people, take spectacular pictures and have fun riding your segway.
strTitle: Alicante Segway Sunset Tour

strIntroduction:
Make life easy, book a Private Airport Transfer before you go and save on all the hassle when you arrive. We have 6 seater air-conditioned vehicles with English speaking drivers ready to take you to your hotel in Phuket or to take you back to the airport.

Your friendly representative will be holding up a sign with your name on it at either the international or domestic exit gates. He will then take you to the driver who will whisk you away to your resort. No fuss. No hassles. We can also provide you a private transfer back to the airport if the option is selected.

Meeting Point at Phuket International Airport

  1. The customer flies with International Direct flight to Phuket airport new terminal gate no. 2
  2. The customer who fly International and change the flight in Bangkok Airport the plane will at new terminal.
  3. The customers who fly domestic will be arrive to the old terminal and we will be waiting for you at gate no.2 which is next to TMB Exchange counter.
strTitle: Private Airport Transfer in Phuket

strIntroduction:
Make life easy, book a Private Airport Transfer before you go and save on all the hassle when you arrive. We have 6 seater air-conditioned vehicles with English speaking drivers ready to take you to your hotel in Khao Lak or the Phuket International Airport.

Booking your private airport transfer in advance will ensure you stay relaxed and to avoid the hassle of lugging your baggage at the airport.

At your arrival airport, you will see our friendly representative holding up a sign at the exit gates with your name on it. He will confirm your booking, then take you to the English speaking driver who will whisk you away to your resort with your selected SUV or minivan in comfort. We can cater for large group or families as well.

You may also want to arrange a one-way private transfer from your Khao Lak Resort to the Phuket International Airport.
strTitle: Private Airport Transfer in Khao Lak

strIntroduction:
Enjoy this hassle-free private airport arrival transfer and travel in AC vehicle from the airport to your hotel in Pattaya, accompanied by an English-speaking driver.

Upon arrival at Bangkok Airport, you will be greeted by a representative holding up a sign with your name on it. You will be greeted at either the international or domestic exit gate, depending on your flight.

You will then be taken to your driver who will whisk you away to your hotel in an air-conditioned, safe vehicle.

Multiple options for this tour depending on the number of people in your group and whether you want hotel to airport or airport to hotel transfers.
strTitle: Private Airport Transfer: Bangkok to Pattaya

strIntroduction:
Make life a bit easier and book a private airport transfer to your hotel before your flight to Bangkok. We have air-conditioned vehicles with English speaking drivers ready to take you to your Hua Hin hotel upon landing at either Bangkok Airport (BKK) or Don Muang Airport (DMK).

Our friendly representative will be holding up a sign with your name on it at either the international or domestic exit gates. He will then take you to the driver who will whisk you away to your Hua Hin resort. No fuss. No hassles.
strTitle: Private Round-Trip Bangkok Airport Transfer to Hua Hin Hotels

strIntroduction:
Treat your group to a private and personalized 4-hour tour of Phuket. Your driver will make sure you see all the key attractions and sites. After that, you will be able to drive around at your own pace while seeing particular sites you want to see.

You will be collected from your Phuket hotel by your driver at approximately 9am.

Starting with the Phuket View Point, take in the view of the 3 famous beaches Kata, Karon and Patong. Visit Promthep Cape with the magnificent view of the southern offshore islands and the perfect half moon bay.

Head out to visit Big Buddha which is built from White Marble on top of the hill and a then pay a visit to Wat Chalong, the most reverend temple on the island. Now it time for a leisurely drive around Phuket town and its Sino-Portuguese historic buildings built by late 19th-century.

At approximately 1pm, you will be delivered back to your hotel safely, with good knowledge of the city.

The above is a suggested itinerary. You can amend this however you wish to see the sites you want to see.
strTitle: Private 4-Hour Customized Tour of Phuket

strIntroduction:
Immerse yourself in the legendary beauty of Ao Phang Nga National Park, known for its striking limestone karst formations, picturesque beaches, and Hollywood history. This day trip from Phuket takes you kayaking at two islands of Phang Nga Bay with a guide and boat crew. Paddle to the lagoons and caves of Hong and Panak islands, and enjoy a buffet lunch, snacks, and beverages.

After pickup from your hotel in Phuket by air-conditioned minibus, you're transferred to the pier to depart for Ao Phang Nga National Park. You will be briefed on safety aspects of the tour, then ride a boat to the beach at Lawa Island. You can start your favorite water sports here, such as kayaking, swimming, or laying in the sun.

After about 45 minutes of time at your leisure, a delicious lunch is served at midday, including and beverages such as soft drinks, coffee, tea, fresh juice, and water.

Then it's off to Phang Nga Bay for a kayaking excursion to two islands: Hong Island, with its interior lagoon and shoreline of white sand and clear water, and Panak Island, where your guide paddles with you into a spectacular limestone cave hung with craggy stalactites. Afterward, move on to James Bond Island (Khao Phing Kan) for another visit.

When it's time, relax for the 1.5-hour boat ride back to the pier and a return transfer to your hotel.

Please note: Itinerary may be subject to change depending on tidal and weather conditions.
strTitle: Phang Nga Bay Day Trip from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Take a sunrise trip to Phi Phi Island from Phuket and avoid the afternoon crowds. Snorkel and swim in the crystal-clear waters of Maya Bay and Bamboo Island, and get up close to the marine life amid corals in the underwater world. Visit Monkey Beach and savor a buffet lunch. Round-trip hotel transport and all necessary equipment included. 

You will be picked up at your hotel lobby in the early morning between 6am and 6:15am for transfer to the Royal Phuket Marina Pier. Board the boat and depart for Phi Phi Island; with an early start you'll avoid the later crowds.

After about a 1.5-hour ride, visit Phi Phi Leh and Maya Bay, which features plenty of sunshine and pristine shoreline against a scenic backdrop made famous as the movie site for The Beach, filmed here in 1998. Explore the stunning bay, sheltered by 328-foot-high (100-meter) cliffs on three sides, and snorkel in the lagoon. 

Afterward, your guide takes you sightseeing to a few different locations with more snorkeling in crystal-clear waters. First, visit Loh Samah Bay, which is separated from Maya Beach by a thin limestone wall; a small hole cut into the rock makes it possible to crawl through. Slowly continue on to Viking Cave, inhabited by nesting swifts. Your guide brings the boat close to the entrance so you can peer inside and take photos. 

Cruise pat the cliffs of Pileh Lagoon, which is only accessible at high tide. At the the hidden cove of Monkey Bay, you'll find a colony of macaques at Monkey Beach that climb onto the legs of visitors in search of bananas.

A buffet lunch is served around noon, before you continue to the sandy beach and crystalline waters of Bamboo Island, a flat evergreen escape. Continue snorkeling then soak up the sun and sights on the return boat trip to Phuket, where the tour concludes with hotel drop-off in the afternoon.

Return to Royal Phuket Marina Pier by 3.30pm
strTitle: Phi Phi Island Sunrise Trip from Phuket

strIntroduction:
Pamper yourself with a pre-booked package at the Orientala Wellness Spa in Phuket. Your treatment lasts 2.5 hours, starting with a 1-hour herbal aromatherapy massage. Rejuvenate sore feet during 30 minutes of foot reflexology and complete your blissful session with a 1-hour Aloe Vera Gold facial. A round-trip transfer is included from Patong-area hotels.

Meet your driver at your selected hotel and transfer to the Orientala Wellness Spa in Phuket, where wellness traditions are rooted in Thai traditional medicine. On arrival, your spa treatment begins with a 1-hour aromatherapy massage. Sink deeper into relaxation while your practitioner expertly applies gentle pressure and uses stroking movements to calm and soothe your body.

Continue the pampering with a 30-minute foot reflexology treatment and a 1-hour Aloe Vera Gold facial, and take a break for an included refreshment.

After 2.5 hours delighting your senses, relax with a return transfer to your hotel in Patong.
strTitle: Orientala Wellness Spa Experience with Round-Trip Transfer in Patong

strIntroduction:
Damnoen Saduak Floating Market is a must-see on any itinerary from Bangkok. Experience the traditional Thai way of selling and buying fruits, vegetables, and other goods from wooden boats on the canals. Travel there by vehicle and speedboat, with about 1.5 hours to spend at the market. Round-trip hotel transport is included.

After you're picked up from your Bangkok hotel, board your tour vehicle and travel west to Damnoen Saduak Floating Market, located 68 miles (110 km) from Bangkok. The rural drive takes you past rice paddies and salt fields. En route, visit a farmhouse and see how sugar is produced from coconuts.

Your tour continues with a 30-minute speedboat ride past fruit plantations and Thai-style houses that showcase a traditional way of life along the riverbanks. Arriving at Damnoen Saduak Floating Market, observe wooden boats overflowing with flowers and fresh produce, which vendors sell to people on shore. Let your guide know if you'd like to hire a small boat for a closer look, or try your hand at bargaining with local merchants.

After roughly 1.5 hours here, you'll make the return journey to Bangkok where your tour ends with drop-off at your hotel.
strTitle: Damnoen Saduak Floating Market Tour from Bangkok

strIntroduction:
Pre-book your one-way arrival transfer from Phuket International or Domestic Airport to Phi Phi Island by ferry. Our English speaking driver will transport you from Phuket Airport by an air-conditioned vehicles. Then, you will embark on the ferry heading to Ton Sai Pier (Phi Phi Island) from Phuket. Stay relax and avoid the long queue navigate a taxi at the airport.

There are four departure times for the ferry from Phuket Rassada pier: 8:30am,11:00am, 1:30pm, and 3pm. Please note that for airport pick up, the flight must be arrive 3 hours prior to ferry departure to avoid missing the ferry.

A representative will be holding up a sign with your name at the Phuket International or Domestic Airport Exit Gates. He will then take you to the driver who will whisk you away to your Phi Phi resort. No fuss. No hassles.

The price includes a private airport transfer from Phuket airport to Rassada pier and one-way ferry ticket from Phuket pier to Ton Sai pier (Phi Phi Island). You need to make your own arrangement or transfer from Ton Sai Pier to your resort in Phi Phi Island.

There are four departure times from Phuket Rassada Pier to Phi Phi Island, 8:30am,11:00am, 1:30pm, and 3pm. Please note that all tourists arriving on the island need to pay a 20-bath fee at Ton Sai Pier to assist in keeping Koh Phi Phi clean.

Each traveler is allowed a maximum of 1 suitcase and 1 carry-on bag. Oversized or excessive luggage (e.g. surfboards, golf clubs or bikes) may have certain restrictions, please inquire with the operator prior to travel to confirm if your excess luggage is acceptable.
strTitle: One-Way Arrival Transfer from Phuket Airport to Phi Phi Island by Ferry

strIntroduction:
Make life a bit easier and book a private airport arrival transfer before your flight to Phuket. We have air-conditioned vehicles with English speaking drivers ready to take you to your Krabi hotel upon landing at Phuket International airport. Please note that the price is per car.

Our friendly representative will be holding up a sign with your name on it at either the international or domestic exit gates. He will then take you to the driver who will whisk you away to your Krabi resort. No fuss. No hassles.

It will take approximately 3-hour drive from Phuket International Airport to Krabi hotel. Rest assure that your safety is our top priority, so sit back and stay relax.

This transfer service include the hotel located outside Ao Nang area, such as Sheraton Krabi Beach Resort, Nakamanda Resort & Spa, Sofitel Phokeethra Krabi, The Tubkaak Krabi, Amari Vogue Resort and Phulay Bay a Ritz-Carlton.

Please note that the service is not applicable for passengers staying at hotels on Lanta Island, such as Pimalai Bay Resort & Spa, Layana Resort and Chada Lanta.

Those who are staying on Lanta Island are required to book transfer direct with the hotel when making room reservation.
strTitle: One-Way Private Arrival Transfer from Phuket Airport to Krabi Hotel

strIntroduction:
Make life a bit easier and book a private airport arrival transfer before your flight to Chiang Mai. We have air-conditioned vehicles with English speaking drivers ready to take you to your Chiang Mai hotel upon landing at airport.

Our friendly representative will be holding up a sign with your name on it at either the international or domestic exit gates. He will then take you to the driver who will whisk you away to your Chiang Mai resort. No fuss, no hassles and price is per car.

When you make the booking please provide your arrival flight number, arrival time, your hotel name and your contact information. Otherwise your transfer will not be confirmed.

Each traveler is allowed a maximum of 1 suitcase and 1 carry-on bag. Oversized or excessive luggage (e.g. surfboards, golf clubs or bikes) may have certain restrictions, please inquire with the operator prior to travel to confirm if your excess luggage is acceptable.

Enjoy speedy, personalized service with this private airport arrival transfer to your hotel in Chiang Mai.
strTitle: One-Way Private Arrival Transfer from Chiang Mai Airport to Chiang Mai Town Hotel

strIntroduction:
Pre-book your transfer from Phuket hotel to Phi Phi Island by ferry. You will be picked up from your hotel lobby by our professional driver to Phuket Rassada Pier. Embark to the ferry and head to the Phi Phi Island, our service end at the Ton Sai Pier (Phi Phi Island).

There are 2 pier in Phi Phi Island call Ton Sai Pier and Leam Tong Pier. If you are staying at Zeavola Resort, Holiday Inn Resort Phi Phi Island, Phi Phi Erawan Plam resort and Phi Phi Natural Resort please choose tour grade for Leam Tong Pier ONLY.

There are 4 departure times available from Phuket Rassada Pier, 8:30am, 11am,1:30pm and 3pm.

There are 2 departure times available from Tonsai pier or Leam Tong pier to Rassada Pier at 9am and 2pm.

This transfer service include hotel pickup for passengers staying at selected hotels in Phuket. We can arrange hotel pickup for other locations with extra charge (pay cash to the driver). The ferry ticket is for one-way transfer, and service end at the Ton Sai Pier (Phi Phi Island).  You can book your own transfer from the pier to Phi Phi Island resorts.

Please provide your name, hotel name and contact information to ensure smooth booking process.

Please note that you need to pay THB 20 per person for garbage collection fee when you entered to Phi Phi Island.

Each traveler is allowed a maximum of 1 suitcase and 1 carry-on bag. Oversized or excessive luggage (e.g. surfboards, golf clubs or bikes) may have certain restrictions, please inquire with the operator prior to travel to confirm if your excess luggage is acceptable.
strTitle: One-Way Transfer from Phuket Hotel to Phi Phi Island by Ferry

strIntroduction:
Enjoy a delightful and unusual afternoon and evening tour with great appeal to those who love nature. Drive to Ao Por pier to board a comfortable twin engine cruiser and enjoy a Thai style light lunch before exploring Phang Nga’s fascinating cave and Hong (cave with the sky opening). Thai seafood buffet dinner and round-trip hotel transportation is included.

Our driver and professional guide will pick you up from your hotel in Phuket around 10:45am and head to Ao Por Pier. Embark in the modern twin-engine boat and a short briefing will be provided. Light lunch will be served around 1:30pm aboard. After lunch, your guide will paddles you through Tidal Nape inside Phang Nga Bay’s marine limestone karstic island into Hong.

Explore caves around Pang Nga Bays with your guide or take your time to swim or go sea canoe with your own paddler this area. Experience some unique and interesting marine geography of the hongs as well as spot wildlife including monkeys, birds and fish. Then, take the opportunity to make your own Kratong (banana leave with candles) and have fun with your friends while watching beautiful sun setting by the Phang Nga Bay.

After dark the magic deepens further and to conclude this truly memorable experience, enjoys delicious Thai seafood buffet under the stars before returning to Ao Por for transportation back to your resort around 9pm. All guides have first aid/CPR training, international standard sea kayak and caving training.

Itinerary
12:30pm – 1:30pm: Hotel Pick-up
1:30pm:  Arrive Ao Por and boarding to our modern twin-engine escort boat, Thai style light lunch, trip and nature game briefing
2:30pm: Arrive the island and explore 1-2 caves and hongs
3:30pm: Return to the escort boat and move to the second island
4pm: Explore two more caves and hongs
5pm: Self-paddle, swimming and make your own Kratong during Phang nga Bay sunset
7pm: Return to a previously visited Hong after dark and launch your own Kratong
8pm: Depart Ao Por. Thai Seafood buffet dinner. Play star game on the star light deck
9pm: Arrive to the pier and transfer back to your hotel
strTitle: Hong by Starlight from Phuket including Thai Seafood Buffet

strIntroduction:
Pre-booking this 2-hour Orientala Spa during your holiday in Phuket, Thailand. This package starts with a 1-hour Thai aromatherapy massage followed by 1-hour of foot reflexology treatment. Round-trip hotel transportation from Patong is included.

Our driver will pick you up from your hotel lobby in Patong area at agreed time and head to the spa center. Upon arrival, you will start with a 1 hour Thai aromatherapy massage. Sink deeper into relaxation while your practitioner expertly applies gentle pressure and uses stroking movements to calm and soothe your body.

Then, our professional therapist will continue the pampering with a 60-minute foot reflexology treatment and take a break for an included refreshment.

Please note that the package cannot be combined with any other offers or promotion and the consumption of alcohol or heavy meals before or during spa treatment is not recommended.

If you have any health or physical considerations that may affect your treatments or activities at the spa, please do let us know in advance. If you have any medical complication, we recommend you to consult with your doctor before having any treatments. The spa treatments and services facilities received or utilized with our spa are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure or prevent any disease and are not intended to be substituted for professional medical treatment.

After the relaxing massage, our driver will transfer you back to your hotel safely.

strIntroduction:
Visit the Red Light Secrets Museum in Amsterdam and step into an intriguing world that remains hidden for most. Skip-the-line and discover the secrets of Amsterdam's Red Light District in the world’s only Museum of Prostitution.

Make your way to the center of Amsterdam, where the Red Light District is located. Here, you will find an intriguing attraction about the oldest profession in the world at the Red Light Secrets Museum of Prostitution.

Step into a world that remains hidden for most and learn about the history of prostitution as well as listen to the secrets told at the museum. Enjoy this unique opportunity to peek inside the hidden world of prostitution at a 17th century monumental canal house.
strTitle: Skip the Line: Red Light Secrets Museum in Amsterdam

strIntroduction:
Discover and experience Normandy apple cider and Calvados brandy. Guided by a specialist, meet local passionate producers. Tastings and entrances included.

Normandy has preserved the tradition of this ancient beverage. Long considered as poor people's brewage, quality has improved and it is now worth as much as wine. Its interest in cooking, as an apertif or a drink to pair a meal is now a widely recognized. It is a must on gourmet's tables. Cider is also the base product to make the world famous Calvados liquor.

This cider tour is a unique opportunity to (re) discover these iconic drinks of Normandy and the link to their terroir.

Our tour is the result of a strong attraction for cider and its manufacturing process. We have developed this route for you to go beyond the traditional duo "visit-tasting tour". Cider products of the Auge country are the result of a territory, a climate and an expertise. They are typical and genuine. They can claim the "terroir product" mention such as Bordeaux wines. It is this notion of terroir and typicality that you will discover with us and the producers.

Our cider route allows you to discover:

"Pays d'Auge" cider,
Perry of the Auge country
Pommeau (aperitif)
Calvados of the Auge country (liquor)

The tour includes an aproach according your cravings (technical, gustatory or historical). The discovery of the "Auge country" and its history along the road as well as a visit of 4 production areas. There will be comparison tastings associated with other local products and personal explanation booklets of products, areas visited and a map of the region. There's an opportunity to buy live from the producer at local prices (lower than anywhere else).
strTitle: Apple Cider Tour from Caen

strIntroduction:
Discover real Normandy cheeses, and hard ciders. Go off the beaten path to meet real producers and awesome products.

This half-day tour is the best opportunity to taste the best of Normandy food: cheese and hard ciders. You will be guided by an agronomist that will help you understanding the farming practices and the transformation processes. You will go to one dairy where they make the original Camembert cheese.

You will then go to two traditional farms where cider is brewed on site and you will taste all of them. Int the end, you will be taken to a small village classified as one of France nicest. All tastings are included.

If there is time at the end of the tour, look forward to a surprise stop. The circuit is on the back roads and it will take you deep in the heart of Normandy. This tour is a unique way of discovering this beautiful region off the beaten paths.
strTitle: Small-Group Half-Day Normandy Cheese and Cider Tour from Caen

strIntroduction:
Small-group tour that will take you deep in the soul of Normandy. Try the only Camembert cheese made in Camembert village and try the hard cider Normandy has to offer. Very scenic roads, best way to experience real France.

Have you ever tried real Camembert made with raw milk? You will visit the last standing farm in the village of Camembert that makes Camembert on site! Have huge samples of farm made cheeses with a glass of cider. Then you will visit a dairy where they also work with raw milk and where you can taste the difference between cheeses.

Lunch is in a classified village outdoors if the weather allows it.

The afternoon is focused on apple and pear brewages. Hard apple cider, hard pear cider, pommeau and calvados. Depending on producers availability, you will visit a traditional cider farm, a estate wine-process oriented cider maker. If you are not too tired by the end of the tour, a small surprise will expect you at the end.
strTitle: Full-Day Small-Group Cheese and Cider Tasting Tour from Caen

strIntroduction:
On this 8-hour cheese and cider tour from Bayeux, discover the soul of Normandy through its two most beloved culinary delights. You'll taste the only Camembert cheese made in Camembert village and try the hard cider for which Normandy is known. Plus, enjoy driving along the region's scenic roads, one of the best ways to soak up the area's natural beauty. Tour is limited to eight people to provide a small-group experience. When booking, you have the option to upgrade to include lunch.

Your tour starts with hotel pickup in Bayeux. With your driver-guide, head to your first stop, where you'll try an authentic Camembert made with raw milk at the last-standing farm in the village of Camembert that makes the cheese on site. Enjoy hearty samples of the farm-made cheeses with a glass of local cider.

Then head to a dairy that also works with raw milk, and learn how to recognize the differences between cheeses. If you select the lunch option when booking, this takes place next outside at a local village, weather permitting. Designed for those without any dietary restrictions, lunch consists of local Normandy products.

In the afternoon, the focus of your tour switches to Normandy's apple and pear beverages—hard apple cider, hard pear cider, pommeau, and calvados. Depending on the availability of the producers, you'll visit a traditional cider farm or an estate wine-oriented cider maker.

If you are not too tired after all this, a small surprise awaits you before your tour ends with return to Bayeux for drop-off.
strTitle: Full-Day Small-Group Cheese- and Cider-Tasting Tour from Bayeux

strIntroduction:
Spend a day exploring Gaudí’s lesser-known sites in and around Barcelona on this private, full-day tour; it’s a Viator Exclusive that can’t be booked elsewhere! After getting picked up from your hotel, visit Torre Bellesguard, a Gaudí-designed hillside house that fuses medieval architecture and art nouveau style in a garden setting. Then, head to Colònia Güell, a small workers’ village home to lesser-known works by Gaudí, for a guided tour. Finish the day at the Gaudí Experience for a 4D journey through the architect’s creative universe.

Begin your Viator Exclusive experience with a pickup from your centrally located Barcelona hotel. Then, relax during the drive out to the Sarrià-Sant Gervasi district, home of Torre Bellesguard. Designed by Antoni Gaudí in the early 20th century, this castle-like museum and private residence stands on the site of a former hillside medieval fortress built by a Catalan king, and commands commanding views over the city’s rooftops. Take a self-guided audio tour of the interior and exterior before meeting your driver again.

Relax in the comfortable air-conditioned car for the ride out to Colònia Güell. On arrival, meet your private guide and commence discovering this fascinating site. A workers’ village from the late 19th century, Colònia Güell boasts a church uncannily similar to the masterpiece Sagrada Familia, modernist-constructed streets and even Gaudí’s own crypt. Take two hours here and enjoy lunch in the village (own expense) before moving on to the next stop.

Arrive at the Gaudí Experience, a center that allows visitors to experience the world of the brilliant architect of Catalan modernism with a 4D projection of his work.

Your full-day tour then concludes with a drop-off back at your hotel.

Viator Exclusives combine unique experiences and great deals — from traditional tours to once-in-a-lifetime experiences — and are not available from other 3rd-party online sellers.
strTitle: Viator Exclusive: Gaudi Experiencia Private Tour of Barcelona's Colonia Guell and Torres Bellesguard

strIntroduction:
Visit to this beautiful and traditional Coffee Farm with a guided tour through the Coffee preparation process, since the harvest up to toasting and packaging!

This tour visits a farm located in the outskirts of Campinas city, approximately 1.5-hour drive from São Paulo.

The farm was founded in 1850 and it has a museum of old machinery and a preserved house where the slaves used to live. Also, it belonged to the Mitsubishi family and it was used as a film location for a Japanese soap opera. Includes a guided visit at the Farm through the Coffee preparation process, since the harvest up to toasting and packaging.

At the end of the tour, you will have the opportunity to taste the coffee from the farm!
strTitle: Coffee Farm Plantation Tour from São Paulo

strIntroduction:
New Karts are protected by a belt of rubber bumpers. By having an engine, closely resembles the professional. As is guaranteed, no one will come out of his unhappy event.

New Karts are protected by a belt of rubber bumpers by having an engine, closely resembles the professional. The narrow chassis and the right front tires, which are thin, provide an easier and enjoyable drive in our quality Karts.

strIntroduction:
This small-group workshop sets to discover Brazilian flavors. Participants will join the chef to buy, prepare and taste the special menu. Visit the Municipal Market, which is one of the important attractions of the city, or the "Open Fairs", where the group can buy some of the ingredients with the chef as the gourmet guide. The chef will give more information about the Brazilian flavor.

The workshop will start with a pick-up then transportation to the Municipal Market to taste some of the famous delicacies of the place. The group, along with the chef, will purchase the ingredients to prepare the special menu that our chef has created specially. The space will be exclusive with music, and the workshop structure aims to make guests feel special on their visit to São Paulo!

The proposed itinerary is as follows:

  • 10:00am to 11:00am – Pick-up at hotels located in São Paulo to visit Municipal Marked to buy some of the ingredients
  • 12:00 to 2:00pm – Departs to the kitchen where the chef will teach how to make the recipe at the kitchen
  • 2:00pm to 3:00pm - A dish from Brazil will be made and served as a lunch with non-alcoholic drinks. Workshop finishes with a drop-off at centrally located hotels
strTitle: São Paulo Gourmet Cooking Workshop

strIntroduction:
Experience Brazilian history and appreciate the Football Museum, an interactive place where it’s possible to learn about Brazil's football culture and journey beyond Brazilian life.

You will also have a panoramic view of Allianz Park - Palmeiras Football house, and we will stop at the famous and historic São Paulo FC Morumbi Stadium.

The tour will start with a pick up from your hotel for Allianz Park and its panoramic view, founded by Italy as "Palestra Italia."

The Palmeiras team has the biggest number of victories and this new stadium can host 43,000 people. The tour continues with a stop at Pacaembu Stadium where the Football Museum is located. There will be free time to appreciate activities like dribbling and shooting the ball to the goal. From there, passengers will drive to Morumbi Stadium, where they can also visit the São Paulo FC Museum, which tells the history of the club and the major awards.

The tour will finish with a drop-off at your hotel.
strTitle: São Paulo Private Football Stadiums Tour

strIntroduction:
This private tour takes place at night and includes dinner at the Italian Building with panoramic view of São Paulo city.

Get ready to enjoy a panoramic view of São Paulo with style! A mix of music from the '60, '70 and '90s will play, but you will also have the option to listen to modern music too. If you like to dance, please join us Wednesdays to Saturdays when a live band will be playing for you.

Dinner will be provided at the Italian Building (42º floor) and includes: couvert, entrée, main dish, dessert, soft drinks (water, juice, soda) and a beer. Menu is not specified as it changes regularly. Taxes are included.
strTitle: Dinner at Italian Building with Panoramic View of São Paulo

strIntroduction:
The newest eco-attraction on St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands! Over twenty years in the making, Phantasea Tropical Botanical Garden is now open for visitors and residents to visit, relax and enjoy the local flora. There are more than 1000 orchids growing throughout the landscape and hundreds of bromeliads, heliconias and gingers, palms as well as many other exotic tropical plants all located in a park-like setting with paths, benches, decks and gazebos.

Experience a natural tropical paradise as you stroll along the winding paths located throughout the native moist forest area of St. Thomas. This unique botanical garden has been the vision of one local woman for over 20 years! The mission of the botanical garden is to provide education about tropical plants and to enhance awareness different plant uses and conservation methods.
